Final_Narrative: Two employees in a scissor lift were wrecking forms, taking forms down, and removing the forms. They lost their grip on the form, which fell and hit an employee walking below on the shoulder, knocking him to the ground. He hit his head on the concrete, causing a wound to the head, a broken collarbone, and a broken rib.

On Friday, January 2, 2015, at 10:30 p.m., a crew of employees were changing out wooden decking boards on a platform off shore. One of the employees was walking the platform, slipped, and stepped on a protruding nail that entered the employee's right foot. First aid was applied to the employee, and the employee was later sent to a clinic for treatment. The employee was admitted to a hospital at 3:00 a.m. on January 5, 2015, from swelling on his foot due to the incident.

While in the process of unloading pre-tied mats of rebar, one of the bundles fell off of the tying jig and pinned three workers underneath. Two of the workers were unharmed. A third employee suffered a fractured rib and a fractured vertebra.
Employee was loading plastic pipes onto a utility trailer.  He jumped off the trailer and broke his ankle.

Employee's right foot was crushed and all of the toes had to be amputated at the hospital. He will require a few days of hospitalization and rehab afterwards. The job required pulling back and laying down pipe.
A worker was installing a retaining wall next to Highway 285 when a gust of wind displaced a tree next to the highway. The tree struck the worker, resulting in back, pelvis, and ankle injuries.

A roofer slipped on the ridge of a roof while securing roofing felt paper.  When he slipped, his nail gun came into contact with his work boot and activated, firing a nail through the boot and into his big toe.  The worker was admitted to Carney Hospital for several days during which several surgeries were performed.
On Monday, January 5, 2014, an employee slipped on ice while walking to his work truck at a job site.  The employee sustained an injury to his neck and was admitted to the hospital that day.
A stack of 12 x 4 foot panels of sheet rock in the hallway of an under construction building fell on the employee and broke his leg.

Employees were moving equipment into the trailer and removed the stairs to the trailer.  Upon exiting the trailer, an employee forgot the stairs were removed and fell about 3 feet to the ground.  Employee has 2 broken ribs, broken scapula, and a dislocated shoulder.

A worker was hospitalized on 01/06/2015 at 3:30 p.m. After doing some clean-up work on a roof, he fell approximately 8.5 to 9 feet while descending a ladder. The worker fractured his leg  and was hospitalized overnight at Athens Regional Medical Center. He underwent surgery, at which time a pin was inserted in the tibia of the fractured leg.

Employee was cutting a 10-foot length of 6-inch PVC pipe into 10-inch sections. He was using a chop saw that was on a pivot because the tool he had been using would not cut the pipe. The employee was using his hand to hold the pipe.  His hand got pulled into the blade.
An employee sustained battery acid burns to the face while attempting to start an air compressor on the back of a service vehicle by boosting the battery with jumper cables.
The worker stepped on a floor joist and fell 10 feet. The worker sustained a broken leg and was hospitalized.
On January 6, 2015, a worker sustained a fracture to the right ankle after slipping on ice at a construction site located at 17400 N. 84th Street, Lincoln, NE  68517.

On or about 1/7/2015 at 12:00 PM, employee working on a construction site was using a metal rebar to repair a broken hinge on another company's truck that was on site delivering soil material.  Employee was standing at ground level while attempting to bend the rebar. The metal rebar broke, resulting in the employee falling to the ground. Employee sustained fractures to his right hip; he was hospitalized and had emergency surgery.

Employee was crushed by falling sheetrock while it was being moved at a renovation site located at 205 Boulevard, Roland, Oklahoma. The sheetrock was leaned in an upright position, totaling 17 sheets or 1,360 pounds. The material fell on the employee's legs and crushed them.
Employee fell 8 feet from a ship's ladder, injuring his head and back. He required in-patient hospitalization.

The worker was cutting the tip of a tube of material with a utility knife. The knife slipped and the tip of the worker's left index finger was cut off. 
Urgent care stitched on the tip of finger and there was no lost time. The worker was wearing gloves.

Employee was descending a 10-foot ladder and was about halfway down when he missed a rung and fell off the ladder. Employee landed on his left side and hit his head on the paved surface below.  At the time of the incident, the employee was on the ladder outside removing sealant from the wall of the Metropolitan Medical Facility.  The employee was transported and admitted to Samcee Hospital. The employee received stitches in his head and sustained a lower back fracture.

An employee was cutting a piece of wood when he slipped and made contact with the rotating blade on a DeWalt miter saw.  The employee cut off the tip of his right index finger.  The employee was taken to UPMC East for treatment.
Employee used a derrick with a tong to unload a utility pole out of a storage area on the ground. The pole rolled onto the employee's leg as he tried to reorient the tong. The left fibula was broken.
Employee working on a ladder was knocked off and landed in a pile of construction debris. Employee sustaineda broken collarbone, eye socket, and skull.
An employee was working on the second floor of the inside section loading material. He fell out of a window opening onto the pavement and fractured his wrist.
Employee working from a ladder on live electrical circuitry received an electrical shock during testing and service installation. The employee fell from the ladder.
The injured employee was hit by a forklift below the knees. He sustained a broken left leg.

On January 8, 2015, at around 11:45 am, an employee working at 22nd Terrace and 3rd Avenue SW, Miami, Florida, was performing tree-cutting operations on a bucket. While cutting tree limbs, he cut his hand with a  chainsaw. The employee was admitted to the hospital to determine if ligament damage had occurred.

Employee was moving a big blower blade by pulling on the fan belt. The machine was off and had proper lockout/tag out. He was there to diagnose a vibration problem on the HVAC. When pulling, his hand got trapped between the pulley and the belt. He dropped his hand and severed the ring, middle, and pinky fingers on his right hand. Each finger was amputated above the joint and was approximately less than 1 inch.

An employee fell from an 8 foot high staging (pedestrian screen). 

Employee injured his tail bone and was hospitalized.
A JP Hogan employee had three fingers amputated on 1/9/2015 while working with a Husqvarna walk-behind concrete saw.
Worker was installing ductwork from a 6-foot ladder, lost his balance, and fell 15-feet through the elevator shaft. He broke both arms and his nose.

A propane-powered space heater was used inside the cab of an elevated crane during workplace operations. The space heater leaked, resulting in an explosion and fire. The employee who was trapped inside the cab sustained burns to the face and hands.
An employee was exposed to falls in excess of four feet while working from a ladder to install a communications cable. The ladder slipped, resulting in the employee suffering a fractured tibia.

Employees were installing wood trusses on the interior 4th floor level of a newly constructed multi-family dwelling when one employee fell approximately 9 feet to lower level. The injured employee's head struck a nail gun that he was operating when he hit the floor. The injury occurred on January 9, 2015, at approximately 1 p.m.
An employee crushed his finger between a 55 gallon drum and a flat bed trailer. The tip of his left index finger was later amputated at the hospital.
A temporary employee fell from the second story of a building under construction and was transported to the hospital with a back injury.

A worker fell approximately 9 feet from a scaffold platform to the ground below sustaining a compound fracture to the jaw and a punctured liver. The scaffold plank bridged over the apartment breezeway and was supported by two walls that were approximately 6 feet apart. The platform was used in setting the rafter trusses.

An employee was operating a lull (large fork lift) to move steel when he went off the road and drove over soft coal. The right side wheels left the ground and the truck tipped over, resulting in broken ribs and hospitalization.
Employee partially amputated index finger with sledge hammer.
Employee sustained a puncture wound to his hand from an air nail gun while setting trusses in the vicinity of 8000 East Highway 42 in Sioux Falls, South Dakota.

The injured employee was installing a back flow preventer in the vertical. The employee was using a chain fall and attempting to place a gasket between the piping. The chain fall "jumped" and the pipe landed on his left thumb, which was resting on the pipe's flange. The tip of this left thumb was amputated at the nail bed and could not be reattached. 

The incident occurred in the Ag Building fire pump room.

A truck loader was being used to load a dump truck with concrete. A piece of rebar was sticking out of the side of the truck. The driver and injured employee tried to manually put the rebar up on the truck. The employee saw some rebar on the ground and went to kick it out of the way of the driver so he wouldn't run over it. The rebar sticking out of the truck became dislodged and hit the employee in the left eye.
An employee fell 12 feet from an aerial lift while laying ornamental sheet metal. The employee sustained a broken vertebrae.

On or about 13 Jan 2015 at approximately 14:30hrs an employee fell approximately ten feet from a platform above a ceiling to the ground below suffering a fracture to his L1, cracked ribs, and broken teeth.
An employee was struck in the shin by the fitting of a water hose when it whipped around after being blown with air from a compressor.
An employee's foot was struck by an excavating machine.  The employee was admitted to the hospital and stayed overnight for surgery.

An employee, in the process of dismantling a scaffold, climbed the scaffold ladder to approximately 25 feet and stepped off onto a pipe header.  Once on the pipe header, the employee slipped off and fell 25 feet to the ground below where he suffered a right arm compound fracture, a right elbow dislocation, and a fractured pelvis.  A yo-yo tie off was available that the employee was not using. The incident occurred at the 100 rack at the enterprise construction site.

Employee was bleeding the pressure off a weighted ball used to check stormwater pipes for leaks. The weight of the water inside the PVC pipe caused the ball to slide down the pipe. Employee grabbed the rope strap with his right hand and the strap's force and sharp edge severed his right-thumb tip. 

The finger tip was recovered and delivered to Parkland Hospital, but didn't have enough bone to be reattached.

An employee using a 10-foot A-frame ladder was knocked over when another employee opened a manual overhead door they were working on. The employee fell off the ladder and sustained multiple bone fractures on both forearms and wrists.

An employee was installing a light fixture. He was shocked and fell from the 8-foot, A-frame ladder he was using, with his feet about 4 feet off the ground. When he was shocked, the ladder and he fell in opposite directions. He has some tingling in his right arm and restrictions for both arms until further evaluation.
Employee was lowering a boom lift while installing fire protection piping. The hydraulics failed, causing the employee to break the lower left leg.

An employee was working from a 12-foot step ladder that was folded and placed on top of an air handler. The top of the ladder was leaning against a wall. As the employee stood on the ladder finishing a wall inside a mechanical room, the ladder slid away from the wall and the employee fell to the ground. The employee suffered a left broken leg above the ankle and a broken right little finger.  The employee was admitted to University Medical Center in Jackson, Mississippi.

Worker was in a trench and was injured when an operator moved the trench box. The spreader bar on the trench box struck the worker in the back, cracking his vertebra. The worker was hospitalized one night.

Employee was on top of a hot oil tanker trailer attempting to remove the lid to fill the tanker. The lid was stuck due to sitting for a couple of weeks because of inclement weather.  The fall protection cage provided at the fill location did not fit the tanker trailer properly, leaving a gap large enough for the employee to fall beneath the cage. When the lid came loose, the employee fell from the top of the tanker trailer, under the fall protection cage, to the ground. The employee dislocated a shoulder, broke two to three ribs, and received contusions.
Employee fell from ladder when coming down the roof and broke his hands and neck.
Two employees were installing a murphy bed when the lifting mechanism snapped.  One employee suffered a severe laceration to a thumb and was hospitalized for two days to reattach the finger.

An employee was assisting the truck driver to clear small amounts of cement left in the vehicle when the rear  chute came down on the employee's left middle finger amputating the tip.  The employee was taken to hospital and the fingertip was reattached.
Employee fell from a ladder while descending. The employee broke arm/wrist.

The HVAC team was removing an air-conditioning system from a roof when an employee stumbled over and fell onto angle irons that were supporting the system. The employee was hospitalized and had two surgeries on his right thigh.

Employees were using a backhoe to remove a section of railroad rail when the rail broke loose and swung, striking an employee in the leg.  The employee received fractures to the femur and ankle.  It was estimated that the rail was 18 feet long and the employee was 15 to 16 feet from the backhoe.
Employee was descending a ladder when he slipped striking his jaw and face resulting in a broken jaw, nose, and facial bones and a broken right thumb.
Employee amputated tip of finger when he caught it in a clamp while running rods.
An employee suffered a severe burn injury while working on a power pole when he made contact with a live wire. The employee was sent to Utah Burn Center.

Employee was installing steam trace lines from an aerial lift. The individual then bent over while working; the aerial lift moved, catching the employee's head between the cage of the aerial lift and an iron beam of the support structure for the unit.
A worker was fabricating a spool from steel. A portion of the steel fell onto the worker's hand and sliced through the tip of his pinky.
Sheet rock was being transported with a dolly. The dolly tipped over and injured an employee's femur.
An employee was operating a table saw when he amputated his right thumb.

On January 21, 2015, a tag line became entangled around an A-frame metal beam weighing approximately 1400 lb., causing the beam to fall against the leg(s) of a worker. The worker suffered fractures of the right lower leg and was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized with broken ribs while pulling de-energized conductor wiring.
The worker was using a chop box and amputated his left thumb.

An employee suffered a leg injury after being struck by a piece of wood. 

An excavator dropped a utility pole which subsequently caused a piece of wood to hit an adjacent worker.

Employee was working on the carburetor of his company vehicle with gasoline on his hands when it ignited, causing 2nd and 3rd degree burns on his right hand and 2nd degree burns on his stomach and left hand. Employee was treated and hospitalized at Doctor's Hospital in Augusta, Georgia.

Employee was at a company site attempting to gain access to the roof ladder via a fixed ladder .  The height of the platform from the ground was 10 ft, 7 in. The employee slipped and fell to the interior concrete floor. The employee broke his wrist, and bone was exposed.
Worker was hit in the head with rebar that fell from an upper elevation on a construction site. The worker was taken to the hospital, where a CT scan indicated a skull fracture.
An employee was injured in a construction accident when a bundle of steel concrete supports struck him. Employee sustained a broken leg and was hospitalized.
Worker slipped on ice and fractured leg. The worker was hospitalized to set the broken bone.
An employee received an amputation injury to the right-hand index finger as a result of a U bolt, which fell during the removal of concrete form work at the new Atlanta Falcons stadium.
A worker was chipping concrete off of a rebar when a big piece of concrete landed on his right ring finger. The worker was hospitalized with lacerations needing 10 stitches.
Employee was helping to move equipment using a front end loader. His finger was amputated by the open pin of the front end loader.

A temporary worker for AUC Group (worker #1) was walking to his truck to leave for the day.  Another worker for AUC Group (worker #2) was backing out a truck owned by AUC Group. Worker #2 struck worker #1 with the vehicle. Worker #1 sustained back injuries caused by the accident, which required a surgical procedure to repair the damage. Worker #1 spent one night in the hospital.

Employee sustained 2nd and 3rd degree burns on 8 to 11% of the employee's back. The wind blew a torch flame around the back side of steel that was being cut and under protective gear, catching the employee's street clothes on fire underneath.

Employee received a crushing injury to the right-hand thumb when the collapsible railing on a crusher plant's catwalk vibrated loose and pinned his thumb between the railing and catwalk. The thumb was partially severed and the bone broke. His thumb was later amputated at Rochester Mayo Clinic because blood flow to the thumb could not be re-established.

Worker was inspecting a flat roof. The surface of the roof was icy. The worker slipped and fell on the same level, fracturing his tibia and fibula bones directly above the right ankle. He was hospitalized and required surgery.

On January 26, 2015, at approximately 8:06 a.m., at the Tel Hai Retirement Community, the worker sustained a partial amputation. At the time of the incident, workers were using a forklift truck to lift a job box (metal box) onto the upper level. While taking the job box off of the forklift truck, the worker's hand was pinched between the forklift truck and the job box. He was taken to Brandywine Hospital Emergency Outpatient. He sustained a bone fracture and partial amputation of his right fourth finger, distal phalanx, distal tuft, with a loss of overlaying soft tissue. He was treated and discharged.
Worker was hospitalized due to a fractured thumb from using a 6" grinder.
Worker injured his left pinky and ring finger when his left hand, which was on the line, was pulled into the main hook lock during the untangling of a crane's lines.

Worker was hit on the left forearm by a backhoe's bucket while he was standing in a 3 feet deep trench parallel to another trench approximately 4 feet away. The backhoe was approximately 8 feet away from the injured worker. The dirt in the trench where the backhoe was located gave out and caused the backhoe to swing and hit the employee.

At approximately 4:30 PM on January 28, 2015, an employee removing cones in the "closed lane" was struck by a motor vehicle driven by a member of the general public. The employee's left leg sustained a fractured femur and fibula. The employee was transported and admitted to Geisinger Medical Center in Danville, PA.

A scaffold board was removed to load mortar onto the scaffold. As the scaffold board was placed back into position, an adjacent scaffold board fell from the third tier, striking an employee in the head. The injured employee was on the ground loading custom bricks into a bucket.  He was taken to the hospital and admitted.
Four employees were cutting an opening in a concrete wall for a door. The wall fell outward onto another employee, striking his back and pelvis area. His injuries required hospitalization.

Employee had just finished unloading a truck into the paving machine. He had his hand on the gate of the truck. The truck operator latched the gate from the cab, crushing the pinky finger on the employee's right hand.
Worker was injured when he fell out of the back of a pick-up truck. The truck was parked and not moving; the employee tripped over the wheel well. He broke his collar bone and some ribs.
Employee was standing underneath a bridge under construction when a 2x4 piece of lumber fell off the bridge and struck him in the shoulder. He was hospitalized as a result.

On or about 01/30/2015, an employee amputated his finger while cutting lumber with a power tool. The lumber was covered with ice; when the blade struck the lumber and ice, it kicked backed and cut the tip of the employee's left thumb.

Worker was using a portable handsaw to cut lumber when the saw jumped to the one side where the worker's left, gloved hand was holding the lumber.  The blade caught the worker's glove pulling it toward the blade and the worker lost the tip of his left thumb.
An employee was walking toward a conex storage system and slipped, popping his kneecap out.
A worker operating a skid-steer loader amputated the first finger on the right hand and the fourth finger on the left hand when they were crushed between the skid-steer and a dumpster.
Employee fell and received lacerations to the ear and cheek while attempting to place a temporary cap over a well-water casing. The well casing is at ground level.

An employee was hospitalized overnight after being struck in the mouth by a hand-held power angle drill. The accident occurred at the job site at approximately 8:00 a.m. on 01/31/15. The employee sustained massive lacerations to his cheek and jaw and broke two teeth.

The employee was setting precast tilt wall panels. The bottom of a panel slid out of place when the angle bar used to hold the panels in place broke. The employee's finger was pinched between the panel and the pin used to set the distance between the panels.
Employee was struck by an excavator while compacting soil with a Wacker Packer vibratory plate.  The employee's ankle was dislocated. He was admitted to the hospital and underwent surgery.
Finger cut accident.

An employee was walking behind a ditch witch, digging a ditch for underground fiber optic lines.  The equipment hit a rut in the ground and fell to the side, trapping the employee's right hand between the controls and a tree.  The right thumb was severely cut and was barely hanging on by two pieces of flesh.  The employee was transported and admitted to Grady hospital.
Employee was struck in the face by a handheld, gas-powered saw he was using.

An oxy-fuel cutter caught his lower right pant leg on fire on 1/31/15 resulting in third degree burns on his right leg from the ankle to the knee. The worker was hospitalized on 2/3/15 for treatment of the burn injuries.
Employee was manually loading a piece of pipe onto a trailer. The pipe shifted and cut off the tip of the employee's right middle finger.
Two employees were taken to the emergency room at Denver General for oxygen and observation after being exposed to carbon monoxide from a propane heater being used indoors.

Employees were installing a pump at the facility. During the process, the pump shifted and caught one of the employees fingers, smashing it against the pedestal wall of the pump. Employee was transported to the Memorial Herman Hospital where they determined that the finger had a fracture.

Worker was walking out from the building and was struck on the head by a falling piece of metal that was removed from an upper level window. Worker was taken to Methodist Hospital at 6565 Fanning St. in Houston, Texas, where personnel stitched his head.

The employee was unloading a flatbed semi trailer. The forklift operator was removing material from the trailer. The material began shifting on the forks, and the employee moved to avoid being struck. The employee lost his footing and fell off of the trailer, fracturing his pelvis.

Employee was offloading a structural beam in a laydown yard.  When the beam was lowered, it rotated, and the employee's hand was caught between the cribbing and bracing.  As a result, the employee broke his third, fourth, and fifth fingers (metacarpals). The employee was hospitalized later that day.

An employee was tightening a bolt on a 16" pipe flange located 6" off the floor with a 3/4" ratchet wrench.  The wrench broke, causing the employee to fall backwards and hit the ground.  Upon falling to the ground, the employee's leg was fractured.
An employee fell from a beam he was standing on, down to a catwalk below, when he was removing rust from another beam. The employee sustained neck and back injuries.

Employee was lowering trash from the edge of the flat roof he was working on. He fell 11 feet 8 inches when the soffit he was standing on collapsed. He broke ribs, shattered an elbow, and cracked his pelvis.
Employee was walking to work when he slipped on ice bruising his right hip.

An employee was moving the forks of a forklift closer together, slightly raising the fork. He slipped as he began to push the fork, pinching the tip of his right middle finger between the fork and the forklift mast.

Employee dislocated his right ankle while stepping off of a rail car. Employee was sent to the hospital where they admitted him because his ankle kept popping out of place after they set it. They had to perform surgery on the ankle.

The worker was attempting to straighten a load of pallets that the forklift operator was placing on the delivery truck. The worker fell off the top of the pallets, hurting his back and breaking several bones.

Worker was repairing an overhead door roller located in the shop. He set up an extension ladder against the wall of the building and climbed up. After he made the repair using his hands, he fell while descending the ladder. He landed on a water pump that was below and sustained multiple injuries to the right side of his body, including his right arm, knee cap, ribs, and cheek.  He also sustained a cranial injury due to the fall and suffered a concussion.

An employee had his left thumb crushed by the wheels of a semi trailer as he tried to avoid being run over. The employee was knocked to the ground and pulled into the wheel well of the trailer crushing his left hand and amputating his thumb. The employee also sustained injuries to the lower left side of his body.
Employee stepped off of excavation equipment and broke his knee.
Employee was struck by a 12-inch pipe while it was being lowered into a three-foot deep trench, breaking his leg in two places above the ankle.
Worker was conducting re-roofing work on a two-story, split-level home without his personal fall protective equipment. He slipped, fell 10 feet to the ground, and hurt his tail bone.
Employee was hospitalized after sustaining a laceration to the left wrist while using a saw.

An employee was removing a hand temper (compaction for dirt) out of a dump truck by lifting it with a backhoe bucket. His left ring finger was pinched between the tailgate of the dump truck and the hand temper when he grabbed the hand temper as it slipped and fell off the bucket. The employee suffered some bone loss (no amputation) and incurred 100 stiches.
Employee was hospitalized after the circular saw he was using slipped and cut his left thigh.
An employee's left pinky was amputated after his hand was caught between a roller and a tank.

The injured employee was in the process of spraying a tacky solution onto the conveyor belt of a dump truck when his arm got caught and he received skin burns/abrasions on his left forearm and left hand. He was admitted to the hospital and had an incision to relieve the swelling.

An employee of SM Fencing & Energy Services, Inc. lost his eye sight after receiving a head injury. The employee slipped on the ice at the project site while carrying a railroad tie. After the employee fell to the ground, the railroad tie fell on his head.
Employee fell 15 feet from a concrete form and broke his pelvis.
An employee was descending a dump truck ladder, when he jumped to the floor and his ring was caught. He lost part of his left-hand ring finger, from the mid-knuckle up.
Employee caught hand in system.

A small crew of workers was working under reactor prefitting beams. They had the beams rigged with a come-along. After getting it into place, they lost control of the rigging and one of the beams fell on the ground and landed on the worker's foot.
Employee broke a leg at a construction yard.
An employee was hospitalized after stepping on a L-shaped nail while working on a construction jobsite.

Employee was working from a scissor lift approximately 12 feet high when it collapsed and ejected the employee onto a concrete slab.  The employee was admitted to the hospital with a broken arm and a broken back.
The worker fell backwards towards the slump rack stairs while washing his concrete truck and sustained a laceration to the back of his head.
A worker on a dock was loading onto a vessel, when the loading chute fell on his left foot, injuring his pinky toe and the toe next to it.
Employee was opening a bag of guacamole using a knife without cutting gloves.  The knife went sideways, cutting her left index fingertip.
Employee was using a skill saw to cut 4X4s. The saw kicked back cutting the employee's finger.
On or about February 18, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation of part of his left pinky finger when an entry door slammed on it due to a strong gust of wind.

The employee was performing a visual inspection of a motor, lost his balance, and placed his hand on a running motor. His right hand slipped below the guard and his fingers slipped into the running belt and spindle, severing the tips of his index and middle fingers.

Employee was installing outside showers and hose bibs when he was struck on the head and shoulder by a falling piece of material from approximately 50 feet above him. Employee was in-patient hospitalized.
An employee suffered a left-thumb amputation when it got caught in metal cording used for safety harnessing.

Employee was setting a column form with an overhead hoist, when his finger became caught between a metal bracket and a two by four. The bracket lacerated the tip of the employee's finger and shaved a small portion of the bone. Employee was taken to OccuCare Medical clinic, where he was then referred to a specialist at Memorial Herman Hospital.
Employee was wrapping a tarp onto an articulating boom bucket mounted and stored on a service truck. Employee fell approximately 6 feet to the ground and suffered fractured ribs.
Employee was cutting a tree. As the tree fell, it struck another tree and bounced back on the employee. The employee suffered a broken ankle.

Employee was installing an incline conveyor.  He was using two chain falls and four come-a-longs. One of the come-a-longs was removed, causing the others to become overloaded, and the conveyor fell. The employee suffered broken bones in his legs, feet, spine, and pelvis area.
Employee's leg was caught between a cable and a stable bar when moving an anchor buoy in the Shinecock Inlet.
Employee installing drywall suffered a broken leg when a slab of drywall fell. Employee was admitted to the hospital.
A propane heater burned the back of an employee's legs.

Employee was operating a stomp shear with a co-worker. The employee was inserting some metal into the shear to be cut when his fingers slipped into the machine as the co-worker activated the stomp shear.
Employee was setting a place pump for concrete when the pump caught, crushed, and amputated his right ring finger.

An employee was performing maintenance work on a crawler crane's ignition system while standing on the track which provided only 5.5 inches of surface to stand on. The mechanic slipped and fell approximately 59 inches and broke his right leg. He was admitted to the hospital.
Employee was hospitalized due to being struck in the head by a backhoe bucket.
An employee amputated his fingertip while tearing down a setting tool on the McMaster Pad site.

An employee walked to the rear of a small crane to retrieve his tool bag. The crane operator extended an outrigger that came down on the employee's right foot, causing multiple fractures. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery.
Employee was attempting to cut banding with a pocket knife.  The knife slipped and struck the employee in the calf, hitting an artery. Employee was hospitalized.

Employee was changing out a piece of pipe while installing underground conduits on a directional drilling rig. He was struck by a wrench. The employee was taken to the hospital with injuries to his forearm.

An employee used the running line that was attached to the hook of a crane to pull himself up. The left tip of his middle finger and half of his ring finger got caught between pinch points (the rope and pulley), resulting in an amputation.

Employee was carrying a building truss with a forklift and placed a truss into a stored area. The employee reversed the forklift and walked up to the stored truss. The truss fell on the employee, causing facial injuries and fractured ribs.
While riding a scissorlift, employee's face struck a doorway. Employee broke the jaw and was admitted for in-patient hospitalization at the University of Virginia Hospital.
Employee clearing trees for a gas/oil pipeline installation was pinned between two trees and broke a leg.
While fighting a fire at the shop, employee received a burn to the left leg.

Employee was cleaning insulator bushings on top of a de-energized transformer/regulator in preparation for tap switch testing. Upon energizing of control voltage for testing, employee received an electric shock.
An employee was starting up a pump and a hose was not secured. As the employee tried to control the hose, he lost his balance and fell at the same level, hitting his head on the concrete.

Employee was servicing an HVAC unit at a customer's facility. While disassembling the chiller, the employee stepped off the chiller barrel onto a pipe. The employee's foot slipped off the pipe causing him to fall approximately four feet resulting in a broken rib.
An employee was hospitalized for a possible concussion, after falling down some stairs.
Employee was reporting for work, got out of the car, slipped on ice, fell and struck the back of the head. He was admitted to the hospital for a brain injury.
An employee was loading a ladder on the ladder rack of a truck. When the employee went to step down, his ring got caught on the rack and his finger was sliced open.
An employee was helping to remove reflective pavement markers when debris caused by the sledgehammer hitting the marker struck the employee's eye.  The injured employee was wearing safety glasses.
An employee amputated his fingers while using a saw.
Employee fell at the jobsite trailer and sustained a leg fracture. The employee was admitted to the hospital.

The employee helped finish installing deep foundation and began disassembling equipment at the site. While dismantling the crane, the employee used a hammer to knock a pin from a boom to disassemble it. The boom fell on the employee, resulting in an in-patient hospitalization and injuries to the wrist, both ankles, and the leg, as well as a possible back injury.

An employee was lifting a pipe into place with a hoist. The pipe came loose and caught his right hand between the pipe and a fusion machine. The pipe was rigged with a choker but not shackled.  The employee's right little finger was crushed and he was hospitalized.
An employee was working on a pipe with a breakout wrench when it slipped and severed his left ring fingertip.
An employee tripped and fell, striking his head against the corner of the house. He was admitted to hospital for head lacerations and overnight observation.

An employee was cleaning the units on the second floor when he stepped on a loose platform close to the forklift and fell 10 feet to the ground. The employee was hospitalized with a broken right elbow and had surgery.
A telescopic Kelly bar dropped on an employee's hand while he was digging a hole with an auger, crushing his left index finger.

The injured employee was standing halfway up a fold-down attic ladder, receiving instructions on what materials/equipment would be needed to fully repair the attic heater. While descending the ladder, the employee missed a step, fell, and fractured a vertebra in the thoracic area of the back.
An employee climbing a ladder fell 12 feet and injured his right wrist and both ankles.
Employee fell approximately 4 four feet from the top of a precast concrete wall, injuring his head and fracturing his ribs.  Sleet was a contributing factor.
An employee was exposed to steam that contained sodium sulfate, tetrasodium pyrophosphate, and potassium hydroxide while working on an HVAC system in the basement/mechanical room of the hospital.
An employee, who was unloading a truck, slipped on ice, fell, struck his head, and was admitted to hospital.
An employee injured his wrist and head when he slipped on a three-rung ladder. He was admitted to the hospital and treated.
An employee fell through the roof while inspecting the wood to see if it was rotten. He injured his lower lumbar.
An employee's finger was caught between two flange faces while manually positioning a portable pipe skid.

Employee was standing on the second floor dismantling a metal mod structure when he fell through the sheet metal and cut his left arm to the bone near his elbow. He was wearing fall protection and did not impact the floor but suffered the cut on the way down.

On 3/5/15 around noon, an employee fell approximately 8' from a ladder when the ductwork he was releasing swung down, hit the ladder, and rocked it. The employee sustained two left arm fractures (wrist and elbow) and a possible pelvis fracture. The employee was transported to ECMC where he was treated and released.

On March 5, 2015, an employee was hospitalized after suffering a foot injury on the job. The employee was standing next to a trench at ground level while lowering a concrete pipe into the ground when the pipe struck the employee in the leg.

An employee was performing carpentry work using a nail gun to nail bracing for a new residential dwelling's soffits. He was descending the ladder when the nail gun bumped the ladder and discharged a nail into his kneecap.

An employee was welding black iron pipe for stem lines at the new Limited Brands facility under construction in Johnstown, Ohio. The employee left work early due to an extreme headache. He was taken to the hospital where he was diagnosed with carbon monoxide intoxication.

A contractor hired to replace an old pipeline damaged it with a backhoe and created a leak. There was a trench about 3 feet deep and 18 inches wide. The injured employee was on scene to evaluate the leak. He moved from one side of the trench to the other. The soil on the opposite side gave way and exposed a tree root; he hit his chin on that root. The employee broke two bones in his left leg about 2 inches from his ankle.
An employee suffered a partial amputation of the thumb tip while using a table saw.

An employee was using a screw gun and handling a metal stud. When he went to put the screw into the metal stud, the tip of the screw gun hit the middle of his hand. The worker was hospitalized and received three stitches.
An employee's hand/fingers were crushed while positioning a wall form, which was being lifted into place by a crane.

On 3/06/2015 at approximately 9:44 AM, an employee was injured when he lost his footing on top of a 9 foot wall while installing ceiling joists and fell backwards onto the concrete floor below. The employee was admitted to the hospital with a brain injury.
An employee was riding on the back of a company pickup truck. As the driver took a right-hand turn, the employee fell off and suffered head trauma.
An employee amputated the tip of the left-hand middle finger while operating a drill.
On March 8, 2015, at approximately 10:00 a.m., an employee exited the cab of his hydraulic link belt crane and fell 6 feet to the ground. The employee was hospitalized for a possible rib fracture.
An employee fractured his hip because he tripped and fell at a construction site.
An employee fell 10 feet to the ground from a scissor lift while working on a construction project. Upon impact, the employee broke his nose and other facial bones.
An employee slipped on ice and caught himself while getting out of his truck at the company-owned quarry. He injured his right, lower leg.

On March 10, 2015, at approximately 1:40 p.m., an employee was using a tag line to guide pipe being moved by a trackhoe operator. As the pipe was turned near the well pad, the employee tripped and fell on the blind side of the trackhoe. The trackhoe ran over the employee's left leg, resulting in hospitalization and amputation.

On March 10, 2015, at approximately 10 a.m., an employee fell down a flight of stairs during work and injured his back. He fell approximately 10 feet from the second floor to the first and was taken to UAB Hospital.
An employee installing gutters fell off an 8 foot step ladder onto the ground (concrete pavers) below.  The employee suffered a fractured hip, which resulted in an overnight stay in the hospital.
An employee attempting to remove a quick-release mechanism suffered a fingertip amputation from a spring-loaded pin in the opening where his finger was inserted.

An employee installing electrical conduit in a room with sodium hypochlorite piping fell from the ladder that he was working on and onto the piping. The hazardous chemical splashed on his left leg and arm. The employee was admitted to the hospital.
While lowering sheets of plywood, an employee's finger got caught between a piece of the plywood and the scissor lift.
An employee was injured while cutting rebar with a Quickie Saw. The saw kicked backed, striking him on the right side of the face. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
A 3-foot x 15-foot steel concrete form was being stripped. During the stripping, the form fell onto the employee's leg and broke it. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee's lower left arm was amputated.
An employee installing insulation from a catwalk fell through a gap in the catwalk and suffered a thigh contusion.
An employee was injured when an I-beam rolled onto his leg.

An employee driving a tractor with an attached dirt pan struck another employee who was driving a tractor with an attached dirt pan. The employee was thrown out of the back window of the tractor and landed on the ground unconscious, resulting in hospitalization.

The company had identified that an underground short was occurring on a 7,200-volt line. The company was attempting to locate the short using a DC charge unit known as a "Thumper." The Thumper would shoot a charge through the line, and the employees would use equipment to triangulate the approximate location of the short. During one of these tests, a charge was sent through the line, and an employee received a shock severe enough to require hospitalization.
After installing a new utility pole, an employee fell approximately 30 feet to the ground while climbing to the top. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured vertebra.
Employee fell down a single step coming out of a meeting and broke a hip.

Employees were building transmission power lines at the site location. They were changing out the cross arm of the power line structure and had the cross arms supported with two slings and a crane.  The injured employee removed the bolt that  held the cross arm onto the pole.  He rested his hand on the edge of the bucket he was working from; the cross arm slipped, landed on his hand in the sling, and pinched his finger between the cross arm and the bucket. His fingertip flesh was removed.
An employee was walking from a concrete sidewalk to a gravel area with a client. She tripped on gravel and rolled her left ankle, breaking it in three places. She was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was injured when he fell from a ladder. He was hospitalized with a ruptured spleen.
An employee carrying a ladder slipped and fell. The employee sustained injuries to his head.
An employee was struck in the back by a wall panel, resulting in fractures to the lower vertebrae.
An employee working from an 8-foot ladder received an electrical shock from an electrical pull box. He fell and broke his pelvis.
An employee was ascending a ladder to go onto a roof for a roof estimate when the ladder shifted.  The employee fell from the ladder to the ground, resulting in multiple rib fractures.
An employee amputated his left pinky (small) finger while moving a drill pipe and putting it on a rack. As he lowered the drill pipe, he slipped and his pinky got caught beneath the pipe.
An employee was driving and lost control of the company truck. The truck flipped and the employee fractured his neck.

An employee fell into an active excavation. The crew was setting trench boxes while the employee stood beside one of them.  As the operator attempted to position the box, it dropped approximately 3 feet, causing the employee to lose his balance and fall into the excavation. The employee sustained serious injuries: a dislocated shoulder, a small chip in a bone, and a slight crack in his pelvis.

An employee fell from a step ladder while drilling holes to blow insulation into a house. He hit an air conditioning unit on the way down and ended by hitting his head on a stone retaining wall. He was hospitalized on 3/16/15.
An employee was injured by a gasoline-powered concrete saw with a diamond blade.  The employee was cutting a core floor when the saw kicked back and cut his thigh.
An employee was struck in the head by a metal frame when a crane hook failed.
An employee was removing a 16"-pipe from a pipe rack by cold cutting. The employee was removed from the pipe rack because he was not feeling well. He was transported to the hospital.
An employee exiting a scissor lift missed the last step and fell approximately 4 feet, fracturing the hip.
After detaching a portable ladder from a rooftop, an employee fell from a ladder approximately 12 to 18 feet to the ground below. The employee suffered a broken right leg and fractured right elbow.
An employee was stepping across a pile of dirt in the way of his work when he misstepped and fell, shattering his left ankle.
An employee was cutting lumber stakes on a sawhorse. He was using a handheld circular saw when the stock kicked back and amputated half of his thumb.
An employee sustained a partial amputation to the left thumb while offloading steel from a truck. The hoisted material shifted, pinching the thumb between the load and the hook.

An employee was about to transfer from the scaffold ladder to the deck when his left foot slipped off. He fell 13 feet and sustained fractures in his left shoulder, fourth rib, and cervical vertebra (C4).

On March 18, 2015, at approximately 12:05 p.m., an employee fell from the tracks of the track truck while unloading straw bales from the truck bed. He fell 2 to 3 feet and struck his head on the ground, resulting in hospitalization for chest-wall bruising and head injury.

An employee was descending a 28-foot ladder when a gust of wind knocked the ladder off of the cable. The ladder has a hook at the end, and the employee had the ladder hook on the cable. The hook knocked his ladder off of the cable strand. He broke his leg.

An employee was stepping down from the bus when she slipped and landed on her bottom backside. The employee attempted to get up and slipped again, hitting her left side. She was hospitalized with a fractured rib that punctured her lung.
An employee was installing two cast iron pipes when the pipes slipped through the bracing and fell onto his right hand, cutting the pinky fingertip.
An employee was burned on the face and hands while refueling a gas-powered air compressor used to spray insulation foam.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after straining his groin area while lifting heavy boards.
An employee fell from a one-level scaffold and received a head injury.

An employee fractured his right femur when a stack of steel roofing sheets slid off of the staging area and struck him on his right thigh. The stack of sheets was hit by a tractor with steel forks, which caused the stack to slide off and strike the employee.

An employee was opening an electric gate. He rested his hand on the top of the gate while taking the slack out of a chain on the gate with his foot. His hand was on a roller on the gate, and his finger got caught between the roller and the top rail on the gate. His left pinky finger was partially amputated.

On or about March 20, 2015, at 3:30 p.m., an employee was placing/helping to place a structural tube on a concrete pier foundation at the jobsite. While the tube was being set, the bottom of the column slipped off of the pier and hit the employee on the ankle.  The structural tube pier weighed approximately 250 pounds and was approximately 14 to 16 feet long. This structural tube would be used as a vertical support tube.

On March 20, 2015, at approximately 11:00 p.m., an employee was using a core drill to remove anchors from the face of the Bluestone Dam in Hinton, West Virginia. A 1/4" to 3/8" rope became entangled in the 3" core bit. The employee's left arm was pulled into the rotating bit, which resulted in fractures of the radius and ulna.
Employee broke leg while installing a cap on an irrigation line in a 4-foot trench. The sides of the trench caved in on the employee, fracturing his right leg between the knee and ankle.

The injured employee was removing a section of a protective walkway. He was using a stepladder to climb beside the walkway to remove a sheet of plywood. He stepped from the stepladder to the top of the protective walkway. The walkway collapsed to the ground with the employee on top. He broke his left femur and dislocated his knee.

A driver was reversing a truck near a bridge. The injured employee signaled the driver to stop, but the driver accidently stepped on the gas and struck the employee. The employee sustained a fractured pelvis and spine.
An employee suffered possible broken bones and a partial amputation of the left long finger while attempting to move a steel grate.
An employee amputated his right ring finger while operating a molding machine.

An employee was blowing insulation in an attic while tied off with a harness and lanyard (personal fall arrest system). He went to move to a different spot. While changing anchor points, he stepped into a scuttle hole and injured his back/neck.
An employee's finger was pinched between a motor cover and forklift forks while trying to reposition the load on the forks.
While walking, an employee tripped on a stump and was impaled between the bridge of his nose and eye socket.

An employee was assembling piping (10 feet long, weighing approximately 100 pounds) on a pump skid. When the pipe was set down, the employee's finger was caught between the pipe and the flange, amputating the tip of the left ring finger. The employee required surgery.

An employee was on a scissor lift cutting a metal water pipe (15-feet long) with a torch. When the pipe was completely cut, it hit the scissor lift and caused the lift to fall 15 feet to the ground. The employee broke his arm and pelvis and was hospitalized.
An employee fell from a ladder and was hospitalized with a broken arm.

An employee was guiding a forklift to set a roll of conveyor belting onto a stand on a table.  The stand collapsed when the roll was set, and the employee was catapulted up and off of the table, landing 12 feet away on a concrete floor in a sitting position. He injured his right hip and buttocks and was hospitalized, and later had surgery to correct hip fractures.

An employee was setting a rebar wall panel. After cutting the panel loose, the crane started to ascend. The employee held the crane choker to keep it from getting hung up on anything as it ascended. During this time, he got his finger pinched between the choker and the rebar. He was hospitalized with a potential broken finger on his left hand.
An employee was operating a truck-mounted crane when the jib fell off and struck the employee's leg. The employee suffered a compound fracture of the left leg.
An employee suffered an amputation to his left index finger when it was crushed by a chain sprocket on a conveyor belt grain thrower. The chain sprocket was unguarded at the time.

At approximately 8:10 p.m., on 3/25/15, an employee fell 20 to 30 feet from an articulating boom bucket to the ground. The employee was tightening bolts for mast arms on traffic signal lights when the clip tie-off point broke and the employee fell. The employee sustained cracked lumbar vertebrae and head lacerations.
An employee was descending a ladder when his foot slipped through, causing him to fall. He put his hand out to break his fall, suffering a broken wrist. He was hospitalized.
An employee hit his head while traveling through a door on a scissor lift. He was hospitalized.

An employee on an elevated aerial lift was attempting to hang a dead-end structure on a pole. The wire he was holding contacted energized wires (7200 V), shocking the employee. He was hospitalized with burns to his right shoulder and the skin on his stomach.
An employee fell 30 feet from the roof area while installing a tin roof on a new building addition. The employee dislocated the left wrist and fractured the right elbow.

On 02/26/2015, at approximately 10:30 AM, an employee picked up an electric handsaw that was energized. The employee activated the handsaw with his right hand and amputated the middle finger from his left hand.

An employee was unloading a wire basket from a flatbed truck. As a crane began to lift the basket, he got caught by it and was lifted approximately 6 to 8 feet off the ground. He fell to the ground, breaking his leg and nose.
An employee was exiting the site trailer and fell 3 feet.  The trailer stairs were removed at the time. The employee was hospitalized with lacerations on the back of the head and a fractured hip.
An employee was installing a sink faucet when he cut his finger on the edge of the stainless steel sink.
Employee pouring concrete sustained chemical burns to the leg due to prolonged exposure to wet concrete.
An employee was checking an skid loader's alternator when the motor fan caught his left hand, amputating the middle finger and severely cutting the pinky.

An employee experienced a shock and arc flash when cleaning the inside of electrical gear that was believed to be shut off. The employee received second and third degree burns on the face, hands, and arms.

An employee preparing to move a damaged light pole to make room for a new one caught his hand between portions of the pole after trying to section it out by cutting it with a reciprocating saw. The light pole bent, and his hand was caught between sections.
An employee removing rocks from an auger suffered a finger amputation.
An employee dropped a piece of PVC conduit on his thumb, breaking it and damaging tendons.
An employee sustained an electrical shock and burns to the hand during construction of electrical power transmission and distribution lines.

An employee was using a hydraulic vise to secure an "I" beam to the band saw table. The power switch on the vise was triggered, causing the loss of his left-hand middle finger. The employee was hospitalized.

On Monday, March 30, 2015, at 12:38 p.m., an employee was standing on a 6-foot fiberglass ladder inside the entrance to the first floor when he touched an energized wire and received an electric shock. He fell from the ladder to the floor and fractured his left elbow.
An employee was moving a 60-inch-diamater pipe on a manual roller table. His right pinky fingertip was amputated in a pinch point created between the metal pipe and the roller.
An employee was injured when bridge piling fell on his leg during highway construction work.
An employee severed his left thumb while using a Skil saw to cut a 2 x 6 board.  He was hospitalized for reattachment surgery.
While working on the roof of a new commercial building, an employee tripped and fell, landing on a steel purlin. The employee lacerated the left arm and required surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was installing duct in a trench box. Because the trench was in an incline, the road plate shifted towards the box and pinched the worker's right forearm, causing it to break.

An employee working from a ladder was installing a pipe when a fitting came loose. The pipe fell, struck the employee's left leg, and caused him to lose his balance. He fell down the ladder and broke his right heel.
An employee was adjusting the rigging holding up a 3'9" tall manway door when the door came loose and fell on the employee's foot.
An employee was shocked and received third degree burns while working inside of a 480-volt panel. The panel was not off at the time.

An employee was moving a sheet of steel (300 lbs.) with an overhead hoist. The employee was using a magnet to move the metal from the grinding area to the finished stack. When the sheet was over the finished pile of sheets, the magnet released; the sheet fell on his hand, crushing the left middle and ring fingers. He was hospitalized.
An employee was clamping a light onto a battery cable when the motor fan turned on and cut the end of his right index finger off.
An employee was repairing an AC unit while working from an A-frame ladder. He fell off of the ladder and struck his head and shoulder on the ground.
On April 1, 2015, an employee amputated his left index finger while cutting wooden stakes using a circular saw. He was hospitalized.

An employee was painting the top of a doorframe while standing on stilts approximately 3 feet off of the ground. He turned to speak to another employee who had spoken to him; while doing so, he bumped his hard hat, causing him to slip and fall to the ground. He fractured his right arm and left elbow. He was hospitalized.

An employee climbed onto a scaffold to place his tools on the wall. He reached a section on the scaffolding where he needed to stretch to reach and removed the guarding at the end frame. When he went back to work in the area, he fell through the unguarded section, breaking his knee caps.
An employee fell from a single story when the employee's work belt was caught on the edge of a man basket.  The employee sustained a broken leg and arm.

An employee working from a platform began descending a ladder while attached to a climbing assist device. The employee reached up to close a hatch above him to prevent an open space where two other employees were working. The employee bumped the hatch and it came down on his right thumb.

An employee was attempting to connect a drill stem to a drill rod inside a bore hole. He was straightening the rod in the hole with his right hand and was using his other hand to run the controls. The cable was still connected at this time.  He lowered the drill rod and used his hand to connect the slipper or hoisting cable from the drill rod in the hole. The cable and the drill rod started to spin around, pulling in and causing an amputation to his right hand and arm.
An employee pinched his finger while removing plywood from a work area. His finger got caught between the concrete and plywood; he was hospitalized.
An employee fell from stilts while installing acoustical ceiling, sustaining a shattered or broken right kneecap and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was putting hurricane clips on the first landing of the stairs using a 4-foot ladder. He had one foot on the window sill and one foot on the ladder. There was dew on the window sill.  He slipped and fell to the ground, breaking his right elbow and suffering a concussion and bruises on his forehead.

An employee was struck by an asphalt roller. The injured employee dismounted the roller to clean the front drum. Another employee got on the roller and ran over the injured employee's legs. There was no evidence of an equipment malfunction.

On April 3, 2015, at approximately 10:30 a.m., an employee was installing a beam on a commercial medical building when the ladder he was on gave out. He fell approximately 10 feet, fracturing his hip bone and injuring his wrist.
An employee was replacing breast cable when a barge stay rope broke free. The rope hit the employee in the back, knocking him to the ground. He landed on his face.

Employees were changing out old aluminum electrical cables and replacing them with new cables.  The cables were in conduit.  The cable to be removed was de-energized.  The employee cut an energized cable and received burns on his right cheek from the resulting electrical arc flash.

Employees were dismantling a scaffold by passing the scaffolding materials in a chain.  One employee dropped a 5-foot scaffold pole at a height of approximately 35 to 40 feet.  The pole fell straight down, striking an employee on the ground on the brim of his hardhat.  The employee fell backwards, hitting his head and suffering head contusions.
An employee fell through the roof while carrying a metal panel. The wind caught the metal panel, dragging the employee over to an opening in the roof.  The employee fell and cut his forearm.
An employee was cutting a wooden 2-by-4 board.  As he cut close to his hand, the saw kicked back and pulled his gloved thumb into the blade, severely cutting his thumb just below the nail.
Employees were using a hydraulic lift to put equipment on a truck. The injured employee suffered an amputation when his finger got caught between a metal bar and a hook on the hydraulic lift.
While unloading a trailer, the trailer shifted and hit the employee in the leg.

An employee was hooking a trailer up to a truck with a coworker. The hitch got stuck; while attempting to unhook the hitch, the employee placed his hand on the hitch. The coworker lowered the trailer, and the employee's right, third fingertip got amputated after getting caught between the hitch and trailer. He was hospitalized.
An employee amputated his finger while cutting a piece of wood with a table saw.
An employee amputated a toe at the Quad B construction site.
An employee suffered severe cramping and heat exhaustion while performing work in 80-degree weather. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee's right middle finger got smashed and trapped between a Roura Hopper material handling device and the forks on a forklift.
The employee crushed his right hand while attaching the outrigger pad during the assembly of a crane.
An employee installing siding fell from a ladder breaking his left leg below the knee. The ladder was on the deck and slipped due to misty, wet weather conditions.

Two employees were preparing two industrial control panels for shipment. The control panel is 5 feet wide, 7 feet tall, 1 foot deep, and weighs approximately 500lbs. They were setting one on the shipping pallet when the second one fell on top of the worker striking him on the back and injuring his right shoulder, ribs, and lung.
An employee lacerated the back of his hand while cutting a board with a power saw.
An employee was tending the tug lines when one snapped and struck him in the face.
An employee was connecting steel beams when one of them came out, causing the employee to fall 15 feet. The employee sustained a fractured hip and was hospitalized.

An employee was installing roof shingles with a nail gun when he tripped over a lanyard and fell onto his hand. The nail gun in the opposite hand landed on his hand, and a nail entered his hand and struck his bone.

On or about 11 April 2015, at approximately 0830 hours, a Brazos Rock Energy employee received burns on his wrist and face when flammable gasses that accumulated during a pipeline hot tap ignited. The employee was helping a welder weld the pipe sections together when two pin-sized holes on a section of pipe 10 feet from the operation leaked flammable gasses into the pipe and surrounding area. The gasses accumulated to a level sufficient enough to cause a flash fire, which burned the employee.
An employee's right leg was crushed after being struck by an excavator bucket and pinned between the bucket and a concrete retaining wall. The employee's right leg was amputated above the knee.
An employee fell approximately 6 feet from a scaffold. He knocked out some teeth and possibly broke his arm.

An employee fell from a ladder while repairing a leaking waterline in the ceiling at a residence. He had just finished soldering pipe and was in the clean-up phase of the job when he fell and sustained injuries to the head, face, right wrist, and left thumb.
An employee sustained broken ribs and a punctured lung after falling while loading a tractor trailer. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a concrete paving saw. He lost control of the saw, and it hit and severely cut the back of his right leg.
While climbing out of his truck and stepping on the ground, an employee lost his footing and rolled his ankle.
An employee and coworkers were pulling fiber optic cables through a horizontal duct beneath the road. The employee passed out and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee descending a ladder fell and broke their pelvis while surveying an area that would need to have an electrical conduit installed.
An employee was filling a power washer with gasoline when combustion occurred. The employee was hospitalized for flash burns to his face.
An all terrain forklift ran over and broke an employee's leg.
An employee's cheek was struck-by a broken grinding wheel while he was using the grinder to clean materials.
An employee was struck in the temple by a hydraulic hose fracturing the eye socket and skull.
An employee was injured after stepping out of a jobsite trailer that had no stairs. The employee was admitted to the hospital with a fractured right leg.

An employee went under an F-350 truck to repair a locked transmission with the engine turned off. He disconnected the transmission cable and the vehicle moved in reverse naturally due to a slope in the terrain. The left front wheel ran over the employee from the shoulder to the abdomen.

An employee was helping to guide a skiff pan onto its side to be painted when the load shifted and the strap came off of the forks of the forklift. The corner of the pan landed on his right foot. The resulting foot fracture required hospitalization and surgery to repair.

An employee was assisting in installing access plates into a box cover.  The chain on the access plate slipped from the narrow portion of the keyhole to the wide portion of the keyhole which caused the plate to be released.  The employee had his finger below on the plate frame, and the plate fell onto the employee's thumb amputating it immediately below the nail bed.  The plate weighed approximately 1300 - 1400 lbs.

A utility line construction crew was in the process of replacing a wooden utility pole with a new metal utility pole and metal cross arm.  After the new metal pole and cross arm was installed the crew wrapped an insulated blanket around the pole above the cross arm.  Insulators were installed on the cross arm.  A crew member was in a lift bucket and was using metal quick ties to connect the power lines to the cross arm insulators.  The crew member tied one of the quick ties to an insulator and was preparing to tie one of the power lines to the insulator. The free end of the quick tie slipped out of the crew member's hand and curled underneath the insulated blanket contacting the power line.  The power line arced and burned the crew member's face.
An employee suffered a crushing injury to his right leg when the excavator that he was walking behind stopped and backed up.

On or about 16 April 2015 at approximately 1530 hrs an employee was leveling a section of the construction site with a 2007 Ingersoll Rand SD77DX Vibratory Smooth Drum Roller, when the vehicle started to slide down the embankment. The employee dismounted the vehicle and injured his neck upon impact with the ground.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet and broke his right wrist and left forearm. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee amputated part of his left thumb while using a masonry table saw to cut 4'x8' brick. The saw was guarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was removing concrete forms and loading them onto a flatbed tractor trailer when his left index finger got caught in the chain rigging that was in use to move the forms.  The load shifted and amputated his left index finger between the bottom of the finger nail and the top of the knuckle.
A foreman and the employee were in the electric room pulling a cover to test the breaker.  The employee reached in to take the shield off and was shocked.
An employee walking down a plywood ramp that was slick from the rain slipped and fell breaking his leg.

An employee was servicing a Gamco concrete paving machine due to a small hydraulic leak.  While servicing the head pulley belt, the employee sustained a puncture wound that released hydraulic fluid into his hand. The puncture wound was cleaned at hospital; however, the employee was hospitalized overnight to ensure there was no remaining hydraulic fluid in his hand.
An employee working at a pump station was hospitalized after being found unconscious on a metal staircase. He was treated for a concussion and shoulder and hip contusions.

On April 20, 2015, at about 1400 hrs, an employee walking on a concrete floor while conducting an inspection of work in progress, stepped on a covered hole that gave way, and fell 10 feet to the concrete surface below. The employee sustained two broken hips, a broken knee and two broken ribs.

An employee was working from a scissor lift performing connecting work when the steel beam that was supported by a crane struck the scissor lift knocking it over.  The employee jumped or fell approximately 12 to 14 feet to the ground and then the scissor lift fell on top of him.  The employee suffered two broken ankles and was hospitalized.

A truck driver was preparing to load material in a truck. A steel bar fell from the bottom storage rack and caught his finger between the steel bar and the ground.  The employees left middle finger was amputated.

A project superintendent was walking on a mezzanine made of a series of steel joists with sheets of plywood used for decking.  The employee fell through an unguarded area of the mezzanine, through the mezzanine floor and into an office below, where he hit his head on a desk.  The employee was transported to an area hospital where he was admitted.
An employee was exposed to hydraulic fluid while servicing a hydraulic line.

An employee was installing electrical cables near the ceiling at a manufacturing facility. The employee was operating a scissor lift at a height of approximately 26 feet. While pulling the cable, a portion of the cable end became entangled on the lift and the lift overturned. The employee suffered left leg injuries that required surgery.
An employee injured a hand working on an electric drill. Surgery was required to repair the hand.
A worker was descending a 20 foot extension ladder at an apartment complex construction site. At about 6 feet, he slipped and caught his leg in the ladder, breaking it in two places.
An employee amputated part of his left little finger when a fusion pipe fell on his hand at the jobsite.
An employee was performing maintenance work at a customer's location. While carrying a large fan, the employee fell and the fan blade struck the employee's right hand and severed the pinky finger.
An employee suffered a thumb amputation while performing demolition work when an excavator pinned the employee's thumb between a wall and a tooth of the excavator bucket.
An employee suffered a serious leg injury from a power pole while moving a stack of power poles using a Gradall forklift at or near 83rd and 64th in Stanley, North Dakota.

An employee was struck by a section of traffic guardrail. A backhoe was being used to remove the section. When it pulled on the guardrail, a portion of the guardrail flung and struck the employee in his legs.
An employee was exiting an excavator.  The employee's foot got caught on the exit ladder on the excavator, causing the employee to fall backwards onto the ground resulting in a broken right hip.
An employee was hit by the blast of a sand blaster, which injected media into his leg.

The employee was tasked with cleaning insulators inside a transformer rectifier set.  The employee reached inside the cabinet with a rag that had a mixture of vinegar and water on it to clean the insulator.  An electrical arc struck the fingers of his left hand.  The voltage is 307 volts and the amperage is unknown.
An employee fell through an elevator shaft of a two-story home thinking that the door led to a closet. The employee suffered a slight fracture to his lower back.
An employee was conducting brick work from a scaffold. He fell 6 feet to the ground and broke both arms.
An electrician who was pulling cables and doing rough-in work in an electrical room became ill, possibly due to heat issues.

An employee was taking down a scaffold when he fell through a hole in one of the scaffold planks.  He hit the railing on the scaffold when he fell, injuring his ribs. The employee was wearing fall protection at the time. He was hospitalized overnight.

An employee grabbed the outside, top edge of the skiff's bulwark when stepping off of the pier and onto the skiff. A wave hit the side of the skiff, causing the employee to lose his balance. His finger got caught between the pier and bulwark, amputating his ring fingertip.

An employee was lowering material from the first floor to the basement using a hoist.  He put his left hand on the wire rope to position the load as he lowered it. His pinky finger got caught between the wire rope and the hoist.
An employee's finger was crushed by a piece of falling casing material. As a result, his finger was later amputated at the first knuckle.
An employee was hospitalized for an infection resulting from a finger wound (metal sliver in skin).

Employees were doing layout work in the building on the floor. They mark lines to know where to set equipment to make wire. The equipment was blocking the layout line. They lifted the bar to set up the equipment with a 2x4. The equipment became imbalanced and titled over on the injured employee, breaking his leg below the knee.
An employee was in a 14-foot excavation installing a concrete box culvert. As he was climbing out of the culvert, he fell approximately 3 feet and broke his right femur. He was hospitalized.
An employee was holding a piece of string connected to a drill bit; when the drill cycled, it partially amputated the employee's right index finger.

A pendant line on a crane was secured to the crane's boom. As the boom was being elevated, the pendant line broke loose and went through the crane cab, striking the injured employee in the face/head. The employee was hospitalized.

At approximately 11:20 a.m., four employees were relocating a rolling scaffold hooch. While trying to move the hooch into position, one of the caster wheels got stuck. The employee tried to redirect the caster to align it with the others. His right-hand pinky finger got caught between the hooch's scaffold leg and a steel saw horse, resulting in an amputation to the fourth digit on the right hand just above the first joint.
An employee was struck-by a co-worker driving a 3/4 ton pick-up truck while walking to the job-site trailer. The employee suffered crushing injuries to the foot, ankle, and leg.

An employee had the tips of his ring and middle fingers amputated above the fingernail during an outlet valve installation.  The outlet valve moved suddenly during the installation, causing the injury.
An employee fell from a 1-tier scaffold and sustained a head injury.

On or about April 26, 2015, an employee was cleaning the inside of a vessel with a water pressure gun when he slipped and his left foot entered the path of the pressure gun causing lacerations. The employee was hospitalized and received stitches.
An employee hooked equipment with a pulley, and the clamp pinched his middle finger on his right hand.
An employee was at the construction site and tripped and fell to the ground resulting in a broken nose.
A worker was installing soffits and while removing old boards a board fell striking the worker's left hand and pushing it into the rotating blade of the skill saw.
An employee had his hand on the back door when someone opened the front door and the draft caused the back door to open and jammed his finger.
An employee was injured while welding a joint on a field plate.  When the joint was re-lifted, the weld broke, and a field plate landed on his left foot.  The resulting fractures required surgery.

On or about April 28, 2015 at 12:30 PM two employees were repositioning a water buffalo on the jobsite. The water buffalo had been delivered by a dump truck so the spring lock handle was positioned and supported too high to be placed onto a pick up truck hitch. To lower the spring lock handle, the employee kicked away the dunnage that was supporting the handle.  In the process of removing the supporting dunnage the handle became unstable and fell to the ground, striking the  employee's left foot and breaking it.

A dump truck driver was dumping on a slight incline when the dump truck tipped over onto its lift side (passenger side). The driver was not wearing a seat belt and fell to the passenger side, fracturing the left femur bone and was hospitalized.
An employee was struck by a company truck at the company's construction yard and hospitalized for a broken leg.
An employee sustained a fractured pelvis and right leg after being ejected from a personal basket attached to a telehandler and falling approximately 15 feet.
While climbing a ladder, an employee lost his footing and fell approximately 6 feet and broke his leg.
An employee broke his left leg after he fell off of a baker scaffold.
An employee operating a prime mover slipped and received a contusion on the leg.  Three weeks later, the employee was admitted to the hospital due to an infection of that injury.

An employee was on a construction site. He was loading a tractor onto the low boy rig in order to move it to another location. He was also loading another piece of equipment; neither piece of equipment fit. He walked between the pieces to adjust them, and the tractor rolled into him. He got caught between the two pieces in his thigh area.
