An employee was assisting a rigger unload material. While unloading the material, the load leaned and one of the forms (whaler pieces) split out and struck the employee's leg.
While bolting two metal plates together one plate slipped and severed a finger.
An employee was dismantling a scaffold when he fell 12 feet.  He broke his left hip and pelvis.
An employee bypassed the safety trigger on a pressure washer and received lacerations to the hand from water.

On April 30, at 9:15 a.m., an employee fell from a ladder while dismantling a scaffold inside a tank.  The fall was less than 20 feet. The dimensions of the scaffold were 10x10x33. The employee fractured both heels and sustained a small skull fracture that required stitches. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized after being struck by soil/dirt while working within a sloped trench that was approximately 9-feet deep. The employee injured the right leg.

An employee was elevated in a work platform attached to a forklift when a piece of conduit fell, striking the basket and knocking him from it.  He fell approximately 20 feet and sustained a broken wrist and leg, requiring surgery.
An employee was working near Grand Isle. He tripped over a rock on the side of the road and fell onto a large piece of glass, cutting his hand. He was hospitalized and underwent hand surgery.

An employee was attempting to offload a car hauler when he lost his balance and jumped off the trailer approximately 5 feet 3 inches landing on his left leg. He sustained multiple fractures to the leg bones and was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was injured when a hydraulic hose from a hydraulic pump busted.  The employee was performing a lug-nut connection on a cable-end. The employee received injuries to his upper right thigh. Hydraulic fluid penetrated into the employee's leg 1/2" wide by 3/4" deep.  The employee was hospitalized for observation.

The employee was helping to secure a concrete wall panel that a backhoe was putting into place. The panel was secured and then the backhoe released the load, but the bottom of the panel came loose. The panel fell and struck the employee in the chest and left hand. The employee sustained broken ribs and abrasions on his hand.
An employee was on a tubular pile adjusting straps. The pile rolled, catching his foot and causing him to fall, fracturing his right leg. No cribbing was used at the time of the incident.

An employee was stripping concrete form work. The employee was tied off to the concrete form work when it moved and fell to the ground. The employee was pulled by the falling form work and hit the ground. The employee fell 14 feet and was hospitalized with head and back injuries.

On 05/04/2015, at approximately 12:45 PM, an employee was assembling tools to hammer down some parts in the shop area of the work facility. His hand slipped, and the tool struck his right hand, amputating the right little fingertip. He was hospitalized.
An employee was standing on a 6-foot scaffold lifting a board when he lost his footing, fell to the ground, and broke his arm.

A road construction crew was using a track-hoe to cover a hole in the roadway with a steel plate.  The chain rigging used to suspend the plate slipped or otherwise failed, causing the plate to shift.  An employee tried to prevent the plate from falling, which resulted in injuries to the right side of the employee's body, including a broken right pinky finger, lacerations to the right arm, a broken right tibia, and five broken bones in the right foot.  The employee underwent surgery and was hospitalized.
An employee fell 8 feet through a hole on the flat roof after removing roofing material, fracturing his shoulder blades.
While an employee was grinding metal materials with a side grinder, the wheel of the grinder kicked back and lacerated his left arm.
An employee suffered hand and torso injuries when a pallet of rebar dowel being lifted by a forklift fell on the employee at 2801 North Joycee Lane in Sioux Falls, South Dakota.
An employee was cleaning an Etnyre Maintenance Distributor when he was sprayed with hot tack coat. He suffered second degree burns on his torso and first degree burns on his arms.
An employee was cutting welding rod with a band saw when the rod ejected from the cutting surface and impaled the employee above the knee on the left leg.
An employee developed an infection after having a sliver of metal in his hand.
An employee's hand became caught in in equipment injuring his index finger.

An employee fueling a boat with gasoline heard a clicking noise near the battery compartment. While investigating, a flash vapor fire occurred, causing second degree burns to the employee's right and left forearms.

An employee was attempting to square up a 90-degree bend with a horizontal pipe using an overhead crane. The horizontal pipe slid off its supports towards the employee who used his hands to push the pipe away. The employee's left ring fingertip got pinched between the 90 and the horizontal pipe, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was injured during response to a boiler pipe breach/explosion, suffering burns to approximately 50 percent of the body.

An employee fell off of a 10-foot roof. The employee had used a ladder to access the roof and was applying caulking around the chimney. The employee fractured the left wrist and left ankle and was hospitalized.
An employee injured a thumb while clearing a clogged drill head, requiring hospitalization.

On May 7, 2015, at approximately 11:00 a.m., an employee received first and second degree burns to his face, hands, left arm, and left leg, resulting in hospitalization.  The employee was troubleshooting an existing switchgear. The employee de-energized the equipment and thought it was safe to perform the work. The buss was still energized with 13,800 volts and an arc flash occurred.
An employee was operating a fuel-loop maintenance truck. While fueling a bulldozer, he stepped over the fuel hose with his left foot. His right foot twisted and broke at the ankle.
On 05/08/2015, at approximately 7:10 a.m., an employee was stripping an MC Wire when he made contact with the live wire and received burns to both hands. He was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was trying to separate a piece of angle iron on the pipe rack with his hands. He separated one side of the angle iron from the other two pieces. He was walking next to the pipe rack to get to the other side when the pipe rack collapsed and landed on him, breaking his leg.

An employee was measuring a form at the manufacturing plant, FMB building. He was standing on the form, approximately 3 feet off the ground. As he stepped back, he lost his balance and fell backwards, landing on his back on the concrete floor.

The first employee was using a backhoe to dig a 12" to 18" trench for the drill slurry, so the slurry water could be pumped away while concrete was being poured. The second employee instructed the first to pull forward so he could dig the pit for the pump head. The first employee put the backhoe in drive, but it lurched forward because it was still throttled up. The first employee tried to pull the shifter down into neutral, but it went all the way down into reverse. It backed up quickly, striking the second employee in the knee.
An employee working on a flat roof fell approximately 12 feet, injuring his back and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was attempting to fix an air/oiler on an air tank under an asphalt silo. The safety gate released and hit the employee in the head.
An employee fell from a two-story roof, sustaining back and neck injuries.
An employee was being harassed by a coworker. The coworker picked up a product and threw it at the employee, striking his right cheek. He required stitches.

An employee delivering and removing skids was injured while unloading 12-inch clamps from the flatbed of the truck. The clamps got caught on the employee's clothing and pulled him off of the truck, injuring his lower back.
An employee was dismounting the cab of a crane when he fell on the deck barge, injuring his right wrist and right hip.
An employee fell from a ladder on 5/11/15 and broke an ankle. The ladder was not set up correctly at the time of the incident.
An employee turned his back on a live high-voltage line as he was uncovering an electrical power he was about to work on, causing burns to his neck and right thigh. He was hospitalized.
An employee attempted to reset forks on a PIT using a second PIT. The fork slipped, catching and lacerating the employee's hands. The employee was hospitalized for hand surgery.

An employee was filling a sandblast pot with more media. As he stepped away from it, the hose fitting decoupled, leaving his right leg in line with blasting media discharge. The discharge caused an abrasion in the right curved area of his right leg.
An employee broke his leg tripping over light-pole foundation footing while trying to run out of the way of a falling security fence.
An employee pulling wire felt a strange pain in his belly. He was hospitalized to determine the source of the severe pain.

An employee was operating hydraulic equipment, a directional bore machine, when he thought there was a leak. He moved the hose to check if there was a leak. He placed his hand on it and was injected by oil into his left middle finger.
An employee standing on top of a box beam slipped and fell onto a platform approximately 5 feet below him, breaking his leg.

An employee was on a 10-foot step-ladder installing some piping in a new structure. The ladder started to "walk" and began to kick out. The employee reached up to the pipes to steady himself, but then fell and broke his wrist.

An employee was on an 18-foot extension ladder. While looking to see if the concrete was poured over the rebar, he fell 8 feet to the ground with the ladder, breaking both of his forearms. He was hospitalized.
An employee was helping coworkers lift the side of a large HVAC unit. His right middle fingertip got caught under the HVAC unit as it was being lowered to the ground.

An employee was torqueing a crossover and putting on tubing with a 36-inch pipe wrench. The hydraulic lever lost power. When the employee started troubleshooting the equipment, the wrench swung back and hit the employee in the chest.
An employee fell from a scaffold rack while unloading scaffolding material from a flatbed truck and sustained a broken wrist and head bump.
A crane hook broke, causing its load to fall from the crane onto an employee. The employee's head was pinned between the load and a dump truck.
At approximately 8:40 a.m. on Friday, 05/15/2015, an employee sustained a broken right arm after falling from a tipping scaffold to the concrete floor.

Three employees were operating a crane on the jobsite. They were getting ready to take some spouting and needed more length on the sling, so they had to remove the jib. The person on the crane platform was attempting to remove the jib and could not get it. Another employee came to help take the pin out.  Once they removed the pin, the jib fell on the employee who was trying to remove the pin, breaking his right leg.

A light-duty pickup truck struck and ran over an employee from behind. The employee was  struck in the hip and fell to the ground; the truck's rear wheel ran over the employee's knee. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee poured water into the concrete mixer and the water splashed into his eyes. Moments later, the employee extended his hand to pick up the bucket when he instead felt a tick on the tip of his left middle finger. His finger got nipped by the concrete mixer paddles. No amputation occurred.
On 5/15/15, an employee was hospitalized after suffering a laceration to the left pinky finger. The employee was conducting maintenance activities at the time.

An employee was removing a hose from an asphalt truck. When the employee unhooked the hose, the oil remaining in the hose splashed back onto the employee's left arm, causing chemical burns. He was hospitalized.

An employee was handling a cable that runs between a drum and the spud. He was trying to put slack in the cable line when the spud shifted and caused the cable to tighten. The cable struck and fractured his left leg just above the ankle.
On or about May 18, 2015, an employee became light-headed and "sick" after likely suffering from dehydration on the jobsite. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was on a head platform attached to the top of a 200 foot tall elevator guiding a new conveyor belt into the elevator from the top. The belt was inserted about 3/4 of the way when the belt broke and fell on two employees on the platform knocking the employee to the floor of the platform and fracturing his right hip. The second employee received stitches and was released.
An employee was working on pressurized pipe.  When he attempted to loosen a pipe to turn a 90-degree angle, the cap on the pipe dislodged and blew into his abdomen.

An employee was attempting to remove a sewer cover using clamps with his right hand.  He reached under the cap when there was enough room to fit his hand, and the sewer cap fell on his left middle finger.  The finger was amputated between the nail bed and the first knuckle

The employee was preparing to dismantle scaffolding the employer had erected in the north stairwell of the building.  The employee stepped onto a scaffold platform and the walkboard gave way.  The employee fell 3-4 feet.  On the way down, the index and middle fingers of the employee's right hand were injured. The tip of the middle finger was amputated and the tip of the index finger was cut such that the tip was barely attached to the finger. The flesh of the index finger could not be saved and had to be amputated (no bone involvement).

An employee was trying to help guide a load by grabbing onto a tag line. He tripped over the stands made out of wood that were holding the extension cords off the ground and landed on his left arm, causing a fracture.
An employee caught his hand between a road-plate and dunnage.
An employee fell about 8 feet from a ladder and fractured his skull. He was hospitalized.

An employee was working with another crane operator to move a crane. The employee had taken in the outriggers on his side and was moving one of the pads to a designated spot on the crane. He was walking around to the other side of the crane where the other operator was still putting the outriggers up. He slipped in the muddy conditions and put his left hand out to catch himself. His hand landed on the outrigger being brought in, crushing his ring and middle finger resulting in the amputation of both fingers.

On May 19, 2015, at approximately 11:00am, an employee was hospitalized after being struck in the head by a 3 inch rubber air hose fitting.  The employee was operating a drill rig at the time of the incident.  A hose under 300 pounds pressure, broke at the fitting (swivel came off the threads) allowing the hose to whip and strike the employee in the back of the head.  The employee fell 5' from a platform resulting in a fractured skull.
On or about  May 19, 2015, an employee exiting a roof onto a ladder was impaled in the back of the knee by a lightning rod.
An employee was hospitalized with an infection due to a foot injury suffered on a jobsite a few weeks prior.

An employee was descending a ladder when his hammer came loose from his tool belt, striking a shot strip that was lying on the floor. One of the unused shots detonated in the shot strip, causing a metal fragment to strike the employee's right arm.

An employee was walking on stilts (raised up about 3 feet), installing batt insulation in the ceiling (about 8-feet high) with a manual staple hammer. The stilts caught a piece of plastic insulation bundle wrapping, causing the employee to lose his balance on the stilts. He tipped forward on the stilts, striking the floor with his knees. His coworkers offered to help him back up, but they couldn't move him. He was hospitalized with a fractured spine.
An employee fell through a hole in the floor to the decking 14 feet below, breaking both wrists.

An employee burned his right foot while transferring hot roof tar from one container to another.  The receptacle into which he was pouring broke, causing some tar to spill onto his foot and burning him.

While digging pits under the foundation of the building, a piece of concrete fell and struck two employees. One employee was treated and released with a hand injury; the second employee was hospitalized with a chest injury.
A tractor ran over and broke an employee's foot while he was loading the tractor onto a truck transporter.

An employee finished installing the ridge cap on a roof and had removed the fall protection anchors. He stepped back onto the ladder to exit the roof and lost his footing, falling approximately 20 feet. He required surgery for a broken hip and ribs.
On 5/21/15, an employee was using a panel cutting machine. When he changed the length of the panel, his hand got caught by the blade, amputating three fingers.
An employee was lowering a fire hose off of the side of a ship using a rope when the rope became tangled around his index finger, amputating it at the first knuckle. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee's leg was pinned by elevator doors.
An employee smashed the middle two fingers of the left hand while connecting two beams.

An employee was clearing the bottom of an underpinning excavation when the ceiling collapsed and he became pinned under a large granite rock from the old foundation they were underpinning.  The employee was hospitalized and received surgery to repair broken bones in his back.
An employee suffered an amputation of two fingers on the right hand when a concrete truck lurched backwards crushing the employee's fingers between the delivery chute and an adjacent wall.

An employee was setting trusses on the second floor. A truss shifted causing the employee to lose balance and fall approximately 25 feet to the floor. The employee was hospitalized with a broken arm and head, nose and left hand injuries.
An employee was on a wooden structural wall pouring concrete when the machine started to malfunction. He jumped from the wall and broke a leg.
On 5/22/2015 the injured worker tripped over rebar lying on a pallet and fell breaking his leg above the ankle. The break required surgery to repair.
An employee was pushing a cart with steel louvers on the cart. The steel louvers slipped off and crushed the big toe on his left foot.

On 5/26/2015, an employee was on a ladder about 4 to 5 feet from the ground and close to the trash chute. When he was reaching over to secure plywood, he lost balance and fell injuring his left leg and wrist.

A four inch diameter drill casing used to load shot when blasting for bridge footings approximately 100 feet deep exploded.  The employee was in a designated area assigned for loading the shot.  The shot was complete and clean-up was being performed.  Once the shot has been ignited in the casing, the casings are retrieved and placed into a scrap trailer.  An employee was attempting to cut the casing with a cutting torch to fit into the scrap trailer when the casing exploded. The employee's face and arms were cut requiring stitches.  He also has ringing in his left ear.
An employee was climbing up a ladder and slipped and fell onto his ankle. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was retrieving bolts from a cardboard box onsite when he was bitten on his right hand middle finger by a copper head snake that was in the box. The employee had a reaction to the anti-venom and was hospitalized.
An employee lacerated his right hand and was hospitalized.

An employee was working on a pallet dismantler machine when his right hand was caught in the  machine while removing a piece of wood that was causing a jam.  The tip of the employee's right thumb was amputated as a result.
An employee slipped and fell to the ground while accessing a loader. The employee broke his collar bone.
On or about 05/27/2015 an employee came into contact with an energized cable.

On May 27, 2015 at approximately 1:30 p.m., an employee received 2nd and 3rd degree electrical burns to approximately 55% of his body when a crane boom contacted overhead power lines and the employee came in contact with the crane.

A temporary employee was setting up a precast form onsite. The employee was attempting to insert a safety pin into the precast form bracket. As he was inserting the pin, his left middle finger was caught between the form and the bracket which crushed/pinched the tip of employee's finger. There was no bone loss; only skin and finger nail.
An employee was removing a section of pipe when the wrench slipped and the employee fell backwards breaking his right leg just above the ankle.

An employee brushing walls with a masonry brush near the northwest corner stairway attempted to step from a step ladder onto a scaffold resulting in a fall.  The employee was admitted into the hospital with a collapsed lung.

An employee suffered a broken wrist as he attempted to close a container door while sitting on a forklift. The employee's wrist was caught between the door of the container and the cage of the forklift.

An employee was helping to lower a template that was being suspended by a crane when his right thumb got caught between the template and one of its folding parts. He was taken to the hospital for surgery to repair a broken thumb.
An employee fell approximately 12 feet, suffering broken ribs and a collapsed lung.
An employee standing on the second floor of the building fell approximately 10 feet to the floor below, injuring his left arm. He was hospitalized and underwent surgery.
An employee was struck on the hand by a piece of concrete that fell from the ceiling while sweeping the floor. The employee suffered a partial amputation to the left ring finger.
An employee pinched two left-hand fingers between the mast and hoist of a moving lift jockey. He was hospitalized and underwent surgery.

An employee took a nap in his pickup truck in the shipyard parking lot because he felt sick. Coworkers found him on the ground next to his truck. He was subsequently hospitalized with a fractured C2-vertebra in his neck.
An employee was struck in the head while carrying demolition out of a warehouse building.

An employee was installing/performing work on an HVAC system and had to enter the attic for an undetermined amount of time. The employee came down into the lobby of the facility where work was being performed, collapsed, and lost consciousness.
An employee suffered a leg injury after being pinned between a concrete form and a concrete truck at or near 25 Airport Road in Minot, North Dakota.

Employees were removing a drill pin from the drill rig equipment when an employee stuck his left hand in the metal mold. He sustained an amputation to his left index finger and middle finger behind the fingernail.

A Santana Textiles employee was working from a ladder when he slipped and fell 4 feet. He tried to grab onto the wall and fell, fracturing his left arm and scraping his forehead. The worksite was very muddy from recent rains at the time of the incident.
An employee was taking apart a cylinder from a Clovis Machine.  The cylinder fell and caught the employee's left middle finger between the cylinder and the work table.
An employee was hospitalized after hitting his head on the edge of an escalator pit and possibly contacting live electrical parts.
An employee lacerated his left forearm from the elbow to the wrist on a dovetail anchor as he poured concrete in formwork. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was taking HVAC equipment to the dumpster and was helping to slide the ducts off the forklift forks. His hand got caught when the duct work slid backwards on the forks, amputating his right thumb tip.

An electrical contractor was installing a 480 volt electrical panel at a customer location. The employee pulled wires to the panel the day before the accident, but did not finish the job. When he returned to the facility the next day, he got on a ladder and touched the panel that he thought was cold. At some point between the time he left the panel and returned to finish the job the wires were energized. The employee was shocked and thrown from the ladder. He received burns on his hands and was admitted to the hospital.
On or about June 2, 2015, a forklift's forks dropped unexpectedly, pinning an employee's wrist between the forks of the forklift and the post support.
An employee's fingertip was amputated while using a table saw to perform carpentry work.
An employee sustained a left ring finger amputation while attempting to clear a bind in a reel of electrical cable.
An employee was loading a duct jack in a pickup truck with other employees when he slipped and got caught on the truck's tailgate, injuring his right shin/leg. He was hospitalized.

On 06/03/2015, around 2:00 P.M., an employee was wearing rubber gloves while handling adhesives in the facility. The employee finished handling the adhesives and went to cut metal pipe banding. As the metal banding was cut, it retracted to the floor and bounced up, cutting the employee at the knuckle on the right middle finger. Company-provided leather gloves were not worn at the time of the incident. The employee was later hospitalized for a possible infection and received antibiotics.

On or about 3 June 2015, at approximately 1825 hours, an AR Daniel Construction employee was hospitalized due to an injury acquired at the jobsite. The employee was working in a trench under the railroad tracks located at Grand and 3rd street in Amarillo, Texas, when he was struck in the face by a piece of angle iron that was being used to hoist the pipeline that he was working near. The angle iron was inside the pipe, and a line was tied to the angle iron to hoist the pipe up enough for the employee to remove wood planking from underneath it. The angle iron became dislodged and struck him, causing multiple facial fractures and lacerations.

An employee was performing maintenance on a compressor fan and suffered an amputation to the tip of the fourth digit (ring finger) of the left hand when the finger came into contact with the fan blade.

A worker was erecting a one section high rolling scaffold.  He was approximately 5-6 feet off the ground on the platform when the end frame detached while he was trying to install a cross brace. The worker fell and the frame struck his leg.

An employee was working as a laborer on a road paving jobsite when his lower left leg was run over by a tire on a Weber machine, which picks up ground-up road surface material and transfers it to a conveyer belt that drops the material into a paver machine.

An employee was employed as a tour guide for this steel mill facility.  He was giving a tour and was walking down a two step set of stairs when he missed the second step and fell to the floor. Later that day he went to the hospital and was admitted for three broken ribs on his left side.
While cutting a sandblast hose, an employee cut his left forearm with a box cutter.
An employee welding on the hospital roof suffered heat-related symptoms.
An employee was struck by an excavator bucket, sustaining compound fractures and broken bones to the leg. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was holding on to the exterior top rail of a moving electric man lift with his left hand. The unit hit a horizontal brace, crushing his left-hand ring and pinky fingers.
An employee lost control of a concrete pumping truck, which then rolled down over the hill. He severed his left leg and broke his arm and pelvis.

An employee was on a pump jack scaffold installing siding on a residential home using a nail gun. A nail from the gun bounced off the wall and hit the employee in the eye. The nail got stuck in his eye, and he was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee slipped and fell on mud while walking on a steel road plate, breaking his hip.

A beam was being loaded onto a flatbed truck. When the beam was being placed onto the flatbed, the wood and entire deck collapsed, causing the beam to shift. The concrete fell on the employee's left small toe; surgery had to be performed.

An employee at a service call for a commercial building was in the attic when he fell through the ceiling and landed on the floor, suffering a fractured right pelvic bone and left wrist, a contusion on the right jaw, and a concussion.

An employee was putting chutes back into a holder when the edge of the chute got caught on the mixer drum. The drum pushed the chute into a bracket, catching the employee's fingers between the chute and drum. His finger was amputated.
An employee installing solar panels fell from the roof to the garage, fracturing a foot.
An employee fell 3.5 feet while welding a digester lid and broke his leg. He was hospitalized.

An employee was using a large wrench to tighten a bore on a boring pipeline.  When he finished, he gave the all clear to start the boring. The pipe wrench was not removed from the bore; it swung around and struck him on his left-hand pinky finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was removing an electrical cord from a water tower when he came into contact with overhead power lines and received electrical burns to his hands.
An employee fell approximately 20 feet to the ground below. The employee was hospitalized with several broken bones and a head injury.
An employee fell while walking in stilts and carrying snips that punctured the employee's abdomen. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee placed a 4-foot long piece of metal into the passenger seat of a golf cart. The piece of metal hit the gas pedal on the golf cart and the golf cart lurched forward, hitting the employee on the left leg below the knee.
An employee was using a rescue saw to cut a granite curb when it kicked back, hitting him in the face.
An employee was carrying a 4x6-feet wooden beam when he lost his footing and slipped and fell, pinching his right index finger between a beam corner and the 4x6 beam.
An employee was injured during concrete hammer chipping operations when a concrete piece flew off and caused a contusion on the employee's right forearm. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell at the Atlanta airport, under Concourse E, Apron level, at the international baggage line. The employee slipped on black dust and broke his hip as a result of the fall.
An employee fell off of a 6-foot ladder and hit his elbow.

An employee was attempting to lift a slurry tank to move with a pallet jack. The tank rolled catching the employee's right middle finger between the slurry tank cribbing and the asphalt ground resulting in an amputation to at least the first knuckle.

An employee was making sure that no one was in the way of the forklift as the forklift driver was lowering a 20 ft long metal beam onto the ground. The employee then pulled the hand grinder's electrical cord that was on the ground so that it wouldn't get crushed by the metal beam, but instead his right index finger was crushed by the beam resulting in the amputation of his right index finger from the second knuckle.

The injured employee was building a scaffold. While constructing the scaffold, the leg of the scaffold hit a valve (located above)releasing sulfuric acid. He suffered burns on the left side of his body and was hospitalized.

An employee was loading a transformer into the bucket of a Bobcat from the side. The Bobcat operator did not see him when he moved the bucket and caught the employee's right pinky finger in the joint/hinge where the bucket is attached and amputated the fingertip.
An employee operating a roller jumped off the machine when it began to tilt.  The employee was hospitalized with injuries to his left arm and shoulder.

An employee was contracted to perform work at another facility to relocate a molding machine.  Normal procedure is to bring the machine within about one inch of the leveling pad so that a bolt can be hand placed to align with the hole on the machine that is being bolted down (to conclude the relocation of the machine). While using a hydraulic jack to perform this task, the hydraulic jack "failed" as the machine came down on the employee's left hand crushing it in 3-4 separate places.
An employee working on a road construction project cleaning up after concrete chipping was struck by the street sweeper and suffered a broken sacrum.
An employee suffered a fractured femur when he fell from a scaffold after the spreader beam that he had tied his fall protection to fell to the ground.

On or about 6/11/2015, at 8:55 a.m., an employee working with a roof cutter attempted to seal a hole that was located on the inside panel of the machine. The employee reached into the machine and his glove got caught in the blade, amputating his ring fingertip and lacerating his middle finger. The machine was running at the time of the incident.

A call from Monroe Community College early in the morning of 6/11/15 said that there was a power outage. Employees were sent on site to restore power. The injured employee inadvertently moved a ground wire in proximity to an energized part and an arc flash occurred. He received second degree burns to his hand and first degree burns to his arm and face.
An employee was walking in the turbine floor of the boiler area and struck his head on an overhanging pipe and fell to the floor breaking his right femur.

The injured employee was a spotter for a broom tractor. The broom tractor operator was backing up and lost sight of the employee. The employee was struck by the broom tractor resulting in a concussion, a fractured skull and facial lacerations.
An employee was hospitalized after he cut his leg with a powered hand saw.
An employee was burned on the leg while cutting rebar.
An employee missed a ladder step and fell 6 to 12 feet, breaking a foot and injuring a shoulder.

An employee fell about 8 feet from a one-story residential house when he stepped onto the ladder from the roof and lost his footing.  He fell onto the concrete and injured his heel, requiring hospitalization.

Employees had removed the canopy top off a small 36" excavator to get it through a doorway.  They were in the process of putting the canopy back on when it slipped and hit the safety lever, which activates the boom.  The boom swung around, and the excavator bucket struck the backside of the injured employee between his ribs and pelvis.  The bucket was constructed of sharp metal, which caused a severe cut that required stitches. The employee was hospitalized overnight for observation.
An employee was changing the tracks on a John Deere bobcat. As he turned the wheel, his finger got caught in the wrong place, snipping off the end of the left index finger.

An employee was checking a leak on the roof. He fell through the roof (skylight) and ceiling (another 15 feet) to the ground for about 50 feet total. He was hospitalized for a dislocated shoulder, a cut on his left rib, and brain bleeding. He underwent surgery.
An employee was unloading a HVAC condenser from a flat bed truck and his index finger was smashed between the condenser and the guardrail of the flat bed truck, causing a partial amputation.

An employee was standing on a step ladder installing temporary lighting. The employee was handed an electrical whip/flexible conduit. The wires in the conduit were live, 277 volts. The employee received an electric shock from the wiring and fell off the ladder. As the employee fell off the ladder his left foot went between two rungs and he fractured his lower left leg.

An employee was standing on the third step of an eight foot step ladder pulling a cable through a conduit with a fish tape. The fish tape popped off the cable and the employee fell off the ladder and struck the ground. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured pelvis and chipped vertebrae.
An employee fell off the roof at a jobsite at New River Marine Corps Station, hitting his head and hurting his back.  He was hospitalized.
An employee was exposed to a live electrical wire while on a ladder installing insulation to the ceiling. The employee came in contact with the wiring.

On or about June 19, 2015, at 11:00 p.m., a 3' x 5' roller rolled over an employee's foot while rolling asphalt.  The employee was working on a Route I-91 jobsite in Enfield, Connecticut. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was on a cat walk operating an ADL boom loader crane. The truck part of the crane started moving forward. The employee got out of the operator's seat and jumped off of the cat walk onto the truck bed, fracturing his right leg.

Two employees were taking measurements under the Route 219 bridge to prepare for their next cut on the bridge. The bridge collapsed. One of the employees was hospitalized for head, neck, and spinal injuries. The other employee was treated for a broken ankle.
An employee was working at the 5-foot level of a 10-foot step ladder. The employee fell to the concrete ground below, breaking the left ankle and requiring hospitalization.
An employee's left index fingertip was amputated when it got pinched between a road plate while rigging the plate to a backhoe bucket with a lift chain.
While cleaning the plunge plate of a pole using a foot pedal, an employee's left foot fractured after getting caught  between the pole and the ladder.
An employee suffered burns on his right leg while using a gas saw to cut steel. The employee was cutting steel when the sparks from the gas saw ignited his jeans. He was hospitalized.
An employee was transferring wash material from one level to another using a scaffold ladder. He  fell backwards and fractured his back. He as admitted to the hospital.

An employee was spray painting for the second part of the day. He cleaned up his tools and was walking to his car. His legs became wobbly and the supervisor put him in a golf cart to cool him off. He collapsed and was taken by ambulance to the hospital.
An employee was cleaning the LMC machine's (glue machine) rollers and caught his right index finger in the chain and sprocket apparatus. His finger was amputated at the first digit.

On a worksite managed by Whiting-Turner Contracting Company, an employee of Concrete Coring Company of St. Louis, was drilling a hole in bedrock using a core drill. Employees of Gold Mechanical, a plumbing contractor on the worksite, were conducting a live test of piping using pneumatic air. The injured employee was working adjacent to a pipe included in the live test. A cap from the pipe was propelled at a high velocity by the pneumatic air and struck the injured employee in the face and fracturing his jaw. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was on top of a scaffold performing dry blasting operations. The employee was kneeling to reach the lower area and lost balance. The employee blasted the left hand and was hospitalized as a result of the injury.

Two employees were pulling wire from one panel to another panel. One panel was energized; the other panel was not. The employee who was working at the energized panel came in contact with the live wires and suffered electrical burns to his hand (277 volt).
An employee was inside a sewer hole and was turning on a jetting tool when the pressure caused the hose to whip around and strike the employee's lip and elbow.
An employee was climbing a ladder with a caulking gun, lost his footing, and fell six feet injuring the right ankle and the left elbow. The ankle injury required surgery.

An employee was installing drywall from a 2-foot scaffold. There was a 5-by-5 foot opening adjacent to the scaffold. The scaffold was on an incline and rolled down the slope into the hole.  Once the scaffold hit the hole, the employee flew from the scaffold and made contact with the concrete, breaking three ribs, bruising the right shoulder, and cutting the forehead.

On 6/23/15, an employee was hospitalized when he fell from a ladder. It was reported that the strap, which secured the ladder, broke. The employee fractured, broke, and dislocated bones in his right arm and left hand/wrist when he contacted the ground.

While reaching through a hole in a wall an employee stepped on a ladder that was leaning against the lower part of this opening. He stepped above the fulcrum of the ladder. Therefore, the ladder acted like a teeter-totter and the employee fell about two feet and broke his left ankle.

An employee was loading a side dump truck while working on a median at the intersection of Lincoln and Lamay in Ft Collins. The driver was given the signal to pull forward just as the injured employee slipped on the curb. The dump truck ran over the employee's leg.
An employee was using a boom when a piece of granite slab fell on the employee's leg.
An employee working construction showed signs of heat exhaustion. The employee taken to the hospital and given fluids and admitted for observation.
An employee was struck by an air hammer chisel, breaking a bone in his right foot.

An employee was working outside on a very hot day, helping another employee pull 4-inch coiled plastic pipe off a trailer when he started feeling sick, vomiting, and experiencing muscle cramps. He was hospitalized for dehydration.

An employee and a coworker were rolling a cylindrical cyclone hopper down a passageway when the hopper became unbalanced and started to fall. As the employee attempted to catch and re-steady the hopper, his left pinky finger got caught between a metal flange on the hopper and a permanently fixed metal pipe of the building. The employee injured the left pinky finger; the fingertip was amputated at the hospital.
An employee working near an auger hole was injured when something in the hole sparked, causing minor burns to the employee's right and left forearms and cheeks. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a heat-related injury while working when he started to cramp. His condition became critical by the end of his shift. He suffered renal failure and was hospitalized on 6/24/15.
An employee who became dizzy was hospitalized and treated for heat-related illness.

A pile up of tiles occurred on line 8. An employee attempted to turn the conveyor off at the switch. The employee was looking at the pile while his hand was aimed at the switch. His hand missed the switch and the back of his hand made contact with the pulley and guard causing a laceration.
An employee laying out a curb line on a road construction project was hit in the work zone by a privately driven vehicle. The employee suffered broken ribs.
An employee transporting asphalt on a roof tripped and fell, injuring his/her hands and wrists.

On Friday 6/26/2015, at 9:00 a.m., a maintenance employee was driving, putting a brand new pin into the backhoe/excavator bucket with a slug hammer. A piece of metal from the new pin broke off, struck him and was imbedded in his shoulder. The injury required hospitalization.
An employee fell approximately 16 feet through a roof opening and struck his head on a table.

An employee was injured when picking up some steel plates from a pallet. When one piece of steel started to slip, he tried to catch it with the other hand.  His middle finger became pinched between two pieces of steel. He required surgery.

On Saturday, 06/27/2015, an employee was on a roof deck cleaning up after installing a roof parapet when he picked up a piece of plywood and fell through the hole that was underneath, falling approximately 16 feet and breaking his pelvis.

An employee was working at DFW Terminal E, cleaning out the debris of an extension joint, when an electric hammer tipped over and fell on the employee's hand. The employee sustained a fractured left middle finger.
An employee suffered renal/kidney failure and severe dehydration while on the job driving a fuel truck, requiring hospitalization.
An employee had a possible electric shock when performing phase-to-ground work.

An employee was helping coworkers trying to undo tension on a 1.5 ton come-a-long. The injured employee struck the angle brace that the come-a-long was attached to. The hook of the come-a-long broke free, striking the employee in the lower jaw/face.
On 6/29/2015, at 12:30 p.m., an employee was backed into by a company pickup truck, which knocked him down. The tires ran over his legs (knees).
An employee was putting a trench box together.  The employee's finger got stuck between the wall and the horizontal spacing bar when the box was lifted.
An employee was on an extension ladder resting on the truck's flat bed. The ladder slipped under him; he fell, broke his nose, and was hospitalized.
An employee was working near a conveyor when the conveyor grabbed his shirt and pulled his arm into the machine, injuring his right hand.
An employee was troubleshooting a sensor on a pallet table for a laser machine.  The table moved and struck the employee breaking the employee's lower leg.
An employee was struck by a section of rebar panel  26' wide by 40' long when the straps used to lift it came loose. The employee suffered a broken leg.
An employee was trying to unjam a shear and caught the pinky finger in a nip point. The sheer was activated when the employee accidentally stepped on the pedal resulting in an amputation injury.
An employee was exiting a cone trailer and slipped off the steps hitting his head on the pavement. The employee was hospitalized with a concussion.
An employee was performing maintenance on a machine and removed a pin.  A part fell and struck the employee on the leg causing a fracture.
An employee was attaching a bracket to a metal stud with a battery-operated drill.  The drill slipped off the screw and the Phillips head driver bit went into the employee's left ring finger.

An employee slipped as he was climbing down a scaffold ladder. He tried to catch himself by grabbing onto the ladder. His left arm hit the ladder clamp, which cut open his left arm (2 inches below his wrist to about 1 inch above his elbow). The cut was approximately 6 inches.
An employee was hospitalized for treatment of a foot infection the developed as a result of a laceration by a piece of concrete.
An employee sustained a partial amputation of the right index finger while moving a concrete form.

Several employees were getting their tools ready for the day after performing JSA at a jobsite outside of Kennedy, Texas. One employee went to uncradle the lubricator from the wire line rig, and the employees put the line through the sheave, which is connected to the wellhead.  The operator watched the weight indicator and pulled 300 pounds of tension on the line, which released the wire line clamp. With the camp being removed manually, the injured employee noted that the wire was wrapped around the handle for the blow-out preventers.  The employee released the wire from the handle; the tension on the wire sling shot the sheave up. The sheave directly contacted the injured employee's right hand and amputated his right pinky through his cloth glove.
An employee was struck by the bucket of an excavator, sustaining broken ribs.
An employee's hand was cut/scratched by a piece of metal while cleaning up trash/debris. The employee was later hospitalized for treatment of a hand infection due to the injury.
An employee was descending a ladder to enter the lower level of a pump house when a steel hatch fell and smashed the employee's right thumb tip, requiring stitches.
An employee slipped on wet ground while checking a dewatering pump. He hurt his back and was hospitalized.
An employee was on a 6 foot ladder repairing an HVAC unit.  The employee started to climb down the ladder, lost his balance and fell breaking his left leg.
An employee was greasing a front end loader when grease from the grease gun punctured and entered the employee's hand.
An employee was unloading trusses and operating a trailer. While dismounting the delivery truck, he hurt his ankle.
An employee working on a swing stage scaffold was lowering the scaffold when his left fingers got pulled into the pulley, partially amputating his middle and index fingertips.
The employee was in a bucket truck pulling wire. The employee touched a live energized line and was hospitalized.
An employee received an electrical shock of an unknown voltage while trimming trees in close proximity to power lines.
An employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion/kidney failure.
An employee was using a ladder to gain access to a roof. As he stepped on to the roof, the ladder slipped out from under him. He fell about 8 feet and was hospitalized with a broken pelvis.

An employee had been framing the roof deck and was tied off using a personal fall arrest system.  A violent  thunderstorm occurred, and the employee began to exit the roof.  He unhooked his lanyard when he got within 2 feet of the extension ladder used to access and exit the roof. He slipped and fell 12 feet to the concrete floor below and sustained a head injury.

A truck driver was making a delivery at another company with a load of material on a flat bed truck. While waiting on a forklift, the truck driver began unloading the pallet by pulling on a strap. The strap broke or he lost his grip, which caused the employee to fall onto the ground landing on his right hip. The injured employee required surgery to repair the hip.
An employee was injured when an excavator operator backed into him. The employee sustained injuries to his left leg and ankle and dislocated his left shoulder. The injured employee was hospitalized.
An employee was using a Skilsaw to cut wood to form a sidewalk. The wood got caught in the saw and pulled the employee's hand into the saw. The employee's left thumb was cut off at the first knuckle.

A crane was removing a heater from a platform. The heater was lifted up to tighten the chains before resuming the lift, but the heater stack (7 ft. pipe) broke off of the heater. The broken piece struck an employee, who suffered a severe concussion and broken bones in the neck.
An employee was taking down a gutter on the edge of a residence's roof and fell approximately 14 feet to the ground, fracturing his right wrist.

An employee was establishing temporary power for office trailers by installing a ground lug on a ground bar on a motor control center (MCC). The employee used a wrench to tighten the lug and contacted an energized circuit or an energized buss bar of the 480-volt MCC. 

The employee was hospitalized.
On 7/7/15, an employee began cramping and felt dehydrated. He went back to an office location and the cramping worsened. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting foam board with a concrete saw when the saw kicked back. The blade impacted his arm, causing a laceration that required hospitalization.

An employee was cutting a piece of wood with a circular saw when the cuff of his shirt sleeve got caught in the saw blade, causing it to kick back on him and cut his right forearm. The employee had surgery to repair his arm.
An employee fell through a roof and injured his back. He was wearing a PFAS at the time.

An employee injured his right shin while positioning a concrete form structure to weld in place. As the employee was lowering the structure, it slipped and brushed against his right shin. His injury later became infected, requiring hospitalization for observation and treatment.
An employee was using a grinder when a piece of the grinding wheel broke off and struck him in the leg, causing a laceration and fracture. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee's left index fingertip was cut while using a chop saw.

An employee was cutting plywood with a skill saw. He was holding the plywood with his left hand. The saw kicked back, and the lower exposed blade amputated part of his left pinky fingertip and lacerated his ring finger.

An operator was carrying steel tubes using a forklift. The load slipped off the forks and landed on another employee's right foot. The employee was taken to the hospital where all of the toes on the right foot were amputated.

An employee was greasing a backhoe with a grease gun. The grease fitting did not fit, and the gun popped and hit his right-hand palm. The employee was later hospitalized for a minor surgical procedure to flush the wound.
An employee sustained a puncture wound to the left forearm on July 7, 2015. The employee was later hospitalized for treatment when the hand and forearm became swollen.

An employee was using a nail gun during a re-roof job at a condominium. Walking on the roof deck, the employee stepped on the rope and his ankle rolled. He fell on the roof deck and shot himself above the knee.
An employee was operating a table saw when he cut his left thumb and was hospitalized.

An employee was on an A-Frame ladder installing a 20-pound piece of aluminum to a light fixture.  The ladder buckled and the employee fell from the second rung of the ladder to the floor, hitting the back of his head on the ground. He was hospitalized.

An operator was unloading pipe from a truck using an excavator. A sling was attached to the pipe. When the operator picked up the pipe, it turned 180 degrees and struck the injured employee, fracturing his pelvis.

An employee working on power lines in an aerial lift in Hinesville, GA became ill. The employee came down, drank water, and went home. He awoke the next day still feeling ill and went to his personal doctor. He was later admitted to the hospital.

An employee was feeling dehydrated and experiencing cramping after coming down from pressure washing the interior of a water tank. The employee was hospitalized for symptoms related to heat exhaustion.
An employee sustained a broken wrist when struck by metal cable.
An employee offloading rebar from a flatbed truck lost his balance and fell off the truck, breaking both bones in his leg and requiring surgery.
An employee was using a step ladder to help erect a pole barn. He fell off when the step ladder tipped, fracturing a heel and some ribs.

An employee standing adjacent to an asphalt dump truck received an electric shock that rendered him unconscious when the bed of the dump truck contacted an overhead electric line. The ground on which the injured employee was standing was wet at the time of the incident. The injured employee suffered burns and blistering on his legs and damage to the big toe on his right foot.
An employee cut his upper left leg with a circular saw.
An employee was carrying a piece of hydraulic shoring on his shoulder and it slipped. He grabbed it and pinched his finger, amputating the tip.
An employee amputated the left thumb by using an unguarded table saw.

An employee was climbing a fixed ladder approximately 28 feet high and fell from an unknown distance to the floor below.  The employee suffered a head laceration, multiple skull fractures and a blood clot behind an eye. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was doing decking work at an apartment complex being constructed. The employee stepped onto an unsecured truss and fell approximately 14 feet. The employee suffered head injuries and was admitted to the hospital for treatment.

An employee climbed a fixed ladder to gain access to a roof. When he approached the top of the ladder, he opened a hinged lid and proceeded to climb up the ladder. The hinge failed and the lid struck the employee in the head causing him to fall approximately six feet to the ground below. The employee received a laceration to the face, contusions and bruising to the right shoulder, elbow and knee, and fractured his right ankle. The employee was transported to a local hospital where he was treated and released.
The employee sustained lower back injuries when the yard dog that he was driving turned over. The employee was hospitalized after the incident.

An employee was working with an impact hammer when the bit got stuck. The employee twisted the hammer to loosen it and got his right hand ring finger caught between the hammer and the scaffold rail. The employee freed his hand, but his glove got caught tearing skin from his fingertip.
An employee was placing an epoxy mixture in a hole.  Because of vibration, the employee was struck by the epoxy grout under his right arm and side.
An employee suffered heat exhaustion and was given IV fluids. The employee was kept in the hospital for observation.

An employee suffered a partial amputation while operating a power handsaw (cutting clips out of 2 X 4). He was cut when he attempted to unjam the saw that kicked back and cut his left thumb below his nail 45 degrees.

A crane operator was going to set up for a crane pick for another company. He began taking the outrigger pads off the rack and caught his finger on the pads causing a partial amputation to right index fingertip.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation while trimming paper on an unguarded guillotine paper cutter.
An employee was digging a ditch to lay conduit when he began to feel ill. He was taken to the emergency room and was diagnosed with heat illness.

An employee, working as a coner, which is the person who sits on the platform crate/grate behind the road line marking paint truck and picks up and places traffic cones, was picking up cones from the right side of the crate/grate when the truck hit a bump causing it to bounce up and down which caused the employee's right leg to get stuck between the ground and the vehicle breaking the tibia/fibula.

An employee was using a skill saw to cut wood pieces for use in building forms for poured concrete.  The saw kicked back causing a deep laceration on all four fingers on the employee's right hand. The employee was taken to the hospital for treatment.

An employee was working with a rotomill machine on the ground checking asphalt depth. The employee used his foot instead of the air wand to remove excess. He caught his foot in the rotomill track injuring the right big toe. A physician amputated bone to close the wound.

On July 14, 2015, at approximately 12:45pm, a tree trimmer suffered fractured ribs and injuries to his hip and pelvis after being run over by a Jaraff rubber tired industrial truck used for trimming trees and brush along a right of way.  A three person crew was returning to work after a lunch break. The Jaraff operator climbed into the cab of the equipment and began trimming branches. He raised the blade and drove over a pile of brush. When he exited the brush pile, the tree trimmer rose from the pile of brush and called out to the operator that he had been ran over.  The employee was hospitalized.
One employee was admitted to the hospital for possible heat stress.
An employee's toes on the right foot were amputated after being crushed by a 36 foot long pillar.

An employee was cutting a 2x4 on a table saw using a push stick. After the 2x4 was cut, the employee attempted to retrieve, by hand, a small piece of scrap wood that cleared the guard.  As the employee attempted to push the piece of wood through with his left thumb, the wood caught the blade and pulled his left ring finger into the blade amputating the tip.

An employee was holding a wall on a new house with five other employees. The bottom top plate broke adding weight to the wall. Everyone let go of the wall except the injured employee. The wall fell on him causing a fracture to his sacrum.

An employee was demolishing a basement floor with a sledgehammer when a section of flooring gave way and the employee fell 10 feet to the subfloor below.  The employee was hospitalized with head, neck, abdominal and back injuries.
An employee was sent to the hospital after experiencing heat stress symptoms.
An employee was cutting a board with a circular saw and amputated the tip of his left thumb.
An employee was trying to access a tool box located on company pick-up truck by climbing the back bumper. His foot slipped and he fell to the ground injuring his hip.

An employee was cutting pieces of plate using a band saw. The employee's glove got caught by the saw causing the amputation of a portion of his left thumb. The employee was taken to the hospital for treatment.
A nail from a pneumatic nail gun struck an employee's eye.  The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.  The incident occurred on 7/15/2015 at approximately 10:30 am.
While setting a steel plate onto the roadway, the chain came off the hoe and the steel plate fell onto the employee's right arm fracturing it.

Employees were removing the flat plate assembly equipment in preparation for vacuum testing in manholes. During the removal process, one of the employees rolled his ankle and fell into the manhole breaking his ankle.

An employee was working with formwork that has pins and telescope. The finger was in one of the scaffold pin holes and when the scaffold collapsed it took off the tip of his right middle finger. No bone was lost.

An employee was installing insulation from a step ladder at an approximate height of 5 feet.  The employee twisted to the side and the ladder became unstable. The employee fell to the ground and fractured the upper right arm.
An employee fell through the roof, breaking his leg.
An employee was operating a pole grab machine to load electrical poles onto a trailer.  The pole became dislodged, fell, and hit the employee in the face, resulting in hospitalization.

An employee was helping a welder install process pipe at the Koch Ag & Energy facility near Enid, Oklahoma. After offloading pipe that had been delivered to the site, he began to experience heat-related symptoms and cramping. He was hospitalized overnight for testing and hydration for heat-related illness.
The employee's left hand was crushed and severely lacerated when he was struck by a fan attenuator.

An employee was unloading water heaters from a forklift. The heater box bottom was faulty and came loose, causing a shift in weight that resulted in the employee falling two stories. The employee's feet and ankles broke.

An employee was installing a Bliss Press by securing four tie bolts using a hydraulic torqueing method. One of the bolts blew apart and struck the employee in the left leg. The employee sustained a fracture to his left tibia.
An employee was using a handheld portable power drill to hang a job site sign when the drill bit hit his finger.

An employee was holding an extension ladder while a coworker was on it. The ladder slipped and the employee's wrist jammed, resulting in a broken wrist. The employee was hospitalized overnight and received surgery.
An employee fell off of a truck trailer and broke his leg. He was hospitalized overnight.

On Saturday, July 18, 2015, around 9:00 a.m., an employee fell through the handrail system of an 8-feet-high platform to the ground while coming out of a grain bin during construction. He was hospitalized with a lacerated spleen.

Employees were placing a 50-foot wood pole into the ground to support electrical lines. The line truck could not fit between the alleyway where the pole was to be placed. The injured employee was tasked with securing a bonding wire to the pole. He straddled the pole to about 12 feet to begin securing the grounding wire. As he stapled the wire, he lost his balance and fell onto the hard pavement/dirt surface. He was hospitalized and required surgery to repair his lower back.
An employee was heating up sealer on a seal coating sprayer. The employee lifted up the lid of the sealer container and a flame shot out, burning the employee's left hand and forearm.
An employee fell and fractured his shoulder. He was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a hydro blaster while cleaning a heat exchanger. As he exited a scaffold that was 15 to 20 feet in height, he slipped and fell through the ladder cage onto the concrete surface, injuring his lower back. He was hospitalized for surgery on his lower back.
An employee was cutting a steel pipe with a power grinder. The grinder kicked out and seriously cut the employee's leg.

On or about July 20, 2015, an employee tried to park his small landscape trailer in the Trew Stone parking lot at 901 River Road, Deerfield, MA. As he tried to unhitch it, the trailer started to move backwards. While he was trying to stop the trailer from hitting a pickup truck parked there, he got between the pickup truck and the trailer and his left thigh got pinched. He was hospitalized and received stitches.
An employee was working on a closed I-64 exit ramp at IL Route 177. A vehicle being driven by a site employee struck a nearby roller, which then struck the employee, breaking both legs.

An employee in a truck had his left foot on the ground and his right foot on the clutch. The vehicle was not in neutral at the time. When he let off the clutch, he was run over by the truck, breaking his pelvis.
An employee was helping a coworker replace struts. They were lining up pins when the supportive strap broke. The truck cab fell and crushed the employee's left hand, resulting in hospitalization.

An employee was operating a mini excavator, removing a floor slab in the west annex of the green mile. The floor slab gave way, and the excavator fell one floor. The employee sustained a concussion and a severe laceration to the right forearm.
An employee who suffered heat exhaustion was given IV fluids and hospitalized overnight for observation.

On July 21, 2015, at approximately 8:30 p.m., an employee was sweeping up sawdust and carrying a paint can at the ECG Crankshaft mill in Sharon, Pennsylvania. Conductors were sticking out of the metal conduit beneath a saw table at the time. The employee reached down to pick up the paint can, which then contacted the live conduit.  The can exploded, burning the employee's right forearm. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee got his finger caught between a base plate and the ground while setting the footings of an outrigger.
An employee completed painting activities and started getting cramps. The employee rode the bike to the water station to take a break. The cramping worsened, and the employee was hospitalized.
An employee got up on a conveyor he was placing. The conveyor came over him, breaking both of his arms.
An employee's finger got caught between a chain and the utility pole.

An employee was dumping trash in the dumpster when he experienced a headache coupled with nausea and cramping. He was taken to the hospital where he received fluids and was kept overnight for observation.
Two employees were electric shocked and hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized on 7/27/2015 for a bacterial infection in his calf that developed after contacting contaminated water that was in a pipe he was cutting.
An employee walked approximately 30 feet off a second-floor balcony and landed on his feet on the ground below, injuring his knee.
An employee received an electrical shock.

On or about 7/22/2015, at approximately 5:15 p.m., an employee was using a shear saw to cut fiberglass blocks when the employee's finger contacted the saw blade.  The employee had four fingers on one hand amputated and three fingers on the other hand amputated. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee's finger was pinched between the housing and saw blade while setting up a band saw. The employee's fingertip was cut off, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was struck in the head by a piece of plastic piping.

On July 23 2015, around 11:00 a.m., an employee working on a powerlift was adjusting a blade stock from the carriage when the carriage came down and pinched his right leg. He was hospitalized to suture the wound.
An employee's right thumb was crushed.
An employee installing cable at a private residence fell from the top of an extension ladder to the ground, injuring his head, neck, and arm, and fracturing his shoulder.
An employee fell 5 feet from a ladder. His leg got caught in the ladder, and he landed on his back and hit his head on scaffolding. He was hospitalized.

On 07/24/2015, at 1:15 PM, an employee was struck by the front tire of a forklift truck while stabilizing a compressor that was being transported. The employee stumbled and fell, and the forklift ran up his right leg, crushing it nearly to the knee. The employee's left foot got crushed and he suffered broken bones in his right leg (tibia and fibula).

An employee was walking to retrieve tools and/or material when he tripped over the metal tract on the floor. The metal tract is secured to the floor for drywall installation and its lip protrudes up about 1 inch. His toe/boot got caught on the tract and he fell at ground level on his buttocks, possibly fracturing his left hip. He was hospitalized.
While using a copper fitting device, an employee cut his hand on a piece of copper on 7/24/15.

On 7/24/15, at 1:15 p.m., an employee sustained a laceration to his left arm near the elbow while moving a 4x10, 26-gauge sheet of sheet metal (36.4 pounds) from one table to another. He was hospitalized.
An employee worked with a foreign object inside his boot. After removing the boot at home, the employee found blood and was later sent to the hospital for an infection.
An employee was wearing gloves and had a ring on his left ring finger. As he descended the ladder of a JLG scissor lift, his finger got caught in the deck of the lift. His finger was amputated.

An employee was aligning highway cones in the construction zone when his legs became pinned between a public driver's car and the rear end of the company's pickup truck, resulting in the amputation of his right leg and the possible amputation of his left leg.
An employee had a hole in his safety shoes and water from working with the concrete soaked his foot resulting in chemical burns.  He was hospitalized and scheduled for skin grafts.
An employee working from a telescoping multiladder in a step ladder configuration fell from the ladder. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured right wrist.
An employee was working on a blast furnace, checking rigging that was used to install the large valve linkage. The employee bent down and started having lower back spasms, requiring hospitalization.
A faulty crate of stone weighing approximately 300 pounds tipped over and hit an employee in the leg, breaking his right shin. The employee required surgery.

An employee was removing a hole cover to align some forms to set up an AC unit. The forms were misaligned and had to be reset.  The employee fell through the hole, approximately 15 to 20 feet. He hit his head experienced swelling. A harness was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was running a phase line for an electric customer when the resident's dog chased him. He tried to climb over a 4-foot fence to escape and his left pant leg and foot got caught on a post. He fell over the fence, breaking the tibia and fibula in his left leg.
An employee was admitted to the hospital for heat-related issues after performing roofing activities.
An employee tripped in a ditch 4-feet deep by 3-feet wide and banged his face on a rock. He was hospitalized.
An employee coating gas pipe with solvent experienced a burn to the left arm.
An employee's finger was amputated while cutting a 4-inch, 90-degree elbow with a band saw. The blade caught the elbow and pulled the employee's hand into the blade.

On July 28, 2015, employees were attempting to pick up a concrete cure deck bridge. There were three employees (one in the fork lift and one on each side of the bridge holding tag-lines) performing the task. The employees attached rigging on both ends of the bridge to relocate it closer to where the pour will take place. During the pick, the rigging fell out of the hook causing one side of the bridge to fall and hit the employee fracturing the tibia/fibula.
Two employees were injured when the tower section rolled out of the hook on the backhoe and landed on them. Each employee broke a leg.
An employee become overheated while laying bricks during a construction project at a church.
An employee was hospitalized overnight for heat exhaustion/dehydration.
The employee was stacking pipe when he was struck by a pipe. His ear was amputated resulting in an overnight hospitalization.
An employee was cutting a metal panel with a saw when the blade broke, hitting and cutting his face.

On or about July 29, a temporary employee assigned to demo a commercial building was standing on a six foot ladder pulling speaker and telephone wire when he fell 4-6 feet to the concrete floor breaking his arm and cutting his shoulder.

On or about July 29, 2015 an employee operating a side boom crane was injured when his right ankle was caught between the wench of a backing bulldozer and the bumper of the boom.  The side boom crane operator was attempting to hook up the wench at the time of the accident.
An employee was arc welding brackets on an overhead conveyor with an electric welder when a spark fell on his shirt and caused it to catch on fire. He suffered burn injuries to his back.
An employee had his left ring finger amputated when a 35 pound form fell on his hand.  He was carrying the form. He tripped and dropped the form and it landed on his fingers.

On July 29, 2015,an employee standing on a tubular steel beam hanging sheeting, untied his safety harness and was in the process of crossing a vertical beam when he slipped and fell resulting in a compound fracture of his right leg.
A concrete saw operator complained about not feeling well and was admitted to the hospital for a possible stroke or heat stroke.

An employee experienced severe cramping in both legs, an arm, and a hand while walking back to work after a rain storm. The employee was hospitalized for treatment and observation for heat exhaustion.
An employee was wiring an exit sign when he received an electrical shock and suffered a severe burn to his finger.
An employee was supervising the loading of material onto a pallet when some of the material fell on his left leg.

An employee was going to install anchorage and tie off to a 6/12 pitched metal roof for a small repair job. The employee waited for the roof to dry for about an hour. However, the roof was still wet and he slipped and fell off the one-story roof onto the concrete patio of the residence. He landed on his legs, suffered a fractured knee cap, and required surgery.
An employee felt sick while sitting in his crane and showed signs of heat illness. He was hospitalized for severe dehydration.
Two employees were injured and hospitalized after the dead 69000 volt line they were installing came into contact with a lower 12000 volt live line.

An employee was using a groover machine when the employee's left index and middle fingers came into contact with the machine's point of operation. A portion of the left index and middle fingers had to be amputated.

An employee was changing out a pole-mounted transformer. A wire that the employee touched was still energized by the overhead powerlines. The employee was shocked by 7200K volts, suffering electrical burns to both hands and memory loss and requiring hospitalization.
An employee had been working outside at a jobsite in downtown Atlanta, Georgia. He was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.

While descending a ladder, an employee encountered a wasp nest. The employee was attempting to swat at the wasps when he fell 6 to 8 feet onto the concrete, causing the employee to break his left hip and fracture his right knee.

An employee was spraying water onto scrap steel that had spilled out of a furnace and had been cut into pieces using an oxygen lance. A steam explosion occurred, causing a second degree steam burn to his face and hands.  He was hospitalized.
An employee fell 13 feet, 6 inches, to the ground while inspecting a roof. The employee cracked several ribs and was hospitalized.

An employee was using a handheld circular saw to rip cut a short piece of wood stock. The injured employee was positioned close behind the circular saw, helping to hold the short 2 X 6 wood stock.  The blade became bound, causing the circular saw to kick back. The blade struck and amputated the injured employee's left-hand thumb, requiring surgery.
An employee was overcome by heat while welding building structure materials.
An employee working on the ground was disassembling the boom of a crane to add another section. A section of the boom landed on and fractured the employee's lower left leg.
An employee got caught between two steel forms, resulting in a broken leg and overnight hospitalization.

An employee was walking on a steel beam when his personal fall protection got hung up on a wire rope clip while anchored to a horizontal life line. He fell approximately 10 feet to the steel deck below and broke his leg.
An employee was working at a sub-station when he experienced cramps and fatigue from hot weather conditions. He was hospitalized for treatment.

On 8/4/15, at approximately 5:20 a.m., two employees were robbed while stopped at a Fuel Depot gas station to refuel their work vehicle. The first employee was shot three times in the stomach and the second employee was beaten up, suffering a fractured jaw, busted lip, and bruises all over his body. Both employees were hospitalized.

On or about August 4, 2015, an employee installing safety guard rails on the second floor of a building began to feel ill and experienced cramping. He was hospitalized overnight for heat-related illness.

An employee was walking on freshly lain concrete blocks when one of the blocks 
came loose. The employee fell, landing on his face and hitting a PVC pipe.

An employee was cutting metal rebar with a powered saw on the Staten Island Expressway (Exit 13) when the saw exploded, splashing gasoline onto the employee's legs. The gasoline caught fire, and the employee sustained third degree burns to the legs. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was using a pedal-activated form roller. The employee was preparing to feed a piece of metal into the form roller, holding the metal above the machine when he inadvertently actuated the foot pedal. His glove got caught in the rollers, and his hand was pulled into the rollers.

An employee fabricating highway signs was welding on a metal plate (approximately 530 pounds and 28"x33"x2") when the tack-welds gave way and the metal plate fell onto and crushed the employee's right leg.
On August 5, 2015, at approximately 4:00 p.m., an employee sustained a left index fingertip amputation when it was pinched between two crane pads that were being loaded by a crane.
On August 5, 2015, at approximately 12:00 p.m., an employee exited the cab of his crane and fell to the ground, fracturing his right hip. He was hospitalized.
An employee was descending a ladder after loading a high ceiling when he fell from the third rung to the floor, fracturing his vertebrae.
An employee fell off of an 8-foot ladder while installing metal canopy.  A beam fell, knocking the ladder out from under the employee who broke a rib and punctured a lung.
An employee working on electrical service started having cramps and was eventually hospitalized.
An employee was cutting a wood plank with a powered circular saw when the saw kicked back and amputated the right-hand middle fingertip.
Employees were taking down sections of a grain elevator when an employee fell breaking a wrist and foot.
Employee was in the process of repositioning a vertical lift basket when his right pinky finger was contacted by a cable pulley. The employee went to the hospital were he was treated and released.
