On or about August 6, 2015 at approximately 8:16 am, a worker was cutting a piece of brick or cement when his saw got stuck.  Employee tried to remove the saw by pulling, when he was struck by it on the face.  Employee sustained cuts on the left side of his face near the mouth and jaw.
An employee was admitted to the hospital and treated for carbon monoxide poisoning while working on a school renovation worksite.

An employee sustained a serious leg injury while he was attempting to dismount a CAT paving machine. The employee was in the process of dismounting the  equipment, slipped and suffered a puncture to the knee from a bolt protruding on the machine. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee lost his balance and fell while working on a 10 foot ladder, breaking his left elbow, right wrist, and lacerating his forehead.

An employee received burns to the hands and right foot while working near overhead power lines approximately 17 ft.  from side structures. The employee was carrying a 24 ft. aluminum bull float that contacted the overhead power lines.

Employees were dismantling a concrete form when a forklift operator hit the corner of the concrete form and the boom holding the form tipped over onto a worker. The worker suffered three fractured ribs that punctured the kidney and liver.
An employee was injured by a 40 foot tie rod that fell from a trackhoe excavator onto the employee's head and shoulders injuring two vertebrae in the neck and bruising the right shoulder.

On August 06, 2015, an employee was bitten on the left middle finger by an unknown source, assumed to be a spider. On August 08, 2015, the employee showed the employer his swollen finger and was sent to a doctor for treatment. On August 09, 2015, the employee's left arm had begun to swell. The employee went to the emergency room and was admitted to the hospital on August 09, 2015.

Employees were moving pieces of rail into position with a backhoe to repair a section of damaged railroad. The injured employee was standing too close to another piece of railing when the backhoe operator set down another piece. His leg was pinched between the two pieces breaking it.
An employee was using a Skilsaw to cut a post. The saw, which was guarded, kicked back and amputated the pinky, ring, and middle fingers of the employee's right hand.
Employee contacted energized electrical wire. The breaker was not shut off at the time. The employee sustained an electrical shock resulting in hospitalization.

The employee showed up to work at 6:00 am.  At 6:15 am, the employee began sweating profusely.  The employee was placed on light duty and worked until approximately 2:30 pm. The employee was admitted to the hospital for dehydration at 7:00 pm.
The employee was operating a front end loader moving dirt.  The employee hit a pile of dirt and came to an immediate stop causing the door to slam on his left index fingertip.
An employee grabbed a metal frame from the floor and cut his right thumb. The employee was hospitalized for surgery on the thumb's tendon.
A forklift operator experienced severe dehydration and was hospitalized.
An employee's hand was injured while using a porta power hand held hydraulic press to change bushings on a truck. The employee's hand was pinched between the porta power and the truck frame.

An employee was struck in the shoulder by a falling piece of rebar breaking the collarbone. The rebar was ~42 feet long and weighed ~108 pounds. The rebar was being manually placed in a storage rack when it slipped and struck the employee.

An employee was walking alongside a motorized aerial lift machine on unstable ground. The lift's tires sank into the ground causing it to tip over and strike the employee's left hand fracturing the wrist.

An employee was working from a ladder putting up the angle iron at the garage door of a new home when the angle iron fell and struck the hose used for the spray painting operation performed by a different contractor on site. The employee came down off the ladder and attempted to stop the leaking paint which resulted in a laceration and latex paint being injected into his hand.

An employee was putting the rear gate on the state body truck when he turned and fell approximately 3-4 feet off the bed of the truck breaking his left hip and sustaining lacerations to his side, arm and leg.

An employee was climbing the newly installed wooden power line pole to help another employee who was working out of the aerial lift bucket move the 4800 V power line from the old wooden power line pole to the new one.  In the process, the injured employee contacted the live 4800v power line on the top of his right shoulder.  

The poles are approximately 45 feet long but once installed they are 35 feet high because 10 feet are in the ground.
An employee was moving a piece of switch gear in the electrical building when it tipped and pinched his finger between the switch gear and the floor.

The employee was in a front end loader attempting to lift a railroad tie.  She lost her grip on the railroad tie and it fell striking her right hand, middle finger on the bucket blade. Her right middle fingertip was amputated.

An employee was getting into the side of a company van to sit on the floor to go to lunch. The employee touched a conduit that was stacked in the van, causing it to shift onto his hand and amputate his right index fingertip.
An employee reached into an open trench to straighten some conduit and was bitten on the left-hand finger by a venomous snake.

An employee was working the night shift on the PA Turnpike, moving traffic signs for the blacktopping crew. The employee climbed over the jersey barrier where a bridge was demolished so he could retrieve personal items. The employee fell approximately 15 feet off the bridge onto Meetinghouse Road, fracturing the foot and ankle.

On 8/13/2015, at approximately 10:00 a.m., an employee was installing electrical insulation on powerlines when a pin broke as he was coming down inside the bucket of a boom truck. He fell and hit the ground while still inside the bucket, breaking his ribs and injuring his right ankle.
An employee was run over and suffered a fractured pelvis, collapsed lung, and collapsed bladder.
An employee was operating a bulldozer to unload it off a trailer onto a dirt shoulder. The bulldozer rolled onto its side and struck the employee. The employee suffered a skull fracture.

Employees working on a roof took an extension ladder apart. The piece with the feet was being used on the roof to access another portion of the building while the other piece of the ladder was being used on the ground. The piece of the ladder being used on the ground was not tied off and fell when an employee used it. The employee broke his leg and was hospitalized.
An employee was acting as a spotter for a trenching site. The trenching machine grabbed a piece of form board, which hit and crushed the employee's ankle.

An employee was disconnecting an attachment from the boom of an excavator for a transmission crew. When the connecting pin was removed, the 100-pound auger motor he was working on fell and crushed the end of his left pinky finger. He suffered an amputation of the distal end/joint of that finger.

On Saturday, August 15, 2015, at approximately 2:00 p.m., an employee was operating a forklift at a roofing project jobsite. He was reversing the forklift when he made a sharp 90-degree turn with the boom extended, causing the forklift to overturn. He sustained injuries to his toes on the right foot and was hospitalized.
An employee was struck by an object that swung while it was rigged to a forklift, suffering a possible spinal fracture.

An employee fell 18 feet through an open hole on a 1/4 x 12 pitch roof while monitoring employees installing a standing seam metal roof. The employee sustained head lacerations and fractures to the skull and face.

On 08/16/2015, an employee was installing highway drainage pipes inside an excavation. A slab of asphalt that was next to the pipe trench broke loose and slid into the excavation, catching his fingers between the slab and the trench bottom. His left index finger at the knuckle and left thumb at the first joint were fully amputated at the hospital.

An employee was installing the wood truss of a roof when the truss moved, causing the employee to lose balance and fall approximately 10 feet to the floor. The employee broke both wrists and ribs on the left side. A fall protection system was not used at the time.
An employee demolishing a kiosk sustained a cut on the right forearm while removing a plank that had a veneer/laminated cover.
An employee was walking on the property. When the employer opened the metal gate, it came off its roller and struck the employee, breaking several vertebrae in his back.

An employee was injured while working from a scissor lift installing a metal corrugated steel panel on a wall. The employee was removing an angle iron on an overhead door that was connected to the overhead door spring. As the final bolt was removed, the spring's tension was released, causing the angle iron to repeatedly strike the employee's left hand. The employee sustained fractured bones and severed tendons in the left hand.
An employee was cleaning gutters at a client's home when he fell approximately 10 feet off a ladder to the ground. He was hospitalized with a broken right wrist.

An employee was painting a traffic light pole at an intersection when a semi truck struck the bucket truck he was working in. He was ejected from the bucket onto the pavement and was hospitalized with multiple skull fractures.

An employee was preparing to operate a motorized roof tear off machine. The machine got stuck in reverse. The employee held on to the machine as it continued reversing. Both the employee and the machine fell off of the roof. The employee sustained bruised ribs and shoulders.

An employee had finished repairing the scraper and was pulling in the outriggers on his work truck. As he pulled up the outriggers, the truck rolled backwards and pinned him between the scraper and truck, breaking his back.

An employee was helping to prepare an electrical transformer for shipment to a customer's location. The transformer was moved to a pallet. When a forklift approached the pallet to pick it up, the transformer began to lean and then fall toward the ground. The employee, in an attempt to stop the 1,200-pound transformer from falling, reached out his left arm, which was then crushed between the transformer and the work table. He fractured his left forearm (ulnar and radius) and all five digits on his left hand.
An employee was spreading decking when he fell approximately 16 feet to the ground below. He was hospitalized overnight with a possible broken arm and fractured jaw, requiring surgery.
An employee was assembling overhead jacks for an upper forming system when he fell approximately 20 feet off of the pier of the bridge. He broke his leg and ankle, requiring surgery.
An employee was installing insulation plates on a flat roof. While walking backwards, he tripped and fell 20 feet through a skylight, injuring his right wrist and left heel.
An employee slipped and lacerated nerves in the right-hand middle finger.

The employee was conducting a residential building inspection and was chased by a dog in the back yard of the residence. While running away from the dog on an uneven surface, the employee fractured the left foot requiring surgery to repair the injury.
An employee was standing beside a truck watching the septic tank get pumped out. The employee bent to pick up the hose and was bitten by a coral snake on the right index finger.
An employee was performing service work on paving equipment outdoors. The employee experienced stomach pain, possibly due to heat stress, and was hospitalized.

An employee was helping a forklift operator load two pallets of solar panels into a flatbed truck. The employee was holding a piece of dunnage and his finger got pinched when the forklift operator pushed the second pallet farther into the box truck. The employee's right ring fingertip and nail were amputated.
An employee was standing between an RCD pipe and a loader with forks on it when the pipe rolled and pinned the employee to the loader, crushing and fracturing his leg.
An employee pouring concrete was struck by a car that drove into the employee's work zone. The employee sustained a broken leg, as well as cuts and bruises to the hip.
An employee was climbing a ladder after a rain storm to set a 2 X 6 on the roof.  The employee slipped and fell about 15 feet to the ground, fracturing his vertebrae and injuring his head.
An employee lost control of a stand-up forklift and their foot got crushed between a racking system and a forklift.
An employee fell from the roof while looking for anchor points, breaking a leg.
An employee stepped from a ladder to the roof, slipped, and fell to the ground. The employee was hospitalized with fractured vertebrae.

An employee was standing on a 5' X 10' board, which was laying on jersey barriers so that the employee could screw other pieces of wood  to the board at a downward angle. The employee stepped off the edge and fell 4 feet, injuring the left knee and requiring hospitalization.

An excavator was dislodged from a flatbed trailer after hitting an overpass on Northbound I-15. An employee attempted to reload the excavator onto the trailer.  The excavator encountered fluid on the flatbed and slipped off the trailer. The employee was injured, sustaining a hairline fracture to the neck vertebrae.

An employee was installing MIBS (solar panel supports) outdoors when the employee started to feel lightheaded. Coworkers took the employee into the general contractor's trailer where the employee began to vomit due to heat stress.
An employee suffered burns to his face and head while repairing an air conditioner compressor with a torch at a customer's job site.
An employee's finger was bitten by a venomous snake while attempting to search for a welding pipe. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was working from a roof approximately three stories high when he fell about 15 feet. He was wearing his harness at the time. During the fall, his right arm was struck and lacerated by a radial arm saw that fell with him. He sustained deep cuts in his tendons and loss of feeling in his fingers.

An employee was in a ditch (approximately 7 feet deep) unhooking a pipe from a backhoe when the ditch caved in from behind. The employee hit his head against the pipe and lost an eye. He was hospitalized.
An employee was hooking up a backyard machine to a digger derrick when the employee's finger got caught between the hook and the backyard machine. The employee's pinky finger broke.
A worker suffered heat stroke while forming and grouting a pressure relief valve.
An employee pulled the start cord on a generator, and the generator fell on the employee. The employee suffered a strained knee.
A demolition saw kicked back on an employee who was cutting railroad tie. The saw hit his opposite shoulder and caused soft tissue damage (blood and nerve damage).
An employee received an electrical shock while repairing 7200 KV power lines resulting in hospitalization and the amputation of three fingers on his left hand.

An employee's leg got entangled in the tag line of the bucket used to haul debris. The bucket went up along with the employee and then the rope broke and the employee fell approximately 10 feet breaking a leg.

An employee was in a trench box inside of a 30 foot deep trench signaling a backhoe operator who was lowering a pipe into the trench. The employee's left arm was caught between the bucket (6 feet wide and 9 feet deep) and the trench box. The employee suffered contusions and swelling of the employee's left arm was evident. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell backwards off of an eight foot step ladder striking his head on the ground.
An employee was walking up the attic stairs in a house to install an AC unit. One of the steps gave way and he slipped and fell resulting in a concussion and 2 cracked ribs.
An employee fell off an 8 foot step ladder and fractured an elbow.

On August 24, 2015, an employee of Russell Standard was struck-by a tri-axle asphalt truck.  The employee suffered multiple injuries including lacerations to his liver and lungs, crushed ribcage, and vertebrae.
A worker was standing beside a milling machine. His right foot got too close to the milling head and the machine ran over it causing severe lacerations.
An employee was struck in the head by a slab of concrete debris that fell from the backhoe. The employee suffered fractured vertebrae in the neck and back.
An employee was erecting a fence when he tripped over some rebar on the ground and fell. He fell on top of his tool belt and punctured the stomach on his tools (pliers) in his tool belt.
An employee was walking out of a salt shed, slipped on gravel and fell striking his knee on rebar. The severe laceration required surgery to repair.

An employee was installing a chicken wire catch all to a sidewalk shed. The employee was standing on the sidewalk shed wall and fell approximately 16 feet onto an iron fence and the concrete ground below.  He sustained broken ribs, a broken jaw and lacerated the liver.
An employee was loading a paver onto a truck. A foot was run over by the paver and may be amputated.
An employee was struck by falling concrete cinder blocks while walking underneath a bridge and sustained a skull fracture.
An employee was hospitalized after getting his right arm caught between the arm of a skid steer and the frame, fracturing his wrist.

An employee was working on a power line from a bucket truck moving wire lines from an old pole to set a new pole when the old cross arm braces broke and live electric wires fell on his right shoulder/arm. As a result of the two phased electrical contact flash, the employee suffered a second degree burn on the right shoulder and right side of his body and was hospitalized.

An employee was replacing a missing shingle on the cedar shake roof of a 2-story residence. He  stepped on a loose shingle, slipped, and fell 20 feet to a cobblestoned area of ground below. He sustained three cracked vertebrae and a bruised lung.
On or about August 26, 2015, an employee was struck-by an aerial lift while guiding it from the ground. The employee sustained a laceration and avulsion injury to the left leg.

An employee was pushing a dolly and slipped. The employee's thumb was caught between the handle and a piece of equipment. The employee was sent to the hospital and some tissue was removed by the doctor.

An employee was hospitalized after being struck by a piece of debris (8 inch pipe) during a building demolition. The employee suffered nine broken ribs, a punctured lung, a broken finger and bruises on the face.
An employee was putting a bolt into a five foot steel I-beam and suffered the loss of the right thumb tip when it was caught between the end of the beam and the wrench.
On or about August 27, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation of the right index fingertip while helping to load a crane onto a flatbed for transport.

While jacking up a pallet of fixtures and using 2x4s for bracing, an employee had his right index finger and thumb amputated when the pallet came down and smashed the employee's right hand between the pallet and the 2x4s.
An employee was moving dirt with a skid-steer when it contacted a hard object. The employee's left leg got caught in the bucket resulting in a facture requiring inpatient hospitalization.
An employee lost his balance and fell in the parking lot, breaking his hip.
An employee was struck by a motor vehicle while working in a highway construction zone.  Surgery was performed to relieve pressure/fluid on the brain.
An employee was operating a roll-off truck trying to load a container onto the truck when it dropped on and crushed his foot.
An employee injured his scrotum when he fell approximately six feet off a ladder and landed on rebar.

An employee was gluing a piece under a bathroom sink when the sink fell. The employee stood up and attempted to step over the broken pieces, which cut through his sneakers and cut the bottom of his foot.
An employee was on a ladder cutting an overhead beam. The ceiling beam collapsed and struck the employee, causing him to fall off and sustain a rib injury.
An employee was sandblasting structural steel. He was using supply air from an air compressor when he felt lightheaded. He was hospitalized for carbon monoxide exposure.
An employee amputated a finger while rigging material. The rigging material slipped and the employee's finger got caught between the material and the steel beam.

An employee was climbing off of a carpenter's bracket scaffold into a second-story window. He missed the window sill, hung from the scaffold decking, and fell to the ground. He suffered internal bleeding and was hospitalized. A personal fall arrest system was not worn at the time.

On August 29, 2015, at approximately 5:00 p.m., an employee was unloading material using a built-in hydraulic lift gate attached to the rear of the delivery truck. The material fell on and broke the employee's pelvis.
An employee fell approximately 20 feet to the concrete ground below while installing angle iron at a steel erection site. The employee suffered cracked vertebrae and a cracked pelvis.
The injured employee contacted an energized electric line while directing roofing activities from a forklift-raised basket. He sustained electrical burns on his hand and was hospitalized.

Four employees were injured while attempting to set trusses on a barn. The trusses collapsed and the employees fell. Two of the employees were hospitalized. The first suffered a chipped shoulder bone and lacerations to his head. The second suffered compression fractures to three vertebrae.
While setting up the railings on a frac tank, an employee fell from the steps leading to the top of the tank to the ground, breaking his arm.
On August 31, 2015, an employee was cutting or clearing a tree for the company owner when he was struck by a falling limb, which gashed his head and injured his ribs. He was hospitalized.
An employee was walking on the roof and fell 8 feet to the ground. His head struck the ground and he sustained injuries requiring hospitalization.
While coming down a step ladder, an employee lost her footing on the bottom step and hit a door frame. Due to the impact, she injured the right side of her back.
An excavator backed over an employee's left foot, resulting in surgical amputation.
An employee fell approximately 13 feet after stepping out onto a 2x4 while pulling wire. He sustained fractures to his left ankle and right leg.
While on his way back to the work office in the passenger seat of a vehicle, an employee suffered dehydration.
An employee operating a dump truck was emptying a load of dirt. The dump truck tipped over, and the employee suffered broken ribs, blood clotting, and lung issues.
An employee was installing water lines for PA American Water when he experienced dehydration from the heat, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was performing pipe maintenance work while exposed to high temperatures. He suffered heat exhaustion and was hospitalized.
An employee was tearing off roof when his finger got pinched between a piece of plywood and a piece of machinery that was not in use. His left index finger was amputated.

An employee was climbing a ladder to reach the area where he was going to start anchoring the truss. He grabbed a nail gun that was hanging from the truss. It slipped from his hand and discharged a nail into his right leg, causing a puncture wound.
An employee fell off an 8-foot step ladder while installing ductwork and sustained a compound fracture to his right ankle.
An employee was framing using a nail gun. A nail from the nail gun punctured his left leg above the knee, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was stepping out of a material hoist when the hoist was struck by another piece of equipment. This caused the overhead protection on the hoist to collapse and strike the employee, who suffered a broken arm.
An employee was hanging string-line while constructing a wall. The employee's foot went between the forms and was lacerated by the wall ties, requiring surgery to repair the cut tendon.
While moving a pole with a bar, an employee experienced back pain.
An employee was performing preliminary work before siding work when a guardrail gave way, causing the employee to fall from a third-story platform to the ground. The employee broke both legs.

An employee was repairing a commercial roof when he stepped off a small drop and lost his balance. He grabbed onto the hot mop cart to keep from falling and he was splashed with hot asphalt, sustaining burns to his head and back and requiring hospitalization.
On September 2, 2015, an employee was setting up garage door headers using a hand trowel when he began to experience cramping. He was hospitalized overnight due to heat exhaustion and dehydration.

An employee exited his dump truck and approached a trackhoe operator. The trackhoe had a piece of concrete barrier in its grasp about 6 inches off the ground. The concrete barrier rolled onto the employee's right foot and leg, resulting in broken leg/foot.

An employee was installing cornices on the side of the house using an approximately 8-foot multipurpose portable ladder when he fell on his back with his gear. The impact of the fall caused the employee to go into a coma.

On September 2, 2015, an employee was removing clay tile and installing a membrane on the roof of a building on the Capitol grounds. The employee began to experience cramping and was eventually hospitalized for possible dehydration.
An employee was working from a 6-foot step ladder when the ground gave way. The employee fell off of the ladder and hit a concrete window well, breaking four ribs on his right side.

A maintenance employee was changing a belt on a fan in a paint booth when the other fans in the booth turned on. This caused the employee's fan to spin, and his finger got caught between the belt and pulley. His left ring finger got crushed and was later amputated. His right index finger was injured and required stitches.
An employee was cutting lumber with a Skill saw when he hit a knot in the wood, which caused him to lose control of the saw. As a result, the tip of his left thumb was amputated.
After operating a hydraulic excavator, an employee began to experience heart-attack-like symptoms. The employee was hospitalized overnight for dehydration possibly due to heat.
An employee was looking at excess equipment in an area with limited visibility. He fell approximately 4 feet from the floor area to the asphalt rail-bed area and broke his a rib.
While prepping a pipeline prior to painting, an employee was bitten on the left middle finger by a rattlesnake. He was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was helping to install a wiring system into a residential property. The employee leaned a ladder against the side of the property's gutter system. A 3"x6' gutter cover dislodged and struck the employee in the arm, resulting in a 3-inch laceration to the bone. The employee was hospitalized with muscle and tendon damage.
An employee was hospitalized with left ankle and knee injuries when he fell through the skylight on the roof while trimming trees from around the building.
An employee was nailing a form together to pour concrete in when he slipped and injured his back.

An employee was dismantling a canopy with a wrench while standing on the cross braces. The employee lost their footing and fell approximately 14 feet to the concrete pavement, sustaining a head injury and requiring hospitalization.
On September 3, 2015, an employee sustained a head injury. While he was looking at a piece of wood, he tripped and hit his head, requiring overnight hospitalization.

An employee was standing in a sewer ditch while guiding a 10-foot steel pipe into position when the device holding the pipe slipped due to the plastic cover. The pipe struck the employee on his right tibia, causing a fracture.

An employee was forming a footing for a water treatment plant. He was working inside a 4-feet-tall trench form and fell while crossing back over to the outside of the trench, breaking his right tibia and fibula.
An employee was using a cutoff saw to cut a 10-inch concrete pipe when the saw kicked back, cutting the employee's collarbone.
An employee was walking on a working surface when plywood fell over and struck his leg, breaking it.
An employee was driving a concrete buggy to move concrete when the buggy tipped, causing him to dismount the buggy. He landed on his feet on the concrete surface and fractured his hip.

An employee was installing a light fixture from a scissor lift when the railing broke. The employee fell about 10 feet, injuring their hip and breaking three foot bones. The employee required hip surgery.

Employees were setting a canopy in place using a lull.  The injured employee used a fiberglass extension ladder to climb to the top of the 9'-high canopy to remove a sling. He fell from the ladder and fractured both wrists and two ribs.
An employee was pouring concrete with a hose. Air got into the line and the hose struck him in the head and neck.

An employee was coming down from an attic after delivering blown insulation materials using a 12-foot extension ladder. The employee fell approximately 9'10" from the ladder to the concrete floor and fractured his back. The ladder did not have anti-slip feet.

An employee fell 10 feet from a mezzanine during welding operations, injuring their left shoulder tendon, cracking the L4 vertebra, and lacerating the left arm. A guardrail was not in place at the time of the incident.
An employee was helping coworkers move a steel beam when the beam fell on the employee's left foot. The employee's left-foot phalanges were crushed and required surgery.

On September 7, 2015, at about 04:00 PM, an employee fell from a 4- to 5-foot scaffold while cutting an aluminum structure beam with a chain saw. The saw kicked back, causing the employee to lose his balance and fall to the concrete floor. He sustained a head laceration and was hospitalized.
An employee standing on the back of a trailer during an offload lost their footing. The employee fell to the ground and rolled their right ankle. The employee was hospitalized with a broken ankle.
An employee fell through a skylight while walking/working on the roof, sustaining multiple arm and leg injuries.
After installing a new roof at the Kendall Square community complex, an employee on his way back to the shop started experiencing cramps in the legs and stomach due to dehydration.
An employee fell through a skylight approximately 15 feet to the ground, sustaining two fractured vertebrae in his lower back, lacerations, and bruises.
An employee was installing gutters from a ladder when he lost his balance and fell approximately 7 feet to the ground below. He broke his wrist and lower back.

On September 8, 2015, at 10 a.m., an employee was walking down the roof to get a piece of plywood to lay down. His fall protection yo-yo locked and caused him to lose his balance. He fell off the edge to the ground below in the building, injuring his head and requiring hospitalization.

During moving activities, three employees unsecured and then lost control of the end piece of a gantry crane. The piece rolled out from under them and struck the injured employee's foot, amputating his right big toe and requiring hospitalization.
An employee removing metal flashing from a parapet wall was shocked when the metal flashing contacted a 7200-volt overhead power line, burning the employee's left wrist and right arm/hand.

An employee was using a 4-inch grinder to cut a piece of rebar when it kicked back and he cut his left hand on the inner part of the left thumb and his wrist on the grinder. He received a cut approximately 1/4-inch long and was hospitalized for surgery. Gloves were worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was replacing a hydraulic lift cylinder on a forklift. As he unbolted the oil line, the second stage of the forklift began to drop, lacerating and crushing his finger between the frame and the second stage. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee preparing to move backhoe forks fractured his right femur when part of the forks fell on his leg. He also lacerated his right ring finger.
An employee fell into an 8-foot deep trench while trying to cross it, injuring his lower back and spine.
An employee was working from a sidewalk shed when he fell and broke his wrist.
An employee suffered from heat exhaustion while cutting 2x4's on a bridge.
An employee was carrying plywood and suffered from heat exhaustion.
An employee was removing the cutter head of an auger when his left arm got caught between the auger and the casing. His left arm was amputated.
An employee fell approximately 8 feet and hit his head on the ground while descending an extension ladder. He fractured the orbital bone in his head.
While adjusting the jack foot pad for an equipment trailer, an employee's left index fingertip was amputated as he was aligning cotter pin holes.

An employee was using a grinder to remove tack welds from a 12" by 4.5" steel plate. While grinding, the steel plate broke free and struck the employee's left eye. The employee sustained a left cheek and left eyebrow laceration, as well as a fractured left orbital eye socket.
An employee was placing sheeting over the stairway to a basement when he lost consciousness and fell 8 feet over the exposed edge to the lower level. He injured his head and was hospitalized.
An employee was working on the front corner of the house tearing off drip edge. He had a seizure and fell seven feet off the roof resulting in possible broken ribs. Fall protection was not worn.

An employee was standing on top of an excavation area flagging a trench box in when the ground gave way. The employee fell inside the trench, hitting the left side of his head and back, breaking four ribs, and bruising his head.

The employer is contracted for all the ground and foundation work for a new grain facility.  On the day of the incident the employer was having gravel delivered to construct a road.  One of the side-dumper trucks got stuck in the ditch across from the site.  In an effort to pull the truck free the employer used one of their Caterpillar D6 dozers and two 16 foot long 5/16 inch chains.  After the first unsuccessful attempt to pull the tractor trailer free the dozer operator attempted another pull. The chain snapped flying backwards towards the dozer where the hook end crashed through the rear window and struck the employee. The employee was taken to the hospital for facial reconstruction surgery.
An employee was walking on the roof behind a buggy and was putting down stone when he hit his head on the buggy handle and fell on the roof. He injured his vertebrae.
An employee was removing shoring when a piece of plywood fell on him, breaking his finger and collarbone and requiring hospitalization.
An employee suffered first and second degree on the face as result of an arc flash while relocating overhead power lines.
The employee was cutting a 1/4 inch piece of plastic liner with a hand held grinder. The grinder jumped, lacerating the employee's left middle and index fingers.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee suffered the amputation of the right index fingertip when his finger was caught between the bumper of a truck and a jack.
A steel beam tipped over and fell onto an employee's right ring and middle finger causing an amputation above the knuckle.
An employee was climbing a ladder to access the roof. The employee fell approximately 16 feet suffering a concussion.
An employee was climbing off a baker's scaffold when his foot slipped and he fell breaking his femur.

An employee was going up a ladder to do a pre job assessment of the air conditioning system.  When he was about 4 feet from the ground, the employee's foot slipped and he lost his balance.  He fell, hitting a movable conveyor on the way to the ground. He hurt his back, head and spine.

An employee was pulling electrical wire onboard a marine vessel. A large hole was cut into the main deck to place the engine into the vessel. The employee fell into the hole breaking ribs and the right wrist.

A worker was attempting to install a safety pin in the self climbing form work system. The platform came down on his hand before any safety pins were put in. The worker's hand was crushed resulting in finger amputations.

On September 14, 2015, an employee was working from a ground level scaffold. The employee stepped on a section of plywood that was covering a steam pipe. Upon contact, the pipe sprayed hot water (198 degrees) onto the employee's left foot. The employee was treated for second and third degree burns to his foot and released. The employee returned to work with restrictions. On September 22, 2015, at a follow-up appointment, the physician noted the foot was not healing.  At approximately 8:00am, the employee was admitted to the hospital to have a skin graft done to his left foot.

A carpenter employee received multiple fractures to his leg when he was struck by and pinned by a section of concrete form.  The employee was climbing down from the top of a stack of concrete forms when he stepped on an L bracket on one of the forms causing the form to move and strike the employee.

Employees were erecting a sidewalk shed  and lost control of an upright as it was lifted.  The upright fell onto the hand of an employee who was standing nearby.  One finger was amputated and another was crushed.
An employee working on the roof fell and was hospitalized for vertebrae fractures.
The employee was performing framing operations when a piece of steel angle struck the employee's head/neck.

On September 14, 2015, at approximately 10:30am, a worker suffered an amputation of the left pinky finger just above the palm while unloading pipe from a pipe trailer.  The employee was standing towards the tractor side of the trailer and a side boom with sling was unloading the pipe.  The load was lowered near the tractor in an effort to raise the pipe above the back stanchion on the trailer.  As the pipe slowly moved, the load struck a stanchion or DOT fender and the employee's hand was crushed in the load of pipe. No tag line was used.

An employee was walking between a barrier (parapet) wall and a rubber track excavator when the excavator struck his right lower leg and ankle, nearly severing his right foot. His right foot was surgically amputated, and his left foot was fractured.
An employee got his fingers pinched between cable and a drum on an excavator resulting in the amputation of the right pinky and index fingers to the first knuckle.

An employee was installing a fence. He had the leveler on top of the fence. He moved a board and the leveler fell hitting the nail gun and at the same time the employee had a finger on the trigger. The gun fired a nail into his thigh.
An employee suffered cramps and was taken to hospital for heat stress symptoms.
An employee was crushed-by a concrete structure when it was being placed along the southeast section of the lake's shores/bank. The employee's pelvis was broken.

Employees were descending a water tower in suspended scaffolding. About 30 to 40 feet above the ground, one of the motors locked up and the scaffold stopped. One of the employees detached his rope lanyard from his harness and attempted to slide down another rope lanyard. The employee fell off the rope hitting the ground and fracturing both legs and suffering severe rope burns on this hands.

An employee was hit from behind by a lifting attachment as he was in the process of rigging a rebar cage. The lifting attachment was not secured properly to the forklift. As it was being raised, the forks were tilted forward and the lifting attachment slid forward falling onto the backside of the employee who suffered ligament damage in the right knee and was hospitalized.
An employee operating a jointer amputated the right hand middle and ring fingers.
An employee was lowering scrap wood from a roofing job when a finger got caught in the rope and skinned the finger from the knuckle to the fingertip.
An employee was walking in the attic to install HVAC equipment and fell between the studs to the concrete floor below resulting in a skull fracture.
An employee was observing other employees install a forming machine and began to complain of leg cramps.
An employee was using a gas powered saw to cut a 30 inch pipe. The saw guard kicked back and struck him in the face causing a laceration.
An employee was cleaning an asphalt paving machine when the roller struck him in the leg.
An employee was standing on the bed of a flatbed truck untying the rigging used to secure a utility pole.  When he finished, the employee jumped off the bed of the truck and fractured his tibia.

An employee was walking across the job site gathering tools when a six inch metal flange fell from above onto the employee and striking his hard hat. The employee sustained a broken collarbone and broken vertebrae.

The employee was installing a shaker box on a plow when he inadvertently bumped the shaker box causing it to move on the jacks and pinch his right ring finger between the shaker box and the mounting arm of the plow. The employee sustained a fingertip amputation with loss of a finger nail.
An employee was lifting a grader with an air tugger and got her left hand index finger caught in the metal wiring resulting in amputation.
On September 16, 2015, an employee was troubleshooting a nail gun when the gun went off and the employee was struck by a nail in the left hand. The employee was hospitalized for hand surgery.
On 9/16/2015 at 8:45 am, an employee was walking between a dump truck and a pick-up truck and broke his left femur. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee using a table saw amputated the tip of the right index finger from the first and second knuckle.

Two employees were replacing a high voltage single power line between two poles. One employee, was electrocuted at approximately at 08:15 AM and received third degree electrical burns on the right arm and back side.
An employee was using a chop saw to cut pipe when the saw kicked back and severely lacerated the employee's neck.
An employee was hospitalized after scrapping his arm on a metal stud wall at a job site.  The cut/scrape became infected.
An employee was working a 100 ft. below the North gridiron floor when a piece of steel fell through the gridiron floor and struck the employee's ring finger on the right hand lacerating it.
The employee was cutting a piece of ductile 8" iron pipe with a hot saw or quickie saw. The weight caused the pipe to pinch the blade and the pipe kicked up and struck the employee in the face.
An employee was injured while guiding a street lamp post into position. The cast iron base of the post slipped and crushed his finger.

An employee was installing metal framing in a scissor lift approximately 25 feet above the ground. A piece of metal that was being installed started to fall out of the lift and the employee went to grab it and severely cut his forearm.

An employee was working on an enclosed balcony putting up flashing between the balcony and the porch. The employee went on the outside of the balcony. He was holding on to the railing when it became loose and he fell approximately nine feet to the ground below injuring the hip, shoulder, ribs and lung.
An employee was on top of the clean room ceiling changing air filters. He lost his balance and fell to the floor, fracturing his left arm.
An employee was laying decking, tripped over the decking, and fell 14 feet to the ground injuring his head and back. Fall protection was not worn correctly at the time of the incident.
An employee amputated his right second and third fingertips with a rope.
An employee was taking measurements for a project estimate and fell off a second story roof breaking ribs and vertebrae and puncturing a lung. The employee was not wearing fall protection.
On or about September 18, 2015, an employee fell while working on an eight foot step ladder. The employee was hospitalized with a broken arm and a head injury.
An employee was walking a jobsite, twisted an ankle and fell. The employee received 16 stiches on his chin.

On September 19, 2015, at approximately 3:45pm, an equipment operator was hospitalized after suffering fractured vertebrae in his neck and back, a broken left arm, and broken ribs.  The employee was operating a Morooca tracked dump truck on an access road hauling water when the track slipped off the road and the vehicle rolled over an embankment.

On Saturday, 9/19/15, at approximately 1:00 PM, a journeyman ironworker fell from the second deck of a structure to the first floor deck sustaining a broken wrist, several cracked ribs, and a head laceration. At the location where the incident occurred, two vertical stud members set on 16" centers had been removed to allow room for an access ladder. As the ironworker placed his weight upon the top plate (in the area where the studs had been removed) to secure the decking, the top plate bent causing the ironworker to fall onto the first floor deck.

An employee was installing six inch sprinkler pipes while on a scissor lift. A hanger came lose and the pipe swung down pinning the employee's left arm between the pipe and scissor lift and fracturing it.

An employee was standing next to an excavator.  The excavator turned and the employee was struck by the excavator's counterweight.  The employee fell over into a sump hole and struck his body against a steel plate.  The employee suffered a broken jaw, broken ribs, punctured lung, and broken left elbow.  The employee was hospitalized.

The employee was in the process of erecting a barrier wall on the side of the road (highway construction).  The employee got his right index finger caught between the panel of the wall and the bolt, pinching/crushing his finger and amputating the fingertip.
An employee utilizing the pace roll groover received a crushing injury to the right index finger that resulted in a partial amputation.

On September 21, 2015, an employee fell from a screed machine while attempting to refuel it. He had ascended the machine with the fuel hose when he felt dizzy, passed out, and fell to the ground below. He fractured his skull and cracked his lip, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell from a one-story scaffold/balcony when the railing broke as the employee leaned against it. The employee broke both wrists and injured their back. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell from a 3.5 ft. high scaffold and broke his right wrist and left elbow.

A flooring employee was cleaning an area on the fourth floor of a new construction project. The  employee lifted a piece of plywood that was covering a floor opening and then fell through the hole to the third floor. The employee fell approximately 16 feet, fracturing his lower back and tail bone areas.

An employee was standing on a pallet holding an accumulator (equipment) in place while waiting for another employee to pick it up with a forklift. The employee standing on the pallet stepped in between the gaps of the pallet and fell down causing the equipment to fall on his right leg and fracture the femur.
An employee was operating a manlift and struck their abdomen against the roof joist causing a contusion.
An employee was using a stand up pallet jack and injured his left ankle when it was caught between a wall and the pallet jack.
An employee fell ten feet off a ladder and onto a trailer hitch while attempting to secure the ladder with a rope. The employee suffered two broken bones in his wrist and three broken ribs.
An employee was rigging a piece of steel. The metal was already on the ground. The employee was removing the tag line when the metal shifted and struck the employee breaking his leg.
On 09/22/2015, two employees working on a propane gas line to a grain dryer were burned on the face, back, torso and arms when leaking propane gas ignited.

A truck driver was standing on the side of the truck while it was being unloaded by a forklift driver. A 12 inch piece of PVC pipe (8 ft. 7 in.) became stuck in the window lip of the truck. It broke free and sprung off the forklift striking the truck driver and causing head and neck injuries.
A Journeyman electrician was making an electrical connection on top of an above ground storage tank and fell twelve feet to the ground below injuring his back.
An employee walking in the laundry area passed out from heat stress and hit his head on the concrete floor.
The injured employee was assisting another employee by holding metal wire. The second employee caught the injured employee's left thumb in the clamp gun resulting in amputation of the left thumb.
An employee slipped from a 10-foot roof while installing flashing. The employee suffered lower back pain and a potential fracture due to the harness and lanyard restraint impact.
On September 23, 2015, an employee was shocked while connecting cable to a pole, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing laminate on the roof when he stepped into a hole and fell approximately 20 feet. He fractured his left arm, dislocated his pelvis, and required left arm surgery.

An employee was holding onto a braided chocker line (wire) that was wrapped around pipes being installed in a manhole by a backhoe. The backhoe came in contact with a live electrical line, and the employee received burns to his right hand and shoulder.
While an employee was exiting the excavator, he missed a step and fell about 35 to 40 inches, fracturing his left femur.
An employee was clearing loose concrete to install a pipe when another employee struck his hand with a sledge hammer resulting in the amputation of the right index fingertip.

An employee was using a scraping pole to scrape spray foam from studs while standing on the floor. He moved to work on a lift and when he finished the work from the lift, he came down and made contact with the pole scraper blade, lacerating his right arm.
An employee fell approximately 20 feet when a series of unbraced roof trusses he was working on collapsed. The employee's legs were pinned in the debris pile of the collapsed trusses.
An employee's powered buggy spun out of control after being accelerated, and the employee fell and injured his left hip. He required hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was unloading a Telehandler off a truck trailer. The equipment became unstable and tipped over striking the employee.  The employee suffered a skull fracture.
On or about September 25, 2015, while using a partner saw to cut a 4x4 piece of wood, an employee cut their left leg across the thigh and was hospitalized.

An employee was on a 10-foot A-Frame ladder grinding a 3-inch carbon steel pipe with a 4.5-inch grinder. The employee fell off the ladder, breaking the left arm in three places (surgery required) and suffering a mild concussion.
An employee fractured and amputated the his left thumb tip when it was caught between the blade of an excavator and a steel chain while attempting to secure the excavator to a trailer.

An employee was taping drywall while standing on a baker scaffold approximately 5 feet above ground level when he fell to the floor below. He fell on his head, suffering a fractured skull and several broken ribs. He was hospitalized.

On September 25, 2015, at approximately 11:00 to 11:30 a.m., an employee was working from a ladder and reached for a nail gun. The ladder slid down the wall approximately 15 feet to the ground. The employee broke his left arm and left leg.
An employee was changing a cracked clamp used to join two panels together during bracing when the MSE wall panel fell over on and hit him. He sustained hand, arm, and torso injuries.

An employee was helping to roll out roofing material. The employee fell approximately 16 feet through pallets and plywood that were covering a skylight to the concrete floor below. The employee was knocked unconscious.
An employee was helping to lower a pipe for a trench. The employee's finger got caught and lacerated between a pipe.
An employee was installing asphalt shingles when he accidently shot himself in the foot with his nail gun.

On September 28, 2015, an employee pulled his truck and trailer off the road and exited to the side of the road. He picked up a large cone and placed it in the trailer while standing on the driver's side. He saw headlights coming towards him and immediately tried to avoid being struck by the third-party vehicle. The vehicle struck the parked trailer at full speed. Something, likely the trailer, struck his head and knocked him to the ground unconscious. He sustained injuries to the back of his body and elbow, as well as a head laceration and concussion.
An employee was helping to unload cable reels when his finger got pinched between a forklift fork and a trailer. His right ring finger was amputated at the first knuckle.

On September 28, 2015, at approximately 9:10 a.m., a crane was being used to move a rebar mat into position when one of the lifting straps failed, causing the mat to fall.  An employee was beneath the mat as it fell; he became pinned, sustaining broken legs, a punctured lung, and facial lacerations.
An employee received an electrical shock when their drill bit contacted an energized wire while drilling a hole into a wall.

An employee was working on a pitched roof, clearing off materials, when he fell approximately 20 feet to the ground below. He was wearing fall protection at the time, but the shock pack did not deploy, and all of the fall protection fell with him. He fractured his lower back.
An employee was helping to lower pipe into a shored trench when the employee's finger got caught between the pipe and one of the trench's shoring jacks.
An employee was welding angle edge onto steel beams. The employee placed a scaffold plank across two beams to provide a surface on which to sit while welding. He slipped and fell fracturing a hip.

An employee was filling wall forms with concrete from a pump truck. He fell off of the 4-foot concrete form he was working on and his leg struck the concrete footer at the bottom of the concrete wall, fracturing his femur.

On or around 9/29/15, while taking measurements for installation of a lightening protection system, a worker on the second floor of Building 148 fell approximately 10 feet through a ladder access hole and fractured their skull.  At the time of the incident, a guardrail was in place on 3 sides of the access hole.

An employee was lowering a load of glass panels onto a manual pallet jack and amputated the tip of his right index finger when his finger was pinched between the load and the handle of the pallet jack.
An additional 480V service for a step-up transformer was being installed. When the circuit was tested, an arc flash occurred, resulting in lacerations to the employee's hand.

An employee wearing a harness and lanyard was accessing the third-story roof. He stepped from the ladder to go to his tie-off anchor point, but slipped in the process. He fell approximately 30 feet to the second story and then to the ground and was hospitalized with a compressed disc.
An employee was on a ladder removing electrical wire from a warehouse. He touched a live wire, was shocked and fell off the ladder. He suffered internal burns and a fractured skull.

While breaking down a hydraulic crane, an employee was in the process of removing the outrigger pad while the outrigger was retracting and got his left hand caught in a pinch point fracturing the middle and ring finger in two places.
An employee was climbing into his dump truck and fell. The employee was hospitalized with a broken pelvis.
An employee's backup hammer slipped over the end stud nut, smashing the employee's left index finger between the stud and wrench. The employee's fingertip was amputated.
An employee amputated his left middle finger at the first knuckle after it was pinched between a C clamp and an access panel while working on an elevator belt.
An employee was loading insulation into an insulation blower machine. The employee's left arm was injured when it got caught in the equipment's metal bars.
An employee was performing maintenance on a press when the press door closed on his finger, amputating the fingertip between the nailbed and first knuckle.

An employee was replacing an underground drain line with a coworker. The employee was bent over when a light pole that was sitting on the ground with the arm section leaned against the wall fell over and hit the employee on the back, breaking two lower back bones.

An employee was performing maintenance, removing manifold gauges from a residential air conditioning unit. The employee unscrewed the gauges and the liquid refrigerant sprayed onto the employee's hands. The employee suffered chemical burns to the left palm, four left fingers, and the right index finger, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was hit in the head by pipe while pulling it up. The employee's skull was fractured.
While an employee was pressure testing a pipe, the test ball shot out of the pipe and severely lacerated the employee's left thumb. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a boom lift during painting operations when it tipped over and fell to the ground while the employee was still inside. He was hospitalized with fractured ribs.

The employees use the Caterpillar tractor bucket to transfer tools and equipment from the storage conex to the work site.  The operator lowered the bucket from the caterpillar onto the left foot of the injured employee injuring the big toe.

An employee was standing above a concrete pump when he fell inside the hopper.  His left leg got caught inside the pump auger, and the lower part of the leg was fractured and lacerated. The pump was running at the time of the incident.
An employee carrying a bucket of paint up a portable ladder fell approximately 10 to 12 feet when the ladder became displaced. He was hospitalized with head/neck lacerations and possible fractures.

An employee lost approximately 1/3 of the finger while performing routine daily maintenance on a piece of equipment known as a topsoil screen. Two employees were cleaning debris from the radiator. In order to gain access to the radiator, the motor was moved. While placing the motor back into its proper alignment by placing a pin into a mount, the mount moved catching the employees finger and causing injury.

Two employees were cleaning on the ground floor outside when an explosion occurred in the boiler room. Both employees were struck by falling debris. One of the employees fractured his right wrist. The other employee suffered a contusion to his right shoulder and right knee.

An employee was in the SkyTrak personnel basket cutting tree limbs. The operator was repositioning the machine when it hit a mound of dirt and caused the SkyTrak to tip over. The employee jumped out of the basket and suffered a concussion and a broken right ankle.
While using a high-pressure power washer, an employee's right foot was impaled by the power washer.
An employee was operating a robot-roller compacter when a coworker ran over the employee's leg with a Bobcat. The employee was hospitalized with a broken right leg, pelvis, and hip.
An employee was performing electrical work on an automatic transfer switch when an arc flash occurred. He was burned on his left ear and face.
An employee working on a scaffold took a phone call, stepped back, and fell 7 to 8 feet to the cement floor. He fractured his skull, neck, and ribs.
While walking, an employee slipped on a mat, falling on and fracturing his right hip.

Two employees were moving an electrical panel board, sliding it across the floor. The first employee was holding the panel from the front and the second employee was holding the panel from the back. The floor was slick, and the panel slipped out from under them. The panel struck the first employee on the top of his left foot, right behind the steel toe of his boot. The big toe and second toe on his left foot were amputated.
An employee operating a gator vehicle drove it into a block out. The approximate 8-inch sudden drop resulted in nose, knee, and wrist injuries, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was flagging traffic to stop. When the first car stopped, a second car came around the first car, hit the employee, and kept going. Both of the employee's legs broke.

Two employees were preparing to perform glazing work on the 16th and lower levels of a new construction project. The adjustable suspended scaffold failed for unknown reasons. Employee 2 was able to jump out of the basket, grab one of the supporting ropes and climb to the roof. Employee 1 fell approximately 100 ft. to the ground with the scaffold. Employee 1 sustained severe head and body trauma along with a fractured right leg.
An employee was nailing siding to the wall when he fell 12 feet between the pump jack scaffold and the wall. He broke his femur and was hospitalized.
An employee was moving a dolly of studs when he stepped between an exterior wall and the concrete floor. His leg dropped down to his knee and was bruised.
While removing gutters, and employee fell 4 to 5 feet from a ladder and hit his head on the concrete.
An employee climbing a fixed industrial roof ladder lost his balance on the upper landing and fell to the level below, injuring his ankle.
An employee fell from a makeshift scaffolding breaking the left ankle.

An employee was using an hydraulic pipe bender and was setting the pipe in place to bend when a coworker started the machine. The employee's finger got caught between the metal conduit and the yoke of the machine. His right-hand middle finger was amputated above the first knuckle.
An employee was pressure washing the roof of a three story building and fell off the roof breaking an arm and pelvis.

Five employees were leaving the jobsite on an ATV designed for four passengers.  The ATV was traveling down a steep hill on a gravel road when it fishtailed and began to roll due to the steepness of the grade. Two employees who were not wearing seatbelts were ejected. One employee suffered two broken ribs and was hospitalized. The other employees were treated and released.

On 10/07/2015 at approximately 3:30 PM, an employee was helping a Bobcat operator load a two piece steel barrier wall form onto the bed area of the knuckle boom truck. As the forms were being lowered into place, the tip of his right middle finger was smashed between the two forms pieces.
An employee was stepping over a barricade, tripped on his lanyard and fell approximately 2-3 feet to the floor. He suffered a broken right tibia that required surgery to repair.
An employee was hospitalized with a fractured right wrist and skull fracture after falling off a 10-foot ladder.

An employee was mixing grout in a cement mixer. The machine was turned off. The employee reached into the mixer tub with his left hand to clean the grout off the mixer paddles and his right shoulder accidently struck the mixer's start lever. His left arm was caught in the machine and broken.

An employee was operating a portable grinder with a cup tool attachment to bevel the edge of a piece of pipe. The cup tool disintegrated and debris from the cup tool struck the left side of the employee's face. The employee was transported to hospital.

An employee was setting up the site to begin work on a scaffold. When the employee got on the scaffold, the scaffold began to roll. It hit a hole in the floor and fell over. The employee also fell and the scaffold landed on top of him breaking the left leg.
An employee was in a bucket truck installing a lightning arrestor and was shocked.
An employee was cutting a piece of OSB with a circular saw and amputated his index finger.
An employee received burns to his hands from electrical shock while stripping off a neutral wire on a 277 volt system.  The employee was hospitalized as a result of his injuries.
An employee was repairing a boiler unit and received electrical burns to the face and arms from an arc flash.
An employee was throwing trash into a dumpster when a guardrail gave way and he fell onto the trailer injuring his back.
An employee sliced the top of the pointer finger while using a power saw to cut wood. The employee was treated in the emergency room, but was not admitted.

Employee 1 was helping Employee 2 weld a flange to a pipe. Employee 1 was holding a 20" diameter, 2" thick flange in place for Employee 2. The flange was held up by a pipe jack.  The flange slipped and Employee 1's fingers were caught between the flange and the pipe jack.  His right middle finger was amputated between the first and second joint and his ring finger was amputated at the first joint.
An employee was erecting a scaffold and fell 10 feet lacerating their spleen.

An employee had been working for the company for a couple of weeks on a commercial construction site as an apprentice carpenter. The employee was experiencing elbow soreness and went to the local hospital. The employee was admitted to the hospital due to a staph infection in the left elbow.
On October 9, 2015, an employee amputated his left index finger to the first knuckle when he was working with an auto-threader machine in the shop.
An employee was working on a tin roof. The employee stepped off the roof onto an overhang. The overhand collapsed and the employee fell breaking the right hip, arm, tail bone and ribs.
An employee was struck by a light pole during an excavation operation resulting in a back injury.

An employee slipped on the plastic backing/laminate of a peel and stick underlayment near the roof edge and fell 23 feet off the roof resulting in broken ribs. The employees were evacuating the roof due to a storm.

An employee was cutting a piece of wood with a battery operated circular saw. The blade got stuck in the wood and kicked back lacerating three fingers on the employee's left hand. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell through a hole in the 3rd floor to the 2nd floor and landed onto a set of chicken cages.  The employee broke two ribs and sustained a fracture in the upper neck.
An employee was rigging a load to be elevated by a crane. He tripped and fell when his feet were pulled out from under him by the tag line. He suffered a fractured left hip.

An Ironworker was tying rebar 8 feet above ground. He hooked the rebar onto a wall with a hook and then leaned back and the wall hook slid off the rebar and the ironworker fell backwards approximately 8 feet to the crushed gravel ground injuring the right leg.

An employee of the McKinney Drilling Company, LLC, got his right foot caught under the bucket of the Bobcat loading machine. The employee was hospitalized with laceration to the soft tissues and damage to his ligaments.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut a piece of plywood and amputated the right index fingertip.
An employee was removing a sticky matt in front of an elevator when he was stung by a wasp inside the building.

An employee was operating a gas power chop saw cutting concrete. When the gas cap came off, the chop saw caught on fire. Gas splashed onto the employee and the employee suffered second and third degree burns to his legs, back, stomach, and arms.
An employee working on the taxi way lights in the air field at O'Hare Airport was hospitalized overnight when incurring electric shock through his hands while working on cables.
The crew was erecting a scaffold. On his way up the scaffolding, an employee slipped and fell landing on the concrete floor below and inuring a leg.
An employee sustained a laceration to the hand while cleaning the drywall finisher sprayer.

An employee was on the bow of a tug boat on the Mississippi River cleaning the cutter head. A large boat passed by causing a wave. The employee put his hand on the bit to catch his balance. The boat rocked up and his right pinky finger was smashed between the bit and the cutter head resulting in amputation.
A conex was being loaded onto a rollback truck. At that time, the rollback bed struck the employee and fractured his femur requiring surgery.
An employee pinched his right ring finger between a chunk of refractory and a conveyor resulting in the amputation of the right ring fingertip.
An employee was cutting wood and lacerated his thumb.
An employee was kneeling down and felt pain in his knee. His knee was infected, possibly due to a previous kneeling incident where a foreign body was injected into his left knee.
An employee was on a ladder to paint the side of a townhouse. The ladder slipped out and the employee fell to the pavement below fracturing both wrists.
An employee suffered leg injuries when a backhoe ran over his leg.
While descending the scaffold ladder, an employee lost his footing and fell 12 to 15 feet to the ground breaking his left leg, right heel and left wrist.
A roofing employee slipped and fell from a 12 foot ladder resulting in internal injuries and possible fractures.

A trackhoe operator was cleaning out the bed of a Kenworth Tri-axle dump truck.  The dump bed was raised and the trackhoe was scraping material out of the bed.  The injured employee approached the dump truck while this was occurring and proceeded to stick his head in between the dump bed and the swing gate to see inside. The excavator made contact with the bed and caused the swing gate to move, catching the injured employee's head between the truck bed and the swing gate.  He was admitted to the hospital with a fractured skull.
An employee was descending a staircase. When he reached the landing, he blacked out and fell 10 feet to the concrete floor below, breaking his hip and fracturing his pelvis.
An employee was covering a manhole with a manhole cover. The manhole cover flipped up on top of the employee's right foot, breaking four bones.
An employee was performing maintenance on a mobile belt system when his fingers were pulled into the conveyor belt, cutting and tearing the tendon on his middle right middle finger.
An employee was welding a beam during steel erection activities for a commercial building. The employee's knee got caught between the boom net and a beam.
An employee was performing a walk around visual inspection of the crusher recycler when he tripped on a piece of rebar and fell hard on his left hip and forearm. His hip broke and required surgery.
An employee fell 6' from a concrete pumping boom to the ground fracturing his left wrist and suffering a head laceration and bruising.
An employee fell approximately 6 feet to the ground while climbing a stepladder, breaking his clavicle and sustaining bruises and lacerations.

On October 16, 2015, around 11:00 AM, an employee was trying to untie a knot in a mule line when he was electric shocked and suffered electrical burns to the left ring and pinky fingers and the left knee. He was hospitalized.

On Friday, October 16, an employee was preparing to lower the drill bar from the rest of the drilling machine. The bar separated from the tool that was holding it and fell on the employee. He sustained four fractured ribs and a blow to the right side of his face and left shoulder.
A temporary employee was working on a scaffold approximately three feet above the ground when he fell off the side and broke his the radius and ulna on the right arm and the radius on the left arm.

On or about October 17, 2015, an employee walking the plant was struck on the hard hat by a hose that was dropped by another subcontractor. The injured employee was admitted to the hospital for back pain.

On October 19, 2015, at about 11:00 a.m., an employee was on a step ladder installing drywall with a drill driver. He fell off the ladder to the concrete floor and broke his right arm. He was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee was cleaning ride-on trowel equipment. As he was taking the clip-on pan out of the ride-on trowel, the round pan (48 inches in diameter; 25 pounds) fell on his right leg and broke his right ankle. He was hospitalized.

An employee was climbing a 22-foot wall using a 30-foot ladder. The ladder hooks were not latched at the time, causing the ladder to slide. The employee fell approximately 16 feet and landed on a sand pile.  The employee's lower right leg broke, requiring surgery.
An employee working from a swing stage scaffold was struck in the head by the counterweights of a winch that was being used to hoist mud/stucco inside 5 gallon buckets.
An employee was pulling a portion of a tunnel section out of a shaft when he fell from an elevation onto a piece of broken slab and broke his jaw.
An employee was rigging pilings for hoisting and pinched a finger between the sling and piling. The tip of the index finger was amputated and reattached.
An employee's hand got caught between the conveyor belt and roller on a sanding machine.
An employee was prepping for concrete pouring work when his finger got caught in a concrete drill.  He was hospitalized for a potential finger amputation.

An employee was struck in the face by a nail from a second employee's nail gun and admitted to the emergency room. The second employee shot himself in the stomach with the nail gun and was hospitalized.
An employee was walking on the sidewalk inside the construction perimeter. He tripped over a discharge hose and fell onto his side, breaking two ribs and puncturing a lung.

Employees were using a Hydrovac to find an underground line.  The Hydrovac has a nozzle to shoot high pressure water and suck up water and mud.  One employee works the vacuum hose and another works the water nozzle. The employee working the vacuum hose saw a rock that he didn't think would go up the vacuum hose. When he reached down to pick it up, he stepped in front of the water nozzle.  The pressurized water punctured his knee on the inside of his right leg.

Three employees were performing leak testing on a 54-inch sanitary pipe when the testing device (80 lbs. air pressure) exploded and struck an employee, causing life-threatening head injuries and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using a power tool to install a support bracket. The screw went through the bracket and cut his finger. The cut became infected and the employee was hospitalized.

On 10/21/2015, a roofing employee was performing a roofing tear off of dead wood. During the replacement of dead wood the worker ran out of replacement wood. The worker covered an opening in the roof with felt paper. The employee lost his balance and jumped from the roof of a single story mobile home instead of falling through the felt covering. Both heels were injured.

On 10/21/15 at approximately 3:30 PM, an employee was cutting banding material off a stack of steel beams. The steel beams were 3 feet high and 20 feet long and came in stacks of two. They had wood blocking that held the two beams and steel banding material together. The employee was on the ground between two stacks of beams and was using a circular grinder to grind off the banding material. When he cut the last beam, the beams fell on him resulting in his hospitalization for a broken pelvis, right femur, and right tibia.

An employee was nailing shingles at the edge of the roof of a new one story house when he lost his footing, fell 8 feet to the ground, and landed on a pile of wood. The employee was not wearing fall protective equipment. He was hospitalized with six broken ribs.

An employee was injured when the ladder he was using slipped, came loose from a rope connection, and fell. The employee fell approximately 9 feet to the next level. He was hospitalized with three broken ribs and a dislocated shoulder.
An employee preparing to perform concrete work on a building climbed up an extension ladder, lost his footing, and fell from the fourth rung fracturing his left knee cap.
An employee stepped off a platform approximately 12 inches off the ground and broke his right ankle.

On October 22, 2015, at about 12:30PM, an employee lacerated the fourth finger on the right hand while removing a piece of concrete that had just been cut. The cut piece measured approximately 60 inches x 18.5 inches by 12 inches thick. When removing the piece, the employee's finger was pinched between the cut piece and the wall.
On 10/22/2015 at approximately 12:30 pm, a carpenter was using a Skil saw to cut some lumber and lacerated his left thumb. He was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut wood stakes. The saw kicked back and amputated a left hand fingertip.
A stack of sheetrock fell onto a worker's leg breaking it.
An employee was clearing a spray gun when the 1100 psi pressure injected a component of urethane foam into his finger causing a buildup of material under the skin in the palm of his left hand.

On October 23, 2015, at approximately 1:00pm, a an employee was hospitalized after suffering a compression fracture to his back and laceration to his head.  The employee was driving an extendible boom manlift across a designated railroad crossing.  The machine malfunctioned and stopped with the bucket portion of the lift above the railroad tracks.  As a train arrived, the employee untied his harness and jumped from the bucket approximately 10' out and 6' down landing on a gravel surface.

An employee was inspecting a crawler crane on site, lost his balance and grabbed the moving cable to steady himself causing his left hand to come in contact with the pulley shiv and amputating two fingers.

An employee was untangling the cable from the block of the crawler crane.  Afterwards, the crane operator raised the block of the crane while the employee's hand was still on the cable.  The employee's left ring and middle fingers were amputated.
A millwright tripped over the edge of 1/16" sheet metal and fell breaking a hip.  The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery.

An employee was installing a metal flange on a 20-inch pipe and pinched a finger between the pipe and the metal flange while retrieving a nut that dropped between the pipe and flange. The right index fingertip was amputated.

An employee fell five feet from either a ladder or the HVAC unit to the concrete floor below while performing plenum work. The employee suffered a fractured  collarbone, two fractures to the lower spine, and head lacerations.
An employee was part of the utility crew removing a utility pole. He was struck by the pole and sustained injuries to his back, left shoulder and spleen.

A lineman was in the process of repairing and reattaching a downed power line to a wooden utility pole. As the lineman was climbing the pole, the pole fell striking the lineman and breaking a leg in multiple places.
An employee was shocked when the trackhoe he was loading onto a trailer made contact with power lines.
An employee was struck by a cable that broke from a choke while moving a utility pole resulting in the amputation of the right pinky finger.
An employee fell nine feet from a wall of reinforcing steel rods as he was descending it breaking the right ankle. The employee was hospitalized for surgery to repair the fracture.
An employee's leg got caught in excess rope while lowering equipment resulting in a leg injury. The employee was hospitalized.
