An employee fell eight feet from or through a floor that was being structurally removed resulting in back and rib injuries.
An employee fell approximately 40 feet while working from a suspended scaffold installing tubes inside the Comanche Power Plant Unit #3, suffering broken ribs and a broken left leg.
An employee was installing railroad track when a rail rolled off the jack and pinched a finger resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee 

amputated the right index finger to the first knuckle when his right hand was caught in steel double doors in an attempt to keep them from closing.

A housekeeping employee was cleaning up a Formalin spill. The Formalin was covered with a spill-X absorbent to soak up the chemical.  As the employee was scooping up the absorbent her head started hurting, she felt dizzy, and she passed out.
An employee fell approximately 20 feet from a communications tower while replacing a metal cross-member of the tower and suffered a concussion.

An employee was preparing electrical conduit and fittings for installation. The employee went to the lower level of the pumping station with the conduit and while handing the conduit to a coworker who was working from a ladder inside the lower pit, he fell into the floor opening, struck a light on the wall and pipes on the floor. The employee sustained seven broken ribs and injured the left knee.
An employee was changing a breaker in live panel. The panel shorted out and an arc flash burned the employee's hands.
While attempting to cut through a 2x8 piece of lumber with a Skil saw, an employee cut his left thigh.
While digging a hole for a fence post installation, the employee struck a live 277V electrical line and was shocked.
An employee lost his footing while climbing down a ladder and fell approximately eight feet to the concrete ground fracturing the left leg.

Three employees were on top of the asphalt grinder trying to troubleshoot why it wouldn't run.  A fourth employee, a lowboy driver, walked over to the grinder unseen by the employees on top of the grinder. The employees started up the grinder. The lowboy driver's hand was caught in the moving belts on the back of the grinder.  The employee suffered the amputation of the tip of his left middle and ring fingers, and had a pin surgically inserted in his left little finger.  The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was fueling a crane. While climbing off the crane, he lost his footing and fell about a foot and a half striking the crane's tracks with his right leg below the knee. He suffered a laceration injury to the right leg and was hospitalized.

An employee was removing excess grease lube from a boom drum on the derrick with a putty knife and got his right hand fingers caught in the rotating metal gears. His right index finger was amputated and the right middle, ring and pinky fingers were crushed.

An employee was connecting a digger/derrick hoisting hook to a material trailer. The digger/derrick started picking up the trailer and the hook slipped off. The hook struck the employee in the face causing blunt force trauma to the face including facial fractures and coma.
An employee was removing formwork when a piece of lumber fell from above striking the right foot and fracturing toes.
An employee fell approximately 9 feet from a roof injuring his lower back.

On 10/30/2015, an employee fell approximately 17 feet during the installation of ridge cap on a pole barn that was being constructed. The employee suffered head injuries, a punctured lung and facial fractures. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.

On October 30, 2015, at approximately 8:30am, an employee was hospitalized after being struck by a 14 inch diameter polyethylene pipe.  The employee was raising a hydraulic jack on the McElroy 618 machine when the pipe under pressure released from the cradle and struck the employee in the face and chest.  The employee's injuries were bruising of the chest, 12 to 13 facial fractures, loosened teeth, and a broken nose.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell backwards off the third rung of a ladder and received a hairline fracture of the pelvic bone on October 31, 2015.
An employee was walking and tripped on an expansion joint in an occupied tunnel underneath the hospital and fractured the pelvis.
An employee tripped over a concrete bumper and fell in the parking lot while walking to her vehicle at the end of day. Her left kneecap was fractured.
An employee was cutting wood with a table saw and amputated the right index finger at the middle knuckle.
An employee amputated half of his nail and finger when an automatic valve closed on his right middle finger.
An employee was shaking out steel member when the steel member struck the employee's lower leg causing a fracture.

The employee was approaching  the doors that go into the lunchroom/cafeteria area. Somebody had just come through the doors. As the doors were closing he grabbed the edge of the door trying to catch it before it closed. The doors caught the end of his pinky finger and amputated it.

An employee was working on a bakers scaffold about 4' high, patching the fireproofing on structural steel. The employee stepped off the scaffold and fell backwards. The employee possibly experienced head and back injury and was taken to the hospital.  At the hospital, the employee was treated and admitted for a finger infection. The employee used his hand to brace the fall and aggravated a previous injury.
On or about November 2, 2015, while installing insulation at a customer's home, the employee's hand/finger got caught in the blower belt amputating the finger down to the first joint.

An employee placing road cones into a pick up truck bed was thrown into the cab when another vehicle collided with the arrow panel that the pick up was towing. The employee fractured the left arm and a hip.

An employee was installing metal roofing for a new pole building. As he was coming down the roof for a break, he fell through a seam in the roof approximately 12 ft. to the ground below. The employee suffered a head injury, a broken left wrist, stitches above the left eye and right elbow and a bruised tailbone.

An employee was working on a crawler crane.  The crane was boomed down and the employee was performing a repair on a sheave. While he was working on the sheave, the wire rope pulled his left index finger and crushed it resulting in a fingertip amputation.

Two employees were bolting round flanges into a pipeline formation.  One employee was torqueing with a ratchet while the other was holding a multiplier that was attached to the ratchet with the use of an extender.  There was another 2" flange (which extended further out than the flange that was being bolted) that was in the middle of the flange that they were bolting.  They were torqueing the bolts on the flange in sequence/series.  When they started the last round of torqueing, the employee holding the multiplier got his pinky caught between the multiplier and the center flange.  This resulted in a partial amputation of the left pinky finger.  The employee had removed skin form the very tip of the finger and the nail bed.
Employees were stripping concrete forms from a bridge when a 4 x 8 piece of plywood fell hitting another employee on the ground causing broken ribs, a back injury, and a punctured lung.
A flagger at the project was struck by car on November 3, 2015. The employee sustained two broken arms, a broken wrist and a broken leg.
An employee came in contact with energized wiring that was carrying 480 volts.  The employee was hospitalized.

Employees were preparing to set steel trusses approximately 66 feet long.  The trusses were being moved via forklift from a staging area in the south parking lot approximately 270 feet to the north.  The injured employee was trying to stabilize a steel truss attached to a forklift.  When the employee removed the strap, the truss, weighing approximately 4000 lbs., tilted and fell onto his leg.  The lower leg was amputated.

A painter was walking up the indoor stairs.  He fell from the second floor landing down to the first floor breaking his collar bone, five ribs and punctured a lung.  It is new construction so there is no railing on the stairs.
An employee fell approximately 14 ft. from a metal roof breaking his leg on impact.

An employee was in the process of cutting plastic roofing material with a hook knife.  The knife got caught up in the plastic roofing material.  The employee pulled on the knife and when it dislodged he cut his thigh.  The employee was admitted into the hospital.

The employee was sitting at the edge of a large commercial dumpster with his feet inside of the receptacle.  The employee was attempting to reach for a piece of plywood, lost his balance, and fell backward, approximately 8 feet to the dirt ground below. The employee was hospitalized with fractures to the neck.
An employee received arc flash burns on the right arm and hand while working in an existing electrical substation.
An employee working with a grout pump got his hand caught in the pump resulting in the amputation of his right hand.
Employees were demolishing concrete when a piece of concrete fell out of the skid steer and landed in such a way that it cantilevered a 2x6 up and struck an employee, breaking the jaw.
An employee walking through yard stepped in wet concrete, thinking it was dry, which caused him to slip and fall, injuring his back.
An employee was framing wooden walls.  A gust of wind blew a wall over and knocked the employee to the ground. The employee sustained a shoulder injury and a cut above his eye.
An employee working on a construction site received second degree burns on his face and neck. The employer is investigating, but the employee was performing electric work at the time of the accident.

An employee injured his finger with a battery power drill while dismantling scaffolding.  The employee's glove got caught in the drill and twisted. The injury required a partial amputation of the tip of his right ring finger.

Employees were emptying a trash buggy into a dumpster. While picking up the buggy, an employee's right ring finger got caught between the edge of the dumpster and the buggy resulting in the loss of soft tissue requiring surgery and graft.
An employee was injured when he lost his balance and fell from a supporting scaffold onto a milk crate. He was hospitalized with lower back injuries.
An employee was installing fiberglass insulation in a cellar when the metal hanger that holds the insulation under the floor hit and lacerated the employee's eye, requiring an operation.

An employee went to make an adjustment on an elevator machine inside the motor room. The machine turned on and caught his right hand, severely lacerating his index finger and crushing his hand and wrist.
An employee was vibrating air out of freshly poured concrete when the concrete boom collapsed and struck the employee, fracturing his left femur and tibia.

On or about 11/9/2015, at 3:30 p.m., an employee was lowering the scissor lift he was in when it got stuck. When the scissor lift became unstuck, it free-fell. On impact, the employee suffered heel and right ankle fractures.

An employee was standing near a coworker who was picking up a metal rod that was about 10 feet long. The employee was struck on the forehead by the end of the metal rod. He sustained a large bump on his forehead and later experienced vomiting, requiring hospitalization.

On November 9, 2015, at 1540 hours, an Urban Concrete employee was participating in a drilling operation when the dislodged auger being used on a construction vehicle struck him on the back, breaking seven ribs. He was hospitalized.
An employee was attempting to assist a coworker when a concrete form became dislodged and struck him, causing abrasions and contusions to his right hand and leg. He was hospitalized.

An employee was on a ladder winding the tension spring for an overhead door when the tension spring blew apart, causing the employee to fall off the ladder. The employee suffered shattered heels and a back injury.
On November 09, 2015, at approximately 5:03 p.m., an employee working on a trench fell 10 feet into the trench. He was hospitalized with a broken tibia, requiring surgery.
An employee was lifting a manhole cover using a handheld hook. The cover slipped off the hook. The employee tried to catch it and amputated his left middle finger.

An employee was standing in the lowered bucket of a skid steer and facing the operator when a rough terrain forklift that was just re-fueled backed up into the skid steer and severed the employee's leg. His leg was amputated at the hospital.

On 11-9-2015, at 11:00 a.m., an employee was using an electric plumbing coil snake to clear out a drain when the coils wrapped around his left hand and fingers.  His left index finger had to be surgically amputated.
An employee fell from the fifth floor to the first floor, injuring his head and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was struck by a come-along, breaking his leg.
An employee was standing on the third rung of an A-frame ladder to replace a vent cover when he fell to the ground below and fractured his left ankle. He required surgery.

As the employee was walking on the second level of a frame and brace scaffold towards the fixed ladder, he slipped on the wet planks and fell 12 feet to the ground resulting in a broken left femur. The planks were wet due to rain.

An employee was unloading equipment from a tilt trailer. A D-ring from one of the hold-down straps was caught between the trailer and the tilt bed. The employee tried to knock out the D-ring with a sledge hammer. When the D-ring was knocked out, the trailer bed came down and amputated the employee's right index fingertip.

An employee entered a sewer/manhole during low flow to install a 36" pillow plug and block flow. During installation, the plug failed and ruptured. The employee was knocked down, fracturing his right arm and wrist. He required surgery.
An employee received electrical burns to his arm, chest, head, and elbow while testing a 4160-volt breaker panel.

An employee was adjusting a 100-ton jack so that it could push pins that held a gantry tube in position. When the jack was in position and pressure was starting to be applied to the pins, something slipped and caused the employee's fingers to get pinched off. About 1.5 inches of his left ring and middle fingers were amputated.
An employee slipped and fell 8 feet to the ground while installing a roof on a mini storage shed, sustaining a broken femur.
An employee was operating a paver on the parkway when the employee's right index fingertip got caught and amputated (no bone loss) between the screed extension of the paver and the wall of a bridge.
An employee using a 4 ft. high A-frame ladder missed a step coming down and reached out to grab a metal stud, cutting the palm of his left hand.
An employee was working on a crew, installing and pressure-testing PVC lines for a sewage line.  The PVC pipe struck the employee's face, causing severe damage.

An employee was performing masonry work from a scaffold. He was changing his work elevation on the scaffold, which required him to remove planking on the current elevation and put it on the next elevation.  During the process, he fell approximately 12 feet, fracturing his ribs and requiring hospitalization.
An employee torching a steal beam from a ladder got caught between the beam and a wall when the beam moved unexpectedly. He fractured his pelvis.

An employee was on the ground floor securing the containment with flexible tarp when the wind started to move it around.  A gust of wind blew against the flexible tarp, knocking him backwards and causing him to land on the ground on his right wrist. His wrist fractured and required hospitalization.

An employee was climbing up the ladder in an attempt to secure it when the ladder retracted and slipped off the wall.  Both the ladder and employee fell to the ground. The employee fell approximately 8 feet, breaking ribs and suffering a swollen spleen.
An employee hit a power line while operating an aerial lift and received an electrical shock.

An employee was helping to lift concrete panels when the metal brace slipped out of his hand and cut his right pinky finger. He was wearing gloves at the time. He was hospitalized for surgery, and his right pinky had to eventually be surgically amputated.

An employee was working in the rod basket of a well-servicing rig when the operator raised the block into the rig derrick. The block bumped the basket, and the employee grabbed the side. His left middle finger got caught between the basket and the derrick, pinching off the end of his finger. The end of his left middle finger was surgically amputated (including bone).

On November 13, 2015, at approximately 2:30 PM, an employee was working from an aerial lift and signaling a crane lifting a pipe. The crane was overloaded, tipped, and struck the aerial basket the employee was riding in.  The employee was bounced out of the aerial lift. When the crane sat back down, the employee was bounced back in the aerial lift and back out again. The employee suffered a spinal fracture, broken ribs, and multiple facial fractures, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell from a scaffold located in a stairway, fracturing their vertebrae.
An employee's left hand received an electrical shock when it grabbed an electrical conduit wiring as he climbed down a ladder.

An employee fell from a 10-foot fiberglass A-frame ladder while setting up to drill a hole in the wall. The employee suffered a concussion, thoracic sprain, lumbar sprain, laceration to the face and forehead, nasal bone fracture, and two broken wrists.

An employee was cleaning a bridge along the embankment of canal.  An operator was using a crane and clam bucket. The employee was guiding the bucket when it came down on and fractured the employee's right foot.

An employee was spotting the loading of a skip hoist onto a semi trailer. The employee attempted to adjust one of four legs that support the motor pack for the skip hoist, which is a separate piece from the skip hoist. The motor pack weighed 1,850 pounds. The employee was loosening a clamp on one of the motor pack legs when the leg collapsed, causing the motor pack to fall on the employee, who suffered broken vertebrae.
An employee fell to the ground below while traversing between roofs, injuring his back.

On November 14, 2015, an employee was loading tools and was folding a triangle tool that has steel cables attached to it. The cables had slack in them and when the employee folded them, the cable tightened up and amputated the employee's right pinky fingertip.
A worker was struck by a mini excavator moving in reverse. It rolled over his right foot and fractured the tibia and fibula.

An employee was outside grinding metal for duct work when a spark or piece of metal blew inside his jacket and ignited it. He suffered 3rd degree burns on his torso and arms and was hospitalized for treatment.

On 11/15/2015, at approximately 1:30 p.m., an employee was working inside a ground stewards tank, which holds the potable water for the city.  As he went up  some rigging on the inside of the tank, the rigging came loose and he fell down with it. He hit the floor of the tank, breaking his leg and fracturing his face. He was hospitalized.
An employee was using an excavator to load concrete slabs into a dump truck. The employee's right leg got caught between the concrete slab and truck tailgate, causing soft tissue damage.
An employee working from a scaffold fell 10 feet to the ground while painting the exterior of a street bridge. He suffered three broken ribs and a fractured disc.
An employee fell approximately 5 feet from a ladder while installing a ceiling tile grid. He broke his knee and was hospitalized.
An employee was moving heavy doors on a drywall cart when a door shifted, fell off the cart, and crushed the employee's left big toe. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was working in front of the side boom when the employee tripped and fell. The side boom moved forward several feet, and the boom track ran over the employee, fracturing their right leg and foot.
An employee was struck by a forklift that was backing up, suffering compound fractures to his left leg.

The employee was trying to dislodge a stone that was stuck on the dump truck.  His right middle finger was stuck between the pin and the locking mechanism on the gate, amputating the tip of his finger.
An employee was painting a balcony when the rail/fence on the balcony broke causing the employee to fall approximately 30 feet and break the right wrist/hand. The employee also had internal injuries.
An employee was measuring the inside of a trench box and was struck by a piece of concrete fracturing a finger.
An employee was walking across the first floor of the building under construction and fell through a hole in the floor breaking the left wrist.
An employee made contact with an energized line and received flash burns to his left hand.

Two employees were installing the top wall plate and caulking the seams of a previously erected pre-manufactured wall.  One employee was in a man lift and the second employee was working from the ground.  The wall fell over as a result of a sudden wind gust.  The temporary supports holding the wall in place failed and the wall fell onto the man lift and struck both employees. One of the employees sustained two broken ankles and the other employee dislocated the right hip.  The pre-manufactured framed wall (structural insulated pane) measured approximately 18 feet in height by 120 feet in length.
An employee was installing fire taping on a drywall from a 16 ft. extension ladder. He fell 9 feet to the ground resulting in contusions to his left ankle, lower back, upper back, shoulder and neck.
A temporary employee was pulling plastic from behind a stack of boards. The boards fell and broke his leg.

An employee was operating an angle line fabricator. The angle iron rolls in and it's measured and cut to length by the machine. The employee was adjusting the punch that cuts the angle iron with a wrench between cycles. The punch came down. The angle iron got stuck on the punch and retracted with the punch crushing the tip of the employee's left middle finger between the angle iron and the machine.

An employee was operating a dump truck and another employee was outside the truck attempting to shut the tailgate. The tailgate was stuck open and the employee was pulling on the tailgate trying to get it unstuck. As the employee pulled on the tailgate, the truck moved forward and the tailgate shut on the employee's hand resulting in amputation of the left middle fingertip.
An employee was winding up a 42 inch wide belt and got his foot caught between the belt guide on the conveyor and the belt. The employee's right leg was broken just above the ankle.
A drain pipe that was being lowered into place crushed a worker's left index finger resulting in amputation.
An employee who had been performing decking operations suffered spinal injuries after he fell 12 feet through a guardrail to the plywood below.

An employee used the ladder to go down into the 8 feet deep trench. He stepped onto the floor of the trench and started to sink. His co-worker dropped down an emergency retrieval sling and as he was pulling himself up with it, he hurt both legs resulting in torn ligaments.

An employee was assisting with the unloading of granite curbing from a flatbed trailer. The bucket of the excavator being used to unload the curbing struck a length of curbing causing it to fall onto the employee's leg and causing injury.
An employee amputated a thumb.
An employee was removing bolts from concrete forms while the forms were laying on the ground. The form shifted and broke the employee's tibia and fibula.
An employee performing plumbing work was hospitalized after the hole hawg drill he was using caught his glove and amputated his right pinky finger.
An employee fell into the trench while trying to cross over it and suffered a moderate to severe spinal injury.
A temp employee was hospitalized with a skull fracture after being struck in the head by the bucket of a mini-excavator.

An employee was driving an excavator up a mountain road. The excavator hit a patch of ice, slid off the side of the road and rolled over. A tree stump came through the cab and pinned the operator's leg between the stump and the controls.

An employee was erecting steel. He was straddling a steel beam suspended by a crane when the end of the beam seesawed up under him and pinned him against a column. He was hospitalized with a leg laceration.

An employee was measuring plywood with a coworker when the coworker stepped on the plywood. The injured employee's finger got caught between two sheets of plywood and the left ring fingertip was snipped off. The employee required surgical amputation down to the first joint.

An employee was helping a coworker demolish a fin fan part that was recently replaced on a cooling unit at the chemical plant. The employee's coworker was tasked with torch cutting a 15 feet x 25 feet, 3/16-inch steel fin fan part into smaller pieces for demolition and removal from the site. The employee was standing 6 to 8 feet away from the torch cutting operation. While the coworker was torch cutting the tail-end area on the fin fan, a side panel that measured 19 feet x 4.5 feet and weighed approximately 650 lbs. came off and fell, striking the employee in the right leg. The employee's right tibia and fibula were fractured.

An employee was replacing purlins on the roof when he fell approximately 30 feet to the ground through a hole, breaking his right arm and leg. He was wearing an unsecured harness at the time of the incident.
An employee was cleaning a propane dryer and blowing dust with compressed air when an explosion occurred. The employee suffered a shoulder injury and hand burns.
An employee had finished installing drywall and began to disassemble the scaffold with coworkers. Part of the scaffold pinched and cut his right thumb. He was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was welding two sections of pipe on top of a skid platform. The skid platform (2 feet high) collapsed, and the pipe rolled onto the employee's lower leg, fracturing the right ankle. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was conducting site preparation using a mini excavator when the vehicle flipped over, causing him to break his hip.
An employee was spotting a front end loader. A traffic vehicle did not yield on the worksite and struck the front end loader, which in turn struck the employee. He broke bones in his right leg.
On or about 11/23/15, at approximately 10 p.m., an employee walking on the jobsite was struck in the chest by the arm and bucket of an excavator. The employee was hospitalized with a bruised heart.

An employee in a roadway work zone was struck by a vehicle that left the roadway.  The employee had dismounted the equipment in a coned area when he was struck.  His leg broke, and he was hospitalized for treatment.
After performing electrical work, an employee was stepping down from an aerial lift when he slipped and injured his back, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was watching an excavator operator dig a hole and he decided to get some measurements in the hole. As he was walking, a large rock rolled down and struck him in the pelvis, breaking his pelvic bones.
An employee was working on a roof and fell through a skylight. He hit his head and body and was hospitalized with head and back injuries. He was wearing fall protection at the time.
An employee fell through the guard rails of a 10-foot platform and broke his tail bone and vertebrae.
An employee was pulling on a light chain to get an alignment for a pavement edge. The chain broke, causing the employee to stumble, misstep, and fall. He broke his left tibia above the ankle.
An employee was climbing up the ladder when he fell resulting in a back injury.

An employee was driving a Vermeer flex track loader onto a flat bed trailer when the load shifted forward. This caused the Vermeer flex track loader to fall off of the trailer and strike the employee's foot resulting in crushing injuries that required surgery.

An employee received a distal amputation of his left middle finger while transporting a cart loaded with scaffolding. The rolling cart shifted and the employee's hand was pinched between the cart handle and an I-beam.
An employee stepped backward into a stairwell on the second floor mezzanine that had no stairs and fell 24 feet to the ground.

An employee was working on roof installing an exhaust fan. The employee stepped back and fell through a skylight to the floor 12 to 15 feet below. The employee was admitted to the hospital for a head injury and surgery.
An employee was backing up the milling machine and struck another employee that was sweeping the road. The employee suffered a fractured tail bone.

An employee was using a Sumner roust-a-bout to lift an I Beam.  The roust-a-bout lost balance and tipped over.  The employee tried to stop the I-Beam from falling.  The I-beam fell and landed on the employee's left pinky finger crushing it. The finger was amputated.
An employee was painting while standing on a 4.5-foot baker scaffold. He fell off the scaffold, injuring his head, ribs, and back on the concrete floor below.
While an employee was moving a loader, the loader door came back and closed on his thumb.

While climbing a fixed metal ladder (ship's ladder) to the high roof of a high school building, an employee slipped and fell approximately 12 feet to the ground, landing on his back and fracturing two vertebrae.

An employee fell 6 feet from a ladder to the cement floor while installing a piece of pipe duct work for an HVAC system. The pipe got hung up on a wire and hit the ladder, knocking him down. He fractured his right forearm.
An employee was kneeling down to hand grate or hand shovel when a bobcat operator struck the employee, injuring his right tibia.

On 12/2/2015, at approximately 12 p.m., an employee was climbing a ladder to the roof to install fall protection anchor points. The decking under the ladder was frosted over.  As the employee climbed the ladder, the ladder slipped, causing the employee to fall approximately 10 feet to the decking.  The employee was hospitalized with contusions to the left shoulder, left leg, and ribs.
An employee was operating a bulldozer to conduct site preparation work. Coworkers found him unconscious on the ground near the bulldozer with neck and arm injuries. He was hospitalized.
On 12/2/15, at about 3:30 p.m., two employees got into an altercation. One employee was pushed to the ground and was hospitalized with a shoulder and back sprain/strain.
An employee was wearing gloves and sorting I beams with his hands.  One beam slid and rolled and caught his finger. The employee had half of his middle finger surgically removed.
An employee's left hand was crushed while operating the sheet metal roller machine.

An employee was carrying an 8-feet-long, 7-feet-wide, reinforced wire mesh on the flat roof of a new building. As he was approaching the area where the wire mesh was to be installed, the wire mesh snagged with the handle of the power pack, causing him to trip. He fell on a 2" by 6" foam board, fracturing his lower left leg and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was unstrapping office tables from the inside of a truck when the tables fell on top of him. He sustained 10 broken ribs and a gash to the head.

An employee was assisting a pit fitter. When a track hoe operator adjusted a pipe approximately 300 feet away, it caused the pipe to fall off the pipe stand and strike the employee just above the left ankle. The employee's ankle fractured.

Employees were performing new building construction. An angle iron slipped and became caught between other objects at a height of approximately 10 to 15 feet aboveground. An employee accessed a ladder to inspect what the angle iron was caught on and determine how it would be removed when the angle iron fell to the ground and struck the ladder, knocking the employee off. The employee fell approximately 8 feet to the ground and struck their head. The employee suffered wrist and skull fractures and required stitches.
An employee's right-hand little fingertip was amputated when a 2x4 piece of lumber dropped suddenly and smashed the employee's finger.
An employee's right foot was run over by a construction vehicle, fracturing the right ankle.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation while servicing an air unit on the roof of a fast food restaurant.

On December 3, 2015, at approximately 1:45 pm, an employee fell from an 8-foot fiberglass stepladder. The employee was installing an exterior light on the side of a building using a hammer drill while standing on the stepladder. The employee fell from the ladder and struck the concrete driveway, fracturing both wrists.  The employee was hospitalized for surgery.

Two employees were driving a company golf cart across an intersection when an automobile ran the stop sign and struck the cart. One of the employees sustained five broken ribs and a broken collarbone, while the second employee suffered knee bruises and a strained neck.
An employee slipped and fell while coming out of the laundry room in an inventory home, breaking the right hip.

A stucco crew set up two A-frame scaffold frames inside a 10x10 enclosed porch area and placed some planks between the frames. The ground that the scaffold was on was not level or solid.  A worker climbed on the planks between the frames and began applying stucco to the walls.  One of the frames slipped and fell over causing the worker to fall to the ground breaking his right arm in a manner that requires surgery. He also suffered scrapes and bruises.

Employees were attempting to insert a section of U-adjuster shackle into a chain link using a sledge hammer. The injured employee was holding the shackle. As a coworker swung on the hammer, the injured employee's hand slipped and got struck by the hammer. His left index finger was partially amputated.

On 12/5/15, an employee was switching out 55-gallon drums of wall waterproofing material in a waterproofing truck when an explosion occurred. The employee suffered second and third degree burns to the abdomen, back, and face and was hospitalized.
An employee was picking up debris in the main work area. He walked up to an excavator as the bucket was turning. The bucket struck his shoulder, causing him to fall down and hit his head.
An employee was pulling a wire using needle nose pliers. The pliers slipped, and the wire struck and severely injured the employee's right eye.
An employee was installing a curtain wall when his finger was pinched.
An employee tripped and fell while walking injuring the left femur.
An employee doing fiber optic installation was climbing a communication pole and fell from an unknown height.  The employee suffered a couple of cracked ribs and a punctured lung.
An employee was moving 55 gallon drums and smashed a finger between a drum and the barrel picker. The fingertip was amputated below the thumb nail.

An employee was walking along the top of a trench that was 4 feet deep, and was carrying a 13 foot long, 8 inch diameter PVC pipe.  The victim slipped, fell into the trench, and sustained a broken neck.
A worker fell approximately seven feet from a mobile scaffold resulting in hospitalization for severe head trauma.

A contract employee at a host employer worksite was changing a light bulb while positioned on a stepladder when his clothing got caught on a piece of metal on a rotating shaft, pulling the worker into the machine and fracturing both forearms.

On December 7, 2015 an employee was opening a construction gate for a dump truck to enter when a passenger vehicle tried to pass the dump truck and struck the dump truck.  When the passenger vehicle struck the dump truck it hit the employee resulting in fractured ribs and a fractured pelvis and a head laceration.
An employee's ring fingertip was amputated when the hinge on a used electrical panel failed, allowing the lid to slam down on his finger.
On 12/09/2015 an employee was spraying insulation and stepped on a drywall screw. The employee was hospitalized when the laceration became infected.
While crimping decking sheets, an employee stepped backwards and fell 14 feet from the first level deck to the concrete below.  The employee fractured the right fibula/tibia.

An employee was moving walkboards. The employee slammed a walkboard to clean off excess mortar which caused an outlooker to break. This caused the scaffold to tilt and the employee fell sustaining a neck injury.

An employee was assisting another employee in moving a large plastic spool. As the employee was pushing the spool, a trackhoe that was compacting the dirt backed over the employee's left foot resulting in injury to the left knee.
An employee slipped and fell approximately 12 feet down a metal ladder on the side of the building. The employee received severe injuries, including broken ribs, and was hospitalized.
Two employees were fusing two sections of polyline. When the fusing device was activated, the area became engulfed in flames. Both employees were hospitalized with burns to the face and hands.

On December 7, 2015, an employee received an electrical shock when the steel cables attached to the spider basket in which the employee was working contacted an overhead power line. The employee suffered electrical burns to the right hand and stomach and the amputation of his right arm just below the elbow.
An employee stepping from an extension ladder onto a wet metal roof slipped and fell to the concrete below. He suffered a compound fracture to his right wrist.
An employee suffered amputation and crushing injuries to his thumbs while operating a metal bending unit.
An employee was holding forklift forks in the upright position when a fork fell and crushed the employee's finger. One-third of the employee's finger was amputated at the hospital.
An employee was using a wood joiner to finish the edge on a piece of wood. When the employee attempted to brush away dust with his gloved hand, the blade amputated his right index fingertip.

An employee was pulling wiring using a 10-foot step ladder. He lost his footing and fell to the ground, losing consciousness for 15 minutes. He was hospitalized with a concussion and minor spinal fractures.
While attempting to install a hand line, an employee made contact with an energized power line, receiving second and third degree burns to the left hand. The employee was hospitalized.
Three employees were working in a scissor lift. An overhead door opened and knocked the scissor lift over.  One employee was hospitalized with a back injury.

An employee pulled into the yard to pick up some rebar. He thought he placed the pickup truck in park and exited the vehicle, however the truck was in reverse. The door knocked him over and the left front tire ran over his right ankle. He was admitted to the hospital for a broken tibia and fibula.

An employee was picking up debris from the roof of a building. She lifted one of the skylight covers, which was not labeled "hole," and fell through 10 feet. She fractured her right arm and was hospitalized.
An employee was hanging drywall from a scaffold and fell resulting in a head injury.

An employee was applying membrane material to the foundation of a house. Her coworkers were transporting hot waterproofing material product in buckets to the foundation and were throwing the hot product on walls and spreading it with brooms. The product splashed and burned the employee's hands, fingers, face, and neck. She was hospitalized.

An employee was hanging dry wall from a 5-ft high scaffold and was found unconscious on the floor with multiple skull fractures by his co-worker who heard the noise from the other side of the wall and came to his aid. The employer assumes the employee was climbing down when the scaffold tipped over and he fell head first onto the concrete floor.
An employee experienced an electrical shock while walking in the reformer section of the paper mill.

An employee was walking on strap-on stilts spreading joint compound on newly installed bathroom drywall when he tripped on an exposed pipe on the floor and fell. He was hospitalized with a broken right femur.
A laborer was cutting down a piece of metal ductwork and cut his forearm. He was admitted to the hospital for stitches and treatment of a 6 inch laceration.
An employee fell approximately 20 feet from a scaffold while climbing down resulting in a lower extremities fracture and hospitalization for medical treatment.

On December 12, 2015, at approximately 12:45 am, an employee was washing a paving machine with a water hose. The employee moved in close to wash behind the auger that was slowly spinning. The auger caught the employee's vest pulling him into the machine and turning him onto his back. At that time, another employee was able to shut off the machine. The employee suffered a dislocated left hip, a left knee strain and a left arm abrasion.

An employee was stabilizing a mortar tub that weighed approximately 75 to 100 pounds on a forklift. The load began to swing in a circular motion and pushed the employee toward the front right-side wheel. The forklift then rolled onto the employee's right leg, breaking the right femur.
An employee was doing maintenance on an electrical transformer when he contacted energized equipment, suffering third degree burns on his left hand.

An employee and a coworker were guiding an electrical cabinet carried by a forklift into a storage unit. They noticed the electrical cabinet was too tall for the storage unit, so they repositioned the electrical cabinet to its side. While moving the repositioned electrical cabinet, a backboard on the pallet broke, allowing the cabinet to fall. The injured employee tried to catch the electrical cabinet, fracturing his right leg.
An employee was operating a break machine and got his left index finger caught in the machine resulting in laceration and fracture.
An employee slipped on a piece of tape and fell approximately 11 feet from the roof resulting in two broken ribs and a fractured scapula.
An employee was descending from a ladder when he slipped and fell to the ground injuring his forehead, elbow, right hand and knee.

An employee fell approximately 20 feet from the roof of a two story building. The employee's fall arrest system was not hooked to the safety line at the time. As a result of the fall, the employee suffered three broken ribs and a broken right hand.
An employee was cleaning debris and moving ladders when the employee tripped and fell breaking a wrist and a hip or pelvis.
While removing rotten decking from a roof, an employee fell about 30 feet through the decking. The injured employee was hospitalized with broken ribs and a collapsed lung.
Two employees working from a man-lift received an electrical shock.

An employee was setting up the table saw to perform dado cuts on a door. The material kicked back and the employee's right hand was pulled into the blade. The employee was hospitalized for surgery on his index finger, middle finger, and thumb.

An employee was operating a cut-off saw and the wheel of the cut-off saw exploded and kicked back injuring the worker.  The worker was hospitalized with a deep laceration to the chest and a chipped collarbone.

On or about 12/16/15, an employee was opening the gate for a semi truck to leave the area.  The semi trailer's rear bumper with the hazmat sign got hooked on the gate.  The gate broke loose from the hinges and went flying 10 feet in the air landing on the employee. The employee was hospitalized with fractured ribs, a potential hole in the lung, and a facial laceration.
An employee was installing low voltage wires and received a shock. He fell from a six foot step ladder resulting in broken ribs and a collapsed lung.
An employee was using a hand-held blower to clean when his thumb was partially amputated by the impeller on the bottom of the equipment. The impeller was unguarded at the time.

An employee was operating a MAC-MR6 truck with a 1997 Putzmeister BSF32.16H 32 Meter Concrete Pump. The pump clogged. The employee was fixing the clog, when suddenly the pump shot concrete out striking the employee in the face and chest.  The employee was thrown a distance of approximately 16 meters. The employee was hospitalized for treatment of his injuries.
An employee was cutting a vehicle's windshield at the customer's home when the cold knife slipped and punctured his right forearm. The employee was admitted to the hospital for treatment.

Employees were dismantling a system scaffold 20 feet in the air. When one of the employees removed a gravity pin that was holding a coupling pin for a scaffold leg, the leg released and fell 20 feet below striking another employee on the right arm above the elbow and on his right middle finger. The employee was hospitalized with a puncture wound above the elbow and a broken right finger.
An employee was inspecting welds on a scaffold and fell 6.5 feet resulting in a broken leg. Fall protection was worn at the time of the incident.
An employee operating a 20 inch masonry saw to cut cinder block amputated his left thumb when the saw kicked back.
Workers were moving Jersey barriers. An employee suffered a broken lower left leg and a broken right foot when the backhoe ran over his leg.

An employee was attempting to connect alligator clips to a battery inside of a welding machine. The machine was running and the fan severely lacerated his right index and middle fingers. The index finger was also dislocated.
An employee fell approximately 30 feet through an elevator shaft after unhooking his self-retracting lifeline to readjust a laser resulting in fractured ribs, pelvis and a punctured lung.
An employee fell through a floor opening on the second floor that had been covered with fiberboard. The employee was hospitalized with broken ribs and lacerations.
The employee was carrying a box when he lost his grip and his right middle finger was pinched requiring partial amputation of the finger at the hospital.
One employee fell three feet from a ladder while installing sheetrock and suffered a compound fracture to his right ankle.
An employee was hospitalized after being struck by a rigid steel tremie pipe that fell from the boom of a concrete pump truck. The employee suffered a broken foot and a broken finger.
An employee was waterproofing and fell approximately 15 feet through a hole resulting in a broken back.
An employee working with a circular saw cutting lumber cut his wrist.
An employee fell six feet from a ladder being used to perform electrical installation work and fractured vertebrae.
Employee was stepping onto the roof from the ladder and slipped off the roof onto the ground fracturing his right heel.
An iron worker was installing a skillet valve. The employee's right hand became lodged between two pipes near the valve and he suffered a partial amputation of his right thumb.

An employee climbed onto a trash trailer and was moving materials around when he fell sideways, catching himself with his hand and cutting his thumb on metal. The employee was hospitalized for surgery to repair the cut tendon.

An employee was loading pallets onto a truck. The pallet hooks shifted and pinched the employee's finger between the pallet and the hook resulting in a partial amputation of the right middle fingertip.
An employee was injured when he slipped on ice in the parking lot.  He was taken to the hospital where he remained overnight for observation. He was treated with four staples.
An employee was moving an LP gas tank to be used on a forklift when he lost his balance and fell from a 3-1/2 foot platform to the ground fracturing his right knee.
An employee was standing on an A-frame ladder preparing to install a heating unit within a garage and fell, fracturing an ankle that required hospitalization.
An employee was in the boom lift cleaning when he got caught between a bar joist and the lift causing damage to his liver.

An employee was relocating the skidder digger.  While turning around, the vehicle was half on, half off the blacktop.  The right side of the skidder sunk into the soft dirt and it started to tip over.  The employee was pinned under the skidder cage. The employee sustained lacerations to the left ear and eye and a left shoulder injury. The employee was not wearing a seat belt at the time.
An employee fell off an extension ladder while cleaning fascia. He fell an unknown height and sustained fractured ribs and lacerations.
A mechanic was repairing a heater in a Bobcat skid steer loader. The employee was in the cab and the door closed on the employee's finger removing a piece of tissue from the left ring finger.

An electrician leaned an unopened, 8-foot A-frame ladder against a wall.  He climbed the unopened ladder, over reached, lost his balance, and fell. 
He was treated for four hairline fractures to his vertebrae.
While the company was installing Google Fiber Optic cable on the public road, a vehicle ran through the traffic cones and struck an employee. The employee was hospitalized with a broken leg.

An employee was operating a gravel crushing conveyor belt. The employee attempted to dislodge stuck material from the return roller under the conveyor belt and the employee's arm was caught in the conveyor belt resulting in friction burns.

An employee placed a sheet metal pipe for an HVAC duct into a roll former.  His left index finger was caught between the sheet metal pipe and the die when the roller's foot pedal was actuated. The employee's left index fingertip was partially amputated.
Four employees were riding on an ATV when the ATV rolled over. One of the employee's right leg was pinned under the ATV and severely lacerated. The employee was hospitalized.

Four Treco, Inc. employees were cleaning tank bottoms at a facility. During the course of bolting a man way cover onto the tank opening with hand tools, an unknown ignition source caused two of the tanks to ignite. One employee suffered second and third degree burns to his face.
An employee was spackling drywall on a rolling scaffold. The scaffold rolled into a hole that was covered by carpet and the employee fell approximately six feet breaking his arm and wrist.

An employee had just finished installing the last of the drip edge flashing on the roof of a two-story 6:12 pitched new house. He unhooked his lanyard from the anchor point in order to go down the ladder. He slipped and fell 20 feet onto the sand resulting in a lower back injury and broken ribs.
An employee was removing snow from the roof of one story house and fell to the ground. The employee sustained a skull fracture and injured his spleen and shoulder.
An employee smashed his finger at a job site while helping to hook up a job trailer to a pickup.
An employee was working from a scissor lift while removing a section of form work from the ceiling. Meanwhile, another section of form work came down and fractured his left leg.
An employee was setting pipes on the ground and working on pipe support. The ground fell out, causing the pipes to slip and crush the employee's right leg.
An assailant robbed and struck an employee in the head with a wooden stick while the employee was taking trash to the dumpster outside of the church being cleaned.
An employee working on the roof of a three-story building fell and fractured his humerus and hips.

An employee delivered plywood to a project site and was walking away on the opposite side of panels boards being installed when he fell to the ground unresponsive. He was hospitalized with external and internal head trauma from a bullet-nail, which pierced his skull and was embedded in his head. A ricochet may have occurred through the panel boards being installed, causing the nail to strike the employee.
An employee was rolling a pipe when his glove got caught underneath it, smashing his right index finger. The finger was eventually amputated down to the first knuckle.
An employee was climbing a ladder on the front side of a house when the ladder fell over. The employee suffered spine and neck injuries.
While using a screw gun, an employee tweaked his back and had to be hospitalized.

An employee was cutting the blower section of an air unit out. As he was cutting the blower, a section that he was cutting fell off of the frame, which caused the blower wheel to fall to the floor. It landed on his right boot and cut through the steel reinforcement, damaging two of his middle toe tips.

Four employees were setting up a suspended scaffold. Three employees were on a level above. The injured employee was standing on a lower level, receiving materials from the employees working above. The employee stepped backwards and fell approximately 8 to 10 feet, breaking multiple back bones.
An employee was installing a floor joist on the deck when he fell 10 feet through the joist to the ground below. He hit and injured his backside and was hospitalized.
An employee was walking from the kitchen to the dining area when he missed a 6-inch high unmarked step. He sustained torn knee ligaments and a head injury.
An employee connecting structural steel fell approximately 17 feet, suffering a broken pelvis.

An employee was preparing to conduct preventative maintenance activities on an HVAC unit on the roof of the building. He took the front panel off the unit. He slipped/lost his footing, causing his hand to enter the unit and get caught in the desiccant belt wheel.  His left index fingertip was amputated.
An employee was struck by HDPE piping, breaking his back and 10 ribs. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
After hanging pipe, an employee fell approximately 10 feet to the ground while descending a ladder.  The employee lost consciousness and suffered head and face contusions.
An employee was cutting concrete when a piece of concrete chipped off and struck the employee's left eye. The employee required surgery.

An employee was cleaning the concrete mixer with a stick when he lost his balance.  He dropped the stick and tried to grab hold of something. His hand went into the open lid of the mixer, lacerating the first three fingers on his right hand.

An employee was loading a pneumatic roller onto a flat bed trailer.  Once the roller was centered, the employee attempted to place the roller in park, but hit the wrong lever.  The roller started to move in reverse, so the employee tried to put it back into forward.  The rear wheels started to spin and the roller fell off the flat bed trailer.  The employee held on as the roller was turning over and hit a mailbox.  The impact with the mailbox broke the employee's left femur.
An employee was one member of a crew applying road asphalt. The 10-wheel truck dumping the asphalt backed over the employee's feet, breaking two bones in his right foot and requiring stitches.
An employee was helping a forklift lift a metal brace that was frozen to the ground when the brace became free and popped up, hitting and breaking the employee's ankle.

An employee 
was doing maintenance on a piece of equipment that was shut down. He grabbed the motor's damper/pulley belt and pulled the belt toward himself. This caused the damper/pulley to rotate, pinning his right-hand thumb between the damper/pulley and the belt. As a result, the top part of his right-hand thumb (approximately 1/8" to 3/16") was amputated.
An employee was using a 4x4 to move a steel beam onto a truck when the board snapped, causing him to lose his balance and fall from the truck. He fractured his ankle.

Two employees working from a scissor lift were removing overhead air conditioning duct work at approximately 19 feet in height. When the employees cut the straps that were holding the duct work in place, it swung down and hit the scissor lift, causing it to turn over. The first employee sustained a fractured vertebra and shattered right knee. The second employee suffered a fractured left femur.
An employee was coring through a sewer while working in a 15-foot deep excavation. The employee's leg got trapped by debris outside of a trench shield, resulting in a lower limb injury.
While cutting metal baseplates on a band saw, an employee attempted to sweep shavings from the cut. His left index finger came into contact with the band saw blade, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was organizing his work truck when a large tank of R-22 refrigerant fell out of the truck, causing the valve to open and spray the employee. He received chemical burns to his face, neck, shoulders, and chest area.
An employee was preparing to change out the equalizer block on a crane when the block fell over and struck the employee, who suffered broken bones in both legs.

An employee was placing a ladder against the main building to tie it off. As he climbed the ladder, he reached out with his right hand and grabbed the energized metal gutter on a drive-under canopy next to the main building and was shocked. This caused him to fall off the ladder, dislocating/breaking his right shoulder, and cracking his right shoulder blade and vertebrae. He was hospitalized.
An employee was attempting to warm spray paint cans in front of a heater when the cans caught fire and burned the employee's hands and forehead.
An employee was walking across a concrete area covered by black ice and snow. The employee slipped and fell, sustaining two fractures to the left ankle and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was applying sealant on the edge of a roof when he lost his balance and fell 28 feet to the ground below, dislocating his right hip.
An employee was moving lumber with a hoe when the lumber shifted and fell off, striking and fracturing the employee's right leg.
An employee was shooting different elevations when he fell onto a piece of rebar, which punctured his left leg.
An employee's right ring finger got caught between furniture and a template press during T-molding operations. The employee's fingernail was amputated.
An employee was struck in the head by a scaffold plank, which fell approximately 10 feet while it was being dismantled. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee building high-voltage overhead powerlines came in contact with 7,200 volts from a live jumper line. The employee was hospitalized for an electrical shock and burns.
While an employee was grinding a weld, sparks caused his shirt to catch on fire. He received second and third degree burns from the mid torso to the upper chest area.
An employee was kneeling down to take measurements for a curtain wall when a forklift operator drove through a door and ran over the employee's left foot, fracturing it.

An employee was installing staircase treads on an industrial-type staircase when he lost his balance and fell from a 10-foot scaffold, severely gashing his right elbow and requiring hospitalization. He was wearing fall protection at the time.
An employee was being treated for a work-related cut when he passed out and struck his head on the ground.
An employee was coming down a ladder and slipped on the bottom rung. The employee fell to the concrete, fracturing a hip.
An employee cleaning a work area slipped and hit the guardrail system, falling 6 feet to the floor below. The employee suffered a broken rib and deflated lung.
An employee performing masonry work on a scaffold stepped back and fell 6 feet to the concrete floor, suffering a compound fracture to the lower right leg that required surgery.

An employee was setting a wall on a house. The house's elevation was raised because the grade dropped in the rear of the house. The back walls were set and the end wall was down, being prepped to be set, when the employee slipped on ice and fell about 9 feet. The employee hit their head and suffered a spinal injury.
While attempting to load the panel used to cover the skylight on the roof, an employee fell approximately 9 feet through the skylight and hit his head on the ground below.

Workers were drilling with a drill rig when a deflection pipe broke off and a stream of water hit an employee standing nearby. The employee fell backward and hit his head on a piece of equipment, fracturing his skull.
On 1/13/16, an employee fell to the concrete floor while working from an 8-foot step ladder.  The employee suffered a head injury and was hospitalized.

On January 13, 2016, at approximately 10:00 a.m., an employee was using a compound miter saw to cut a board when the plastic guard on the saw shattered, and the guide slammed down and amputated the employee's left-hand ring finger and middle fingertip.

An employee stepped backwards off a landing deck and fell approximately 21 feet to the ground below, suffering a head injury. His retractable lanyard caught, but the lanyard broke as it rubbed against the beam.
While driving a buggy, an employee's ankle was crushed between the buggy and a barilla (storage of project material) full of screw jacks. His ankle broke.
On January 13, 2016, an employee was cutting cast iron stack with a reciprocating saw when the saw blade snapped. He suffered neck vertebrae injuries and required surgery.
While descending an A-frame ladder, an employee lost his balance and fell. He landed sideways and broke his right ankle, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was removing the inside corner form for a concrete foundation when his left hand was crushed between the form and a waler, amputating his left middle finger and fracturing his thumb.
On January 14, 2016, an employee was cutting a recycled paper insulation board using a table saw. His right hand came into contact with the blade, amputating his pinky finger.
An employee broke his left ankle when his ladder collapsed as he was painting the side of a house.

An employee was placing the steel roof and ridge cap in place on a barn when he slipped and fell. He reached out and grabbed onto a piece of steel that lacerated four fingers and amputated his pinky fingertip.

An employee was working from a 6-foot stepladder, removing flex tubing from the ceiling level. He was pulling on the tubing when it gave way, causing him to lose his balance and fall to the concrete surface below. He broke his hip and elbow.

On January 15, 2016, at approximately 11:00 am, an employee was installing siding and slipped and fell. He was wearing his harness and lanyard which arrested his fall, but he struck a small brick wall and broke his left leg. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was shoveling wet concrete in front of a paving machine when the employee's right leg/ankle got caught in the paving machine.  The employee was hospitalized for surgery on a broken right ankle.
An employee was welding near waste motor oil.  The waste motor oil caught fire and the employee sustained first to third degree burns to the legs while putting the fire out.

The employee was working with a crew repositioning a large rotor at a power plant. The employees were rotating the rotor 90 degrees. After rotating, the rotor stopped, then rolled back onto his hand resulting in a pinkie finger amputation.

The employee was helping another subcontractor unjam the lock on the dump truck's gate. The employee put his hand on the latch and when it became operational, the lock struck his fingers and amputated the right pinky and ring fingertips.
An employee was changing the breaker on a live panel (1200 Amps/480 Volts) when two phases crossed and an arc flashed occurred. The employee suffered head and face injuries.
An employee was moving a cart full of materials. The cart fell over onto the employee and fractured the left pelvis.
An employee was working from a ladder scrubbing the frame wall of a blender machine when he lost his balance and fell into the blender. He amputated the first two toes on his right foot.
An employee fell from an eight-foot ladder resulting in a broken right ankle.

An employee was using a scissor lift to gain access to suspended piping. The scissor lift controls failed allowing the lift to continue to elevate. The employee's head struck the suspended piping resulting in a fractured jaw.
Employees were staging materials.  An employee was struck in the back by a column that fell off of the forks of a skid steer resulting in a fractured hip.
The employee was dumping material from a dump truck and was struck by the material (approximately one ton of soil) resulting in a compound fracture to the leg and a broken nose.

An employee was climbing a scaffold when the scaffold came apart.  The employee fell 12-15 feet to the ground resulting in a upper left thigh laceration and a compression fracture to the T10 vertebra.
An employee was attempting to attach his fall rope to the anchor on the roof.  He slipped and fell resulting in cracked vertebrae.

An employee was positioned at the rear of a 60 ton truck crane. The crane's outrigger jacks were raised in preparation for re-positioning the crane.  As the jacks were raised the crane traveled backward approximately 5 feet. As a result, the employee's right leg was caught between the rear of the 60 ton crane and the outrigger mats being utilized by an adjacent 240 ton crane. The employee suffered a puncture wound and fracture to the right knee requiring corrective surgery.

A two-man team was adjusting an exposed metal stud wall at a new construction site. Another employee in an aerial lift located on one side of the exposed metal stud wall was on his way back down to ground level and hit a piece of electrical conduit. Upon hitting the piece of conduit, the conduit nudged the exposed metal stud wall and moved the wall. When the wall moved it amputated the left ring finger of an employee who was at ground level and on the other side of the exposed metal wall.
An employee was installing the frame of an atrium and fell from a plank between two extension ladders fracturing an elbow.
An employee was cutting wood on a table saw and amputated his thumb.

An employee was trying to show a coworker the controls on a skid steer to deactivate the interlock on the fork attachment. While the employee was pointing out the disengagement button, the coworker immediately pressed it, causing the forks to lift and pin the injured employee between the fork mast and the cab. The employee suffered a fractured hip.
An employee was on a rooftop installing metal. While adjusting his harness, he slipped and fell off the roof, fracturing his back.

An employee was removing a pressurized cap from the coolant tank on an excavator when it blew off resulting in first and second degree burns to his right arm from the hot coolant. In addition, the employee jumped from the excavator in reaction to the burns and broke his leg. He was hospitalized.
On 1/21/16, an employee was in a bucket truck working on a splicing box. He fell approximately 18 feet out of the bucket, breaking his shoulder and several vertebrae.
An employee welding a bar joist fell 13.5 feet and suffered broken ribs and a punctured lung.

An employee was working with a concrete core drill, coring anchor bolts from concrete, when a piece of concrete got caught in the bit. When the employee backed the drill out of the hole, his jacket became caught in the bit. The bit was turning and wrapped the jacket around itself, breaking the employee's left arm.
An employee broke his leg after tripping over a cord. He was hospitalized and treated for the injury.

An employee was standing on a six foot folding step ladder assembling wooden forms.  The plywood that the ladder was on shifted and the employee fell 18 feet off the side of the building resulting in a back injury.

An employee was climbing down an extension ladder from the second-story roof after servicing a solar panel system. He fell off the ladder and landed on the concrete driveway, breaking his leg and wrist and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was signaling a crane that was loading a forklift with steel beams. After the beams were placed on the lift, one fell and hit him on the head, breaking his neck. He was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was climbing a ladder to install a venting pipe when his hand slipped off the ladder rung, causing him to fall backwards onto the second floor deck. He fell approximately 6 to 8 feet, fracturing his left arm and breaking three ribs.
An employee's ring finger became caught and was smashed in a pinch point while adjusting forklift tines.
An employee was installing two jumpers on a double dead end when an arc flash occurred, burning the employee's arms and upper chest.
An employee was placing a fiberglass beam down to be bolted to the concrete when his left ring finger was caught between the beam and concrete, amputating the fingertip.
After an employee cleared jammed material from inside a slicing machine, the machine cycled and amputated the employee's right thumb and index finger.
While completing maintenance activities on an HVAC unit, an employee fell approximately 10 feet from the roof and fractured the left hip, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cleaning an air handling unit when his hand was caught between a pulley and a belt, partially amputating his left middle fingertip.

An employee was installing drywall to the exterior of a building while working from a boom lift that was approximately 40 feet from the ground. A coworker got on the service elevator and went up.  The elevator made contact with the bottom of the boom cage, causing the employee's face to hit the rails of the cage. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured jaw.

An employee was using an electric impact wrench to tighten bolts used to secure the lifts frame. He was found unresponsive with his head caught between the frame of the lift and the frame of the building. He underwent surgery for head trauma.
An employee fell approximately 25 feet off a roof, breaking his shoulder and ribs.

An employee was installing tile flooring on the second floor of a new construction residential townhouse. The employee brought a generator inside the townhouse and left it on the first floor with the front door open, but the door was later closed by the wind. The employee started to feel nauseous and dizzy and eventually lost consciousness. He was hospitalized with carbon monoxide poisoning.
An employee slipped on the sidewalk and struck her head on the concrete surface, resulting in a concussion and hospitalization.
An employee climbed over a screen gable over a pool in order to pull a tarp down. He slipped because the aluminum was icy and fell on top of a deck chair resulting in a lower back injury.

An employee was tightening bolts while standing on a 10-foot step ladder when the ladder tipped over. The employee fell approximately 10 feet to the concrete floor below, suffering skull, rib, and vertebra fractures.

An employee was preparing the floor slab of a parking garage for abrasive, sand-injected water blasting. During this process, an electrical conduit was uncovered. Not wanting the water associated with the blasting process to accidentally enter the PVC conduit, the employee attempted to seal the conduit with tape. The employee then contacted a live, energized electrical conduit and was electric shocked, suffering nerve damage and leg pain.
An employee's right-hand ring fingertip/first knuckle was amputated by an excavator bucket while the employee was taking measurements under a tank.
While an employee was climbing a scaffold, his foot slipped and he fell to the ground, breaking his foot and lacerating his head.

An employee was using a gas-powered cutoff saw to cut a 2-foot section out of a 42-inch diameter storm drain pipe when the saw kicked back. The saw blade struck and lacerated the employee's right facial cheek, requiring hospitalization.
An employee's fingers were crushed while fabricating metal (e.g., bending metal flashing) on a brake press machine. The employee was hospitalized overnight for surgery.
An employee was descending from a stationary ladder when he missed a rung and fell about 6 feet, fracturing his left tibia. He required surgery.

An employee was nailing decking on a first floor deck. The plywood was icy, and the employee slipped and fell with his nail gun in hand.  As he fell, the nail gun discharged a long nail that punctured his right knee.
While a backhoe was pulling dirt into a hole, it caught the wire on a nearby barbed wired fence. The backhoe pulled the wire out, causing it to strike and break the leg of a nearby employee.
A employee slipped and fell on ice, fracturing his right femur and requiring surgery.
While demolishing a precipitator, an employee fell approximately 33 feet to the ground below, suffering wrist and leg fractures and tissue injuries.

A masonry contractor was helping to move a mattress in a home owner's 2nd floor condo.  The masonry contractor did not observe that a glassed area had the glass wall removed and he fell through the open area.  The employee was taken to hospital for a broken collarbone, three broken ribs and a head injury.
An employee was cutting a 2x4 to size for framing. The employee was standing in approximately 1" of water on a concrete slab. The employee was shocked.
An employee was installing an electrical fixture when he fell from a 16-foot fiberglass A-frame ladder to the concrete floor below. He hit his head on the floor and was hospitalized.
At approximately 08:30, an employee slipped on ice, fell, and broke his ankle while walking from a building to a truck to gather tools needed for the job. He was hospitalized.

An employee was working to replace a lightning arrester( electrical distribution work). When the tool he was using came in proximity to an energized jumper coming from the top of the lightning arrester, an arc flash occurred.

An employee was installing snap ties on the outside of a three-story house's masonry wall when his coworker on an aerial lift was coming down and knocked the employee off the scaffold platform. The employee fell 6 feet to the ground, dislocating his shoulder and fracturing his proximal humerus. He was hospitalized.
On or about January 28, 2016 at 8:15 am, an employee performing stripping operations fell approximately 10 feet.  The employee sustained a fracture to a thoracic vertebra.
An employee was knocking the steel wedge out of the rigging. As he struck the steel wedge (10lb. 6 in. long), it shot out, struck the employee in the face, and  fractured it.
An employee was installing cable from the utility pole to a house and fell off of an extension ladder fracturing vertebrae as a result of the fall.

An employee was attempting to center a winch drum spacer on a lathe. The winch drum spacer flipped off the lathe and fell onto his right foot resulting in injury. The employee sustained a contusion on upper part of right leg and had four toes amputated.

Employees were removing equipment and debris from a roof. The Skytrak was raised for equipment and debris to be placed on the forks. The injured employee grabbed the forks. The forks came down while the employee was holding on to them and smashed his left hand fingers between the forks and the catwalk.
An employee was injured on 1/29/16 when the crane gave away underneath soft ground and pinned the employee's right leg underneath the outrigger. The wooden mat was broken.
An employee was preforming drywall taping and working from a baker scaffold when he fell off, breaking three ribs and potentially puncturing a lung.
Employee was hospitalized after burning his legs while welding structural steel. Hot slag caught the acetylene tank on fire.

The employee had completed the work operation and was shutting down the crane.  The employee was asked to check the control switch located on the crane's turn table. The employee's finger got caught in a slot where the switch was located and the crane engaged and started to turn. The employee's left middle finger was crushed. It was later amputated at the first knuckle at the hospital.

Three workers were setting a cast iron tree grate in place. Two lifted the grate while a third placed wooden block underneath to prop it up. When the grate lowered, a worker's finger was caught between the grate and the block, resulting in the amputation of the right little finger from the fingertip to the second knuckle.

An employee was descending an air enclosure roof when his foot slipped and he fell off the roof. He hit structural steel as he fell, fracturing his upper left arm and left shoulder and suffering brain bleeding.
An employee was working on the electrical circuit on pole lights when the equipment arced, burning his hands and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was holding a concrete form stake when a coworker struck and crushed the employee's right thumb with a sledgehammer.

An employee was walking on a catwalk to inspect the current job progress. While inspecting bolts, the employee fell 20 to 25 feet through the grating into a 2-feet-deep pool of water. The employee sustained rib and vertebrae fractures, a heel fracture, and a punctured buttock.
An employee was attempting to connect the cables for an LED light fixture when he received an electrical shock, suffering burns to his hands. He was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was working from the fifth floor, installing a 28'/2300-pound window with a hoist. The employee's finger got caught underneath the window and was partially amputated, requiring surgery.
An employee was on a lift installing sheet metal at a job site when he fell off the lift and landed between two pieces of equipment, breaking his ribs.
An employee fell approximately 6 feet while dismantling scaffolding at a jobsite and was hospitalized with a fractured right foot and lower back injury that required surgery.

An employee was helping to install ground pipe in a deep trench. He was outside of the trench box on top of the 60-inch, pre-cast pipe form and bracing pipe. A back hoe operator was attempting to move the trench box when a portion of it made contact with the employee's left foot, crushing and breaking it.
An employee was descending a 12-foot attic ladder hen he slipped and fell approximately 4 feet, breaking his left leg below the knee.
An employee was stepping from a ladder to the metal roof when he slipped and fell 11 feet, fracturing his left femur. He was not connected to a fall protection system at the time.

A worker cut a 4-foot x 6-foot x 5-inch piece of concrete slab from the operating floor, which fell toward the barricaded area in the basement. As the concrete slab fell, it struck a piece of equipment and was deflected to an area outside of the barricade. The slab then struck an employee standing nearby, lacerating the employee's leg.
On 2/1/2016, at 8 a.m., an employee was holding the end of a beam being lowered by a crane. The beam bumped into a column and pinned the employee's hand, amputating the pinky finger.

An employee was loading materials while standing on a flatbed trailer. The employee stepped backwards off the flatbed trailer and fell 4 feet to the ground, sustaining bruising and possible spine damage.
An employee fell 10 feet off an unprotected edge and fractured his left ankle.
An employee's left ring finger was partially amputated after being struck by a sledge hammer while the employee was repairing a 34-inch pipeline.
