An employee was laying a metal deck with another employee when he lost his footing and fell approximately 20 feet over the leading edge. He suffered several fractures to the back and neck bones and a gash on the side of his head.
An employee was climbing up or down a scaffold ladder when he fell approximately 14 feet and broke his leg.
An employee was standing on a 10-foot A-frame ladder, changing a motor inside a dropped ceiling's air handler. He fell off the ladder, fracturing his right upper arm and his right wrist.

An employee was helping to install a marine loading arm.  As he stood near the base of the loading arm, the weight shifted and struck him, causing his right-hand index finger to be caught and amputated between the base of the loading arm and a piece of pipe.
An employee was walking down a flight of stairs to the basement while carrying equipment in his hands. He tripped and fell fracturing five ribs and chipping vertebrae.

A worker was pressure washing concrete slab. The hose became kinked. During the process of un-kinking the hose the spray wand slipped and made contact with the worker's hand just enough to actuate the water spray. The nozzle which was very close to the worker's right leg sprayed high-pressure water into the worker's calf. The action caused a pin-prick sized hole that was quickly filled with water and air. The laborer was admitted to the local hospital.

The employee was working on an elevated platform (scaffolding) removing form boards from a new concrete structure.  The employee was tied off to a form board that had been taken apart by mistake.  The form board fell 15'-20' to the ground pulling the employee to the ground with it. The employee suffered a fractured leg.
An employee was finishing up concrete when concrete got into the top of the employee's boots and burned both feet.

An employee was delivering sheet rock to a new residential home. While unstrapping a metal cart from the truck, it rolled off and struck the employee on the head and shoulder. The employee was hospitalized.

A crane operator was stacking concrete slabs. A slab on the stack slid and struck another employee on the ground in the left thigh area. The employee was hospitalized due to deep laceration to the thigh requiring surgery.

While performing pump repairs, an employee got his right middle finger pinched between the coupling extender on the pump and the discharge piping flange resulting in amputation of the right middle fingertip.
An employee was working on a Ferris wheel because a sweep was not lining up properly.  As the crew was working to line it up, it let go, crushing the employee's fingers on the right hand.

In the afternoon of February 4, 2016, two employees were 
lifting a concrete pole onto a truck using a crane when another concrete pole on the ground rolled away from the stack and struck one of the employee's lower left leg and foot. The employee was hospitalized for medical treatment.

An employee working from a ladder at an elevation of approximately 8' fell from the ladder onto a carpeted floor and struck his head and back.  He was admitted to the hospital with a skull fracture and cranial bleeding.

The employee was working from the 6th rung of an 8' ladder.  He removed a strap from a pipe containing conduit which had tension on it.  When he removed the strap, the force slung him off of the ladder and onto the concrete below. The employee sustained a fractured hip.

The injured employee was working with other employees to rig and lift a bridge beam for transport. The bridge beam was frozen in the ice/ground.  When the beam was dislodged it struck the employee resulting in a crushing injury to his shoulder.
An employee was cutting metal with a saw and a piece of metal lodged in the employee's eye.

On 2/5/16 at approximately 9:00 a.m., an employee was loading four-inch black pipe onto a truck rack. The employee was securing the pipe into straps and a pipe rolled back onto his hands. The employee was wearing leather work gloves. The pipe crushed his right middle finger on his right hand resulting in a hairline fracture and laceration requiring sutures. The employee was later hospitalized for treatment of an infection.
While rolling the belt onto or off a pulley, the employee's glove was caught in between the pulley cutting the right pinky.
An employee was operating surveying equipment. A dirt clod rolled down a hill and struck the employee in the back knocking him to the ground. The employee was hospitalized with a back laceration.
An employee was descending a ladder from a roof when the ladder collapsed. The employee fell to the ground and broke his left arm.
An employee slipped and fell 3 to 4 feet off the back of a straight truck while filling up the water tank, suffering broken ribs and a collapsed lung.
An employee was working on a drilling operation. An excavator was lowering a pipe casing onto a stack of casings when the casing shifted, contacting and bruising the employee's right leg.
An employee's left thumb was slammed in the door of a work vehicle, causing an open fracture to the thumb and an amputation of the distal tip. The employee required reattachment surgery.

On February 8, 2016, at approximately 1:00 PM, an employee working on an HVAC unit fell approximately 8 feet into the return case of an air handler unit on the roof of the structure. The employee suffered vertebrae, rib, and scapula fractures, as well as a collapsed lung.

An employee had just poured concrete on the bridge deck and was using a paving machine to move the concrete when the employee slipped back and fell approximately 10 to 11 feet to the lower roadway from the upper bridge level. The employee hit a metal corrugated pipe and fractured the left knee.

An employee was working on top of a steel girder when he stepped down to a concrete bend that was approximately 30 inches beneath the girder and diagram. While climbing down, the employee's retractable locked up, causing the employee to lose his balance, slip, and fall against the girder and diagram, fracturing his left leg.
An employee was hospitalized for knee pain after performing shoring activities.
An employee was climbing a 6-foot ladder while carrying a piece of lumber when he fell, injuring his ribs and lung.
An employee was on a scissor lift when it tipped over onto him and pinned him, breaking bones in his back.

While an employee was laying pipe, a piece of 36" concrete pipe became disconnected from an excavator. The pipe rolled down the slope of the excavation and up against the employee, striking and breaking his lower left leg bones.

While pop riveting awning trim from a single buck scaffold platform, an employee fell approximately 6 feet from the platform onto the concrete below, suffering a head injury. The platform was unguarded at the time.
After installing a light fixture, an employee fell off the ladder, suffering a compression fracture to the lower back and dislocating an elbow.

An employee was unloading the last window from a container when the previously unloaded windows that were stacked against the container fell against his lower leg. He was hospitalized with a broken tibia and required surgery.
An employee was cutting plywood on a table saw when the sawblade amputated his left thumb at the knuckle.

An employee was in the bucket of an aerial lift while it was being repaired. A stabilizing cable broke, the bucket tipped, and the employee fell to the ground. The bucket had been lowered down onto the truck during the repairs. The employee sustained a punctured lung, cracked ribs, and a broken collarbone.
An employee was coming down a ladder. The wind pushed him to the ground, where he tripped on a wire, breaking his left leg.

An employee went on the roof to clean plastic debris. He noticed a piece of plastic by the leading edge of the roof. When he attempted to remove it, he slipped and fell about 13 feet from the leading edge of the roof to hard-packed dirt below, breaking both legs. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.

On or about February 12, 2016, an employee was making a cut to a roof membrane. The HVAC unit hole was uncovered to fit the material around the hole, and the employee fell into the hole through the roof. The employee was hospitalized with right elbow and hip injuries.
An employee slipped and fell hitting his head, resulting in hospitalization.
A valve cap, under pressure, struck an employee in the upper left arm resulting in a fractured arm and flesh loss.

An employee was inspecting the location of a future concrete pour. A gust of wind lifted him and the material he was standing on into the air. When he landed on the ground, bones in the neck, arm, and back were broken.
An employee was cleaning equipment, slipped in the mud, and fractured the right fibula.
An employee was lifting a 50 lb. pipe fitting elbow with another employee and suffered an abdominal hernia rupture on his right side.
An employee was clearing debris from a sloped roof. The employee slipped on a piece of plywood and fell 18 feet to the ground resulting in a broken back.

An employee was struck by a forklift when he was trying to warn the driver that a box was about to fall off the forklift. The forklift ran over the employee's right ankle resulting in the amputation of the foot.

On February 5, 2016, at approximately 11:30am, an employee was delimbing a felled tree on sloped ground using a chainsaw. As the last limb was being cut, the tree began sliding on the snow and the employee's right leg was pinned by the limb resulting in fractures to the tibia and fibula and hospitalization.

An employee was operating a table saw cutting lumber. A piece of the wood that he was cutting kicked back causing the employee to lose his balance.  His right middle finger struck the saw blade resulting in the loss of bone to the right middle finger.
A third party truck driver was loading natural gas condensate into his tank truck when an explosion occurred and injured the driver. He was hospitalized for burns to both hands and his back.
An employee got off a ladder to move the ladder and while pulling the ladder towards himself, the ladder struck his right shin resulting in a contusion.
An employee was walking up a conveyor belt and fell resulting in a head injury.

An employee was jacking up a floating roof in an above ground storage tank. The extension on the bottle jack slipped and struck the employee resulting in stitches to the ear and a concussion. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell while installing roof sheathing. The employee suffered a concussion and broken ribs.

An employee climbed up a 35' X 5' X 5' rebar column to attach the forms.  He cut loose two supports.  The column began to slowly roll and fell catching the employee's foot. The employee was admitted to the hospital for a contusion on the right foot.
An employee suffered a finger amputation after his finger was injured from a drill bit attached to a roto hammer.  The drill had accidently been actuated as employees were attempting to move it.
An employee was putting rebar in a down cell in a block wall. The employee was electric shocked when the rebar he was working with arced with a power line.
While ripping a piece of 2x4 on a table saw, an employee amputated the tip of the right thumb.
An employee was working on a roof.  The employee was in the process of moving roof trusses when he fell 9 feet to a lower level and broke his left leg.

On Tuesday, February 16, 2017, at approximately 12:30PM, an employee was in the process of washing out the salt spreader on the rear of a truck. The employee sustained fractures to his right arm and was hospitalized when his hand was caught in the moving spreader mechanism.
An employee was lowering a scissor lift with the remote control. His left thumb got pinched in the lift resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was working on a ladder and felt it wobble. He jumped off the ladder resulting in a broken leg.

A cart had been loaded with 2"x4"s.  The cart has two wheels in the middle, front, and back on both sides.  The day shift had used half of the lumber, pulling the lumber from one side.  Approximately 40 2"x4"s remained stacked on the other side of the cart.  The second shift employee started to move the cart to his saw, where he cuts the lumber to specified lengths.  As the employee was moving the cart, the cart fell over onto the employee's legs breaking both legs below the knee.
While using a core drilling machine, an employee's hand was caught in the core drilling cylinder, amputating the right index finger.
Two workers were passing windows from an elevated trash box on a forklift to a balcony and fell approximately 3 stories, suffering back and head injuries.
An employee was exiting a parked vehicle on the jobsite, slipped on ice, and fell onto concrete. The employee suffered a concussion and a compression fracture to the back.

An employee was traveling from the second floor to the first floor and was about halfway down the first run of stairs toward the platform when he fell and landed with his face hitting the platform wall.  The employee suffered two fractured ribs, a punctured lung, a shoulder injury and a dislodged lower tooth.

An employee was cleaning out trash from the bed of a truck at the PSO yard.  He stepped back and turned to throw out some trash and stepped on a plastic bottle. As he slipped and fell, his foot was caught between a fiberglass pole and the bed of the truck, breaking his leg.
An employee was working from a 10 foot ladder and fell to the ground cracking two vertebrae in the neck.

On or about February 18, 2016, an employee was settling trusses while standing on the top plate of the building being constructed. Due to high winds, a 100-foot section of approximately 50 trusses fell and knocked the employee off the top plate.  The employee fell 16 feet to the frozen dirt ground, suffering a broken wrist, shattered elbow, and head injury requiring stitches. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was installing gas pipes when his arm was caught between two pipes, resulting in vascular injuries.
An employee went into the silo to make adjustments on the grain sweep. A coworker did not know that the employee was in the silo and turned on the grain sweep, which lacerated the employee's leg.
An employee's left pinky fingertip was amputated by a digger truck's rope drum, which was being used to pull a truck that was stuck.
While performing wood framing, an employee fell from a 10-foot ladder to the concrete floor, breaking ribs.

An employee was standing on top of a masonry wall, removing the wall forms, when a wall form fell. The employee's personal protective equipment was attached to the form. As the form fell, it also brought the employee down 10 feet to the ground below, crushing the employee's left hand, fracturing the spine, and causing lacerations.

On February 19, 2016, an employee was cutting a steel beam with a grinder when the grinder jumped out of the cut and contacted the employee above the knee. He was hospitalized overnight with a right leg laceration.
An employee was cutting pieces of wood using a table saw. A piece of wood slipped and his right hand contacted the blade, cutting three fingers.
An employee was cutting a piece of wood with a table saw when the blade lacerated his right index finger, requiring stitches.
Two employees were installing a protective goal post for overhead power lines when the post made contact with the energized line, causing the employees to receive an electrical shock.
An employee was using a shovel to perform foundation work when a skid steer backed up and ran over the employee's leg, breaking it.
An employee attached a tagline on some pipe casing. When the pipe was picked up, his foot was tangled in the tagline, ultimately breaking his ankle.

An employee installing gutters on a house fell off an extension ladder that was sitting on a porch roof. He then rolled off the porch roof to the ground and was hospitalized with a compression fracture of the lower back.

An employee was unloading steel poles from a trailer. The employee was on the trailer during the rigging, trying to locate the center gravity of the poles. Once he located the center gravity, he went to the other side of the trailer to get off. He lost his balance, slipped, and grabbed one of the rebar supports on the trailer. At that time, the operator began lifting the pole upward. As the pole was lifted, it swung toward the injured employee and caught his right hand between the rebar support and the steel pole. His right middle fingertip was amputated and his right index finger was lacerated.

An employee was returning to her work area carrying a case of water bottles on her right shoulder.  She was walking down a catwalk and came to a 4-step elevation change. As she walked down the steps, her left foot became entangled in some air hose, causing her to lose her balance.  As she stepped down with her right foot to regain her balance, she stepped on more air hose, which caused her ankle to roll. When she brought her left foot back up, all of her weight went onto her right ankle. She dislocated her ankle and fractured her tibia and fibula.
An employee using a pneumatic nail gun was shot in the right forearm when the nail came out the back of the gun.

On February 23, 2016, at approximately 10:40 am, an employee and his crew were clearing a powerline right-of-way. A 1/2-inch rope was placed in the tree and held by the foreman. The employee notched and back cut the 26-inch diameter poplar tree, 107 feet in height. Using the 1/2-inch rope, 120 to 150 feet in length, the foreman began tugging on the rope to assist the tree to the ground. Once the tree was safely on the ground, the foreman yelled "clear" and no one answered. The foreman found the employee on the retreat path, face down on the ground, in the opposite direction of the felled tree. The employee was rolled over and his face was covered with blood. He suffered face and head injuries and was hospitalized.

An employee had just delivered a load of steel to the galvanizing plant to be coated, and a load of galvanized steel had been loaded onto his trailer for the return trip. He climbed onto the flatbed trailer, positioned the tie down straps used to secure the load, and was climbing down the rear step/bumper to get off the trailer when he slipped and fell, breaking his right leg.
On February 23, 2016, an employee was trying to access the roof when he fell approximately 11 feet from an extension ladder to the lower roof level. He dislocated his kneecap and required surgery.
An employee fell from a screen plant and suffered neck and back fractures, requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee bent down to pick up a post while installing a silt fence when a snake bit his finger.
An employee was working on overhead powerlines when an arc flash occurred, causing second degree burns to his face, neck, and arm.
An employee was working on building trusses when he fell 12 to 14 feet from the truss. He suffered a brain injury and broke his neck and ribs.
An employee was replacing a pyrite gate on a pulverizer when the gate slipped and struck the end of the employee's left index finger, resulting in a partial amputation.

An employee was struck by a suspended load (2x4) that was being hoisted by a crane. The material fell approximately six stories onto the employee's back, breaking ribs and a shoulder blade and puncturing the employee's lung.
An employee was putting down plywood to cover a hole when he fell through the hole and fractured his skull. He was hospitalized.

An employee was trying to unclog an asphalt distribution (spreading) machine. When he opened up a porthole, the pressurized pump caused hot liquid asphalt to shoot out and burn the palm of his right hand.
An employee was removing the existing membrane from the roof deck when he fell approximately 25 feet through metal decking to the ground below. He suffered a broken arm and broken facial bones.
An employee was adjusting a beam inside the nacelle when his finger was pinched between the beam and the beam bracket. His left ring fingertip was amputated.
An employee fell 20 feet from a scaffold and broke the right foot.

An employee was cleaning mud from a roadway while a trackhoe was being operated nearby. A car came over the hill in the same lane as the employee. When the employee stepped out of the way, he moved in the direction of the turning trackhoe. His overalls were caught by the track, which pulled his left leg underneath. His left leg below the knee had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was trying to put plastic up on a building to protect it against the elements. The wind caught the plastic and knocked the employee off the 12-foot ladder. The employee suffered a hairline fracture of the lower back.
An employee was in a bucket running wire from a transformer when they received burns across the upper torso and hands due to an arcing power line.
An employee was cleaning out the bed of his dump truck while holding the tailgate with his right hand when the tailgate came down on his right middle finger, amputating the fingertip (no bone loss).
An employee fell approximately 15 feet through the floor of an enclosed scaffold structure while working on a bridge. The employee suffered a broken leg, wrist, and arm and was hospitalized.
An employee fell off a ladder and broke two ribs.

An employee was holding a 2 x 4 stake while a coworker hit it with a sledgehammer. The coworker struck the employee's right index finger with the sledgehammer, breaking bones in the employee's right hand.

An employee was on the first floor when he was called down to the basement level to assist with a repair. Coworkers had drained water from a boiler into a sump pit, which was approximately 3 feet deep and 2 feet in diameter. There was no cover on the pit, and the sump pump had trouble keeping up with the volume of water being added and quickly filled up. When the employee came down from the first floor to help, he fell into the sump pit and suffered second and third degree burns on his lower torso, legs, and hands. He was hospitalized.
An employee missed a rung while climbing a fixed ladder and fell 15 feet. He suffered multiple right leg fractures and shattered his right ankle.
An employee was loading materials into a storage room. His finger was caught on the hinge side of a door resulting in a fingertip amputation.

While descending a ladder with a nail gun, an employee tripped over the nail gun hose and started to fall. As he tried to prevent the fall, his finger activated the trigger and he was shot in the right leg.
On or about February 29, 2016, one employee was injured when he disconnected his PFAS to untangle the line and fell from the roof area breaking a leg.

An employee was loading a pallet into a pick up truck using a forklift. The employee placed the pallet onto the tailgate of the pick up truck, then got off the forklift and proceeded to push the pallet into the pick up. The forklift moved forward slowly and a fork struck the employee in the arm and pinned his arm. The employee suffered two cracked ribs and a fractured forearm.
An employee working on a residential roof slipped and fell to the ground, injuring his knee and back.
An employee was surveying an area for future work while standing on an 8-foot A-frame ladder. He fell from the ladder, breaking his ribs and puncturing his lung.
An employee was working on a crane, fixing a hydraulic line. The employee fell from the crane to the concrete ground, suffering head injuries and a fractured clavicle.

An employee was working with a sewer jetter to clean a sewer line and the jetter became stuck. The employee attempted to remove it from the sewer line when the high-pressure dirty water shot into his right index finger, causing an infection.

An employee was working early in the morning at a residential construction site, using a ladder to reach a gable to install corners finishing work. He stepped onto the icy roof, slipped, and fell approximately 10 to 12 feet to the ground, crushing/fracturing his vertebrae.

An employee was stenciling a piece of 4" 30' drill pipe inside a racking system. A second pipe was kicked over onto the racking system and rolled down the table, striking the employee from behind. This caused the employee's face to impact the stationary pipe in front of him that he was stenciling. He sustained a fractured jaw.

An employee was wearing a full harness, shock absorbing lanyard, rope, and anchor while working on the second floor roof. The employee slipped on a peel-and-stick felt pad and fell. He landed on his feet and fractured his right hip. He had 38 feet of rope laid out and the roof height was 23 feet.
An employee was pushing a cart of plywood when a strong wind blew the plywood over, causing the cart to strike and fracture the employee's left ankle.
An employee installing an ice and water shield slipped and fell 30 feet, breaking two ribs.
An employee fell through an opening on a permanent structure, a compressor, suffering a pelvic fracture.
An employee's fingertip was amputated while stretching a cable.

An employee was checking on a mini-excavator being worked on by a subcontractor. As he walked around the mini excavator, a hydraulic failure caused the extended boom to drop and strike the employee in the upper back area, cracking vertebrae.
An employee was trying to replace a fiberglass grate when the grate slipped from his hands and fell on his right leg.
An employee was clearing a jam on a powder-actuated tool when the tool discharged. The actuating piston struck the employee's right palm, requiring surgery.

An employee went to check wires on a pull box using a ladder. The employee contacted live wires, was shocked, and fell approximately 4 feet off the ladder. He landed on his back and hit his head on the ground, suffering bleeding on his brain.
On March 3, 2016, at approximately 3:15 p.m., an employee fell 32 feet from a roof while installing metal panels. The employee suffered broken ribs and a broken pelvis, as well as a hand laceration.
An employee was operating an auger and amputated the three middle fingers on the left hand.
An employee was hit/crushed by a motor grader's rear differential while the operator was backing up. The employee suffered a fractured back, three broken ribs, and a broken shoulder/collarbone.
Three workers were raising the structural wall frame of a single family house when the wall fell onto an employee, fracturing his upper leg.
An employee was adjusting the location of a barrier on a work site when the barrier fell on his foot, fracturing some bones.
An employee fell from a ladder and fractured three vertebrae while installing home TV cable.

An employee was hanging 8x8 tubes from the ground level. The first tube was set in place and the second tube was being placed. The column leaned out and separated from the wall, causing the tube to slip off the column. The steel tube hit the employee's forehead and knocked the employee against a wall.
An employee was finishing drywall seams on the fourth floor corridor ceiling when he fell to the concrete below. He suffered a right-side facial laceration and broken right arm.
An employee was cutting in wall blocking and amputated a finger with the saw.
An employee's left hand was caught between a pontoon and a rigging chain, amputating the left-hand index finger at the first digit.
An employee was working off an extension ladder when the bottom of the ladder slipped and the employee fell off, landing on his feet and injuring his back.

An employee and coworkers were setting up the small mortar mixer on a concrete masonry unit to allow the mortar to be poured into a wheelbarrow. As he was lifting the mixer, it moved forward, causing him to lose his grip. It slipped out of his hand and pinched his fingers between the top of the concrete masonry unit and the bottom of the back of the mixer, amputating his right index fingertip.
An employee's left middle finger was pinched between decking support, requiring hospitalization for surgery.

An employee was attempting to reach and adjust a chain that was holding up one of the very large bags in the baghouse. The employee crawled on top of the bags, which are held in place by angle irons 11 inches apart. While crawling toward the bag, the employee lost his grip and fell through the 11-inch gap. He fell 37 feet to the ground, breaking a foot and fracturing a vertebra.
A crane operator was moving a load, which was secured by choker slings. An employee on the ground was struck in the head by the pole/rod while the lift was taking place, fracturing his skull.
An employee was framing a residence when he fell off a scaffold to the ground, breaking his ribs and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using a router to cut a groove in a panel when his index finger went into the opening on the router. The bit pulled his glove in and his right index finger was amputated.
An employee was installing lift straps when he slipped and his hand entered the bearing point of a mill and bearing roll. His left thumb broke.
An employee was repairing a roof when he fell approximately 30 feet to the ground, puncturing his lung.
An employee was installing a light fixture from a ladder when he made contact with a live electrical wire. He fell from the ladder and fractured his clavicle.
An employee descending a 28-foot extension ladder misstepped and fell approximately 9 feet to the ground, breaking an ankle.

An employee was working from a 4-foot A-frame ladder when the soffit on which he was working de-stabilized and fell, knocking the ladder and employee to the ground. He broke four ribs and suffered a partially collapsed left lung.

Two employees were operating a manual, foot-operated shear to cut aluminum sheet metal. The injured employee was helping to hold down the sheet metal when the second employee operated the shear, amputating the injured employee's right index and middle fingertips.
While replacing roof sheet metal, an employee fell approximately 26 feet from the roof, to the top of a forklift, and then to the concrete ground, suffering a broken leg.
An employee's right-hand pinky fingertip was amputated when an equipment facer fell.
An employee's left thumb was amputated while the employee was fixing the railing of a flatbed truck.

An employee was pulling a nail with a pair of 6" channel lock pliers when the nail broke and released from the pliers. A nail fragment went under the employee's safety glasses and punctured the globe of the employee's left eye.

An employee was holding a railroad crossing gate for a vehicle to get on the railroad. The vehicle struck the gate and the gate fell on his finger. His left ring finger was lacerated and the fingertip was eventually amputated.

An employee was operating a winch on a barge when the rigging came free and hit the protective cage, breaking the cage loose. The cage hit the employee, lacerating his forehead and causing multiple facial fractures. The was hospitalized.

The employee was picking up hand tools and materials from around a drilling rig when he was struck in the head by a falling drilling rod and knocked unconscious. He suffered a head and neck vertebra injury.
An employee's finger was smashed in a car door in the parking lot. His fingertip was amputated.

Workers were removing a load of rebar from the jobsite with a rough terrain forklift when the load of rebar shifted. An employee on the ground was struck by the falling load and ended up falling onto cribbing, fracturing the right ring finger, left pelvis, and tailbone. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was using a pressure washer to clean a forklift. The pressure washer lost pressure, so the employee walked around the pressure washer to try and see what was wrong. At that time, the "caps" blew off of the heater element on the pressure washer, striking the employee in the jaw and fracturing it.

On or about March 9, 2016, an employee was working with an internal combustion machine in the basement of a new construction residential house when he collapsed. The employee was overexposed to carbon monoxide and hospitalized.
An employee was installing roofing materials when he lost his footing, tripped, and fell onto an asphalt buggy. He was hospitalized with burns to his arm.
An employee fell to the ground from an extension ladder that was 5-feet high when the ladder kicked out from under him. He broke his right foot.
An employee was working from a mid-stand ladder that was hooked to a cable when the cable broke. The employee fell to the ground and suffered lower vertebrae fractures, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was removing rigging grabbers/biters for a wall panel when his finger was grabbed by the equipment, causing a finger injury.

An employee and coworkers were removing rigging from a steel I-beam. As they were freeing the straps from under the load, one of the straps became caught under the beam. The upward force of the strap caused the beam to tip over, pinning the injured employee's foot underneath it. He was hospitalized with a broken right ankle.

An employee was helping his foreman crank an electrical generator. The generator's pull starter started whipping around and broke off from the motor's plastic cover. As he tried to turn off the kill switch, the pull starter wrapped around his left thumb and amputated it. He was wearing leather gloves at the time of the incident.
An employee was climbing down a ladder inside a home when his right ear hit a shelf on the wall and started bleeding. He was hospitalized.

On 3/10/16, at 6:15 a.m., an employee went up a ladder to unlock a hatch and access the roof for work. He unlocked and opened the hatch, saw that the ladder was not extended 3 feet above, and went back down to readjust it. He lost his footing and fell 8 to 10 feet, breaking his left leg and right heel. He was hospitalized.
An employee was pinched between a trailer truck and a 40-yard dumpster after the trailer rolled from where it was parked.  He suffered a right thigh laceration and a right shoulder strain.

An employee was placing mechanical insulation on a storm drain pipe when the employee fell from a 10-foot fiberglass step ladder to the concrete floor. The employee suffered a fractured left hip socket, concussion, and head laceration.
An employee fell 12 to 15 feet after his scissor lift was knocked over by falling duct work. He suffered a back injury from hitting the ground.

An employee was operating a sand blaster when the sand blaster whip hose fell. The blast media penetrated the employee's sand blast suit and lacerated the employee's forearm, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cleaning gutters on a residential roof. The employee fell 20 feet off the roof while pulling on a hose that was stuck, dislocating a shoulder and requiring stitches.
An employee was working in an excavation when he was hit by a front loader on both ankles. Both ankles fractured and required hospitalization.
During a drill assembly task, an employee was hooking up wires inside the arm of a drill. The employee stepped over the arm, fell approximately 2 feet, and struck his head on the pavement.

An employee was helping to place a mandrel into a wire reel. The mandrel shot through the hole and pinched the employee's middle finger between the wall and mandrel. The employee's finger was amputated above the first knuckle.

An employee was working from a ladder, installing cable lines to the eave of a roof over a driveway, when he fell off the ladder. He injured his head, pelvis, rib, and arm on his left side and was hospitalized.

An employee was elevating a manlift on the construction site to paint the side of the building. The employee was wearing a safety harness and was tied off in the basket at the time of the incident. The wheels of the lift began to sink in the ground, causing the manlift to tilt over. The lift fell to the ground on its side with the employee tied off in the basket. The employee's right hand broke while trying to brace for the fall.
On March 14, 2016, an employee fell approximately 5 to 6 feet from a baker's scaffold while working on crown molding, breaking his right wrist, fracturing his hip, and fracturing his vertebrae.

An employee was removing the nails securing two scaffolding planks together. A coworker had removed the support beam beneath the scaffold platform. When the employee removed the nail holding the two overlapping scaffold planks together, the planks collapsed, and the employee fell 8 feet to the concrete floor, face first. The employee suffered a broken right upper arm, broken cheek bones, and a broken nose.
A worker was engaged in steel erection activities when he tripped on his life line and fell off the canopy striking his elbow resulting in a broken elbow.
An employee was cutting a roof vent on a steep roof using a hook blade utility knife when he lost his footing. The blade contacted his left arm, severely cutting it to the bone.
An employee was setting floor trusses using a ladder when he fell from the ladder and broke his ribs.
An employee was removing a lineup clamp from a piece of pipe when his finger was caught between the turtle clamp and a metal ring. The tip of his right middle finger was amputated.
An employee fell off a roof that was 10 feet high and fractured both wrists.

An employee was struck by a passenger automobile while performing road construction activities. The employee suffered leg and face injuries, including lacerations, crushing injuries, and bruised bones.
An employee's finger was amputated while cutting wood flooring on a table saw.
An employee was laying brick from a scaffold. The employee stepped off the end of the scaffold and fell to the ground, breaking a wrist and requiring  surgery.
An employee slipped and fell while getting out of a vehicle, suffering a bruised spleen.

An employee was inspecting demolition work that was completed at the end of the day when he was struck by a piece of structural steel, lacerating and crushing a toe on his right foot. He was hospitalized.

An employee was cutting 2x6 lumber used to frame the exterior of a building. He had the lumber stacked on saw horses and was using a cordless saw to 
trim it. After he completed the cut, a small piece 
of the wood became lodged inside the saw guard, causing the guard to become stuck 
in an open position. Not knowing that the guide was stuck, he set the saw down by 
grabbing it with his left hand. With the combination of the guide being stuck and the 
blade still in motion, the moving saw blade made contact with and amputated his left middle finger.

On 3/18/2016, an employee was connecting two sheet metal sheets to finish an enclosure. While he was sliding the sheet into the interlocking system, a chain came loose and caught his left ring finger with the sheet metal. He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was driving a forklift, traveling to his next pick-up, when the road embankment gave way beneath his tires and caused the forklift to turn over. He broke nine ribs, punctured a lung, and lacerated his forehead and right elbow.
An employee became ill after soldering inside a walk-in refrigeration box. The employee was hospitalized due to heavy metal exposure.
An employee was working on a roof and fell on the same level striking his back on the standing seam roof deck resulting in a back fracture.
An employee walking beside an excavator slipped or stumbled on the dirt track from the excavator, lacerating the left leg.
An employee was power washing exterior windows when the end of the washer tip went across his left hand, lacerating it and requiring surgery to repair a damaged tendon.

An employee was lifting the end section of pipe to help clear an I-beam of a pipe rack. As the crew moved the pipe forward, the employee's left thumb was caught and amputated between the pipe and an I-beam support member.

An employee was installing metal decking when he fell while trying to grab a piece of sheet metal that was elevated by a forklift. He fell approximately 15 feet to a dirt surface and was hospitalized with head and neck trauma.

An employee and a coworker were trying to introduce air into a condensate line to empty it. When the employee went to remove a plug from a valve on the condensate line, hot water splashed onto his left shoulder, arm, and back, causing second degree burns.
On or about March 20, 2016, an employee was operating a track excavator when his leg contacted equipment that contained hydrated lime. He suffered a chemical burn.

An employee was moving a pipe to another pipe to be welded. As the employee was maneuvering out of the way of the moving pipe, he tripped on another pipe that was laying on the ground. He fell onto that pipe and broke his left wrist, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was working with a screw jack when it became stuck. When he tried to move the screw jack, it fell and amputated his left middle fingertip.
An employee was grinding on tack welds when the grinder lost power. As the employee was checking the cord, the grinder restarted and lacerated the employee's left thigh above the knee.
After he had changed a block and adjusted the wire rope in the sheave, an employee's right hand was pulled between the wire rope and the block. His hand was amputated and required hospitalization.
An employee was about to step onto a homeowner's roof when he fell backwards 10 feet resulting in a spinal cord fracture and hospitalization.
An employee in a bucket truck was dismantling powerlines when he was electric shocked, suffering burns to both hands. He was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was lifting an 8" pipe to place it on a pickup truck when the pipe slipped out of his hand and fell on his right index finger. The pipe severed his index fingertip, which had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was pouring cement from a truck when he noticed a hard piece of cement on the conveyor belt. When he attempted to remove the cement, the belt lacerated and broke several of his right-hand fingers.
An employee tripped on a step and fell forward. When he fell, his left hand entered tar and received burns.

An employee was performing maintenance on a horizontal grinder and had the guard in an upright position to access the work area. A strong gust of wind displaced the guard and it fell on the employee's head, resulting in torn neck ligaments. The employee was wearing a hard hat at the time of the incident.
An employee was working on the roof. He lifted up a wooden hole cover and stepped forward into a roof hole, falling 15 feet to the concrete floor below. He fractured his elbow, vertebra, and pelvis.

On or about 3/23/2016, at approximately 9:30, an employee was working from a 15-foot fiberglass extension ladder to install satellite TV cable at a residential home. The employee was drilling holes to install clips that hold the cable to the side of the building. While working from the ladder, the employee fell approximately 15 feet to the concrete below, suffering injuries to both legs/feet that required hospitalization.

While installing vinyl siding on a roof, an employee fell approximately 8 feet to the lower ground level, sustaining compound fractures to the right leg, tibia, and fibula. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was conducting a fire wall inspection while working from a ladder. While descending the ladder, the employee lost their footing and fell against an adjacent countertop and then to the floor, breaking ribs.

An employee on a ladder was caulking underneath eaves when the ladder slipped and the employee fell. The employee was approximately 12 to 14 feet from the lower level at the time.  The employee was hospitalized with a partially collapsed lung and fractured wrist.

A front-end loader bucket on an articulated wheel loader was transferring tools to another part of the work site. The operator of the wheel loader inadvertently released the end loader, which fell on top of and broke an employee's left foot. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was repairing a leak on a roof when he fell 45 feet to the ground, injuring his torso and pelvis and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was changing the light bulb beneath the diving board in a drained swimming pool. The employee then slipped along the sloping wall and fell onto a cinder block located on the bottom of the pool, suffering a possible broken hip.
The employee was over head structure welding from a scissor lift at the height of approximately 18 feet. His head became caught between the scissor lift railing and the structure.

An employee was helping to move a generator with fold-out handles off the back of a truck. His index finger was caught in the pinch point between the handle and frame of the generator, amputating the distal end of his finger. He was wearing gloves at the time.

An employee was clearing the inside of a vacuum hose of accumulated debris that was interfering with the suction force. Once the employee cleared the vacuum hose, the suction force grasped the employee's right arm. The employee's right arm and hand were injured.
A piece of metal framing fell off a cart and struck an employee in the face.
While core drilling on a second floor balcony, an employee was struck by the drill and fell 12 feet to the concrete floor below, suffering broken arms.
An employee was operating an asphalt machine when the machine caught fire. He attempted to turn it off and received burns on his face and arms.

An employee was installing siding on a house and stepped from one side of a scaffold to the edge of a 2 x 12 platform on another scaffold. He lost his balance and fell on his back, and the platform then landed on his face. He suffered a laceration above his left eyebrow and a back injury.
An employee stepped into an improperly covered hole and fell (approximately 3 feet), breaking his right arm.
An employee's hand was on the edge of a gang box when a coworker closed the box on the employee's finger, partially amputating it.
An employee fell from the roof to the ground while installing rubber membrane roofing, breaking the right hand and fracturing the right hip.

An employee was standing on a drill rig and stepped on the flight of an auger to pull the swing radius barricade tape into position. The auger tilted over and hit the employee's hand, which was positioned on the counterweight of the drill rig. The employee's left index finger was lacerated and fractured.
An employee was loading the wooden scaffold system into the truck and got a splinter. The employee removed the splinter. The wound became infected and the employee was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee working on a concrete form slipped and fell on top of a bolt. The employee reinjured a stomach hernia and was hospitalized.
Employees were taking down a scaffold and the scaffold collapsed. An employee suffered a broken left ankle and wrist and a fractured right knee.
An employee was performing maintenance on a machine when a finger contacted the belt and pulley resulting in a fingertip amputation with bone loss.
An employee was walking down a hallway when 1,200 pounds of stacked drywall fell on him and broke his ankle.

An employee was torch cutting anchor bolts from the anchor plate of a stand-alone jib crane. As the employee cut the last of the anchor bolts, the approximately 10-foot-high round column with a 10-foot-long jib fell over onto a second employee standing nearby. The second employee was hospitalized with a fractured lower leg and lacerations to the back, neck, forehead, and leg.
An employee was helping to work on an electrical panel when the panel arc flashed. The employee suffered burns over 65% of his body and was hospitalized.
An employee cleaning out roof gutters in an aerial lift contacted the overhead powerlines, receiving second and third degree burns to his hands.

At approximately 2:00 p.m., on 3/30/16, an employee was climbing down from a one-story roof using a metal extension ladder. The ladder collapsed, and the employee fell approximately 10 feet to the ground. He was hospitalized with two cracked right-side ribs and four cracked vertebrae.
An employee was lifting a steel diamond plate cover off a lagoon pit when the cover slipped out of his hand and fell on his foot. He slipped and fell, breaking his right hip. He was hospitalized.
An employee was using a drill when the glove was caught in the machine resulting in a pinky finger amputation.
An employee was on an 8-foot step ladder installing fire caulking. The employee tried to re-position, lost his balance, and fell. He was hospitalized overnight with a possible broken pelvis.
The employee was placing a concrete blanket over the newly poured concrete. The wind picked up the blanket causing the employee to fall and break his left leg.
An employee was standing between the inner core and outer jacket of a precast concrete form. The employee was struck by the outer jacket resulting in a broken leg.
The employee was walking down the incline of a bayou on uneven terrain at the jobsite. The employee slipped, tripped, and fell to the ground fracturing his right leg.

An employee was removing whalers of gang form. While positioned on the form, he removed one nut, and the form slid backwards. He was still connected to the form when the form detached from the concrete wall and fell. He fell 8 feet 6 inches with the form to the ground, dislocating his hip and breaking his pelvis. He was hospitalized.

An employee was working from a 6-foot step ladder while using a screw gun to install a panel cover. He lost his footing, knocked the ladder from beneath himself, and fell to the ground, landing on top of the ladder. He suffered a head laceration and wrist injury, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was coming down from a shoring scaffold that he was erecting when he lost his footing and fell 10.5 feet to the ground. He was hospitalized with a fractured back.
An employee was cutting out bricks as part of demolition activities when several courses of brick slid down a steel beam and struck his hand, lacerating and fracturing it.
An employee fell 5 feet off scaffolding and fractured the left wrist. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee climbed a ladder to install a buss over an energized circuit. The buss slipped from the employee's hand and made contact with an energized circuit. An arc flash occurred and the employee's hands, face and chest were burned.
On Monday, April 4, 2016, an employee was hospitalized with a crushing injury to his right leg.
An employee was installing bridging from a scissor lift. He stepped out of the scissor lift and onto the bar joist and fell approximately 16 feet to the concrete below, suffering head trauma.
An employee was cutting a piece of PVC piping with a chop saw. The blade kicked back and struck him in the chest, lacerating it.

While working the boom lift, an employee was struck by a vehicle, suffering a broken knee and nose, bruised head, and injured foot. The employee was wearing a harness, but was not tied off at the time of the incident.
An employee was walking along the roof, conducting an inspection for roof replacement. The employee fell through the roof to the concrete floor, breaking ribs and a wrist.

While spray painting a building, an employee went over a gate and walked off the ledge. The wind had blown a tarp over the area and covered the edge, which could not be seen. The employee fell approximately 50 feet, suffering broken ribs on the right side and a collapsed lung.
An employee was working near a boring tunneling pit when he experienced dizziness and fell through railing, breaking his pelvis and two ribs.

On or about April 5, 2016, at 1:00 p.m., an employee slipped and fell 6 to 8 feet from the fixed industrial ladder to the boiler's eighth elevation platform, suffering compound fractures to the tibia and fibula, as well as metatarsal fractures in both feet. He was hospitalized overnight for surgery.

While performing construction work on an apartment building, an employee's lanyard became tangled. While the employee was attempting to untangle the lanyard, a cantilevered portion of one truss contacted and pushed down another roof truss, causing the employee to lose his footing and fall to the ground. He suffered a broken pelvis, lacerated kidney, lacerated spleen, punctured lung, and broken rib.
An employee was using a drill press to drill a hole in a piece of metal when a metal bur contacted his glove and pulled his finger into the drill press. His finger was amputated.
An employee was pushing push rods through the ceiling to pull wire when he fell off of a 6-foot stepladder and broke his right leg.
On or about April 6, 2016, an employee fell one story down detached stairs to a lower level. The stairs then fell on top of him, breaking his vertebrae.
An employee was climbing down a fixed metal ladder when he lost his footing and/or grip and fell from a height of approximately 5 feet. He fractured his left leg bone beneath the knee.

An employee was helping the operator mount the concrete mold to the side of a slip form paver. He took the transport strands off the mold before the operator had secured the mold to keep it from overturning. The concrete form fell onto the employee fracturing his right ring finger and right leg.
On April 6, 2016, an employee was hospitalized with a broken leg after slipping and falling from a step on a box truck.
An employee was moving bricks on the roof of a one-story house when he lost his balance and fell approximately 10 feet to the ground, suffering left leg trauma.
An employee was fine grading a stone with a shovel when an excavator backed up and pinned the employee's legs. One of his legs was amputated and the other suffered broken bones.

An employee was loading metal plates into the bucket of a Bobcat when the equipment tipped over and struck the employee's foot. The employee suffered a contusion that became infected and required hospitalization.
While descending a step ladder, an employee fell from the lower rungs, injuring his head and torso and breaking two ribs.

An employee was operating a right angle grinder cutting a door jamb when the frame pinched the grinding wheel causing it to kick back and strike the employee in the left bicep.  The employee required surgery to repair the injury and was hospitalized.

On April 7, 2016, an employee was using a walk-behind skid steer machine to pick up steel debris in the basement of the mill.  While picking up a piece of steel with the bucket, the bucket became stuck due to the weight of the steel. The back end of the skid steer raised up and moved the employee's hand to a flange, where the employee's left ring fingertip was amputated.

An employee was inspecting a rotary valve airlock system. He opened a hatch to see if it was plugged and attempted to move some plugged material. He contacted the internal rotating parts, partially amputating three left-hand fingers.
An employee slipped and fell while walking through the bottom of a cyclone (large tube) interior, breaking her ankle.
On 4/7/16, an employee was ripping a 2'x10' board on the floor with a circular saw when the blade amputated a quarter-inch of his left finger.
An employee was repositioning a platform on a construction site when it collapsed to the level below. The employee fell 18 feet and was hospitalized with a broken hip.

An employee was walking up the stairway while carrying a sheet of sheet rock. A gust of wind came and caught the sheet rock like a kite, knocking the injured employee backwards. He lost his balance and fell 5 to 6 feet to the ground, suffering a concussion.
An employee twisted and fractured his ankle while carrying a 4x4 piece of wood on his shoulder.
An employee was working on a transformer when another worker hooked up a generator to the power shop and a back feed caused the employee to receive an electrical shock to his hands and side.
An employee was installing shingles on a two-story house when the employee lost their footing and fell, suffering a broken back and two broken hands.

On April 9, 2016, an employee was sanding a metal part using a stand-alone upright disc sander when the rotating sander part grabbed the metal part and the employee's gloved left thumb. The employee's thumb tip was amputated.

An employee was lowering an irrigation pipe into a trench when the pipe slipped from its rigging. The employee's knee was caught between the falling pipe and a coupler screw, requiring surgery to remove shattered bones from the knee.
An employee fell from a roof to the ground and was hospitalized with a broken right shoulder.
An employee was working from a portable ladder when the employee slipped and fell. The employee's hand became caught on the metal garage door and was lacerated.
An employee opened a manhole for fiber optic installation and immediately began hyperventilating.
An employee and two coworkers were working from a one-frame-high scaffold to remove masonry when the scaffold tipped over to the ground. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured tailbone.

An employee was helping to stabilize an optical comparator on the forks of a forklift when the machine shifted slightly. One corner of the machine slipped off the edge of the fork and hit the employee's leg above the ankle. The employee was hospitalized with a broken leg.

An employee was operating a hand saw while cutting concrete blocks when the blade pinched up and kicked back. The employee lost control of his upper hand, and the machine spun around and came down on his left bicep, lacerating the muscle. He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee and a backhoe operator were leveling the waler on a slide rail system. The backhoe operator flipped the bucket, pushed up the waler, and lost sight contact with the employee. The operator then lost his grip on the bucket, causing the waler to fall.  The waler hit a 8' 2"x4" piece of wood, which jumped up and hit the employee in the face. The injured employee lost consciousness and was hospitalized with a fractured jaw.
An employee was nailing with a nail gun. When a nail hit another nail, it bounced off and struck the employee in the left eye. The employee required surgery for the eye injury.
An employee was cutting 2" by 4" pieces of lumber with a saw when the saw kicked back and partially amputated his left index finger at the second joint.
An employee was unclogging a hose used to spray roofing products when the chemicals in the hose sprayed into the employee's face and eye.
On 4/13/16, an employee slipped on metal decking and fell approximately 10 feet, suffering fractured ribs and a fractured skull.
An employee was egressing from a 12 foot A-frame ladder and slipped and fell. The employee suffered a concussion, a thoracic sprain and minor lacerations.

An employee was helping to take a cable winch system down. The system had been used to pull a heat exchange bundle. The employee's hand was on a poly snatch block when the operator moved the cable. The employee's fingertip was caught between the cable and poly snatch block, resulting in a distal finger amputation.

An employee was working on the ground, backfilling a sidewalk with hand tools. When a nearby excavator operator reached to close a window, the operator's knee struck the bucket control lever. This caused the bucket that was resting on the ground to extend and strike the left foot of the employee who was working on the ground.

On 4/13/16, an employee was working on a road/street/underpass project, installing "mini piles" that consisted of digging holes and inserting rebar, casing, and grout/lye. Grout/lye entered the employee's rubber boot, burning his right foot and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was removing spouts on a decommissioned grain elevator. While the employee was removing the last spout, the grain elevator collapsed and the employee fell approximately 50 feet, suffering a fractured femur, shattered left heel, and facial lacerations.
An employee was using an electric pulley to raise materials up a scaffold when the employee's finger became stuck in the pulley casing, resulting in a partial finger amputation.

An employee was operating a forklift when the forklift lost traction and hit a racking system. When the employee attempted to brace himself, his right hand was caught between the mast and the rack, pinning his right wrist.

An employee was inspecting bridge-cleaning activities and was walking on the 5' 6"-high wood bridge with 14" rails. The employee took a step back, tripped on the rail, and lost balance. The employee fell back off the bridge and suffered neck fractures.

An employee was tossed from an aerial lift/bucket when the silo/pole being lifted broke away and struck the arm of the aerial lift. The employee sustained a broken left ankle and pelvis, a punctured lung, and a concussion.

While crossing a passageway, an employee was struck by a forklift being operated by another worker, suffering a broken tibia and fibula. At the time of the incident, the forklift driver's view was blocked by the lift's jib.

On 4-14-2016, at 12:15 p.m., two employees were dispatched to trench, lay cable, and connect service to an underground pedestal. During the installation, the first employee fell on the second employee, who was preparing the wire to be installed in the pedestal's energized bar. The first employee's left arm made contact with the energized 120-volt bar and was electrocuted. He was hospitalized.

An employee was installing a wood beam as part of the framing for the garage of a new home construction. He was carrying the beam up an A-frame ladder when he lost his balance and fell. The beam fell on top of him. He sustained an eye injury and head laceration.

An employee and coworker were installing a cable lifeline while standing on a scaffold platform. The wall plate of the middle scaffold support broke at the connection point, causing the employee and coworker to fall approximately 12 feet. The employee was hospitalized with a ruptured spleen, requiring surgery.

An employee was canting a pole (moving a power pole from the ground to a standing position) when the rope and cant hook slipped because they were wet. The employee fell backwards and put his hands behind him to catch himself. He landed on his right hand and broke it near the wrist.
An employee was installing a machine gear on an elevator using rigging and chain falls when the employee's left pinky was pinched in the rigging, removing the fingernail and some flesh.
An employee was using a table saw to cut flooring when the saw partially amputated his right-hand ring and middle fingers.

On or about April 15, 2016, an employee was setting trusses on a post frame agriculture building. While coming down from the trusses, the employee fell approximately 11 feet to the ground, sustaining upper and lower back contusions and requiring hospitalization.

Employees were offloading pipe onto a pipe stand. An employee's hand was resting on the pipe stand and when the pipe came down, his hand was pinched between the pipe and the pipe stand, breaking his left index finger.

An employee and coworker were working 10 feet off the ground in an aerial lift. They climbed onto a 4-foot by 5-foot wall landing and were trying to bend a piece of rebar when the injured employee lost his balance and tripped into his coworker. Both employees fell from the wall landing. The injured employee landed on his back, breaking it.
An employee's finger was partially amputated when it was caught in a strap being used to rig pipe.

An employee in an aerial lift was pulling on a come-along to align a piece of steel. The chain broke and struck the employee's leg, knocking him to the floor of the lift. He suffered a broken tibia and fibula.
On April 15, 2016, a cable dropped and hit a concrete surface. A piece of metal from the cable struck an employee and injured the employee's liver.

An employee was attempting to reinstall a concrete pouring conveyor cable on a pulley. The employee operated the conveyor controls to cycle the pulley and re-engage the cable. The employee's thumb tip was pinched and partially amputated between the pulley and cable.

On 4/17/16, an employee was cutting down trees to clear an oil field well pad site. A previously cut tree became caught up in the tree he was currently cutting. The tree then fell down and struck his right leg, breaking it.
An employee was using the freight elevator when his hand was caught between the gate door and the landing door. One finger was crushed, and another was nearly amputated.
An employee crushed his thumb between a door jamb and the railing on a scissor lift while lowering the lift from inside the basket.

Two employees were manually lifting a power cooling fan (approximately 60 pounds) off a stack of units on a pallet. While lowering a unit on a cart, the injured employee lost grip, or the unit shifted, and the employee suffered a left wrist laceration requiring surgery.
An employee's right thumb was crushed while he was trying to prevent an excavator from falling.
An employee was installing metal roofing on a porch roof when the supporting pole collapsed.  The employee fell approximately 10 feet to the ground, fracturing his elbow, pelvis, and two ribs.
On April 19, 2016, an employee fell off a mobile scaffold and was hospitalized for a broken leg.
An employee's hand was caught in a pinch point while raising one of the legs of a cable form, partially amputating the left-hand index finger.

An employee was guiding an 8" PVC water pipe that was attached by a synthetic sling to the bucket of an excavator. The pipe was being set in place when the sling slipped from the pipe. The pipe rolled on the ground and struck the employee in the leg, fracturing the employee's upper thigh bone.

On 04/19/2016, at about 5:00 p.m., an employee was installing new lights on wires when a coworker turned on the breaker. The employee received an electric shock and fell 4 feet off the ladder. He was hospitalized overnight with second-degree electrical burns to one of his hands.
An employee was preparing to pour bridge deck when his pants and subsequently right leg were caught and pulled into the deck finishing machine. He was hospitalized with a fractured right leg.
An employee was at the bottom of a ramp painting a container when a forklift driver backing down the ramp ran over the employee's right leg.

On April 20, 2016, at approximately 6:15 p.m., an employee was helping to move a precast concrete panel on a dry wall cart. The 12' x 60" concrete panel, weighing 1200 pounds, was loaded by forklift onto the cart, which had a load capacity of 3200 pounds. The cart was being navigated through a doorway by two employees. While making a turn, the wheels swiveled. The injured employee reached behind the panel and grabbed the cart to pull it forward.  The panel lost its center of balance and fell forward and onto the employee, fracturing his shoulder, ribs, pelvis, and three vertebrae. He was hospitalized.

An employee was installing coping while working from an extension ladder when the ladder kicked out at the bottom, causing him to fall approximately 10 feet. He hit the ground and broke his left arm and left leg.

An employee was climbing up an extension ladder to caulk a wood soffit which was 10 feet above the ground when he slipped and fell about five feet onto the concrete sidewalk resulting in a left wrist fracture and possible bruising to the left leg.
An employee fell approximately 5 feet off a crane while checking fluid levels and fractured his leg.
An employee was installing a 10" piece of duct over a doorway when his belt was caught on the ladder, causing him to fall and break his wrist and elbow. He was hospitalized.

On 4/20/2016, a piece of plywood sheeting, used in poured concrete construction, fell from a floor above and struck the head of an employee standing on the ground, cracking his hardhat. He was hospitalized with a concussion and lacerations.

An employee was replacing a residential septic system using an excavator.  He placed his left hand on the bucket of the excavator to gain leverage as he moved an object with his foot.  His force against the bucket caused the bucket to move.  The movement of the bucket created a pinch point between the bucket and "thumb" of the bucket. His left ring finger was caught and crushed in the pinch point.
An employee was loading rebar onto the forks of a forklift when the rebar rolled off the forks and struck the employee, breaking the right leg.

An employee was threading some 3-inch conduit when he identified burrs that needed removal.  He was using his channel locks to get rid of the burrs when the channel locks grabbed and pulled his left hand into the machine. The fingertip of his left pinky finger was surgically amputated above the fingernail.

On 04/21/16, at approximately 3:00 p.m., an employee was cutting a concrete pipe with a cut-off saw. The blade became stuck, and the guard that covers the blade struck the left side of the employee's face, fracturing the orbital bone and causing lacerations.

An employee was working with a screwdriver to remove a screw from a 480-volt circuit breaker when he hit an energized switchboard. An arc flash occurred, burning the employee's face and arm and requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell from a platform roof, injuring his pelvis and breaking a wrist and arm.
An employee fell from a ladder on the roof while troubleshooting a solar system installation project, breaking right-side ribs and fracturing an ankle.
An employee fell from the mezzanine while installing a permanent guardrail, suffering a pelvis fracture and elbow injury.

An employee was hydro blasting on top of a vertical exchanger with a 20,000-psi cleaning lance when he lost his balance and control of the lance. The water stream from the lance cut through his metatarsal boot, lacerating the top of his right foot.

On April 22, 2016, an employee was backing up in the trench while directing an excavator operator to come back with the bucket when he was crushed between the excavator bucket and a water main behind him. He suffered cracked ribs and contusions to the left side of his chest.
An employee was cleaning when a valve failure caused hot water and steam to release in the area where he was working. He suffered second degree burns on both hands and was hospitalized.

An employee was acting as a spotter for a crane being moved. While standing between the crane and another stationary crane, the employee attempted to warn the crane operator that he was about to hit the other crane when he was crushed between the crane that was moving and the stationary crane. He suffered lung, hip, and head injuries and required surgery.
An employee was troubleshooting a metal door when a gust of wind hit the door, causing it to strike the employee's head. The employee suffered head trauma.
An employee fell through the roof to the concrete floor, requiring wrist surgery.

An employee was trying to pull down a section of drilling pipe from the back of a truck when one of the pipes fell down and pinched his right ring finger, amputating it between the first and second knuckles.
An employee was a cutting a form board with a circular saw. The saw jammed and kicked back cutting the employee across the chest.

An employee had just completed residential roof tile work. While throwing debris to the ground close to the edge, the employee fell 20 feet to ground level. The employee suffered left shin, left ankle, and right ankle injuries, requiring surgery.

An employee was helping to lower metal sheets into place for ground stability when the wind caught one of the sheets, causing it to strike the employee's leg. The employee suffered a broken tibia and fibula.
An employee fell approximately 13 to 15 feet while descending a ladder from the roof where workers were painting. The employee suffered multiple fractures in the left wrist.

An employee was coming down a fixed ladder when the right and left grab rails broke. He lost his balance and fell 11 or 12 feet to the lower roof level, breaking his left arm above the elbow and requiring hospitalization.
After greasing equipment, an employee fell while descending metal stairs, breaking a shoulder and wrist.
An employee was struck by a vehicle while setting up a work zone on a state highway. The employee suffered rib fractures and a punctured lung.

On Tuesday 4/26/16, at about 1 PM, an employee was installing a control panel on a cooling tower. The employee dropped his screw driver and it rolled under the cooling tower. When the employee knelt down to retrieve the screw driver, his knee landed on some wire debris. He required surgery to remove the wire debris.
An employee was collecting debris at a construction site when a large piece of clay came off the debris and hit the employee's left shoulder, lacerating it.
An employee was using a hammer to clean accumulated material from rollers on a conveyor. The hammer slipped and his arm was caught between the rollers. His arm broke and required surgery.
A crew was setting a steel plate on the ground using a backhoe. The plate became loose and fell on an employee's lower left leg, causing three fractures.

An employee was positioning steel casing with a synthetic web sling. As he removed the sling from the casing, the casing shifted and pinched his left middle finger between the casing and the clamp set to receive the next piece, partially amputating his left middle fingertip.
An employee was struck by a forklift transporting materials while controlling traffic at a construction site. The employee suffered fractures to lower extremities.
While unloading light pole foundations from a truck, an employee fell off the truck and broke his wrist.
An employee was installing 14-inch pipe into a new pipe rack.  The employee's right pinky finger was caught between the pipe and the structural I-beam, amputating the fingertip.
On April 28, 2016, at 12:00 p.m., an employee slipped on a wet tile floor and broke a femur bone, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was repairing a winch with a ratchet wrench. Tension on the winch caused it and the wrench to spin. The spinning wrench struck the employee's right lower arm and fractured it.
An employee was cutting sheet rock in an auditorium when an existing wall gave way and fell on the employee, breaking his right arm and a rib.
The employee was on a ladder securing facia board to the roof. The employee fell to the ground and suffered multiple left rib fractures.
An employee was operating a winch. The winch cable broke and the winch hook struck the employee. The employee sustained back injuries.

On April 29, 2016, at 5:45 PM, an employee, who was  wearing a harness while performing sheeting work, fell from a second story and fractured an eye socket and both hands and wrists. The employee was hospitalized.

Two employees were installing siding on a residential home from a wooden pole scaffold equipped with a metal panel platform. The scaffold collapsed. Both employees were hospitalized. One employee suffered a fractured forearm. The second employee suffered a severe spinal injury.
An employee was ripping boards on a table saw when his right hand came into contact with the saw blade and was lacerated.

An employee was standing on a mobile painter's scaffolding system and installing drywall. The scaffolding system tipped and the employee fell to the ground. The employee landed on his feet and fractured both heels.
An employee fell about 15 feet off an extension ladder resulting in a fractured back.

On or about May 2, 2016, employees were on a bucket lift servicing electrical transmissions.  An employee was changing dies in the press head.  When the motor started, the press head began to close, resulting in the amputation of a right hand fingertip.
An employee suffered a hand laceration and broken finger when bolting in a blind with a combo and impact wrench.
An employee was installing the ground rod. While using the ground rod pounder to pound the rod on the downward position, the rod went through his right middle finger resulting in amputation.
A welder was working above the injured employee and dropped a welding rod which struck the injured employee's arm.
An employee was being lifted in a forklift. During the lift, the basket tipped forward, pinching the employee's right fingers between the top rail of the basket and the forklift mast.

On May 4, 2016, at approximately 9:00am, an employee was hospitalized after falling down a set of stairs. The employee, and three other workers, were carrying a metal cabinet down the stairs. The employee slipped on the first step and fell, resulting in 3-4 fractured ribs.
An employee was attaching a banner to a building, lost his balance, and fell off the ladder. The employee suffered a broken wrist, loss of a tooth, and lacerations to his lip and head.
An employee installing drywall fell from a mobile scaffold approximately 54 inches to the floor below and broke a hip.
A worker was engaged in concrete finishing activities on a new highway and fell 2.5 feet from a finishing platform landing on the concrete. The employee's left leg was fractured below the knee.
An employee suffered a left index fingertip amputation while clearing a clogged grout pump.
An employee was struck by a roof jack on the left side of the face while working in a tank with a floating roof.
An employee was shocked while changing light bulbs in the parking lot. The employee was hospitalized.

Two employees were working on a scaffolding system that toppled over injuring both employees on May 5, 2016, at approximately 0930 hours. One employee fell directly onto a small structure near the scaffold and suffered a broken pelvis, shoulder, ribs, and wrist on his right side. The employee was hospitalized for treatment of his injuries. The second employee fell directly on the bare ground and suffered a small laceration on his leg. The second employee was treated and released.
An employee was attaching a hydraulic coupler and sustained a puncture wound to the left index finger.
An employee was cutting a piece of galvanized pipe with a chop saw and amputated the tip of his left index finger above the knuckle.
An employee's arm was caught in the motor of a cement mixing machine resulting in injury.
An employee was loading concrete onto the truck. The concrete shifted and struck the employee's leg resulting in ankle fractures.
An employee was severely burned by steam/hot water during a maintenance check on a malfunctioning water pump.
An employee was cleaning a condenser coil. Kleen Coil (yellow) spilled into his boots burning his foot.
The employee was using a table saw to rip off a small section of a 12 foot long 2x2 when the employee caught his left hand in the blade, amputating the tips of three fingers.
An employee suffered lacerations to his head when it was caught in an elevator gate.
The employee was walking into the store and out of the rain to service the HVAC system, slipped and fell on the floor breaking a wrist.
An employee was hooking lift cables to a precast concrete slab when he fell from the bed of the flatbed trailer onto the pavement and suffered a concussion.
