An employee received lacerations to his head and numbness in his fingertips when he was hit in the head with a piece of scaffold component that fell approximately 15 feet. The employee was wearing his hard hat.
An employee was climbing a job made ladder, lost his grip and fell approximately 15 feet to the concrete floor below sustaining injuries requiring hospitalization.
On 05/09/16 at about 12:00 p.m., an employee was hit by an aluminum beam that fell, striking the employee's face and head. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was painting on the roof when he slipped and fell to the ground breaking his pelvis, injuring his back, and bruising a lung.

An employee was attempting to remove the teeth from the bucket of an excavator when a piece of metal flew off, striking the employee in the neck. The employee suffered internal bleeding and required surgery.

Two employees were setting a steel beam that was attached to the choker of a crane. The crane operator picked up the beam and started cabling up. As the beam started rising, it became caught on part of the structure. The crane continued to pull up. The beam broke loose from the structure that it was caught on and swung free, striking the two employees. One of the employees was hospitalized with fractured ribs, pulmonary contusions, and a collapsed lung.
On or about May 10, 2016, an employee was paving a roadway. While stepping off a paver, he fell on the hot asphalt, breaking his leg and burning his arm.
An employee was on a 9-foot wall, supervising work activities, when he tripped and fell to the ground. He fractured his shoulder and hip, requiring hospitalization.

Two employees were working together to align a PVC vent pipe. When one of the employees used a 2-pound hammer to strike a PVC wedge, the PVC wedge fractured, and a piece of the wedge entered the right side of the employee's eye, past the safety glasses.
An employee slipped and fell off the second story of a roof during tear-off activities. The employee hit the first story, then rolled and fell on the ground, sustaining a broken hip/pelvis.

An employee was grinding on a structural handrail for a work platform with a grating floor. The employee lost control of the grinder, which lacerated and fractured his left index finger. His left index fingertip was surgically amputated.
An employee was walking back to a truck that was backing up. The driver never saw him and ran over his right foot.

An employee was preparing a trailer to load a roller that was on a slope. A coworker was in control of the roller and left it unattended. The coworker set the emergency brake, but the emergency brake was not working properly. The roller then began to roll slowly and struck the employee, who suffered a leg/hip dislocation.

An employee was tailing in a piece of pipe while the drill rig was picking up the other end. The pipe swung into the derrick of the rig and caused the other end of the pipe to flip up, striking the employee in the mouth.
An employee fell and broke his pelvis while performing roofing work.

An employee was using a spud wrench to loosen bolts on a steel form panel. The nut was on very tightly, so he placed his foot on the wrench to loosen it. He lost his balance and the point of the wrench went up through the sole of his work boot, puncturing and fracturing his right foot.

Two employees were fixing a sewer system at the intersection. The first employee went down into the sewer to relieve a blockage. He finished and proceeded to climb the 9-foot ladder up the sewer hole. Just before he was able to reach the top of the hole, he collapsed and fell down the ladder. The second employee went down the ladder to rescue the first employee and put a hoist rope around him. While the first employee was being hoisted up the hole, the second employee succumbed to the gases that were in the sewer and collapsed. One of the employees was hospitalized.
During torque wrench preparations, an employee's right ring fingertip was amputated.
An employee was driving home after working on underground plumbing when he started to feel cramping in his legs and fingers. He was hospitalized overnight for dehydration.
An employee was performing work on a workover rig when a lifting cap came loose from a valve and hit the employee's hardhat. The employee suffered cuts on the head from the hardhat.
On 5/12/2016, at 0930, an employee was rigging up the top section of a bucket elevator that he was installing. The load shifted and rolled onto him, fracturing his pelvis and possibly some ribs.
An employee fell from a boom lift basket while driving through a mall parking lot, contacting the ground and suffering a head injury.
An employee was pre-fabricating duct work when he hit his right pinky finger with the hammer on the sharp edge of the duct, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was stopping traffic as a flagger. A truck failed to slow down or stop, crashing and skidding off a stopped car. The employee saw the collision coming, attempted to run to safety, and was struck by the truck, suffering a broken hip and shoulder.

An employee was loading his pickup truck. While waiting for an inspector, he decided to clean some trash out of the bed of his truck. A gust of wind then came along and blew the employee off the tailgate of the truck. He lost his balance and fell to the ground, fracturing his left leg and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was pulling nails from roof panels. He started to carry a panel across the roof and stepped on an area that was insulation only. He fell approximately 15 feet to the lower level, breaking his left femur and one rib.
An employee was installing wooden forms on shoring when the brace slipped. His hand was caught between the forms, crushing his left middle finger.
An employee fell approximately 5 feet through an open ground-floor elevator shaft, suffering a fractured eye socket and requiring hospitalization.

On 5/14/2016, at 11:30 a.m., an employee was stripping concrete forms. A wooden block was removed from between the two forms, which then came together and crushed the employee's right thumb. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee lost footing and fell down stairs to the ground level, breaking ribs and puncturing a lung. The employee required hospitalization.
An ironworker was handling an S-4 beam when he lost balance and fell to the floor. The employee was caught between the beam and the floor and a section of the employee's pinky was amputated.
An employee was removing a fence from a ditch near an excavator when the excavator backed over the employee's leg, breaking it.
An employee was replacing a concrete grinder wheel when the grinding wheel exploded, lacerating his left index finger and fracturing his left shin bone. He was hospitalized.

On May 16, 2016, at 11:05 a.m., an employee was replacing a light fixture while standing on a ladder that was approximately 4 feet off the ground. He came in contact with a live electrical wire and was shocked. He then fell from the ladder to the ground below.

An employee was attempting to tighten bolts on a sprinkler system used for fire suppression when a gasket ruptured, causing water under pressure to flow out and strike him. He then fell 16.5 feet from his ladder to the concrete floor below. He suffered facial scrapes, an orbital bone fracture above the left eye, a left shoulder fracture, a left rib fracture, a sacrum bone fracture on the left side, a collapsed lung on the left side, and a loss of consciousness.

An employee fell through a rotted section of a commercial flat roof while stripping material from the center of the structure. The employee fell approximately 16 feet to the floor, breaking bones in the right arm and elbow, cracking the tailbone, and fracturing the pelvis.

An employee attempted to drive in a sheet-metal screw with a Phillips-head bit attachment on a power hand drill. The drill slipped and punctured the middle finger on his right hand. His hand then became infected and required hospitalization.

An employee was dismantling an overhead conveyor when the connection point for the rigging gave way and the conveyor fell, amputating the employee's left pinky finger at the first joint (just below the nailbed).
While dismounting a roller, an employee's left foot became caught in the bottom step. The employee could not hold on and fell backwards onto stone and dirt, fracturing the left ankle and elbow.
An employee slipped and fell on the workplace parking lot, suffering a right knee injury that required surgery.
An employee slipped and fell off a free-standing ladder approximately 2 to 3 feet high, landing on his hands, and suffering a compound fracture of his right arm.
An employee was trying to unattach the hook from a lifting "eye" on the top of a compressor after it was moved when his pinky fingertip was caught and amputated between the hook and the "eye."
A worker fell six feet off the back of a bucket truck while securing the boom to its cradle. The employee fractured a rib and an elbow and sustained a cut over the right eye.
An employee was using a saw to cut an 8-inch PVC fire-waster line pipe when the pipe moved, causing the saw to kick back and lacerate the left side of the employee's chest.
An employee was using a saw to install water lines when the saw kicked back and lacerated his chest.
An employee was disconnecting a trailer and a jack when the trailer moved, pinching and amputating his left-hand index and middle fingers between the trailer and jack.
An employee walking towards an aerial lift, fell, and struck his head. The employee was hospitalized for a brain injury and lacerations.
On May 19, 2016, an articulating off road truck turned over and an employee sustained a broken ankle.

On May 19, 2016, at approximately 3:30 pm, an employee was working as a flagger assigned to handling traffic control in a street renovation/construction work zone and was struck by a vehicle. The employee suffered a fractured ankle and was hospitalized.
An employee fell 8-10 feet from an extension ladder breaking ribs on the left side and sustaining a small puncture to the lung.
An employee was installing a frame angle using a powder-actuated tool when a pin ricocheted off a steel beam and punctured his chest. He was hospitalized.

An employee was helping a coworker unload a portable generator from a box trailer. The generator was equipped with a fold-away handle. The generator had to be lowered approximately 18 inches to the ground outside of the trailer. The employee's right hand was placed between the generator frame and the handle. When his coworker pulled the generator out of the trailer, the generator fell 18 inches to the ground. The handle struck the floor of the trailer, pinching the employee's finger between the frame and the handle with approximately 200 pounds of force. The employee's middle finger was fractured, and the distal tip was amputated. His ring finger was also partially amputated.
An employee was installing solar screens on windows and fell from a ladder, striking his head, breaking an arm, and cracking ribs as a result of the fall.

An employee was climbing a telecommunications tower without incident.  A co-worker looked over and the employee appeared to be in pain while holding on to the tower at a height of approximately 250 feet.  No fall or other event occurred.  The employee just climbed the tower and started feeling pain in his lower back.  Tower rescue was initiated and the employee was lowered to the ground.  The employee was using a personal fall arrest system and was fully tied-off when he experienced the pain.  Upon reaching the ground, an emergency response crew began administering pain medication.  The employee experienced an adverse reaction to the medication and was rushed to the hospital where he was admitted primarily due to his reaction to the medication administered by the first responders, but the employee may have some lower back disorder(s) as well.

An employee was using a sledge hammer to install a master pin into the track of a track hoe. When the employee struck the pin with the sledge hammer, a small piece of metal splintered off the pin and struck the employee in the right leg below the knee, puncturing the leg and lacerating an artery.

On May 20, 2016, at about 4:00 p.m., an employee was popping out reflective items in a construction zone when a driver entered the zone and ran over the employee's foot. The employee was hospitalized with broken bones.

An employee was breaking up wooden furniture on a raised loading dock and then throwing pieces into a 30-yard dumpster positioned along the dock. While attempting to throw a wooden drawer into the dumpster, the employee's right foot entered the gap between the loading dock and dumpster. He then tripped over the dumpster lip, fell forward into the dumpster, and struck his chest on the debris inside. He broke two ribs and suffered internal bleeding, requiring hospitalization.

An employee attached a strap from the excavator bucket to the jack hammer and then signaled for the operator to move the bucket back. The employee saw the strap start to get tighter when the jack hammer popped up and crushed his right hand between the hammer and the pipe. His right pinky finger was amputated.

An employee was pouring hot tar from a tote bucket to a mop cart when the person mopping went to dip the mop. The hot tar then splashed up and inside of the employee's glove, burning his right forefinger, thumb, and hand.

An employee was helping to inspect an electrical line and repairing a jumper that came off the transformer switch. The employee pulled two of the three switches to de-energize the pole line and then repositioned his bucket truck to get to the next switch. When he grabbed the wire to reinstall it onto the third switch, the switch was energized and caused third degree burns to his index, middle, and ring fingers on both hands.

An employee was washing down the drum of a mixer truck and was attempting to remove concrete that was stuck on a sprayer. His left arm was caught and crushed in a pinch point, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was holding on to the basket of the aerial lift. The employee's left middle finger was crushed between the lift rail and a piece of steel resulting in the amputation of the fingertip below the first knuckle.

On or about May 23, 2016, an employee was handling a piece of steel with a magnet lifting-device.  The steel shifted and fell on the employee's left hand, amputating the first joint of the ring finger.

An employee was carrying a set of chains while walking on the outside of the Jersey wall. He slipped under the top rail and fell about 12 feet to the ground below, breaking his right ankle and requiring hospitalization.
An employee strained their lower back while pulling a power cable up a cell tower.
After climbing over a 3-foot joist, an employee stepped on a loose angle iron and fell on his right side, suffering internal injuries.
An employee was using a ladder to clean the fascia at a residential home when he fell to the surface below, suffering a broken right arm and a head injury. He was hospitalized.
An employee was pulling cable from a 4160-volt switch gear when the cable made contact with an energized spark arrestor, causing an arc flash. The employee suffered burns to the face and both hands.

An employee was removing the last bolt from the joint bar that holds the rail line in place when the rail abruptly shifted, hitting the employee and fracturing his left foot. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee fell through a roof skylight to the floor, breaking his arm.
An employee was working on a ladder when another employee pushed the trash cart filled with drywall into the ladder thereby causing the employee on the ladder to fall and shatter his knee.
On May 24, 2016, an employee was helping to place sections of concrete barrier with a track hoe. One piece shifted and fell on the employee's leg, fracturing it and requiring surgery.
An employee fell from an A-frame ladder to the concrete floor while pulling/installing 277-volt wires for new indoor lighting. The employee sustained a skull fracture and brain hemorrhage.

An employee was helping to set two risers for a new underground utility vault when the operator lowered the riser onto his hand, fracturing his left index finger. He was hospitalized with hand swelling.
An employee was using a pry bar to align a flange when the bar slipped, causing him to fall backward and fracture his left ankle. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was cleaning the engine of an excavator with starting fluid when an arc sparked and triggered a fire on his sleeve. He was hospitalized with burn injuries.

An employee was helping to perform maintenance on an elevator and was handing a mechanic a wire cable when the cable became caught on the elevator, amputating the employee's right arm and lacerating the leg.

A work crew was wrapping the steep tank with poly to protect it against the weather. To do so, the crew was moving the grating away from the tank so that they could slide the poly down and tie it to the tank. While setting down the end of the grating, the injured employee's left fifth finger became caught between the grating and the I-beam.  When he went to pull his finger out, he partially severed the fingertip, which had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was cutting a wood board when his left-hand middle finger was cut by the circular saw.

An employee was cutting a 45-degree angle on a piece of 2x4 wood when the circular saw kicked back. The saw blade severed multiple tendons in the employee's forearm and penetrated the bone just above the wrist.

While assisting in material handling operations, an employee's finger was crushed between a skid steer fork and a concrete slab. The employee suffered a fingertip laceration resulting in amputation and fingernail loss.
An employee was climbing a ladder at a construction site when he suffered cramps and started feeling dizzy and lightheaded. He was hospitalized for heat stroke.

An employee was standing near the area where an auger crew was preparing to drill a hole to install a light pole. A pin holding the auger broke, causing it to fall. When the auger fell, it hit a security fencing and then landed on the employee's right foot, smashing the fourth and fifth toes.
An employee was drilling a hole in the foundation when a cinder block fell from the third floor and struck him, causing contusions to his lower back and kidney. He was hospitalized.
An employee slipped off a ladder while descending and broke the tibia and fibula at the knee. The employee was wearing a fall protection harness while working on the ladder.

An employee was cleaning stairs using a handheld electric grinder with a fine wire brush. The wire brush became caught up in the employee's pant leg, causing the grinder to make contact with his right ankle. His ankle was lacerated to the bone, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was hospitalized with a severe laceration to his arm when a saw blade kicked back while cutting pipe.
An employee was struck by 12 sheetrock panels that tipped over and fell onto and broke his left leg.
An employee was setting wood blocks under the stabilizer of a backhoe when his finger was pinched. The right index finger was partially amputated.
An employee injured the tip of the left ring finger when it came in contact with the rotating chuck on a hand-held power drill.
An employee was moving a glass mirror when it fell and he was cut by the glass. The cut severed an artery and two tendons in the wrist requiring surgery to repair.

An employee was installing bat insulation at a residential construction project. A nearby stack of 13 foot long sheet rock was knocked over and struck the employee on the upper left leg, resulting in a fractured bone.
An employee was climbing a ladder when a bracket came loose and the ladder fell to the side. The employee suffered a compound fracture of the lower leg.
An employee suffered a finger amputation while operating a drill.
An employee was cutting metal with a miter saw when the saw jammed and shot the metal backwards into the employee's hand, cutting a right thumb tendon.

An employee was cutting 4-inch rigid conduit pipe with an electrical band saw while on a step-ladder. After the section of pipe was cut free, the employee carried the pipe down the step-ladder, stepping on the extension cord that was energizing the band saw. His ankle rolled, causing him to lose his balance and lose his hold on the pipe. He fell and reached out with the hand holding the pipe to try and gain some balance. The pipe fell from his shoulder and struck him on the hand, crushing two fingers and amputating another on his right hand.
An employee was climbing a ladder and attempting to step onto a roof when his foot slipped. The ladder gave way and he fell 13.5 feet to the ground, fracturing his wrist and requiring surgery.
An employee was unloading supplies from a truck when a metal pole struck and broke the employee's leg.

An employee was lowering tilt wall panels from an aerial lift with a rope. As the employee attempted to catch a panel, the rope removed the skin from the right pinky finger. The finger had to be amputated, and the employee was hospitalized.
An employee was walking down a stairwell when he missed the last step, lost his balance, and bumped his head on the wall, suffering broken vertebrae.
An employee fell approximately 15 feet while climbing down an extension ladder, breaking a right lower leg bone.

An employee and a coworker were lifting up a manhole to see the direction of a pipe. The lid was lifted and held vertically. Some dirt started to fall into the manhole, and the employee used his hand to brush it away so it did not fall into the manhole. The lid slipped off the tool and smashed the employee's left thumb between it and the casting, amputating the end of his left thumb.
An employee was offloading a bundle of steel pipe from a flatbed truck when his fingers were pinched between the pipes. His right-hand middle and ring fingers were amputated.
An employee was walking up a steep roof while carrying a staple gun when he slipped and discharged a staple into his knee, requiring surgery.
An employee fell approximately 30 feet to the ground while installing a truss, suffering facial fractures, as well as injuries to the spleen, liver, and kidney. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee on a ladder was working on a circuit that he thought was de-energized. He grabbed the circuit with lineman pliers. He was knocked off the ladder by a coworker, sustaining a shoulder fracture and shock injuries.

An employee working on a paving crew started to feel dizzy, so he went to rest under an umbrella. He then passed out and fell, hitting his face, forearm, and hand on the just-poured hot pavement. The employee suffered burns to his left-side face, forearms, and hands. He was hospitalized.

An employee was cutting steel with a cutting torch while in a scissor lift. The steel beam twisted and turned the scissor lift over with the employee inside. The employee suffered a broken left femur.

While replacing a damaged metal carport awning, an employee fell approximately 6 feet from the awning to the ground below. The employee suffered head, face, neck, and mouth injuries, requiring overnight hospitalization.

On 6/5/16, at approximately 12:15 p.m., an employee was climbing onto a mobile scaffold to install drywall mud. The employee was ascending an add-on scaffold ladder designed for safe scaffold access when his foot was caught on the second rung. He then fell less than 4 feet, fracturing three vertebrae in his neck.

An employee was observing a back-hoe operation when the back-hoe operator turned the vehicle and struck the employee, who then fell to the ground. His hard hat was knocked off, and his head was lacerated by rocks on the ground.

An employee was closing up the equipment yard and was using his left hand to pull up on the gate. As he was pulling and lifting at the same time, his left middle finger was caught and amputated by the gate roller.

An employee was using an excavator to place a concrete barrier rail and crash cushions when the excavator boom moved and pinched the employee beneath a section of crash cushion. The employee suffered a broken left femur.
On June 6, 2016, an employee suffered an arm amputation above the elbow while working with a jack.
On June 6, 2016, an employee performing maintenance work on a furnace platform fell approximately 10 feet, suffering injuries to the abdomen and lower extremities.

An employee was using a chop saw to cut an 8-inch, old clay pipe to replace it with a PVC sewer pipe. The saw kicked back and the blade went through the employee's face shield, lacerating his skin from his right chin to his right ear. He was hospitalized.

Employees were taking a delivery of long pipe from the loading dock to the hoist and then to the eighth floor using a dolly. As they were coming down the ramp off the hoist, the dolly began to tip over and one of the pipes struck an employee's foot. The employee was hospitalized with a broken foot.

An employee was on top of a structural beam, waiting for the crane to hoist the next beam into place, when the rigging failed. The beam then fell and struck the employee's left leg, partially amputating it below the knee.
A crew was installing a new powerline when an employee in a bucket truck came close to an energized line and suffered flash burns to the back.
An employee was helping to fill an asphalt tar kettle when the line failed and the employee's face and arms were severely burned. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a heat-related illness while moving dirt piles.
An employee was moving a wall panel when his right pinky finger became stuck between the panel and the skip pan, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was cleaning a wood floor and picking up wood by hand. He picked up a piece of plywood that was covering a shaft and then fell approximately 20 to 30 feet through the shaft, breaking his hip and eye socket.
An employee was helping to build a scaffold when he experienced light-headedness, cramping, pain, and nausea. He was hospitalized for a heat-related illness.
An employee was installing concrete blocks onto a modular home's concrete piers to level a double-wide trailer. A block fell onto his left middle finger and fractured it.
An employee injured his left thumb while he was sliding a reshore jack post into the closed position.

An employee was dismantling a mobile tugger. As he was pulling back on the motor, the pulley was caught on the bottom track of the wall and came out of the extension arms, causing the weight to shift toward the motor side. The motor began to counterbalance toward the employee. He then tried to prevent the equipment from flipping up by catching the weight of the motor. At that time, he injured his back and fell to the floor. He was hospitalized.
An employee was power-washing the airfield surface when the water spray or the sharp edge of the spray nozzle lacerated his upper left arm. He was hospitalized.

An employee turned on a core drilling machine. The machine was stuck, resulting in him being knocked to the ground. The drill base kept spinning and went over his hand, amputating his left ring fingertip.
An employee was sweeping up leftover chips when a nearby distributor truck began to back up and hit the employee. The employee was dragged under the truck, cracking three vertebrae and two ribs.
An employee was installing a light fixture from a ladder when he received an electrical shock and fell to the ground, suffering broken teeth and a fractured right patella.

An employee was shoveling gravel into a 1-foot trench by a partition wall. The site supervisor was operating a mini excavator near the partition wall while the employee was working on the opposite side. The mini excavator bumped into the wall, causing it to fall to pieces. Some of the pieces fell on and broke the employee's hip.
On or about June 09, 2016, an employee was jacking a truck up when the jack slipped and hit the employee in the torso. The employee was hospitalized with a ribcage injury.

An employee was in a boom lift, replacing an emergency light at a warehouse. As he was lowering himself, the bucket swung into an industrial ceiling fan, which lacerated his left forearm. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting decking with a handheld saw when the saw cut his leg.

An employee was reinstalling a cutting shoe on a direct push tube soil sampling rod. The dual tube rod slid out of the tensioner that was being used to hold it up and fell back down the bore hole, amputating the employee's right index finger below the first knuckle.
An employee was working on the side of a wall, positioning ties. As he was climbing the wall form, he fell from a height of approximately 4 to 5 feet, breaking his left ankle.

An employee was replacing an old lightning arrester with a new one. The new arrestor began to move, so the employee reached over to stop it. The employee's left elbow then came into contact with an energized line, causing an electrical shock.
On 6/10/16, an employee fell onto a wooden stake in the ground and punctured his lungs. He was hospitalized.
An employee was tightening a loose tarp over the load of a dump truck when he fell and suffered head trauma.

An employee was taking electric breakers and wires out of a live electrical panel. One of the stingers from a bus bar dropped down after breaking a set screw, causing a cross phase and starting an arc flash. The employee fell to the ground and suffered burns to the eyes, face, and left forearm.
An employee had been installing electrical wiring and was descending a ladder when the ladder collapsed. The employee fell and contacted the floor, suffering a contusion and bruised tailbone.

An employee was dismantling a crate that was housing a small boiler unit. While his right hand was between the boiler and a board of the crate, the board kicked another part of the crate. The force of the kick caused the board to move and amputate his left ring finger between the board and the boiler.

An employee was using a band saw to cut angle iron. One of the five pieces of angle iron that was being cut was shorter than the others and was not secured by the clamp. When the band saw was lowered to make the cut, the unsecured angle iron was pulled into the backstop, or guide, and the employee's left thumb was caught between the angle iron and the backstop resulting in amputation.

An employee was working from a 19-foot electronic scissor lift (set at 11-feet high) to cut a large structural brace using a torch. As the brace was cut loose, it struck the top of the scissor lift and fell onto plastic storage containers. The back of the employee's head hit the scissor lift guardrails and was lacerated, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was descending some stairs from a platform when he lost his footing, put his arms out to break his fall, and caught his pinky fingers on both hands in the "V" formed by the railing. Both pinky fingers were amputated.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut wood when the saw jumped and amputated two of the employee's fingers.
An employee was stung by a wasp while inspecting scaffolding and had an allergic reaction, requiring hospitalization.
While getting out of his truck, an employee misstepped and re-injured a previous hernia in his left lower abdomen.
While installing underground utilities, an employee began to feel sick. The employee was hospitalized for heat-related illness.

An employee and a coworker were applying stucco from a scaffold to the exterior of a building. When the employee and his coworker stepped off the scaffold onto a canopy awning, the canopy came off, causing them to fall. The employee suffered a broken left ankle and tailbone, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using a ladder on a tile floor with plastic sheeting when the ladder slipped out, causing the employee to fall and break their pelvis.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut plywood when the blade lacerated the employee's left-hand fingers.
An employee's leg was punctured by the nail from a nail gun the employee was using to hang fascia.

On June 14, 2016, an employee was felling trees and brush around an overhead power transmission line with a chainsaw. The oak tree being felled slit up the middle and toppled to the ground, striking the employee's shoulder and knocking the employee to the ground. The employee was hospitalized with fractured collarbones and ribs.
An employee experienced heat cramps and dehydration while stacking materials.

An employee was unloading/hoisting structural steel members/composite joists from a flatbed trailer truck when the load shifted. The employee dismounted from the truck and landed on a bucket of bolts on the ground. He rolled and broke his ankle.
An employee became ill after working inside a new construction building for part of the day and also outside part of the day. He was hospitalized that evening for heat stroke.
An employee fell to the ground while descending a ladder, breaking a leg and injuring an arm.
An employee was cutting down a tree and was shocked by a power line.
An employee was moving a switch gear into place when it fell on him. He was hospitalized with a head gash and broken ribs.

An employee was in a drainage ditch, digging and preparing the area for concrete work, when a driver lost control of his car on the highway, drove across two lanes, across the frontage road, and into the drainage ditch. The car hit the employee, who was hospitalized with a fractured pelvis, fractured ribs, and knee injury.
An employee was driving an off-road vehicle at a jobsite when the vehicle rolled, breaking the employee's leg. He was hospitalized.
An employee's right middle finger was caught and partially amputated in a pinch point while positioning an h-pile.

An employee was getting a crash attenuator truck set up at a road construction job site when the employee's fingers were caught between a support cable and a support structure. The employee suffered a finger amputation and broken finger.
An employee was boring using an industrial auger when the auger locked up, pinning him against the bank. He suffered a fractured right leg and internal injuries.

An employee was pressure-washing a flat roof with an existing membrane for repairs. The roof had a parapet wall of 25 to 28 inches all around the perimeter. The employee hit the wall and fell over onto the grass below, suffering a broken ankle and requiring surgery. The building was a 2-story condominium.
An employee was carrying a mirror to the dumpster when it broke and cut his left wrist, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was putting straps on a load of materials on a truck when the employee stepped on a rock and twisted an ankle. The employee fell on the right knee and required surgery.

An employee was dismantling scaffolding when a board became jammed. When the employee attempted to unjam the board, he lost his footing and fell through the space between the edge of the scaffold board and the wall of the building and struck the ground below. He broke two wrists and his hip.

An employee was moving a 70- to 100-pound steel plate with a coworker when the steel plate fell on and crushed his right middle and ring fingers. A portion of his ring finger had to be surgically amputated.
An employee fell from the back of a truck while loading materials, suffering a fractured leg.
An employee was walking next to a rough terrain forklift when the forklift operator ran over the employee's left foot, fracturing it.
An employee was driving a forklift in the warehouse parking lot when he became disoriented from the heat.
An employee was putting together steel with another connector when his right thumb was caught between the vertical column and the horizontal beam. He broke his right thumb and was hospitalized.

An employee was rolling out the slip sheet (filter fabric) for the protected membrane roof when he fell 14.5 feet through a roof-access opening, breaking a wrist and two back bones. He was hospitalized.

An employee was installing a lighting fixture from a stepladder when the employee contacted energized electrical parts and was shocked. The employee then fell from the ladder. The employee suffered an electrical burn to the hand, as well as a bruised back.

An employee was using a chainsaw to cut a felled tree into sections once it was on the ground. The tree broke/snapped, and a section of the tree struck and pinned the employee's lower leg, causing multiple tibia and fibula fractures.
An employee was marking plates for framing on the 2nd floor while standing on a 6-foot ladder. He slipped and fell on his way down the ladder and struck his head, cracking the back of his skull.

An employee was troubleshooting a lighting circuit from a ladder when the employee fell 4 feet off the ladder and hit the concrete floor below. The employee sustained a head laceration and a broken tailbone.
On June 20, 2016, at about 9:30 a.m., an employee contacted live electrical parts during a service call and received a shock and burns to 50% of his body. He was hospitalized.
An employee fell approximately 30 feet through an uncovered hole in the floor, sustaining multiple broken bones and a broken nose, and knocking out teeth.
An employee was cutting wood with a table saw when the blade amputated two fingers.
An employee was struck by a steel beam that fell approximately 40 feet, suffering a head injury, leg fractures, hip injuries, neck injuries, and lower back damage.

An employee was helping a forklift operator organize the yard, placing cribbing to be used under a steel angle iron, when he was struck by the forklift while it was backing up. He suffered a broken pelvis and internal injuries.

An employee was drilling fence post holes with an auger bit attached to a skid steer. The auger bit was coming loose so the crew pulled it out to tighten it up. The auger bit fell over after it cleared the hole and pinched the employee's left calf against the skid steer, causing a severe laceration that required hospitalization.
An employee fell from a ladder and suffered a broken leg.
An employee working on a roof experienced nausea and was hospitalized for heat-related illness.

An employee was trying to move a scaffold when it collapsed. The cross member detached from the scaffold and the employee's right hand was caught between the crossbars, amputating the pinky and ring fingertips.

On or about June 21, 2016, an employee was at a customer's residence to provide an estimate for a chimney repair. As the employee was climbing the ladder, he lost his balance and fell, injuring his back and ribs.

An employee was repairing a pipeline at a residential home. The employee took the pipe apart and was handling the pipe and fittings when contaminated debris from within the pipeline contacted the back of his hand. He suffered skin irritation to his left hand that became infected and swollen.

On or about 6/21/2016, employees were moving a scaffold. While going over a piece of equipment, they lifted the scaffold and a piece of material fell from the top. The piece landed on an employee's femur, fracturing it. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was aligning sheet metal in a shearing machine when the employee's hand slipped and the piece that holds the part came down on the employee's right ring finger, amputating the fingertip. The shear has a foot control that was activated when the employee's hand slipped.
An employee was preparing material to be roped up to a scaffold crew when a pipe struck him on his hard hat. He suffered a bump on his head.
An employee was overcome by heat while performing roofing activities, requiring hospitalization for heat stress.

A company was installing an irrigation pivot when the pump malfunctioned, allowing the water to seep back down the hole. When an employee attempted to slow the spinning shaft, it amputated his right-hand pinky and ring fingers.
On or about 6/22/16 at 2:15 pm, an employee suffered from heat stroke.
While walking across a concrete barrier, an employee lost his footing and struck his forehead on the concrete barrier, suffering a forehead laceration.
An employee was placing an empty bucket through an opening when the employee's hand was pinned between a concrete ledge and the bucket. The employee suffered a hand fracture and required surgery.
An employee was working in a launder trough inside a clarifier structure when he fell out of the trough to the concrete floor 16 feet below. He was hospitalized with a head injury.
An employee entered a 5-foot trench to fix a broken water line when the trench wall caved in and trapped the employee from the thigh down.

An employee was removing insulation from the sheetrock ceiling of a roof when he stepped on the sheetrock ceiling and fell 20 feet to the floor below. He suffered a fractured skull, broken ribs, lacerated spleen, broken left wrist, and bruised kidney.

An employee was shutting down a riser pipe to a fire sprinkler system in a section of a building. After performing the shutdown, he went through a set of double doors and onto a small walkway that led to the mechanical room of the elevator. The elevator's floor had been removed as a result of a construction project, and the employee fell approximately 80 feet down the shaft. He suffered spinal fractures, leg fractures, and a broken arm.

An employee was cutting a piece of poly-core sheeting with a chop saw when the employee's fingers contacted the blade. The employee suffered lacerations to the left thumb, index finger, and middle finger.

An employee was using a tugger to pull electrical wiring when his right pinky finger was caught between the wheel on the tugger and the rope being used to pull the wiring, amputating his pinky fingertip and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was getting materials to set up the work site when a heavy sheet of plywood injured the employee. The employee sustained broken ribs and a deflated lung.

An employee dumped a load of dirt off at a job site and, before departing, exited the truck to clean dirt out from the back of the dump truck. He was parked behind a track-hoe that was being operated at the time. The track-hoe struck him, breaking two bones in his right lower leg.

An employee was lifting a metal water gate and placing it into the front bucket of a loader.  The water gate shifted and the employee lost control of it.  His right pointer fingertip was caught between the water gate and the bucket of the excavator. His finger broke and was lacerated across the nailbed.

An employee fell from a 6-foot step ladder while working with another technician to install an air duct.  The employee cracked their left shoulder blade, fractured two ribs and suffered a concussion and a bruised lung.

An employee was in an elevator toward the rear of the car when a mason began to enter the elevator with an electric pallet jack that was loaded with a pallet of bricks. The mason lost control of the loaded pallet jack and struck the employee in the stomach, pinning him between the bricks and the rear elevator gate. He was hospitalized.
On 6-23-16, an employee was cutting plywood with a saw when the blade cut his palm and amputated his pinky finger, requiring surgery.

An employee was on top of crates, helping to rig them to a boom lift, when he stepped into a hollow area in a crate that was covered by plastic wrapping and fell approximately 10 feet to the ground. He suffered multiple right-heel fractures.
An employee was using a nail gun to attach molding inside a home when a nail came back and hit him in the eye.
An employee was working from a baker scaffold when the steel frame pole pulled away from the scaffold and the employee fell onto the pole, puncturing his armpit.

On June 25, 2016, at approximately 12:10 p.m., two employees were digging with hand tools around a main telephone pole when the push pole fell and struck one of the employees. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured pelvis that required surgery.

On 6/23/16, at 11:50 a.m., an employee was working from a 6-foot step ladder using a cordless screw gun when he lost his balance and fell to the ground, breaking four ribs and requiring hospitalization.
An employee who was tending to masons began to feel light-headed, weak, and dizzy, requiring hospitalization for possible heat exposure.

An employee was standing on a step ladder and reprogramming an overhead garage door in the company shop when the garage door opened and knocked him off of the ladder to the concrete floor. He suffered a facial fracture and right arm laceration.

An employee was loading a steel standard on a flatbed truck when his right index finger was caught and crushed between the standard and the steel, requiring hospitalization. Gloves were worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was tightening a turnbuckle when the weld broke and it struck the employee's left knee, causing a contusion.
An employee that was prepping alongside the curb began to feel ill and was hospitalized for possible heat exhaustion.
An employee was operating a mini excavator on a slope when the excavator tipped over and rolled over the employee's ankle, breaking it and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was lifting a man-hole cover with his hand when it fell and struck his right index finger, amputating the fingertip.

On or about June 27, 2016, at 1:30 p.m., an employee was proofing an underground 1.25" polyduct when a blowing gun blew out of the line due to built-up back pressure. The employee had been standing to the side of the polyduct to be out of the line of fire.  When the blow gun came out of the duct, the employee stepped over to pick up the gun to turn the air off and the blow dart then came out of the duct, striking him on the right shin. He was hospitalized and required surgery for a broken right tibia.
An employee was dismantling a trash chute when he was struck by a 5-pound brick that was stuck in the chute, severely lacerating his forehead and requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell into an excavation and broke his femur.
An employee was working in an excavated trench, putting together PVC pipe. A board from the fifth floor fell off and struck the employee's right arm, breaking the humerus.
An employee was operating a backhoe when he struck a security gate. When he attempted to lift the security gate, the gate fell on him and fractured his neck.
While performing measurements for a lime operation, an employee was caught between a pickup truck and a dozer blade, breaking the right leg.

An employee was helping a backhoe operator rig crane mats when he possibly became caught between the backhoe and the crane mats that he was spotting. He was found unresponsive with head and back injuries, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing a joist when he fell down, breaking his shoulder and injuring his head. He was hospitalized.

An employee was measuring a parapet wall on the front portico of a hotel building when he lost his balance and fell approximately 18 feet, breaking both legs, his knee, and his ankle. He was hospitalized.
An employee was inspecting the water pipe from a fire hydrant for leaks. The pipe burst and hot water burned the employee's stomach and legs.

An employee was approximately 8 feet high, standing on an extension ladder that was leaning on the exterior wall of a house. He reached out to the right and above his head to place a nail in the fascia board when the ladder slid to the right and down the wall surface. He fell down to surface level and landed on the ladder, breaking his left fibula, tearing ligament near his left ankle, and rupturing his right Achilles tendon. .
While taking measurements, an employee was struck on the head by an elevator bracket, suffering a concussion.
On June 27, 2016, at approximately 10:30 AM, an employee was helping to install a boom extension when it suddenly fell and hit the employee, fracturing his pelvis bone.
An employee was unloading construction materials (steel) to be inventoried when his fingertip was pinched and amputated between two pieces of steel.
An employee was troweling concrete and fell 8 feet off the edge of the foundation wall resulting in back and head injuries.
An employee was using a step stool to scan products with a hand-held scanner unit. The employee then fell from the stool, injuring a leg and fracturing the left hip.
An employee fell 10 feet when the scaffold he was on collapsed. He was hospitalized with five cracked ribs.

An employee was on a man-lift when it was struck by an 18-wheeler. He fell approximately 15 to 19 feet to the ground below, injuring both legs and lacerating his head. His lower leg was surgically amputated.

An employee was working on the roof taking photographs and measurements when he stepped through a skylight and fell approximately 20 feet, striking metal shelving before landing on the concrete flooring. He suffered fractured ribs (all), a fractured sternum, a fractured back in three locations, and a fractured skull.
An employee suffered a seizure and fell off the scaffold striking his head and causing a laceration. The employee was also diagnosed with fractured vertebrae.
An employee was fire-taping above the ceiling when his arm brushed against a pipe, scratching his right elbow. His elbow experienced pain and swelling, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing pipes. The rigging slipped and a pipe struck his leg fracturing it.
The employee was directing a mini-excavator onto a trailer when the excavator shifted and struck his hand, amputating a fingertip.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet from a double gang job ladder to the lower level and suffered injuries including two fractured ribs, a punctured lung and a laceration to the back of the head.
An employee fell while in the back of the truck and injured his right hip.

An employee was on a scaffold using a chain fall to remove the manway cover to a vessel. As the employee removed the manway cover, the chain fall had too much slack and slipped, catching and amputating the employee's left middle fingertip.
The employee attempted to throw a urinal up and into the dumpster. The urinal struck the top, broke, and fell back striking and lacerating the employee's right forearm.

An employee was directing the use of a tow strap to move a vehicle when the employee's left pinky finger was crushed by a quick coupler that was on a rubber tire loader. The employee's finger was amputated up to the knuckle.

An employee was working from an extension ladder to paint the side of a single-story residential home when he lost his footing, fell to the ground, struck his head on the concrete surface below, and sustained a head injury to the point of unconsciousness. He was hospitalized.
An employee was preparing to hook up a tank trailer to his truck and suffered heat exhaustion.
An employee was hospitalized for possible infection of lacerations on the left arm that the employee received while attempting to remove debris from an insulation blower.
An employee suffered a finger amputation.

An employee was performing a hot splice, hooking up temporary power to residential construction from a main distribution using a crimping tool when an arc flash occurred. He sustained second degree burns on his left arm and first and second degree burns on his face.

An employee was performing maintenance on skid steer equipment. The employee was changing the bucket and putting pins on. The lock pins were stuck so the employee used a pry bar to pop it loose, but it did not come apart. The employee asked another worker to tilt the skid while the pry bar was in the front of the equipment. The employee's left ring finger got caught between the pry bar and the skid steer carriage resulting in amputation of the finger.
While descending from the roof on an extended ladder, an employee slipped and fell approximately 4 feet from the ladder, spraining the left wrist.

An employee was doing concrete formwork when he turned into a coworker who was using a sledgehammer on a stake. The employee's left middle finger was caught and fractured between the sledgehammer and stake.

On June 30, 2016, a work crew was preparing to offload an electric utility pole from a trailer to install it into the ground. As they attempted to roll the pole off the trailer, a hook-shaped copper ground on the pole caught and wrapped up the safety vest of the injured employee, causing him to be pulled toward the rolling pole. He tried to free himself, but the pole landed on his lower right leg, breaking his fibula and dislocating his ankle.
An employee was installing a fiberglass grating when he fell off a platform, injuring his head. His harness was not tied off at the time of the incident.
An employee was setting a piece of casing in a trench when the line-up tab broke, swung off the pipe, struck the employee in the head and chest, and pinned him between the pipe and wall.

An employee was transferring diesel fuel from the middle tank of a fuel truck to the forward tank using a barrel pump when a fire/explosion occurred. The fire/explosion threw the employee off the tanker to the ground and ignited his clothing, causing second and third degree burns to his body and arms.
An employee suffered an allergic reaction to a wasp sting and was hospitalized.
An employee fell approximately 12 feet from a welded, tubular steel frame scaffold into the bottom of an empty pool, suffering a leg/foot injury.

On or about 7/1/16, at approximately 11:30 a.m., an employee was climbing into an articulating boom lift from the horizontal section of a structural steel tube that was 12 feet above the ground when he began to slip. A coworker who was in the lift went to grab the employee and was pulled out of the lift, causing both employees to fall 12 feet to the ground below. The employee was hospitalized overnight for a fractured vertebra. The coworker was not hospitalized.
An employee was replacing a 40-foot pole and was installing a lightning arrester when the arrester failed, resulting in second degree flash burns to the left side of his face. He was hospitalized.

An employee was performing duct work demolition from an extension ladder approximately 15 feet off the ground. The ladder feet slipped and the employee fell from the ladder, which then fell onto the employee. The employee suffered a dislocated shoulder and head/arm lacerations, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using an 8-foot ladder to remove a recessed "can" for lighting when he lost his balance and fell to the concrete floor, suffering a head injury.
An employee was attempting to lower a concrete piece of manhole onto another section when it fell and landed on the employee. He suffered a broken left clavicle, broken left ribs, and a broken hip.
An employee touched a live wire while installing a 277-volt light fixture, burning his right hand index finger and receiving an electrical shock.

An employee on a ladder was cutting a 3-inch copper pipe that was filled with 150 psi of nitrogen gas. As he was cutting the pipe's end cap, the pressure of the nitrogen pushed him off the ladder. He fell approximately 6 feet and landed on a nearby table, injuring the back of his body and cutting his left ear.

One employee spent the entire morning of 7/5/16 stripping forms off of concrete slabs. He fell over during his lunch break inside of the job trailer. The doctor diagnosed heat stroke and the employee was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was lowering the scale box from a Lull when the scale box slid off the Lull and fell on the employee's lower right leg, breaking the employee's femur.

An employee was pulling the sampler attached to a 140-pound hammer out of the ground using the "cat head" (a revolving spool that helps raise the hammer) when he was pulled up off the ground and into the cat head by the force of the rope being pulled. He broke his left forearm.

An employee on a ladder was removing wiring from a junction box in the ceiling while doing demolition. He removed the wires and placed wire nuts on them. The white neutral wire was hanging down. When the employee started to climb down the ladder, he touched the wire with his hand and it shocked him. When he pulled away from the shock, the fast motion broke his scapula.

The employee was tracing the power source of the AC unit on the roof and went to the third floor to disconnect the power. He stepped on a plywood piece that came loose, and he and the plywood fell down to the lower level. The impact caused him to tumble from that level to the ground. He was hospitalized with a gash to his head, three fractured neck vertebrae, and left wrist and back trauma.

An employee was installing exterior walls to a back patio storage unit. He was nailing the top sill plate with a nail gun when the gun bounced and swung down, hitting his left leg. His finger was still on the trigger, and the gun fired a nail into his leg.
While working outside and pouring concrete into forms, an employee felt sick and experienced nausea due to heat stress/exhaustion.
An employee was helping to erect a tower when a 4-pound bolt fell down the center of the tower and struck the employee's head.
An employee was carrying a piece of sheet metal with a coworker when the metal slipped and severely lacerated the employee's right arm.

An employee was walking on the cord of the roof trusses taking measurements inside the roof trusses when he stepped on a weakened area and fell approximately 10 feet to the concrete floor below breaking the L1 vertebrae and other bones.
An employee was climbing down a ladder when he fell from the last rung. He landed on a tape measure and cracked his right femur bone.
An employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.

An employee was working from a ladder installed on the top of a scaffolding system when the ladder and scaffolding pushed away from the wall, causing the employee to fall approximately 20 feet. The employee suffered a broken neck and a concussion.

An employee experienced leg pain and dizziness after a long-distance haul and light to moderate work at an outdoor single-family home construction site. He then sat in an air-conditioned truck. When he attempted to exit the truck, he fell onto the hard ground and suffered a skull fracture.
An employee was preparing to begin work and was riding in an aerial lift at low elevation when he was catapulted from the aerial lift and hit the pavement, fracturing his right ankle.
An employee was installing windows from a scaffold three stories high when he fell and suffered head trauma, requiring hospitalization.
While cutting wood on a table saw, an employee sustained a laceration from the left index fingertip down to the palm of the hand, requiring hospitalization.
An employee working on the heating/air-conditioning unit on a roof fell approximately 10 feet to the ground below. He injured his back and was hospitalized.
An employee was shocked while modifying a lighting circuit, burning his hands and causing a right index finger amputation.

An employee working in the pipe yard felt discomfort and started cramping. He decided to take a break, but his legs buckled and he collapsed to the ground. He was hospitalized with a heat-related illness.

An employee was on a beam helping coworkers remove wire from a cable tray when he fell to the floor, cutting his forehead and breaking his right hand, left-hand finger, and nose. He was wearing a safety harness but was not tied off at the time of the incident.
An employee stepped off the back of a truck bed and slipped, breaking his left foot.
An employee was helping to set elevators and was also taking trash outside when he became dizzy and nauseated. He was hospitalized for dehydration from heat stress.
An employee experienced heat stress symptoms after performing jobsite cleanup, requiring hospitalization for acute kidney injuries and dehydration.

An employee was working in the fabrication shop when a transformer across the street from the shop exploded. The employee was struck by fragments from the transformer and received lacerations to his face and left arm.
An employee was constructing a flatbed trailer for a heavy haul when he felt lightheaded and started cramping due to heat exhaustion.
An employee was installing a tongue and groove wooden ceiling from a scaffold when he fell off, fracturing his arm and wrist and requiring surgery.

While removing asphalt shingles near the chimney area on a pitched, single-story residential roof approximately 8 feet high, an employee became unstable and slipped, falling to the grass-covered ground area. He broke his leg and hip.
An employee was placing blocking between the rafters when he stepped wrong and fell from an approximate height of 16 feet to the dirt below, breaking his femur, tibia, and two vertebrae.

An employee was working on an excavator while on a catwalk. He then attempted to get off the excavator by holding onto the rail, which was unbolted from previous maintenance work. The rail came loose, and he fell from excavator, fracturing his lower left leg.
An employee fell about 20 feet from a ladder to the ground while drilling into a wood stud, suffering a broken nose and ankle.
An employee was climbing down the scaffold ladder and fell. The employee was hospitalized with fractured ribs and a spinal cord injury.

An employee was helping to position a 'cage' form into a caisson for concrete. A 2x4 that was part of the rigging came loose and hit the employee in the face, causing multiple facial fractures that required hospitalization.

An employee was spotting for a forklift driver who was attempting to lift a steel I-beam. The employee was standing on the opposite side of the I-beam pile from the forklift. When the driver began to lift the I-beam, the pile shifted. 
One of the-I beams rolled down and landed on the employee's ankle, breaking it in several places.
An employee fell through a safety rail at a height of 18-20 feet injuring their back and feet.
An employee went to the hospital with a potential heat related illness.

After working on the ground and gathering materials for the lineman, an employee became ill and started vomiting due to dehydration and heat cramps. The employee was hospitalized with heat-related illness.

An employee was removing a tire from a forklift. While removing the tire from the split rim, the employee removed all of the split rim bolts. When the tire was inflated, the split rim separated and struck the employee in the left side of his head, face, and jaw. He suffered lacerations that required surgery.

An employee was heating up a track frame pin with a torch. While the employee was removing the track frame pin, a hot bolt or part of the frame pin punctured an adjacent aerosol can of brake cleaner and the contents ignited into a ball of fame, causing thermal burns to the employee's lower left and right arms and face.
Employees were working on a wheel loader when the bucket fell off and struck an employee's left ankle, breaking it and requiring surgery.

On or about July 12, 2016, an employee was hospitalized after receiving a severe laceration to the left armpit from a dragon saw. As the employee went to set the dragon saw onto the ground with one hand, the saw was activated and jumped striking the employee under  the arm.
An employee was moving a transformer that was on a hand dolly. The employee  tilted the dolly back so that he could move it and it fell over and struck the employee in the right ankle, breaking it.
An employee was hospitalized after being struck by a transfer beam that kicked out and struck him in the abdomen resulting in a broken rib and punctured lung on the right side.
On or about July 12, 2016, an employee was using a nail gun to install wood blocking. The nail gun discharged and the nail struck the employee in the stomach area.

An employee was working from a 10 foot step ladder on an overhead register vent. As the employee went to pull down the register, he fell backwards about 5 feet to the floor below and fractured his right ankle. The employee required surgery to his ankle and was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was using a chop saw to cut a granite curb. When he set the saw down, the blade was still rotating and made contact with the curb. The saw then kicked back and struck the employee in the right shoulder and forearm, slicing his skin.
An employee fell from a 6-foot ladder and suffered a fractured leg.

An employee was installing wood bracing on the trusses. A gust of wind knocked over the trusses which caused the employee to fall approximately 16' to the ground resulting in a sprained left ankle and a fractured L6 vertebrae.

An employee fell a distance of approximately twenty feet while performing concrete work on a pour form wall. One of the engineered ties used to hold the form in place snapped allowing for concrete to pour out of the form, striking the scissor lift from which the employee was working, and causing the scissor lift to topple over. The employee fell to the ground where he sustained serious injury to his arm and pelvic region.

An employee was on a 6/12 pitch roof tearing off shingles from a single story residence. The employee was wearing a harness and attached to a lanyard that was anchored on the roof. At the time of the incident, the employee was preparing to get off the roof and disconnected his lanyard from the harness. He was transitioning to the ladder and lost his footing falling 6 to 8 feet to the ground below. The employee fractured a bone in his back and was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was attempting to stabilize the concrete barrier that was being lifted by a rubber tire loader. The operator of the rubber tire loader lowered the barrier and caught the tip of the employee's right foot resulting in amputation of the tip of the right foot to the first joint.
An employee was attempting to adjust the bars on a drill rig but the drill rig rotated and hit the employee. The employee was caught between the drill rig and the casing, suffering abdominal trauma.
An employee was climbing up a scaffold when the scaffold fell over. The employee sustained a broken leg.
An employee was hospitalized for a bruised arm and hand after he fell from a ladder.
An employee was pouring concrete when he became disoriented due to heat stress, requiring hospitalization.
An employee dismounted from a crane boom he was reconfiguring and fractured his ankle.

An employee went to retrieve a tool from another section of the cooling tower. En route, his pinky finger (left) was caught in the belt/pulley system of a maintenance fan as he passed by, amputating the fingertip.
On July 14, 2016, an employee sustained a broken foot when the outrigger on the truck landed on his right foot.
An employee climbed a pole to raise conductors off of the ground. The pole broke at the ground level while the employee was on it. The employee hit the ground and suffered a fractured right hip.
On or about July 14, 2016, an employee was performing a vertical cut in a concrete wall using a gas-powered masonry cut-off saw when the saw kicked back, lacerating the employee's chest.
An employee was coming down a ladder to leave the roof when he slipped off and fell approximately 6 feet, suffering ankle and back sprains.
An employee was flagging traffic for a construction site and was struck from behind by a truck exiting the road. The employee suffered two fractured ribs and two fractured vertebrae.

An employee was lifting panels from one place to another place, finished the job and then went home. While at home the employee felt pain in his chest. The employee went to the hospital and was admitted with a collapsed lung.

On July, 15, 2016, an employee suffered an amputation of three fingers on their left hand when their hand was crushed between the die and steel rail while operating the rail pierce machine to punch holes in a steel rail.

An employee was driving a tri-axle dump truck, delivering a load of stone to a customer at a camp ground. The employee raised the bed of the dump truck 2-3 feet and then went to observe the load. He noticed the load was unbalanced and was causing the truck to lean to the driver's side. The employee got back in the truck and started to lower the bed. At that point, the telescoping rod that raises and lowers the truck bed broke. This caused the truck to tip over onto the driver's side. The employee climbed out of the passenger side and down a ladder. The employee was  hospitalized for a fractured T-12 vertebrae.
An employee was erecting a wall and became disorientated. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized on Friday, July 15, 2016, after having an allergic reaction to epoxy flooring adhesives. The employee presented with swelling and a rash.

An employee was installing a replacement garage door at a commercial business.  During the installation, the crew released the tension off the last of three overhead springs. The spring caught the employee in the shoulder and upper right arm causing a severe laceration and pulling the employee into the side of the structure.
An employee fell from the back of a flat bed truck as he was unloading beams and ruptured his spleen.
An employee was operating a rubber tire roller. The roller went off the road and as the employee returned the roller to the road the roller tipped over resulting in injury to the employee's face.

An employee was preparing to dismantle formwork. With the wedge pins of the formwork removed, the employee attempted to step out onto an outrigger. The employee fell and his harness, tied off to the formwork, brought the form work down on his ankle, breaking the ankle.

An employee was cleaning up for the day and was setting a metal shelving unit onto the bucket of a backhoe machine. The employee lost control of the shelf and it dropped, pinching his index finger between the bucket and shelf. The finger was amputated at the first joint.

On 7/16/16, an employee had just finished filling one of the rollers with water and was walking around the roller. A second roller came by and the operator put his roller in neutral. The injured employee walked between the two rollers and was caught between the rollers resulting in a broken shoulder and arm.

An employee was dismantling scaffold when a large exhaust fan turned on. The fan blades amputated the employee's right middle fingertip below the nail bed, fractured the right ring finger and lacerated to the right index finger.
An employee was working on a 6' ladder installing a light fixture. The employee received an electrical shock and fell from the ladder fracturing his foot.

An employee was finishing the drywall on a mobile rolling scaffold when he stumbled off of the scaffold while attempting to climb on top of the scaffold's platform. He fell against the wall and pinched a nerve in his back. The employee was admitted to the hospital.
An employee suffered back and pelvic fractures when a piece of machinery fell on him.
An employee was struck by a trackhoe while working in an excavation resulting in a chest contusion and chin laceration.
An employee was conducting stucco work while on the third buck of a scaffold when he fell 18 feet to the ground resulting in facial and skull fractures. He was admitted to the hospital.
An employee on a construction site was standing while talking and suddenly passed out possibly due to heat, hitting their head on the wall and falling to the floor. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was hospitalized after he fell from a ladder while painting a building. The employee fell backwards off the ladder, which was up against a parking bumper for stability, and onto the bumper. The employee received bruises to his head and back, a broken pelvis, and two broken heels.

An employee was partially pinned underneath the front three sheets of bundled steel plates that slid off of the front of a flatbed trailer while the crane was attempting to set them down on the trailer. The employee suffered a fractured cheek bone and ocular socket, a large laceration on his back, and a dislocated shoulder.

An employee was untying a 32-foot extension ladder from the building. As the employee descended the ladder it began to slide sideways. The employee kicked free from the ladder and fell approximately 15 feet, resulting in fractured ribs and a collapsed lung.
An employee was working on a flat roof and using a pump sprayer to spray material onto the roof. He tripped over the power cord and fell and breaking his right wrist.

An employee was attempting to remove a stainless steel window sill segment from the drive-thru window system using a cordless drill. The screw he was removing reversed quickly, causing his left thumb tip to become pinched between the stainless steel section and the drill he was operating, resulting in a partial amputation.
An employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion and dehydration.
An employee was climbing a ladder, slipped due to a faulty grab bar, and fell approximately 12 feet. He was admitted to the hospital for a broken wrist and a bruise to the head.
An employee was climbing a fixed ladder to the roof and fell. The employee sustained a fractured left ankle and leg requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee fell off a porch roof approximately 10' above the ground and was hospitalized for a broken ankle and shoulder.
An employee was hospitalized with a fractured elbow after he fell 12 feet through a floor hole.
An employee was painting from a boom lift and fell 8 feet out of the lift and landed on an iron fence. She suffered an impalement injury to the right leg and a broken rib.
An employee experienced severe leg cramps and abdominal pains while working in the heat.
On July 19, 2016, an employee suffered a partial little finger amputation while guiding the well casing into a bore hole.

The injured worker was on a scaffold measuring chilling water piping. The electrician turned on the water circulating pump that was hooked onto the chilling water piping. The junction box that the wiring was inside of shorted and the injured worker received an electrical shock.

On 7/19/2016, an employee was performing maintenance on a palletizer lift elevator. The lift platform was elevated about 3 inches with a chain fall in order to adjust the lower jack bolts. The elevator dropped, crushing the employee's left index finger between the jack bolt and palletizer elevator resulting in an amputation close to the second knuckle on the left index finger.

A 4'x11' concrete form wall was being lifted with a crane. During the lift, an employee walked near the lift area to retrieve some tools. As the employee walked into the lift area, the form wall got caught on another piece of the construction project. The form wall came out of it's rigging and fell to the ground, tipped over, and struck the employee on the head and back. The employee was hospitalized and suffered 2 fractured vertebrae.

An employee stepped on a metal grate that had a weak corner from where a pipe was penetrating through the grate, lost his balance, and fell 10-16 feet into a sloped pit. The employee sustained a soft tissue injury to his left leg and ankle and a mild concussion.
The employee was supervising the expansion of a high school and suffered heat exhaustion/dehydration.
An employee was hospitalized for a heat related injury.
An employee was operating a circular saw when their vest got caught up in the saw. The employee's right quadricep was lacerated.

On July 20, 2016, at around 6:40 PM, an employee was walking at the jobsite beside the dirt mound and was struck by the skid steer that was backing up at the moment. The employee suffered a broken ankle and lower body injuries and was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was operating a table saw and amputated the left index finger while moving material away from the blade.

An employee was painting a room with a paint sprayer (approximately 2000 psi). The equipment malfunctioned and the employee's left thumb was lacerated. In addition, paint was injected into the laceration.

Rigging employees were setting a pipe that was 20 feet long, 24 inches in diameter, and weighed 5 tons. As the load was being transferred from the crane to the rack, the riggers were adjusting the chain fall hoists. Slack was taken up in one of the hoists, which caused the pipe to lift. When the pipe lifted the injured employee was straddling the beam, and the shoe plate of the pipe contacted the injured employee's left lower leg, causing a compound fracture. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery.

Employees were unloading a flatbed truck in the laydown area of the job site. An operator picked up a piece of pipe with a telehandler to unload it. Another employee signaled the operator to lower the pipe down onto the truck to readjust the straps. When the tie down strap released, the pipe rolled and struck an employee's lower right leg fracturing it. The load also struck another employee in the lower back. Both employees were knocked off the truck by the rolling pipe.

An employee was repairing cable lines at the top of a telephone pole. As he was climbing down the pole using the preinstalled pegs on the pole, he missed a step and fell 10-12 feet breaking both legs and an ankle.
An employee fell onto a safety rail and suffered broken ribs. He was wearing fall protection.
An employee was kneeling down on the ground shooting grade at an active construction jobsite when he was struck by a backing bulldozer, fracturing his ankle.

An employee was trying to flip a metal stair stringer over when it fell onto his hand and crushed his index finger between the stair stringer and the concrete resulting in the amputation of the index fingertip.
Employee fell approximately six feet from scaffolding while dismantling it and was hospitalized for cuts and a fractured arm.
An employee was welding and was hospitalized for dehydration/heat stress.

An employee was installing expansion joints on a bridge attachment while working from a man lift. The employee grabbed hold of a pipe on the bridge and sustained electrical burns to his arms and legs.
An employee helping with solar panel equipment experienced legs cramps, requiring hospitalization for heat exhaustion.
An employee fell from a ladder and fractured their femur.
An employee fell from a height of 46' and was hospitalized with a hip injury.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet and suffered broken vertebrae.

An employee was using a digging bar to loosen sand located over a cable buried in a shunt box when he impacted the primary cable. An electric flash occurred, causing first degree burns on his left forearm and a piece of sand to become lodged under his eyelid.
As the employee was standing with both hands on the JLG lift rail, a lighting strike hit the JLG. The employee was stunned, fell to the ground, and was hospitalized.
An employee was walking in the parking lot and slipped on a puddle of water rolling his ankle resulting in a right ankle injury.
An employee tripped on a pipe while walking and fell, hitting their head on the concrete. The employee was hospitalized for a head injury.

An employee had finished rolling and wrapping a deck sheet and was using a hoist with hooks to lift it when he noticed a problem and grabbed the hook.
