At the same time, the deck sheet came out of the hook on his side. His finger became wedged between the air bar with the rolled deck sheet and the bracket that holds the air bar on the power roller, partially amputating his left ring fingertip.

An employee was fixing a water line at the sawmill near the kettle burners and was digging around the line with a shovel when he experienced leg and hand cramps. He was hospitalized for dehydration and heat trauma.
An employee was struck by a steel column and suffered a broken scapula. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was outside on the ground level cleaning up when a coworker on the fifth floor threw trash out the window, which struck the employee in the head.
A stone fell from a scaffold and hit an employee who was walking under it, causing head injuries.
An employee's hand was caught between a 4 x 4 and the reaction arm on a pneumatic torque wrench, suffering a contusion.
An employee was installing form work when he fell and his leg was impaled by a piece of rebar.

An employee was on his ladder, replacing a mid-span drop. His ladder was resting on the strand (cable line from pole to pole). When he cut the line off at the mid span (toward the middle of the strand), quick release in tension caused him to fall from his ladder to the ground. He fractured his pelvis and chipped a bone in his ankle.
An employee was climbing a cell tower. The employee slipped and the safety climb did not grab. The employee's right ankle fractured.
An employee was working on stilts, hanging sheet rock, when he slipped and fell. He fractured his elbow and injured his hip, requiring hospitalization.
An employee stepped on a 7-inch rusty screw while performing roof tear-off activities.
An employee was cutting a 30-inch pipe when it rolled over his ankle and fractured it. He was hospitalized.
An employee collapsed due to potential heat illness.
An employee had been working outside on the bridge of a highway when he began to feel unwell. He was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee was prepping a load for rigging when a power arc occurred as the employee contacted a power line. The employee suffered an electrical shock.

An employee was scraping loose asphalt off the apron of a dump truck containing hot asphalt. The excavator shovel was laying in the bed of the dump truck when the dump truck started to move forward. The dump truck pulled the excavator forward, causing a blade on the excavator to strike the employee, who then fell onto the hot asphalt. The employee suffered severe burns on both forearms, a chipped left ankle bone, and broken bones in the right ankle/foot.
On July 25, 2016, at 11:30 a.m., an employee was hospitalized with a compound leg fracture after a steel drainage grate that he was carrying fell on his leg as he tripped.
An employee was installing a pin while changing out a bell bucket on a drill rig when the employee's right pinky finger was crushed and amputated.

An employee was validating the work progress at the jobsite when he picked up an available aluminum ladder and climbed to the roof of the business. As he started descending the roof using the ladder, he lost his footing and fell 15 feet to the asphalt pavement below, injuring his right side and head.
An employee was paving a road and fell into hot asphalt suffering burns to his hands and elbows.

An employee was setting a tong on a pipe to break the pipe off from the cutter. A backhoe operator thought he was getting a signal from the flagger to lower the bucket. As the backhoe operator lowered the bucket, it struck the right hand of the employee that was positioned on top of the tong. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured and lacerated right hand.

An employee was cutting loose a temporary support with an angle grinder, equipped with a 4-inch cutting blade to cut a tack weld. The grinder grabbed and jumped towards his left forearm, severely lacerating it.
An employee was struck by a bucket while engaged in cement pouring operations. The employee was hospitalized with pelvic area injuries.

An employee was walking on the roof to access the new addition area of an existing commercial building. While walking on the roof, the injured employee fell through a fiberglass panel into the interior of the building. The employee struck a conveyor belt on his way down before hitting the ground 18 feet below. The employee suffered five fractured ribs and a fractured collarbone.
An employee was climbing up a ladder to access the roof and inspect the chimney when he fell off the ladder to the ground, fracturing his rib, pelvis, and ankle. He was hospitalized.
An employee fell 8 feet though a floor opening into the basement while setting a floor joist. The employee was hospitalized with a broken arm and lower back fracture.

An employee was walking back to the concrete paver when a ready-mix truck backed into him. He was first struck by the chute, and then his lower right leg was run over. His leg broke at the ankle and below the knee, and he suffered a muscle injury.

On July 27, 2016, an employee was cutting a sewer's lateral pipe in a trench when a backhoe bucket pushed two pipes onto the employee's foot. His left foot was crushed between the pipes, requiring surgery for broken toe bones.
At 7:00 a.m., on 7/27/2016, an employee was tripping decking forms when he fell off the 5-foot step ladder, breaking ribs and his wrist. He was hospitalized.
An employee was helping to unload crane when equipment came down on his right foot, breaking it.

An employee was directing traffic near an area where a structure was being stripped. The employee entered a control zone and was struck by an aluminum beam that fell from that structure, suffering head, face, and chest injuries that required hospitalization.
A drill stem fell onto an employee's leg as it was being lifted by a crane. The employee sustained a broken leg.
An employee fell 20 to 22 feet from a ladder while cutting a tie-wire, fracturing a rib and his L1 vertebra.
An employee was cutting stakes using a skill saw and amputated his left index finger.

An employee was preparing to install ceiling tiles while working from a 10-foot step ladder. As he attempted to screw into the ceiling tiles, the nail twisted, and he lost his balance while standing on the third rung from the top of the ladder. He fell and broke both wrists.
An employee passed out and fell to the ground while climbing a ladder, breaking a femur and requiring hospitalization.

On or about July 28, 2016, at 7:00 a.m., an employee was on the second landing of a scaffold on the side of a building, preparing a chalk line to put a V-groove in a column. When he stood up, he became dizzy and fainted. He fell forward toward the building and onto a brick ledge, fracturing several vertebrae, his left scapula, and several left- and right-side ribs. He was hospitalized.
On 7/28/16, an employee was climbing a ladder when he lost his balance and fell to the ground, breaking his wrist and hip. He was hospitalized.

An employee was using a pipe threader to thread a pipe. When the employee released the chuck on the pipe threader, the pipe dropped. The cut end then came up and amputated the employee's left ring finger to the first knuckle.
An employee was using a jack hammer that collapsed and fell on his left hand, breaking his middle finger and causing an open wound.
An employee was standing on the fourth rung of an extension ladder painting an interior wall when he slipped and fell off the ladder to the concrete floor, breaking a vertebra in his back.

An employee was working in the bucket of an aerial lift to change out a two phase 13.2 KV straight line pole with a two phase pull off. The employee boomed down to get bottled water. The employee was booming back up to finish working on a pole when he made contact with the power line (tap primary) resulting in electrical burns to his left hand, right shoulder, and the right side of his face. The employee was admitted to the hospital and due to the severity of the burns on his left hand it was amputated.
An employee was pushing a drywall cart. The cart tipped over onto the employee fracturing the right femur.

Employees were removing sections of side panels from an open ended cooler that was approximately eight feet above the lower surface. As employees carried a disconnected side panel across an unbolted belly panel, the belly panel collapsed. The employees fell through the opening and the side panel they had been carrying fell with them. Employee 1 suffered a fractured left tibia and fibula and a fractured right femur. Employee 2 suffered a fractured left ankle, a dislocated left patella, and a back injury. Both employees were hospitalized.
An employee's foot was caught in a hydraulic steering component on board a docked vessel, crushing it.
An employee was putting on a metal elbow and fell, fracturing the right leg.
An employee was on a pitched roof. The employee slipped and fell sliding several feet off the roof resulting in back injuries and lacerations.

An employee was laying down sheathing and securing it to the trusses when he fell through an opening, landing on the pavement below. He fell approximately 14 feet, suffering head and back trauma and requiring hospitalization.
While decking on the roof, an employee became overheated and required hospitalization for heat exhaustion.

An employee was tack welding with an automatic MIG welder. The employee was holding the steel part with one hand and engaged the pneumatic clamp with the other hand. The clamp smashed and amputated his left middle finger.
An employee was using a 12-foot step ladder when the pin on the ladders bracing broke causing him to fall to the ground. The employee suffered cracked ribs and a fractured coccyx.

On 08/01/2016, an employee was working on a 12-foot ladder gluing PVC pipe onto the ceiling when a brace on the ladder broke, causing the employee to fall 12 feet to the floor. The employee suffered broken ribs and a fractured pelvis.

An employee was installing a ductwork hanger while working about 14 feet from the ground level on the metal trusses. He fell 14 feet from the trusses, injuring his head and breaking his ribs, shoulders, and back.
An employee fell approximately 8 feet down an extension ladder. He landed on a rock and broke bones in his foot.
An employee was bending pipe when his thumb became pinched between the pipe and the bender shoe, amputating his thumb tip.
An employee in an aerial lift was installing sandwiches between precast panels when the panels collapsed and fell on top of the lift. He suffered a broken leg and wrist.
An employee was carrying a concrete cap when the cap slipped and struck the employee's left forearm, resulting in an open fracture.
An employee fell 35 feet while snapping bolts, suffering broken ribs and bruised lungs.

On or about August 2, 2016, at approximately 3:30 p.m., an employee was helping to install roofing underlayment when he stepped on wet membrane material and slid off the roof, falling more than 12 feet to the ground below and lacerating his head and tongue.
An employee was standing by a concrete pump when a hose connected to the pump broke loose and struck the employee in the face, causing a laceration and nose fracture.
An employee was cutting a tree into smaller pieces when he began to feel ill. He was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.

On August 2, 2016, at approximately 5:15 p.m., an employee who had been welding pile splices and performing pile-driving work began to feel ill and lost consciousness. The employee was hospitalized for heat-related illness.

An employee was at a client's jobsite sweeping up debris in a new room addition to a home. He stepped onto an area that was covered with sheetrock and fell 14 feet to the lower level onto a staircase below, hitting his head and breaking his ankle.
An employee on a ladder was shocked while installing circuits in an electrical junction box. The employee fell off the ladder and suffered a head injury, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell 22 feet to the ground while placing decking, suffering a broken pelvis, elbow, wrist, and nose.
An employee was carrying a door frame and door when it slipped and fell, bending the employee's right index finger backward and dislocating it. The employee required surgery.
An employee suffered from heat exhaustion while performing metal framing on a new construction prior to installing drywall, requiring hospitalization.
An employee on a ladder was applying flashing to a roof that was 17 feet high when the flashing ignited. The employee dismounted from the ladder and fell to the ground, fracturing the tailbone.
After spending all day installing a fence, an employee became ill and was hospitalized due to dehydration/heat exhaustion.

An employee was installing wind-ties between trusses on a new construction building when he started noticing cramping in his right arm. He was moved to a shady area to rest when he started vomiting. He was hospitalized due to dehydration.
On or about August 3, 2016, the wire rope on a rigging system broke, allowing a hinge pin to fall about 20 to 30 feet and strike an employee's left arm.

An employee was troubleshooting a light fixture when he came into contact with an energized circuit. He was working from a scissor lift at a height of approximately 19 feet. After the shock, he fell out of the scissor lift and landed on the concrete surface below, suffering multiple fractures and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using a high-pressure water line (6,000 psi) lance to clean out a tar line when the lance kicked back and lacerated his neck and upper chest. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee was leaving a mobile tool trailer when the door broke and caught his right index and middle fingers, amputating his fingertips.
An employee was climbing up the third or fourth rung of a ladder when he fell to the ground and hit his head. He was hospitalized with a fractured vertebra.
An employee tripped and stepped into an open manhole. He fell across the manhole, fracturing two ribs and puncturing a lung.
After working in the heat, an employee was riding with his coworkers back to the company yard when he began to feel sick. He was hospitalized with stomach pains and possible heat-related injuries.
An employee fell 4 to 5 feet off a scaffold to the ground while preforming masonry work, suffering a hip/rib injury.
An employee was walking from one location to another and needed to step over a small foundation wall. His foot became caught on a wire and he tripped and fell 1.5 feet, fracturing his tibia.
An employee was flagging for traffic control when a tandem dump truck struck her and ran over both of her feet. Her left foot was fractured and bruised.
An employee was hospitalized due to heat stress.
An employee hurt his finger while using a screwdriver to perform electrical work.

An employee was in the process of removing an overhead roll-up door. While the employee was removing bolts from the door, the "D-Ring" swung out of place and struck the employee's ladder, causing the employee to fall and break an arm.
An employee was gathering roofing debris in a wheel barrow when he tripped and fell on roofing material, breaking his right ankle and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was working on the lower leg of a standing tower, installing steel members and bolts, when he fell approximately 30 feet from the tower to the concrete ground. He fractured his sternum, pelvis, leg, and arm.
A decoiler slipped off of forklift straps and crushed an employee's right-hand pinky and middle fingers, amputating them.
An employee fell through a skylight while installing a new roof. He injured his wrist and spleen and broke his eye socket.

An employee was holding the top of a small manway cover and abrasive blasting the handle. The force of the blast media hitting the cover caused the cover to twist in the employee's hand, which caused his left hand to move into the blasting media stream. The blast media penetrated the back of his glove and abraded the back of his hand.

An employee was carrying a ladder on his hip when he tripped and fell, landing on top of the ladder. He later experienced irregular breathing and was hospitalized with nine fractured ribs, a collapsed lung, a broken collar bone, and shoulder and hip sprains.
An employee was climbing a ladder when he fell off and broke his right arm.
An employee was testing electrical voltage when an electrical arc flash occurred. The employee suffered electrical burns to the arms and was hospitalized.
An employee fell 3' 11'' and dislocated the right shoulder.
An employee suffered a fractured ankle during a scaffolding collapse and simultaneous fall, requiring hospitalization.
On or about August 8, 2016, an employee was exposed to excessive heat while tearing off a flat roof and was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.
An employee was retrieving material from a drying rack and descending a 4-foot ladder when he fell and suffered a broken hip, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was operating a large farm tractor outdoors when he experienced blurred vision, slurred speech, a queasy stomach, and unsteadiness. He was hospitalized with heat-related illness.
An employee was using a skill saw to cut plywood for concrete forms and cut his left index finger to the middle of the nailbed (no bone loss).
An employee was using a drift pin to align form holes for assembly. When the employee struck the pin, a shard flew up into his interior nostril, lacerating it.

Workers were offloading jersey barriers from a trailer when they lost control of one of the jersey barriers, causing it to strike an employee in the back. The employee rolled off the trailer and laid down on the ground. The employee was hospitalized with L2 and L3 vertebrae fractures.
An employee was removing a strap from a column that was being adjusted using a forklift. The strap released from the load and struck the employee in the face, causing head trauma.
While painting an awning, an employee fell about 15 to 16 feet and fractured his femur.

An employee entered a trench that was properly shored with a steel trench box and access ladder. The employee was using a cut off saw to cut through an abandoned water main. The section of main was isolated/shut off and restrained from the live portion of the main the prior day. The employee successfully cut through the main and turned around to place the cut off saw on 
the ground. As he did, the water main valve from the live portion of the 
main failed and separated from the pipe striking his knee. Water from the main began to fill the trench. As the employee began to exit the trench box his hard hat fell off. The employee fell and his head hit the spreader bar. The employee suffered a left knee fracture and a head contusion.
An employee fell 4 feet off a ladder, fracturing the lower left leg.
An employee was shoveling asphalt when he began to feel unwell. He was hospitalized for heat exhaustion/dehydration.
An employee was holding onto a scaffold when a metal flashing on top of the scaffold fell and struck the employee's left forearm, lacerating it.
An employee stepped on a piece of bridge decking and fell through to the ground, suffering a cut on the head and one broken rib.
On or about 8/09/2016, an employee was guiding an operator who was lowering a concrete mat. The spreader bar came loose and hit the employee in the lower back, fracturing his right femur.
An employee was climbing an extension ladder to place a clamp when he fell 8 feet to the ground, bruising his forehead and lacerating his nose, lip, and back.
An employee working from a ladder suffered an electrical shock. The employee fell from the ladder and suffered fractures to the face and back/neck, requiring hospitalization.
An employee's right index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was offloading a termite mini excavator from a trailer when the excavator missed the ramp and began to tip over. The employee dismounted the excavator and broke the left femur, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee on a scaffold had been welding on a pipe structure for 8 to 8.5 hours. When he came down off of the scaffold, he exhibited signs and symptoms of dehydration, hyperglycemia, and heat exhaustion, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was finishing up concrete padding operations in 90- to 91-degree temperatures with a 105 to 106 heat index when he felt dizzy and experienced cramping. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was assembling scaffolding, took a step back, and fell down the stairwell dislocating the right wrist.

An employee was changing a viber plate on a mini-excavator and aligning the shim when the driver in the cab accidentally bumped the lever, causing the arm of the machine to pinch the employee's thumb. The employee's thumb tip was amputated and thumb bone was smashed, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was getting ready to step from the roof onto a ladder when it started to rain. He fell to the ground and suffered back and sprain injuries.
The injured worker was installing a pet drinking fountain when he became dizzy and disoriented which resulted in hospitalization for heat stroke.
While helping to install a metal hand railing, an employee suffered cramping due to working in the heat. The employee was hospitalized overnight for heat exhaustion.

An employee was retrieving work equipment from the roof when he fell through a hole cut by another employee. He suffered broken ribs, cracked vertebrae, and a dislocated shoulder, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was using a side boom along a pipeline when the wooden mat broke apart and the lift began to rock. The employee exited the side boom and landed on some rocks, injuring his left elbow, ribs, abdominal area, lungs, and the right side of his face. He was hospitalized.
An employee stepped into an open pit and fell 4.5 feet to the concrete floor, breaking the right femur and requiring surgery.

An employee was operating a table saw to cut a piece of wood when the wood became bound in the saw blade and kicked back, causing the employee's left thumb to contact the blade. The thumb tip was amputated with some bone loss.
While cutting metal studs with a chop saw in hot weather, an employee did not feel well and was hospitalized due to dehydration.

On 8/11/2016, at approximately 3:05 PM, an employee was cutting a stair stringer with a circular saw when the board moved. As he attempted to grab the board, the saw kicked back and amputated his left middle fingertip.
An employee  was installing cable system at an apartment complex and was overcome by heat.
An employee was attempting to rig a solid web rafter beam when the beam leaned toward the employee and fractured the employee's right foot.
While working from the roof of a house, an employee fell approximately 20 feet from the roof eave to the ground. The employee suffered a fractured right heel and was hospitalized.
An employee fell approximately 13 feet from the roof while attempting to install an anchor, suffering a fractured pelvis.
An employee was carrying a pipe to a dumpster when the pipe dropped and landed on his leg. He was hospitalized with a broken leg.
As an employee was walking on site, he felt lightheaded and headed over to the gang box, where he blacked out. He was hospitalized for possible heat-related illness.
While changing/replacing lighting from an extension ladder, an employee received an electrical shock and fell 20 feet, breaking a tibia.

An employee was signaling a backhoe while doing excavation. His hand was holding onto a chain that was attached to a trench box and the backhoe. He signaled the backhoe, which moved the trench box. When the weight shifted, the employee's hand was pinched by the chain, avulsing and fracturing his left ring finger.
An employee was installing electrical conduit when he fell 3 feet, 7 inches through an expansion joint opening in the floor, landing on top of an I-beam and injuring his vertebrae.

At approximately 2:30 PM on August 6, 2016, an employee fell off the roof of a commercial building into a keg of hot tar and suffered burns to approximately 70 percent of his body. He was hospitalized.
An employee fell approximately 12-13 feet off of a roof and suffered a broken hip that required surgery and four broken ribs.  Fall protection was not used at the time of the incident.
An employee fell off of a roof while cleaning a window and landed on a concrete wall. The employee was hospitalized with broken ribs.
An employee received electrical burns to both hands and the left forearm while pulling wires from an energized breaker panel.

An employee operating a forklift was lifting a small dumpster on a 1- to 2-degree slope when the forklift tipped over. The employee jumped out of the forklift during the descent and was struck on the right calf by the overhead bars, suffering tissue and ligament damage.
An employee was repairing a motorized tarp on a side-dumper semi-trailer when his fingers became caught in the drive chain and sprocket, amputating his left ring finger to the first knuckle.
After working all morning, an employee began to have cramping and feel ill. The employee later collapsed and was hospitalized for heat-related illness.
An employee fell off a ladder while installing lightning protection on the roof, fracturing a left rib, the left tibia, and an ankle.
An employee was repairing a metal roof. The employee stepped on a glass skylight. The glass broke and the employee fell 12 feet to the floor below fracturing his left hand.
An employee was putting up wall boards while working from a ladder when he fell and landed on a screw gun, injuring his right arm and triceps.
An employee fell onto gravel and lacerated his head. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell from an extension ladder while installing gutters, breaking the pelvis/hip.
While moving an aerial lift, an employee came in close proximity to a powerline. The power line arc-flashed and the employee sustained an electrical shock, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was kneeling and nailing shingles on a roof when a nail struck his right knee. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee experienced heat stress while performing bridge work in 86-degree weather, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was loading an asphalt kettle when the asphalt splashed on and burned his hands, face, and chest.
An employee was setting up a plastic pipe on the fusing machine when the ring finger on his left hand was caught and amputated between the mechanism of the fusing machine and the plastic gas pipe.

On August 15, 2016, at approximately 11:00 a.m., an employee was constructing a storage tank. The employee was standing on grating that surrounded the tank and at a height of approximately 47 to 48 feet. Because there were no railings, the employee wore a full body harness and was tied off to the structure. While he was tightening a bolt, the ratchet slipped off and he fell from the grating. During the fall, his right arm struck the structure, amputating his right ring finger and lacerating his arm. He was hospitalized.

An employee was working on a project on site. He was cutting trim with a circular saw when the trim piece slipped and he tried to keep it from falling. In the process of grabbing the piece of falling trim, his left index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was operating a barge with two steel beams stacked on the deck. As he approached another barge, he slightly tapped it. When he tapped the barge, the top steel beam slid and pinned him against a wall, injuring his torso and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing a cable outside a customer's home using a 6-foot ladder when he fell from the ladder and broke his left tibia.
An employee fell and twisted an ankle while setting up an extension ladder.
An excavator struck an employee, pulling the employee's left ankle under the right track of the machine. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery for a left ankle fracture.
An employee fell from a scaffold after a cable line broke, breaking his leg and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was positioned at the base of the pole, aligning it into the correct position. As the employee was stepping forward, a chain hoist fell from an overhead bucket truck/personnel lift, striking the employee on the hard hat. He suffered a fractured C1 vertebra and was hospitalized.
An employee received a deep laceration on his thumb while using a circular saw to cut wood.

An employee was using a wrench to disconnect a nut on a cable on the back side of the switch gear when an arc flash occurred. The employee received second and third degree burns to his hands and both knees.
An employee fell from a crate while drywalling, lacerating his eyebrow.

An employee was holding a stake in place while a coworker used a sledgehammer to strike it in place for forming. The employee lost his balance and held onto the stake at the same time that it was being struck by the sledgehammer. The sledgehammer struck and broke his left index finger.
An employee was installing guttering at a commercial construction site when he fell approximately 28 feet to the ground. He was hospitalized with a fractured vertebra and required surgery.
An employee was taking the chain off a cage that stored concrete foundation forms. When the chain was removed, the forms fell on the employee, breaking his left hip and ankle.
An employee was installing solar panels from a ladder. When he stepped down from the ladder, he was hit by a trailer that was passing by, breaking his right leg.
An employee was finishing concrete in a man lift under a bridge. When the man lift was raised, his arm struck the bridge beam and broke.
An employee was cut on the left hand while making a plunge cut.
While installing a stone veneer on a chimney, an employee fell approximately 8 feet from the roof, suffering a broken left ankle and wrist and a fractured pelvis. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was using a safety tool designed to unstop a paint sprayer (spray gun) when the gun blew paint out the front or side and injected it into the employee's fingertip. He underwent surgery to remove the paint/debris.
An employee suffered a back injury while securing a strap on a trailer with a ratcheting strap and bar.

An employee was operating a paving machine and was backing up in a closed lane when a truck swerved into the closed lane. The truck's side mirror struck the employee knocking him to the ground. He struck his head on the pavement, and the truck ran over his right wrist fracturing it.
An employee was working in a trench when it collapsed on the employee, breaking the employee's femur.
On August 19, 2016, an employee fell from an extension ladder and hit his head on the floor. He also broke a tooth and injured his ribs and wrist. He was hospitalized.
An employee fell off a 4-foot ladder and hit his head.
Two employees were shocked when the ladder they were holding contacted a powerline.
On or about August 19, 2016, at approximately 9:00 a.m., an employee fell from a height while performing tear-off of a roof on a 2-story residence, suffering a serious back injury.
An employee was injured while hooking up two pieces of steel when the pig tail hook became caught on a beam on the ground, which rolled the beam onto the employee's leg.
An employee was attempting to descend from a scaffold that tipped. He fell 5.5 feet from the scaffold onto a 3-foot ladder and suffered a laceration.

An employee was on an extended scissor lift tightening a bolt when the bolt broke and threw him between the top rail and the chain of the scissor lift. He fell 20 feet to the concrete below resulting in a head injury.

An employee was using an oxygen/acetylene torch to un-solder a copper line on an HVAC system when refrigerant oil or oil vapors in the system ignited and caused a flash fire. The employee sustained first degree burns to his left arm and minor burns to his face.
An employee was repairing/installing insulation on top of a panel when he fell approximately 25 feet through the roof to the ground below, breaking his leg.

An employee was removing plastic inserts from the back side of a precast panel. He was standing on a trailer, which had the precast wall on the bed. When he stepped out, he lost his footing and fell 4 feet to the ground on his right side, head and shoulder first. He fractured some right-side ribs and his collarbone, and his right lung collapsed.

An employee was welding pipe as part of a compressor change-out when pressurized oil in the pipe released and ignited. The employee suffered burns to his wrists and face and was hospitalized for treatment.

While pouring concrete, an employee felt dizzy and lost his balance, possibly due to heat exposure, and fell backwards striking his head on an unknown object. He was hospitalized and required stitches.
An employee was standing on the ground tightening a bolt with a wrench. The wrench slipped and the employee fell, fracturing his right hip.

An employee was cutting one single roofing paver that was not fitting properly at a doorway. He was using a handheld electric saw and the saw slipped and caught the employee's work glove cutting his thumb.

An employee was standing on a ladder plugging in the garage door opener motor. He began to fall and grabbed the metal frame that holds the motor to the ceiling. When his hand contacted the metal, he sustained a laceration to the first knuckle of his left ring finger and his pinky finger was amputated.

An employee was preparing to add a stiffener to a cross-brace and was loosening a nut on a bolt of the cross-brace. After the nut was removed from the bolt, the cross-brace moved and the employee's fall protection slid off the cross-brace. He fell approximately 45.6 feet to the ground, breaking his ribs, collarbone, and pelvis.
An employee was on an 8-foot ladder hanging wire supports when he lost his balance, fell off the ladder, and struck the concrete floor, fracturing his elbow, hip, and vertebrae.

An employee was working on the deck of the barge assisting with securing the dredge swing anchor. The employee placed his left hand between the anchor and the side of the barge. While lifting the anchor, the employee's left thumb was crushed and suffered a partial amputation (above the knuckle).
An employee had been working in a bucket truck doing overhead electrical line work all day. Later that evening, the employee started feeling ill and was admitted to the hospital for heat exhaustion.

An employee fainted while on top of a ladder and fell approximately 10 ft. to the ground. The employee was hospitalized for fractured vertebrae, a fractured sternum, a fractured thumb, bruised lungs and bleeding in the brain.
An employee was picking up trash at the site. At the end of the day, he started having cramps and not feeling well. He was hospitalized overnight for dehydration.
An employee was installing new utility lines. While cutting through an abandoned electrical line, he struck a live line and was shocked and burned, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was descending a step ladder and fell 5 feet onto the right hip resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was loading plywood onto a pallet to be lifted out of a tank. Three sheets of plywood fell on the employee causing the employee to fall and fracture the left tibia and fibula.
An employee fell three feet off a ladder and fractured the right ankle.
An employee was running underground conduit and began cramping. The employee was hospitalized for possible heat-related illness.
An employee was hospitalized for dehydration after working at a jobsite setting pipe and operating equipment.
Two employees were hospitalized after an arc flash burned their hands, arms and faces.

An employee was guiding the hose and pouring concrete on the jobsite. When there was a build up of air pressure in the machine, the hose started to shake and the metal portion of the hose struck the employee in the head. The employee fell backwards onto a piece of horizontal rebar and fractured five ribs on the right side. The employee also suffered a contusion on the right arm and a minor chemical burn in the eyes from the concrete.
Employee was cutting a base plate with a band saw. As the employee was cleaning off the metal shavings, the band saw caught his glove and amputated the left index finger above the knuckle.

An employee was operating a tractor and mowing around the lake. When the tractor came close to sliding into the lake, the employee jumped off of the tractor and struck the front of the tractor with his left foot resulting in lacerations.
An employee was stepping off a ladder, tripped over a copper AC line, and dislocated an ankle.

An excavator was lifting a compactor out of an excavation. The cable that was used to lift the compactor slipped and an employee was repositioning the cable when his finger was caught between the cable and the compactor resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was standing on a folded up step ladder on a scaffold platform. The ladder was leaning against the wall and caused the scaffold to tip over. The employee sustained a head injury that required hospitalization.
While returning to the construction site from lunch, an employee slipped/tripped and fell onto the excavator blade lacerating the employee's right shin. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was stepping onto the roof, slipped on an air hose, and fell eight feet to the ground fracturing his wrist.

An employee was spreading concrete on the second floor of a construction project from a truck-mounted concrete pump with a 4-section placing boom. The boom fell onto the employee's leg resulting in a broken right ankle and a broken left leg.

On August 25, 2016, an employee unstrapped a concrete form to remove it and as they were lifting it with the crane one of the filler forms fell and struck the employee. The employee was hospitalized with a broken right collar bone, facial abrasions, a head laceration and a contusion on the right shoulder.

On August 28, 2016, the owner of the independent contractor crew and his laborer were moving a wheel barrow of material when it struck a metal pole of a pump jack scaffold. The pump jack scaffold was dislodged and the top pole of the scaffold struck an overhead power line. Both men attempted to move the wheel barrow and the scaffold with their hands and received an electrical shock and third degree burns to their hands. Both were hospitalized.
An employee was using a high pressure washer and lacerated his hand between his thumb and index fingers.
On or about August 26, 2016, an employee was walking on rebar when the tie wire broke causing the rebar to come up and cause a puncture wound.

A bin wall was set in place by a crane. As the employee was disconnecting the bridles and the crane swung away, the bin wall shifted and pinned the employee crushing his pelvis and fracturing the L2 vertebra.
A crew member became nauseous, was throwing up and had cramping in the hand and wrist. This incident occurred while working on a barge. The barge was not docked at the port.

An employee was installing insulation from a scaffold in a kneeling position. An insulation clip fell onto the scaffold planking. Debris became airborne and got into the employee's right eye, lacerating the cornea.
An employee was hooking a dolly onto a crane. The dolly rolled and pinned the employee between the dolly and crane fracturing the employee's pelvis.
On August 26, 2016, at approximately 10:30 AM an employee was cutting a barrel. The barrel exploded and the employee suffered several burns and broke his left leg.
An employee fell through a roof and was hospitalized with a concussion, a broken right elbow and cuts and scrapes.
An employee was hosing down dust at a demolition site and was struck by a piece of concrete resulting in a broken bone in the face and arm.
An employee exiting a crane was walking on the tracks and slipped and fell two feet off the tracks breaking the right leg.
An employee slipped and fell from a ladder striking his head on the floor. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was ripping a board using a circular saw and amputated part of his left thumb.
An employee was installing attic insulation and fell from a ceiling joist that was not properly nailed in place. The employee fractured their wrist.
An employee suffered first and second degree burns to his face, chest, right shoulder, arm and hand when he was sprayed with hot power steering fluid from the concrete truck.
An employee was removing light fixtures and fell off a ladder injuring vertebrae and fracturing fingers.
An employee was cutting pipe duct material with a knife and suffered cuts to the arm.
An employee was tied off on a beam while working inside a hoist way. The employee lost their balance and fell into an exposed drywall stud causing a laceration on the elbow/forearm requiring surgery.
An employee slipped on a piece of glass and fell while using stilts fracturing the right patella.

An employee was washing out a concrete bucket beside the guardrail of a bridge when a concrete delivery truck struck and pinned him between the left front side of the concrete delivery truck and the bridge guardrail. The employee sustained an injury to his right leg and was hospitalized.

An employee was driving a skid steer loader with chunks of blacktop in the bucket. The bucket was raised and the employee dumped the load into the dump truck. A large piece of blacktop was hanging over the edge of the dump truck and a piece broke off and fell, striking the employee's right knee and fracturing the knee cap.
An employee was helping to remove a door when the door fell onto the employee injuring their neck.
An employee was climbing a ladder to the roof to remove materials and fell 12 feet resulting in a broken right ankle and leg.
An employee was performing roofing work when his aluminum ladder came in contact with overhead power lines. The employee was shocked.
As the employee was straightening a rebar to lay a block, the rebar snapped. The employee fell 14 feet over a parapet breaking the right knee and pelvis.
An employee fell from a ladder and hurt his back.
An employee had his feet up on a brace.  The brace failed and the employee fell to the ground fracturing an arm and vertebrae.

The employee was on the top rung of an 8-foot step ladder counting end of the month inventory and fell. The employee struck his right arm and hand during the fall and suffered an orbital fracture and concussion upon impact with the concrete floor.

An employee had just completed airing up a tire and walked over to the tool table to retrieve the valve stem cap. When the employee returned to the tire and was screwing the valve stem cap on, the tire suddenly depressurized causing the tire and rim to strike the employee. The employee suffered multiple fractures to the face, chest and ribs, a head laceration and a broken elbow.
An employee was hospitalized for heat-related illness.
An employee was working and began cramping and not feeling well. The employee was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee was connecting natural gas service to a ground-mounted HVAC unit and stepped backwards into a wash-out ditch, breaking a leg.
An employee was hanging drywall when planking from the scaffold attached to the wall gave way. The employee fell approximately 10 feet and broke both legs.
An employee was riding a bicycle at the jobsite, swerved to avoid striking another employee and hit a containment wall. The employee fell from the bicycle and fractured the left hip.
An employee was walking across the barge deck when a rigging spreader bar fell over onto the employee's foot and broke bones in the foot.
An employee was inserting wires through electrical conduit and fell from an A-frame ladder. The employee fractured his skull and two ribs and suffered four compressed discs.
An employee suffered dehydration while working on a roof installing insulation.
Employees were working on a 3 phase power line and the employee made contact with an energized powerline resulting in third degree burns to the right shoulder.
An employee felt dizzy and fell approximately 10 feet from a ladder fracturing a leg.
An employee was on a ladder rewiring an electrical ballast in the ceiling when he received an electrical shock and fell 15 feet, hitting his head on the surface below.
While cleaning, an employee fell approximately 9 feet through a skylight and broke bones in his back.
An employee was working on a mast climber work platform cord when the machine turned on and the railing pulled in his hand, crushing his right forearm.
An employee was installing a metal roof and handing sheet metal to his coworkers above when the sheet metal slid off the roof and cut him from his elbow to his shoulder.
An employee was using a torque head to set the pressure in a hydraulic hose to 1,725 psi when the hose formed a pinhole and injected hydraulic oil into the employee's right index finger.

A 14-foot deep trench caved in while an employee was operating a track hoe nearby causing the track hoe to tilt. When he attempted to exit the machine, his foot was caught between the door and the ground, fracturing his left ankle.

On September 06, 2016, at approximately 5:10 AM, an employee was welding a window on a pipe of a boiler header when hot water and steam suddenly came out from an open pipe that was next to the other pipe, burning the employee's legs, torso, and arms. He was hospitalized.
An employee was moving steel tubes using a dolly. While taking a tube from the dolly, the employee's middle and little fingers were caught and amputated.
An employee was repairing the rod on a bore machine when a clamp closed on his left hand, amputating his middle fingertip.

An employee was cutting a concrete form on a window sill using an angle grinder with a cut-off blade. The grinder went through the plywood and struck the concrete, resulting in a kickback that caused the grinder to strike and deeply lacerate the employee's chest. He was hospitalized.

Two employees were removing form panels from an upper elevation while working from the basket of a lift. One of the employees had his right hand on the basket's handrail, which came in contact with the building's steel beam. The employee suffered a partial amputation of the right ring fingertip.
On September 7, 2016, an employee was hospitalized overnight for dehydration after building a brick wall with the mason group.

An employee was dismantling a scaffold when the pin from the toe board came out, lifting the guardrail up. The employee went to grab the guardrail as it was falling and fell with it. The employee fell approximately 20 feet to the ground below, fracturing an arm and cheekbones and suffering numerous contusions.

An employee was reviewing drawings in a work cart, misjudged some material over the floor, and tripped over a spool of wire or piece of metal. The employee fell to the ground breaking his right wrist.

An employee was walking beside a moving large rubber-tired loader, providing hand signals and verbal guidance to the loader operator who was transporting a piece of equipment, when the loader tire ran over the employee's left foot. He suffered a broken left foot that required hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was using a circular saw to cut 2x4 pieces of wood when the saw kicked back and struck the employee's left hand, amputating the ring finger at the middle joint and the middle finger just below the fingernail. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was setting up a scaffold to work on painting a ceiling and fell off the scaffold breaking their heel.
An employee was servicing an elevator when he was caught between the elevator and was hospitalized with injuries to his abdominal area.

An employee was cleaning a packer machine when his hand contacted the area where a compressing piston was moving and his right index finger was squashed. His right index finger had to be surgically amputated.
An employee fell 15 feet from a metal deck to the concrete floor below and broke a leg.

An employee was threading and preparing to install a fire water pipe when several employees began to experience respiratory irritation. A visible plume of hydrofluoric acid gas was in the vicinity. The crew began evacuating the unit and an employee was hospitalized for treatment.
On September 7, 2016, an employee working on insulating pipes was hospitalized for possible heat illness.
While disconnecting the hook from a lifting eye, an employee's right middle finger was caught and crushed between the street plate and the hook.

On 9/9/2016, at approximately 1:30 PM, an employee and coworker were trying to uncrate electrical switchgear. They were using tools to pry the switchgear's cabinet off the wooden pallet when the switchgear shifted over onto the employee's right foot and knocked him backwards, leaving him hanging over the mezzanine by his caught foot.  When his coworker righted the cabinet, it freed his foot, causing him to fall head-first to the concrete floor below. He suffered skull fractures, right leg/ankle fractures, and shoulder and arm injuries, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was setting up a wire reel when the reel axle came down and crushed the employee's left index fingertip between the axle and the jack.
An employee was washing down his truck with the tag trailer down when the truck moved forward and pinned him underneath the wheels of the tag trailer. His lower body and pelvis were crushed.

An employee was performing service/maintenance on a roof top refrigeration unit. While testing the temperature of the refrigeration line, the employee's right hand was struck by a fan blade, lacerating and fracturing the right middle finger. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was cleaning asphalt material from the back of a truck with a scraper when the truck's tailgate moved and trapped his right pinky finger in a pinch point, amputating it to the second joint.
An employee was using a portable bandsaw to cut a metal I-beam when the saw blade amputated the employee's left index finger.
An employee was shoveling an excavation wall next to a roller when the roller slid down and pinned his leg, causing injuries.
An employee suffered hand/finger injuries as he was helping to unload corrugated metal sheets/sea walls from a truck. The metal sheets were being removed with a back-hoe and chain.
An employee severed his left index finger and lacerated his left middle finger.

An employee was going to weld on the casing of a drilling rig. The employee was sitting on/near the control panel with the right hand on the traveling chain and left hand near the controls. The employee's left hand bumped the controls, causing the traveling chain to move. The chain caught the employee's right hand, amputating three fingertips to the first knuckle.
An employee was carrying and tying a rebar throughout the work day in a warehouse when he began to feel unwell. He was hospitalized due to heat stress.

An employee was removing broken pieces of concrete from a recently demolished road deck. He was flipping the lagging boards when he slipped and fell through the boards 28 feet to the ground below. He suffered a broken pelvis, ruptured spleen, and broken ribs and was hospitalized.

An employee was working from the ground prepping for setup at a home site when the homeowner attempted to pull a tarp, which was held down by bricks, off the roof. The bricks fell from the roof and struck the employee in the head, causing a concussion that required hospitalization.

On or about September 09, 2016, an employee was cutting a small section of 3" PVC piping with a battery-powered bandsaw. The employee's left middle finger came in contact with the blade, amputating the fingertip.

Employees were uprighting a steel beam while constructing a gas station frame. A beam was being hoisted when one edge became stuck on the dunnage. When the beam swung loose, it struck an employee, causing the employee to be caught between the hoisted beam and a beam on the ground. The employee suffered a compound fracture to the left leg.

While installing insulation on the back side of a kitchen exhaust hood duct, an employee's hand came into contact with a live exposed 277 VAC wire. The employee received an electrical shock and was hospitalized.

An employee was using a pneumatic nail gun to secure roof decking when a nail shot through the employee's shoe into the top of the foot and was embedded in the bone. The employee required overnight hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was setting equipment when he became dizzy due to heat stress and fell out of his truck, striking his head on the ground. He was hospitalized with a head contusion and a drop in blood pressure.
An employee was loading a tire rim into a truck when the tire rim slipped and pinched his left pinky finger between the rim and a grease gun, fracturing his fingertip and requiring surgery.

An employee was standing on a scaffold to set a stone in place. The stone panel slipped out of the synthetic webbing sling and struck the scaffold platform, causing the planks to separate. The employee fell through the scaffold about 35 feet, breaking his right leg and right ankle.
An employee fell about 40 feet while installing a new valve, suffering head and body trauma.

An employee and his crew were loading steel coils onto a barge for shipment. As a coil was being lowered onto the saddle-shaped dunnage, the employee used his right foot to adjust the position of the dunnage board. He missed the board and the coil came down on top of the steel-toed cap of his boot, which collapsed onto his right toes. His big-toe nailbed was crushed and his second toe was fractured. His third and fourth toes were surgically amputated just below the nailbed.

An employee was supervising as a forklift operator was unloading switchgear. While retracting the forks, the forklift operator backed into a lip on the ground, which caused the forks to lift up and the switchgear to tip over. The switchgear fell onto the employee's right leg, breaking two bones.

While attempting to set grating to weld it into place, an employee fell approximately 30 feet from a mid-point rest platform and suffered a broken collarbone and nose. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee suffered a hernia and was hospitalized.

An employee was removing a beam cross framing when the existing welds connecting the end dam steel to the bridge beams broke free and struck the employee, fracturing his leg, knee, and foot. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting insulation with a knife when his hand slipped, cutting and puncturing his upper right forearm. He required surgery.
An employee slipped off the second step of a ladder while descending and fell to the ground, fracturing his left hip and requiring surgery.
An employee was stripping a concrete form in a building basement when he lost his balance and fell approximately 4 feet onto a concrete slab. He was hospitalized with a concussion.
An employee was cutting a piece of wood with a skill saw when the saw kicked back and amputated two fingers.
On September 13, 2016, an employee was placing concrete when he became ill due to dehydration and lost consciousness. He was hospitalized.

An employee was in an aerial bucket, trimming trees to get to a communication cable. As he moved the bucket, it touched the powerline, resulting in an electrical shock. He suffered severe burns to both arms and was hospitalized.

An employee was standing on a 3-foot scaffold platform, screwing sheetrock into the metal studs when he lost his footing and fell off the scaffold. He fell through the open door onto sheetrock that was on the other side. He caught the sheetrock corner on his right side, breaking two ribs.

An employee was pushing a heavy trash bin with a pallet jack when it struck a concrete column, causing the load to shift and crush the employee's finger between 3/4" plywood and the edge of the metal trash bin. His right middle fingertip was amputated without bone loss.
An employee was walking in the warehouse when he stepped on an extension cord and lost his balance, falling to the ground and fracturing his right hip.

An employee cut a hole in the roof to install a vent curb and then fell 15 feet through the hole to the concrete floor below, sustaining leg and pelvic fractures. The hole was uncovered at the time of the incident.

An employee was operating an overhead crane. He was moving the overhead trolley into position over the load by trolleying toward his position. The hook of a rigging chain caught on the flange of an I-beam girder to be moved, knocking the 4,600 lb. girder over onto him. The flange of the girder struck his lower left leg, causing a compound fracture just above the ankle.

An employee was pulling MC cable on a catwalk and had to step over some ductwork when his heel caught some of the ductwork, causing him to trip off the catwalk and fall 15 feet through a ceiling. He broke the femur, scapula, and patella on the left side of his body. There was no railing on the catwalk at the time of the incident.

An employee was operating the panel roll forming machine and was measuring a piece of panel that had to be cut. As he was running the piece through the machine, his left ring and middle fingers were amputated.
An employee was sliding an industrial ladder off a truck when his left pinky finger was caught between the end of the ladder and his steel-tip boot, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was directing traffic standing next to a slacked cable when a vehicle passing by caught the cable, which hit and threw the employee to the ground. The employee suffered right knee and left hip injuries.

An employee was helping to install a guide wire for a high voltage 7620 volt line. He was holding onto the guide wire at ground level while a coworker in an elevated aerial lift was tightening the guide wire bolt. The coworker came into contact with a live wire bolt, which energized the guide wire that the employee had in his hand. Both of his toes suffered electrical burns, requiring hospitalization. PPE was not worn at the time of the incident.
While carrying a machine with a cutting edge guard, an employee tripped and the guard of the machine crushed the employee's four fingers.
On or about September 15, 2016, an employee performing flagging duties in a construction zone was struck by a privately owned vehicle, suffering leg fractures.
On 09/14/2016, an employee was lifting one side of a sheet pile when he lost his footing and the sheet pile fell on his right leg above the ankle, breaking his lower leg. He was hospitalized.
An employee was sizing a 15" piece of reinforced concrete pipe with a cut off saw when the saw kicked back, striking and lacerating the employee's upper left arm. The employee was hospitalized.
After returning to the warehouse, an employee felt overheated and began cramping due to dehydration. He was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.

On 9/15/16, an employee was injured and hospitalized when the employee fell off a joist and a steel beam fell on him as he landed one floor below. The employee sustained a torn kidney and liver and fractured ribs and a knee.

The employee was operating a hydraulic torqueing machine, completing a torque sequence on a 16" discharge valve. He was using both hands to pick up and position the hydraulic torqueing machine wrench head onto the bolt. The employee had been working with a coworker who was operating the remote controller of the hydraulic torque wrench head. The coworker then activated the wrench head, which was set at 2800 psi and amputated the right index fingertip of the injured employee.
An employee was walking alongside a skid steer that was in operation when he tripped and his left leg was caught in the skid steer track. He sustained a fractured left femur.

An employee and coworkers were using machetes to cut overgrown brush and grass to create a clear path to use surveying equipment. A coworker's machete struck the left hand of the employee, amputating the employee's left index finger.
Employees were erecting an I-beam 10 to 12 feet overhead when the I-beam  fell on the back of an employee below, injuring his shoulder and knee. He required surgery.

An employee was working from a cable tray 15 feet above the ground. The employee was utilizing a fall protection harness in conjunction with a PFAS. As he tried to move from one location to another, he fell to the floor, shattering his right heel and fracturing his left ankle. His lanyard was not tied off at the time of the incident.
An employee was setting aluminum shoring for excavation using a hydraulic shoring machine when his finger was pinched inside the shoring. His right-hand middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee fell off a ladder and fractured the T-12 vertebrae.
An employee was attempting to install a belt on a pulley system on a PVC mixer machine when his finger was caught between the pulley and the belt, amputating his pinky finger above the fingernail.

A temporary employee was working from a 10-foot ladder and cutting ductwork from the ceiling when the ductwork fell and undercut the ladder. The employee fell and struck their head on the concrete floor, suffering severe cranial/brain injuries.

An employee was installing fiber cable optic in an apartment complex building. The employee stepped out to the hallway on the second floor and leaned against an unsecured railing, falling approximately 9 feet to the ground below and fracturing the pelvic bone.
An employee was loading concrete forms when they collapsed and partially crushed the employee, who suffered a broken hip and leg.
An employee was caught between a utility pole and a truck, fracturing a leg.

On or about 9/16/2016, an employee was performing demolition work by cutting away metal ducts when suddenly the duct fell to where the employee was on a 12-foot ladder, knocking the employee to the ground. The employee was hospitalized with fractured ribs and a tailbone.
An employee was replacing a motor when an asphalt plant component fell and hit the lift platform, knocking the employee to the ground. He suffered a back vertebrae injury.
An employee was unloading poles and was pinned to the ground when a pole rolled off of the fork truck, suffering a right leg injury.
An employee was digging an excavation when the excavation collapsed on the employee. The employee suffered a broken pelvis.
Workers were installing a heat exchanger when it fell, striking and fracturing an employee's ankle.
An employee was on the back of the paver operating the screed when he started to feel unwell and experienced muscle cramps. He was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee was changing bags in a bag house with three coworkers when his left hand entered a rotary air mover, partially amputating three fingers.

On September 19, 2016, an employee was sliding a ductwork transition across the ground and tripped over a 4-inch step. The employee fell to the ground and the flange on the ductwork amputated the employee's fingertip.
An employee was getting ready to start the kettle motor on the tar kettle. The pipe was not hooked up yet, causing hot tar to burn his face, neck, and arms.
An employee lost his footing while descending a fixed cage ladder and fell 10 feet, fracturing both ankles.
An employee was cutting wood with a table saw when the saw amputated two fingers and damaged two others on his left hand.
On or about September 19, 2016, an employee was installing rack systems. As he was loosening a rack from a bundle, it fell on him, dislocating his ankle and breaking his tibia.
An employee was bending a piece of rebar when the employee's glove was caught between the rebar and the table, causing an amputation without bone loss.
An employee felt overheated while cutting rebar with a saw from approximately 1235 to 1250 hours. He was hospitalized for heat stress.

On September 20, 2016, at approximately 2:30 PM, an employee was coring concrete using a drill. His hair somehow became caught in the drill and he suffered damage to his scalp and broke his neck. He was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee at a utility power pole was moving an insulator cover that was draped over a power wire. He was working from a bucket truck about 30 feet up. When the employee removed the insulator, the insulator cover failed and an arc flash occurred, causing flash burns to the employee's hands. He was hospitalized.
Two employees received second degree burns to the arms, face, and neck while installing a switch on a pole.
An employee suffered heat stress while welding on a roof, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell from a baker's scaffold to the floor while blowing in insulation, suffering a broken clavicle and contusions.
An employee was squeegeeing mud when he fainted after experiencing dizziness and leg cramps due to possible dehydration.
An employee was under the kitchen sink connecting a water line to install a dishwasher when his arm contacted a live 220-volt line, causing an electrical shock and burns to his arms.
An employee was attempting to cut a piece of trim (wood) with a battery-powered circular saw when his index fingertip was amputated.
An employee broke a hand while working with a ladder.
An employee began experiencing dizziness, nausea, and cramping after returning to the office from a roofing jobsite. The employee was hospitalized for heat stress.
An employee was carrying a bucket of hot asphalt when he tripped. The hot asphalt splashed on and burned his face, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was bending over to pick up a 10-foot stick of 3/4" electrical metallic tube (EMT) when he felt and heard a pop in his back and experienced a sharp lower back pain. He was hospitalized with a compressed back disc.

An employee was drilling a hole through an overhead bar joist. The bit broke suddenly and the employee lost control of the hand-held drill. The unused portion of the drill bit went around his safety glasses and penetrated the eye.

An employee was helping to install an 8-inch water line, working approximately 4-feet, 8-inches deep, when the dirt underneath the concrete of the street gave way and hit the employee on the right-side hip/pelvis.

Employees were loading I-beams onto a flatbed truck with an excavator. The last beam of the load was just set and secured in place when the crew removed the rigging from the I-beam. The excavator then turned away from the truck. A piece of the rigging was unintentionally caught on a piece of the I-beam, causing the beam to slide off the truck. The I-beam hit an employee's arm and leg.

An employee was operating a backhoe, shoveling milling material off the road, when the shovel became caught on a manhole road protrusion. This contact jarred the backhoe and the employee with great force, causing a liver injury where the seat belt connection contacted the employee near the right abdominal area.

An employee was helping to load a barrier rail clamp onto a lowboy trailer. When the clamp was over the correct stop on the trailer, he directed the operator to lower the clamp. His left hand was resting on the clamp. As the clamp settled on the trailer, it closed enough to catch and amputate his left ring fingertip.

An employee was helping a coworker empty trash carts into a dumpster. They were lifting the trash cart manually from a loading dock. The trash cart slipped and caught the employee's left middle finger between the trash cart metal frame and the trash cart, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was assisting a rigger and a crane operator with guiding a furnace tube through the opening of a furnace when the employee's finger was caught between the 90-degree point of the furnace opening and a furnace tube. The right-hand index finger was partially amputated, requiring surgery.
An employee was using a rubber tub to pour water out of a double hung window when the top section of the window slipped and amputated the employee's left index fingertip.

An employee in an aerial lift was installing overhead solar panels on a new steel structure when he was crushed between the rail of the aerial lift basket and the steel I-beam he was working on. He suffered a crushed sternum and broken ribs, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing a vapor barrier to the outside of a new home while working from an extension ladder when he lost his balance and fell 6 to 8 feet to the ground, breaking his pelvis.

An employee walked to the rear of a trailer that was loaded with steel purlins. He began removing straps from the stored purlins and turned around, making contact with the edge of a purlin, which lacerated his right eye.
An employee on stilts slipped on plastic while installing insulation in a building and fell, tearing a knee tendon and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was hauling sand in a dump truck. He dumped the truck load of sand and was attempting to close the tailgate on the back of the truck. The tailgate failed to close completely. The employee attempted to pull the tailgate away from the vehicle to create momentum from the swing to close it. His hand was positioned on the bottom of the tailgate and as it swung toward the truck, it created a pinch point. His left hand was pinched between the tailgate and the vehicle frame, causing fractures, cuts, and bruising to the fingers.

On September 23, 2016, an employee was installing a fire sprinkling system in the attic of an office building when a 110-volt wire hanging down touched his shoulder and shocked him. He was hospitalized.

On September 23, 2016, an employee was shocked when the boom of a concrete pump truck he was operating came in contact with energized electrical lines. He suffered first and second degree burns to his arms.
An employee was loading tools into the trailer when he was bitten by an insect. He was later hospitalized when he had an adverse reaction to the bite.

An employee was removing material in the bed of a dump truck. While using the access ladder to descend from the dump truck, the employee fell approximately 5 feet, fracturing both wrists and one vertebra. The employee required surgery.

An employee grinded a steel pipe that was approximately 24" in diameter x 40' long. An excavator machine with a nylon strap then raised the pipe. One end of the strap was connected to the excavator machine and the other end of the strap was around the pipe. During the pipe raising, one end of the pipe came free and struck the employee's left leg, breaking it below the knee.

An employee was core drilling holes into a set of concrete exterior steps to make sleeves for the handrail. The drill bit became hung up, making the core drill twist and throwing the employee off balance. He fell off the side of the steps and landed on a concrete sidewalk, breaking his left wrist and landing on the side of his head.
On or about September 23, 2016, an employee received an electrical shock from a light circuit while working on an elevator car top box.

An employee was operating the lights for the work area when a drunk driver drove into the work zone, causing an object to strike the employee and ricochet him into a nearby box truck. He was hospitalized with two broken legs, a broken hip, broken ribs, and a concussion.
An employee's arm was caught in a construction hoist's counterweight, requiring hospitalization.
On Saturday, September 24, 2016, an employee was using a demo saw (wood saw) to cut wood when the saw kick backed and cut his left arm. He was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was operating a loader to backfill a trench with sand when the loader turned over and slid into the open trench. The employee's leg contacted the control console of the loader, breaking the fibula and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing a cover for a wastewater treatment pond. When the employee initiated the welder, a fire occurred, burning the employee's arms and face.
An employee was mudding sheetrock from a scaffold when it collapsed, causing the employee to fall 10 to 12 feet. He injured his foot and broke his ankle, requiring hospitalization.

The employee was assigned to perform housekeeping of the shielding/work platform and clean the deck panels and grinders. At the start of the shift, the employee was walking and stepped on a conduit pipe causing him to roll his ankle.
While cutting a truss, an employee fell from a second-story roof and sustained a hip fracture.
While attempting to change the railroad track direction, an employee's left thumb was caught and amputated between tracks.
An employee was walking with a tagline for a forklift carrying an 8' by 13' steel sheet when he tripped and the forklift operator rolled over his right foot. He was hospitalized with tissue damage.
An employee was cutting a masonry block when the saw bounced off the block, kicked back, and cut his collarbone.

While performing dozer operations in a skid loader/grader, the employee was placing top soil dirt into a beach bulkhead. The skid loader/grader backed off the bulkhead and fell 3 feet to the ground. Broken glass from the rear window lacerated the back of his head and the safety (lap) bar caused bruising to his chest.

An employee entered a robot cell through an opening used to remove sand. As the employee attempted to adjust the casting, the saw caught and cut the employee's finger. An interlocked gate was in place at the time.
An employee was stripping concrete forms when a form fell towards him. As he attempted to move out of the way, his back impacted a metal toolbox, fracturing his lower ribs.

Employees building a lake deck were using a mechanical pile driver to drive piling into a lake bed. The rope broke as the hammer was being raised, and the hammer fell and struck one of the employees. The employee suffered facial trauma, a broken left shoulder, and a left arm laceration.
An employee installing water piping was injured after attempting to close/clamp a cracked pipeline. The employee suffered a broken femur and was hospitalized.
An employee was moving a tree log with a remote mechanical grapple when the log came loose and rolled onto his left lower leg. He was hospitalized for a leg fracture.
After climbing a ladder and stepping onto the roof, an employee fell approximately 10 feet from the roof to a concrete slab.
While performing routine food preparation inside a kiosk, an employee fainted due to heat stress, then suffered right forearm pain after falling.
An employee was riding on a trailer when it hit a bump and he fell off, breaking his ribs, sternum, and leg. He was hospitalized.

While working in a ditch, an employee cut a test header off a piece of steel pipe.  The test header was being lifted out of the ditch when it tipped to the side and some methanol, which had been used to clean the pipe, leaked out and onto the employee's legs. The methanol ignited and caught the employee's legs on fire. The employee was hospitalized with leg burns.

An employee was operating the swing stage lift to raise it to the top of the suspension cable. As soon as the motor hit the swage, the swage split into two pieces. One end of the swing stage then dropped approximately 5 feet and the air motor struck and cut the employee's lower left leg.

An employee was operating an aerial lift to torque the bolts on a connection point of the steel girder to a bridge. His head was pinched between the aerial lift control panel cover and the bottom of the steel girder above him. He suffered a laceration to his right ear and a skull fracture, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was experiencing chest pains while running electrical conduit and was taken to the hospital 09/28/2016.
An employee was caulking holes on a wall while standing on a 6-foot ladder when the employee fell to the ground, breaking ribs and puncturing a lung.
An employee was shoveling dirt onto a paved surface when a nearby skid steer made an abrupt backward turn and struck the employee's left leg, breaking it. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
While performing powerline maintenance, an employee received first, second, and third degree burns to his back and arms due to an electric arc flash.

An employee was maneuvering a lid for a hole in a platform in a building. The employee lost control of the lid and both the lid and the employee fell into the basement area. The employee suffered three broken ribs.

An employee was walking inside a trailer containing appliances for new homes when he tripped and fell onto an oven canopy hood that was stored on the floor, cutting his right wrist and severing an artery on the metal edge of the oven hood. He was hospitalized overnight and required surgery.

Workers were drilling a water well. They were removing the drill pipes from the well with a block when the block went past the block stop at the top of the rig and broke free. The block fell to the drill deck and the bails on the block struck an employee, causing him to fall 8 feet to the ground. He was also struck by slips that were dislodged by the impact of the block. He suffered four fractured vertebrae and lacerations to the head and ear.

An employee was cleaning a hydraulic tank with a brake parts cleaning solution. The employee sprayed the cleaner on the parts to be cleaned and then dropped a mechanic's droplight to the ground. The bulb then sparked and caused the cleaning solution vapors to ignite, resulting in burns to the employee's face and neck.

An employee was unloading scissor lifts from a truck trailer ramp. As the employee was bringing a lift down the ramp, the wheel started turning sideways, which caused the lift to tip over with the employee on it. The employee suffered a back injury and was hospitalized.

On September 30, 2016, at approximately 11:00 a.m., an employee was attempting to help fellow crew members fuel up machinery when he lost his balance and fell. He received minor scrapes to his face and injured his right eye. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was installing insulation when he grabbed a truss that had a nail, puncturing his hand through his gloves. He required surgery when the wound became infected.
An employee was cutting a 24-inch cast iron pipe with a saw when the saw kicked back and severely lacerated the left side of his neck.

An employee was working from a ladder, installing a communications drop. The ladder slipped laterally, and the employee fell and impacted the ground, suffering a fractured right wrist that required hospitalization.
An employee was on an 8-foot step ladder performing maintenance tasks when he fell off the ladder to the platform below and rolled down 21 feet into an unguarded pit. He broke his left arm and leg.
An employee was working on a unit with piping when he became overheated. He was later hospitalized for dehydration.

An employee was on an 8-foot ladder installing electrical materials overhead. The employee missed a step while descending the ladder and fell approximately 4 feet to the ground below, resulting in hospitalization for a right ankle fracture.
An employee was removing a scaffold runner when it came loose and struck him. He fell backwards and struck his head, suffering a contusion/laceration.
An employee was struck by a truck while flagging in a work zone, breaking an arm and leg.
An employee fell to the ground while coming down a ladder, fracturing his right wrist.
