An employee was working on a highway, pouring concrete on a part of the road, when a car sped into the construction zone. The car hit a wood plank, which ejected toward the employee, striking him in the face and causing major swelling and bruising. He was hospitalized.
A worker was moving a piece of material with an excavator when it struck an employee's calf, causing a lateral laceration that required hospitalization and surgery.
An employee fell approximately 9 feet through a working surface to the concrete below, sustaining fractures to the skull, ribs, and wrist and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was relocating a light switch on a wall when he was shocked by a hot wire on the light switch, suffering burns on his right hand.

An employee was lifting a 12' x 8" diameter steel vent pipe with three coworkers. They were using a come-along/chain fall to lift the pipe in place while the other employees were guiding. The pipe was shifted to maneuver around a guard rail, causing the rigging beam to slide off the I-beams it was placed on. The entire rigging assembly and load fell. As the rigging fell, the chain whipped around and struck the employee in the right arm, fracturing the ulna and radius.
An employee was near the roll-bending machine while the machine operator was feeding metal into the roller. The employee's index and middle fingers were then caught and amputated in the roller.
An employee fell down the stairs while pulling a pallet jack, suffering fractured ribs and a lacerated spleen.

Two employees were installing a 25-foot, 1000-watt halide light onto anchor brackets using a forklift when the metal fixture broke at the knuckle, striking one employee in the head and the other in the back. The first employee was hospitalized with a head injury, and the second was hospitalized with fractured vertebrae.
An employee fell into a hole that was 18 feet deep and was hospitalized with a broken nose and cheek and jaw injuries.
An employee was hit by a mini-excavator bucket while walking, suffering a right shoulder injury.
The employee was aligning the traffic control barrels when a vehicle struck the employee. The employee sustained a broken leg, arm and a dislocated ankle.
An employee was welding structural steel. While descending a ladder, the employee fell to the ground and dislocated an ankle, requiring hospitalization.
On 10/05/2016, an employee's right calf was struck by construction equipment that backed up unexpectedly. He suffered a compression injury to his calf, requiring surgery.

On Thursday, October 5, 2016, at approximately 3:15 p.m., an employee was descending from the fourth deck of a scaffold (5x16x40) after installing blinds. At the 8-feet mark, he lost three-point contact and fell to ground level, dislocating and fracturing his left elbow. His PPE was not connected at the time.

An employee was walking up a hill while a pickup truck was backing up the hill from the other side. The driver did not see the employee. The employee attempted to get out of the way but fell and was run over by the truck. The employee suffered broken ribs, a collapsed lung, and a fractured ankle.

An employee was attempting to place a pin in the hydraulic cylinder of a backhoe when the front of the backhoe struck the employee. The employee sustained lacerations to the right forearm, three broken ribs, and a fractured pelvis.
An employee was attempting to lift a 300-pound stone to place a lifting strap underneath it when his left index finger was caught beneath the stone, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was taking down cement forms when their pinky finger was smashed by rebar material.

An employee was walking by an air handler when he heard a strange mechanical noise. He walked behind the air handler to investigate and attempted to stop the machine's moving rubber belt. His right middle finger contacted the belt and was amputated above the knuckle.
While installing underlayment on the roof, an employee fell to the ground and suffered a fractured pelvis.
An employee was coming down a ladder when he slipped and fell approximately 9 ft. injuring his left leg and arm and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was working on a 480-volt electrical panel when an arc flash occurred, burning the employee's stomach, chest, hand, and arm.
An employee was fabricating a piece of sheet metal on a press when the press brake came down on the employee's right hand.
An employee was replacing a gear box and was bitten on his wrist and forearm by a black widow spider.

An employee was cutting wood wedges with a skill saw on a boom lift when the saw jumped and cut the three middle fingers on his left hand. His middle finger was amputated from the bottom of the fingernail up.
An employee fell approximately 20 feet through an unsecured hole on a parking garage roof and was hospitalized with multiple fractures to the wrists and pelvis.
On 10/6/16, an employee was performing roofing work on a bay window roof at an elevation of 18 feet when he fell to the ground, fracturing his feet and/or legs.
An employee was applying a belt dressing to an aggregate conveyor when his arm was caught by the conveyor. He suffered arm and pinky finger fractures, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was on an upper platform of power-producing machinery checking the phase rotations on the fan motors. While descending a fixed ladder to come down from the upper platform, the employee fell off a lower rung approximately 4 feet to the floor below. The employee suffered a bruised left leg and back pain.

On Friday, October 7, 2016, two employees were helping to decontaminate the blow down settling drum in the coker unit.  In order to remove the check valve, one employee had to hold the back up while the other loosened the check valve. As the employee began to loosen the check valve, it suddenly came off and product sprayed out of the line onto the two employees. As a result, one employee received burns to his face and hands, requiring hospitalization.

On 10/07/2016, at approximately 8:45 a.m., two employees suffered electrical shock. An employee was shocked while using a concrete saw. Another employee attempted to move the first employee out of the water and was also injured. The employees were hospitalized.
A boom section fell and struck an employee who was disassembling an 80-ton crawler. The employee suffered a fractured right leg and was hospitalized.

An employee was helping to move equipment on the ground while a nearby payloader with forks was moving equipment and wooden dunnage. The forks made contact with the wood dunnage, which then struck and broke the employee's jaw.
An employee contacted live wires and suffered burns to the hands and forearms when an electric arc flash occurred. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was starting a pressure washer when a plug from the block valve blew out and struck the employee in the face, fracturing the left cheek and jaw.
An employee was repositioning an I-beam when his right middle and ring fingers were caught and partially amputated between the moving I-beam and an adjacent stationary I-beam.

An employee on a ladder was operating a battery-powered screw gun while sliding jam pieces of a door when a gust of wind blew the door open, thus knocking down the ladder and employee to the ground. He was hospitalized with broken ribs and multiple contusions to his left side.

On October 9, 2016, an employee was loading scrap into a trailer that had an insulator sticking out of it. The trailer operator moved and the insulator struck the employee in the back near the kidney. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was pulling electric wire when an anchor bar broke and struck the employee's left leg, breaking it.
An employee was unloading a drill. The auger was still spinning. His clothing became caught on a bolt and he was caught up in the auger, suffering three fractured left ribs and bruises.
An employee was unhooking a flatbed trailer from a truck. The trailer dropped abruptly and pinned the employee's hand between the truck bed and the trailer.

On October 10, 2016, at approximately 4:30 p.m., an employee was helping to remove a light plant generator from an excavation. A 9-foot chain was attached to telehandler forks and the light plant was lifted from the excavation and transported to a flatbed pickup truck located below a power line. While standing on the ground, the employee used his hand to guide the light plant onto the 4' high flatbed. The telehandler forks made contact with the overhead 7,200-volt line. The employee received second degree burns to his left hand, abdomen, and leg.
An employee was pushing a board though a saw blade when a splinter entered his hand. His left hand then jerked and hit the turning saw blade, amputating his left thumb above the knuckle.
An employee was servicing a gas boiler system and was burned on the head/face due to a faulty gas valve.
An employee was standing on the floor while plumbing a line on a wall when a passing scissor lift struck the employee, breaking the employee's left fibula and left shoulder blade.
While unloading trash into a dumpster during roofing activities, an employee fell approximately 15 feet onto an I-beam, breaking ribs.

An employee and a coworker strapped an industrial site plan printer onto a forklift's long skid to take it to the second floor. The employee was on the forklift's skids when he fell 10 feet to the first floor of the warehouse, suffering lower back injuries that required hospitalization.
While rigging wire, an employee slipped and fell off a truck, breaking a wrist and ribs.

An employee was removing cabinets from a second-story apartment, which was under construction. The employee was walking onto the plywood and 2X4 box, which was being lifted by a forklift, when the box, cabinet, and employee fell approximately 10 feet to the ground. The employee suffered two broken wrists, facial fractures, and a dislocated/broken right elbow.

An employee climbed a ladder after retrieving ice/water shield and was hooking up to fall protection when ice/water shield fell. The employee and the ice/water shield went over the edge (4/5 pitch). The employee fell about 30 feet and suffered a broken arm and leg.
A front end loader drove over a heavy steel plate (the panel/side of a trench box) that was lying on the ground. The contact caused the panel to strike and break an adjacent employee's leg.

On October 12, 2016, at 3:10 p.m., two employees were setting up to cut the main 8" gas pipe to install a new pipeline when the pipe coupling failed and the pipe exploded. Debris struck the employees, who suffered facial lacerations and fractures. Both employees were hospitalized.
An employee was preparing to pour concrete for a bridge tower/column. He was descending the tower when he fell approximately 16 feet to the ground, breaking his right-side hip and ribs.
An employee suffered a lower back strain while lifting and placing boxes of material onto a dry wall cart.

Employees were installing an 8 inch pipeline and one employee was hospitalized as the result of a pipe failure. The employee's injuries included facial lacerations and fractures to the nose and forehead.
An employee was installing wood backers for a roof and he tripped over the backer. His left arm hit a sharp valley in the metal causing a laceration when he fell. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was attempting to remove a 1/2 inch drill bit from a battery operated drill equipped with a keyless chuck. The employee was wearing cotton rubber palm gloves and squeezing the keyless chuck to remove the bit. As he pushed the trigger increasing the torque to the keyless chuck his grip slipped and the bit caught the fingertip of his glove twisting it and his fingertip into the bit causing lacerations and a fracture to the employee's left index fingertip.
An employee was attempting to secure a material basket and was struck by the basket fracturing the left thumb.

An employee was operating a backhoe to lift a pipe. He got off the backhoe to remove a plug from the pipe and the backhoe rolled and pinned the employee between the pipe and the backhoe causing a right femur fracture.

An employee who had just climbed onto a roof approximately 9 feet 2 inches in height after his lunch break was in the process of securing his fall protection when he slipped and fell off the roof fracturing the left ankle.

Employees were picking up a piece of pipe that was about 5 inches wide and 42 inches in diameter to load it on a trailer when the pipe shifted and struck an employee on the left thigh pinning his leg between the pipe and the trailer. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery on his broken left tibia.
On October 13, 2016, an employee received a hip and leg injury when the employee entered a 10' trenching (cave protected) to repair a main water line and a cap located on a 12' water line blew.

An employee was unloading dirt for a bridge construction site. The raised dump bed made contact with an overhead power line. The employee exited the dump truck, placing his feet on the ground, and was shocked resulting in electrical burns to his left hand, left hamstring, all toes and feet.
An employee was using an air powered nail gun and shot a nail into their left hand. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was working on the roof structure of a stadium to install structural steel. The employee was using a wire rope to pull a 600 pound steel beam when the beam fell from the roof structure. The employee's hand was caught in the wire rope causing the tip and left side of the employee's left pinky finger to be separated from the bone, but still attached.

An employee was adjusting a 30" diameter PVC vertical stand pipe. There were some bricks holding up the casting, acting as adjustment shims. The employee stepped on one of the bricks as he was going to take the casting off of the vertical stand pipe. The brick, which was now underneath his foot, was on a gravel base and rolled out from under his foot as he lifted the casting off of the pipe causing the employee to lose his balance. As he was falling, his right arm and shoulder area landed in the center of the vertical stand pipe and his right upper chest area landed on the sidewall of the pipe. He was hospitalized with broken ribs and a collapsed lung.
An employee just completed repairing the sewer line and was backfilling the trench. As the employee was removing the wheeler, it impacted the employee's left foot and fractured it.

An employee was waiting for a guardrail to be set in place by a fork lift so it could be anchored. After the guardrail was in place, the employee attempted to line up the guardrail with the anchor spots with her foot. The guardrail fell away from her into a post and came back toward her striking her left leg and fracturing the tibia.
A piece of rebar was lifted with a front end loader. The rebar slid off and struck an employee causing neck and shoulder injuries.

An employee was using a circular saw to cut a piece of wood. The saw got stuck in a knot in the wood. The employee tried to free the saw from the knot and the blade amputated the left middle and index fingers.

An employee was watching for oncoming traffic while a fellow worker was installing wiring on a light pole. The employee was struck by a motor vehicle that was driving illegally in reverse down a one way street in the wrong direction. The employee sustained a sprained right ankle, contusions to the left hip, thigh and forearm and lacerations to the left side of the face.

An employee was measuring duct for insulation while standing on a sheet of plywood that had been laid across the beams of the ceiling. The end of the platform was extending over a beam, so when the employee stepped on the end of the plywood he fell approximately 8 feet. He fractured seven ribs and was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was standing under a crane's boom while a coworker released the stow pin to disconnect a jib from the crane's boom. Once the coworker pulled the stow pin, the heavy side of the jib drifted down and made contact with the employee, dislocating his hip.

An employee was removing spoils from the tailgate of a dump truck using a scraper (flat shovel). While maneuvering near the tailgate, he tripped over a dirt clod roughly the size of a basketball and fell on the ground. He got up and fell again, breaking his left ankle, tibia, and fibula and requiring surgery.
While walking to a truck to get materials, an employee slipped on an empty bag and fell backwards onto a concrete block, injuring the lower back vertebrae.

Employees were installing grating that consisted of 4 sheets (approximately 4 feet by 5 feet), cumulatively weighing approximately 800 pounds. When the employees disconnected the load from the crane, they realized the corner of the grating rested on the edge of an existing guard rail toe plate. The injured employee attempted to lift the grating upwards while his coworker used a spud wrench to shift the grating off the toe plate. The grating shifted and caught the injured employee's left index finger between the grating and structural steel. He suffered an avulsion to his left index finger flesh beneath his fingertip, which was crushed and cut. He required surgery and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee fell approximately 8 feet while securing a ladder to a building. She landed on her back and was hospitalized.

The employee was sitting on a static (not operational) skid steer bucket when he stood up and began walking to the compressor work truck. As he walked away from the skid steer bucket, he attempted to step over the angled right side of the bucket. At this point the employee tripped on the right side of the bucket and fell, putting his right arm down in an attempt to break his fall. There was a steel pothole cover nearby that was inverted, with a 12-16 in. appendage that extends out. The employee struck this pothole appendage with his right elbow as he fell, resulting in a shattered right elbow. Employee was admitted to the hospital where he received surgery for the injury.

An employee was digging a ditch underneath a digger derrick that was lifting a transformer onto a pole. The rope holding the transformer broke and the transformer fell, hitting and fracturing the employee's arm, leg, and heel.

The employee was attempting to couple a pipe trailer to a hitch on a backhoe and got a finger caught between the coupler on the trailer and the receiver on the backhoe after lifting it to connect the two. The right index finger was amputated.

An employee was installing metal roofing panels when he lost his balance, slipped, and fell 14 feet to the concrete floor below. He suffered a head injury, fractured skull, broken ribs, and minor internal injuries.
An employee broke his left leg and was hospitalized.
An employee was pinned between a pickup truck that rolled forward and a skid steer resulting in a broken femur.
An employee was attempting to open a gas cover/cap when a flash fire occurred and burned the employee's face.
An employee was preparing a pipe flange for paint when the pipe ruptured causing a release of trichlorosilane. The employee sustained chemical burns to the left hand, forearm and hip.
An employee was coming down from a six foot ladder, lost his footing, and fell landing on a concrete walkway and breaking both fibulas.
An employee fell approximately 18 feet  through an open roof hole and was hospitalized for a back injury and head laceration.
On October 19, 2016, approximately 7:30 AM, an employee fell approximately 5 feet while dismounting a front-end loader. The employee was hospitalized for a back injury.

An employee was feeding wire to a wire stripping machine when he noticed that the wire had a loop in it. He reached to get the loop out and while his left thumb was in the loop the machine tightened the loop resulting in the amputation of the tip of his left thumb.

Employees were installing helical piers at a residential location when an employee was struck by the torque arm of the hydraulic power head. The employee sustained three broken ribs and a punctured lung.
An employee was climbing a 32' fiberglass ladder to access a two-story new construction roof and fell fracturing the right heel and left foot (forefoot).

An employee was working on the side of a column that was supported by a wood planked scaffold forming concrete foundation on a wall. The employee lost his footing and fell three and a half feet to the ground fracturing his right lower back.

An employee was connecting a temporary 480 Volt AC electrical pigtail cord into an electrical box. This pigtail would supply the plug connection for the 480 Volt AC cord for the floor shot blasting machine.  An arc flash occurred burning the employees hands and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was attempting to raise a load with an air hoist when the air hoist came loose from its anchor point and swung down, striking the employee's torso and breaking ribs. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was working from a scaffold driving metal studs into the wall. A metal stud kick-back struck the employee causing a laceration over the right eye.
While performing form work, an employee fell 14 feet down with the form. The form fell on top of the employee, causing a broken sacrum and pubic bone.

An employee was helping to set a concrete lid weighing a couple hundred pounds for an electrical box in place. One end of a length of steel chain was attached to a steel loop (hasp) embedded in the concrete lid.  The employee attempted to attach the other end of this chain to a steel loop (hasp) on the back (underside) of an excavator bucket when the excavator boom unexpectedly dropped, pinning the employee's right thumb between the bottom of the excavator bucket and the concrete lid. His right thumb was amputated at a point between the first and second knuckle.
An employee slipped and fell off a roof while attaching an anchor, suffering cracked vertebrae.
An employee was spotting equipment being moved by a rough terrain forklift when the forklift ran over the employee's foot, breaking it.
While modifying scaffolding, an employee fell to the ground, suffering head and facial trauma, an internal injury, a broken wrist, and a leg laceration.

An employee was working on a roof when a piece a material started sliding down the roof.  The employee chased the material but was unable to stop and fell off the roof, suffering a broken wrist, facial laceration, and other injuries.
An employee was opening the cover to an exhaust fan when the motor pulley wheel and sheave caught and severely pinched the employee's left index finger, partially amputating the fingertip.

An employee was flagging to help a tractor-trailer driver park when a gust of wind sent a temporary job fence in the air. The fence struck the employee who sustained neck and back compressions and a fractured sternum.
An employee was standing on the rig floor of a water well drilling rig when a block came down, hitting and breaking the employee's left foot.

An employee was on the roof of a two-story house checking the felt to make sure it was smooth when he slipped on the wet felt and fell two stories, breaking his elbow and suffering a possible concussion.
An employee fell off a roof when a gust of wind knocked him off balance. His harness was disconnected at the time.
An employee was pushing lumber through a table saw when his hand slipped and made contact with the blade, amputating his left middle finger.
An employee fell one level through an unmarked hole in a roof while he was removing debris and plywood. He was hospitalized for spinal and rib fractures, abrasions, and a cut to the head.
An employee was working inside of a boiler on the 13th floor of Unit 3. A piece of slag fell from above and struck the employee on the head. The employee sustained a concussion and minor lacerations.
An employee was removing a satellite dish when his foot became tangled in his tool belt and he fell 4 to 5 feet to the ground below, suffering a possible concussion.
An employee was removing trash out of the building. As he was dumping the trash from a rubber container into a steel dumpster, his left ring fingertip was smashed and amputated.
An employee was struck in the back by a piece of rebar resulting in hospitalization.

Employees were standing at the company truck about to break for lunch when a log truck came down the road and a tire blew. The weight of the logs broke an axle on the log truck and the tire and wheel broke off striking two of the employees standing at the company truck.
An employee was installing two segments of a concrete chute when it closed on his right hand, crushing his fingers and requiring surgery.

An employee was installing foam pieces into bridge deck panels on a beam when he lost his footing and attempted to jump toward the opposite beam. His body struck the beam, fracturing his nose, face, rib, and sternum.
An employee was repairing a water main when he slipped on a clump of dirt and broke his tibia, requiring overnight hospitalization.

An employee was unloading a truck of pipe pile when his finger was pinched causing a right thumb amputation above the first knuckle. The employee was hooking up rigging from a crane at the end of the pipe pile which was beveled and significantly sharp. His right thumb was inside the throat of the hook as the crane operator was signaled to take the slack off of the rigging. When the hook was pulled into the pile edge the employee's thumb tip was pinched.
An employee fell 10' through a stairwell opening from the mezzanine to the floor below fracturing a rib and the clavicle.
An employee was replacing a plow on a tractor when it slipped and fell on him, lacerating and breaking his leg.

An employee climbed a 12-foot step ladder. He stepped off the ladder with his left foot to position it on a large round valve handle to reach an anchor point he intended to tie off to. As he reached with his left hand, to attach his lanyard to this anchor point, the large round valve turned, and the employee lost his balance and fell approximately 6 feet onto a pipe below the ladder. The employee sustained a fractured left arm, fractured thumb and two fractured ribs, requiring hospitalization.
During excavation work, an employee stepped on loose soil and rolled his right ankle while spotting for the excavator. The employee's right ankle was dislocated.
Two workers were carrying a bundle of struts into a truck. The struts shifted and a strut struck a worker's ear causing a laceration that required stitches. The employee was hospitalized.
On October 25, 2016, an employee sustained an amputation injury after the employee's shirt was caught in a belt and pulley pulling the hand in.

Two employees were installing siding on the third floor of a stair landing from a makeshift scaffold. Both employee's fell approximately 30 feet to the ground when the scaffold failed. Employee 1 suffered a broken back and neck. Employee 2 suffered fractures to the pelvis, tailbone and lower back. Both employees were hospitalized.

An employee was using a mag drill when the glove on his supporting (right) hand was pulled into the drill.  The employee sustained a mangling injury to the right ring finger that required surgery and hospitalization.

Employees were re-positioning a boiler's mill liner on a pallet. There were three boiler mill liners laying side by side on the pallet. As the employees were re-positioning the liner to the pallet, the mill liner shifted and the employee' right ring finger got caught between two boiler mill liners, resulting in the amputation of his right ring fingertip and a laceration to his right index finger. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee pulled the generator string and his left hand got caught in the string as it returned into the generator amputating the middle fingertip and thumb tip.
An employee was pulling wires from a pipe while standing on an 8 ft. A-frame ladder. The employee lost balance and fell from the fourth step of the ladder breaking his left ankle.
An employee fell through a hole on the third floor and landed on the second floor resulting in a head injury.

An employee was extending a scaffold being used by employees to lay bricks for a school wall. As the employee was bolting down the scaffold towers, his wrench slipped off the bolt. This caused the employee to fall over the front of the scaffold and over the brick wall being built. The employee suffered a possible hip fracture and a dislocated shoulder.
On October 26, 2016, an employee was struck in the head when a section of chain link fence blew over due to high wind. The employee suffered a concussion and was admitted to the hospital.
Two employees were leaning over the safety handrails to grab a 4'x8' piece of sheathing and the Perry Scaffold fell over injuring three employees. Two employees were hospitalized.

On October 26, 2016, at 12:00 p.m., an employee was using a pry-bar to raise the manholes to the level of the new pavement. The manhole cover slipped off of the pry-bar as he was reaching under the manhole cover and crushed the tip of his left middle finger. The tip of his left middle finger with some bone was amputated at the hospital.
An employee suffered a potential amputation of the left middle fingertip while aligning a bolt hole on the bucket of the track excavator.

An employee was doing work on a drop ceiling while standing on a ten foot ladder. The employee contacted 277 volts resulting in a burn on the back of his hand and causing him to fall off the ladder. Employee fell backwards onto the concrete and was knocked unconscious.

Two employees were entering a sewer manhole. One of the employee's hands slipped and the second employee's middle finger was caught and amputated at the first joint as the manhole cover fell back into place.
An employee suffered a fractured lower right leg, when a stair rail rigged to a chain fall became unbalanced and fell, striking the employee in the right leg.
An employee was preparing a mobile crane for transport and amputated a portion of the left index finger when the jib moved into place.

An employee operating a Bobcat suffered a broken arm and severe lacerations after a metal chain being used to lift a 450 lb. bollard pipe released unexpectedly and the pipe whipped around striking the operator.
An employee was walking onsite, tripped and fell breaking a leg.
An employee was de-rigging the suspended scaffolding on the bridge. He did not see a cable and ran into the cable clips resulting in an abdominal hematoma.
An employee started the pressure washer in order to wash a concrete wall when he lost control of the pressure washer wand resulting in a laceration to his neck. He was hospitalized.

An employee was helping unload a wooden crate full of glass (about 1,000 lbs.) from a flat bed truck with a forklift and jib. The crate slipped loose, slid, and struck the employee. The employee was hospitalized with a broken left leg.

An employee was spotting the PIT operator, lost his footing due to some loose ground near the unloading area, and fell. While on the ground, his leg was crushed by the bridging material when it was unloaded onto the ground. The employee suffered a broken leg and ankle.
An employee was unclogging the pump truck piping during a concrete pour. When he removed the flange, the pressure plate struck his lower left leg breaking it.

An employee climbed onto a flatbed truck to unhook equipment. As the employee unhooked the load, the chain binder's lever suddenly released, allowing the chain to fall and hit the employee's right leg, fracturing two bones.

An employee was capping an 8 inch PVC water line. Backpressure built up in the line from a leaking valve and blew the cap off resulting in amputation of the employee's left pinky finger and a partial amputation of the left ring finger.
An employee was using a table saw to cut a piece of lumber and lacerated their hand.
An employee was spreading hot asphalt and fell sustaining second degree burns on the lower legs.
While assisting with the sewer line inside the trench box, a section of trench wall fell into the box and pinned the employee against the box wall. The employee was hospitalized with a spinal injury.
An employee fell approximately 24 feet off a roof and sustained back injuries.
An employee fell off a flatbed trailer while loading material onto it.  The employee fractured his clavicle and ribs and displaced his scapula.

An employee was using a spike maul to set a steel spike in a wooden tie. The spike maul struck the steel joint bar and the impact broke a small piece of steel off the joint bar. The small piece of steel struck the employee in the right eye.
An employee was building a riser for electrical power lines and received burns to the arm and neck.
An employee was setting a type and inlet cover. One object was put down on top of other material and struck the top of the employee's foot breaking two toes.
An employee suffered the partial amputation of the right ring fingertip.
An employee was demolishing a piping assembly. When the weight shifted, the pipe rolled and struck the employee, fracturing and severely lacerating his left index finger.
An employee was bitten on the right index finger by a poisonous snake and hospitalized.
An employee was insulating ductwork over an air handler when he slipped and fell approximately 6-9 ft. to the ground below. The employee sustained head trauma and fractured facial bones.
An employee was installing a conveyor system using a pry bar to separate parts and amputated a fingertip when the tool slipped and pinched his finger between the two parts.
When handling a 4 foot waler and loosening bolts, an employee's finger was caught between metal bolts and the waler, amputating the left middle distal fingertip.
An employee was operating a loader. A bus drove by the loader causing the door to slam closed on the employee's thumb and amputate 1/4 inch of the thumb.
An employee was using a ladder to access a single-story residential roof when he fell off, landed on the ground, and broke his femur.
An employee was standing on the floor surface when steel erectors struck an adjacent building, causing a piece of steel to break off and strike/deeply lacerate the back of the employee's head.
An employee was walking across a concrete deck and fell through an unguarded floor hole breaking the right tibia.
An employee was moving a pack of sheetrock that was placed against the wall when the pack fell over and struck his knee, requiring surgery.
An employee was stepping off the truck, missed the step, and fell breaking the right hip.

An employee was refueling a job site crew boat on 10/31/16. He removed the boat  battery to plug in the portable fuel pump. During fueling, some fuel ran over and spilled inside the boat. He turned off the fuel pump, cleaned up the area, and reinstalled the boat battery. A fire occurred. He put the fire out with a fire extinguisher and suffered hand and arm pain.
An employee was removing cable from the cable rack when the cable rack collapsed. The reinforcing steel holding the cables fell and struck the employee in the lower right back.

An employee was bent over checking the layout for a window opening with a tape measurer when the wind caused a nearby metal stud (weighing 60 pounds) to fall over on him. He was struck on the back and suffered a contusion, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was starting to clean the cabin of an off-road haul truck used for rough terrain when his left middle finger was caught between the truck frame and the truck door, amputating the fingertip.
An employee tripped and fell over a 2-inch form, fracturing his left elbow.

The bucket on a backhoe froze up and an employee tried to free it up. When the bucket moved, the employee's right hand  was pinched between the moving pin and the hole that it was inserted into resulting in a right thumb amputation.

An employee was on the ground setting up some steel parts when an 8-inch C-channel post that had been previously set became loose and hit the employee on the back of his head, causing head trauma. He was hospitalized and required stitches.
While installing blocking between trusses, an employee fell through the trusses to the concrete floor, suffering a broken leg and hip.
An employee was installing bolts using an extension ladder and fell approximately 13 feet resulting in two broken ribs.

An employee was going up on a fixed ladder attached to a convenience store exterior wall. When he reached the top, he fell approximately 10 feet. During his fall, he hit the back side of his body on the metal toolbox of the company utility track, fracturing his spine.
While stepping out of a construction vehicle, an employee suffered a foot laceration and two fractured toes.
An employee was walking to his work trailer when he was struck by a work truck, breaking his left tibia and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was standing outside a tank that was being cleaned. The cleaning head came out of the tank through the manway and struck the employee causing a laceration to the abdomen and shoulder.
An employee was using a chop saw to cut wooden pieces for window frames when the saw amputated two of his fingers.
An employee was cutting granite to trim the edge and the saw kicked back, lacerating their chin and jaw.

An employee was struck by a 10' x 10' section of wood framing while he was descending from a ladder. He fell 6 feet to the ground. While he was on the ground, the section of framing fell on top of him, breaking his collarbone, two left-side ribs, and two right-side ribs.

An employee was standing in a doorway directing a forklift operator. The front-end assembly on the forklift was being lowered down to retrieve a concrete troweling machine. The boom went sideways and struck the employee, breaking three ribs.
An employee tripped over a halogen light stand and suffered a knee injury, requiring hospitalization.
While cleaning the windshield of a backhoe, an employee slipped and fell to the ground, suffering internal injuries.
An employee was standing on a trailer inside of a tank spraying foam insulation when he slipped and fell 2 feet. He landed awkwardly and fractured his right femur.
Employee slipped off a side boom and hit the side boom stick, breaking his ribs and lacerating his kidneys. He was hospitalized.
An employee was walking with a piece of pipe in his hand when he tripped over a cord that was laying on the ground. He fell to the ground and landed on his left hip, requiring hospitalization.

While stepping out of a trailer, an employee grabbed the hinge of the rear trailer door. The employee's hands were pinched in the hinge, breaking the right middle finger and pinching the left index finger.
An employee was cleaning a truck with a pressure washer when the employee's left hand was lacerated by the pressure washer's stream of high-pressure water.

An employee was cutting metal pipe with a cutting torch that used acetylene and oxygen gas during interior metal removal when the torch caused second and third degree burns to the employee's face and hands. Personal protective equipment was not worn at the time.

An employee was standing on top of a first floor wall and was setting floor joists for the second floor when he lost his footing and fell 10 to 12 feet to the concrete ground below, suffering a head injury.

An employee was going to install bolts onto plates on furnaces located on the third level when he stepped on a piece of metal stair grating that had not been welded down. The grating flipped and the employee fell through the opening to the stair landing 7 feet below, suffering a fractured L1 vertebra.
An employee was framing the external shell of the building when a block of wood fell off a wall and struck the employee's head. The employee suffered a concussion and was hospitalized.
On November 5, 2016, an employee fell approximately 4 feet from a ladder, suffering head and rib injuries that required hospitalization.

An employee was installing a circuit breaker on an existing panel. As the breaker made contact with the bus bar, an arc flash occurred, causing first degree burns on the employee's face and second degree burns on both arms.
An employee was driving downhill to return a UTV (utility terrain vehicle) to a truck when he lost control and capsized, breaking 11 ribs.

An employee was performing a service trouble call at a private residence. He went into the attic and put his hand down on a truss that had a live wire, suffering an electrical shock that required hospitalization.
An employee fell from a height and broke his left leg.
On November 07, 2016, an employee who had been servicing a circulating water pump began to feel ill. The employee sought treatment at a local hospital and was diagnosed with legionellosis.
An employee was operating a circular saw when it cut the employee's hand.
An employee was working on a new recycler, when a piece of the recycler fell on and partially amputated the employee's middle finger.
While installing a light fixture, an employee was shocked and fell from a ladder, hitting the ground and suffering a lower back injury. The employee was hospitalized.

On November 7, 2016, at approximately 8:15 a.m., an employee on a ladder was installing an overhead gas line approximately 12 feet above the ground. A coworker climbed the backside of the employee's 10-foot fiberglass ladder, causing the support rungs to bend and the ladder to collapse. The employee fell to the concrete below and was hospitalized for a fractured collarbone and punctured lung.
An employee was installing acoustic panels while standing on a Perry scaffold system. The system became unstable and the employee fell breaking the left leg.

An employee was installing a grain bin while standing on a ladder when a nearby coworker's ladder fell on him, causing him to fall 13 to 15 feet to the ground below. He suffered a broken left arm and facial cuts.

An employee was replacing a sprinkler pipe while standing on a trestle ladder. As he was tightening the sprinkler pipe with a pipe wrench, he lost his grip and fell from the ladder, injuring his head, back, and left shoulder. He was hospitalized.
An employee was using a metal shear when the shear guard came down and crushed his left ring finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was struck by a car in a work zone, suffering a head laceration, leg and torso bruising, and internal injuries.

An employee was operating wire pulling equipment when the glove on his left hand was caught in a rope, which pulled his arms and body into the equipment. His left thumb was amputated and he required surgery for right wrist and arm injuries.
An employee received an electrical shock of 277 volts while installing commercial light fixtures.
An employee was cutting a steel I-beam using an oxygen/acetylene torch. When he cut all the way through the beam, it fell on and broke his right leg.

An employee was working in the warehouse and loading stacks of panels (3 feet wide, 48 feet long, stacked 7 feet high). One of the stacks fell over and landed on the employee, who suffered internal injuries, broken ribs, and a broken collarbone.

An employee was on a ladder approximately 8 feet up. The employee attempted to move the ladder away from a tree branch, lost his balance and/or footing, and fell onto the concrete sidewalk. The employee suffered a broken pelvis and a fractured rib.
An employee was locking truck compartment doors in the parking lot when a coworker lowered an outrigger on his right foot, crushing it.
An employee was climbing an extension ladder to access a single-story roof when he slipped at the roof edge and fell 8 to 9 feet, sustaining a broken leg and facial trauma.
An employee was descending a 12-foot column form and came down on a section of rebar that was in his path. The piece of rebar impaled his left upper leg.
An employee was moving an A-frame across a loading dock when a drain tipped over and fell. The employee was trapped between the wall and the falling material, breaking his leg.
The employee was climbing the asphalt distributor tank to take measurements when a fire occurred. The employee was burned on the hand, face and upper torso.
An employee was loading a box when it fell back, causing the employee to lose balance and fall. The employee suffered a broken rib and punctured lung.
An employee was compacting an embankment (fill material) using a single drum vibratory roller when the machine overturned. The employee was hospitalized with a broken pelvis.

An employee was preparing to install pipe into a bore hole when the pipe began bouncing on cribbing. He put his right hand underneath the pipe, and his right pinky fingertip was pinched and amputated between the pipe and the cribbing.

An employee went to the top of an asphalt silo to check on a drag conveyor. His left hand became caught in a drive pulley, amputating his middle finger, lacerating his index finger, and fracturing his wrist. The drive pulley was unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was descending a fixed ladder when his foot slipped. He fell from the caged area of the ladder and broke his left leg.

An employee leaving the facility at the end of a shift was physically assaulted by a former employee in the parking lot. The employee suffered serious head and neck injuries including brain swelling and skull fractures.
An employee's fingertip was amputated while aligning an 8-inch PVC drain pipe.
An employee was stepping down from a 6-foot baker scaffold when he fell 3 feet, injuring his shoulder.
An employee was putting a metal plate down in the hole inside of a trench box when his hand was caught between a chain and a steel plate, amputating his index finger.
While installing fascia and soffit, an employee slipped on a roof tile and fell from the roof, fracturing a leg and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was giving hand signals to a powered industrial truck (PIT) operator who was pushing pipe around the yard. When he motioned the operator to lower a bundle, his hand was caught between the fork of the PIT and the pipe bundle, lacerating and fracturing his right thumb.
An employee received an electric shock and burns to the right hand and lower part of the arm and face while tightening a screw inside a cubicle.
An employee was making mechanical repairs on a machine and struck their face with a bar while removing a pin. The jaw was broken.
An employee was struck by a steel angle while performing maintenance on a piece of machinery, suffering a torso injury and neck laceration.

An employee was attempting to install a harness on a roof that was approximately 12 feet high when he fell through a skylight to the ground, injuring his neck and body. He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was assisting with the extraction of a 4-foot by 24-foot steel plate from an excavation. As the steel plate cleared the top opening of the excavation, it rotated and struck the employee in the right side, causing a serious contusion and small tear in the kidney that required hospitalization.
An employee was drilling out old electrical boxes in the pharmacy with a core drill. The core drill spun out of control with the employee on it, resulting in two broken ribs and a punctured lung.
An employee fell approximately 7 feet through an open hole while dismantling old stadium bleachers, suffering a broken arm.
An employee was in a lift and descending when he fell out of the lift, landing on his feet. His right ankle and right heel bone were fractured.
An employee was separating two stacks of bridge railing when one slipped and smashed his right little finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was in a trench preparing to set up a laser lever when an excavator bucket detached from an excavator and struck the employee, who suffered broken ribs and arm lacerations.
An employee suffered a left index fingertip amputation when his hand was pinched by the wheel of the Bid-Well workbridge.
An employee was pouring hydraulic oil into a skid steer when a trackhoe reversed into the door where the employee was standing. The door swung shut, crushing and breaking the employee's right arm.
An employee fell off a ladder and fractured a hip.
While installing plywood decking to a rooftop, an employee lost his balance and fell 11 feet 8 inches to the lower level, breaking his spinal cord/back. Fall protection was not worn at the time.

An employee was grinding on an auxiliary diesel fuel tank to fix a clog when a spark from the grinding wheel ignited diesel fumes inside the tank and it exploded. A piece of the exploding tank hit and broke his right leg below the knee, requiring surgery.
An employee fell approximately 21 feet when a guardrail failed, suffering a broken right arm.
An employee was climbing up the outer portion of a water station when he slipped and fell, breaking his ankle and hurting his back.
On November 17, 2016, an employee fell off a single-story roof damaging their pelvis and breaking the left arm.
While installing a gate, an employee's left middle finger was amputated above the knuckle when the gate pinched the finger as it was being hung.
An employee was struck by a paving machine and suffered broken bones in his foot and leg.

An employee was standing on the roof top of a truck supplying hot asphalt (400 degrees). The hot pipe became loose and had a slight leak. The employee was trying to tighten it when the pipe burst and splashed him with the hot asphalt, causing first degree burns to the face and arms.
An employee was hospitalized after breaking a hip while walking in a sewer.
An employee fell to the ground while repairing shingles on the roof of a private residence, requiring hospitalization for facial injuries and a torn aorta.

An employee was replacing a furnace in a customer's home and was installing a PVC exhaust pipe.  The PVC pipe was to run directly over the water heater out the side of the home.  He set his PVC cleaner and glue on top of the water heater (chest height) as he put the exhaust together.  While installing the final piece, he cleaned the connection with the PVC cleaner and put the dabber back into the can. When he reached for the glue, he bumped the can of cleaner and it spilled on his chest.  He caught the can with his hand but the contents spilled on the floor. The water heater ignited vapors from the cleaner and a fire started, causing first and second degree burns to his chest, right lower arm, right neck, earlobe, left armpit, and both lips.
An employee contacted a capped wire while installing radiation panels. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was part of a rigging crew tasked with using an overhead 8-ton crane to move a heat exchanger through two columns. The employee pushed the exchanger through by hand and it swung back and struck the employee's left index finger and thumb. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.

Two employees were resurfacing part of an interstate when a car entered the construction area and struck a nearby work trailer. The trailer then struck the employees. The first employee suffered a broken left leg, and the second employee suffered left leg lacerations.

An employee was helping a three-man crew with a backhoe to lift a walk-behind saw approximately 6 inches and move it forward approximately 3 feet. The employee attached rigging from the walk-behind saw to the backhoe and stood to the side of the forks approximately 4 feet away. As the backhoe operator lifted the saw, the backhoe forks disengaged and struck the employee's hard hat. The employee was hospitalized for a head injury.
An employee was welding burner tubes when his shirt caught on fire, causing second degree burns to his torso that required hospitalization.
A brace holding up a tilt wall sheered off and swung out of place, striking an employee in the legs.

An employee was climbing a wooden ladder with a string of lights over his shoulder. When he reached the top of the ladder, he attempted to grab the rail but missed and fell approximately 20 feet, lacerating the side of his face and head and breaking his wrist.
An employee was climbing a ladder to a roof when his foot became tangled in the ladder and he fell 8 feet, breaking his ankle.
An employee was cutting a concrete foundation to install an egress window when a piece of concrete broke off and landed on the employee's leg, breaking it.
While accessing the roof, an employee slipped and fell approximately 10 feet, bruising his back and knee. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee suffered burns to the face when an arc flash occurred while he was working on electrical lines. He was hospitalized.
An employee was performing maintenance on the wing of an aircraft and fell to the floor fracturing the right side of their body. The employee was not attached to the SRL at the time.
An employee was using an electric torque gun to tighten bolts when his right thumb was caught and partially amputated between the gun and the steel.
An employee was sliding T-beams from a staging area to a forklift when a beam pinched and amputated his left fingertip.
An employee suffered a partial amputation to the right index finger while cleaning a drive chain on a band saw while the machine was in operation.
An employee's gloved hand was caught in the rotation fan of a welder unit during repairs, amputating the thumb.
An employee was pulling wire when his pinky finger was pinched between equipment and wood, tearing a ligament.
An employee was standing on a 6-foot ladder troubleshooting a light fixture when he lost his balance and fell off the ladder, suffering a subdural hematoma.
An employee fell approximately 11 feet off the roof and was hospitalized with broken legs.

An employee was working from a 14-foot boom lift, setting up a wire pool and trying to place it in a sheave, when he lost control and his right arm was caught between the wire and the railing of the lift, breaking it.
An employee fell 20 feet from a scaffold while helping to build a wall for an elevator shaft. The employee landed on concrete and suffered five broken ribs and a collapsed lung.

An employee had been removing ceiling ductwork from an 8-foot step ladder. When he stepped off the ladder, he rolled his ankle and fell. He tried to brace himself while falling and extended his hands. He suffered a compound fracture of the ankle and a broken wrist.
An employee suffered a hand laceration while using a saw to cut material.

An employee was struck by a motor vehicle driving approximately 35 miles per hour. He hit the car's windshield and was then thrown approximately 30 feet, suffering a broken leg, three broken ribs, and multiple facial lacerations.

While installing plywood covers over the stairwell opening of a new two-story residence, an employee fell approximately 9 feet through the opening from the second level of the home to the concrete floor, fracturing the neck, hip, and two ribs.
While working on the 1st floor mezzanine installing structural steel, an employee was struck in the head by a steel beam and required hospitalization.
An employee was repacking a pump when his right-hand pointer and middle fingers were amputated. The pump was not locked/tagged out at the time.

An employee was working from a ladder on a roof, installing a heating and air conditioning unit, when he fell 20 to 25 feet to the concrete driveway below, cracking his pelvis and ribs and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was operating a table saw to cut backing material when the material became snagged and pulled his right hand into the saw blade, lacerating his middle and ring fingers. The saw was unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was connecting wires to a switchgear when an arc flash occurred, burning the employee's head and shoulders.
An employee fell off a scissor lift that was approximately 12 feet high, breaking both heels and a vertebra.

On 11/29/2016, at 4:00 p.m., an employee was in the machine room when he saw debris on the sheave where the elevator cables wrap around. He started to clean the sheave using a screw driver. When the elevator started to move, the cable caught his left hand and pulled him, causing him to tip over and fall to the ground. He sustained three finger amputations on his left hand, broken teeth, and lacerations to his face, requiring hospitalization and surgery. The elevator was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee suffered left ring and middle fingertip amputations while cutting sheet metal with a mechanical shear.
An employee was helping a coworker who was using a sledgehammer when the sledgehammer ricocheted and hit the employee's face. The employee was hospitalized with head trauma.

On 11/28/16, an employee on a ladder fell to a cement patio floor while handing a pipe boot to a coworker on the roof. The employee suffered a brain hemorrhage and several broken ribs, requiring hospitalization.

On 11/28/2016, an employee was unloading a 53-foot trailer using a forklift. As he was attempting to enter the trailer, the tractor and trailer rolled forward, causing the forklift to fall to the ground.  As the forklift was falling, the employee jumped out of it and hit the ground, breaking his hip and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using a backhoe to lay down a steel beam when the beam broke through the backhoe's glass window and struck his left kneecap. He was hospitalized with a broken left kneecap.

An employee was attempting to climb from one scaffold ladder to another. As he reached to tie his lanyard off to the ladder, he fell to the ground and fractured his right leg, requiring hospitalization.
An electrical current traveled through a crane to a nearby tractor, where two employees were electrocuted.

An employee was plastering a wall approximately 14 feet above the ground while working from a hydro lift when he fell to the ground, breaking his left wrist, fracturing his hip, and rupturing his spleen. He was hospitalized. The lift was not guarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was struck in the face by a metal cap while leak testing a water line. The employee's cheekbone was fractured.
An employee was installing insulation and  stepped on a board with a nail in it. The nail punctured his boot and foot. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was prepping a storm drain in the middle of the road when a city inspector drove up past the site barricade and struck a ladder, which then struck the employee. The employee lost three front teeth and suffered a fractured nose. The employee was wearing a safety vest and hard hat at the time.

An employee was checking for coolant leaks on a generator when his left hand contacted the fan blades, amputating a few fingers. He was hospitalized and had surgery. The generator was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee was walking from the printer to a desk when her right foot became caught on the corner leg of a desk. She lost her balance and fell to the floor, injuring her left hip.
An employee was exiting a ladder to a rooftop when he slipped and fell 10 feet to the ground, breaking his ankle.
An employee was greasing the back of a milling machine when the operator reversed the machine and crushed the employee's ankle that may result in a medical amputation.

An employee was working on the roof of a building when he noticed a crack in a concrete deck panel. As he attempted to remove the deck panel to patch it with wood, the panels he was standing on also broke. He fell almost 20 feet to the concrete floor below, cracking his L2 and L3 lumbar vertebrae. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was removing a temporary barrier wall. A loader with forks was used to lift the wall to relieve pressure so the employee could pull pins from it. The pin shifted as he was pulling it and his right index finger was caught between the bolt and the barrier wall, amputating it at the first knuckle.
An employee was working on a sprinkler pipe while standing on a 6-foot ladder when he fell off the ladder and broke his ankle.
An employee was working at a construction site and his foot was run over by a forklift that was transporting metal sheets. The employee suffered a broken ankle, foot and toes.

An employee was removing service wires from an electrical panel when his pliers slipped and struck the electrical cabinet. An arc flash occurred, causing second degree burns to his right hand and minor burns to his face.
An employee was hanging sheet metal from a ladder when he fell from the ladder and broke some ribs.
An employee was working from a step ladder when one of the ladder legs failed and the employee fell approximately 8 feet to the ground. The employee suffered a bump on his head and was hospitalized.
An employee was opening a crate of safety glass when the glass fell on top of him, fracturing both legs and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was attempting to place roof sheathing material on a new residential structure when the wind picked the employee up and sent him off the edge of the structure to the ground below. He suffered a cracked rib.

An employee was ground spotting while coworkers moved a transformer on a pull and push truck near a railroad crossing when he tripped and fell over a road marker and was pulled under the trailer tires, fracturing his right leg.

An employee was using a 4'x8' 3/4" MDO plywood to construct an 8' trash bin. The employee was using the plywood as a saw horse to put another side on the bin. He went to cut the wood using an electric circular saw and the vibration caused the wood to fall which caused the saw to kick back and amputate his left index finger below the second knuckle and cut his left thumb.
On 12/3/16, an employee fell off a residential roof and suffered head trauma, requiring hospitalization.
An employee misstepped while climbing an extension ladder and fell approximately 10 feet, suffering facial fractures to the eye socket area.

On December 4, 2016, an employee fell from a portable 4-foot, fiberglass A-frame ladder that had been set up on the finished floor and was covered with paper. The floor vents had not been installed and one of the ladder legs was on the paper that covered a vent floor opening. The injured employee had climbed the ladder to approximately the second or third step when the ladder tipped as the leg dropped into the floor hole. He fell and his lower body struck the floor while his upper torso struck against the wall corner. He suffered two fractured right ribs and a punctured right lung, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing a cross arm in a pole with 7620 KV when he received flash burns on the left side of his body (arm to waist). He was hospitalized.
On December 5, 2016, an employee fell to a lower level while exiting the roof, suffering cuts, scrapes, and possible fractures to the wrist and ankle.
An employee was cutting a dock plate when it came loose and landed on the employee's left foot, injuring several toes. Two toes had to later be surgically amputated.
An employee was installing rubber protection (hoses and blankets) on a 13.2-KV powerline when an arc flash occurred, causing second and third degree burns to his upper right back and left upper leg.
An employee pulled the cord on a small water pump motor and their hand was pulled into the flywheel amputating a fingertip (without bone loss).
An employee slipped on some ice and fell to the ground fracturing a hip.
An employee was helping to move a transformer when his left index finger was pinched and fractured between the transformer and metal strapping on the wall.

On December 5, around 9:00 a.m. to 9:30 a.m., an employee was using an aerial boom lift in a road center median. As he was coming down with the basket, the basket became positioned in live traffic and was hit by a box truck. He was hospitalized with fractured ribs and a punctured lung.
An employee's retractable lifeline became caught and the employee fell approximately 28 feet from a metal roof to the concrete below, suffering arm, shoulder, rib, and hip injuries.

On December 6, 2016, around 1:25 p.m., an employee was cleaning the gutters of the second level of a residence from a ladder placed on the roof of the first level. When he was on his way down the ladder, he slipped and fell on the roof, and then rolled off to the ground. He broke his neck and was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was carrying a metal pole to install filler between tables. He was walking by a table truss when he bumped the truss, which was being supported by a cross brace. The truss then fell over and landed on the employee's lower back and leg, pinning him down. He suffered a dislocated left hip and broken left femur.
An employee was connecting a trailer to the ball of a truck. His finger was in the coupling when the trailer came down and amputated his fingertip.

An employee was rigging up forms and installing a lifting hook when the crane operator inadvertently lifted the form. The employee's finger was then caught between the form and the lifting hook, amputating the first left-hand digit.

Two employees were replacing the decking on a roof. They were lifting up the concrete panel using a pry bar when the deck to the right of them gave way and they fell through the roof. One of the employees fell to the concrete floor below and was hospitalized with six broken ribs and a broken pelvis. The employee was not tied off at the time of the incident.
While servicing an HVAC unit on the roof of a commercial building, an employee's finger was caught and amputated or avulsed in the fan belt of the HVAC unit.
An employee was installing dunnage on a trailer float when his left thumb tip was crushed just below the nail.
An employee was unhooking a trailer from a tractor when his left hand was caught between the trailer and tractor, amputating his left index fingertip at the first knuckle.
An employee was working on a 6-foot ladder, repairing stucco at a commercial building, when he fell and broke his arm and ribs. He was hospitalized.

An employee in a drilling rig had drilled a shaft for a new sewer tunnel. The employee was changing the bit on the drilling rig when the seat broke on the operator's station, causing the employee to fall off and into the drilled hole (14 feet). The employee suffered a head laceration and concussion.
While installing metal decking, an employee slipped and fell 15 feet to ground level, suffering broken ribs.

An employee was walking on stilts to his working area. He was working in a computer room (raised floor) that was covered in tile squares. Someone had removed a carpeted tile and he fell between the false floor and carpeted sections of the floor, dislocating his left elbow and breaking his right wrist.
An employee was caulking while standing on a ladder when he fell, injuring his neck and ribs. He was hospitalized.

An employee was walking beside a 26 ft. electric scissor lift when his right foot slipped and was run over by the left wheel of the scissor lift. The employee was hospitalized for fractured bones in his foot.

An employee was going to turn off an escalator after a cable was cut when the zipper on his pants caught on the lever. The lever swung around and bumped the employee who then fell onto a drainage culvert. He suffered a rib fracture and a bruised lung, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was inspecting for leaks on a small 5-foot roof that extended above the main roof. The employee bent over, became dizzy, and slipped off onto the main roof, fracturing a wrist and ribs.
An employee was servicing a heating system (boiler) when it pre-ignited during purging. A fire ball came out of the inspection door and burned the employee's right and left arms.
On December 10, 2016, at 9:30 a.m., an employee was removing shoring equipment when his right thumb tip was pinched and amputated between shoring and an I-beam.

An employee was standing near a frame assembly while a crane was bringing in steel. The crane bumped the frame assembly clamp, which then failed and allowed the frame to fall over and strike the employee. The employee suffered a broken left leg.
While inspecting a construction activity, an employee fell approximately 20 feet to a lower level and suffered a broken leg.

A crew was putting together a slide rail-style protective system. In the process, the injured employee was positioned on the right-hand side of the retaining wall. While the crew was positioning the wall into the positioning slots, the wall jolted to the right-hand side and pinched the employee's hand between the retaining wall and the slide rail. His right pinky and middle fingers were lacerated.

An employee was connecting a cable that had been looped around a pipe to hook the pipe onto an excavator bucket and lay it across the highway. As the excavator operator raised the boom, the employee's hand became caught between the cable and the hook, amputating his left index fingertip.
While cutting a 2 x 4 piece of wood with a miter saw, an employee suffered amputations of the index to ring fingers.

An employee was putting bags on a 16-inch by 20-foot ductile iron pipe that was resting on the forks of a skid steer. The employee was standing in front of the open forks when the pipe rolled off and landed on and broke the employee's left leg and foot.
An employee was installing wires on an electrical box when a worker at the jobsite energized the box, which then burned the employee's right palm. He was hospitalized overnight.

On December 13, 2016, at approximately 2:30 p.m., an employee was climbing an extension ladder to access the roof of a residence when he fell approximately 12 to 15 feet to the ground, fracturing his back. The top and bottom of the ladder were secure at the time of the incident.
On December 13, 2016, an employee was replacing some underground piping and removed a section of existing pipe. The existing pipe then shifted and pinned the employee's left forearm, injuring it.
An employee was stepping off the platform floor of a print shack when she tripped and fell to the ground, fracturing her left femur.

An employee was standing just outside the jobsite fence to direct a truck driver to the truck wash-out area inside the construction site when a driver struck the employee with a public vehicle, fracturing his left tibia.
An employee slid off a damp roof and fell approximately 9 feet to the ground, sustaining a broken ankle that required hospitalization.

An employee was helping to move a large heating/cooling piece of equipment when one of the panel doors fell off and struck his leg, contusing his thigh. His leg became swollen and required hospitalization.
An employee was crushed between an excavator and another piece of equipment, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was operating a cement mixer that was covered with a tarp due to extreme cold temperatures. The tarp covered the mixer's exhaust and trapped carbon monoxide vapors, which the employee inhaled.

An employee used a foot step to climb on top of a 6-foot-tall mud tank to de-sand cones, which needed to be repositioned. When he attempted to reposition the cones using his hands, he lost his balance and fell to the ground, breaking his collarbone and six ribs.
An employee was drilling a piece of metal with a magnetic drill when the bit bound, causing the drill base to spin and amputate the employee's left index fingertip.

An employee was attempting to hook up a ground heater to a truck, but the trailer wasn't hooking up properly. His finger was between the ball hitch and receiver when the trailer dropped onto the hitch, pinching his left ring finger. His fingertip was amputated.
While unloading supplies from a truck, an employee slipped on ice and broke an ankle.
On December 14, 2016, an employee fell in the snowy parking lot while on the sidewalk and was hospitalized for a broken hip.

An employee was terminating underground cables in a three-phase switching cabinet when an arc flash occurred, causing first and second degree burns to the employee's face. The employee was hospitalized.
A temporary employee fell while descending a 6-foot ladder, fracturing the left hip.

An employee was helping to move jersey barriers from a corner to clean up for a storm water inspection. A coworker was lifting the barrier with a skid steer that had forklift forks installed. One corner of the barrier was elevated on the forks approximately 10 inches high when the employee went over the barrier to move a tool that was in the way of where they were moving the barrier. When he was on the other side of the barrier, the concrete corner that was elevated broke off of the barrier. The barrier then fell sideways onto the employee, pinning him between the fallen barrier and the street curb and breaking his left leg.
An employee stepped off the edge of a roof while dragging a roof sheet, falling to the next lower level and breaking ribs.
An employee was cleaning up debris and creating a drywall barrier. When he shifted the drywall, it fell on him, breaking his right tibia and fibula.
An employee was sawing wood with a table saw when the blade amputated two fingers. The saw was unguarded at the time.
An employee was standing on an air line when a coworker yanked on the line, causing the employee to fall and land on a stack of metal bars. The employee fractured some ribs and was hospitalized.
An employee was removing wall flashing when he fell approximately 30 feet from the roof to the ground below, bruising his right-side ribs.

An employee had just installed a windshield in a vehicle and was putting his tool away. He attempted to use the handle of a scraper to push a plastic clip into the cowl when the handle of the scraper, which had a razor blade attached to it, slipped off and cut his left thumb tendon, requiring surgery.
An employee was attempting to set up a trench box when the box shifted and his knee was caught on a spreader bar. His foot was then compressed to his heel in the storm culvert.

An employee was moving from one steel girder to another when his foot became caught on a beam. He lost his footing and fell 14 feet, 10 inches to the ground below, breaking his right knee and lacerating his chin.

An employee was erecting a portable ready mix concrete plant and was lifting steel plates into position when one of the plates became unattached from the boom and fell on the employee's foot, amputating three toes.
An employee fell 20 feet from a roof resulting in broken ribs, a bruised kidney, and fluid in the lungs.
An employee was plugging in a grinder to remove a metal piece from the floor. When he placed the plug into the socket, he was shocked and thrown back about 3 feet.
An employee was taking trash out of a construction trailer when he tripped and fell to the ground, spraining his left shoulder.

Employees were cleaning up the warehouse area when a bundle of boards fell onto an employee striking their head. Two hours later the injured employee suffered stroke-like symptoms and was hospitalized.

An employee was unbolting a storage tank when he stepped on a 3-foot segment of a grated platform that was not secured. He then fell 15 feet to the concrete floor below, breaking his left hip and requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was unloading light poles when a pole slipped from his hands. He tried to stop the pole from falling with his leg and suffered a right upper thigh injury that required hospitalization.

An employee was loading a hydraulic hammer into the back of a truck when he lost his footing and control of the hammer. It then rolled back and caught his hand between the hammer and the bucket of the tractor, amputating his left ring finger.
An employee was troubleshooting a UV chamber to see if there were bulbs installed when something in the chamber burst and contacted the employee's face. The employee lost the right eye.

An employee was rolling a driveway using a compact roller (equipped with a rollover protective system and canopy) when he drove into a tree limb. His right pinky finger was caught and amputated on the tree limb.
An employee was installing windows from a scaffold when the scaffolding collapsed. The employee then fell approximately 12 feet, suffering broken ribs and fingers.
An employee was removing gutters and fell 12 feet through a skylight. The employee suffered a skull fracture, fractured vertebrae, a fractured wrist and a fractured pelvis and tailbone.
An employee was heating a paint spray can with a heat gun when the can blew up, burning his hands, wrists, neck, and face.
An employee was coming down a ladder, slipped, and fell fracturing an ankle.
An employee was loading/unloading steel I beams when a steel I beam slipped off the crane hook and amputated two of the employee's toes.

An employee was cleaning out a gate valve while on a scissor lift about 15 feet in the air. As the employee opened the inspection door on the valve, hot ash dislodged and landed on the lift's control panel. The hot ash on the control panel made it impossible to lower the lift. The employee manually lowered himself from the lift and fell on his back.
An employee was working on forms for a concrete pour and fell seven feet to the deck below fracturing their pelvis and shoulder. The employee was not tied off at the time of the incident.
An employee was painting a house. The employee exited the scaffolding onto the roof and then fell approximately 12 feet. The employee sustained a fractured L1 vertebra and left arm.

An employee was setting culverts along a highway. After a culvert was in place, the employee slipped on the embankment. The employee grabbed the rim of the culvert to catch his fall and lacerated three fingers on the left hand.
On 12/26/16, an employee was bending rebar with a machine. The employee sustained a hand injury requiring hospitalization.
An employee was working on a baker scaffold 5 to 6 feet high when he fell off of the scaffolding and broke a leg and cheek bone.

An employee was walking alongside a forklift moving decking. He was wearing a harness because he would eventually have to go up to an elevated position. The lanyard from the harness became caught on a pipe, causing the employee to fall, which then caused the load to shift. Decking sheets then pinned the employee's left hand between a column and the sheets, injuring his ring finger.
An employee was laying metal decking and fell approximately 15 feet. The employee suffered a fractured left hip and fractures to both arms, the jaw and cheekbones.
An employee was using a handheld skill saw when the employee's glove was caught in the blade. The employee's left ring finger was then amputated up to the first knuckle.
An employee was testing de-energized conductors at a solar farm construction site when an arc flash/fire occurred, burning the employee's hands, face, and neck. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was installing decking and transferring from a static fall protection line. The employee disconnected from one anchor and was trying to reattach to another when the employee fell 15 feet to the ground, suffering a broken wrist and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was walking alongside a Bobcat when he tried to mount the vehicle for a ride. The vehicle then ran over him, breaking his leg.

On December 29, 2016, at approximately 11:30 a.m., a crew was moving skids out of the bottom of a large excavation. The skids had been placed in an excavator's hoe bucket on the ground.
