An employee was unloading the skids from the bucket and handing them to the injured employee, who was positioned next to the track hoe bucket and a super sack of sandbags. At this time, another employee walked by the hoe operator and asked him to take over the track hoe. As he twisted around to speak, his safety vest caught the operating lever and caused the bucket of the track hoe to move and pinch the injured employee's left ankle between the hoe bucket and super sand bag. His lower left leg was fractured just above the ankle.

An employee was unhooking a trailer from the truck and was pulling the 5th wheel pin to drop the trailer. The trailer was on a slight incline and when he pulled the pin, the trailer slid and dropped catching his right hand and causing lacerations.

An employee was blasting angles inside the cargo tank on the upper level of a scaffold. A 6-inch pipe approximately 24 inches above the scaffold deck was running horizontally behind him. During the process, he stepped backwards, lost his balance and fell backwards over the pipe as pressure remained on the hose. His legs went in the air during the fall the blaster blasted his right leg below the knee. The employee suffered a deep laceration and injection injury to his lower right leg.
An employee was wearing stilts to place ceiling grid when he tripped on a metal stud and fell, breaking both wrists.
An employee was dismounting a boom truck when his leg was caught in the outrigger, breaking it.
An employee on a loading dock was walking away from a pallet truck he was handling when he fell 4 feet off the dock to the lower level, fracturing his T4 vertebra.
An employee was using a circular saw to rip a plywood counter top brace when the saw bound up and kicked back, partially amputating the employee's thumb.

While moving equipment (a concrete testing machine) from one building to another via forklift the load became unstable and began to tip off of the forks. An employee attempted to grab the equipment to keep it from falling and his hand was caught between the equipment and a doorframe. He suffered lacerations to his hand and a fracture resulting in hospitalization.

An employee was removing the safety barricade in front of a cap on a 24-inch PVC pipe after pressure testing when the cap became over-pressurized and blew off the pipe, striking him and knocking him against the wall and to the ground. He suffered a fracture to the left side of his skull near the ear and a sprained right knee.
An employee was assisting in a dowel drilling operation and attempting to steady the drill when his glove was caught in the drill bit. His left fourth fingertip was then amputated by the drill bit.
An employee was changing an electrical pole when he fell approximately 10 feet to the ground and fractured his right wrist.

An employee was handing down a sewer connection fitting to an employee below in a trench when a bolt on the fitting snagged on the employee's jacket, causing him to lose his balance and fall. He fell on the fitting, breaking two left ribs and bruising his left lung.
A crane was lowering a steel beam when the beam dropped unexpectedly and struck an employee. The employee suffered broken fingers, a hand laceration, and back pain.
An employee was moving a signal arm at a toll booth gate when a nylon sling failed, causing the arm to swing down and strike the employee's chest. He fell to the ground and struck his head.

An employee was climbing on a baker's scaffold to reach a working platform when the scaffold turned over on top him. He fell approximately 6 to 8 feet to the ground, puncturing his lung and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was trying to grab a small piece a wood that was being cut with a circular saw when his left hand contacted the blade, lacerating his index finger.

On January 5, 2017, at approximately 10:20 AM, employees were moving a small safe in order to renovate the floor and wall behind the safe. They attempted to lift the safe one corner at a time to place a shim under each corner. While they were placing a shim under a corner, the safe slipped off the pry bar and caught the injured employee's left-hand index finger, crushing it to the middle knuckle. The finger had to be amputated.

An employee was cutting off a tree branch with a chainsaw while standing on a guard rail. The branch pushed back and struck him in the chest. He was pushed against another tree and fell off of the guard rail.

An employee was using a tugger machine to pull wire through a conduit when the machine mounts broke free, causing the employee to fall backward and strike the metal racking. The employee suffered a hand laceration and cracked ribs, requiring hospitalization.

On January 7, 2017, at approximately 2:40 p.m., an employee was attempting to lay out structural steel pieces with the assistance of a forklift truck. A steel truss fell over and struck the employee's legs resulting in fractures and crushing injuries to both lower legs.
An employee fell 10 feet through a hole while removing a carbonate roof fracturing a wrist, eye socket and temple.
On January 6, 2017, at around 10:00 AM, an employee was using a baker scaffold to patch concrete on interior walls when he fell about 4 feet to the hard floor below, fracturing his pelvis.

An employee on a baker's scaffold reached over to tie a wire lath when the scaffold tipped and he fell 5 feet 6 inches to the ground, fracturing his left femur. The scaffold had guardrails and the wheels were locked at the time.
An employee was replacing a natural gas pipeline when he slipped on ice and fractured his left ankle.

An employee was on a ladder installing a recessed light when the ladder (which was nailed into the wall) came away from the wall. The employee fell with the ladder, breaking the right femur and left leg below the knee.

An employee had rigged slings and shackles to a 419-pound fan silencer and communicated to the crane operator via radio to cable up. A coworker was helping stabilize the silencer because it was upside down in the shipping crate. While trying to stabilize it, an employee's fingers were caught between the silencer leg and the ground.  His left index fingertip was crushed and had to be amputated, and his left middle finger was lacerated.

An employee was helping a carry deck crane operator deliver items to the field. He followed the crane in a golf cart to the fab tent to retrieve equipment. As he was walking out of the fab tent with a strap in his hand and looking down at the strap to perform a visual inspection, the crane operator was putting his outriggers down. They did not see each other and an outrigger caught the employee's big toe. The outrigger smashed the steel toe of his boot, splitting and breaking his big toe.
An employee tripped over a window opening and fell off a balcony, breaking ribs and an arm and suffering internal injuries.

Employees were laying a tarp over a section of a trench. Two employees slipped and fell approximately eight feet into the trench. Both employees were hospitalized. Employee 1 suffered broken ribs. Employee 2 suffered torn tendons/ligaments in his hands.

An employee was replacing the thermostat on a pole hauler truck. He was accessing the engine from the passenger side fender using a step ladder. As he was transitioning from the ladder to the fender, the ladder became unstable and the employee fell resulting in a fractured right femur.

An employee was climbing to the top level of a steel commercial building under construction to perform decking work. The employee climbed to the first elevated level and his hard hat fell to the ground level below. The employee went to the edge of the level to ask someone to get his hard hat for him. At this time, the employee lost his footing and fell to the ground below causing broken arms and injuries to his face. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was walking into a residential setting to repair a furnace when he slipped and fell on the icy pavement, hitting his head and fracturing his skull.

An employee was attempting to locate an underground conduit by using a fiberglass duct rod with an attached copper wire. The rod came into contact with a ground bar inside a switch gear, causing an electric shock that burned the employee's shoulder and both feet.

An employee was removing a light enclosure. He was standing on a 8-foot A-frame ladder and was on the fifth step when he lost his balance and fell to the ground. He injured his left knee and was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet while removing formwork, suffering trauma to both arms, the face, and the torso.
An employee was loosening rusty bolts on a traffic light and aggravated an existing hernia. The employee was hospitalized for surgery to repair the hernia.

Employees were performing maintenance work on an HVAC unit on the roof of the building. As an employee was descending a ladder, his right leg slipped and he fell 10-12 feet to the concrete floor fracturing both legs and ankles.

An employee was using a torch to cut a 10 inch diameter pipe for removal on top of a pipe rack approximately 30 feet high. The employee's fall protection equipment was unhooked to move down the pipe. The employee lost his balance and fell 30 feet resulting in two broken wrists.
An employee was using a step ladder in a garage while framing and fell resulting in a broken ankle.
An employee was working on a pump trailer and was pulling on a wire in order to clean the door. The wire snapped and the employee fell off the trailer. The employee was hospitalized for a concussion.
An employee was prefabricating rebar pile cages on horses when his leg was struck by a rolling pile cage, fracturing his knee and requiring hospitalization.
A cross arm fell and hit an employee in the head.

An employee was about to install a fascia board on a roof. When he climbed out of a lift bucket onto the roof, he lost his footing and fell approximately 13 feet to the ground below. He broke his ankle and required surgery.

An employee was cleaning up the area and drove over a manhole. The lid fell into the manhole and the employee went into the manhole to retrieve it. The employee slipped and fell resulting in a broken right tibia.
An employee was building forms for a concrete pull box and stepped on an X brace. His foot slid down the brace and he severely rolled his ankle resulting in a broken tibia.
Two employees were conducting a pre-job assessment. When the employees opened an electrical box an arc flash occurred burning both employees on the face.
An employee slipped on ice on the roof deck and fell on the roof deck suffering a pinched nerve in his neck.
While cutting a piece of wood trim on a table saw, an employee cut the fingers on the left hand. The pinky finger required amputation at the hospital.

An employee operating a forklift lowered the forks while another employee was loading it. The employee's finger was caught between the pallet and floor resulting in amputation of the right middle finger to the first knuckle.

On Friday, January 13, 2017, at approximately 8:20 AM, an employee was moving rebar on the third floor when he stepped out onto unsupported plywood and fell approximately 10 feet onto the second floor stairway. The guardrail had been removed the previous evening to allow removal of formwork and was not reinstalled. The employee suffered a compression fracture of the T11 vertebrae.
An employee was walking up the ramp of an equipment trailer when the grating on the ramp suddenly gave way and his foot fell through the ramp grating fracturing the lower right leg.
An employee was climbing a ladder carrying welding leads when the ladder kicked out from under him causing him to fall 16 feet. The employee suffered a fractured pelvis and a broken arm.

An employee was waiting inside of his vehicle for the pipe to pull through and heard the equipment make an erratic sound. The employee stepped out of his vehicle to check on the pulling equipment. As he approached the cable pulling equipment, the cable released from its guide/pulley and whipped back and forth striking the employee and breaking an arm.
An employee was working at the oil drill site repairing a compressor unit and was injured. The employee's injuries included broken teeth, a laceration under the chin and possibly a fractured jaw.
An employee was installing a light fixture, contacted a live wire, and fell off a ladder. The employee sustained multiple skull fractures, facial contusions, and a burn on his hand and arm.

An employee was descending a ladder approximately 10-12 ft. high when the employee fell and hit his back on a fence. The employee suffered 4-5 fractured ribs, a broken ankle and a fractured orbital bone.
An employee was leveling the base of a unit with the use of a chain fall to lift the corner while adjusting the concrete anchor. The unit dropped and crushed his right index finger.

An employee was trying to remove a tool extender bit from a hand drill wearing slip-resistant gloves. The employee grasped the tool extender bit and when the drill was turned on, the glove became entangled and torqued. His finger was squeezed between the glove and drill bit, amputating the left pinky fingertip.
An employee was pulling a truck out of a ditch with the winch from another truck and amputated the left pinky fingertip.
An employee was cutting shingles with a manual shingle cutter and amputated the left index fingertip.

An employee was operating an excavator machine approximately four feet from an above ground power line when the power line arced out and electrocuted the employee who suffered second degree burns on the right arm and a broken wrist.

An employee was walking through the yard and stepped on a piece of plywood on which other materials were stacked. The plywood shifted and the stack of rebar fell and struck the employee's leg. The employee suffered a broken leg requiring surgery.
An employee was inspecting a well at a customer's site when he slipped and fell on a patch of ice, breaking his rib and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was walking across a roof purlin to attempt to connect to a retractable lifeline when the purlin broke and he fell 20 feet to the concrete below. He broke his neck and suffered brain swelling.
An employee was installing a door when his right thumb was caught between the door and the jam, severing it before the first joint.
An employee fell 18 feet from a flat roof, suffering a lacerated spleen and broken ribs.
An employee fell from a job-made ladder while accessing the upper deck at a work site, suffering foot injuries.

An employee and a coworker were lifting a trash cart to empty its contents inside a dumpster when the employee's left middle finger was caught between the metal dumpster and the trash cart. The employee's fingertip was amputated up to the nail bed.
A temporary employee tripped over a bundle of metal studs and fell onto the concrete floor, fracturing the femoral head bone.

An employee was walking on a steel beam that was lying on the ground when it flipped over and pinned his leg between it and another beam. His right leg was fractured above the ankle, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was guiding a tractor trailer into an unloading area. The employee realized some pipes were hanging over the side of the trailer and moved behind and to the side of the truck to warn the driver to stop. The employee got caught between the trailer and a wall resulting in a broken left arm and two broken ribs.
An employee was pushing a container of hot asphalt on the roof when the asphalt splashed him, severely burning his face and neck.

An employee was standing on a flat bed truck while a transformer was being loaded onto it with a sky lift. Outriggers were not used at the time. The sky lift tipped over and struck the employee on the head causing a laceration to the ear and abrasions to an arm and leg. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was carrying a bucket up a ladder to an 18-foot roof. The employee then stepped on plywood sheathing and slipped off the roof to the ground, suffering a broken tailbone.

The employee was walking on two stacked railroad ties to take a picture of aerial construction. The railroad ties shifted causing the employee to fall. A railroad tie rolled into his right leg and fractured it in three places.
An employee was tying rebar. As he disconnected his positioning hook to come off the rebar, he fell to the ground, breaking his arm and ribs and displacing a disc in his back.
An employee was helping to direct a trackhoe in placing 30-foot concrete barriers on a roadway when a barrier fell on his left foot, partially amputating his pinky toe.
While stepping onto a joist on the second floor of a commercial construction site, an employee fell 13 feet to the ground below, fracturing the left pelvis and elbow.

An employee was installing form boards inside a confined space cell. While working inside the cell, a piece of pipe (bell reducer) approximately 7" long, 8" diameter, and weighing 55 pounds fell approximately 35 feet and landed on the employee. The employee suffered a neck fracture and a left hand metacarpal fracture with a complex laceration over the web space.
An employee was loading material onto the roof of a newly constructed home when he fell to the ground and fractured his elbow and hip. Fall protection was not worn at the time.
While cleaning debris from a roof, an employee fell approximately 12 feet to the ground, breaking a rib.

An employee was climbing a scaffold to access the building's roof. As the employee was crossing the walk boards to get to the roof, the employee fell 12-14 feet to the ground resulting in broken ribs and a neck injury.
An employee was unloading material from a flatbed truck and fell from a ladder resulting in three broken ribs and a punctured lung.

On 1/24/2017, an employee was dismounting an excavator when his safety vest got caught on one of the levers. The lever engaged and caused the bucket to drop on a second employee who was standing close to the excavator and crushed both of his ankles.

An employee was transporting a scaffold section from the hall of a school under construction to a bathroom to begin masonry work. The employee had his hand against the wall as he was waiting to erect the scaffold. Another employee slid a section of the scaffold down to the injured employee. At that point the section slid down and amputated the employee's left pinky fingertip.

An employee was assisting another worker with transporting bricks to complete the job. The employee was climbing down from the scaffold when he slipped on one of the railings and fell approximately six feet striking another piece of the scaffold during the fall. The employee was hospitalized with a broken leg.
An employee was climbing a ladder and fell approximately 4 feet fracturing an ankle that required surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was relocating sprinklers above the ceiling and was shocked by live wires resulting in hospitalization.

An employee was climbing a ladder to access the blower motor. The employee was standing on the fourth rung when their right hand came in contact with the running pulley belt resulting in amputation of the right middle fingertip.
An employee was walking to their car in the parking lot, slipped on ice and fell fracturing a hip.

On January 25, 2017, at around 9:30 a.m., employee 1 was operating a Skyjack Telehandler forklift with a telescopic boom and outriggers on the front. Employee 2 attached a nylon choker midway down a steel pipe that was 40 feet long and 10.75 inches in diameter. Employee 2 then attached the other end of the checker to a hook located under the boom of the forklift just behind the forks. Employee 1 lifted the steel pipe and carried it to an area where there were existing above ground steel supports. The designated area was muddy and wet. Employee 1 put the outriggers down and extended the boom approximately 40 feet and placed the steel pipe down onto the steel supports.  Employee 2 was removing one end of the checker from the hook on the bottom of the forklift boom that was about 10 inches above the steel pipe, when the telescopic boom came down on top of the employee's right hand that was on top of the steel pipe resulting in fractures and lacerations to his fingers.
An employee was inspecting a water heater in the attic of a residence and fell 8 feet when the ladder gave way, landing on his back.

The injured employee was standing at the edge of an excavation when an excavator hit a natural gas line while digging resulting in a fire. The injured employee suffered first degree burns to the lower right arm and thigh.

An employee was behind the dump truck trying to pull the dump gate up in order to drop it back against the truck and loosen gravel. The truck driver lowered the truck bed and the dump gate crushed the employee's right ring finger.

An employee was driving a flatbed delivery truck loaded with construction materials (e.g. lumber) to a residential construction job site.  The employee drove into the respective subdivision and past his destination.  The employee stopped on the roadway, place the vehicle in reverse, and attempted to drive back to the destination. The vehicle stalled and the employee jumped from the cab of the moving vehicle resulting in a broken ankle.

An employee was pushing fish tape through a pipe. The fish tape fell from the employee's hands and onto an energized buss/switchgear creating an arc flash. The employee suffered burns to the face, arm and hand.

An employee was lining up pipes to be connected when the clamp that holds the pipes together broke and the employee's left index finger was caught in the lifting chains amputating it at the first knuckle.
An employee was installing a curtain wall and fell through a hole in the floor breaking the right femur and the right arm.
An employee was working from a ladder and fell approximately four feet injuring his back.
An employee fell approximately 15 feet through a skylight and sustained broken legs, feet, and ankle. The employee was not connected to his lifeline at the time.
An employee was kicking garbage to clear an area and struck a solid object under the garbage resulting in the dislocation of the right knee requiring hospitalization.
An employee working inside a trench was struck by the bucket of an excavator fracturing his hip.

An employee was performing decking work and fell approximately 30 feet while moving from one work area to another. The employee suffered broken facial bones. The employee was wearing fall protection at the time.
An employee was erecting the second tier of a masonry scaffold when he fell approximately 10 feet to the ground below breaking the L1, L4 and L5 vertebrae. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was about 13' up a cell tower in a spider basket taking steel off of the tower for new reinforcement. The employee fell and sustained lower back fractures. The employee was not tied off at the time.
An employee was walking down the stairs in a building when the stairs collapsed and he fell from the third to the first floor landing on his left side and injuring his wrist and back.
An employee was approximately four rungs up on an 8-foot A-frame ladder when he slipped while trying to tighten bolts on a steel structure and fell breaking the right ankle.

An employee climbed onto the bed of the truck to retrieve a 2x4 off of the rack and fell approximately five feet to the ground.  The employee suffered multiple left wrist fractures and a head laceration.
An employee was performing maintenance on equipment when a spring broke and a piece struck the employee's face causing a laceration.
An employee was operating a truck and fell while descending the ladder backwards (i.e., while facing away from the ladder) sustaining face and back injuries.
An employee was on top of the semi-truck unloading steel joists when the load shifted and struck the employee. The employee fell and hit his head on a concrete block.

An employee was removing a steel cross brace from a steel I beam. The crane hook was not centered over the brace and when the brace came free, it struck the employee in the leg and head. The employee suffered a leg contusion and was hospitalized for blood clots that developed in his leg.
An employee was operating a gas powered saw and lacerated his left leg from the top of the left foot to just below the knee area. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee had been working on a lower-sloped porch roof and was preparing to get off the roof to have lunch when he noticed a four-foot level was getting close to the edge of the roof. The employee reached for the level and slipped on snow or ice or some other moisture and then fell off the roof approximately ten feet to the ground. The employee was hospitalized for a head injury.

An employee fell approximately 15 feet from the roof while working. The employee suffered a broken collar bone, broken ribs, a collapsed lung and a concussion. The employee was not using fall protection at the time.

On January 31, 2017, an employee was removing teeth from a core barrel that was used to drill a 30-inch diameter eight-foot deep hole. The employee was facing towards the hole when he was witnessed as experiencing seizure type symptoms. The employee turned around and looked upwards. The employee then backed up and fell into the hole. The employee suffered a broken neck.
An employee was cleaning an airless sprayer and pressed the trigger while his finger was at the nozzle and the sprayer contents were injected into his right index finger.
An employee fell approximately 16 feet through an elevator shaft resulting in broken ribs and a punctured or collapsed lung.
An employee was fixing a damaged pipeline and was struck by a pickup truck. The employee suffered a broken leg, rib trauma, damaged spleen and a punctured lung.

An employee was walking alongside a Lull (forklift) while balancing a 21 ft. long pipe next to the front tire. As the operator moved forward, the Lull ran over his foot. The employee's foot was amputated.

On February 1, 2017, an employee fell while installing roof sheeting. The employee's fall protection retractable did not hold, and the employee fell from the edge of the roof to the ground, breaking ribs and a hip.

An employee was framing the corner area of an apartment complex on the fourth floor when he fell approximately 30 feet from the edge to the dirt surface below. He broke his left wrist and a bone in his back, requiring hospitalization. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was working in an excavation, tightening flange bolts on a pipe, while an excavator operator was changing the excavator bucket nearby. The bucket came loose, hit the ground, and rolled approximately 10 feet into the excavation, striking the employee and pinning him underneath it. He suffered a lower leg injury.
An employee was walking on the roof toward a ladder when he fell 15 feet through a skylight to the ground, breaking his right leg. He was hospitalized.
An employee was preparing to drill a building foundation with rigging when a cable wrapped around his ankle, breaking his leg.
An employee was lowering the lift gate on a stake truck when his fingers were caught and smashed beneath the closing gate. His left middle finger was partially amputated.
An employee was working from a ladder on top of a roof when the base of the ladder slipped, causing the employee to fall and break an ankle. The employee was hospitalized.
While cutting molding with a saw, an employee suffered a cut to the right interior forearm, requiring hospitalization. The saw was unguarded at the time.
An employee was lifting a rebar cage with several coworkers when he felt a pop in his back. He was hospitalized with a slipped disc.

An employee was riding in a truck on icy/snowy roads when the truck and trailer became stuck in a snow drift. The employee then attempted to push the truck out of the snow drift. When the truck became unstuck, it rolled forward, causing the trailer to strike and pin the employee underneath it. The employee suffered a bruised back and bruised legs.
An employee was using a hoist attached to a bracket to pull a guy wire right.  The bracket broke causing the guy wire to strike and break the employee's arm.

An employee was changing a lamp in a light fixture when he lost his balance and fell off an 8-foot ladder. He struck the concrete below and suffered a broken back bone, fractured skull, and brain trauma.
An employee was cutting plywood with a table saw when the blade partially amputated his right thumb.

An employee was on an 8-foot ladder installing a bus duct switch when an electrical arc flash/blast occurred, burning the employee's face and right hand. The employee was also thrown from the ladder, suffering fractured ribs.
An employee fell off a 20-foot ship ladder, suffering a fractured left elbow, dislocated left shoulder, broken left ankle, two broken ribs on his right side, and a broken right leg.

An employee was watching a crane drive a timber pile into the ground. His hand was between the cable and the timber pile as the crane operator lifted the cable. The cable then pulled tight, pinching and amputating his right thumb tip.
An employee was guiding a steel load that was being lowered from a tower crane when the load pinned and crushed the employee's right foot.
While installing metal sheets on a roof, an employee fell through an old sheet of roofing material to the concrete below, suffering a left arm injury.

An employee was removing an attachment from a skid steer. He released the locking devices of the bucket and disconnected hydraulic hoses from the machine, but the bucket did not separate completely from the machine. The employee operated the machine and raised the bucket to check if debris was preventing it from disconnecting. When he came over to check the bucket, it dropped on and broke his left foot.

An employee was terminating a ground wire onto a mechanical lug on the lower half of a 480-volt, 200-amp disconnect. When he loosened the mechanical ground lug, the ground wire came into contact with an energized A-phase, which was not fully insulated, at the top of the disconnect. An arc flash then occurred and burned the employee's face and left hand.
An employee was feeding a roll into a tube-cutting machine when his hand entered the hopper area of the machine. The internal cutting blade then amputated his right middle finger.

An employee was installing a handrail system in a newly constructed railcar unloading facility. A railway machine that was slowly moving through the area contacted some construction material, causing it to pivot and pin the employee's leg between the material and the edge of the concrete slab. The employee suffered a leg laceration and fractures, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was standing underneath a 40-foot cell tower section that was propped up on jacks. The section fell on and pinned the employee, fracturing his clavicle, vertebrae, and ribs.
An employee was cutting an exterior trim on a table saw when his push stick broke and his left hand went into the saw. His left thumb was amputated above the knuckle.
An employee was installing a reamer rod in the ground when the rod cut his right leg.
An employee was opening a window when it fell down and pinched the employee's right index finger between the metal sash and the bottom of the window, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was pulling belts on a large blower when his hand became caught on a belt. His right ring fingertip was amputated and a bone broke in his right index finger.
On February 8, 2017, at about 9:30 AM, an employee was inspecting air handling units and amputated his right middle fingertip when it was caught between the moving belt and pulley of a fan blower.

An employee was hooking up a strap to connect a small excavator to a concrete saw. While a coworker was picking up the saw with the excavator, he attempted to readjust the straps at the moment the two pieces of equipment came together. His left ring finger was caught and amputated from the nail between the excavator bucket and the concrete saw.
An employee fell while going from a ladder to the roof, breaking ribs and the collarbone. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was filling a mixing hopper when two fingers on his right hand were amputated by the mixing paddles.

An employee was removing a steel pot that was in the upright position. The steel pot was supported by its own weight on the ground. In trying to do so, the steel pot shifted and leaned to one side. The steel pot landed on a piece of cement wall that was adjacent to the steel pot. The employee's finger was caught between the steel pot and the cement wall. The employee's right middle finger was amputated at the last knuckle.

An employee was operating a pipe grooving machine when the employee's glove and hand were pulled into the point of operation, partially amputating the right index finger to the second knuckle and the middle fingertip to the first knuckle.
An employee was removing shoring material when it slipped out of the employee's hand and amputated the right pinky fingertip.
An employee was inside a trench box waiting on pipe to be lowered when a piece of PVC pipe fell from above and struck the employee's leg above the ankle.
An employee was stripping nails from formwork when the formwork shifted and lacerated the employee's left ring finger.

An employee was installing an arch pipe in a driveway. After the employee released the mechanism on the hoisting apparatus that held the pipe, the pipe fell on the employee's finger, pinching it between the pipe and the concrete driveway. The employee's right ring finger was amputated at the first joint.
An employee was emptying the truck of salt. The employee tried to clear a jam in the auger when their glove got caught and their left hand was pulled into the auger resulting in a fractured hand.

A pipefitting crew was installing wear pads on a 30-inch-diameter pipe. When they lifted the pipe with a chain fall, it fell approximately 1 to 2 feet and pinched an employee's right foot between the pipe and support, injuring his right small toe, fourth toe, and the distal portion of his foot. He was hospitalized.
An employee was setting windows on the first floor when he lost his balance, fell backward, and struck his head on a concrete parking block.
An employee was balancing a granite countertop that was on the floor when it fell on and broke his left ankle.

An employee was helping a coworker load a piece of equipment called a "walk-behind" onto a trailer. He was at the back end when they lost control of the equipment, which started to roll. His left middle fingertip was crushed and amputated by the equipment and the trailer.
An employee was performing maintenance activities on a rock crushing machine when the machine's bucket struck him. He suffered a chest contusion and was hospitalized.

An employee was standing on a ladder changing out a light fixture. As he reinstalled the light, he was shocked when he touched the wiring. He fell approximately 4 to 6 feet from the ladder and struck his head on the concrete, fracturing his skull. The fixture was energized at the time of the incident.

An employee on a scaffold was helping to install metal roofing material when a strong gust of wind blew and knocked the employee over the rail. The employee fell 10 feet to the floor, suffering skull and vertebrae fractures.

An employee was forming metal on a press brake when he experienced a cramp in his leg and began to stretch his leg to get the cramp out. In the process of taking care of the cramp, the foot pedal was engaged which caused the machine to cycle and partially amputate his left ring and middle fingers.

Two employees were carrying a sheet of metal decking. When they went to put the sheet down, one employee's finger was caught between the cement wall and the sheet of metal decking, amputating the left index fingertip.
An employee was walking across the jobsite when a reversing bulldozer struck him, breaking his right leg and dislocating his left hip.
An employee was ground spotting during post pulling activities when his fingers were caught between the post pulling plate and a rigging strap. He suffered one broken finger and one lacerated finger.
An employee fell approximately 5 feet while climbing on a vertical metal formwork to install whalers. The employee was hospitalized with back bruising.

An employee was laying metal decking when his foot slipped on a bar joist, causing him to lose his balance and fall 17 feet to the ground. He suffered a fractured rib, fractured vertebrae, and a lacerated liver, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was helping a coworker lower and position a steel beam onto a rolling cart when his right middle finger was caught between the steel beam and the rolling cart, amputating his fingertip at the nailbed.
An employee was working on the roof of a weather shelter when he fell 6 feet to the ground, crushing three vertebrae.
An employee was operating a floor buffer on the second floor when he stepped back and fell from the upper level, which had no guardrails in place. He suffered a head injury and was hospitalized.

An employee was helping a Lull operator offload crates of switch gear from a truck when one crate became caught on another. The Lull operator then tilted the forks down. The products slid down and pinched the employee's right fingertip, amputating it.
On February 15, 2017, at about 9:30 AM, an employee was using an excavator to push a concrete pipe together when his right forefinger was partially amputated above the fingernail, requiring surgery.
An employee was carrying two 1-gallon bottles when his foot was caught on the leg of a power press and he fell, striking and breaking his lower leg on the foot of the machine.
An employee was attempting to re-spool electrical wire onto a drum when he tripped over the wire and hit the ground, fracturing his ribs, right index finger, and left elbow.

An employee was standing on an extension ladder installing shingles on the roof. The employee was using a nail gun when the hose became tangled. The employee pulled on the hose and fell approximately 5 to 6 feet from the ladder to the ground, breaking vertebrae.
An employee stood on the second rung of a platform ladder while cutting a door opening. When he stepped off the ladder, he rolled and fractured his left ankle. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was climbing a ladder when he lost his grip on the rung and fell approximately 10 feet to the ground below. He damaged his shoulder and fractured his pelvis, wrist, and elbow.
An employee was looking over the second-story balcony of a building when the guardrail gave way and the employee fell to the ground. He suffered pelvic and rib injuries.
While moving materials across planking, an employee fell 11 feet to the ground, suffering a fractured right wrist.
An employee fell and struck a scaffold while climbing a ladder to the roof, suffering a fractured cheek bone.
An employee fell down the stairs and suffered head trauma, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was working from a ladder to connect a light fixture. The circuit was live and shocked the employee, causing him to fall 8 to 10 feet off the ladder. He suffered a minor electrical burn on his left hand, a lower back fracture, and a fractured right heel.

An employee and a coworker opened the hood of a dump truck to diagnose why the fan of the radiator was not engaging. The injured employee was on the passenger side while the coworker was on the driver side. The coworker entered the cab and started the engine. The injured employee contacted the radiator's belt and pulley at that moment, which amputated the end joint of the employee's right index finger.
An employee was removing a piece of pipe when he lost his balance and fell approximately 12 feet to the ground. He bruised his lung and broke his wrist and ribs.

An employee was working on the elevated surface of a scaffold. As he turned the corner from one scaffold to another, he fell approximately 15 feet to an elevated roof deck below, lacerating the back of his head and suffering other scrapes and bruises. He required hospitalization.
An employee was cleaning the blade of a power tool when it activated, partially amputating his right thumb. The blade was unguarded at the time.
An employee was moving drywall on a motorized pallet jack when his leg was caught and fractured between the jack and a scissor lift.

An employee was on the second level of the roof with his harness on and was preparing anchors to start work. The employee fell 15-20 feet through a hole and suffered broken ribs, a torn right lung, a ruptured spleen, a broken pelvis and bleeding on the brain.

An employee on a ladder was drilling a hole in concrete when the drill bit made contact with a rebar rod and kicked back, causing him to lose his balance and fall to the floor. He broke his left foot and right leg.

An employee was holding the rigging line while he was signaling the operator to lift the load. As the load was lifted up, it shifted and his left hand little finger was caught between the rigging strap and the lifting box and was amputated.

An employee was using a crow bar to move steel beams for unloading while standing on the trailer bed of a truck. 

The crow bar came loose from the material, causing the employee to lose his balance and fall to the ground. He extended his arms to break his fall, resulting in broken bones in his right wrist and left elbow. He required surgery.
An employee fell 18 feet from an apartment complex roof while installing shingles, breaking two right-side ribs.
An employee on a bakers scaffold fell while attempting to remove a light fixture. The employee's head struck the floor and suffered a contusion, requiring hospitalization.
The cover of a splice box closed on an employee's hand, amputating the ring and middle finger down to the middle knuckle and a small portion of the pinky.

An employee was sweeping the area in front of a work site when a flatbed truck containing post tension cables arrived. The truck pulled in through a gate and stopped to begin off-loading the post tension cables. The forklift operator unlatched the post tension cables and then noticed that the truck had stopped near a mound of dirt which the operator could not access with the forklift. When the truck moved forward, a post tension cable shifted and fell off the truck striking the employee who was sweeping in the face causing multiple lacerations and severing the top part of his left ear.
An employee was on a scaffold preparing an area for masonry work when the employee fell from the scaffold and onto some bricks, suffering a back injury and head laceration.
An employee suffered a left index fingertip amputation.

An employee was removing a gutter from the wall of a residential structure and descending an 8-foot A-frame ladder when he missed the bottom two rungs and fell to the ground. He hit his head on a brick wall, sprained his back, and lost consciousness, requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was helping to load a backhoe hammer into a trailer when the employee's thumb was caught and partially amputated between a chain and the side of the trailer.

An employee was standing on an extension ladder in an in-surface pool to take field measurements of an opening in a soffit. The employee then fell off the ladder and struck their head on the side of the pool.
On February 22, 2017, at approximately 4:00 PM, an employee was operating a circular saw to cut a small block of a 2x4 when the saw amputated his left thumb.

An employee was cutting a piece of plywood on a table saw when his left glove and hand were caught and pulled into the saw blade, amputating his index and middle fingers and lacerating his ring finger.

On February 22, 2017, at approximately 4:15 p.m., an employee trimmed the top of a dead, 85-foot tree. The tree was notched and roped, and the employee made a back cut. As the tree was being pulled over, it caught the fork of a second tree. The second tree uprooted, fell, and struck the employee in the back left side, resulting in broken ribs, a fractured shoulder, and a punctured lung.
An employee and a coworker were attempting to remove a sewer grate when the grate shifted and pinched the employee's thumb between it and the ground. The employee's thumb was partially amputated.
An employee was riding in an aerial lift when the lift went off a curb and tossed him up. When he came back down, he struck the edge of the lift, cutting his leg.
An employee was installing a transmission line when the cable snapped, causing it to recoil and strike the employee in the mid section. He suffered broken ribs and a collapsed lung.

An employee was cleaning a concrete pump and breaking down the pipe. He was running a pig through the pipe when an air pocket in the pipe caused the pipe to buck and strike him, breaking his left tibia. He was hospitalized.
An employee was loading tools into company vehicles when he tripped and fell on asphalt, breaking his left elbow and wrist.

An employee was loading a pair of forks for craning onto a delivery truck. The pair of forks have a sliding mechanism that helps with loading and unloading. One of the forks slid towards the employee as he was loading the truck and his right middle fingertip was caught and amputated (no bone).
An employee was attempting to loosen a bore with a cheater pipe wrench when the wrench spun around and hit the employee's head, fracturing the skull.
An employee sustained a fractured right leg when a trench collapsed.
An employee was performing mechanical work from a six-foot A-frame ladder. The employee fell from the ladder and struck his face on the concrete ground resulting in a fractured jaw.
While working on the air conditioning on a new home construction, an employee fell off an eight-foot ladder suffering a compression fracture of the L1 and L4 vertebrae. The employee was hospitalized.

On 2/24/2017, an employee was changing out the hangers that hold up piping inside the pump room. As he grabbed the material, his right pointer finger was caught and crushed between the top piece of the hanger and the pipe, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was standing next to a bore pipe observing the work. An excavator was being used to pull an auger bit out of the bore pipe. A chain was attached to the excavator to pull the auger sections. While the excavator was pulling the auger, the chain failed and whiplashed into the employee's face. The employee lost the left eye and suffered a right orbital socket fracture.
An employee slipped on ice on the sidewalk and fell, suffering a fractured hip that required surgery and hospitalization.
An employee stepped into a hole and fell 14 feet while welding on an I-beam, fracturing the right shoulder and tailbone.
An employee was fixing a water leak in the attic at a customer's home when he fell 9 feet through the attic to the wooden floor, breaking his right wrist and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was working on a plank on an elevated surface 6' from the ground. The plank broke and the employee fell to the ground resulting in a compound fracture to the left leg.
An employee was working with a table saw and amputated his thumb and index finger.
An employee fell through a skylight and sustained a dislocated shoulder and a broken lower leg and ankle.
An employee was shoveling dirt around a gas main pipe in a trench approximately 5' x 8' x 5'6" deep. A section of the trench caved-in breaking the employee's left ankle.
An employee was climbing a ladder, slipped and fell off resulting in a broken left leg.
An employee was sweeping off the roof, slipped on ice and fell 13 feet to a lower level. The employee sustained broken ankles and a broken wrist.
An employee was assembling a trench box when his finger was caught in a pinch point between the spreader and another trench box shield, resulting in the amputation of two fingers.
On February 27, 2017, at approximately 12:40 PM, an employee was assembling a scaffold and fell from the scaffold. The employee was hospitalized for a herniated disc.

The injured employee was helping another employee remove a three foot concrete wall from a hoist. When the wall was removed from the hoist it became unstable and fell onto the injured employee's right foot fracturing it.
An employee was moving steel from one location to another and broke a leg.
Employees were drilling holes to obtain geotechnical soil samples on a cold day. An employee's jacket was caught in the auger, pulling him into the auger and breaking his ribs and arm.

An employee was guiding two wooden utility poles supported by a winch when one pole struck a pole lying flat. This caused one of the two supported poles to shift, slip from the restraints, and fall striking the employee's right foot and fracturing a toe.
An employee was working on a scaffold and fell approximately 15 feet. The scaffold fell on top of him when he landed on his back.
An employee fell from the third scaffold level to the ground below resulting in a fractured and dislocated finger.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet from a mezzanine to the concrete ground below resulting in a broken hip and elbow.
An employee was hospitalized for carbon monoxide poisoning while working at a construction site.
An employee was struck by a forklift injuring his hip and fracturing his leg and foot.
A worker was on the seventh or eighth rung of a 10-foot ladder and fell resulting in a broken rib and a bruise to the head.
An employee was moving a piece of steel plate with a hoist. The steel plate swung into the employee's lower left leg, fracturing it.

An employee received an electrical shock when he made contact with a 277V circuit. At the time of the incident, the employee was relocating a 2' x 4' ceiling grid light fixture using an 8-foot A-frame ladder.

An employee was using a chop saw to cut a pipe. The pipe was wet and his hand slipped from the pipe up into the saw blade. The employee's left index finger was amputated at the first knuckle and the left middle finger was lacerated.
An employee fell approximately 25 feet from a section of a roadway bridge during remodeling. The employee sustained fractures, contusions and a concussion.
An employee injured his right hand when it was caught in the moving parts of a router during flooring installation.
An employee was hospitalized for dehydration after spreading grass seed.

Employees were in the process of connecting gas to a fire pit. The gas accumulated underneath the access door where the injured employee was monitoring it. A flash fire occurred and the injured employee sustained first degree burns to the face and second degree burns to the left elbow. He was admitted to the hospital.

Employees were building the stairs to the loft area in a barn. The injured employee was carrying a piece of housewrap in front of him and fell 14 feet through the stairs that were under construction. The stairs did not have guardrails at the time. The employee suffered three broken ribs, a fractured hip and internal bleeding. His spleen had to be removed.
An employee was removing rubble from the tailgate of a dump truck when his hand was smashed in the tailgate resulting in amputation of the left ring finger.
An employee was removing a wall form away from the scissor lift. The scissor lift dropped after it was freed pinching the employee's finger.

An employee was throwing a 4-inch cast iron pipe into a garbage dumpster. The dumpster was full and the pipe came back and smashed his left hand ring finger. He was hospitalized for a severed tendon in the finger.

An employee was descending a baker's scaffold from a height of approximately 4 feet 9 inches. The employee fell from the scaffold ladder to a concrete floor and suffered a head injury. The employee was admitted to the hospital.
An employee suffered a toe amputation when his foot was caught between the roller and the sheet.
An employee was unloading scaffold planking from a truck when the load shifted and a plank fell striking the employee's back. The employee suffered a spinal injury, broken jaw and bruises.

An employee was cutting the bolt heads off carrier flights of conveyor chain when the oxygen hose on the torch unit sprung a leak and the oxygen ignited. The employee's shirt caught on fire and the employee was burned on the left side of his chest.
On Monday, March 6, 2017, at approximately 1:30PM, an employee was operating a tractor when the tractor rolled over trapping the employee underneath. The employee's lower left leg was fractured.

An employee was cutting a section of a six foot I-beam and placed it on the material cart. The employee's left hand was caught between the I-beam and the cart resulting in amputation of the middle fingertip.

An employee was inside an M-Starter cabinet mounting a bracket to the back panel using a cordless drill. Energized wires were located outside the cabinet along the back panel and an arc flash occurred. The employee received burns to both hands, wrists, and arms and the face.
An employee's left index finger was caught between the chain and the concrete while unloading a precast concrete box, resulting in amputation of his fingertip.

An employee was removing a steel caisson tube and lacerated four left-hand fingers when he grabbed the rigging hook and his left hand was caught between the hook and the tube as the tube slid downward.

An employee was installing a 400 pound cable tray into a skid when his hand was caught between the cable tray and the skid when the cable tray was lowered. The employee suffered the amputation of the distal phalanx on his right pinky finger.
An asphalt crew was lifting a piece of equipment when an employee strained his back and injured ribs. The employee was hospitalized.
While an employee was moving an 80 lb. grate, the employee fell 15 ft. through the hole in the floor. The employee suffered broken ribs and stitches to his face.
An employee was working on the roof when a gust of wind blew a loose piece of roofing insulation that struck the employee in the head knocking him down. The employee suffered a concussion.

An employee was working on a wall and using a positioning device when his anchor point failed causing the employee to fall approximately 11 feet six inches to the lower level. The employee suffered a fractured left wrist.
The injured employee was acting as a spotter for the skid steer operator. The skid steer jumped forward and ran over the spotter's foot. The employee was hospitalized for a fractured foot.

The injured employee was helping the apprentice install 6 inch rigid conduit. The injured worker was installing the conduit while the apprentice held the pipe. The conduit slipped out of the apprentice's hands and struck the injured worker's left hand injuring his finger. The finger was not amputated, but required surgery to repair.

The injured employee was moving an anchor point to a different position to continue adding shingles when he fell 10 feet from the roof of a three-story building to the flat roof of the second floor resulting in a head injury and hospitalization. The employee's lanyard was detached from the anchor point at the time.

An employee was assisting others to move a partition wall. The employee stepped backwards, tripped and fell. As the employee was falling, the employee twisted their body and landed on their shoulder. The employee sustained a broken right shoulder and was hospitalized for surgery to repair the fracture.
An employee was pulling wire while working from an 8 foot A-frame ladder. The employee lost his balance and fell off the ladder breaking the right leg.
An employee was installing duct wrap from a 10 foot step ladder and fell. The employee struck his head and was hospitalized with a head laceration.
A stairway fell onto an employee's ankle causing a fracture that required hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was cutting decking material with a circular saw. The employee miss-stepped and lost his balance. In doing so, the arm that was holding the saw raised and lacerated the opposite forearm. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee returned a loaded trailer to the yard at the end of the day. The loaded trailer was supported by a jack. It fell off the jack and landed on the employee's right leg/foot causing multiple fractures that required surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was operating a table saw and cut his hand requiring hospitalization for surgery.

Two employees were removing a plywood cover over the vault for a pad mount transformer. One employee stepped forward while lifting and fell into the 3-foot deep hole. The employee sustained a fractured mandible, broken teeth and lacerations to his face.
An employee was grading gravel next to a backhoe when the control lever got stuck and struck him in the hip resulting in a fracture in the ball-and-socket joint area.
An employee was unloading roofing materials on a flat roof when a gust of wind blew him off the roof. The employee fell 16-17 feet to the ground fracturing an arm in numerous places.
An employee tripped and fell down an unguarded stairway resulting in injury to the employee's head, back and shoulders.
While releasing a turnbuckle for a poured concrete wall, an employee's right ring finger was amputated at the first knuckle.

An employee was releasing the tarp that rolls over the top of the load of the dump truck, when the employee fell to the ground causing a pelvic fracture. Strong winds were a factor in the employee's fall.
An employee was performing maintenance on a motorized roll-up door and received an electrical shock and burns to the index finger and thumb.

The employee and a second employee were confirming measurements adjacent to an open stairwell that did not have the stairs installed yet. While looking at the blue prints and masonry wall to the north, the employee stepped to the east into the unprotected stairwell and fell approximately 11 fell to the ground below. The employee suffered a broken left scapula, fractured ribs on his left side and fractured vertebrae in his lower back.
An employee was inspecting the work being done when a metal scaffold board failed and the employee fell ten feet. The employee sustained a broken arm, three broken ribs and two broken vertebrae.

An employee was waiting for his trailer to be off loaded. He was leaning against the trailer with his left hand resting on the trailer when his left thumb was crushed between a board and the step deck platform of the trailer during the unloading process.
An employee was ascending an eight-foot step ladder to install a metal strut and fell five feet off the ladder fracturing the right ankle.

An employee was hospitalized after his left arm was caught inside the hose of a high pressure vacuum while the employee was collecting abrasive blasting debris on a bridge. The employee suffered from severe swelling and inflammation of his left arm, from the upper biceps to the hand while cleaning the hose of the high pressure vacuum.
An employee fell 35 feet to the ground while handing sheet metal up to the roof from a JLG. The employee suffered fractures to the lower extremities.
An employee was doing stucco work when a roll of roofing paper fell off the roof and struck the employee in the head.
An employee fell from a collapsing cantilever scaffold and suffered a compound fracture to the right leg.

An employee was installing steel grating on the mezzanine level of a newly constructed building when the steel grating panel unexpectedly shifted and fell. The employee fell 20 feet with the panel, suffering skull and vertebrae fractures.
An employee was breaking down the scaffold system when a bar slipped, knocking his safety helmet off and striking his forehead. The employee was hospitalized for a concussion.
An employee was loading insulation into a blow machine when he tripped. As he tried to catch himself, his left thumb tip hit a gear and was amputated.
An employee was connecting a beam to a column when the beam struck and caught his forearm between the beam and column, causing internal bruising that required hospitalization.

On 3/13/17, a ladder slipped while an employee accessed an elevator pit and the employee fell 14 feet to the elevator platform. The employee then rolled and fell an additional 6 feet to the elevator pit, suffering a hairline fracture to the head.
An employee was cutting plywood with a powered hand saw when his left index finger touched the saw blade and was amputated.
An employee was erecting a scaffold and was on the second level when he slipped and fell 12 feet to the concrete floor, breaking his left ankle. He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was working with sheet metal and studs. He did not realize that a piece of sheet metal was close behind him and when he moved his arm, the sharp edge of the sheet metal struck his left arm resulting in a laceration to his triceps. He was admitted to the hospital for treatment.
On March 13, 2017, at approximately 11:30 a.m., an employee was unloading copper pipes from a forklift when he suffered an umbilical hernia and was hospitalized.
An employee was installing a section of scaffolding and suffered a hernia.
An employee was stacking scaffolding material in a rack and crushed his hands between boards. The employee's left middle finger was fractured and lacerated.
Two employees were cleaning out a tank with a vacuum hose and an air lamp when a flash fire occurred burning both employees on the face.
An employee was pulling a pallet jack into the buck hoist and got his right foot caught between the pallet jack and hoist fracturing it.
An employee was on a ladder cutting a piece of wood that was inside an attic access. The ladder slipped out from under him and he fell breaking his right arm.
An employee was on a 6 foot A-frame ladder cutting a 2x6 using a circular saw and amputated a finger.

The injured employee was part of a three man team replacing a rope in a high rise elevator. The employee was feeding part of the rope through the rigging when excess rope on top of the car created a loop. The employee's right leg was caught in the loop and when it tightened the employee suffered a compound fracture to the lower leg.
While performing maintenance to a large piece of equipment, an employee burned their back with scalding water that was being used to flush the  equipment.

An employee was replacing a fluorescent light fixture when he was shocked and fell off a ladder approximately 5 feet high. The employee suffered an injury to his shoulder blade from the fall as well as the electrical shock from the light fixture. The employee was admitted to the hospital.

The injured employee was walking along side the forklift in order to steady a piece of equipment being moved by the lift. The equipment was being carried in a sling that was suspended on the forks of the lift and the employee was walking in front of the lift with his hand on the equipment to prevent it from swinging. The employee tripped and the lift struck the employee. The injured employee sustained two broken hips and a fractured pelvis.
An employee was paving a highway road and was struck by a cement truck. The truck ran over the employee's left leg.
An employee was working on the ground close to an excavator when the excavator bucket lowered and struck the employee resulting in a dislocated right ankle and possible cracked ribs.
An employee was working on top of the roof installing drains and fell approximately 25-30 feet to the ground breaking both legs and ankles and displacing a hip.

An employee was installing fascia onto the truss inside of a two-story house from an extension ladder 6 feet above the floor. His upper body was leaning over the wall when the ladder slipped. As he slid down, his stomach struck a piece of all-thread rod that was protruding from the wall resulting in a puncture wound and hospitalization.

Two employees were moving light poles in a parking lot. The injured employee slipped and fell in front of the other employee who was operating a Lull at the time. The Lull ran over the injured employee's foot. The injured employee was hospitalized for treatment of a broken left foot.
An employee was getting lunch meat from the cooler box and walking back to the slicer when her foot got tangled in a box strap causing her to fall and injure her right hip.

On March 16, 2017, an employee was changing evaporator coils on the roof-mounted cooling unit for the store's walk-in cooler.  The employee was going up an extension ladder to access the roof from the street when the ladder slipped from under him and the employee fell approximately 12 feet to the ground below. The employee suffered a broken right leg above the ankle and a shattered heel bone. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee suffered atrial fibrillation after shoveling snow and was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was conducting touch-up work on precast concrete on a worksite and suffered a stroke.
An employee amputated the right ring finger while operating the back pack vacuum machine.
An employee was walking the work site in preparation for land clearing. The employee tripped and landed face first onto a tree resulting in a cut lip and chipped teeth.
While climbing up a scaffold to measure a window, an employee fell approximately 9 feet to the concrete ground, breaking ribs and the pelvis.
An employee was operating a cutoff saw to cut pipe when it bound and kicked back, lacerating his chest, neck and cheek.
An employee lost his footing and fell in the path of an excavator bucket, which scraped his right leg, causing a hairline fracture and swelling that required hospitalization.

An employee was trying to pick up a piece of concrete with a walk-behind mini track loader when he was kicked back by the loader and struck a concrete wall behind him. He suffered a fractured hip and pelvis.

An employee was adjusting the jib lock at the side of the main boom on a 55-ton boom truck. He loosened the lower securement bolts. While loosening the upper bolts one of the lower bolts came out and the jib slipped off of the locking plate. It dropped a couple feet until resting on the cab and struck the employee on the face and left shoulder.

An employee suffered a fingertip amputation while working with conduit on a concrete floor. The injured employee was manually bracing a piece of metal conduit while another employee applied pressure to bend it. The conduit rolled and caught the injured employee's finger between the conduit and the concrete floor resulting in amputation of the left middle fingertip.
An employee's hand slipped while cutting wood with a table saw. The saw blade then avulsed the employee's left third fingertip.

An employee reached into a gang box to get some welding rods. He placed one can of welding rods to the side and set it on another can of rods. He was reaching to grab a 1/8" can of rods when an opened can tipped over and lacerated his ulnar artery with the metal lid.

On March 21, 2017, an employee was cutting sheathing with a circular saw to make an opening for a staircase and fell 9 feet 3 inches from the first floor to the basement resulting in a fractured eye socket. The employee was not wearing fall protection at the time.
An employee was feeding wire into a wire-pulling unit when the employee's fingertip entered a pinch point on the machine and was partially amputated.
An employee was cutting aluminum stock on a table saw. A piece of metal kicked back and severed the tendon to the thumb on the right hand.
An employee was loading pre-fabricated racks of 4-inch conduits from a cart onto a trailer when his finger was caught between the cart and the conduit, amputating his right ring fingertip.
An employee was cutting pipes located in the ceiling. The employee dismounted the ladder and broke both feet/ankles.

An employee was standing on a ladder to install an HVAC at a jobsite when he slipped and fell approximately 4 feet to the ground. He cracked several ribs and felt sore on his right side, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing transition duct on top of a unit when he fell 5 feet to the concrete below, breaking his leg.
An employee was pushing a loaded scaffold rack onto a pallet jack and pinched his right thumb between the pallet jack handle and the pipe spool resulting in amputation of the thumb.
An employee was in a cage carried by a forklift with his harness on when the cage with him inside fell approximately 12 to 14 feet to the ground.

Employees were inserting 6-foot pipe into a mill lathe. When the machine turned on, one of the employee's hands was caught between the lathe and valve stem resulting in lacerations to two fingers on the right hand.
An employee was cutting concrete with a power saw when it slipped and lacerated his hand.

A crane operator was setting up to perform work on the HVAC units on the roof. The rear outrigger penetrated the concrete surface which caused the crane to partially turn over in the direction of the counterweights. The pill ball swung back towards the crane cab. The crane operator exited the crane cab and struck the injured employee standing outside the crane cab knocking him to the ground. The injured employee sustained fractured lower vertebrae, a foot fracture and a head contusion.

On March 24, at around 7 a.m., an employee was working on an HVAC piping system that was under a pressure test. Believing that the pressure test was completed, he removed the end cap from the pipe. There was still pressure in the pipe, which caused the end cap to fly off and strike him in the mouth area. He suffered lacerations to his mouth and cheekbone.

On March 24, 2017, an employee was spotting a front-end loader that was loading barrier walls onto a low boy trailer when one of the barrier walls (12 feet long, weighing about 5,000 pounds) fell on his ankle and fractured his left leg. He was hospitalized and his leg was amputated below his knee.
An employee fell 2 to 3 feet from a bakers scaffold, suffering  broken ribs.

On March 24, 2017, at 10:30 a.m., an employee was in a manlift trimming tree limbs with a chain saw when he lost control of it and received a severe laceration to his left index finger. He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was leaving a roof where he was laying insulation when he fell 35 feet through an uncovered hole. He hit several air ducts on the way down and sustained head lacerations, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was working on a plank supported by two A-frame ladders when the plank broke, causing the employee to fall approximately 5 feet and break the right femur. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was surveying a site to install cable when a brick wall from the neighborhood fence came crashing down on the employee. The employee was knocked down by the falling brick and debris, suffering trauma to the facial area, a broken jaw, and several fractures of the sinus cavity and eye socket. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee and a coworker were changing out an actuator cylinder. They were using supplied air to operate the cylinder and align the holding pin by lowering and raising it. The employee aligning the holding pin asked the air supply operator to put air into the line. Afterwards, the employee was checking the alignment when the cylinder dropped and amputated the employee's left middle fingertip before the bone.

An employee was erecting steel grate flooring on a tower while wearing personal fall protection. He was repositioning himself to another location when he tripped and fell 30 feet to the concrete surface below, landing on his left shoulder and head.

An employee hooked up a chain sling to a section of I-beam so a bridge crew could move it with a crane. He was guiding the material as the crane moved it when the chain sling slid and allowed the beam to roll. His right index fingertip was then caught and amputated between the chain and I-beam.

An employee was cutting 2x4s with a circular saw for grout forms. The boards were on saw horses. The saw kicked back and the employee's hand slipped under the saw resulting in amputation of the right ring fingertip.

On March 27, 2017, an employee fell approximately 12 feet through a hole on the furnace deck and struck the floor below, suffering left shoulder, left internal, and facial abrasions that required hospitalization.
An employee had welded a clip onto a vent plate. He was using a come-along to straighten the plate when it broke off and lacerated his elbow.

On March 28, 2017, at approximately 11:00 a.m., an employee was cutting around an old water main line in preparation to install a new main when the east wall of the trench collapsed. He was buried up to his waist in dirt from the collapse, suffering a possible hip fracture.
An employee was standing on a folding ladder painting the overhang of a house when he overreached, lost his balance, and fell to the ground, breaking his arm.
An employee was jet rodding a sanitary sewer line when the jet rod hose ruptured and cut the employee's right hand.

On March 27, 2017, at approximately 12:00 p.m., an employee was on the existing roof of the high school with a coworker, cutting a hole in that roof for the installation of an HVAC unit. He then stepped into the hole and fell to the floor approximately 15 feet below, suffering fractures to his hip and pelvis and contusions to the head and both hands. He was hospitalized.
An employee and crew were laying pipe in an easement when the employee backed into the roadway and was struck by the rear wheels of an 18-wheeler. The employee suffered a broken femur.
An employee was breaking a metal conduit to make it fit into a trash cart when the end hit his face, breaking a bone and requiring surgery.

An employee was inside a stationary scissor lift, loading windows into the lift basket from a wooden box on a nearby all terrain forklift, when he exited the scissor lift to retrieve a window he could not reach and fell 6 to 8 feet to the ground below. He suffered a broken wrist, nose, and back.

An employee was cleaning a patch kit machine after use. The employee was using an air wand to blow sand from around the machine. There was a clump of sand that he couldn't get out with the air pressure so he attempted to remove the clump of sand with his hand. At that point, the machine cycled and amputated his left index finger. The machine was guarded at the time.
An employee smashed his left pinky finger while pulling the lever of a 6-yard tilt dumpster. Half of his finger had to be medically amputated.
An employee was descending an 8-foot A-frame ladder when he slipped on the second or third step and hit his head on the floor.

An employee was using a hot tap device to drill a pilot hole into a steel pipe that had green liquor flowing through it. After drilling the pilot hole, the employee was attempting to withdraw the drill bit/holder beyond the ball valve, so the valve could be closed. While the employee was withdrawing the shaft, a coworker was trying to close the valve, but could not get the valve handle to turn. The employee continued to pull the drill bit out of the piping until the shaft came out of the device, allowing green liquor to spray him and burn his chest and side.

An employee was helping to erect a balloon wall when the metal tie down straps gave way, causing the balloon wall feet to kick out and the wall to fall on him. He suffered a fractured vertebra and was hospitalized.
An employee was working to install a box culvert. He was walking across a stream when he slipped and fell onto a hardline discharge hose from a pump, suffering internal bleeding.
An employee was using a wooden handled cant hook to move a wooden pole. The handle broke causing the employee to fall backwards, twisting and breaking his right ankle.
An employee was installing ground rod, slipped, and injured his left palm.
An employee was installing precast concrete fence panels when a panel fell onto his right hand, crushing his right index, middle and ring fingers.
An employee was removing stickers from duct work when they fell off an 8-foot ladder and suffered a concussion and bruises to the shoulder and back.

An employee was observing delivery of equipment from a truck using the power lift gate. The equipment became unbalanced and fell off the lift gate striking the employee and knocking him backwards. The employee sustained a fractured right knee and a tendon injury.
An employee was repairing a switch panel and received third degree burns to his hands and face from an arc flash.

Employees were guiding a metal light pole from its base to the ground. As the employees were guiding the light pole, the top portion of the light pole came in contact with a 7200v overhead power line. All three employees received burns to their hands and one employee received burns to the upper torso.
An employee was loading an exhaust fan on a flatbed truck when his left shin hit the fan and was lacerated.

While unloading a reel of wire with a pallet jack, the wheels of the pallet jack rolled off the truck's lift gate causing the wire and the pallet jack to flip over onto the ground and strike the employee's ankle and fracturing it.
An employee was unloading drill rods when their gloved right hand got caught in the boring machine and was injured.
While performing wood framing activities, an employee fell through a floor hole and struck the ground, suffering broken ribs and a punctured lung.
An employee was painting a newly paved road when a vehicle struck him, breaking both of his legs and one of his shoulders.
An employee fell approximately 12 feet from a ladder while attempting to access the roof, suffering broken ankles.

An employee was exiting a vehicle when it started to move, causing him to lose his balance. He fell backward and hit his head on the ground/concrete, busting his eardrum. The parking brake was not engaged at the time of the incident.
An employee was on a ladder against the roof when the ladder slipped, causing him to fall to the ground. He sustained fractured vertebrae in his back and was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a press brake and suffered broken fingers. The employee was removing shims from under a four-way die on the press brake when the dies shifted and pinched the employee's fingers.
An employee cut his fingers while using a circular saw.
An employee was operating the boom truck and received injuries to the chest, ribs, and shoulders when the truck rolled over onto its side and over the employee.
An employee fell four to five feet off an extension ladder resulting in a broken lower right leg.

An employee was applying tape to metal flashing on a flat roof approximately 12 feet high. The employee fell from that roof and was hospitalized for a broken right toe, bruised ribs and a sprained right arm.

Two employees were using a manlift to paint the bridge approximately 30 feet above the ground with an identified, energized, electrical power line running parallel to the bridge containing 12,000 volts of electricity. Either the manlift basket made contact with the electrical power line or the power line arched and made contact with the manlift basket resulting in injury to one of the employees.
