The employee suffered first and third degree electrical burns to his right arm, stomach and back.
An employee was climbing onto a trailer when the hook the employee was holding broke off. The employee fell to the ground tearing their ACL and suffering a head injury.
An employee was moving a girder and was pinched between a girder and a piece of steel resulting in a broken pelvis.
An employee was cutting a circle from a piece of plywood using a circular saw when it kicked back and lacerated his right toe and the one next to it. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting lumber to make a form for a concrete slab. The saw kicked back and cut the tip of his right index finger resulting in amputation of the fingertip.
An employee was cutting plywood using a powered saw and suffered a partial amputation of the left ring finger.
An employee was swinging a sledgehammer while removing tracks from the excavator and suffered chest pains.
An employee was driving a ground rod down with a ground rod driver when the driver came off the rod and broke his left thumb.
An employee was walking on plant property when he slipped on wet fly ash and fell resulting in a fibula and tibia fracture.
An employee was unloading pipe from a trailer when the employee's right hand became caught between the pipe and trailer, breaking the thumb and causing lacerations.

An employee was emptying a trash dumpster into a 30-yard, roll-off container at the loading dock when the dumpster started falling into the container. The employee attempted to catch the dumpster when it slid down and amputated the last digit of his ring finger between the dumpster and roll-off container.
While going to grab a wheelbarrow, an employee stepped and fell through rotten metal decking, suffering a head injury that required hospitalization.

While removing roof decking, an employee stepped on the end of a sheet of decking that was not supported. The decking tilted and the employee fell 10 feet to the concrete floor, fracturing three ribs.

An employee was using a front-end loader bucket to push against a plow. The employee went under the plow to knock a bolt out with a 3-pound hammer. When the bolt broke free, the bucket dropped and struck the employee in the head.
An employee was replacing a gutter from a ladder when the ladder slipped. He then fell 15 feet to the ground and fractured his pelvis.
An employee was installing a catwalk in the area where a new trimmer machine was getting ready to be installed when he fell 15 to 20 feet and landed on his head, suffering severe head injuries.
An employee began running to warm up when he fell and broke his left femur.
An employee was painting the ceiling while on a scaffold system that was about 10 feet from ground level when the employee fell from the scaffold and suffered a head injury.
An employee was waterproofing culvert boxes. He was attempting to cross a 4.5-foot gap between the boxes when he fell backwards to the ground and broke his leg.
The employee was troubleshooting a pump jack when an arc flash occurred burning both hands.
An employee was installing concrete moldings when he fell from the third floor porch and fractured his right femur and right wrist. He was hospitalized.
On April 8, 2017, an employee was cutting a 10-inch water pipe using a pipe saw when the saw blade kicked back and lacerated his face. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was setting a piece of metal floor decking on the 2nd floor when he stepped back and fell through an undecked portion of the floor. He fell down onto the 1st floor concrete flooring, fracturing his right wrist and skull.

An employee was trying to de-energize the medium voltage temporary switchgear. He was pulling down on the knife switch, which was spring loaded, and thought the switch completed the action to the "open" or off position when the knife switch sprung back up, striking him on the right side of the face. He was hospitalized with a laceration to the corner of the mouth, a fractured eye socket, and a damaged tear duct.
An employee was unclogging a trash chute at a construction site when something hit the top of his right foot resulting in fractured tarsals.
An employee was pushing two rigging cables through the whip line head block to untangle them and amputated a finger.
On April 10, 2017, a temporary employee was using a nail gun and shot a nail into his right knee resulting in hospitalization to surgically remove the nail.
An employee was doing framing work while standing on a plank of wood when he fell approximately 10 feet to the ground, injuring his body and back.

On April 10, 2017, at approximately 11:15 a.m., an employee was performing maintenance on a rooftop HVAC unit when he fell 19 feet through a skylight to the ground. A personal fall arrest system was not worn at the time of the incident. The employee was hospitalized with severe internal injuries such as a lacerated liver, punctured lung and head trauma.
An employee was paving a road when a passenger vehicle broke through the barriers at the construction zone and struck the employee, who was hospitalized with a head injury.
On April 11, 2017, an employee was cutting wire with a hand-held cable cutter and suffered a partial amputation of the right thumb.

An employee was disassembling an 75-ton conventional truck crane. The employee was watching the cables as they moved through the sheaves. The employee removed a pin out of the boom and the boom dropped, pinning the employee to the ground. The employee's knees and ankles were crushed.
An employee was working on a roof installation and suffered a heart attack.
An employee was cleaning the hydrovac tank when a valve failed and struck him in the face. The employee suffered injuries to his face and jaw requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell off a scaffold breaking his leg and pelvis.
An employee fell while climbing down a 16 foot aluminum extension ladder resulting in a broken left wrist/arm and bruised ribs on the right side.
On April 12, 2017, an employee was nailing plywood to a truss with a nail gun, when the nail gun double jumped and a nail went through his right foot.

An employee was working from a ladder approximately 11 feet above ground, lining pre-cast concrete panels and performing final welding of the panels. The employee fell from the ladder while attempting to align the panels. The employee was hospitalized for a traumatic brain injury.

An employee was working off a scaffold side bracket patching a concrete wall structure in an elevator shaft. While working off the outrigger platform, the platform failed causing the employee to fall about 30 feet to the ground. The employee suffered three fractured ribs, a punctured lung, and a dislocated right elbow.
An employee was climbing a ladder to get to the roof when the base of the ladder slipped out and the employee fell approximately six feet to the concrete sidewalk resulting in a fractured ankle.
An employee was struck by a pickup truck during a flagging operation on a road construction project, suffering broken ribs and left leg, spinal, and liver injuries.

An employee was dismantling a scaffold and stripping its platform when the employee fell approximately 8 feet from the platform to the concrete below. The employee fractured four ribs and four vertebrae, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell from a roof and broke his hip.

An employee was weighing 55-gallon drums that were on a pallet next to a scale. When he tried to rotate a drum off the pallet and onto the scale, his right thumb was pinched between two drums, amputating the thumb tip.

On April 13, 2017, an employee suffered a fracture of his right femur after he was struck by a displaced railroad rail while performing cutting operations. The rail was hoisted via backhoe grapple while being cut by the injured employee. As the employee was making the cut the rail fractured, striking the employee in the leg.

An employee pulled a 40-foot long spool (pipe hardware) from near the bottom of a skid using a rope that was tied between the crane outrigger (rear passenger side) and the pipe spool. As the outrigger was retracting, the employee's left hand and arm were caught between the outrigger base and the crane outrigger causing a crushing injury to the employee's left hand/wrist that resulted in surgical amputation.
An employee was cutting a roll of flooring protection with a handheld circular saw when their left hand middle, ring and pinky fingers contacted the rotating blade. The ring finger was amputated.
On April 13, 2017, an employee was attempting to "block off" a cylindrical boiler and caught their right index finger between the boiler and the dunnage resulting in a fingertip amputation.
While performing re-roofing activities, an employee fell 7.5 feet off the roof to the surface below, fracturing two ribs.
An employee was loading and unloading 3" pipe from a trailer to the ground when a pipe rolled and pinched his finger. His finger was amputated.
An employee was holding a clamp while a coworker swung a hammer. The coworker struck the employee's finger with the hammer, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was getting ready to pour a concrete footing when the outrigger became unstable, causing the pump jib to move and strike the employee's left leg. The employee suffered a compound fracture below the knee and above the ankle, requiring surgery.

An employee was ascending an indoor ladder into an attic space to replace air filters. While on top of the ladder, the employee lost stability and fell off, landing on a metal mailbox case and then the floor. The employee suffered severe pain in the lower back and right leg.
An employee fell through a stair opening at a home construction site and was hospitalized for injuries to the head, ribs and hip.

An employee was performing demolition work. He opened a large heat treating oven door. When he opened the door, a piece of metal fell from atop the door and struck the employee's left arm causing a laceration to the arm.
While operating a drilling machine, an employee was struck by the machine, suffering a broken left knee and pelvis.
An employee fell approximately 12 ft. from a scissor lift while doing electrical work. The employee suffered multiple fractures including vertebrae, foot, wrist and hip.
An employee was cutting wood stakes out of 2x4s with a hand saw and lacerated a finger on the left hand.
On April 17, 2017, at approximately 3:30 p.m., an employee received an eye injury when he was struck by a nail from a second employee's nail gun.
An employee was installing HVAC ducts, fainted and fell approximately 10 feet injuring his head and back.
An employee was hospitalized for burns to his body from the chest up from an arc blast.

An employee had climbed an A-frame ladder to install a window unit. As the employee was holding the window unit, a gust of wind blew and the employee lost his grip on it. The window unit fell out of the opening and onto the injured employee's right leg resulting in a double fracture to the lower leg and lacerations.

An employee was emptying debris using a dump box on a forklift at a construction site. The employee released the latch on the dump box in order to tip it into the dumpster. At the time, the employee slipped and when he tried to catch himself his left hand got caught between the fork and the dump box pinching his middle and ring fingers resulting in a crushing injury to the ring finger and a middle fingertip amputation.
An employee was removing 6x6 cribbing on top of a 4" pipe when the pipe fell off and struck the employee's left ankle fracturing it.
An employee fell from the top of a concrete form and fractured a hip and the left leg. The employee was not tied off at the time.
An employee was walking around the outside of a trench while an excavator was removing old PVC pipe. The pipe shattered and a fragment struck the employee's left eye.

An employee was working on a fresh air intake fan. The electrical source of energy was locked out, but the residual sources of energy were in the process of being locked out when his hand was caught in the pulleys resulting in the amputation of his left pinky at the knuckle and amputation of the ring, middle, and index fingers.
Two employees were walking down a steep grade. Employee 1 dislodged a large rock that rolled down the grade and struck employee 2 in the lower leg causing a compound fracture.
An employee was cutting wood with a circular saw when the saw kicked back and amputated the employee's left index finger.
An employee was on a ladder painting when he fell off, breaking his heel and ribs.
An employee dumped wet mud out of a dump truck and was closing the tail gate when it smashed the ring and middle fingers on both hands, causing an amputation.
An employee was dispatched to inspect an electrostatic precipitator (ESP). While walking from the ESP to the office trailer, the employee was overcome by sulfur dioxide fumes.

An employee was installing pipe insulation from an extension ladder. As he started to descend from the fourth rung, he missed a rung and the ladder slipped. He fell to the floor and fractured his right hip.

While installing a building wrap to waterproof a balcony, an employee grabbed onto the 2x4 guardrails and fell 15 feet with the rails to the lower level before falling an additional 20 feet to the ground level. The employee suffered a broken back and twisted spine.

An employee was using a powered industrial truck with a man basket when the basket with the employee in it slid off the forks to the ground. The employee suffered a fractured wrist and a laceration to the side of the body.
While installing a shear panel, an employee fell approximately 8 feet to a balcony below, breaking several ribs.

An employee was standing on the third rung from the bottom of a 6-foot step ladder patching concrete on an adjacent wall when he lost his balance and fell off, landing on his back and fracturing his pelvis.

An employee was walking from his office to his personal vehicle in the parking lot. As he descended some wooden steps, he slipped and fell down 3 to 4 stairs to the asphalt parking lot, tearing the quadricep tendons in both of his knees. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was gathering materials to construct concrete formwork. The employee picked up a sheet of plywood not realizing it was covering an existing floor hole. As a result, the employee stepped into the floor hole and fell approximately 12 feet to the next lower level, suffering wrist and neck injuries that required hospitalization.
An employee fell from a ladder and injured his back as he was ascending with a mortar bucket to a single story roof.
An employee was lifting a manhole cover when it slipped and amputated the right middle finger of another employee.

An employee was struck by a motor vehicle while working within the work zone installing reflectors and was hospitalized with severe injuries including four fractured vertebrae, a broken bone in the neck, a concussion and various abrasions on the arms.
An employee fell 15 feet from a wet ladder fracturing the L2 vertebra.
An employee engaged in framing and drywall operations fell through an elevator shaft resulting in broken legs, a broken arm and multiple lacerations. The height of the fall was approximately 20 feet.

On 4/21/2017 at 11:30 a.m., an employee was using a circular saw to cut a 2x4 when his hand contacted the blade resulting in lacerations and a fracture of his left index finger. The employee was hospitalized for surgery to repair the fractured finger and tendon damage.
Two employees were moving a post tension machine to another location. The injured employee's left hand was inside the machine when it turned on resulting in a partial amputation of three fingers.
An employee was performing roofing operations and fell from the roof sustaining broken ribs, arms and a leg.

An employee was driving an excavator down a ramp from the second floor to the ground floor when the boom struck a slab and caused the equipment to stop. The employee's body then moved forward and struck the windshield, causing head and neck injuries.

An employee was wearing safety glasses while working on a water tower. When he descended the tower and took off his glasses, he felt debris in his left eye. His eye later began to bleed and felt painful, requiring hospitalization.

The injured employee was pushing a tree that was being cut by another employee with a chainsaw. The chainsaw kicked back and struck the injured employee's left leg resulting in a four-inch laceration.

While attempting to align fiber cement boxes weighing 300-400 lbs. on a forklift, the boxes shifted, catching the employee's left hand between the edges of the top and bottom boxes. The employee's left middle finger was amputated at the first knuckle joint and the left ring finger was crushed.
An employee was descending a wooden ladder and fell approximately 14 feet resulting in two broken ribs and two fractured vertebrae and a head injury.

An employee was using a portable cutting and beveling tool to cut a bevel on the end of a 24" schedule 120 pipe. The employee's gloved hand was caught and pulled between the beveling die and the pipe causing a partial amputation of the left index finger.
An employee sustained head and nose injuries while using an overhead crane/hoist/chain/hook system.
An employee was moving heavy machinery over steel rollers when his hand became caught in the metal rollers. He was hospitalized for crushing injuries to his fingers.
An employee was standing in an excavated pit approximately 2.5 feet deep and 5 feet wide when the side wall caved in on his leg resulting in a fracture.
An employee was connecting a gooseneck trailer to a truck and manually adjusting the hitch onto the ball when the trailer dropped onto the ball, amputating the employee's fingertip.
On 4/24/2017, an employee was working on the roof and started to feel ill. The employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.

An employee was checking a belt in an HVAC unit on a roof. The unit was shut off and locked out. However, 30 mile per hour winds caused the fan to move and pinch the employee's left pinky finger between the belt and the pulley, resulting in amputation of the left pinky fingertip.
An employee was waterproofing and fell while descending a ladder resulting in a broken left wrist and a broken right ankle.

An employee was loading a pallet into a trailer from the inside of the trailer when a pallet contacted the stack and caused pallets to fall. The employee shifted to avoid a falling pallet and fell onto the floor of the trailer. The employee was hospitalized for back and hip injuries.

An employee was installing a seal on a large shaft when it slipped and pinched his right index finger between the shaft and a flange. The employee was hospitalized and his right index finger was amputated at the first knuckle.
An employee was replacing a HVAC fan belt when their thumb became caught between the belt and pulley, resulting in amputation of the thumb.
An employee was standing on an 8-foot ladder stringing conduit when he fell onto a concrete floor and was hospitalized for four broken ribs.
An employee was struck by a 7-foot-high bakers scaffold, suffering a compound fracture to his leg.

On April 26, 2017, an employee was working on the second floor installing G-track on top of the shaft when the employee stepped into a stairwell and fell approximately 9 feet. The employee landed on a PVC pipe at the bottom of the stairwell and sustained bone fractures and a broken sternum.

On April 25, 2017 at 10:30 a.m., two employees were installing a fire hose on a fire hydrant for washing piping when a car ran over the hose, causing it to become lodged under the car. The hose and water meter were pulled from the hydrant and struck the employees, knocking them to the ground. One employee was hospitalized for a laceration to the back of his head, bleeding on the brain, and a fractured right ankle.

On April 26, 2017, an employee was performing rescreening repair on the roof of a screened enclosure when he lost his footing and fell approximately 15 feet to the ground. He was hospitalized for a head injury, broken ribs, and a spinal injury.

An employee was helping remove a skylight from a roof, when he fell through the opening and struck the ground. He was hospitalized for a broken pelvis, broken arm, and a fractured back. The employee's harness was not tied off at the time of the incident.
An employee was removing HVAC units, when the unit and the employee fell to the ground, approximately 7.5 feet. He was hospitalized for two broken wrists, a knee injury, and a concussion.
An employee was removing excess sheetrock around an elevator shaft when the employee fell approximately 20 feet through the shaft, suffering a fractured elbow and heel.
An employee was operating a bulldozer to clear debris when the bulldozer fell into an 8-foot pit. He sustained two fractured vertebrae in the lower back.

An employee was walking on the deck of an all-terrain crane. When he held on to the crane door, it opened and caused him to lose his balance and fall 5 feet 10 inches to the ground. He was hospitalized for broken ribs and a collapsed lung.
An employee was cutting a beam with a circular saw when the saw slipped and contacted his right hand. He sustained amputation of four fingers on his right hand.

An employee was installing pipe from a scissor lift when one of the scissor lift's tires fell into a hole in the floor causing the lift to fall over and eject the employee. The employee sustained a broken back and a head injury.
An employee was working on a power line when the employee received an electrical shock and burns from the power line and was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a table saw when his left hand contacted the blade, amputating three fingertips to the first knuckle.
An employee was placing screws in a electrical panel when a screw touched wires and created an arc flash. He sustained burns to the left hand and chest and was hospitalized.
An employee was attempting to grab an operating circular saw when the employee's right middle fingertip was amputated.

An employee was tying rebar at a work site when a rock rolled down a hill and struck the employee's upper body. The employee suffered a broken right arm and left finger, cut over the left eye, and a partially collapsed right lung.
An employee was operating a grooving machine when his glove was caught in the machine and his right hand was pulled in, amputating his little finger. The machine was unguarded at the time.
An employee was walking up the stairs when his knee popped and gave out. He fell back down the stairs, breaking both kneecaps and tearing a tendon.

An employee was installing weatherproofing on a balcony of a new residential building when he leaned against the handrail and it failed. He fell approximately 22 feet to the lower working surface, breaking his right arm and left cheekbone and injuring his head.

An employee was installing electrical work from a steel frame when he fell approximately 20 feet to the lower level and sustained broken ribs and a spine fracture. His personal fall arrest system was disconnected at the time of the incident.

An employee was preparing to feed cables to a coworker in an aerial lift. The employee received an electric shock from an elevated cable that came in contact with an energized power source, suffering burns to his left foot, hand, and abdomen.
An employee was servicing an A/C unit with a clamp-on amp meter. He removed the cover to test the A/C when his left middle fingertip was caught and amputated (no bone loss) between a belt and pulley.
An employee was using a sledgehammer to nail a stake into the ground. When he swung the hammer, it missed the stake and struck his hand, breaking it and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was adding hot oil to a hydraulic line when an air pocket bubbled up and splashed his neck, causing burns.

An employee was reaching through a 4-inch hole to drill a pilot hole into an electrical panel when his left finger touched the trigger on the drill and turned it on. The drill then lacerated the top of his left hand.
An employee was in a 4-foot-deep elevator pit removing forms from the area when dirt fell from the top, landing on and breaking both of his legs. He was hospitalized.
An employee was removing insulation from refrigerant piping when a moving fan contacted the employee's right hand, breaking and lacerating the right index and ring fingers.

An employee was working at a client's commercial building and climbed through an attic opening to check a conduit. The attic had no stairs and a ladder was used through the opening. The attic opening was approximate 30" by 30". When he attempted to come back down the ladder, he slipped and fell 10 feet through the hole to the floor, breaking his left arm and two fingers and cutting his left hand. He was hospitalized.

An employee was handling sheet metal and assembling ductwork in the shop. While handling sheet metal, the employee lost his balance and fell, striking his hip against the concrete floor. He had a tape measure in his pocket on the hip on which he fell. Ductwork that was being handled then fell on the employee. The employee was hospitalized with a broken hip.

An employee was operating an aerial lift at the worksite. A vehicle struck the boom of the lift causing it to swing into a steel column and the operator was bounced around in the basket resulting in facial and internal injuries and a fractured arm.

An employee was installing a mixer with a coworker. His right hand was inside the pulley assembly, attempting to get the cable back on the pulley, when the up/down air lifter was actuated to relieve tension on the cable. The mixer then came down and amputated his right index fingertip between the knuckle and the nail.

On May 2, 2017, at 3:00 PM an employee was repairing the brakes on a trailer. He released the jack and the trailer came down on his right hand resulting in a laceration. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was operating a scissor lift and pinched the left ring finger at the middle phalanges between the lift's guardrail and a steel angle support resulting in amputation.
An employee was walking on the roof when he fell 30 to 40 feet to the ground, suffering broken ribs, punctured lungs, and other injuries.
An employee was removing debris from a roof and stepped into an uncovered 3' x 3' hole falling approximately 15 feet and injuring their back.

An employee was removing a security fence panel while trusses were being delivered to the job site nearby on a flatbed truck. The banding holding the trusses together broke, and the trusses slid off the truck and struck the employee's right ankle, breaking it.
An employee was walking behind a truck at a jobsite when the truck backed up and struck the employee on his right side, breaking his right arm and ribs. He was hospitalized.

An employee was working in a trench when the dirt wall fell in the trench, pinning the employee between the dirt and a pipe. The employee suffered a fractured pelvis, fractured leg, and puncture wounds.

An employee was loading a catalyst into a reactor when the pipe containing the catalyst became clogged. He attempted to unclog it by making a horizontal cut in the pipe when it whipped around, striking him. He suffered a fractured scapula, six fractured ribs, and a T-12 spinal disc compression.

An employee was on the second floor of a structure straightening rebar for an exterior block wall when the rebar snapped. The momentum caused the employee to fall 18 feet to the ground. He suffered fractured ribs, a punctured lung, and a lower back injury.
An employee was climbing a ladder when it moved and he fell about 9 feet to the concrete floor, fracturing his right foot and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was vacuuming steel grit using a 4" vacuum hose when the employee's arm up to the bicep was suctioned into the hose. The employee suffered extensive swelling and required surgery.
An employee fell 15 feet off a scaffold and suffered a dislocated wrist.
An employee fractured his left ring finger while working on a ladder.

An employee was on a ladder nailing a piece of siding into place when the employee slipped off the ladder and fell approximately 23 feet to ground below, sustaining broken ribs, collapsed lungs, broken vertebrae, a pelvic fracture, and left arm nerve damage.
An employee was walking across a roof deck when he fell approximately 20 feet through a soft spot in the roof deck to the floor below, breaking his wrist and cracking his pelvis.

An employee was working from a scaffold installing plywood sheets to the side of a building. The employee suffered a seizure and fell off the scaffolding approximately 12 feet to the ground below. The employee suffered facial and back injuries.
On 5/4/17, an employee was installing production equipment (conveyor) when the equipment fell 6 inches onto his left foot, breaking and lacerating it. He was hospitalized.
An employee was installing a 6" threaded metal fitting to a mud unit. The fitting slipped and the employee's left middle fingertip was crushed and amputated between the fitting and the mud unit.
An employee was operating a table saw when the employee's finger contacted the saw blade, amputating the fingertip at the first knuckle.
An employee was using a portable table saw to cut a board when his left thumb contacted the blade and the thumb tip was amputated. The saw was unguarded at the time.
An employee was helping to rig a pipe with a sling to lift it. During the lift, the employee's right middle finger was caught between the pipe and sling, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was welding plates inside a culvert using a stick welder when the welder ignited his clothes. He suffered third degree burns to his chest, arms, hands, and head, requiring hospitalization. Fire-resistant clothes were not worn at the time.
An employee was walking across the wash bay approximately 20 feet away from where two coworkers were cleaning a crane when he slipped and fell, fracturing his femoral neck.
A transformer slid off a forklift's forks and landed on an employee's ankle. The employee sustained an open fracture and needed surgery.
An employee was attempting to fix a dozer that had a clogged fuel line. As he siphoned diesel through the fuel line to unclog it, he suffered lung inflammation.
An employee was involved in a fist fight with another employee and was hospitalized for a head injury.
An employee was erecting a garage wall when it fell back and struck him. He was hospitalized with a back injury.
An employee in a manlift basket had just finished a painting job. He was wearing a harness and coming down with the manlift when he fell from the basket and struck it, breaking his pelvis.

An employee was on a ladder cutting I-beams. He cut one beam and a piece fell and hit the bottom of the ladder causing the ladder to kick out. The employee lost balance and fell resulting in two broken bones in his left wrist and a broken nose.
An employee was preparing a crane and was placing a hydraulic pin in a hole when the hydraulic engaged and pinched his fingers. His left middle and ring fingertips had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was working in a 5.5-feet-deep trench when a portion of the trench gave way and struck the employee's shoulder, dislocating it.

An employee was operating a pipe grooving machine to groove a steel pipe when his glove became caught and his hand was pulled in between the pipe and the back plate of the machine. His left middle, ring, and index fingers were partially amputated.
An employee was walking up a slope carrying a ladder when he rolled his foot and broke his ankle, requiring overnight hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was servicing an air conditioning unit from an extension ladder that was leaned against a building while a coworker was holding the bottom of the ladder. The coworker released the ladder and walked away to retrieve a part. The ladder then slid out and the employee fell 13 feet, breaking his foot.
An employee was walking at a site and fell resulting in a head laceration and hospitalization.
On May 9, 2017, an employee was attempting to cover a wall with fiberglass because of impending rain when the wall fractured two of the employee's fingers.

On May 9, 2017, an employee was standing at the rear door on a vacuum suction tank when the employee was caught and pinned between the hydraulic-actuated closing door, suffering a crushed midsection and chest.

An employee was checking if there was enough clearance between an excavator and a fence when the excavator operator tried to move the excavator tracks. The excavator bucket moved instead and struck the employee against a trench box. He suffered fractured ribs.

On May 09, 2017, an employee had dismounted a tugger and was hooking carts onto it when a second tugger passed by. The second tugger's carts broke loose and struck the employee. The employee was knocked to the ground and suffered a laceration on the right foot and a fracture to the right knee.
An employee was performing duct work from a ladder when he lost his balance and fell about 4 feet to the ground, breaking his wrist and collarbone.

An employee was elevated in a scissor lift, attempting to remove straps from a section of wall that was being lifted by a forklift. The forklift backed up while the straps were still connected and pulled the wall onto the employee in the scissor lift. The employee suffered a broken hip and ankle.

An employee was on a ladder, removing a vice grip from a garage door to open it. When the vice grip came off, the door rolled open and knocked him off the ladder. His right thumb was pinched and amputated between the door and the track.
An employee was descending an extension ladder when he lost his balance and fell 8 feet to the brick patio floor. He fell on his side, fracturing six ribs and bruising his lower back.
An employee was moving a steel panel when the panel fell and hit him on the left forearm. The steel panel cut into his skin, muscle, and tendon. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was nailing felt paper on a deck when the felt paper moved, causing him to lose balance while holding the nail gun in his right hand. A nail then ejected and punctured his left middle finger. He was hospitalized.

An employee was re-erecting goal posts below a power line when the stringer of flags on one end of the goal posts became hung up on the passenger-side rear-view mirror of a haul truck. The injured employee was attempting to free the stringer of flags when a coworker raised a PVC pipe to place it over a t-post. The top of the PVC pole, where the stringer of flags was tied, came into contact with the overhead power line. The employee sustained burns to his left arm, left hand, and right foot. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was conducting framing activities for a residential home when he lost his footing and fell approximately 24 feet from the roof to the ground, breaking his wrist and ankles.
An employee had removed a loading dock plate when he fell into the gap between the truck and loading dock, fracturing his left femur.

An employee and a coworker were installing sheet rock while standing on a bakers scaffold that was approximately 7 feet tall. The employee needed to reach higher so he was also using a step ladder on the bakers scaffold. His coworker climbed down off of the scaffolding and the scaffolding began to roll. The employee was on the scaffolding standing on the step ladder as it was rolling. The scaffolding tipped over onto its side, and the employee fell approximately 8 feet to the concrete floor, suffering a broken wrist, foot, and skull.
On 5/11/17, an employee fell from a step ladder to the concrete floor of a new home under construction, suffering a head injury and broken wrist.

An employee fell from an unfinished stairwell platform, hit his head on a wall on the way down, and then landed on the concrete floor 10 to 15 feet below. He suffered bleeding in the brain, a broken bone in the neck, and a broken bone in the chest.

An employee was working on the second level of a scaffold approximately eight feet high. The employee was reaching up to adjust the toe board for the level above when he slipped and fell through the mid-rail to the ground below. The employee suffered a left shoulder and elbow injury and a laceration above the left eye requiring stitches.

On May 11, 2017, an employee was guiding a generator that was being lowered to the ground by a crane. At approximately 9:45 a.m., the employee used his right hand to hit the headache ball of the crane to unhook it from the generator. The ball dropped suddenly, pinching his right pinky finger between the headache ball and the hook. Half of his finger had to be surgically amputated.
An employee fell from a ladder while installing a flex duct. On the way down, he put his hand out to brace himself and his right hand came into contact with a metal RC channel, cutting three fingers.

Workers were using a mobile crane to lift several 60-foot sections of 4-inch coiled rubber hose when one end of one of the coils caught the single coil that was being lifted. Once the coil rigged to the load line was approximately 10 feet above the ground, the end of the coil that had attached itself to the coil being lifted came free, rolled back, and struck the head of an employee on the ground. He suffered a 2-inch scalp laceration and numbness in his right arm.

An employee was in a ditch assisting with setting a water pipe. A pipe attached to machinery with a chain struck the employee's leg when the equipment was moved. The employee suffered a fracture under the knee cap that required surgery.

An employee was running a service line to the residence. The ladder shifted as he was climbing it, causing him to fall approximately 10 feet to the ground. The employee sustained a broken left wrist requiring surgery to repair and lacerations to the face and right arm.
While installing a catwalk on top of a grain elevator, an employee fell approximately 15 feet through an opening in a platform to a lower level, suffering a broken ankle and requiring surgery.

An employee was using a string trimmer while standing on an uphill incline when he lost footing as a mower approached from behind. His foot slid backwards and into the path of the mower deck, which severed his Achilles tendon and ligaments and broke bones in his lower leg. A mulching block-off plate was not in place on the mower's discharge opening and pulley guards were not installed at the time of the incident.
An employee was removing a street light when the base kicked back and struck the employee in the stomach area.

An employee was working on an electrical box while on a ladder when he passed out, fell 4 feet from the ladder, and hit his head on the concrete. He suffered a head injury, broken clavicle, and two broken ribs. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was welding pipes when his left index and middle finger were caught and amputated in a pipe clamp.
The employee was lowering planks down to another employee from approximately 10 feet high on a mast climber scaffold. The employee fell and injured his back and ribs.

An employee was cutting a piece of duct work to size using a grinder with a cut-off wheel. The pipe was staged on the back of a truck parked approximately 5 feet from two manhole covers. As the employee was cutting, vapors from an underground tank beneath the manhole covers ignited, causing first degree flash burns to the employee's torso, chest, hands, arms, head, face, neck, and back and second degree burns to the chest and hands.
An employee's left foot was caught and fractured between the forks brace and step of a skid steer. His big toe was also severely dislocated.
An employee tripped and fell down a flight of stairs while engaged in construction operations. The employee sustained a mild concussion and was subsequently hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was sliding a section of grating into place and crushed his left middle finger between the grating and horizontal support steel member underneath resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was moving a pallet jack when it hit and broke his ankle, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cutting concrete with a hydraulic saw when the saw kicked back, slipped from his hands, and lacerated his left bicep.

An employee was helping to sandblast an underground pipe with a hose and sandblasting wand when the wand pointed at his arm and released sandblasting material under high pressure. He suffered a serious arm abrasion.

An employee was placing a 12-inch elevator on a column pipe when the elevator opened unexpectedly and crushed the employee's right index finger in a pinch point. The employee's finger was also lacerated.

An employee was cleaning a cooling coil on a rooftop HVAC unit. He removed a panel to the unit to wash the coil from the inside out. His left hand was inside the unit when the fan blade struck and amputated his left index finger and lacerated his middle finger.
An employee fell off a stepladder while installing a new HVAC unit, hitting the floor and suffering a head fracture.

An employee was preparing to weld on a small building frame and had removed the strap securing it when a gust of wind blew the frame over. The frame then struck him on the right knee and the back of his head. He suffered right leg fractures above and below the knee.
An employee was tarring a roof on a building when he fell through an area of the roof where metal decking had been removed from the inside. He broke his left leg.

An employee had just repaired an overhead door chain in an ambulance garage and was climbing down a 12-foot A-frame ladder. His left hand was resting on the chain he just repaired when a paramedic came in and activated the switch to raise the garage door. His hand was caught between the chain and sprocket to the garage motor, amputating both middle fingertips.
An employee was measuring and cutting metal studs using a 6-inch grinder/cutter. When he cut through the stud, the grinder kicked back at him and cut into his upper right leg.
An employee was reaching onto a shelf when the employee lost balance and their ring was caught on the shelf resulting in a left ring finger degloving.
On May 16, 2017, an employee was assisting a welder transition a pipe when he suffered from heat stress and required hospitalization.

An employee was unhitching a trailer and was putting it on a block when the trailer rolled off. The jack stand came off the block and landed on the employee's right foot, amputating his right big toe.
An employee was repairing an HVAC unit when the refrigerant leaked out and severely burned both hands.

An employee was unplugging an extension cord from a wall on the fifth floor when it got caught on the door frame of the hydraulic double doors. He reached between the door frame and door to remove the cord when the hydraulics triggered to close the door catching his right middle finger between the door jamb and door. The fingertip was amputated.
On May 17, 2017, at 9:30AM, an employee was filling a bucket with hot tar when the spigot broke, allowing hot tar to splash and burn his left hand, right forearm, and face .
An employee was changing from one tether to another to get to a different section of a roof when he slipped and fell 10 feet to the ground, bruising his right knee and requiring hospitalization.
An employee suffered from heat illness and severe dehydration while performing carpentry work, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was attempting to unlock barges at a job site when the employee's left middle finger was caught between the lock and the barge. The employee suffered a fracture and partial amputation to the top distal portion of the left middle finger.

An employee was about to throw water out of a 5-gallon container while leaning on a stair railing when the railing broke and gave way. The employee fell 30 feet to the ground and struck his head, losing consciousness and requiring hospitalization.
An employee fainted from the heat while performing electrical work.
An employee was struck by a motorist while flagging oncoming traffic in a work zone, suffering severe head and body trauma that required hospitalization and surgery.

On May 18, 2017, around 2:00 pm, an employee began to feel ill at the end of his shift. He had spent the morning removing a black buildup of pitch from a commercial roof and the afternoon installing new roofing material. He was hospitalized with heat-related illness.

An employee was using a pressure washer when he noticed slack in his hose. He leaned over to pull the slack and lost his balance. He grabbed the wand and inadvertently engaged the trigger. The wand then ran over his right foot, causing a deep laceration.
An employee was cleaning out a concrete pipe using an air compressor to blow out the system. The air pressure inside of the pipe was relieved, causing the pipe to hit his chest and break his ribs.
An employee suffered a left thumb laceration while using a Skil saw.

An employee was working inside a dryer to change out a turn-flow. He was stepping on a 2-inch x 10 ft. board to hook his lanyard when the board broke and he fell 50 feet to the hard surface below, fracturing his skull and breaking his collarbone.
While cutting out a window on a construction site, an employee fell approximately 8 feet to the surface below and broke a leg.

An employee was positioning a counterweight to be displayed in a renovated building. The counterweight slipped and slid down, partially amputating the employee's finger as it was caught between the flat face of the weight and the floor opening.
An employee was descending into a trench using a ladder when he lost his footing and fell off, hitting a pipe in the trench. He broke his ribs and clavicle.

An employee took a break from abrasive blasting and laid the abrasive blast nozzle on the ground. When he returned to the work area, he stepped on the blast control nozzle and suffered abrasions to the left thigh from the abrasive blast media.
An employee was moving a manhole cover when it slipped and crushed his right middle finger. His fingertip had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was standing near the base of a material hoist when a wheeled trash cart fell from the hoist's elevated platform and struck the employee, fracturing two fingers and several bones in his left hand.

An employee was inflating a skid steer tire and was putting the cap on the valve stem when the bead slipped off the rim. The escaping air caused the assembly to jump and hit the employee in the face. The employee was hospitalized with facial and head fractures.
An employee fell approximately 9 feet off a ladder while closing a roof hatch, fracturing an elbow.
An employee was about to take an extension ladder down when he slipped and fell 6 feet off the ladder to the ground, fracturing his right knuckles.

Two employees were working from a column form wall about 19 feet in height to complete rebar tie-in on the cage of the column. Both employees were descending from the column form wall when they lost their footing and fell to the concrete slab below. One employee sustained a crushed heel and broken lower leg and was hospitalized. The second employee sustained a back injury.
An employee fell 20 to 25 feet while climbing a pole and fractured his L-1 vertebra.
An employee was standing on a ladder approximately 7 to 8 feet from a lower level when the employee fell, fracturing ribs and suffering a head injury.

An employee was working from a swing stage scaffold when the scaffold's up switch was activated, raising the scaffold and pinning him between it and the stone ledge above. He bruised his chest and lost consciousness.

An employee was removing a hydraulic line from a piece on an excavator. The line was still pressurized and when the connection was broken, the line crossed his left hand, injecting hydraulic oil into the hand and causing a laceration. He was hospitalized.
An employee was climbing a ladder when his foot slipped and he fell back, striking his head on the ground.
An employee received an electrical shock to his upper back while installing a powerline insulator.

An employee was getting into a footing approximately 3.5 feet deep to show a crew member how to tie the rebar. As he entered the footing, his foot slipped and fell on the rebar. He suffered a laceration/puncture wound to the base of his neck next to the clavicle.
An employee received an electrical shock while installing a new powerline.
On 5/24/17, an employee was removing the bottom bracing of a wall when it began to collapse. The employee attempted to catch the wall and suffered an umbilical hernia, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was near a loader truck that was picking up and transporting pieces of old road concrete when a piece of concrete fell off the loader basket and struck the employee in the head, causing a concussion.
An employee's right middle finger was caught and amputated in a folding chair.
The employee was installing insulation. A 4' x 4' insulated metal panel slipped from the hoisting clamp, bounced and ricocheted off the building, and struck the employee's left arm fracturing it.
An employee was framing a soffit using screws and a drill when a screw became lodged in his hand, injuring his left index finger.
An employee was dismantling a one-tier scaffold and put all the boards to one side. It started to fall and as he tried to dismount the scaffold a board caught his foot and fractured the right ankle.
An employee was performing electrical work from the platform of a scissor lift when the scissor lift tipped over. The employee fell 20 to 25 feet to the ground and suffered a fractured pelvis.
An employee was cutting a metal tube with a band saw. While removing a metal shaving that came off the tube, the employee's right index finger contacted the sawblade and was amputated.
An employee was working on a 16-inch stainless steel duct work. He was putting a coupling inside the duct and lacerated his wrist above his glove.
An employee was framing on the job site when his pneumatic nail  gun shot a nail into his knee. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was prepping trusses on the ground when his framing nail gun shot his left leg.
An employee was loading a large valve onto a forklift. As the forklift lifted the valve, it tipped over and struck the employee, lacerating and puncturing the right leg.
An employee was working from a ladder. The ladder shifted and the employee fell 11-12 feet to the ground fracturing the left femur.
An employee was on an extension ladder trying to access the roof when he slipped and fell approximately 20 feet to the ground below, fracturing three vertebrae, his nose, his skull, and a wrist.
An employee was rigging material on a crane. After releasing the rigging, the employee's pinky was smashed between a headache ball and the main block of the crane, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was waiting in front of a switch gear box when the C-phase arc came out of the box toward the fuse he was holding and knocked him unconscious. He suffered an electrical entrance wound to his left index finger and electrical exit wound to the left and right big toes. He was hospitalized.
An employee was tearing up ceramic tile when a tile chip ruptured the employee's left eye globe, requiring hospitalization and stitches.

An employee was cutting stock on a table saw when their glove was caught in the saw pulling a finger into the blade. The left pinky finger was amputated at the second knuckle. The saw was unguarded at the time.
An employee was connecting two chutes on a cement truck when one of the chutes slipped. The employee's right index finger was then caught and partially amputated between the two chutes.

An employee was in a trench using a machine to locate the end of a pipe. A cylinder came off the machine, and the machine bucket became detached and rolled down the trench, striking the employee. The employee suffered a broken right wrist, left leg laceration and torn muscles, and a right ankle laceration.

On May 30, at 11:50 am, an employee was exiting a crane. The cab of the crane was blocking the exit ladder on the right and left side, so he headed to the back of the crane and stepped on the maintenance access platform to head to the ladder when his feet became caught in rigging. He tripped and fell 5.5 feet to the ground, fracturing ribs.

An employee contacted live wires in an electrical box while standing on a ladder and was shocked, causing the employee to fall to the floor. The employee broke a femur, a wrist, and vertebrae, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was working under a truck. When he removed the drive shaft, the vehicle began to roll backwards. The truck's catalytic converter then struck his chest area, injuring his ribs and clavicle. He was hospitalized.

On June 1, 2017, at approximately 4:00 PM, an employee was descending from a two-story roof onto a ladder. As the employee climbed from the roof to the ladder, the ladder slid sideways, causing the employee and ladder to fall to the ground. The employee suffered a broken pelvis and two broken vertebrae.

An employee was cutting a piece of wood flooring on a table saw when the blade caught the board and pulled his left hand toward the blade, amputating his middle fingertip to the knuckle. The saw was unguarded at the time.
An employee was attempting to stop a truck from rolling backwards into another when his left hand was caught between the two vehicles, seriously lacerating his left thumb.
An employee was removing the cap on a temporary stand pipe when a pressure buildup inside the pipe caused the cap to fly off and hit him in the face, cutting his upper lip.
An employee was opening the tailgate to a dump truck when it crushed the employee's right middle finger.

An employee was walking under the suspended boom of a pump concrete truck when concrete slid down the boom, causing it to fall and strike the employee. The employee was pinned to the ground under the weight of the concrete and boom, suffering broken ribs, a broken tibia, a lower left leg injury, and a back injury.
On June 1, 2017, an employee was moving scaffolding frames when they fell on him. He was hospitalized with head lacerations, a punctured lung, and a broken rib.
An employee was looking for a hydraulic leak on a boom lift when the hydraulic hose burst and injected fluid into the employee's left middle finger and lacerated it, requiring surgery.
An employee suffered dehydration while performing road work and was hospitalized.

On June 2, 2017, an employee was installing a ceiling joist while standing on a ladder and guardrail when the guardrail failed, causing the employee to fall approximately 12 feet. The employee suffered a spleen laceration, abdominal bleeding, and an elbow fracture, requiring hospitalization.
While checking an air handler in the attic above a garage, an employee fell through an opening in the attic floor and struck the concrete below, suffering severe head and shoulder injuries.

An employee was conducting maintenance on a conveyor that was locked and tagged out when a metal plate that is operated by a pneumatic cylinder closed and caught the employee's left arm. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee fell to the ground while working from a scaffold, breaking an arm and rib.
An employee was operating a boom lift. While the employee was in the boom lift basket, the basket came into contact with a steel beam, which struck the employee's head and face.
An employee was helping to transfer a load from a crane to a chain fall when the load shifted and partially landed on the employee's foot, breaking bones and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was performing preventive maintenance on railroad switches and a pressure-actuated rail greaser. He was attempting to reinstall the connecting bar for the greaser. When he picked up the bar from the middle joint, the joint straightened and amputated his left middle finger distal tip.

An employee was painting the front section of the first floor entryway of a three-story split plan house. He attempted to access the exterior wall between the first and second floor using a 6-foot step ladder on top of a 3:12 pitched metal roof. He slipped and fell about 4 feet from the ladder onto the metal roof, fracturing his right hip and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was removing a wood utility pole from a hole when the pole slipped. The employee was then caught between the pole and an adjacent truck, suffering a collapsed lung and breaking ribs, an ulna, and a radius. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee and a coworker were working in an electrical room, pushing a ground cable through the top of the main distribution panel, when an arc flash occurred. The employee was thrown 5 feet back from the panel and required hospitalization.

An employee was attempting to reinstall the connecting bar for a pressure-actuated rail greaser. He was picking up the bar from the middle joint when the joint unexpectedly straightened and injured his finger.

An employee was rotating a 14-inch steel casting pipe on a pipe rack roller when the employee was pinned between the rack and the pipe. The employee suffered a broken left leg and possible left middle finger amputation.
An employee was adjusting a slide seat in an excavator when his right middle finger was caught between the slide seat adjustment bar and the latch behind it, amputating his middle fingertip.
An employee was measuring neutral wire for a new feeder installation when an arc flash occurred, burning the employee's face and hand. The employee was hospitalized.

On 6/3/2017, an employee was working in a trench to erect a retaining wall to insert a large machine. During the work process, the concrete company had to remove the trench walls so that the work crew inside the trench could apply mortar to a pre-set area where the cinder blocks were to be placed. As the concrete crew removed the walls, the side of the trench collapsed and toppled onto the injured employee. He suffered forehead lacerations and bruising and temporarily lost consciousness. He was hospitalized.
An employee was closing a gang box when his left middle finger was caught between the gang box, amputating the distal phalanx.
An employee was going to pick up pieces of concrete that were cut from the building when his foot slipped and was caught between two pieces of concrete slab, breaking his leg. He was hospitalized.

An employee was working on a truck. He was going to back it out of the shop when he exited the truck to hook up something beneath it. When he hooked up the wires under the truck, the truck began rolling backwards and rolled over the employee. He was pinned under the vehicle, suffering head injuries and broken bones. The truck was running and in reverse at the time of the incident.
While installing cable in an attic, an employee slipped on a joist and fell approximately 15 feet through the ceiling. The employee broke several ribs and punctured a lung, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was watching a load of glass being moved from a delivery truck to his company truck when the load lost its lean, became unstable, and fell. The employee tripped and fell as he attempted to jump out of the way, and a load of glass fell on and broke his leg.
An employee was loading a powerline pole on the back of a digger truck when he fell approximately 4 feet off the truck platform to the ground, striking his head on the concrete.

An employee was installing flashing on a concrete deck floor to waterproof it. The employee leaned on a guardrail while attempting to reach a section of work just outside the balcony guardrails. As he leaned on the guardrail, it gave way and he fell approximately 20 feet to the ground floor, breaking his left wrist and requiring surgery.
An employee was on a ladder pulling wires for a security system when the extension ladder slipped out from under him. He fell approximately 10 feet to the concrete floor and fractured his left arm.

An employee was holding a pipe level as it went through a machine when he slipped, lost his balance, and let go of the pipe. He tried to straighten it, but the pipe crushed his pinky fingertip between it and the adjacent concrete wall. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was cutting 2x4's on sawhorses when the circular saw possibly kicked back and struck the employee's left ring finger, severely lacerating it and requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was hospitalized for possible dehydration.
An employee was attaching a piece of plywood to the front of a wooden crate for a stack of marble slabs weighing between 3,500 and 4,000 pounds when the stack fell on and crushed the employee's foot.
An employee partially erected a scaffold and attempted to use it when he fell off the scaffold and broke his left wrist, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was snapping a chalk line on the ground when he dropped the ball of string. He went to grab the ball and slipped on wet pavement, falling and fracturing his right leg.

On 6/07/17, an employee was using a tunnel boring machine drill to install rock bolts in a tunnel roof when his right jacket sleeve became caught and began to twist around the drill steel, restraining and breaking his lower right arm.

An employee was removing a sheet of oriented strand board from the floor when he fell 5 feet through a floor hole to an HVAC duct below. He suffered a collapsed lung, two broken ribs, and a broken arm.
An employee was working on a de-energized electrical panel when the panel became re-energized, causing an arc flash that burned the employee's right hand.
An employee was hand digging a hole when an excavator struck his right leg. His right leg had to be amputated at the knee.

An employee was standing outside the entrance of a power house when he heard a loud noise inside. The pressure relief valve of the absorber and the condensation released, spraying hot steam on the employee. He suffered burns on his back and shoulders.
An employee was using a saw to cut clay pipes when the saw kicked back and cut the left side of the employee's face.

An employee and a coworker were working on a reverse osmosis system, removing membranes from inside a metal pipe that was removed from the processing equipment. The coworker was pushing the membranes while the employee was attempting to catch them as they exited from the opposite end of the pipe. The employee's finger was then pinched and a portion was amputated between the outside surface of the membrane and the inside of a metal tube.

An employee was touching up paint on a fireplace located inside a new home when his extension ladder slipped out from under him. He fell approximately 18 feet to the floor, possibly breaking his leg and hip. He was hospitalized.
An employee was six feet high on an extension ladder replacing siding. When he began to climb down, he lost his footing and fell to the ground, fracturing his heel.

An employee was guarding a trash chute opening as the chute was being dismantled when a contractor working overhead dropped a 2x4, which ricocheted off equipment and struck the employee's arm. The 2x4 deeply lacerated the employee's arm and fractured it, requiring hospitalization.
An employee received an electrical shock while splicing wires under a reception desk.

On June 8, 2017, an employee was holding one side of a manhole cover while a coworker lifted the manhole cover with a crowbar on the opposite side. The manhole cover slipped off of the crowbar hook and fell onto the employee's hand, pinching off the finger pads of his right middle and ring fingers between the manhole lid and lip. His ring fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
On June 8, 2017, an employee was performing road construction work and fell into a trench and broke his back. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting a concrete slab with a gas-powered concrete saw when he lost his grip on the saw. The saw lacerated his chest and left arm, requiring hospitalization.

An employee and a coworker were moving a headache rack when the coworker dropped his side. The employee's finger was then caught between the headache rack and the C channel, amputating the right ring fingertip.

An employee was moving a sheet metal press when one of the rollers used to move the press became loose and slid away. The press became unbalanced and fell on the employee, pinning a leg against the floor. The employee's leg had to be amputated.

On June 8, 2017, an employee was inspecting the nailing of roof plywood and the strapping of the rafters. While walking back to the access point, the employee slipped and fell 13 feet to the ground, fracturing his left tibia and suffering a compression fracture to his L2 vertebra. Fall protection was not worn at the time.
An employee was moving a drum filled with chunks of lithium. The employee hooked a drum cart to the drum and tilted it back. The drum lid blew off and struck the employee in the face and upper body.
An employee was operating a dump truck and was trying to level the load by shaking the trailer when the truck bed came down on his arm, breaking and lacerating it.
An employee was walking on top of a bridge beam when he was bumped off by a forklift. He fell 10 feet and injured his right humerus.
An employee was handling a tilt wall brace when it lacerated and fractured the employee's left index finger.
An employee was removing panels from an A-frame when six panels fell on the employee, who suffered a broken ankle.

An employee was standing on the wheel well of a sweeper vehicle. He was checking the radiator water level immediately after shutting the machine down. As he was filling the radiator with water, it began to bubble up, so he dismounted the machine. He landed oddly on the ground and fractured his left leg above the ankle.

An employee was inserting a plastic sleeve for some pipe to go through a granite curb stone. He was attempting to straighten the pipe when his left middle finger was caught between the pipe and the granite curb stone, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was using a paint gun to apply primer paint when the employee stepped back on a 2x4 and fell backwards. As the employee fell, the gun went off and injected paint into the employee's left hand.
An employee was drilling a hole to install an anchor when he received an electrical shock.

While replacing a roof, an employee walked by an asphalt lugger. The pipeline burst and sprayed hot asphalt on the employee, causing second degree burns on both forearms and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was climbing a ladder when he missed a rung and fell 14 feet, striking a transformer box and breaking his ribs.

An employee was getting ready to repair a broken PVC pipe that was dripping water on the floor. He placed blankets in the area to contain the dripping water and then began climbing a ladder to the pipe when he slipped and fell off the ladder, fracturing his hip.

An employee was working off an 8-foot step ladder, standing on the sixth step. As he started to descend the ladder, the ladder shifted and he lost his balance and fell to the floor. He landed on his left wrist, causing a severe fracture. He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was climbing down a step ladder when he missed a step. He tried to grab onto a ceiling tile on the drop ceiling, but it could not hold his weight and he fell to the ground, breaking his hip. He was hospitalized.

An employee climbed a ladder onto an unguarded level below the work level when he became dizzy and blacked out from dehydration and fatigue. He fell about 6 feet onto the concrete below, suffering head injuries, a fractured clavicle, and broken ribs.
An employee was attempting to repair an existing clay sewer pipe. He was cutting the pipe with a saw when it kicked back at him, cutting him from the chest to the chin.

An employee was acting as a spotter for a truck driver. They lost sight of each other, and the employee's arm was pinned between a pole and the truck back gate. He received a laceration on his left arm and hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was helping an excavator set a 16-foot steel post. The rigging was removed before the post had been bolted in place. The steel post then fell and struck the employee, who suffered a broken leg and was hospitalized.

An employee was installing a bridging angle to a bar joist while wearing fall protection. He was welding it when he fell 30 feet to the ground, suffering a fractured skull, collapsed lung, and three broken ribs.

An employee was using a 3-foot pry bar to lift a 3/8-inch piece of sheet of metal to remove the 3/4-inch wooden support blocks from underneath. The 3-foot pry bar slipped while the employee was removing the 3/4-inch wooden block, allowing the sheet metal to drop onto and amputate the employee's left index fingertip.
An employee fell from the tire of a front-end loader while performing maintenance on the vehicle, injuring his back and head.
An employee was placing a section of masonry into a trash cart when the masonry fell on and amputated the employee's left pinky fingertip.
An employee was cutting lumber on a table saw when the blade lacerated his left index finger. The table saw was unguarded at the time.

An employee was putting PVC pipe together while on a ladder while a coworker held the bottom of the ladder. The coworker let go of the ladder and stepped around the corner to check if the placement of the PVC was correct. The ladder slipped and the employee fell to a cement pad below, breaking a bone above the ankle.

An employee was moving a scissor lift downgrade in a parking structure. He was in the lift in the fully lowered position when he struck an overhead concrete beam with his upper body. He was pinned between the beam and the guardrail of the lift, suffering a fractured jaw and left sinus as well as chest contusions.
An employee was struck by an automobile while setting up a work zone, suffering multiple broken ribs, a broken pelvis, several broken vertebrae, and multiple internal injuries. He was hospitalized.

An employee was unloading a crate of marble from a delivery truck. The truck gate fell off during the unloading and the employee fell 4 feet off the truck, fracturing the right pelvis, right elbow, and right ribs.
An employee was operating a trencher near a trench when the ground gave way. The trencher and the employee rolled down into the trench. The employee suffered three broken ribs and a chest laceration.

On 6/14/2017, at approximately 1500, an employee was riding in the rear of a line striping truck that had just completed striping a freeway entrance ramp and was travelling down the freeway to turn around in the median. While the striping truck was slowing down to turn around, it was struck from behind by an approaching truck. The employee in the rear of the truck suffered a fractured leg and thumb and was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was terminating an electrical panel. At the same time, a coworker located in a different part of the job site turned on a different panel that was wired incorrectly and energized the panel being terminated, causing a second degree burn to the employee's hand.
An employee was working on a ladder approximately 3 feet in the air painting a doorframe when the extension slipped out and he fell, breaking his ankle.

An employee was working in a stairwell to conduct drywall finishing. The employee placed one end of a plank on the landing and the other end in the rung of an extension ladder and climbed onto the plank. The employee then fell 16 feet to the ground, fracturing the left heel and lumbar spine.
An employee was attempting to remove a mirror from an apartment ceiling when the mirror fell on him and cut his arm, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was tearing up drywall from a scissor lift when he tried to move the scissor lift closer to the wall. His left hand was on the scissor lift's guardrail when his left pinky was caught between the scissor lift's guardrail and the guardrail housing, amputating his pinky's first joint.
An employee became dehydrated while digging a trench, requiring hospitalization.
While loading a cart with debris and supplies during deck removal work, an employee fell about 20 feet to the ground, suffering a broken hip and wrist as well as a possible orbital fracture.
An employee was welding a 10-inch pipe when the jack stand that was supporting the pipe sank into the ground, causing the pipe to strike and break the employee's left femur.
An employee was spraying penetrating oil under a truck when the oil entered his mouth. He suffered chemical burns to his mouth and lungs, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was reaching over piping when he lost his footing and fell over the piping. While falling, he used his left hand to break his fall. His hand was then caught and fractured between two pipes.
An employee was grinding concrete while on an extension ladder when the ladder slid out. The employee fell and landed on the ladder, breaking his right ankle.

An employee was sitting in the back of a pickup truck, which had the tailgate down, when the truck moved. The employee then fell about 3 feet to the concrete ground, hitting the back of her head. She suffered bruising and two head fractures.

An employee was carrying a mirror into an apartment building through an interior staircase. As the employee was entering the doorway, the mirror inadvertently hit the doorframe. This caused the mirror to break. A portion of the mirror fell and lacerated the employee's left forearm, severing arteries and cutting two nerves.

An employee was landing a pallet jack that was elevated by a tower crane. As the crane lowered the load into a courtyard where the employee was located, the load struck something and started to swing. The employee's right hand was caught between the swinging load and the aluminum joists, crushing and amputating the ring finger.
On 6/17/2017, an employee was installing vinyl siding from a ladder when he felt dizzy and fainted. He fell approximately 10 feet from the ladder, breaking several ribs and his spine.

An employee was using vise grips while changing out components and wiring to an elevator when the vise grips failed, allowing the components to fall and catch the employee's left thumb between the cable and a sheave. The employee's left thumb tip was amputated.

An employee was helping to pick up lumber from an overturned 18-wheeler on the interstate. The employee was standing on a bundle of lumber when the load shifted and catapulted the employee 4 to 6 feet in the air. He landed on and injured his neck.
An employee fell off a roof suffering a head injury, multiple left-side face fractures and pain in his left shoulder. He was hospitalized.
An employee was reversing a compact utility loader when it struck a forklift outrigger that was moving in the forward position. He suffered a left leg fracture and right calf laceration.
On June 19, 2017, an employee was loading a reel of wire into the back of a pickup truck when the employee's right pinky fingertip was caught and amputated between the reel and the truck bed.
An employee was picking up trash on the roof when he stepped back and a coworker's nail gun released a nail into the back of his right ankle.
An employee was measuring and cutting wood on a table saw when the saw blade amputated his pinky fingertip and cut his ring finger.
An employee was installing glass in an interior window frame when the glass lacerated the outside of his right hand across the knuckles.

Two employees were laying pipe underneath a joist when a third party hit the joist, causing it to fall on them. The first employee suffered a head injury, while the second suffered a broken arm, broken wrist, and bruised ribs.
An employee was climbing up an attic ladder when he fell about 5 feet backwards and struck his head, sustaining head trauma. He was hospitalized.

An employee was placing a tag line on a concrete pole as the pole was being moved. The employee was trying to get out of the way when his right leg was caught between two concrete poles, breaking his right femur.

On June 20, 2017, an employee was working on a pipe while standing on skids stacked on the pipeline. The employee was closing the valve on the pipe so it could be tested for leaks when the skids shifted and the employee fell. The flange of the pipeline hit the employee's right foot, amputating it from the ball of the foot forward.
An employee fell 14 feet while engaged in steel erection activities, suffering a broken pelvis. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was standing on a pallet on a forklift that was raised 10 feet to retrieve material from a shelf when he lost his balance and fell to the floor, suffering a broken neck vertebra, broken rib, and head laceration. He was hospitalized.
On June 20, 2017, at 12:50 PM an employee was exiting an attic using a ladder after installing cable. The employee fell and suffered an lower back injury and was hospitalized.
An employee was using a rivet machine to repair scaffold components when the machine amputated the employee's left index fingertip.
An employee was lighting an oxy-propane torch when a leak allowed a flame to propagate up the employee's arms, burning them.

An employee was installing wooden guardrails around a newly cut stairway opening with a coworker on the second floor when part of the floor collapsed. The employee fell approximately 10 feet to the first floor concrete flooring, fracturing the left shin and injuring the right knee and back.
An employee was attempting to cut a zip tie on an HVAC water hose with a pocket knife when the knife slipped and stabbed his left forearm.

An employee was on a forklift platform, installing butyl tape on a metal building, when the employee fell approximately 22 feet to the ground. The employee suffered clavicle fractures, a head laceration, broken ribs, shattered vertebrae, and a spinal cord injury.

An employee was cleaning up a lay-down yard when a pressurized CO2 bottle valve discharged, causing him to lose his balance and fall. He hit and cut the back of his head and suffered shoulder pain, requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was attaching skid steer forks to a truck when the forks fell off and landed on the employee's foot, causing a possible fracture to the foot/ankle that required surgery.

An employee was inside an excavation that only had one side sloped to grade and the other side was 9 to 10 feet high. Part of the excavation's high wall collapsed and struck the employee. The employee sustained a broken left metatarsal, humerus, and vertebrae.

On June 22, 2017, an employee was working on an asphalt crew shoveling and raking asphalt. The crew made different stops during the day and at one stop the employee began to feel ill. The employee was hospitalized for heat stroke.
An employee was holding a concrete form plate with his hands when he was struck by an impact hammer, amputating his left index, middle, and ring fingers.
