An employee was cutting wood with a miter saw when the wood kicked out, causing his left hand to contact the saw blade. His hand was lacerated and fractured, requiring hospitalization and surgery. The saw was guarded and proper PPE was worn at the time.

An employee opened an energized PMH (large electrical box used for power transmission) to verify tags and labels and an arc blast occurred. The employee received first and second degree burns to his right arm, arm pit, shoulder, ear and neck.
An employee was making a gutter when the knife he was using became stuck. When he tried to remove the knife, it cut his left thumb. He was hospitalized the next day for surgery.
While working on a reel, an employee's right ring fingertip contacted a sprocket and was amputated.
An employee was operating a handheld grinder when the wheel broke and pieces of metal struck the employee's right eye, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was pouring concrete when concrete entered his boots, causing a chemical burn that became infected.
An employee's hand was crushed between a forklift and scaffold frame, injuring his right index and middle fingers and requiring surgery.
An employee was using a bending machine to roll tubing into a circle when the feeder caught his glove and right hand, amputating his right index finger.
An employee was framing a stud wall on the second floor when he fell approximately 15 feet to the first floor lobby, suffering head trauma.
An employee was guiding a corner of a frame of the platform. The employee dismounted from the roll line frame to the ground 3.5 to 4 ft. below and broke his left leg.
An employee was walking around the job site and stumbled. When he did, he twisted and his left femur snapped resulting in a fall to the ground.
An employee was cutting on a vertical stone surface with a chop saw. The chop saw kicked back and the guard struck/lacerated the employee's face.
An employee was standing by the side of a road, signaling a truck out from a site, when a car struck him and broke his left leg. He was hospitalized.
An employee was vacuuming a pool when he leaned over and his leg broke.
An employee was inspecting the tracks of a bulldozer. When he placed his hands on a slit fence, his left forearm was bitten by a poisonous water moccasin. He was hospitalized.

While demolishing an overhead door, an employee loosened bolts to the bracket holding the spring that helps lift the overhead door. The spring was un-sprung and still had tension. When the bolts were removed, the spring sprung, causing the bracket to spin and strike the employee. The employee suffered left arm lacerations, left thumb and finger fractures, a broken right arm and thumb, and multiple right arm lacerations.
An employee fell off an 8-foot ladder while changing a ceiling filter, injuring his back and head and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was unloading a padder from a trailer when the padder flipped and ejected the employee. He suffered a punctured lung, facial fractures, and a dislocated shoulder, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing a pipe on an air handler when a butterfly valve flew off the 120 psi pressurized line and struck his left shoulder, armpit, and chest, causing burn-like injuries.
An employee was putting a piece of concrete in a dumpster when it slipped and crushed his left ring finger between it and the edge of the dumpster.

An employee was on an extension ladder (approximately 8 feet up) testing a phone port on the ceiling when the ladder slipped out from under him and he fell to the ground, breaking his vertebrae and crushing a disc in his lower back. He was hospitalized.
An employee was driving a fence post and caught the left ring finger between the "T" post driver and the post, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was installing plywood on a second floor when he stepped backward and fell into a stairway opening, bruising a rib.
An employee fell approximately 12 feet while attempting to set a gable truss. The employee suffered a broken hip and wrist.

An employee was changing out a blast hose on the underside of a pot when someone recharged the pot, causing blast media to discharge from the lower port and strike the employee on the right side of his face. He suffered an abrasion and blunt trauma to the face from blast grit under pressure. Some of the blast grit was embedded in his facial skin. He was hospitalized. All required PPE was worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was on a 10-foot ladder, sealing ductwork, when the ladder slipped. He fell approximately 6 to 7 feet to the floor, suffering possible fractures to the jaw and left wrist.
An employee was shocked while pulling an electrical cable, suffering electrical burns to the legs.

An employee was installing ladder racks along a hallway when he tripped into a 12-inch deep open floor tile on a raised floor. He fell forward and his forearm struck an uninstalled metal track, lacerating it.
An employee was troubleshooting an air conditioner on top of a roof when the top of the employee's right hand contacted the fan, lacerating it.

An employee was operating a concrete gunning machine when it became clogged. He placed the gunning machine on its side and was using compressed air to unclog the cement when the machine's hose whipped and struck his left leg, breaking his fibula and tibia.
An employee was descending a ladder from a roof when he lost his footing and fell 4 feet to the ground below, fracturing his right ankle and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was loading concrete onto a temporary barrier on a flatbed truck. While turning to exit the stairs of the trailer bed, the employee fell approximately 4.5 feet to the ground, fracturing the right wrist and right clavicle.

An employee was cleaning his agitator truck with a hose when his foot hit a lever that activated a gate. The gate swung and pinched his right forearm, causing abrasions and pressure buildup in his right hand. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

Employees were pouring concrete footings for a support on a second story school expansion. Two employees were using a concrete buggy to dump concrete. While they were raising the dump into position, the buggy tilted forward and tipped into the footing excavation. The injured employee was pinned between the buggy and excavation wall, suffering left arm and leg fractures.

An employee went to the passenger side of a truck and leaned the double-step fabric glass ladder against it. As he climbed the ladder, he fell backward and hit the curb. He suffered a bruised right shoulder, knot on the head, bruising and bleeding around the brain, a broken big toe, and a possible spine fracture.
An employee was stressing post tension cables using a stressing machine when his right fingertip was caught and amputated in the machine.
An employee was pulling a gang box when the lid of the box closed on the employee's right hand, amputating a fingertip (no bone loss).
While installing plywood sheathing on top of floor joists on the main floor of a house, an employee slipped and fell 10 feet onto the basement's concrete floor, suffering a collarbone injury.
An employee was hammering plywood at an outside construction site when he lost his vision and fainted. He was hospitalized due to dehydration.

On June 27, 2017, an employee was standing on a ladder pulling on a wire that was stuck when it broke free, causing him to lose his balance and fall 8 feet to the ground. He broke his right hip and ankle, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing a satellite dish on a residential home. He was working from a ladder when he fell approximately 10 feet, breaking his left leg and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was working underneath the elevated rear-end of a crane when the crane rolled and crushed him, fracturing his arm, foot, and ribs and lacerating his bladder. There were no chocks or jacks in use at the time of the incident.

An employee was assembling an equipment dolly. The dolly table was not stabilized and the rocker beam slid off when the table shifted. The rocker beam struck and crushed the employee's foot, which had to be partially amputated at the hospital.

An employee was using a propane welding machine, set at ground level, while standing in a scissor lift inside an empty room under construction when the employee experienced headaches, dizziness, nausea, and fatigue due to carbon monoxide exposure. These symptoms developed slowly over approximately five hours.
An employee was loading a 5-7/8 pipe on pipe racks when the pipe rolled off the rack and crushed the employee's leg and knee.

An employee was installing a switch to a pole when his hand contacted an overhead powerline and an arc flash occurred. He suffered a first degree burn on his chest and second degree burn on his back, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was breaking down a scaffold when he lost balance and fell 12 feet to the ground, bruising his knee and injuring his head. He was hospitalized.

An employee was delivering masonry materials using a boom truck. While the employee was on the back of the truck, a piece of equipment shook loose and struck the employee. The employee was knocked to the ground approximately 5 feet below, fracturing ribs and requiring hospitalization.

An employee on a scissor lift was caught between the lift's guardrail and a suspended conveyor belt. At the time of the incident the lift was elevated and being driven by a coworker. 

The injured employee was hospitalized w broken ribs.
An employee was cutting ductwork from an elevated position on a scaffold when the ductwork fell and knocked the employee 5 feet to the ground. The employee suffered head trauma and broken vertebrae.
An employee was rolling a steel beam to be staged for a crane and caught his left middle finger between the beams resulting in amputation of the finger.
An employee fell three stories down an unguarded elevator shaft and sustained a broken right ankle and various back injuries.
An employee fell 5 to 6 feet to the ground while climbing a scaffold, fracturing a leg.

On 06/29/2017, an employee was attempting to move an old guide roller from a saddle to a forklift. The roller did not have enough momentum to roll onto the forklift and rolled back onto the saddle, catching and crushing the employee's left leg between it and another roller. He was hospitalized.

On June 29, 2017, an employee was emptying a trash dumpster. He used a forklift to set the dumpster over the trash compactor. Once it was set, he exited the forklift and used the lever on the side of the dumpster to dump the trash. On his way back up, his finger was caught and fractured in a pinch point between the dumpster and compactor, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was walking when he was struck by a malfunctioning riding trowel, breaking his leg.
While pouring and finishing concrete using a pull-along tool, an employee began cramping and feeling fatigued due to heat-related illness, requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was tightening the negative cable of an elevated dump trailer when the trailer fell on and crushed his arm.

An employee was installing sheet metal at a business when wind blew a section of the sheet metal into a powerline, causing the employee to sustain an electrical burn to the right hand. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee's left leg was crushed by a steel beam being lifted by an overhead gantry crane. The employee was hospitalized with compound fractures.
An employee fell approximately 12 to 14 feet while installing felt on the porch area of a commercial roof, suffering a broken clavicle, broken ribs, a collapsed lung, and head trauma.
An employee was back-filling dirt along a newly installed silt fence using a shovel and suffered heat stroke.
An employee was using a crane to unload a nail jack from a truck when the crane shifted and caught the employee's right index finger, partially amputating it.
An employee was testing a 50-foot liner that goes inside a hose when he suffered second degree steam burns to his back.
An employee collapsed due to dehydration.
While climbing a fiberglass, 6-foot, A-frame ladder, an employee became dizzy, fell backward, and struck the ground, suffering a fractured skull, jaw, and vertebra.
While sandblasting a pipeline, an employee stepped on the sandblaster's air hose. The nozzle then swung toward the employee, and sandblast media was injected into his arm.
An employee was overcome with heat stress and was hospitalized.
An employee was breaking out of a substructure when a driller went in the wrong direction with equipment and struck the employee's left thigh and calf, causing a laceration and severe contusion.
An employee was installing drywall sheathing and felt dizzy. The employee was hospitalized for a heat-related illness.
An employee was removing panels from a pre-existing roof when he fell 20 feet from the center of the roof to the concrete surface below, breaking his left wrist and severely bruising his pelvis.

On July 3, 2017, an employee was erecting a system scaffold tower when it shifted, causing the employee's finger to become pinched between the wall and the scaffold system. The employee's left ring fingertip was amputated.

While spraying precast concrete from a scaffold, an employee slipped and fell 4 feet to a main scaffold and then fell an additional 14 feet to the ground, suffering a head injury that required hospitalization.

An employee was operating a winch boom crane bucket truck. The employee was in the bucket using the winch to remove a manhole cover that was stuck. The manhole cover released and the bucket truck bucked, throwing the employee out of the bucket. The employee fell 25 feet to the concrete pad and suffered head trauma. A harness was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was re-painting a patio ceiling while standing on an extension ladder when the ladder became unstable and fell backwards, causing the employee to fall 15 to 16 feet to the ground. During the fall, the employee's face struck the ladder. The employee suffered a broken nose and cuts and bruises to the arms, legs, and hands.

An employee was dismantling scaffolding. The employee raised a platform section from the lowest position (at four feet high) up to approximately eight feet in order to access and unbolt the top tower section to take it down. The employee removed the four corner bolts holding the section in place then proceeded to climb back down. The employee inadvertently grabbed the unbolted tower section while attempting to climb back down and it  fell onto the employee pushing the employee off the platform approximately eight feet to a compacted stone parking lot surface. The employee sustained a fractured pelvis, a head laceration, and contusions and abrasions.

An employee was carrying tools up an extension ladder when the ladder's feet began to slide back along the steel decking below. He lost his balance and fell approximately 7 feet to the steel decking, lacerating his right knee and breaking his right kneecap. He was hospitalized.

An employee was using a forklift to put a wooden header into place when the header fell off the fork tines and broke a wall brace, causing the wall frame to come loose and strike the employee's right leg. The employee suffered a broken right femur and was hospitalized.
An employee was about to go down an elevator to a service tunnel when the elevator abruptly dropped 50 feet. The employee suffered head and neck injuries.
An employee was operating a machine on a roof when he moved backward and fell 30 feet off the roof into a material roller on the ground, breaking his ribs.
On July 6, 2017, an employee fell from a ladder while performing HVAC servicing, hitting his head on the concrete floor below.

An employee was pouring concrete when concrete blocks began to fall on him. As he attempted to move out of the way, he hit his head on the ground, suffering head injuries that required hospitalization.
An employee was cutting wood with a circular saw when the blade amputated his right thumb tip.
A temporary employee was admitted to the hospital with heat exhaustion/stroke.

An employee was setting forms in preparation to pour a concrete deck on a bridge when he started to feel ill. He later experienced intense cramping and was hospitalized for heat exhaustion and dehydration.
An employee fell from a 20-foot extension ladder while installing a window, suffering a fractured jaw and losing some front teeth.
On July 6, 2017, an employee suffered from suspected heat illness after forming concrete all day in temperatures in the mid-80s. He was hospitalized.

An employee was removing gutters. The employee stepped off a ladder onto the roof to remove a screw from the gutter, disturbed a wasp nest, and was stung repeatedly causing the employee to fall 15 feet from the roof edge. The employee was hospitalized for a laceration on the forehead.
An employee was pouring concrete when the hot concrete contacted and burned the employee's right foot.
An employee was preparing for a concrete pour when he began to feel ill. The employee was hospitalized overnight due to heat related illness.
An employee was helping to direct a hose during a concrete pour when he cramped up due to the high heat levels. The employee was hospitalized and also diagnosed with a muscle injury.
An employee was standing on a ladder when he lost his balance and fell approximately 4 feet to the ground, breaking his arm.
An employee had been supervising employees installing overhead electrical lines when he felt ill and experienced cramping. He was hospitalized for heat exhaustion and dehydration.
An employee was operating a handheld grinder to cut cast iron when the grinder kicked back and lacerated the employee's finger, requiring surgery.
An employee was installing an electrical box when a concrete form fell on and broke the employee's ankle, requiring hospitalization.

An employee went to retrieve keys from a utility truck during a thunderstorm when lighting struck the overhead powerline and energized the truck, causing him to experience shortness of breath. He was hospitalized.
An employee was walking down stairs when he fell and broke his left leg. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was moving a stack of drywall when the stack became unstable and the sheets fell on the employee's leg, breaking bones.
An employee was adjusting the belt wiper on the conveyor belt of a paving machine when the employee's right arm was caught in the machine. Part of the arm had to be surgically amputated.

A truck driver backed up, stopped, and put the vehicle into park. The injured employee lowered the tailgate. At the same time, the truck settled and rolled back. The employee's index fingertip was then caught and amputated between the truck and the adjacent wall of the building.
An employee was torching flange bolts on a by-pass run when the by-pass twisted and swung down, striking and breaking the employee's ankle.
An employee was setting up to hydro-blast inside a pressure vessel that was 72 degrees when he became nauseated and suffered cramps. He was hospitalized for dehydration.
On 07/07 2017, an employee was exiting a flatbed trailer (36" from ground level) when he landed wrong and fractured his right ankle.

Two employees were stacking and organizing wooden temporary work platforms on dunnage when the injured employee heard a pop in his lower back while lifting a platform. The employee suffered two herniated discs in his lower back.
On July 8, 2017, an employee was spotting for a forklift when the employee was pinned between the forklift and a cement column, bruising the abdomen and groin area.
An employee was transferring a transformer to a new pole when the employee's index fingertip was caught and amputated between the transformer and the bucket.

An employee was sitting on a casing pipe. The road bore operator could not see the employee and then activated the machine and moved it forward. The right leg of the employee sitting on the pipe became caught/pinched between the track and pipe. He suffered a broken tibia and was hospitalized.

An employee was riding in the basket of an aerial lift while installing exterior rigid insulation on a house when the employee made contact with the house's electrical service drop. The employee suffered an electrical shock and second degree burn to the right hand.
On July 10, 2017, at about 1:30 p.m., an employee was working on the deck of a barge when he felt hot and started to cramp. He was hospitalized for heat exhaustion and dehydration.
An employee was overcome by heat stress while loading a rig at a pipeline construction site, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was conducting electrical work in a non-ventilated building under construction with a temperature of 110 degrees and fell 6-7 feet from a ladder. The employee struck his head on the concrete floor and sustained severe head injuries requiring surgery and hospitalization.

An employee was guiding a trailer-mounted compressor that was suspended by the bucket of a loader. He had positioned the suspended compressor's trailer hitch so that it could be lowered onto a tow vehicle's pintle hitch when his left foot/ankle was struck and ran over by the loader's left front wheel. He was hospitalized.
An employee was using a hoisting mechanism to retrieve pile driving rods from a casing when a sling slipped off a rod, allowing the rod to fall, strike, and fracture the employee's right shoulder.
While climbing an access ladder through a roof hatch, an employee slipped and fell to the ground, suffering a lower leg fracture that required hospitalization.
An employee was troubleshooting an engine on a piece of equipment when a fire occurred, burning the employee's left forearm.

On July 11, 2017, an employee was installing thermal materials on top of a newly constructed metal building when the employee fell 11 feet to the ground, suffering severe back injuries that required hospitalization.
An employee was caulking exterior panel joints on a man lift under direct sunlight with a heat index of approximately 109 F. The employee suffered heat stroke and was hospitalized.
An employee was sanding drywall and going from bathroom to living room while wearing stilts (40 inches above the ground) when he fell, twisting his right leg and fracturing his right fibula.
An employee was repairing an electrical generator when the motor started unexpectedly, amputating two of his fingers. The generator was not locked/tagged out at the time.
An employee slipped and fell 10 feet while connecting steel beams, striking structural steel and the ground. The employee suffered a fractured forehead and was hospitalized.
An employee was climbing down a ladder into a manhole and slipped and fell. The employee landed on his right ankle fracturing it.

An employee was monitoring as an electrical crew used a pulley system to pull conduit when the pulley plate broke loose and struck the right side of the employee's body. The employee suffered a broken elbow and forearm, as well as contusions to the hip area and below. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was replacing silt fabric in a catch basin. The employee's right hand was crushed when the catch basin drain cover dropped on it. He was hospitalized with two broken fingers and two lacerated fingers.
An employee was running wires in order to install an additional disconnect to a temporary power bank when an arc flash occurred. His right forearm was burned, and he was hospitalized.
After working on a roof pulling a whip hose for 8 hours, an employee suffered from heat exhaustion and was hospitalized.
An employee fell 10 feet to the concrete ground while painting a townhouse roof, fracturing the left hand/arm and the right hip.

An employee was moving and rearranging traffic cones on the shoulder of the road when a car struck him from behind. He was hospitalized for a possible fracture to his lower leg, lacerations to his right cheek and right lower lip, and abrasions around his face and arms.
An employee was installing an 18-inch pipe in a pipe rack when the pipe moved and struck him, fracturing his left arm.
While performing masonry work from a scaffold plank, an employee tripped and fell 3 to 4 feet to the ground, breaking a rib and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was on a ladder climbing out of the basin of a water treatment facility when he fell 10 to 15 feet from the ladder to the concrete surface below. He suffered ankle and hip injuries that required hospitalization.

An employee was driving a rough terrain lift down a road and moved toward the ditch to allow a car to pass. The lift then rolled into a ditch and overturned. The employee suffered broken ribs, a lacerated lung, and an L1 vertebra fracture.
An employee suffered from heat-related illness while digging a hole to find a water leak in a 1-inch service line, requiring hospitalization.
After mixing liquid components of elastic patching material for airfield lighting work, an employee had an allergic reaction that affected his respiratory functions and was hospitalized.
An employee was driving nail spikes with a 6-pound sledgehammer when the hammer struck his right hand, fracturing his index finger. He was hospitalized.
Two employees were using a crane to load beams when a possible arc flash occurred. Both employees suffered an electrical shock.
An employee was climbing a ladder when it slipped out from beneath him. He fell and injured both ankles, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was performing an electrical study. While he was taking a fluke meter reading on the building's main switch gear (1600A, 480V 3 phase), an arc flash occurred and the fluke meter blew up in his hands. He suffered second degree burns to the hands, arms, neck, face, and eyes, requiring hospitalization. PPE was not worn at the time.

An employee was using a core cutting machine to finish a 3-foot-diameter cut when the machine's top cover came loose and rotated into a hydraulic line. The line then whipped and struck the employee's leg, while the cover struck his back. He suffered leg and back lacerations and was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting a board using a circular saw when the sawblade amputated the employee's fingertip.
An employee was repairing an electrical meter for street lights when an electrical flash occurred, resulting in first and second degree burns on his arms and face. He was hospitalized.
An employee was manipulating a piece of concrete with a burke bar when the employee's left middle finger was caught and amputated between the bar and a piece of pre-cast concrete.
An employee was climbing down a fixed metal ladder when he slipped and fell about 8 feet to a concrete mezzanine, breaking his tibia and injuring his shoulder ligament. He was hospitalized.
An employee fell off a ladder while installing electrical wiring, suffering a broken arm and wrist and a facial laceration.

An employee was servicing an HVAC system in a ceiling crawl space. As she was walking in the crawl space, she stepped on a closed access panel that suddenly opened. She fell to the ground below and hit a table, fracturing her hip.
Three employees were performing masonry work on a scaffold that collapsed and they hit the concrete ground. One employee was hospitalized for a head laceration requiring stiches and contusions.
An employee was pinned between a gang box and a wall, suffering a bruised spleen, fractured pelvis, and fractured L1 vertebra. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was hanging sheet rock when he became sick due to possible dehydration. He passed out, started shaking, and fell, striking and scratching his face.
An employee fell 7 feet off the top of a step ladder while painting, breaking his wrist and hip.
An employee fell through a 1/4 inch transit board resulting in a C7 fracture and a broken femur.
An employee fell approximately 6 feet to the ground while disassembling a crane. He landed on and broke his back.

An employee opened an electrical switching cubicle with 7,200-volt electrical lines to repair a dead line. He lost his footing and fell forward into the electrical switching cubicle, making contact with the energized electrical lines. He received electrical burns to his left arm and left knee, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell approximately 25 feet from a roof, suffering a broken back.
An employee was pressure washing concrete and contacted his left knee with the high pressure water stream (3500 psi) resulting in a laceration to the kneecap and air behind the knee.

On Monday, July 17, 2017, at approximately 9:30 AM, employees were attempting to hook a trailer to a truck in the parking lot of the facility. During the hooking process, the trailer moved, catching and amputated an employee's left index fingertip between the ball of the hitch and the trailer.
An employee was holding metal I-beams on a floating barge when one of the beams fell and struck the employee's right fingers, injuring them.
An employee was moving a 300-pound stone when the stone flipped and fell on the employee's right foot, lacerating it and fracturing the big toe.

An employee was preparing to throw debris from a roof into a dumpster when he lost his footing and fell approximately 15 feet to the concrete below, injuring his back, ankle, and wrist. His safety harness was unhooked at the time of the incident.
An employee was walking when a plywood board fell from the 18th floor and hit his hard hat. He suffered a head injury.
An employee was helping a coworker stack hydraulic shoring into the bed of a service truck when the shoring shifted and smashed/amputated the employee's ring fingertip.
An employee was wiping debris from the bottom of a bundle of lumber when the bundle shifted and pinched the employee's left middle finger, amputating the distal tip.

An employee was walking as a nearby truck attempted to pull another truck using a hook and a synthetic sling. The hook on the sling broke and impaled the employee's stomach, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing a guardrail along the interstate and suffered heat stroke. The employee became light headed and fell over with cramps and nausea.
An employee was skinning a wire to test for voltage on a light pole when he suffered an electric shock from the energized line.
An employee was walking behind a track hoe when it struck the employee's right foot, breaking the third, fourth, and fifth toes and the metatarsals.
A temporary employee was ripping a board on a table saw when it kicked back. His left hand then contacted the blade, partially amputating his fingers.
An employee was on top of a structure retrieving a 2x4 piece of wood when he fell through a hatch opening to the ground 20 feet below. He suffered a punctured lung, broken rib, and cracked vertebrae.
An employee was hauling a 5-gallon bucket of water up a 20-foot incline to dump it when he experienced symptoms of dehydration. He was hospitalized for dehydration and heat stress.
While working on an elevated pallet racking system, an employee slipped and fell approximately 10 feet to the ground, injuring the head, back, and chest. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was using a saw to cut concrete when the saw bound and bounced back, hitting and lacerating his right cheek. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting a piece of glass when the glass fell and lacerated his wrist.
On 7/19/17, an employee was dismantling a scaffold and removed a brace when the scaffold's end frame fell on his back and pushed him over. He suffered a back injury and was hospitalized.
An employee was working on the roof of a second story structure, approximately 17 feet from the ground, when he fell off and broke both ankles.

An employee was helping a coworker install a 600-pound flange/pup onto another pipe. The coworker was using a homemade flange hook to hold the flange/pup when the flange/pup fell onto the employee's foot. The employee was hospitalized with broken toes.
An employee had been painting outside in high temperatures when he felt ill, experiencing nausea and vomiting. He was hospitalized overnight for dehydration and heat stress.
An employee was installing satellite TV at a residence when he suffered heat exhaustion. He was hospitalized hospital for treatment.
An employee was using a small air-driven chisel to remove hardened asphalt from the conveyor slats of a hot mix asphalt transfer device when a piece of asphalt flew into his right eye.
On July 19, 2017, around 11:00 a.m., an employee was working at ground level framing walls for a new building when he began feeling hot and sick. He was hospitalized for heat-related illness.

An employee was abrasive blasting structural steel on a bridge rehabilitation project when he stopped to inspect his work. The nozzle was still on and the abrasive blasting material struck his left leg.

An employee was standing on an 8-foot ladder looking into a wall to receive a fish stick (an electrical tool) when the fish stick became jammed. When the fish stick became free, it went up under the employee's safety glasses and poked his left eye, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was hanging pipe and was feeling overheated with a head ache and chest pains.
An employee was carrying roofing materials on a roof when he fell 20 feet over the edge. He broke his arms and some facial bones, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing PVC pipe from a 6-foot A-frame ladder when the employee fell, suffering a possible left arm fracture and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was climbing a ladder to cap a live wire when he bumped the wire and received an electric shock. He then fell from the ladder to the ground, breaking his leg and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was driving a forklift when his hand became caught between the forklift and a column. He required surgery.

On July 20, 2017, an employee began having cramps while working. The employee went home after work and became nauseous and began vomiting. The employee was admitted to the hospital for heat exhaustion.
An employee was helping to pour concrete when the concrete poured inside his work boots, burning his skin on both legs.
An employee was moving forms when his left hand was caught between a shear wall form and an aluminum beam. His left pinky and ring fingers were lacerated.

An employee was using a pneumatic nail gun to build a deck. The nail gun was attached to his tool belt. As he bent down, the safety on the nail gun pushed against his leg. The hammer then swung around and hit the trigger on the nail gun, causing it to fire a nail into his thigh.

An employee was on top of a wall setting floor trusses when he lost his balance and fell outside the building. He fell 12 feet to a concrete patio and then rolled off the patio and fell another 10 feet to a dirt surface, breaking his left-side ribs and left leg.

An employee was climbing a fiberglass extension ladder tied above to a stanchion post. While moving off of the ladder onto the roof, the employee's foot slipped on the roof deck and his hand slipped off of the ladder resulting in a fall. The employee suffered fractured ribs, vertebrae in the neck and a concussion.
An employee was connecting a 2-inch pipe in a ceiling using hand tools and a drop light when he received an electric shock.
On July 21, 2017, at around 10:30 a.m., an employee was working from a welded frame scaffold approximately 15 to 20 feet high when he fell to the ground and broke his right femur.
An employee was using a concrete saw when it kicked back and lacerated his chin and chest. He also lost two teeth.
An employee was connecting a fiber optic cable on a utility pole when his spike kicked out and he fell approximately 15 feet to the ground, breaking his leg and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was hospitalized after having seizures in a car before moving to the next worksite. The cause may be heat related.

An employee had been supervising solar panel installation on July 21, 2017, until approximately 3:00 PM. On his way home, the employee started to feel nauseous, light headed, and exhausted. The employee was transported to a hospital and admitted due to heat stress.
An employee was repairing a digging chain when he fell backward, fracturing ribs and lacerating his head.

An employee was helping to replace a conveyor belt on a slitter machine that was suspended by a crane when the employee's foot slipped through two steel plates. The plates then sprung back and pinned the employee's left lower leg between the two, causing severe contusions.
On July 22, 2017, an employee was hooking up a holiday detector to scan a pipe for any bare metal when he received an electrical shock on the hand and fell to the ground. He was hospitalized.

An employee was attempting to fix a board when he lost his footing and fell 16 feet to the ground below. The employee was hospitalized for a head laceration, two brain bleeds, a fractured shoulder blade, and fractured ribs.
An employee was loading a spool of cable onto a trailer bed when he fell through the trailer decking, injuring his left leg and back.
An employee was trying to tighten a control rod on a concrete power screed when it ran over his right leg, breaking his tibia and fibula.
An employee was working on an air conditioning system when his left middle fingertip was caught and amputated between the blower wheel pulley and belt.
An employee was walking through the job site when a rattlesnake bit his left lower calf.
An employee was unstrapping a load on his trailer when the materials fell on him, breaking his ribs.
An employee was washing a concrete pump when the hose was sucked into the pump. When the employee attempted to grab the hose, the employee's hand was sucked into the pump, amputating fingers.

An employee was on the ground directing an excavator operator to pick up a steel rail track when the excavator bucked caused the steel track to turn around and strike the employee's left leg, breaking it.
While moving traffic cones, an employee was struck by a road sweeping vehicle that was operating in reverse. The employee suffered a fractured left pelvis.

An employee was working on the fourth rung of an 8-foot ladder when one leg of the ladder moved and he reacted to the movement. The ladder fell with the employee, hitting the floor. He suffered a left rib fracture and partially collapsed left lung, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was moving a dust collector when it tipped over and fell on the employee's left leg, breaking it.
An employee slipped while trying to cross over roll off truck rails and fell breaking his leg.

An employee was stretching out a garden hose for a pressure washer on a roof when he backed up and fell over the parapet wall approximately 9 feet to the roof below and fractured four ribs. He was hospitalized.
An employee experienced dehydration after laying ABS pipe at a construction site, requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee stepped on an old screw while installing roof fiber boards, puncturing his foot.
An employee became ill while installing new poles, requiring overnight hospitalization for dehydration/heat exhaustion.
An employee was working on pipes under the sun when he experienced hand cramping and was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee was erecting steel when he was overcome with heat stress, requiring hospitalization.
An employee climbed on a roof, fell through a rusted area, and landed on the concrete floor approximately 11 feet below, breaking 10 ribs and the tailbone.
An employee was finishing drywall and suffered a heart attack.
An employee was replacing bearings on the shaft doors of a hopper when his thumb became caught in a hole where the bolt was supposed to go, amputating the first digit.

An employee was straddling a beam approximately 19 feet above the ground when he lost his balance while preparing to connect a beam being hoisted into place by a crane. He fell to the ground, striking dirt and the first course of cement block around the building's foundation. He fractured his nose and arm and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee became unconscious and was hospitalized for possible heat stroke.
An employee was lifting a piece of metal and it fell, amputating the tip of the left thumb.
An employee was stepping from a company van when the van slipped into gear and moved. The employee was knocked to the ground and suffered a broken left femur.
An employee was using a grinder to cut a threaded rod when the grinder cut his arm.
Two employees were in an open trench checking and making a grade when they were struck by a piece of rock. They both suffered leg injuries and were hospitalized.
An employee was standing on a ladder using a hammer drill when the drill amputated his left pinky finger.
An employee was rigging the hook on a crane when his hand was caught between the hook and the D-ring, lacerating his left middle fingertip.
An employee was operating a miter saw and experienced kickback when the material became bound. The employee's fingers were thrust under the blade which resulted in the amputation of three fingers.

Two employees were traveling in an all-terrain vehicle with coworkers when it flipped over. The first employee fractured the right ankle, requiring surgery. The second employee suffered head and facial lacerations.
An employee was digging a ditch for an electrical line when he suffered from dehydration and heat exhaustion.

The injured employee was standing on a wellhead that weighed about 8,000 pounds. The wellhead was sitting on a ring gasket about 10 feet off the floor. While the employee was unlatching the chain from the elevator to the wellhead, his colleague moved the elevator. The employee and the wellhead fell about 10 feet to the ground. The employee was hospitalized for a lacerated liver and spleen, as well as multiple fractures, which included several ribs, the pelvis, and the left arm.
While loading a forklift, an employee sustained a broken arm when the forklift fell on him.

An employee was asked to hold a wrench that was attached with a rope to a rod. The employee was retrieving the rod from the ground while the jaw on the drill rig was turning and the employee's left lower arm got caught between the wrench and the drill rig jaw. He was hospitalized for injuries to his lower left arm.

On 7/26/2017, an employee was working on the forms and finishing concrete of curbs / sidewalks / driveways at a worksite. At the end of the workday, the employee started to experience cramping in their hands and legs. On 7/27/2017, the employee was admitted to the hospital for heat exhaustion.

An employee was chipping asphalt in a dump truck. The employee tossed the spud bar from the truck and caught his right index finger between the spud bar and the truck body resulting in amputation of the first digit.

An employee was shaking metal bar joists bundled on the forklifts to separate the metal bar joists and to move them to the staging area for edge grinding. One metal bar joist broke free from the bundle and smashed the employee's finger in between the metal joist and the forks of the forklift. The employee suffered an amputation to his left middle finger up to the first knuckle.

Two employees were installing mesh wire from the fifth level of a scaffold. The planks tilted to one side of the scaffold and the employees fell 40 feet. They were hospitalized with a broken left arm and broken ribs.
An employee was conducting steel roofing work and fell approximately 17 feet from the roof, breaking the hip and arm.
An employee was walking on the flat metal roof of a warehouse and fell through a skylight resulting in broken ribs and lacerations.
An employee was assembling a scaffold and fell approximately 12 feet resulting in a left hip fracture and a right shoulder contusion. A harness was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was operating an excavator to excavate a pipeline. While scooping the bucket toward the machine, it hit a rock, and a tooth broke off and went through the windshield of the excavator. The employee sustained a broken right leg.

The injured employee was inside the plant in the basket of a 60' aerial lift with another employee at the lift controls. The injured employee's head was pinned between the basket and the ceiling beam resulting in a fractured skull and bleeding from the nose and mouth. The injuries will require surgery.
An employee was on a stack of lumber and fell about 10 feet, resulting in a skull fracture.
An employee was struck by a trackhoe resulting in a broken right foot.

An employee was tracing overhead conduit in a mechanical room. The room has HVAC ductwork that runs from the ceiling down to 2' x 2' louvers in the floor. As the employee was looking up at the conduit, he stepped backwards and fell through one of the louvers approximately 10 feet to a lower level, suffering a head injury.

An employee was assisting in rigging the pull head from the trench box. The pull head slipped out of the chain while suspended and fell to the ground, striking the employee and causing a fractured right scapula, fractured sternum, nine fractured ribs, and a bruised right lung.
An employee received electrical burns on the right arm, neck and face when a stirrup fell and struck an energized part causing an arc flash.
An employee was on a ladder nailing struts. The employee fell off the ladder and sustained a back injury requiring hospitalization.

On July 27, 2017, an employee had been welding on steel casing outside. The employee felt sick/nauseous and went home. On July 28, 2017, the employee tried to work but felt nauseated and sick by 2:00 p.m. and went to the hospital for heat exhaustion.
An employee was hanging drywall while on a ladder when he slipped and fell to the floor, fracturing his knee cap.
An employee slipped on a wet surface while on a roof and tore his hamstring. He was admitted to the hospital the following day.

An employee was standing outside a storage tank while water blasting operations were being conducted inside. The employee's upper legs were cut by water coming out of the manway from a water blaster being used to blast asphalt inside the storage tank.

An employee was walking across stored rebar on the ground to access some framework angle iron. He retrieved a piece of angle iron and was returning back across the rebar, when he slipped and fell. The band of rebar that was being carried in his right hand came down on his left ring finger causing an open fracture which required surgery.

An employee was starting the main compressor and checking it to see if it was operating correctly. The main airline supply hose, which comes from the air dryer to the sandblasting pot, came off and struck the employee in the lower right leg, resulting in a fractured tibia and fibula.
An employee was on the roof of a building and was cutting a six-inch pipe to install a device on it. The grinder he was using kicked back, cut through his glove, and cut a tendon on his right hand.
An employee had been working on building a foundation for a residential home. The employee was cleaning up for the day and collapsed from heat exhaustion.

On July 31, 2017, an employee's finger was crushed between a concrete form and a curved radius bar during form stripping operations. The employee sustained a partial amputation of the middle fingertip on the right hand.
While working at a construction site, an employee fell from height and was hospitalized with a broken foot, hand and pelvis.
An employee was lifting a portable generator when it fell on his ring finger amputating the fingertip.
Two employees were working from a scissor lift. When the lift moved, one employee had his fingers caught between the lift and a line-up pin, causing the amputation of the right middle fingertip.

While working on a pre-cast concrete panel, both welds for the hinged joint were cut through, causing the panel to separate, twist, and then collapse while the employee was on it. The employee fell to the ground and was subsequently hospitalized with a broken leg and head trauma.
On July 31, 2017, an employee was assisting in the removal of bridge beams and was pinned between two bridge beams, resulting in hospitalization for a fractured clavicle and fractured ribs.

An employee was painting the peak in the front of a house from an extension ladder. The ladder slid out and hit the ground. The employee fell from the ladder and suffered broken vertebrae and paralysis.
An employee was assisting in elevator installation and was hit in the head by a brick that fell from two stories above resulting in a possible concussion.
While getting up from a kneeling position, an employee lost his balance, stumbled backwards and fell fracturing the left wrist.
An employee was cutting a lift loop block with a chop saw when his glove was caught in the blade. This resulted in partial amputation of the left thumb.

An employee was operating a vehicle to move traffic control drums from a closed lane to the shoulder. She was traveling 5 to 10 miles per hour when she crashed into the road's barrier wall, striking her knee on the plastic and metal underneath her vehicle's steering column. She suffered a knee laceration, fractured ribs, and a liver laceration, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was assisting with fuse installation in a 480-volt electrical panel and was exposed to an arc flash resulting in burns to the face and left eye.
An employee intervened in a physical conflict between students and was pushed to the floor resulting in a broken upper left arm.
An employee was conducting sandblasting operations and was struck by the sandblaster spray. His leg was injured above the knee and required hospitalization.

An employee was holding the end of a measuring tape near the base of an 800-pound switch gear that was on uneven ground. He was helping to measure the switch gear to relocate it when it teetered on the uneven ground and struck one of his left-hand fingers, fracturing it.
An employee was hospitalized overnight after being struck in the head, back and shoulder by a falling piece of sheet metal.

While closing the dump truck's rear gate, two employees' hands were injured when the gate closed on them. One employee had four fingers amputated as a result of the injuries. The other employee received crushing injuries to the hand.

An employee was weatherproofing a construction area by placing plastic in the area. He was tucking weatherproofing around an open door when a coworker closed the door on his right index finger, amputating the fingertip and fracturing the finger.

An employee was standing on a forklift with a spool of pipe and its supporting cribbage. The employee was trying to reposition the pipe spool when the forklift moved, causing the spool to smash the employee's left finger on the supporting cribbage. The employee's left fingertip was amputated.
An employee was tied off to a D-ring on a pitched roof. The anchor point was not secure and the D-ring came out causing the employee to fall approximately 15 feet and break a leg.

An employee was helping to remove forms from a parapet wall over the interstate. Tension was being placed on the form from the opposite side to assist in the removal. The form broke loose from the parapet wall, swung, and struck the scaffold guardrail and the employee. The guardrail broke, and the employee fell approximately 25 feet to the shoulder of the roadway, breaking a leg and suffering lumbar fractures.
An employee was prying back some rebar on a grade beam when he fell backwards approximately 6 feet, striking his head on a 2 x 4 piece of lumber. He was hospitalized with a head injury.
An employee was picking up a roll of rubber in the storage shed and lost his footing. He fell on the 4" storage lip and broke his hip.

An employee was conducting sheet decking on a roof that was approximately 10 to 14 feet from a lower level when he slipped and fell to the concrete floor below. He fractured his sacral area, right wrist, right elbow, and L1-L2 and L4-L5 vertebrae, requiring hospitalization. The employee was not tied off at the time.
An employee was installing rebar in a curb. When he stood up, he collapsed. The employee was hospitalized for a possible heat-related illness and dehydration.

An employee was working on leveling prefabricated metal stairs while in a scissor lift. The stairs slipped off supports and struck the scissor lift knocking it over. The employee was ejected from the lift and sustained fractures to his arm and finger.

An employee was trying to unclog a concrete hopper on a small conveyor line when the employee tripped on the equipment cribbing and fell into the conveyor belt. The employee suffered a broken right arm, dislocated left arm, and lacerations.
While preparing to change a drill bit on a drilling machine, the Kelly bar moved resulting in amputation of the employee's right middle finger.
An employee had been working outside in hot and humid conditions. The employee became dehydrated and was hospitalized for heat exposure.

The injured employee was getting a steel plate positioned in the plate rack to place a plate clamp onto the material to remove it from the rack. Another employee was assisting by separating the plates to create room for the plate clamp. The pry bar slipped out of position allowing the plates to start falling back into their original position. As the plates were falling, the injured employee reached out to stop them and pinched the left middle finger between the plates resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee fell approximately 13 feet and broke a leg.

An employee was operating an excavation compaction roller up the side of a hill when his roller began losing traction and spun out, causing him to fall out of the vehicle. The roller landed on top of him, pinning and crushing him underneath.
While placing a cover on an electrical box, an employee fell off an 8-foot stepladder and hit his head on the floor.
An employee fell approximately 52 feet to the water below while painting a bridge, dislocating a shoulder.
An employee slipped while stepping off a ladder, dislocating an ankle.

An employee was on an A-frame ladder receiving floor trusses from a coworker when he slipped and fell off the ladder. He had nails in his pocket and they fell to the ground. The right side of his head landed on the nails and was punctured, requiring hospitalization.

A temporary employee was tracking a conveyor belt in the process of its installation when his wrench slipped. His right index finger was then caught and amputated between the conveyor and the pulley. The conveyor was not locked/tagged out at the time.

An employee was loading a drum roller onto a truck when the roller fell off the side of the truck. When the roller fell, the employee was launched out of the truck seat. He landed on his right shoulder and neck, suffering C7 neck fractures and two broken ribs. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was operating an electric paddle mixer when the employee's finger's became caught in the moving parts. The right pinky fingertip was amputated, while the ring and middle fingers were smashed.
An employee was using an overhead hoist to lift a trailer axle with a strap when the strap broke. The axle then fell on and crushed his left hand, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was grit blasting the exterior of a sulfur tank when he lost his grip on the blast nozzle. The hose swung freely, and the blast media was injected into his upper thigh.

An employee was standing on a flatbed trailer, guiding a crane hook to move A-frames on the trailer. As the crane operator moved the hook upwards away from the A-frame, the hook became detached from the line. The hook assembly then fell from a height of approximately 12 feet, first hitting the steel A-frame, then hitting the employee on the back right side. He was knocked down onto the trailer, suffering a back injury and broken ribs and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was removing a skylight from a roof when the wood truss supporting the skylight collapsed. The employee fell 20 to 30 feet through the opening and landed on the plywood that was covering the pool below, suffering a back fracture.

On August 7, 2017, at approximately 2:30PM, employees were coming down from the roof for a break. An employee unhooked the harness of their personal fall arrest equipment to come down the ladder, lost footing and fell approximately 24 feet to the ground below. The employee suffered a broken femur, broken wrist, punctured lung, and a fractured hip.
An employee fell approximately 7 feet off a wall after climbing a ladder, hitting the ground and suffering a head injury.
An employee was holding a board that was being cut in half with a circular saw when the saw jumped and swung backwards, hitting and cutting the employee's right thumb. The employee had surgery.
An employee had been removing concrete forms from columns. The employee stepped onto a piece of plywood, which gave way, and fell 14 feet to the ground below. He fractured his lower back.

An employee was sandblasting steel above his head. While he was adjusting his hand position on the nozzle, it slipped out of his hand. When he tried to catch the nozzle, it blasted his arm above the elbow, lacerating his arm and a vein.
An employee was climbing a fixed ladder to access the HVAC system on a roof when the ladder came off the building. He fell approximately 10 feet to the ground, fracturing his legs.
An employee was trying to move a cart with granite on it when the cart and granite overturned and struck the employee, injuring his neck and breaking the vertebrae in his lower back.
An employee fell 13.5 feet to the ground while connecting steel beams in a storm shelter, suffering a broken left arm and concussion.
An employee was helping to form concrete when he became hot and passed out. He was hospitalized for dehydration.

On August 8, 2017, around 4:30 p.m., an employee was helping a forklift operator load 18,000 lbs. of galvanized pipe into the back of a flatbed trailer. The injured employee was holding a trailer stake and when the forklift operator lowered the load onto the truck, the employee's hand with the stake drifted under the trailer. The trailer came down and crushed his hand between it and the stake. He suffered a fracture to his left ring finger metacarpal and was hospitalized.

An employee was hooking up a trailer onto a truck at the job site. When the truck driver moved the truck, the trailer fell on his right foot. He suffered foot and toe lacerations that required hospitalization.

An employee was helping a concrete pump operator with a concrete system. He was trying to pick up a 4'' clamp that was wedged under the concrete pipeline when it surged, smashing his right middle finger and amputating the fingertip.

An employee was entering a portable water tank to erect a scaffold when he fell through a hole in the platform about 10 to 15 feet to the tank's floor. He suffered a broken left leg, back injuries, and two head lacerations, requiring hospitalization.

An employee had been prepping concrete forms for removal and was on top of one of the forms. While moving from one anchor point to another, the employee fell off the form. His self-retracting lanyard failed and he fell to the concrete, 16 to 18 feet below, sustaining injuries to his head, hip and wrist.

An employee was cleaning a concrete mixer with a hose when his right hand was caught between the mixer's paddles and the mixer's drums, fracturing his right middle and index fingers. He was hospitalized. The mixer was unguarded and energized at the time.
An employee was grabbing his framing gun when it shot a nail into his leg, requiring surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was in a bucket working on a primary electrical distribution powerline when he became disoriented and suffered heat exhaustion.
An employee was welding an H-beam and was putting an electrode on the holder when he was electrically shocked by the circuit. He momentarily lost consciousness and fell over. He was hospitalized.

An employee was setting a steel beam while working out of an aerial lift when the beam leaned against the lift and pinched his left hand between it and the top rail of the man basket. His middle finger was amputated to the first knuckle.
Two employees were on eight foot ladders aligning connectors when the beam rolled, knocking them off the ladders. An employee suffered a torn left leg.
An employee was lifting a bucket of bolts when he strained his back.

An employee and a coworker were standing on 10-foot ladders while removing an old air duct when a segment of the duct separated and struck the ladders. The employee fell to the ground and broke ribs on the right side.
An employee was standing on top of a 54-inch reinforced concrete pipe when he slipped and fell to the ground, landing on his left side and lacerating his spleen.
An employee was removing a plug from a 6-inch pipeline when pressure in the line caused it to blow off and strike his hand and arm, requiring surgery.

On August 9, 2017, an employee received an electrical shock while installing new ovens and suffered cardiac arrest which resulted in an inpatient hospitalization and medical treatment beyond first aid.
While clearing land, an employee unearthed a bee hive. The bees stung the employee over 100 times in the face.

An employee was on an extension ladder scraping loose paint on the side of a building when the ladder slid down. The employee fell about 6 feet to the asphalt pavement, and the ladder landed on top of his left leg, breaking his femur.
An employee collapsed and was hospitalized for suspected heat stress/exhaustion.
An employee was using a high-pressure water jetter to clean out a piece of large pipe when the equipment turned around on its own and high-pressure water hit the employee's left arm, lacerating it.
An employee was attempting to remove a kink in a chain being used to pull out a stuck truck when the chain unkinked and struck the employee's left hand, amputating the pinky finger.

An employee was on a scaffold removing shoring from a concrete form when the shoring slipped out of the employee's hands and struck the scaffold planking. He then fell approximately 8 feet, suffering head lacerations that required stitches. He was hospitalized overnight.

On August 10, 2017, an employee was taking fall protection system anchors to the roof while using a ladder when the employee either fell from the ladder while placing the anchors onto the perimeter wall or while accessing the roof. The employee fell more than 20 feet to the ground and suffered a head injury, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell approximately 8 feet off a sidewalk shed and was hospitalized with a sprained wrist and hip injuries.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut a 2X4 when the blade amputated his middle fingertip.
An employee working on a carport fell through a damaged section of decking and was hospitalized with a broken kneecap and shoulder.
An employee was cut on the right middle finger knuckle while unloading stainless steel.

An employee was installing a 6-inch PVC sewer line. As he was holding the pipe, something smashed his thumb against the pipe. He suffered left thumb trauma and a possible fracture, requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was loading equipment onto a trailer when the employee's thumb was pinched and lacerated between the equipment's roller and articulating plate.

An employee was standing on an extension ladder while affixing flashing around a door frame. When the employee attempted to drill into the flashing, the ladder slid and one of the rungs came down on top of the employee's right knee, injuring it and requiring surgery.

An employee was preparing two splice plates for connection to a beam when the bottom splice plate fell open and onto a J-hook. His left-hand fingertips were pinched and fractured between the edge of the J-hook and the concrete bridge deck, and his left thumb was dislocated.
An employee was securing his positioning straps to the ladder and fell about 15 feet to the ground, fracturing the left wrist.

On August 11, 2017, at 11:00 a.m., an employee was changing out a residential electrical meter. He performed a line-to-line voltage check and then proceeded with the change-out. When he hooked up the jumper cables, an arc flash occurred, causing second degree burns to his right hand. He was hospitalized.

An employee was using a pry bar to pry form work when his right pinky finger was crushed between the pry bar and the form work. His fingertip fractured and he lost the fingernail, requiring surgery and hospitalization.

On August 11, 2017, at 8:30 a.m., an employee was dismounting a ladder onto a roof when the metal shingle that he stepped on detached and he fell 15 feet to the ground, fracturing his lower lumbar, cervical spine, and three ribs.  He was hospitalized.
On 08/12/2017, an employee felt ill and was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee was driving a stand-up tugger and trying to throw something in a garbage can when she fell to the concrete floor and suffered a concussion.

An employee was operating a grapple log skidder to move cut trees when it rolled over the side of a hill and partially landed on the side of the turnpike below. He suffered multiple skull fractures and a fractured T3 vertebra.

A crew was changing out a single phase pole with a transformer on it. Work on the pole was completed and the cover-up was being removed when an employee noticed the animal guard that was installed on the arrestor was not in its proper place. As he attempted to correct it, he came in contact with energized parts while his elbow contacted a grounded surface. He received second degree electrical burns on his right arm.

An employee was working on a ladder that was set up on a roof when his foot became caught on one of the rungs. The ladder then slid out from under him, causing him to fall approximately 8 feet. The ladder fell on top of his leg, fracturing his tibia and displacing tendons.
An employee rolled and fractured his ankle while moving a sign.
An employee was picking up concrete debris and throwing it into a skid steer bucket when the concrete fell out of the bucket and snagged his right ring finger, amputating it.
An employee fell while installing trusses and hit the ground, fracturing an ankle and injuring a kidney. The employee had surgery.

An employee was climbing a ladder to assess a leaking roof when he missed a rung with his hand and fell approximately 10 feet to the ground. He suffered a gash to the left side of his head and a fracture to his left elbow.

A 19-foot box truck drove off the road, over the curb onto the sidewalk and struck an employee. The employee was hospitalized for collapsed lungs, head injuries, lacerations, and fractures which included broken ribs.
An employee was using an impact wrench when it amputated his left pinky finger at the first joint.
An employee was using a dolly cart to move an armature that weighed approximately 1,500 pounds when the cart tilted and struck him above the ankle, breaking his leg and ankle.
An employee was performing maintenance on a chairlift when the chairlift platform started to move and came off the line. The employee fell to the ground, suffering a broken pelvis.
An employee was installing roof shingles when he fell to the ground, injuring his spine.
An employee was troubleshooting a rebar bending machine when his right pinky finger was caught and amputated in between the machine's stopper plate and the return lever.
An employee was testing a transformer when an arc flash occurred, burning his arms and hands.

An employee was crossing from a working platform (24' above ground) to another lower area of the scaffold when he lost his footing and fell, breaking his hip, wrist, and femur and lacerating his chin and forehead.
While loading an 18-wheeler trailer, an employee fell approximately 4 feet from the trailer to the concrete ground, suffering a concussion and requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was tightening a bolt on a flange while standing on a wooden box when the employee slipped and fell from the box and struck a metal valve wheel, suffering a broken rib and punctured lung.
An employee was dumping a debris cart when the cart shifted and crushed a finger between the cart and the dumpster.

On August 16, 2017, an employee was jackhammering concrete around an electrical conduit bank when the jackhammer struck an electrical line and an arc flash occurred. The employee suffered burns from the waist to just above the knee.
An employee was dismounting the rear of a backhoe when his wedding ring became caught on equipment, causing a traumatic amputation to his left ring finger.
An employee was carrying insulation material on a roof when he slipped on dew and fell on the roof surface, injuring his shoulder and possibly his head. He was hospitalized.

Several employees were unplugging an electrical cable to install a new switch to a transformer containing 7,200 volts when an arc flash occurred. One employee sustained burns to his left hand and was hospitalized.
An employee was adjusting the track on a skid steer that was on a jack when the skid steer shifted and caused the jack to slip. The skid steer then fell on the employee, fracturing the T2 vertebra.

The injured employee moved a super sack of product to the crystallizer area by forklift. The sack is lifted by a hoist over the hopper of the slurry machine and the bottom of the super sack is cut. The employee was attempting to retrieve a piece of sack that fell into the operating hopper when his left hand became caught in the hopper, injuring his middle and ring fingers.

An employee was standing on a bridge sidewalk when a passing vehicle with a ladder rack snagged a vertical hand line hanging from the upper portions of the bridge. The rope struck the employee along the midsection and threw him against the bridge's hand railing. He suffered two fractured ribs, a mild concussion, and minor bleeding in the spleen.
An employee was cutting wood with a saw when it amputated the employee's left middle finger. The saw was guarded at the time.

An employee and two coworkers were working from an elevated platform when it shifted, causing them to fall on top of each other and onto one end of the platform. One of the employees was hospitalized with a broken right wrist and right ankle.

An employee was operating a milling machine when the engine compartment caught fire. The employee had to go through the fire to exit the machine, suffering first and second degree burns to the left and right forearms, a wrist, and face.

On August 17, 2017, an employee was on a step ladder helping to remove a sanitary sewer pipe in a ceiling when the employee fell approximately 4 feet off the step ladder, suffering cracked back vertebrae and requiring hospitalization.
While working at a client's home, an employee was walking on a staircase and the stairs gave way. The employee fell 9 feet through the stairs and sustained a compound fracture to the left ankle.

An employee was on a lower level when an unsecured steel grate fell from the level above and struck the employee. The employee sustained a concussion, broken rib, broken vertebrae, and inter-laceration of the liver.
An employee was clipping in a new conductor on an existing distribution line when a phase to ground fault occurred, causing an electrical flash that burned his left arm and shoulder.

An employee was working from an extendable boom platform when the boom was struck by an overhead crane's block and tackle, which had broken loose. The employee was thrown outside of the platform, suffering multiple spinal injuries and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was driving a ground rod into the ground when he missed/slipped and fell into the rod. His head struck the rod, breaking the eye socket bone and driving it into part of his brain. He was hospitalized.

An employee was on the roof to see what was needed to be completed that morning when he stepped on a piece of felt paper, slipped, and fell on the roof, breaking his ribs and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was checking grade lines when he was struck by a front-end loader, breaking his leg.
An employee was standing on a steel beam during a re-rigging operation when a steel beam struck his right leg, fracturing his femur.
An employee was working on a residential re-roofing job when he fell from the roof to the ground, suffering multiple fractures to the elbow/arm and possibly other bones. He was hospitalized.
An employee was working on a pump jack scaffold when he fell 15 feet from the scaffolding to the ground, breaking his shoulder, wrist, and ribs.
An employee was walking around checking a truck when he stepped on a rock and twisted his foot. He then fell on his face, lacerating it.
An employee was installing additional bolts on the secondary side of a transformer, which had a voltage of 277480, when a flash occurred and burned the employee's face.
An employee was cutting a piece of wood with a handheld circular saw when the saw kicked back and amputated his right small fingertip without bone loss.

An employee placed a 4-foot ladder on top of a 5-foot scaffold and climbed up the ladder to install drywall when the scaffold and employee fell over. The employee suffered a fractured skull and was hospitalized.

An employee was measuring the corner of a roof. When he adjusted his lanyard to get to the other side of the roof, he tripped and fell 21 feet to the ground. He broke his L1 vertebra and was hospitalized.
An employee fell 35 feet while standing on a wall, breaking his heel and pelvis and requiring surgery.
An employee was testing a transformer when his hand hit a primary and was shocked, burning both of his hands.
An employee was installing new storm drain pipes and storm inlets in a trench 9 feet deep when it caved in, trapping him up to the shoulder area and injuring his back. He was hospitalized.

An employee installed an insulator on a pole and was coming down from the pole using a boom lift when he saw something was not complete and went back up to the location where he was previously working. He then made contact with a switch, which sent an electrical current through the left side of his body and out through the right hand. His right hand was amputated.
An employee was finishing concrete when he became lightheaded and ill due to heat stress and dehydration, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was locking up the gate at the site when his personal vehicle, which was still in gear, struck him, injuring his shoulder and ribs.
An employee was unloading a goose neck trailer using a winch and cable. The employee's hand was caught in the winch hook when the truck pulled away amputating the index finger below the nail.
An employee fell approximately 12 to 15 feet from a ladder to the ground, suffering internal injuries that required hospitalization.

An employee was running wire through a crawl space when he fell through the drywall ceiling and landed 18 feet below on a concrete surface, suffering blunt force trauma to the head, a severe laceration to the leg, and a fractured lower back.
On August 21, 2017, an employee was on top of an 8-foot high box moving a pallet when he lost his balance and fell to the ground, injuring his head and torso.
An employee was cinching up a rigging cable on a forklift when a steel beam fell off the forklift and struck the employee's legs, breaking the left femur and right tibia.
An employee was moving a portable welder from the back of a pick-up truck when his right ring fingertip and nail were amputated between the handle of the welder and the pipe rack.

An employee was operating a spreader bar while installing an HVAC unit on a rooftop. A load was being lowered while the injured employee got into position. The load came down too fast for the employee to move out of the way and the spreader bar slammed into his steel toe boot. His hand was caught between the load and the bar, amputating two fingers.
An employee was loading a riding trowel when the employee's finger was caught between the riding trowel and equipment, breaking and lacerating it.
An employee was loading a screed machine into a semi-trailer and descending the machine's ladder when he fell and hit his head on the asphalt below. He suffered a brain hemorrhage and brain swelling.
An employee fell approximately 35 feet while erecting a scaffold, suffering a broken left leg, broken right arm, fractured pelvis, and head bruises.

An employee was underneath a residential home installing an HVAC plenum when his right hand made contact with an exposed energized electrical wire. He received an electrical shock and sustained burn injuries to his right hand and chest.
An employee was using a table saw when the blade amputated his ring and middle fingers. The saw was unguarded at the time.
An employee was clearing material from a table saw when it partially amputated his left thumb. The saw was running at the time.

An employee was cutting lumber with a rough knot saw. The employee was moving planks of wood from a roller when the saw was activated. The saw's guard came down just before the saw blade came up, and the employee's right index and middle fingertips were amputate by the blade or the moving guard.
An employee and coworkers were pouring a concrete floor when the floor collapsed about 18 feet. The employee suffered back and rib injuries and was hospitalized.

An employee was working inside a 10 to 12 feet deep excavation for the installation of a new underground pipe. He was standing inside the trench box (12 feet high x 8 feet long x 20 feet wide) when the excavation soil sheared off and hit him from behind at the calf level. The dirt pushed him forward and fractured his right ankle.
An employee suffered a heat-related illness while installing plumbing.
An employee was climbing a scaffold when it collapsed. The employee fell onto the ground and was struck by falling parts of the scaffold, suffering a broken leg and forehead laceration.

On 8/29/2017, at approximately 3:15 PM CST, an employee and a coworker were tightening a nut on a push rod.  The coworker was using a pry bar to pry on a piece of tube steel to take the pressure off the nut and make it easier for the employee to turn. The bar slipped and pinched the employee's right index finger, avulsing it and partially amputating the fingertip without bone loss.
An employee suffered burns to their arm from an electrical distribution panel while replacing an overcurrent device. The panel was not locked/tagged out at the time.

An employee was attempting to reposition the fork on a telehandler. His right pinky finger was between the fork and the mounting bracket when the fork shifted and swung back, crushing his pinky finger.
An employee was installing insulation from a step ladder when the ladder tipped. The employee fell to the floor and broke the left hand.

An employee was securing concrete wall blocks on a step-down trailer. As he was throwing a chain over the load, he lost his footing, fell to the lower deck, and then hit the ground. He broke his hip and was hospitalized.

A crew was offloading T-wall panels using a spreader bar and a loader. Two employees were assisting with the rigging while the loader operator positioned the loader.
