While the employees were connecting the second piece of rigging, the tension from the rigging attachment gave way, causing the spreader bar to strike the injured employee's hands, fracturing the left index and middle fingers and dislocating the right thumb.

On 8/29/2017 at 12:50 p.m., an employee was pouring concrete at a construction site when he became ill and later started sweating profusely and had shortness of breath. He was hospitalized for possible heat stress or heat stroke.
An employee was operating a punch press when it amputated his fingertip.
An employee was moving a pump jack when an aluminum pump jack pole slid and hit his head, knocking him unconscious and bruising his head.

On August 30, 2017, at approximately 2:15 p.m., an employee was transitioning a process air compressor from the vertical to the horizontal position when the employee's fingers were caught between the compressor's round housing and the internal tube section, amputating the left ring finger above the first knuckle and the left pinky fingertip.
An employee was ripping wood with a table saw when his fingers contacted the blade, cutting his right middle and pointer fingers. He was hospitalized.

An employee was starting to unload equipment from a trailer. The employee released the bar holding the trailer ramps up when the hydraulics failed, causing the ramp to fall on the employee. The employee suffered a head laceration, three broken ribs, a collapsed lung, and a lower back injury.
An employee stepped on an unsecured hole cover and fell into a 12-foot-deep window well, breaking his left tibia and fibula and injuring his head.
On 8/30/2017, an employee was cutting wood using a power saw when it kicked back and cut his thumb.
On 8/30/2017, an employee was repairing a roof when he fell off, fracturing his heel.

At approximately 9:15 a.m., on 8/30/2017, an employee was bending three pieces of rebar when the employee's right index finger was smashed between the rebar. The finger had to be surgically amputated at the first knuckle.

On August 30, 2017, an employee was unloading concrete barriers from the back of a flatbed truck when the employee's left middle fingertip was caught and amputated between the lifting device and a barrier.

An employee was walking beside a piece of 4-inch pipe on jack stands while a coworker was pushing the wind block. The wind block hit the pipe on the jack stand, causing the pipe to fall and strike the employee, who suffered a broken left leg.
An employee was installing drywall on a wall next to a door opening when the door closed on his middle finger, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was unloading equipment from a work vehicle when his heart began beating rapidly.

An employee was unloading a piece of pipe from a dump truck when the truck moved forward and he slipped. As he slipped, he gave a stopping motion to the driver. The driver stopped suddenly, and the truck tailgate came down and amputated the employee's right pinky finger.

A crew was lifting a concrete power pole off a pole trailer to verify the lifting point was in the proper position. The injured employee's hand was on an insulator that was attached to the pole, checking for balance, when the pole shifted and caught his right pinky finger between the insulator and a bolt on a second pole that was on the trailer. His finger was fractured between the main and middle knuckles.
On September 1, 2017, a temporary employee fell through a hole from the second floor to the first floor, suffering a head injury and brain swelling. He was hospitalized.

An employee was using a portable grinder with a wire brush wheel to clean a metallic natural gas pipe in preparation for welding. The flow of natural gas had been stopped with a metallic stopper pin. As the employee was using the grinder, the stopper pin became dislodged from a seated position, resulting in a brief ignition of the natural gas. The employee suffered first and second degree burns to the right side of his face and nose.
An employee was installing a pump at a remote site when he lost control of the pump. The pump then hit and amputated approximately 1/2 inch of his right middle finger.
An employee lost his grip and fell from a ladder rung as he was climbing a scaffold, breaking two ribs.
An employee was lowering a scaffold when the employee's left-hand palm was impaled on the scaffold lever.

While climbing down a secondary ladder in a water tower, an employee fell approximately 30 feet to a platform, breaking two vertebrae, puncturing a lung, and breaking a foot. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee lost his balance and fell to the ground while transitioning from the top of a porch into a man lift. He injured his back.

An employee finished a roofing repair patch at a completed installation and was descending from the roof using a permanent ladder when he slipped and fell 12 feet to the ground. He fractured his right foot and was hospitalized.
On September 5, 2017, an employee working on a residential home fell 10 feet from an A-frame ladder, suffering a head injury and requiring hospitalization.
An employee's left middle fingertip was pinched and amputated by a machine.
On September 5, an employee fell approximately 10 feet off a canopy while repairing a roof. The employee suffered a fractured back.

An employee was troubleshooting a broken water hose on a cement truck. The employee lifted the charge hoop (chute), which then came down and smashed the employee's thumb between the truck's hopper and drum ring, causing a possible fracture or torn nail.
An employee had removed dirt inside a trench using an air hammer. The air hammer was then being removed when it fell on the employee's head, causing a head injury and brain swelling.

An employee was painting the walls and ceiling in a school room. While descending a 12-foot A-frame ladder, he felt dizzy, missed a step, and fell 8 or 9 feet to the floor, bruising his head, scraping his right arm, and fracturing his right hip. He was hospitalized.
An employee suffered an electric shock and/or burns on the hands and fingers while installing distribution lines.
An employee's hand was caught between the tailgate and the truck as he tried opening it with his hands. A finger was injured requiring stitches.

An employee was walking back from lunch to the worksite when a piece of spiral duct on the rooftop blew down to the ground and struck the employee's neck. The employee suffered a laceration from the neck to the shoulder.

On September 7, 2017, an employee was hoisting a large argon gas cylinder with a chain. As the cylinder was being lifted, the chain started to move and the cylinder shifted. The employee grabbed the valve ring on top of the cylinder and was trying to stabilize it when the first digit of the employee's left thumb was caught and amputated between the chain and one of the ring supports.
An employee was framing the garage roof at a residential home when he fell from an 8-foot elevation, suffering a head injury. He was hospitalized.
An employee was hand-controlling a hoist to bring up a load of bricks when the entire hoist system tipped back and fell on top of him, injuring his back.
An employee was using a portable cordless drill to prepare tubing for welding when the drill started to slip. When he attempted to catch the drill, the attachment amputated his left index fingertip.
An employee was cutting wood with a circular saw when the saw kicked back and amputated two fingertips without bone loss.

An employee was welding on a steel casing pipe while laying on the ground. One pipe was on the bucket of a backhoe when hydraulics settled on the backhoe, causing the pipe to roll off the backhoe and onto the employee. The employee sustained a broken pelvis, internal bleeding, and a contusion to the left leg.
An employee was picking up trash at a construction worksite when he stepped in a hole and tripped, dislocating his right ankle.

An employee was using a utility knife to notch out sections of a composite trim when the knife slipped on the hard surface of the trim and struck the employee's left forearm, severing an artery and cutting veins. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
Employees were placing a water line for the city when one of the employees stepped outside of the trenching box. The earth collapsed around him, fracturing his lower vertebrae.
An employee was reaching under a pump when a rattlesnake bit his thumb. He was hospitalized.

An employee was walking down the street wearing a reflective vest and hard hat while conducting a visual inspection of a repaired powerline when he was struck by a hit-and-run vehicle. He broke his right leg and was hospitalized.
An employee was throwing a piece of plate glass into a dumpster when the piece of glass broke and fell on his left arm, lacerating his bicep. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was on a 20-foot ladder when it moved. The employee dismounted the ladder and landed on both feet, injuring both heels. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was hanging glove bags on pipes when he fell 3 feet from a mobile scaffold and hit his head on the concrete floor.
An employee was cleaning up debris from chipping vertical columns when a 20-foot beam fell and hit the employee, breaking the right leg and ribs and injuring the stomach and back.

An employee was glazing windows while on a lift. A tree uprooted and a branch fell onto the lift's cage knocking the employee out of the lift. The employee suffered a fractured nose and vertebrae and required 14 stitches in an eye.

An employee was driving a bulldozer. When it drove on an unlevel surface (about 2 feet difference), his foot slipped off the gas pedal and he fell out of the cab hitting his mouth and nose on the side mirror. The employee fell on the tracks of the bulldozer and it ran over his arm and leg resulting in a fractured femur.

The injured employee was operating a telehandler that had a man basket with two employees in it. He was backing it up and struck a large object. He stopped suddenly and began to lower the man basket. The telehandler tipped over. The injured employee had multiple broken toes on his left foot that required hospitalization and surgery. The employees in the man basket suffered cuts and bruises.

On September 13, 2017, at approximately 2:30 p.m. an employee was spraying a form with oil. The employee slipped and fell about 8 feet and was caught under the arm by a form rack. The employee suffered a cut to the arm that severed a nerve.

An employee was at the top of a fixed ladder mounted on the interior of a 10-foot deep trench box. It was raining and the employee's feet and the ladder were wet. The employee slipped off the ladder and fell onto his back on the plywood flooring of the excavation, sustaining a back injury.

While working to reposition felt, an employee slipped on the felt and fell from the roof of a 3-story building to the ground below and was hospitalized for an injured pelvis, broken ribs and a punctured lung.
While working from a bucket truck, an employee received an electrical shock from a downed power line.
An employee had been performing roofing operations and was hospitalized for heat stress on 9/13/2017.
While framing an apartment complex under construction, an employee fell approximately 22 feet to the ground and sustained a fractured skull, broken back, sprained arm and contusions.
An employee was painting a steel beam that was on a saw horse when it fell on and broke his leg.

An employee was locating underground utilities. He opened a hand hole to inspect inside for damage and was exposed to 750k electrical current. The employee was shocked and received injuries to his chest and calves.
On 09/14/2017, an employee experienced symptoms of dehydration and heat stress while assisting with power restoration, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was applying chemical paint remover to a beam when the chemical got inside his sleeves and burned both arms. He was wearing PPE at the time.
An employee fell four feet from a ladder and fractured the left tibia and fibula.
An employee was standing on top of a 12-inch-diameter pipe, attempting to hang a chainfall, when he lost his balance and fell backward onto a piece of horizontal pipe, puncturing a lung.

An employee was ascending a crank-up scaffold system via an affixed access ladder when one of the employee's hands slipped from a rung. The employee then fell approximately 3 feet to the finished concrete surface below, twisting and breaking the right ankle. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee fell to the ground while transferring his safety equipment from one purlin to the next, fracturing his ankle and leg.

An employee was climbing a residential structure to reach the top plate when he slipped and fell, landing on a brace and breaking his left foot above the ankle. Fall protection was not worn at the time.
An employee was using a vertical hammer to pile drive when a steel piece of the hammer came loose and struck his head, lacerating it. He was has hospitalized overnight.
An employee was painting the ceiling of an indoor gun range, stepped off the edge of the scaffold and fell 11 feet resulting in multiple fractures to the back, hip, legs, ankles and feet.

On September 15, 2017, at approximately 7:00 a.m., an employee was operating a paint machine when the paint wand hose sprang a leak and began discharging paint at high pressure. He was attempting to grab the wand gun handle when his right index finger was struck by the high-pressure paint (2,000 PSI). His right index finger had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was using a forklift to clean up trash/debris at the end of the day and the forklift rolled over. The employee remained inside the cab area, resulting in a shoulder injury.

An employee was operating an earth compactor to compact soil so cement could be poured for a new driveway. The employee drove up an incline and then turned the compactor so it was parallel to the hill. The compactor tipped over, causing injury to the employee's left hip and breaking his left foot.
An employee was on a roof doing prep work for painting. The employee fell off the roof and sustained a broken arm.
An employee was hooking up a 70-foot rebar into the ground when a 25-foot piece of rebar fell and hit the back of his hard hat. This resulted in a fracture to his C1 and C2 vertebrae.

On 9/18/2017, an employee was installing a residential roof and tearing off layers of the roof's pitch. While throwing a bundle of shingles to the ground, the employee fell about 17 feet to the ground, injuring the wrist and lower back. Fall protection was not used at the time of the incident.
An employee was unloading crates from a container when one of the crates fell on top of the employee, fracturing the right arm/shoulder.
An employee was descending from a power pole when he fell, injuring his back and breaking his right foot. His safety belts were removed at the time of the incident.

An employee was in the basket of an aerial lift painting the exterior fascia in the front of a building. The lift moved and the employee contacted a 13.2 kV power line. The employee was shocked and received burns to the hands and head.

An employee was working to cut sewer pipe to a specified size. The employee had cut one side of the pipe with a powered concrete saw and was turning the pipe to cut the opposite side. The saw kicked back and lacerated the employee's chest.

An employee was running wires via an electrical panel to provide temporary lights when a ground wire touched the panel's line terminal and created a spark. The spark burned the employee's right elbow and left cheek.

Two employees were in a scissor lift approximately 17 to 18 feet high to hang duct work. They had finished hanging a piece when the scissor lift activated, began moving quickly in circles, and overturned. One of the employees was hospitalized with vertebrae, wrist, and ankle fractures. Both employees were tied off in the scissor lift at the time of the incident.
An employee was unpacking a pane of heavy glass when it fell on and broke his right leg. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was operating a powered pipe threading machine when it amputated the employee's right middle finger at the second knuckle.

On September 19, 2017, an employee fell about 10 feet from an extension ladder to the concrete floor while working on a beam pocket. The employee was hospitalized with paralysis of both legs and the right arm.
An employee fell approximately 8 feet from an unprotected edge while installing rebar for a barrier wall, fracturing the sternum, wrist, rib, and vertebrae.
An employee's left index fingertip was amputated.
An employee's ankle was run over by a truck.
An employee suffered a hernia while climbing a scaffold and was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell off a crane while climbing into the cab, fracturing his left arm and elbow.
An employee was on a scaffold when he became dizzy. As he was descending the ladder, he lost his balance and fell to the ground, breaking his left femur and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was drilling a concrete anchor with a hammer drill when he pulled on a loose duct hanger, which then cut his arm.
An employee fell from the second step of a stair set he was assembling, sustaining two broken ankles and a broken tibia.
On 9/20/2017, an employee was acting as a spotter for an aerial lift when the lift ran over the employee's left foot, fracturing three toes. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was maneuvering a manlift over a speed bump at a crawl when the manlift accelerated and lunged forward as the front wheels went over the speed bump. The employee was lifted into the air and straight back down onto his feet in the basket. He then dropped down into a seated position. This jarring action broke his lower right leg.
An employee was working on a sheet metal machine when the sheet metal slipped. The machine then came down on his left index finger, partially amputating it.
A temporary employee was working on a new construction job site conducting plumbing related activities and suffered dehydration and heat stress. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was working on a scaffold when it tipped over. He hit the ground and broke his leg.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet onto a concrete slab while laying decking on joists because of windy conditions. He suffered broken ribs and a punctured lung.
An employee slipped on elevated steel beams and fell 11 feet to the floor, suffering a broken left foot, sprained left knee, broken tibia, and torn meniscus in the right knee.

An employee was rigging a steel casing for relocation when the casing slipped, causing the employee to lose balance. The casing hit the ground/wall, and the employee's right hand was caught between the casing and a solid object, amputating the middle and index fingers.

An employee was operating a lift with a man basket to install a drainage pipe underneath a bridge when the lift started to slide down a slope. The employee was then ejected from the man basket and fell approximately 20 feet to the ground, suffering abdominal and facial injuries.
Two employees were using a ladder near a powerline to assess the condition of a roof when they received an electric shock, suffering burns on their feet and requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was standing near concrete-crushing equipment when the ground gave way. The employee fell 10 feet and suffered a broken back.
On September 21, 2017, an employee was readying gates for installation. While manually moving the slide, the employee's finger was caught in a gear, pinching and removing the skin on the fingertip.

An employee was priming bolts in a stairwell while standing on a 6-foot step ladder. He had a paint can in one hand and a paint brush in the other hand. He fell as he was descending the step ladder, breaking two ribs and suffering a collapsed right lung. He was hospitalized.

An employee was pulling wire via a fish tape into an electrical box in the ceiling when he went through a window (which had not been installed) and fell four stories down to the ground, suffering broken bones throughout his body, internal bleeding, and a head injury. He was hospitalized.
An employee was moving a sheet of 4x8 shoring board to the edge of a trench when he fell 8 feet into the trench, fracturing his right tibia and fibula.
An employee was operating construction equipment to back fill an excavation. As he was backing up near a ventilator wall, his left leg was pinned between the wall and equipment, breaking it.
An employee was testing a transformer with a secondary voltage of 2,400 volts and suffered first and second degree burns to his right elbow from an arc flash.
An employee was standing near a load being suspended by a crane. While trying to move the top bundle, the employee's right first fingertip was pinched and amputated between two bundles.
An employee was pulling the concrete pump hose, lost grip on the pulling rope attached to the pump hose, and fell onto the metal decking resulting in a broken left arm.
An employee was servicing gas pump equipment at a gas station when a fire occurred, burning both of his hands. He was hospitalized.
While installing insulation on a roof deck, an employee fell about 24 feet, striking metal bracing on the wall and then the concrete floor. The employee suffered a head injury and was hospitalized.
An employee was climbing a structural ladder to access the first landing of a building when his hand slipped and he fell approximately 10 feet to the ground, breaking two vertebrae and his hip.
On September 22, 2017, an employee was cutting flooring material on a table saw when the flooring material kicked out. His hand then contacted the saw blade, amputating his finger.

An employee was preparing to clean a clogged spray bar on a distributor truck (tack truck). When the employee removed the protective screen that covers the bolts securing the cover, hot oil sprayed onto the employee's right hand and arm causing second degree burns.

On September 23, 2017, at approximately 6:40 an employee was helping another employee to remove build up on an energized fabric cutter roller using a putty knife. The putty knife and the employee's hand were pulled into the knives, resulting in amputation of the distal tip of the right middle finger. The machine was not guarded or locked out at the time.
An employee was disassembling a crane and lattice boom when the boom fell onto the employee's steel-toed boots crushing toes and amputating part of the big toe, pinky toe and the fourth toe.

An employee was dismantling a scaffold. While walking across two 7' steel scaffold planks, the planks separated and the employee fell 18 feet through the gap to the concrete surface below. The employee sustained a fractured left clavicle, fractured arm and a collapsed lung.
An employee was climbing down a ladder and lacerated his left arm above his elbow on an air conditioning duct.
An employee was installing sprinkler pipe. A 10-inch pipe weighing 1,000 lbs. slipped off the trackhoe as the pipe was being lowered and struck the employee causing a severe leg injury.
An employee was descending a ladder after placing a scaffold plank when he lost his footing and fell approximately 15 feet to the ground, breaking his ribs and pelvis.
Employees were replacing the membrane on a flat roof when an employee became affected by the heat. He was hospitalized overnight with heat exhaustion and dehydration.
An employee stepped into the footing of an excavated site that had wet concrete, which caused second degree burns to his knees and lower legs. PPE was not worn at the time.
An employee was removing a tarp from a roof when he lost his balance and fell 10 feet to the ground. He fractured his jaw and wrist and suffered broken teeth, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
While walking on a bridge platform, an employee fell about 13 feet to the rocky surface below, breaking both wrists and a leg. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was on a ladder installing a light fixture when he received an electrical shock, causing him to fall off the ladder to the ground. He suffered a back injury.
While doing touch-up painting on a roof, an employee slipped and fell approximately 15 feet to the concrete below, suffering a head injury.

An employee was attempting to move two fittings that were blocking an elevated walkway when he tripped and fell through the guardrails and down eight stories onto a portable toilet. He then rolled onto the ground. He broke his leg and pelvis and dislocated his hip.

An employee was standing on the forks of a forklift approximately 4 feet above the ground looking into a refuse container when he fell off the forks to the ground, injuring his left-side ribs, knee, and hand, and suffering a possible fracture to his spine.
While dropping a tailgate on a dump truck, an employee's hand was caught between the tailgate and chain, amputating the right index finger.

On September 27, 2017, an employee and coworkers were attempting to load a crane onto a truck when the lifting strap broke and an outrigger fell on the employee's leg, resulting in a partial amputation below the knee.
An employee was washing out a cement mixer when he slipped on a slick area and fell, fracturing his right tibia.

An employee was standing on top of a concrete wall to receive a hoisted steel member when he lost his balance and fell 14 to 15 feet to the soil below. He suffered multiple contusions to the body with minor facial lacerations.
An employee was manually moving a scissor lift when it rolled over his ankle, breaking two ankle bones. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was removing an exit sign, received a shock and fell from the ladder. The employee was hospitalized for a left arm injury and a cardiac injury.
An employee was climbing down a gantry crane and knocked out the gantry pin pinching his finger resulting in amputation of the right index and middle fingers.
An employee was using an oxygen/acetylene torch in a small walk-in cooler when the employee developed breathing problems and lung aspiration from the fumes or smoke. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was installing hurricane shutters when a metal reel fell and struck the employee's right hand, crushing the index finger. The finger was surgically amputated.

An employee was climbing onto a scaffold when he tripped on bricks laying on the scaffolding platform and fell approximately 6 feet to the ground below, fracturing multiple right-side ribs and contusing his thorax. He was hospitalized.
An employee was demonstrating how to install a blue tarp safely when he slipped on the tarp and fell, tearing ligaments in his neck. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was cutting a piece of wood form with a circular saw when the saw kicked back and amputated the employee's left pinky finger.
An employee was cleaning up foam debris on a boat when he fell 7 feet down to the floor of the boat dock, injuring his head and back.
An employee was picking up a saw when a coworker activated its power pack. The saw engaged and lacerated his right shin.
An employee was injured and hospitalized after a piece of scrap metal dropped on his toe.
An employee was cutting 3-inch tubing on a band saw when the employee's right thumb was pulled into the blade, amputating it.

An employee was climbing off a roof onto a ladder when his foot slipped and he fell approximately 10 feet to the ground. He broke his right ankle and sprained his left ankle, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was operating a rebar bending machine when their fingers were caught in the machine resulting in amputation of the end of the index and middle fingers.

On October 3, 2017, at approximately 10:00 a.m., an employee was descending a ladder when his lanyard became tangled around his feet. He turned and jumped approximately 13 feet, fracturing both of his heels and requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell 20 feet from a roof, breaking his lower back and ankle.
An employee was riding in the basket of a scissor lift that was rigged with a steel beam when the lift toppled over. The employee suffered four broken ribs and was hospitalized.

An employee was waiting for a crane operator to unload an I-beam from a flatbed truck. His right hand was on the load. When the material reached the ground, his middle and ring fingertips were caught and amputated between two H piles.
An employee was using a gas-powered cut-off saw when it cut the employee's arm near the elbow, requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was climbing an extension ladder that was on top of a drop cloth when the ladder slipped, causing him to fall to the hardwood floor. He fractured his right elbow and right hip.
An employee was struck by a concrete mixing truck while walking at a construction site, suffering a lower leg injury.
While performing diagnostics on a street light pole, an employee received an electrical shock and burns on both hands, the abdomen, and the shoulders.
An employee removed a six inch valve off the HF unit and received a second degree burn to the back of the neck.
An employee was walking on the job site and stepped on a rock which caused him to slip and fall resulting in a broken hip.

An employee was attempting to clear a jam from a piece of demolition equipment used to recycle and process refuse concrete when his right arm entered the point of operation. His arm tendons and arteries were severed, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was standing next to a crane truck when the crane truck touched an electric line and the employee received an electric shock.

An employee was walking across the roof of a shopping center to locate a leak when the roof and deck gave way. He fell about 15 feet to the ground on top of merchandise, breaking ribs and his C5 vertebra. He was hospitalized.

On October 4, 2017, at 3:00 p.m., an employee was using a tape measurer to measure a warehouse roof vent hole where the vent cover structure had been removed to place decking material. The tape measurer then fell onto the retrofitted drywall vent cover. The employee was trying to recover the tape measurer when the drywall collapsed and he fell 28 feet to the floor of the warehouse, fracturing his right hip, left foot, right cheek, and lumbar spine. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was coming down a crank-up scaffold when he fell approximately 25 feet to the sandy ground below. He broke his upper back shoulder bone and some ribs.
An employee was tying rope to a pole when a vehicle simultaneously pulled the other end of the rope. The employee's right index finger became entangled and amputated in the rope.
An employee lost consciousness and suffered a fractured skull at a multi-story apartment building construction site.
An employee was on the second floor of a building, making and lifting up new walls from the ground, when he slipped and fell 22 feet to the ground. He fractured his left arm and face.

An employee was moving paint from one storage area to another. He opened the door to the storage area and placed his right hand on the door for support while he bent down to pick up a bucket of paint. His right hand began to slip, causing the door to shut and trap his right ring finger between the door jam and hinge. His distal phalanx was amputated.
An employee was guiding an underground concrete pipe in a trench when the pipe fell off its cable and hit his right leg, breaking it.

On October 5, 2017, at approximately 9:00 a.m., three employees were working together to remove vinyl siding from the side walls of a residential balcony for demolition. They were working from extension ladders with hand tools. The injured employee entered the balcony from the extension ladder to look for a potential anchor location for his personal fall arrest system. When he entered the balcony, it collapsed beneath him. He landed on the ground and broke his leg.

An employee was operating a forklift truck when he extended himself out of the right side of the forklift cab and inadvertently activated the boom-down lever. The boom came down and struck him, fracturing three ribs and his rib cage.

An employee was moving a mainframe containing multiple drivers off a pallet. When the employee moved the mainframe off the pallet, it tilted. The employee tried to stop the mainframe from falling but it fell and hit the employee's right leg, breaking it. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was pulling wire using a pulley when the pulley gave way and fell 10 feet, striking the top of the employee's head. He was hospitalized.
An employee was placing belts on a pump jack when his right pinky finger was caught under the pump jack's belt, amputating the fingertip.

On 10/5/2017, at approximately 11:58 a.m., an employee was operating construction equipment when it flipped and threw the employee 100 feet from the cab. The employee suffered brain and arm injuries, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was on a haul truck trailer helping a mechanic tighten bolts. When they were finished and coming off of the trailer, the employee slipped on mud and fell to the ground, breaking an arm.
On 10/06/2017, an employee's left hand was struck by a coworker's forming hammer, amputating his middle fingertip.

An employee was using two hydraulic jacks on each side of a 36-inch pipe to create a drainage beneath the highway. The unit was under pressure when a 3-inch fragment of the jack separated and penetrated the employee's hard hat, fracturing the skull.
An employee was stepping onto a fork truck platform to retrieve equipment when he fell 22 feet to the ground, fracturing his orbital bone an suffering a concussion.

An employee was removing tin from the roof of a residential structure when he slipped and fell, grabbed the edge of the roof, lost his grip, and then fell 12 feet to the ground below. He struck the back of his head on a wall when making contact with the ground, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was operating a telehandler on a county road and moved to the shoulder to avoid oncoming traffic. The shoulder gave out and the telehandler tipped on its side into the ditch. The employee sustained two broken ribs and was hospitalized.

An employee was lifting a steel joist with two coworkers when the coworkers on the other end of the joist let their end go. The employee's right index finger was smashed under the joist, amputating it halfway below the nail.

An employee was drilling a hanger in an overhead utility chase while on an 8-foot ladder. While he was descending the ladder, it kicked out, and he fell to the concrete floor, landing on his right hip and breaking his right femur. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was cleaning a machine when the chain and sprocket amputated one of the employee's fingers.

On October 9, 2017, at approximately 10:00 a.m., a traveling crew was working on a new natural gas pipeline installation. The crew was forcefully inserting a plunger (under mechanical pressure from an excavator) into the pipeline for standard pipe cleaning when its apparatus became disconnected from the excavator and flew out, striking the injured employee in the head/face. He lost consciousness and suffered a concussion, multiple contusions, multiple abrasions, and fractures to the nose and nasal cavity. He was hospitalized.

An employee was kneeling on the ground putting bolts on a rafter while a second metal rafter was leaning on a secured larger rafter section. A gust of wind blew the leaning metal rafter onto the employee, pinning him between the rafter on the ground and the rafter that fell on top of him. He suffered a facial laceration, broken foot, and broken cheek bones.
An employee was struck by a bus while directing traffic, fracturing the left leg and collarbone and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was climbing down a ladder with a tool bag swung over his shoulder when it swung and struck him. He suffered an infection and was hospitalized.

An employee was wheeling a tool cart from one job location to another when a stack of sheetrock that was leaning vertically against the wall toppled over and landed on the employee, fracturing his right wrist and seven right-side ribs.
At a construction site, an employee fell from a ladder broke his pelvis.
An employee was installing peel and stick underlay material on a roof when his foot became tangled in the material and he fell 12 to 15 feet, breaking his ribs.
An employee was laying sod and spreading grass seed at the construction site. He complained of chest pains and numbness in his arm. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was standing next to his truck in a work zone when he was struck by a drunk driver, suffering multiple head, neck, and back injuries.
An employee was operating a metal folding machine when the machine closed on her hands, amputating both thumb tips.

An employee was cleaning a spray gun. He had mineral spirits in the gun and was adjusting the spray tip when the gun shot the mineral spirits into the skin on one of his fingers. The finger was surgically removed and the employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell 18-20 feet through an uncovered hole in the roof while helping to install HVAC equipment. The employee was hospitalized for a facial fracture.

An employee was operating a tar truck on the highway and noticed a problem with the equipment. He exited the cab of the vehicle and noticed a large amount of hot tar coming from the valve of the equipment. He slipped on the tar and fell to the ground, contacting the 240-degree tar. He received burns on his hands and back.

An employee was working from a 20-foot scaffold and cleaning a pipe system when the hook of a come-a-long tool that was holding the pipe hit the upper side of his right leg, cutting the soft tissue. He was hospitalized.

An employee was on the second floor of a job site, which had a safety rail system around the perimeter. He was bending over to pick up a piece of wire mesh when he lost his balance and grabbed for the safety rail. One of the uprights then detached, allowing him to fall to the first floor (concrete). He broke his right leg.
An employee's glove and left hand became caught in a rotary hammer, amputating a finger.
An employee was working on 46-inch high stilts inside a building. The floor was slippery and dirty, and the employee slipped and fell. He injured his right hip and was hospitalized.
An employee was bending down and cleaning out a box when a piece of angle iron fell on his left ring finger, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was removing hot tar from a hot pipe and placing it in a lugger when the wire broke, causing the lugger to fall on the employee. He received burns to the left side of his face, his left arm, and the back of his neck.
An employee was paving forms for sidewalks when his small left finger was smashed and fractured by a piston on a material loader.

An employee was working at a height of approximately 14 feet when he detached his fall protection system to move from one spot to another and fell to the lower level. He punctured a lung and broke two ribs and his right ankle. He was hospitalized.

A crew was preparing to load a spool onto a trailer to spool up flex-pipe. An employee was trying to guide the center spool shaft into the trailer guide so he could place the guide-pin into the spool shaft when the spool shifted, trapping his left middle finger between the center spool and the guide place. His fingertip was partially amputated.
An employee was bending a pipe with a metal punch when the punch amputated his left index fingertip.
An employee was changing a beam on a skid steer using a hammer when a chip of steel broke loose and punctured the employee's left arm, requiring surgery and hospitalization.

An employee was servicing a boiler at a client location. The employee was removing the belt from the motor on the outside of the boiler when the boiler started up, causing the power transmission belt to grab his finger and pull it into the ingoing nip point between the belt and pulley, amputating the tip of his left middle finger. The boiler was not locked out at the time.

Employees were offloading pipes from an 18-wheeler and laying them on the ground. The operator dropped the load too soon, and the pipes struck an employee's left leg, breaking the tibia in two places.

An employee was on a ladder removing overhead sprinkler piping with a reciprocating saw when the employee fell from the ladder to the concrete floor, suffering head trauma that required hospitalization.
An employee was loading an A-frame when it fell on his legs and then feet. He was hospitalized and had foot surgery.
An employee was loading tempered glass one piece at a time when a stack of 10 panels fell on the employee. The employee suffered a fractured pelvis.

An employee was using an auger to dig a hole for a sign. The auger bit went down approximately 3.5 feet when it reached clay soil, which pulled the auger down toward the ground. The employee's right middle fingertip was then caught and amputated between the auger handle and the sidewalk.
An employee fell from a 6-foot stepladder and hit the floor, suffering a compound fracture to the right forearm that required hospitalization and surgery. The stepladder was not braced at the time.

On October 16, 2017, at 12:15, an employee was laying roofing material when he suffered a cramp, lost his balance, and fell 5 feet onto the roof, fracturing multiple back vertebrae. He was hospitalized.

On October 17, 2017, three employees were testing the voltage of electrical equipment that was not labeled as high voltage during Hurricane Maria operations when an arc flash occurred. One of the employees suffered burns that required hospitalization.
An employee was performing residential framing when a telehandler knocked the employee down and ran over the employee's right leg.
An employee was walking down a hill after clearing trees when he slipped and landed on a tree stub. The stub punctured his buttock and required hospitalization.

An employee was disconnecting two adjoining 4" hoses from a slurry pump when he was splashed by residual hot material left in the hose after a cavitation. He suffered burns to his leg and arm, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was positioning cords bar to start roofing work when he stepped on a power cord, slipped, and fell 20 feet to the ground. He injured his back and was hospitalized.

On 10/17/2017, an employee was disassembling scaffolding and unbolted a section of the tower using wrenches. As he started to climb down, he grabbed the loose section of the tower and it gave way. He then fell about 12 feet to ground, fracturing a vertebra and both heels.
An employee was digging a hole near a broken electrical panel when he made contact with the panel, suffering a 1-inch cut on his left pinky finger. He was hospitalized.

An employee was attempting to remove a manhole lid when it slipped and pinched his left middle finger between the lid and the manhole rim. Skin was removed from his finger (no bone or fingernail loss).

An employee was doing preventative maintenance at a 480-volt motor control center. He was holding a screwdriver in his hand while tightening connections and cleaning at the line side of the breaker when an arc flash occurred. He suffered second degree burns to both hands.

An employee was standing and supervising the take-down of a pole and lines when the pole cracked, broke in half, and fell toward the employee. The employee avoided being struck by the pole but fell to the ground, suffering broken ribs, a broken pelvis, and a collapsed lung.

An employee was using a shackle to rig a beam plate. The shackle shifted and caught the employee's left ring finger, pinching and partially amputating the fingertip between the shackle and the steel beam plate.

An employee was using a circular saw to cut a 2-inch by 8-inch piece of lumber on a saw horse. When he finished the cut, the saw's guard did not retract into the safe position. The blade then lacerated his right outer thigh, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was helping place a vault into an excavation when the chain moved. The employee sustained a fractured vertebra, an ear laceration, fractured neck and a possible dislocated shoulder.

On October 18, 2017, at approximately 9:55 a.m., an employee was working on a planned outage and ascending a white pine tree scheduled to be removed. He was in the tree at a height of approximately 59 feet when he inadvertently unhooked the wrong safety strap and fell 68 feet to the sloped ground below. He suffered a partial lung collapse, four fractured ribs, a small cut to the right eyelid, and a hairline fracture to the left leg.

An employee was troubleshooting a golf cart that he uses to travel around the site. The employee reached into the engine compartment to manipulate the starter belt. When he pulled on the belt, stored energy was released and pulled his right index finger into a pinch point between the belt and pulley. He suffered an injury to his finger that resulted in amputation of tissue above his knuckle.
While working from a ladder to mark dimensions on a truck, an employee fell from the ladder and injured the right and left wrists and left ankle.
An employee was standing on the second or third rung of a ladder and using a drill overhead to make a hole for a vent when he hit the back of his head on concrete, suffering a concussion.
While descending a scaffold ladder, an employee fell 15 feet from around the second tier of the scaffold to the ground, suffering a hip fracture and concussion.
An employee was on a roof using a power saw to cut two-by-fours at a 45-degree angle when the saw slipped and cut his right leg.
An employee was unclogging a paint sprayer when it fired while his finger was at the end of the nozzle. The paint/toxin was injected into his left index finger, lacerating it.

An employee was moving an I-beam by rolling it. The I-beam rolled faster than anticipated, so the employee attempted to grab it. At that point, his finger was pinched between two beams. He lost the end of his finger.

An employee was helping another employee move lead-containing sheet rock with a dolly when the lead-containing sheet rock fell on the employee's right ankle and fractured it. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell to the floor while cutting a metal panel, suffering a fractured wrist that required hospitalization.

An employee slipped while attempting to board a skid steer. The employee's left foot was then caught between the bucket and the frame of the skid steer, breaking the left ankle. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee tripped and fell down the stairs, breaking his neck.
An employee was on a step ladder working on a soffit and fascia when he fell off the step ladder and landed on a sprinkler head. The sprinkler head punctured his intestines and stomach.
An employee made contact with an overhead powerline while working with a well point injection. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a scissor lift when a steel beam swung and struck the employee and the lift. The scissor lift tipped over, and the employee fell 10 feet to the concrete floor, suffering a fractured hip and pelvis.
An employee was climbing a concrete form wall when the wall shifted. The employee then fell about 6 feet to the ground, breaking ribs and requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell to the ground at a construction site, breaking his left leg.

An employee had just rigged up a 3/4" thick plate (10'x 6') with a single hook chain. The chain was choked through a hole in the center of one edge of the plate. The employee was standing near the plate while an equipment operator was raising the plate with an excavator. The chain came loose, and the one edge of the plate that was 2.5" in the air came down on the employee's toes resulting in amputation of two toes.

An employee used a collapsible ladder to access a roof. After setting up the ladder and checking it for stability, he began to climb up the ladder. He reached the roofline and began transitioning to the roof when the ladder began sliding underneath his feet. He began sliding with the ladder, and his legs went between the ladder's rungs. He then fell backwards, landing on his back on top of the ladder and fracturing his T-12 vertebra.
An employee climbed a pole to work on an order when the pole fell over. The employee also fell to the ground, and the pole landed on his legs. He fractured his back.

On October 23, 2017, employees were cutting cross frames and a girder as part of the demolition process for a bridge. While torch cutting the girder, one employee connected his personal fall arrest system to a beam clamp that was connected to the tail section of the existing girder. The tail section was supposed to remain in place when the rest of the girder was dropped. After the employees finished cutting the girder, the tail section fell from its bearing and pulled the employee approximately 13 feet to the ground. He suffered a broken wrist and back injury.

An employee was bulldozing parallel to a hill while installing an oil and gas pipeline on a 32-degree slope when the bulldozer tracks made contact with two large sandstone rocks. The bulldozer became unstable and rolled over. The employee suffered rib fractures and a dislocated shoulder, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was standing three rungs up on an open step ladder using a pry bar to pry plywood off from studs when the pry bar slipped. He then lost his balance and fell to the ground, fracturing his left hip/femur.

An employee was installing an overhead electrical power line. The tool the employee was using contacted the ground creating a direct short. The employee was hospitalized for electrical flash burns to the face.

An employee was operating a roll groover to press a groove into the ends of pipe for coupling purposes. He was checking the depth of the groove with his right index finger when it was caught in the point of operation, amputating it between the first and second knuckle.
An employee slipped while stepping down out of the cab of his paving truck. He fell to the ground and broke his hip.

An employee was helping a heavy equipment operator move a joint of pipe by holding a tag line. As he was walking with the pipe, he stepped on a rock and lost his balance, falling onto and breaking his right leg. He had surgery.
An employee was operating a slitter machine when the employee's right hand was caught in the machine, causing an amputation to the little finger.

An employee was cleaning a battery-powered caulk gun with gasoline when the employee bumped the trigger. The gasoline then ignited the employee's shirt sleeve and pant leg, and the employee received burns on the right arm and upper right ankle.
An employee was sealing highway asphalt when he tripped, fell, and dropped a hot asphalt sealer can. The hot asphalt spilled on and burned his left hand, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was helping an elevator mechanic install an elevator when his left index finger was caught and amputated in the pulley.

An employee was placing a wooden 2x4 between steel roadway grates when the employee's right hand was caught between two grates, fracturing two fingers and causing tendon damage and an amputation to the first knuckle of the right ring finger.

An employee was using a 10 lb. sledgehammer to secure pins to a metal form. As he was striking the last pin, the sledgehammer struck the small digit on his left hand, removing his fingernail and amputating the tip.

An employee was cutting a bag liner to relieve the water pressure when the bag filled with hot water and ruptured. The hot water covered the employee, causing second degree burns to 40 percent of his body.

Employees were troubleshooting an elevator. The injured employee opened the overhead hatch and climbed halfway out onto the ladder to attempt to toggle some switches. Another employee hit the up arrow and the elevator moved crushing the injured employee's right arm between the ladder and the elevator resulting in a fractured and punctured arm. The interlock switch was damaged and did not work allowing the elevator to move with the overhead hatch open.

An employee was on a work platform helping a coworker weld a brace in place on a structure when the platform tipped. He lost his balance and then fell approximately 10 feet, suffering a liver laceration, minor concussion, and broken wrist.
An employee fell 20 feet while supervising employees installing a ridge cap on a metal building, fracturing his left hip and right elbow.
An employee was working on a ladder when it slipped. The employee then fell to the ground, suffering a left shoulder injury. The ladder was unsecured at the time.
An employee fell approximately 7 feet to the ground while descending a fixed ladder from a roof, fracturing the left leg.

An employee was inspecting work performed during the construction of a water tower. He was trying to remove a manhole cover when it slid off his hand and caught his left index finger, partially amputating his fingertip.

An employee fell 20 feet off a roof while installing fiber optic cabling, suffering two fractured hips, a broken collarbone, and multiple other broken bones. The employee was hospitalized. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was drilling holes in a metal angle piece when the metal angle slipped and his glove became wrapped up in the drill bit, severing a finger.

An employee was sheeting a roof on a single-story residence when the wind caught the sheeting. He then lost his balance and fell approximately 10 feet to the ground, breaking his wrist and suffering a concussion.
An employee was standing in an area waiting for a crane to put an H-beam in place when the H-beam struck and broke the employee's right leg.
On October 26, 2017, at about 7:30 a.m., an employee was bent on the ground popping a chalk line when a scissor lift struck the employee. The employee suffered a broken right femur.
An employee was removing the barrel from a fire hydrant. As he removed the barrel, a pinch point was created. His left ring finger was caught in the pinch point, amputating his fingertip.

An employee climbed a ladder to put foam on a window. He was stepping onto a 2" x 4" that was on the edge of the window when the board slipped and he fell 20 feet to the ground. He broke seven ribs and possibly an arm.
An employee fell 12 to 15 feet from a ladder to the ground below and hit his head on a drain pipe. The employee lost consciousness and had a cracked rib.
An employee was working with a hammer to remove wall ties when a drill was dropped from the next level up, striking him on his hard hat and causing neck and shoulder injuries.
An employee was working from a scaffold and fell approximately three feet, sustaining a head injury that required surgery.

An employee was operating a soil boring tool and lifting it out of a 36-inch deep trench. As he was preparing to place the tool on the ground, he lost his grip on it. The tool dropped to the ground, and his left middle finger was caught between the falling tool and the concrete sidewalk, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was driving an electric maintenance cart. While making a left turn, her leg hit a bollard, breaking it.

An employee was on a scaffold connecting ductile iron pipe in a water treatment plant. The employee had to remove a side rail from the scaffold to gain access to the pipe. The employee lost his balance and fell approximately 15 feet onto pipes that were below. The employee sustained injury to their L1, L2, and L3 discs, which had to be fused.

On October 28, 2017, an employee was standing on a scaffold spray painting, when he leaned over the scaffold's top rail, lost his balance, and fell approximately 8 feet to the concrete floor. He suffered a skull fracture, broken collarbone, broken elbow, broken ribs, punctured lung, and broken ear drum.
An employee was pulling a cable for a tower operation when his right little finger was caught and amputated between the cable and a handrail.

An employee was standing on the back of a pickup truck when an unknown person jumped in the vehicle and drove off. The employee was ejected from the pickup truck and sustained severe head injuries after hitting the concrete road.

An employee was removing loose shingles and debris from the corner of a roof when debris shifted underneath him causing him to fall 30 feet to the ground. He was admitted to the hospital with a broken left forearm.
An employee was disconnecting old wiring in an attic when the employee stepped onto a false board meant for drywall support and fell 12 feet through the ceiling to the floor, suffering a back injury.
An employee fell at work and fractured her hip.
An employee was using a router to groove the end of a piece of flooring when the router cut and amputated his right pinky finger. The router was guarded at the time.
An employee was cutting metal pipe with a portable saw. The saw kicked back and the handle struck the employee on the lower lip and chin.

A crew was removing trees from a drainage swale using chainsaws and a small excavator. The excavator was moving a tree limb when one end of the limb became stuck in the ground. As the excavator advanced, the limb bent until it suddenly released, springing forward and striking two employees. One of the employees was struck in the leg, requiring hospitalization and possible surgery.

Employees were erecting a large tent. The first column bent was put in place using a forklift. Once the column bent was released from the forklift, the column bent fell and struck the injured employee who was on all fours resulting in non-displaced fractured lower vertebrae, broken ribs and head injuries.

An employee was nailing shingles on a roof using a nail gun when the nail gun hose became caught. When the employee went to nail the shingle, the nail gun pulled back and the nail shot into his right knee.

An employee was walking in the lower level of a building while other employees were removing a section of temporary office wall. Wall debris fell and struck the employee, who suffered fractures to the upper and lower left leg.
An employee was removing a guardrail post. His hand was on a 16-inch bolt when a piece of equipment began to remove it. The bolt bent on his index finger, which had to be amputated to the knuckle.

An employee was standing on an outrigger. He was accessing the super structure of the outrigger when he fell approximately 9 feet to the ground, fracturing his right shoulder and detaching a shoulder muscle.

An employee was threading banding over the top of a coil and passing it between the coil and coil car when the turnstile moved. The employee's hand was then caught between the coil car and coil, smashing the hand and wrist and fracturing a finger.
An employee was working on a building roof when he fell through a weak area of the roof and hit the ground, injuring his tailbone. Fall protection was not worn at the time.

An employee was moving steel reinforcing rods and associated supports with a skid steer when one of the employee's right-hand fingers was caught and crushed between a steel rod and the skid steer's grapple arm.

Employees were laying rebar when a gust of wind rolled an unsecured vapor barrier around three of the employees, causing them to fall to the ground. One of the employee's suffered a skull fracture and required hospitalization.
An employee was drilling a piece of metal when a part became stuck. When it came loose, it pulled the employee's glove and arm into the drill press. The employee suffered a broken arm.
An employee fell from a ladder while installing insulation, fracturing a thumb and requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was stepping off a tractor, missed the last step and fell onto their hip breaking it. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was carrying a sheet of drywall when he knocked over a bucket of drywall compound, causing the contents to spill onto the floor. He then fell and struck the floor, fracturing his knee.

While working in the factory/warehouse, an employee observed a trash truck that was dropping off a 20- to 30-yard roll-off dumpster. He noticed some pallets in the area that he thought needed to be moved and yelled at the driver to stop. The driver stopped, but only to release the chain to free the dumpster so it could be positioned. The driver did not hear the employee and proceeded to make the drop. The employee attempted to get up from the area but was struck by the dumpster. He was caught between the dumpster and the loading dock, fracturing his right tibia.
An employee was positioning drill rods on a high, flat trailer when he lost his footing and fell to a lower level, breaking his arm and wrist. He was hospitalized.
An employee was on a ladder working on a gutter when the gutter hit him in the head. He then jumped off the ladder to the ground, breaking his heel.
An employee was struck on the chest and face by a concrete pump truck hose when the pump operator started the pump.
An employee was pressure testing a fire pump. As the pump was pressurized, a fitting blew off and struck him on the head.

An employee was assembling a log splitter. He was putting on a sling choker for a log splitter beam when another beam rolled forward and severely cut and crushed his right finger between the two beams. The last digit of his right finger was amputated.

An employee was working from an aerial lift basket installing conduit tabs on structural steel when the employee was caught between a structural steel beam and the control panel of the lift. The employee suffered facial fractures and was hospitalized.

On 11/2/17, an employee was driving a stringing truck that was carrying two joints of pipe when the truck struck a guardrail, causing the truck to rollover.  The operator was hospitalized with fractured vertebrae, a fractured nose and a fractured occipital bone.

An employee was on-site performing scheduled preventative maintenance tasks in the building. He was attempting to break a pipe union on an external rear blow-down line to check it for obstructions when scalding water spontaneously released from inside the boiler and exited the pipe cleanout port, which had its cap removed. He sustained first, second, and third degree burns on his legs, the right side of his torso, and his right arm.
An employee was inspecting a foundation when he tripped over the string line surrounding the foundation layout, fracturing his right leg and requiring hospitalization.
On November 3, 2017, an employee was rip sawing a board when it kicked back and amputated the employee's fingertip.
An employee was unloading a material storage cabinet on wheels when the cabinet fell over and landed on the employee's leg, breaking the femur.
An employee was transporting a structural steel roll on a cart when it tipped over. The structural steel then rolled back and crushed his toes on the right foot. He was hospitalized.
An employee was using a power tool when the tool cut his leg.

An employee was pushing a cart loaded with 4 steel columns that had plates at the end. A plate on the ground hit and pushed another column inside the cart. The employee's left pinky finger was caught between the plate and the cart, crushing it and amputating his fingertip.

An employee was monitoring the loading of a railcar when he noticed a vent was leaking. He tried to close the secondary valve to isolate the leak. He put his safety harness on and pulled a probe up to close the valve and isolate the leak. When he pulled the probe up, he heard a pop. The vent hose blew off, spraying him with acetic acid. He suffered first and second degree burns to his lower legs and feet, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was working near a boring machine when the employee's hand was caught between a rotating pipe and cable. The employee suffered four finger amputations and a broken arm.

An employee was trying to access the roof from a ladder when he fell off and hit the ground, breaking his ankle.  The ladder did not extend 3 feet above the access point and was not tied to any structure at the time.
An employee was moving equipment at a trade show. The equipment fell off the forklift and crushed the employee's foot. The employee sustained a right ankle fracture.
On 11/4/2017, an employee was dismounting a bulldozer when the employee's right foot slipped. The employee then made hard contact with the ground, breaking the tibia and fibula above the right ankle.

An employee was cutting on a column and began to cut into a pipe with a torch. When the torch cut through the pipe, diesel (residual fuel) splashed back onto his body. He sustained burns to his right arm, left wrist, and the right side of his face, requiring hospitalization and surgery. PPE was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was stepping down into an excavation when he fractured his tibia.
An employee was approximately 6 feet up an 8-foot ladder when the employee lost footing and tried to grab a ceiling grid for support. The employee then fell, breaking a wrist.
An employee was carrying a 4X4 in an alleyway when he tripped and fell, breaking his right lower leg.

An employee was working from a 6-foot portable step ladder when he lost his balance and fell to the floor. He suffered a dislocated finger, fractured vertebrae, and a fractured skull, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was checking a truck out of the site and gave the driver his manifest ticket. The employee turned around to go to a guard shack. The truck driver may have turned his wheels too tight and ended up striking the employee's legs with the truck's rear tires. The employee suffered soft tissue injuries.

On November 7, 2017, an employee was using a chop/miter saw to cut a section of roll material when the saw kicked back and caused his left thumb to contact the blade. He suffered a deep cut to his thumb and was hospitalized.

An employee was at the rear-end of a forklift, trying to see why the forklift was caught on an I-beam. The I-beam fell and pinned the employee's leg, breaking bones and causing a contusion. He was hospitalized.
An employee was shocked while installing suspended light fixtures.
An employee was tugging on a jack when he cut his finger, requiring hospitalization.

A digger derrick operator was positioning the boom off the back of a truck. He got out of the operator's chair and stepped onto the walk platform to the back of the truck to get a better view of the placement of the anchor and to instruct the ground man. He lost his footing and fell off the back of the truck resulting in a broken left elbow, a broken right wrist and facial lacerations.

An employee was preparing to stow an auger drive shaft. To prevent the drive shaft from dragging on the ground, the employee planned to have the shaft tucked under a boom and temporarily tied off in an elevated position. Overhead obstructions prevented the employee from raising the boom and moving forward. To get the drive shaft into position, the employee stood to the side of the boom and had just started to pull the drive shaft toward the back of the truck when the boom was lowered. The tip of the drive shaft then contacted the employees foot, injuring the big and second toes and requiring surgery.

An employee was repairing a sectional garage door that had been hit by a motor vehicle and knocked partially out of its tracks. The bottom section of the door flexed, causing the rollers to come back out of the track. When this happened, the bottom two panels came out of the track and shot upwards, striking the underside of the employee's arm and knocking him off his ladder. He dislocated his shoulder.
An employee suffered a foot fracture while running from the scene of an accident in an interstate work zone.
An employee was walking behind a milling machine when it unexpectedly moved backwards and struck the employee. The employee suffered fractures to the right foot and ankle.

An employee was working on a pump truck when a gear cylinder engaged unexpectedly. Both of the employee's hands were caught in the belt pulley, resulting in amputations of three fingers from each hand.

An employee was identifying whips to ensure they were not hot and then ohming them out. When he tested the last one, electricity jumped across his hands, causing third degree burns that required hospitalization.

An employee was attempting to install a ship's ladder into a ceiling opening. He was leaning into the hole from the roof and using a cable come-a-long to hoist the ladder up to the opening. The hoist then slipped, causing the ladder to fall and pull the employee down 10 feet through the opening. He landed on the ladder, breaking his left leg and seven ribs.

On November 8, 2017, around 10:50 a.m., an employee was moving out of a man basket onto a housing unit to prepare it for rigging when he stepped on ice and fell 15 feet onto the dirt below. He was hospitalized with a fractured ankle and back.

An employee was working from a ladder, installing a header/beam and form board/plywood, when he suffered a cramp in his lower back, which caused his leg to fall asleep. He then fell from the ladder onto protruding pieces of unguarded steel/rebar, impaling his thigh.
On November 10, 2017, an employee was installing carpet when he attempted to move an A-frame cart with 33 large sheets of hardboard. The cart then tilted and fell on him, fracturing his right leg.
An employee fell off a ladder raised to the second story of a house, fracturing his back.
An employee had loosened two bolts on an isolation plug and was working on the third one when the employee suffered fractured ribs and a collapsed lung.
Two employees were discussing job tasks when they began arguing and shoving one another. One employee pushed the other employee, who fell backwards to the ground, injuring her neck, back, and foot.

An employee was conducting layout with a coworker. The injured employee was walking to move some construction material that was in the pathway of the layout. On the way back to his instrument, he walked behind a dump truck that was being loaded. As the operator attempted to place a load of concrete into the dump truck, a piece of the concrete missed the dump truck and fell, striking the employee on the top of the hard hat. The employee suffered concussion symptoms.
An employee was installing roof trusses on a new building. While standing on a masonry concrete wall, he fell 12 feet to the ground, injuring his spleen, ribs, and right leg. He was hospitalized.

On November 11, 2017, an employee was working on the fourth rung of a 10-foot step ladder, attempting to secure polyethylene plastic to an inside wall opening for weather protection. The employee  reached and grabbed a threaded rod protruding from the concrete ceiling to aid in stability while performing a stapling task. The threaded rod unexpectedly detached from the ceiling anchor and caused the employee to lose balance and fall from the ladder to the cement floor. The employee suffered a fractured leg, dislocated ankle, and torn tendons, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing rebar when adjacent rebar fell and hit the employee, who suffered bruises and a broken arm.
An employee was using a pneumatic nail gun when it went off and shot him in the leg.
An employee was welding and installing an economizer for a boiler from a temporary elevated work platform when he fell approximately 15 feet to the concrete floor, fracturing his pelvis.

An employee was picking up scrap and loose material when another employee swung some aluminum angle flashing and struck the first employee, who suffered a lower left neck laceration. The injured employee was hospitalized.
An employee was standing on the side of the highway when he was struck by a passing vehicle's side mirror. The employee was admitted to the hospital for facial surgery.
Two employees where painting in a scissor lift when they fell. The first employee fell on his back while the second employee fell face down on the floor. Both were hospitalized.

On November 14, 2017, at approximately 10:40 AM, an employee fell while disassembling a work platform at a height of over 6 feet. The employee suffered a cracked L5 vertebra and bruising to the chest and shoulders, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was attempting to repair a refrigeration unit when he fell approximately 12 feet to the ground from either a ladder or the top of the refrigeration unit. He suffered broken ribs and was hospitalized.
An employee was standing outside of an excavator in a gore area worksite when a vehicle lost control and left the roadway, striking the employee. The employee was hospitalized with a head injury.
An employee was descending a ladder when he lost his footing and fell, breaking his leg and injuring his right-hand fingers.
An employee was spraying what's called a "hot box," a process of strutting rubber. While spraying, there was a flash fire that caused second degree burns to his right hand and forearm.

An employee was looking for a leak in a water main. He was walking on the pipe when he slipped and bumped his head on a trench box. His back also hit the pipe. He suffered head and back injuries, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was operating a mortar mixer on a construction site when his right hand entered the mixer's moving parts, amputating two fingers. The mixer was unguarded at the time.

An employee was working inside an elevator shaft when the elevator button was pressed, causing the elevator to descend. He was trying to step out of the shaft when the elevator landed on his back, fracturing his vertebra.

An employee was guiding a bundle of scaffolding equipment into the bed of a truck when the scaffolding shifted. The employee's right fifth finger was then caught and partially amputated between the scaffolding racks.
An employee tripped over the edge of a box scraper attachment and fell landing on top of the loader attachment. The employee sustained a head laceration and a broken collarbone.
An employee was cleaning up a site when a sheet of plywood fell on his head. He was hospitalized with a head injury.

An employee was in an aerial lift using a chain fall to plumb a steel column and set a row of purlins when the lift's rise button was activated. His head was then caught between a purlin and the lift at a height of 13 feet. He suffered a laceration above his left eyebrow, a cut to his lower lip, and a hairline fracture to his cheekbone.

On November 16, at approximately 11:00 AM, an employee was using a table saw to cut the edge off a board when the blade amputated two of the employee's fingertips to the first knuckle. The saw was unguarded at the time.

On November 16, 2017, an employee was descending a 6-foot step ladder when he lost his footing, slipped, and fell approximately 2 feet from a lower rung to the concrete deck below, fracturing his right tibia and fibula.

An employee was part of a crew that was placing stop bars, turn arrows, and crosswalks at an intersection. A vehicle entered the work zone and struck the thermoplastic handliner, which the crew was using to apply the roadway markings. The handliner is a small hand machine that uses molten thermoplastic (430 degrees F) to produce the markings. The impact of the vehicle on the handliner caused the molten material to splatter onto the injured employee, who suffered burns to the neck, right side of the face, and right ear.
An employee dropped a granite countertop and suffered a back injury, requiring hospitalization.

An employee dumped a load of gravel material from the dump truck he was driving. After he dumped the load, he drove off to a speed of approximately 45 mph with the truck bed erected. He began driving under a bridge when the elevated bed struck the lower part of the bridge and caused the truck to flip and land on its side. He suffered a broken nose, facial fractures, and a broken ankle.
An employee was conducting re-roofing work while tied off to his harness when he slipped and fell 12.5 feet to the ground, fracturing both heels. He was hospitalized.

An employee was installing material strap while standing on the third step of a 6-foot ladder when the employee lost balance and fell to the floor. The employee suffered a punctured lung and broken rib, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was preparing to strip a column by attaching it to a crane when the column struck and fractured the employee's pelvis. The column's pins were knocked out at the time of the incident.

An employee was using a jack hammer to remove concrete at a job site. The employee rested the jack hammer against some pipes while he used a shovel to remove debris. The jack hammer slid off the pipe, striking and crushing the employee's left middle finger, which had to be surgically amputated.
An employee lost balance while pouring concrete in a paving machine. The employee's hand was then caught in the machine, amputating a finger.

An employee was attempting to jump onto the running boards of a pickup truck that was starting to leave the parking area when he fell off the running board. The pickup truck then ran over and fractured his leg.
An employee was helping to guide a beam into place when the beam slipped, catching the employee between it and a forklift. The employee suffered chest contusions.
An employee was setting frames when a frame gave way and struck him, injuring his back and requiring surgery.
An employee was on the metal edge of a roof when his knee rolled over and he lost his balance and fell to the ground resulting in broken ribs.
An employee was attempting to release a skid steer bucket when he fell and broke his left ankle.

An employee was attempting to kneel on the upper deck of a crane to communicate with his coworker in a lower section while they moved the crane. He fell from the crane onto the ground, fracturing his right wrist and forearm and dislocating his arm.

An employee was overseeing another employee who was removing a pipe cap when the pipe cap exploded off the pipe and struck the first employee's torso. The employee suffered broken ribs and a torn esophagus.

An engineer was working with an estimator at a customer site. The engineer was climbing a ladder when a foot slipped and the engineer fell about three feet to the ground resulting in a broken left arm and hospitalization.

While installing a waterline connection, an aluminum trench box weighing 400 lbs. was removed so the legs could be adjusted. A mini excavator was used to tilt and hold the box while the leg pins were removed. The excavator operator set the box back down on all four legs and the legs pushed up inside the box causing it to fall over and strike one of the employees on his lower body resulting in a broken pelvis.

An employee was wearing gloves while using a rag and flammable solvent to clean dust and debris from a roofing lap. He lit a cigarette with a disposable lighter, which ignited the solvent on his gloves and caused burns to both hands.
An employee was using a circular saw and lacerated his right middle and index fingers. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting concrete with a cut-off saw when the saw kicked back and hit the employee's face, causing a laceration.
