An employee was walking between a truck and a cement truck when the cement truck ran over and crushed his right foot. His foot had to be amputated.
An employee was using a hammer drill to install drywall when he lost control of the drill and broke his leg.
An employee was climbing a ladder to conduct roof maintenance when the ladder slipped. The employee lost balance and fell, suffering a fractured scapula, rib, and pelvis.
An employee suffered an injury while pulling a pole butt on a concrete metering pedestal that leaned over and pinned him. He sustained rib and back injuries that required hospitalization.

On November 24, 2017, an employee picked up a piece of plywood that was covering a hole on a roof. The plywood was not marked as a hole. He stepped forward and fell through the hole to the ground, breaking his elbow and pelvis and suffering a brain bruise and concussion. He was hospitalized.

An employee was installing siding on a house's exterior wall while standing on an 8-foot A-frame ladder. He was attempting to step onto another 8-foot A-frame ladder when one of the ladders fell. He then fell 6 feet to the ground and hit his head on the ladder's leg. He was hospitalized with a laceration and fracture to the head.

An employee was painting while standing on an A-frame ladder. He slipped while stepping onto the ladder's third step. One foot stayed within the ladder while the rest of his body fell back. His back right leg landed on the floor while his left leg was stuck in the ladder. He suffered numbness in the saddle region along the medical aspect of his left thigh.

On November 27, 2017, at approximately 1:45 p.m., employees were replacing bad decking and roofing. Materials were torn off and handed to the injured employee, who then placed the materials in a cart and transported them to a chute. He was receiving materials when he tripped and fell into an area where the decking was bad. He fell 60 feet to the floor below, fracturing his left leg.
An employee was removing a test ball from a manhole. An excavator was lifting the test ball when it struck the employee's head, fracturing vertebrae in his neck.
An employee was installing an overhead electrical conductor when he strained his chest, requiring hospitalization. A pull strap was not used at the time of the incident.
An employee was moving a bundle of decking when he fell 26 feet, fracturing his head. He was hospitalized.
An employee was helping another employee move steel beams when the beams injured his left hand, causing lacerations and broken bones.

While standing on a ladder and installing light fixtures, an employee touched live wires and was thrown from the ladder. The employee suffered a fractured tailbone from the fall and electrical burns to the right thumb and left shoulder from the live wires.

On November 28, 2017, at approximately 11:00 a.m., an employee was installing telephone service in the basement of a residential customer. He was standing on the second rung of a fiberglass step ladder when one of the ladder hinges buckled, causing him to fall to the basement floor. He fractured his tibia and fibula, requiring surgery.
An employee was on stairs applying insulation above his head when he lost his balance and fell, hitting a protruding pipe and breaking his left hip.
On November 29, 2017, at approximately 9:15 a.m., an employee was repositioning his climbing line when he fell 50 feet from a tree and fractured his right leg, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was performing framing operations when he tripped and then fell against a wooden midrail. The midrail broke and he fell approximately 12 feet to the ground, lacerating his head and bruising a shoulder.
An employee slipped and fell while descending a ladder, sustaining broken ribs.
An employee was removing metal stake truck bed side gates when he tripped over the gates on the ground, dislocating his right hip and fracturing his right leg.

Employees were standing on the median edge of an interstate lane's inside shoulder, removing traffic control barrels. They were behind the guardrail when a private vehicle lost control and struck another vehicle, which left the road and hit two employees. One employee was hospitalized with a broken leg, broken finger, and head laceration. The employee had surgery.
An employee was bolting a 20" pipe when the restrainer gave way and released the pipe cap. The pipe then struck and fractured the employee's left hip socket.

An employee was climbing a ladder when it fell, causing the employee to ride it to the ground. The employee suffered a broken hip and jaw. The ladder was not 3 feet above the roof edge or tied off at the time of the incident.
An employee was on a roof during construction work when the employee fell through a removed section of the roof. The employee suffered broken ribs and a back injury.
On November 30, 2017, an employee was laying down a single person lift to move through a doorway when he lost his grip. The lift fell on and broke his leg.
An employee was installing a pipe into a drainage structure when his thumb was caught and amputated between the pipe and structure.
An employee was helping to position a barrier when both of his feet were struck by a concrete barrier, amputating three digits on his left foot and two digits on his right foot.

A crane was lowering a concrete plank onto the first floor of a work site while an employee was providing direction (by radio) to the crane operator. The concrete plank hit a plumbing-up cable for steel and bounced back, coming toward the employee. He then fell approximately 15 feet from the first floor to the dirt floor below, injuring his hip and breaking some ribs.
An employee was using a miter saw to cut a baseboard when the saw amputated the employee's pinky finger and partially amputated the ring and middle fingers.
An employee was maneuvering a boom truck when the vehicle tipped over on its side and ejected the employee, who suffered a dislocated wrist.

An employee was 11 feet up on an extension ladder, installing straps into a window opening, when the ladder moved. He lost his balance and fell off the ladder, landing over the ladder on the ground. He fractured his right leg.

Two employees were moving a scissor lift from the third level to the fourth when another employee's head became pinned between a concrete beam and the top rail of the lift. The injured employee sustained multiple contusions to the chin, cheek bones, nose, temple and eye sockets.

On December 1, 2017, an employee was insulating an HVAC system in an attic when the employee stepped onto a foam panel and fell through the ceiling, lacerating and breaking a wrist. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was walking across a job site looking for rebar when he tried to get on a 15-inch-high concrete slab. He then tripped and fell on the edge of the slab, which had a bolt sticking out of it, fracturing four ribs and lacerating his chest.

An employee was diagnosing a problem with a bump truck's steering. His left hand was between a stationary object and the steering components when a second employee rotated the steering wheel. The employee's left hand was crushed, suffering swelling.
An employee was moving material and stacking it in piles when a wood splinter punctured his glove and thumb. He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was exiting the excavator when his foot slipped causing him to stumble on the uneven surface. As he attempted to maintain his balance, he fell forward extending his left arm and landing on his left hand/wrist. The left wrist was fractured.
An employee was picking up a steel cap when the load shifted and pinched his right foot, dislocating his big toe.
An employee was attempting to troubleshoot a clogged crane auger when a piece of drill spoil fell 55 feet and struck his hardhat, injuring the back of his head and neck.

An employee was climbing a ladder to investigate a work area when the ladder moved. The employee then fell approximately 4 feet, landing on the concrete below and an empty 5-gallon bucket. The employee suffered broken wrists and vertebra.
An employee was hoisting a motor with an "A" frame when the frame fell on and broke the employee's ankle and lower foot.
An employee was adjusting the forks of an all-terrain forklift when his pinky finger was pinched between the forks, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was chipping concrete from around the rollers of a truck when the drum turned and caught the employee's glove. The drum then pulled the skin on the employee's hand back from the knuckles toward the wrist. The truck was running at the time.
An employee was operating a rough terrain forklift. As he was getting out of the cab, he fell to the ground fracturing the left arm, right leg and pelvis.

An employee was drilling holes in a concrete column with a hammer drill. While attempting to pull the drill out, he lost balance and grabbed onto the rotating drill bit, injuring several left-hand fingers.
An employee was installing metal decking when another employee moved the decking into place where the employee's hand was located, partially amputating a finger.

An employee was standing in the basket of a scissor lift. As the basket was lowered, it lost power and hit the wall. The employee hit the side of the basket and broke three ribs, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was injecting fluids into a well. As he disconnected the hose, caustic solution sprayed his face.

An employee was using a fence post driver to install temporary fence posts. After he installed a post, he noticed that it was crooked. He was attempting to straighten it when he lost his footing. The post then swung back and hit him in the face, severely lacerating his nose and requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was mixing mortar when he had trouble breathing. He was hospitalized for a possible allergic reaction.
An employee was descending a flight of stairs at a new home construction site when he slipped and fell, fracturing his leg.
An employee was working on a ladder when it slipped. As he attempted to stop the ladder from falling, his finger was caught in a clamp.

On December 6, 2017, at approximately 9:15 a.m., an employee was climbing a 12-foot step ladder to attach a retractable lanyard to a structural member when the employee fell backward from the fourth rung. The employee's head struck the concrete floor, and the employee was hospitalized with a skull fracture, brain bleed, and abrasions to the lower left calf and ankle.
An employee was moving wires from one meter to another meter when one of the wires went two-phases to gear, burning the back of the employee's hands.
An employee was repairing a skylight when he fell 15 to 18 feet through the skylight, hitting his head and injuring his foot.

An employee was pushing of piece of wood through a table saw to build a frame for a concrete pour when the blade caused an amputation to the employee's right ring finger. The table saw was guarded at the time.
An employee was on a ladder prying on a shipping container when he slipped and fell approximately 6 feet to the ground below, breaking his left wrist and requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was hanging drywall on a ceiling while wearing stilts when the employee fell to the floor, injuring the right knee.
An employee was climbing down a ladder when he slipped and fell. He broke his foot and was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was climbing a fixed ladder to access a roof to repair an HVAC system when the employee fell from the ladder, breaking vertebrae and the pelvis. The employee was hospitalized.
Two employees were working in a trench when a backhoe bucket rolled into the trench and struck them. They suffered a broken ankle and shoulder injury, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cutting a 2x4 with a circular saw when the saw blade cut and partially amputated the employee's left middle finger.
An employee was pouring concrete from a hopper into a pre-cast concrete mold when he was caught between the hopper and mold, fracturing his pelvis.

Employees were removing a piece of switchgear weighing more than 1,000 pounds when it fell forward, striking and pinning an employee between it and a wall. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured clavicle, fractured scapula, fractured vertebra, and fractured ribs.

An employee was holding a grade stick for a foreman to check the grade of elevations when an excavator driver rotated the equipment, causing the excavator bucket hook pipe to be spring loaded. The hook pipe then struck the employee, who sustained a contusion to the left side below the waist/hip.
An employee was driving a concrete mixer. He exited the truck and fell due to an apparent heart attack.

Employees were using an excavator to dig near a residential home when the excavator operator dug into an underground powerline, shocking a nearby employee. The employee was knocked backwards and received a concussion.

An employee was mixing cement using a mortar mixer. The employee started scraping the mortar patches inside of the mixer when the rotating paddles impacted the right hand, fracturing and lacerating it.

An employee was inspecting a possible crack in a crane track when the crane operator swung the crane. The employee was crushed between the counterweight of the crane and a handrail, breaking two legs and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was working on the second floor of a new construction building installing wrap on the outside walls when a guardrail broke, allowing the employee to fall approximately 12 feet to a lower surface. The employee suffered multiple leg and feet fractures.

An employee was at the top of a hill reversing a truck on the left side of a ramp when the truck rolled off the ramp. The employee suffered a collapsed lung and broken ribs, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was attempting to retrieve a piece of metal from a folding machine when he pressed the foot pedal. The machine then came down and crushed his right forearm.

An employee was using an airless sprayer when the employee's sleeve became caught in the sprayer, which then injected oil-based asphalt paint into the employee's left index finger. The employee's finger became swollen.

An employee was on a roof removing old roofing materials and throwing them into a dump truck in the driveway below. He fell approximately 17 feet from the roof, and a coworker found him laying on the concrete driveway. He suffered a head injury and was hospitalized.
An employee was fixing an overhead pipe while standing on an 8-foot step ladder. He lost his balance and fell from the ladder to the floor, breaking his left wrist and left ankle.

An employee was troubleshooting electrical fuses and relays on the driver's side of a skid steer when another employee rotated the bucket to actuate the hydraulics. The skid steer started moving and lurching, then knocked the employee over and ran over his ankle and foot, fracturing his right ankle and dislocating his right foot.
An employee was moving a portable heater when his finger was caught in the grating protecting the fan blade on the rear of the heater. His left ring fingertip was amputated with no loss of bone.
An employee was on an 8-foot step ladder passing a broom up to another employee when he fell to the ground, fracturing his left collarbone and ribs and suffering minor brain bleeding.

An employee was on top of a concrete pile looking inside the grout box to ensure there was enough concrete against the existing header. He had placed his hand on a concrete plow cable to brace himself when the operator moved the equipment, causing the cable to move and catch the employee's hand between the concrete and the cable. His left pinky finger was nearly severed.
An employee was surfacing the road for access and got too close to the edge of the road. The roller began to roll down the hill and the employee suffered a back and pelvis injury.

An employee was repairing/replacing the insulation on a chiller unit when he attempted to lift a pedestal fan to dry the chiller's paint. He then suffered a bulging disc and pinched nerve in his lower back, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was attempting to release refrigerant gas from a cooling unit when the gas began to release from a valve and hose. He attempted to stop the escaping gas and suffered burns to the thumb and a forefinger on his right hand and a forefinger on his left hand.
An employee was moving dunnage when a stack of lumber fell over and struck the employee, breaking the left leg.
An employee was installing framing for a concrete system when a forklift load shifted and struck his left leg below the knee, breaking it and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was climbing down a cross frame to the top of a pier when the employee slipped and fell approximately 7 feet to the pier, suffering a head injury.

An employee was helping to remove an abandoned 20-foot section of 10" pipe from a trench. When the pipe was free from the trench, it swung around and hit the employee's lower leg, breaking it and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was installing 2x4 light fixtures into a ceiling grid. He measured how much tie wire he would need to secure the fixtures' catty corner onto the ceiling grid. He realized he would need a taller ladder so he started coming down and decided to cut the wire he had measured out. The wire spool was sitting on top of the ladder he was using. When he cut the wire, the end sprang upwards and went between the bottom of his safety glasses and his face, puncturing his right eye.

Employees were performing demolition work on the second story of a residential property when an employee fell from the roof and landed on the ground approximately 20 feet below, breaking the left leg.
An employee was disassembling hot tar tanker pipes when the hot tar splashed both of his lower legs, causing first and possible second degree burns.
An employee was struck by a taxi cab while crossing the street, suffering a fractured left leg.

An employee was using a sledgehammer to drive a stake when he felt a pop and pain in his lower back on the left side of his tailbone. He fell to the ground and was unable to move his left leg. He suffered a herniated L5 disk.

On December 12, 2017, an employee was driving a mini roller compactor on a roadway when the unit drove off the edge of the roadway and turned over into a ditch. He hit his head on the compactor's roll-over protection and was hospitalized with a concussion.
An employee fell over 12 feet from the building he was working on to the ground, breaking his left elbow.

An employee was hooking up propane lines for heat at a construction site when propane spewed from the lines, covering the employee's hands. Another line then flared, flashing back at the employee and causing minor burns to the head. The employee's hand suffered frostbite from the propane, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was screwing a fascia into place while standing on an 8-foot portable ladder when he fell approximately 4 feet off the ladder, injuring his head and breaking three ribs.
An employee was setting a piece into a plate press when the plate press shifted. His left middle finger was then caught between the plate and the plate press, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was going up on a lift. His hand was outside the lift railing, and his right index finger was caught between the railing and a steel erection. His fingertip was amputated.

An employee was looking for utility marks while surveying for a new fence when a car hit the employee. The employee suffered a broken pelvis, broken collarbone, removed spleen, lacerated liver, and punctured lungs.
An employee was taping drywall on a baker's scaffold when the employee fell from the scaffold, breaking a hand and ribs.

An employee had just finished installing gutters and was transitioning to a ladder when the employee slipped on the ladder rung and fell approximately 14 to 16 feet, suffering a fractured sacrum. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was running cable through a wall and attaching it to a wall plate. He needed another screw to attach the plate to the wall. When he drilled the screw, it drilled through his left hand.

On 12/14/2017, an employee was disassembling a bakers scaffold. As he was descending the scaffold, his right foot was caught between the step rail and siderail. He then fell no more than 3 feet to the concrete floor, fracturing his skull and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was driving a wooden stake into the ground using a sledgehammer when the sledgehammer missed the stake and hit his right index finger. His index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was descending a ladder from a roof when it began to slide sideways. He dismounted the ladder at a height of about 10 to 12 feet and landed with his right foot on the concrete pad below, suffering a compression fracture to the right leg above the knee and below the hip. He was hospitalized.

An employee was installing a rolled insulation system on a building rooftop. The injured employee stepped from the controlled decking zone onto a galvanized purlin at the joint between the insulation and a ceiling liner panel. The purlin was slippery from weather exposure and the employee fell approximately 22 feet to the lower level (concrete), fracturing the upper left leg.
Two employees were performing roofing work and changing anchor points when they fell 20 feet. One employee broke his wrist.

An employee was troubleshooting why the latch to the door of a mini-excavator would not open. He had climbed up onto the mini-excavator to get a better vantage point when he lost his footing and fell backward onto a skid-steer bucket that was parked next to the mini-excavator, breaking multiple ribs. He was hospitalized.
An employee was driving in a fence post using a fence post driver when the employee's fingertip was caught and amputated between the fence post and the driver.
An employee was working on a 5-foot step ladder while using a saw to demolish a wall when he slipped and fell to a concrete slab, injuring his lower back.

An employee cut an 8" crown molding using a sliding compound miter saw. When he attempted to pick up the cut piece, his right hand contacted the blade, amputating his thumb's top knuckle and requiring surgery.
An employee was operating a chop saw to cut wood when the saw cut the employee's arm, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was performing roadway excavation work when he lost control of a widening machine while going downhill. To avoid the pending impact, he tried to jump clear of the machine and sustained multiple fractures to his right leg.

The employee was part of a scaffold construction crew.  During the course of the work day, the employee had been passing materials to higher scaffold levels from the ground level through the use of ropes and pulleys. Immediately prior to the incident, the employee had been conversing with another crew member while in the process of looking for an electrical cord. The employee became very pale and sweaty and suffered an apparent heart attack.

Employees were installing trusses in a commercial construction setting. An employee was using standard pine studs as a catwalk to gain access between the newly installed trusses. One of the studs had a large defect (knot). When the employee placed his weight on the defective board, it broke. He fell approximately 22" to the concrete surface below, suffering blunt force trauma, head trauma, and severe bodily injuries. He was hospitalized. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was using a wire wheel on an electric hand grinder to remove dried concrete slurry from a vertical steel column while on a 12-foot step ladder. The employee was reaching around the column and fell to the floor resulting in a right femur fracture.
An employee was testing breakers on an electrical panel when an arc flash occurred. He sustained burns to his arms, hands, and neck.
After tying down pallets on a flatbed trailer, an employee was about to step down onto the bumper to get off the trailer when he missed the bumper and fell to the ground. He fractured his left hip.

On December 18, 2017, at approximately 2:00 p.m., an employee complained of indigestion type symptoms as he conducted a five minute walk through rough terrain while carrying survey gear weighing 20-30 lbs. The employee was hospitalized for cardiac issues.

A crew was setting an air release vault lid onto an air release vault when the load shifted. The employee's right-hand fingers were then pinched between the lid and the vault, breaking the ring finger and causing minor lacerations to the middle and index fingers. His pinky digit was later amputated.

Employees had finished clearing trees for a pipeline and were walking back to the trucks. The injured employee slipped and fell to the ground after stepping on a rock covered with leaves. The employee suffered a broken leg and was hospitalized.
An employee was walking with a staple gun when he tripped and caught the gun's air hose. The gun then fired a staple into his right knee, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was cleaning copper pipe staining from masonry surfaces with a chemical cleaning product when he became ill and started shaking. He was hospitalized with an inhalation upper respiratory illness.

An employee was on a deck that was approximately 10 feet high, supporting an insulation board that was being hoisted by a crane, when he stepped backward and fell off the deck to the ground. He injured his back and neck, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was on top of a bridge when it collapsed. He was hospitalized with a back injury.
An employee's left pinky fingertip was amputated.

After a crane lift, an employee removed the hooks from a casting and was retracting the crane when one of the hooks caught on the edge of a platform. As he attempted to free the hook, the tension on the crane sprung and the hook struck him in the face, breaking his facial bones.

An employee was working in the breezeway of a new construction townhome and  reached over a guardrail to hand a ladder down to another employee. When he put pressure on the guardrail it gave way and he fell through the upper and mid-rail to the ground, landing on the other employee. He broke his hip and lacerated his head, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cutting wood shims with a circular saw when the saw lacerated his left middle finger. He was hospitalized.
An employee was throwing an old street light into a dumpster when the glass lens broke and lacerated his arm, requiring surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was pulling a trailer onto the road when the pulling unit slipped off its timbers and crushed all five toes on the employee's left foot.

While pulling a hose across the ground, an employee stepped forward and fell into a 3-foot hole for a foundation, fracturing the right side of the face and bruising the upper right thigh. The employee was hospitalized.

On 12/19/2017, an employee was standing in the parking lot talking to the plant manager of a customer. The area was marked adequately with cones and tape. As the discussion was taking place, a security guard for the customer drove his vehicle through the cones and struck the employee, throwing him onto the hood of the vehicle. He suffered a concussion and four broken ribs.

An employee was removing cast stone panels from an existing structure and placing them on a piece of 2x4 lumber when the employee's right little finger was pinched between the 2x4 and cast stone, amputating the fingertip.
An employee's left hand was caught between some equipment, amputating his middle finger.

On December 15, 2017, at 1:55 p.m., an employee struck a pile of drywall while operating a scissor lift. The drywall then fell and struck the employee's right leg, fracturing the tibia and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing sheet metal roof curb and caught a finger between the sheet metal divider and a standing seam roof rib resulting in amputation of the distal phalanx.

On 12/20/2017, at about 10:00 a.m., an employee was operating a masonry mixer when he attempted to scrape the dry mortar off the side. His fingers were caught in the mixer, amputating his index and middle fingertips to the first knuckle and detaching his pinky finger from his right hand.

An employee was working near an overhead crane that was supporting a 30-foot, stainless steel pipe that was perched on jack stands. The pipe fell from the jack stands and crane, striking and breaking the employee's pelvis.
Employees were using an ATV to travel through a tunnel when they collided with another ATV being used by a colleague. One of the employee's suffered a broken leg, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was helping another employee manually reposition three 5-inch pipes that were placed awkwardly on a rack. The employees straightened the pipes and returned to their work station. A forklift operator then drove over and attempted to manipulate one of the pipes with the forks. The pipe rolled and crushed the employee's right hand, causing a laceration and muscle damage that required hospitalization.
An employee fell to concrete while descending a ladder and broke his left elbow.
An employee was mixing paint with an electric drill and paddle drill bit when his left middle finger was caught between the drill bit and chuck, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was stripping insulation from an electrical wire to test an electrical circuit when his right index finger contacted a live electrical wire, suffering second and third degree burns.
An employee was rotating a non-powered fan when the employee's fingertip was caught and amputated between the fan's belt and pulley.
While installing a soffit on the bottom of a roof, an employee walked backwards off the work platform and fell 15 feet to the ground, suffering a broken wrist and possible rib fractures.

An employee used a chop saw to cut an aluminum channel and then turned off the saw. His hand was near the winding down blade when it caught his glove and pulled his hand into the saw, cutting his thumb. He was hospitalized.
While carrying a prefabricated door, an employee tripped and fell to the ground, fracturing the right hip.

An employee was grabbing a bookbag out of a skid steer that another employee was operating when the bag strap became caught on the joystick. The skid steer then ran over him, fracturing his right leg, pelvis, ribs, and collarbone.
On 12/22/2017, at 6:18 PM, an employee was rolling a house wrap on a new residential construction when he fell off the edge of the house and injured his ankle, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was in a trench cutting a pipe with a cut-off saw when it kicked back and cut his face.
An employee was drilling a mounting hole into a piece of PVC pipe when the pipe shattered. A shard then struck the employee's eye, resulting in a possible eye loss and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using a sand blaster when sand from the nozzle hit the employee's calf, causing a laceration.
An employee was installing building panels when his fingers were caught between a panel and a wire, amputating his left index and middle fingertips.

An employee was loading a trailer with a dingo digger that had an auger head attachment when the attachment slid out and came down on the employee's hand, amputating his left thumb between the nail and knuckle.

An employee was carrying a chainsaw from his truck to his work location. The gas cap was not properly secured at the time. While he was walking, some of the gas spilled out onto his right pant leg. He set the saw down and was walking back to his truck to get more tools while smoking a cigar. As he was attempting to discard his cigar it struck his outer layer of clothing, igniting the fumes from his fuel-soaked pant leg. He suffered third degree burns to his right forearm, abdomen, and chest area.

An employee was installing circuits in an office attic. During the work, he went up and down a ladder carrying tools and materials. A different employee needed access to the attic, so he folded the bottom of the ladder. The injured employee did not notice the ladder was folded and began to descend it. He then fell to the concrete ground and fractured his hip.

An employee was standing on about the fifth rung of an 8-foot extension ladder while operating a pneumatic paint spray gun to paint the exterior of a residential, single-family home. The ladder shifted as the ladder support (leg) sank into the sandy ground surface, and the employee dismounted from the ladder and landed on the ground, striking his right hip. He suffered a nerve injury and was hospitalized.

An employee was unloading bundles of rebar from a flatbed trailer and rigging them for a crane lift using wire rope slings. He was holding up the rigging until the slings began to tension and was positioned alongside the load. As the crane operator began to tension the load, the boom deflected, resulting in the boom tip sheave traveling laterally and losing alignment with the center point of the load. The resulting angle of the main hoist line caused the load itself to move laterally once it was up off of the trailer. The employee had to secure himself to the load to avoid being knocked from the trailer. The signal person who witnessed the event directed the crane to lower the load. While the load was coming down, the employee attempted to regain footing on the trailer and ended up with his left foot below the load. The load contacted his lower left leg, fracturing his tibia and fibula.
An employee was walking when an unknown object fell from above and hit his head. He was hospitalized with head and neck pain and swelling.
An employee was on the ground and lifting a bundle of shingles when he collapsed in pain from a hernia, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was operating a knuckle boom crane attached to a pump truck. The employee was loading bagged material into the truck's hopper when the hopper door jammed. The employee climbed onto the truck to open the jammed door and then fell to the ground, suffering a musculoskeletal injury in the left knee.
An employee was conducting form work when he fell into an unguarded hole, suffering fractures and a concussion.
An employee was inspecting some plumbing on a roof when he stepped through a stair hole and fell from the fourth level to the third level, breaking vertebrae and ribs.

An employee was installing floor trusses on the second level of a residential construction site. The employee was walking on the top plate of a framed and braced wall, marking the location of floor trusses. When the employee stepped onto the bump wall, it became unstable and the employee fell approximately 10 feet to the ground below, fracturing a tibia and fibula. Fall protection was not worn at the time.

An employee was installing HVAC equipment in the attic of a home when he stepped onto an un-decked section of the attic and fell through the ceiling to the floor approximately 12 feet below. He suffered several fractured ribs, a fractured left forearm, a right wrist injury, and facial lacerations above his left eye and on his lower lip.
An employee was working on a mechanical salt spreader (attached to a salt truck) when the salt spreader activated and hit the employee's right hand, breaking it.
An employee fell from a flatbed trailer to the ground while securing a load. He landed on his right leg and injured his pelvis.
While performing concrete form work from a scissor lift, an employee was caught between the ceiling and the lift, suffering a fractured jaw.

On January 2, 2018, an employee was retrieving a 14 ft. 2x4 board from machine he was operating when his hand slipped and was caught between the board and machine. His left ring fingertip had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was guiding a trash pump that a crane was moving into place for a concrete pour. The employee had to climb onto the trash pump base to release the main block hook from the wire rope rigging. As he grabbed the rigging with his right hand, his footing slipped and he grabbed the top frame of the trash pump. In his efforts to keep from falling, he pulled the rigging (still attached to the main block) toward him, which caused the hook to amputate his left little fingertip.

An employee was operating a boring machine in a trench box when the bit became stuck and the torque of the machine caused it to tip over. The employee was then caught between the machine and the trench box, bruising his right side.

An employee was working inside an 8' x 26' steel trench box and was helping an excavator operator install a 30" ductile iron pipe. He directed the track excavator operator to place a bucket of stone bedding for the next pipe to be installed. The excavator operator dumped the bucket of stone into the trench and began to level the stone. The employee was then caught between the excavator bucket and the bell of the pipe, suffering a fractured left leg, fractured ribs, a fractured pelvis, and punctured lungs. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was spray painting polyurethane onto a tank from an extension ladder. The ladder slipped on wet paint, causing the employee to fall approximately 5 to 6 feet onto the concrete below. He suffered a head laceration, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was setting up a warming tent at a job site when a work truck struck and pinned the employee between it and a 54-inch reamer. The employee's lower right leg was crushed, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was taking out a screw from a roof panel when he fell from the roof, breaking his ankle/foot and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was working on a light fixture when the bulb broke and cut his right little finger. The employee wrapped his hand initially, but then unwrapped it to look at it and fainted.  The employee fell and hit his head on the baggage rack before hitting the floor and having a seizure.
An employee was descending a carpenter bracket scaffold. The scaffold shifted and the ladder moved causing the employee to lose balance and fall 20 feet. The employee sustained a broken right leg.
An employee was putting a truck lift gate in the locked position when his left pinky finger was caught between the truck bed and the lift gate, amputating 1/3 of the digit.
An employee installed conduit and was descending from a ladder when he fell and hit his head. The employee suffered a seizure after the fall and lost consciousness. He was hospitalized.
An employee's left index finger was smashed between a ratchet handle and measuring rod while doing a hot tap. The first digit of the employee's finger was amputated.

An employee was unloading paneling from a truck when the paneling fell on him, knocking him to the floor of the truck trailer. He suffered a concussion and lower back injury, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was helping to unload a conduit bending machine from his van onto a forklift. The weight of the forklift shifted, and his finger was caught between the forklift and the bender. He suffered a transphalangeal amputation of the right ring finger.
An employee was working from a ladder and fell breaking the right leg.

An employee was gluing PVC duct along the shoulder of a runway when he was struck by a pickup truck and thrown about 6 feet, hitting his head on the pavement. He suffered head lacerations, a broken left ankle, and a broken nose, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was putting pipe on a hanger rack using a ladder when the ladder shifted. The employee then fell 5 feet to the cement/concrete floor below and suffered a broken scalp, broken shoulder, and finger injuries, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
A metal pipe fell off a forklift and struck a nearby employee, breaking his foot. He required surgery.
An employee fell from a ladder to the ground at a customer's house, suffering clavicle and rib fractures, brain bleeding, and loss of consciousness.
An employee fell 15 feet through a skylight while performing roofing work, suffering multiple face and skull fractures, as well as a right hand laceration.

An employee was spotting for a pipe as an excavator moved it from the pipe yard to the fabrication area. His foot then became stuck in mud and the excavator ran over his foot. He sustained a contusion to his right leg and was hospitalized.

An employee was climbing an extension ladder to inspect a roof when the bottom of the ladder slipped, causing him to fall 15 feet to ground. He broke his elbow and pelvis. The bottom of the ladder was placed on top of plastic sheeting at the time of the incident.

An employee was jackhammering asphalt with his back to a backhoe. The backhoe bucket was resting on the blacktop to the right of the backhoe. The backhoe operator was reaching down for a head warmer on the cab floor when the operator's sweatshirt pocket caught the stick control. This action inadvertently moved the control lever for the "swing arm" and "bucket." The backhoe bucket then moved and pushed the employee who was jackhammering asphalt about 2 to 3 feet until he lost his balance and hit the ground. The bucket continued pushing him for approximately 4 to 5 feet. During that time, the bucket also rose, and the tooth contacted the outer portion of his right boot. The bucket continued to move up and over his boot. The operator then stopped the bucket, but it remained on top of his foot. The bucket's weight (approximately 300 pounds) crushed and lacerated his foot.

An employee had just finished working on top of a main engine, tightening bolts to the exhaust system. He was climbing down the main engine when he slipped and fell to the next lower level (approximately 6-7 feet). His torso struck a guardrail and he suffered a ruptured spleen, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was stringing an overhead powerline of a pulling rig between two towers. When another employee started pulling the wire, the employee maintained contact with the wire and was raised approximately 15 to 20 feet above the ground. He then lost his grip on the wire and fell to the ground, breaking his pelvis and left wrist.
An employee was climbing off a ladder onto a roof to install a heat vent when he slipped and fell to the ground, injuring his left leg.
An employee was helping a forklift move a crane mat into position when the crane mat slid off the forks of the forklift and fell, striking and breaking the employee's right tibia and fibula.
On 1/8/2018, a temporary employee was doing demolition work in a bathroom when debris struck the employee in the eye, causing a retinal detachment that required surgery.
An employee suffered a finger amputation while pile driving.
An employee was preparing to bolt in two flanges on a 72-inch pipe when his left thumb was caught in the flange, partially amputating his thumb tip.

An employee was placing straps for a pile of plywood to be picked up by an excavator when the excavator operator released the excavator bucket, which fell and struck the employee's right middle finger. His right middle fingertip was amputated.

An employee was standing on a 6-foot ladder making repairs to an approximately 25' tall x 10' wide x 15' deep air rotation unit when an explosion occurred and knocked him from the ladder. Flames erupted from the unit, causing third degree burns to his face. He was hospitalized.

An employee was replacing the bottom seal on a garage door. When he removed a roller, tension on the door caused it to fling up. The bottom section of the door struck his face, fracturing his cheekbone.

An employee was installing soffit supports from a walkboard 13 feet above ground level when the employee fell to the ground, suffering shoulder, leg, rib, and back pain, as well as a cut on the head. Safety equipment was not hooked up at the time of the incident.
An employee was rigging a column when another beam fell and struck the employee's leg.

At approximately 8:00 a.m., on 1/10/2018, an employee was signaling an excavator operator who could not see the bottom grade of a box trench to dig farther when he fell approximately 8 feet into the excavation, fracturing a bone in his neck and requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was operating a handheld drill and attempting to drill through a brick wall when his glove was caught on the drill and his left pinky finger was amputated at the first knuckle.

An employee was coming down a 6-foot step ladder when it tilted to one side. As she attempted to correct the ladder, it fell to the other side. She then fell from the second or third ladder rung to the ground, breaking her elbow.

An employee and his coworker were installing a new meter set on a 4-gang meter base to provide electrical service to a multi-residential area. While his coworker went to the company truck to retrieve a new meter ring, he noticed a frog inside the meter base and was attempting to remove it with a pair of pliers when an electrical flash occurred. He sustained second degree burns on his right-hand fingers and was hospitalized.
An employee was working polish rods on a pump jack and placing clamps on rods when the employee's hand slipped and was caught between the clamps. The employee's right index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was replacing wire in a police sub-station that had been flooded.  As he reached for a wire, he sustained burns to his left hand because the circuit was not de-energized, requiring hospitalization.
An employee received an electric shock while working near a crane and powerlines.

An employee was guiding a section of pipe that was being lifted with an excavator so that a connection could be made. The excavator bucket slid down and struck the employee's arm and leg resulting in a left arm fracture.
An employee suffered a burn to the left side of his face while welding.
An employee was dismantling a mobile crane when the rigging system slid from the load. His left middle finger was then caught and amputated between the two crane sections.

An employee was checking the rigging on a rig. His hand was on a sling that was lifting a piece of pipe when his right hand was caught between the sling and the pipe. His right little finger had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was working at elevation, installing fitting support brackets on instrument air piping, when he fell 25 to 30 feet to the ground. He was tied off, but his fall protection disengaged about halfway down, allowing him to hit the ground. He suffered a fractured left forearm, multiple fractured ribs, a skull fracture, and a hematoma/brain bleed.
An employee was installing a metal jacket onto a 12" plumbing line. He was on a slope, lost his footing and rolled his right ankle. This resulted in a dislocated and fractured ankle.
While erecting a scaffold, an employee fell and fractured the left ankle and the right femur, fibula, tibia, and ankle. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee stood up from a chair and tripped on a desk, falling forward onto her knees. She then either hit her shoulder or braced herself with her right arm and suffered shoulder pain. She also hit her head on the door. She was hospitalized with a right shoulder fracture.

An employee was standing on a 12' step ladder about 8' off of the ground while cutting a pipe. As he was cutting the pipe, the pipe came loose from the fasteners that were holding it into the ceiling. It swung down, knocking his ladder over and causing him to land wrong on his right ankle. He was hospitalized with a right ankle injury.
An employee fell off a roof to the ground, suffering a head injury and a broken arm.
An employee was installing a new pipe/liner when he made a cut in the liner and hot water splashed on him. He was hospitalized with second degree burns to the arms and torso.

On January 15, 2018, an employee was backing a cart load of cinder bricks, weighing about 500 lbs., down a ramp by himself. His finger was caught and crushed between the cart and the frame of the doorway as he was going through, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was standing on the fifth floor at an open window waiting to receive three reels of aluminum electrical wire and one ground wire reel. The reels were in a makeshift wooden box set atop the forks of a telehandler, which were being raised to the open window by a truck operator. The employee retrieved two electrical reels and the ground wire reel. The last reel of electrical wire remained lopsided within the box. The employee climbed out from the window into the makeshift wooden box (holding the last reel of electrical wire). The box shifted and slipped off the forks. The employee fell with the box approximately five stories to the ground, suffering broken ribs and a back injury. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
On January 15, 2018, an employee slipped and fell approximately 10 feet while climbing up a ladder affixed to a welded frame scaffold. The employee suffered possible bruised ribs.
An employee fell off a concrete form while hooking it to a crane, hitting the ground and injuring the left arm.
An employee was operating and cleaning a molding machine when his right thumb was pinched in the machine, amputating his thumb tip.
An employee was photographing underground utility marks while walking on the sidewalk when he slipped and fell on ice, fracturing his right leg.

While walking down a residential home's stairs to the basement, an employee slipped and fell, landing on top of a tool bag that contained drill bits. One of the drill bits impaled the employee, causing muscle damage and a punctured lung.

An employee was operating a rough terrain forklift when the lift went across a slope that tilted the mast and forks down, causing the forklift cage to fall from the forks. An employee then fell approximately 12 feet from the cage, suffering fractured ribs.
An employee was walking to his car when he slipped on black ice and broke his hip.
While welding on a beam that was approximately 20 feet high, an employee fell to the ground, fracturing an arm and hip.

An employee was on the roof of a building installing his anchor point to hook up his personal fall protection when he slipped on an ice patch and fell 21 feet to the ground below. He broke both wrists, both arms, his left leg, and his left hip, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was using a rodder to clear underground communication lines and was placing it into a cradle when it slipped, striking the employee in the face. The employee was hospitalized with facial fractures.
An employee was installing a bracket on top of a pier in a basement. As the top of the bracket was adjusted onto the pier, it bent and slipped off the pier, hitting and injuring the employee's chest.
An employee stepped off a rolling scaffold and slipped. He used the scaffold to hold himself and injured his abdominal muscles.
An employee got a finger caught between a suspended valve and a bolt. When the employee pulled the finger back quickly the fingertip was amputated.
An employee was walking across the parking lot to enter the building when he slipped on a patch of ice and fell to the ground, striking his head and suffering brain bleeding.
An employee was manually loading pipes onto a low boy when the pipes slipped and pinched one of his left fingers, fracturing and lacerating it.
An employee was working in a boom lift when a scaffold board fell from the fifth floor and struck the back of his left shoulder.
An employee was using a cribbing skid to separate two jacks when the cribbing skid slipped out and struck his chest.
An employee fell while climbing up a ladder onto a front-end loader, tearing his bicep.
An employee fell approximately 22 feet while conducting roofing activities, suffering a knee injury.
An employee was breaking down spools of cable from a cable pole when his left ring finger was caught and crushed between a reel jack and the arbor that was holding the spools.
An employee was carrying a 7-foot pipe when he stepped on a pallet and dropped the pipe, which then struck his leg and fractured his femur.

An employee was installing home wiring from a 6-foot A-frame ladder when he leaned over to get wire from a coworker and lost his balance. He started to fall and grabbed onto a metal roof frame, which cut four of his fingers and caused tendon damage. He then let go and fell approximately 4 feet.
An employee fell from a bakers scaffold resulting in a broken left leg, muscle damage to the left leg, and a shoulder injury that required surgery.

On January 19, 2018, at approximately 10:09 a.m., two employees were replacing a gasket on a sight glass when an arc flash erupted from the transformer, causing second degree burns to their face, head, and hands.
An employee was tying his lanyard to an anchor point at a roof's ridge vent when he slipped due to frost and fell 15 feet to the ground, breaking his right femur. He was hospitalized.

An employee was attempting to separate a hex socket from the sleeve of an adapter that was used to link a bore machine to an auger. The employee was supporting the hex socket with a finger while tapping the socket with a small hammer to unseat it from the sleeve. The socket gave way, amputating the employee's fingertip with a guillotine action.

An employee had helped to load a backhoe onto a trailer and was walking toward the front of the trailer to get down. The employee was walking under the outrigger of the backhoe when the chain snapped and knocked the employee off of the trailer onto the ground. The employee suffered a ruptured spleen and internal bleeding.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet from the shop roof to the ground, suffering cracked ribs and a broken shoulder. He was hospitalized.

An employee was framing the edge of a roof dormer when he leaned against an unsecured rafter and fell approximately 20 feet from the roof edge, breaking his back and knee and suffering lacerations. He was hospitalized. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was unloading materials from a truck trailer when an all-terrain forklift dumped timber onto the employee. The employee suffered a broken pelvis and ankle.

An employee was working at a height of about 15 feet to remove gang forms and strip out a bulk head with another employee working on the opposite side of him. The employee was wearing a positioning belt and was tied off to an anchor point affixed to a rebar. As he was working, the positioning belt's hook slipped off the tie-off point and he fell, striking a protruding rebar at a lower level and puncturing his right thigh.
An employee slipped and fell to the floor while working from a scaffold resulting in a fractured right wrist.
An employee was in a manhole getting ready to test a pressurized sewer line when the line plug struck the employee's head.

An employee was unloading an I-beam from a flatbed truck and then hooked the I-beam's chains onto an all-terrain forklift's low back rest. He signaled the forklift driver to raise the I-beam. As the I-beam was being raised, the chain broke, causing one side of the I-beam to hit and break his left tibia. He was hospitalized.

Two employees were removing a bundle of glass by hand from a ground-level storage rack when the bundle fell, striking one of the employees in the back of the right leg. His right tibia broke, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing new wiring for a sign when he received an electrical shock and fell off his ladder. He landed on his ankle, fracturing it and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was standing on a 4-foot scaffold when the employee stepped off the edge and fell to the ground. The employee's head struck the ground, suffering a temporal fracture.
An employee was working near a shoulder spreader when it was loaded onto his foot, breaking it and requiring hospitalization.
An employee used a forklift to pick up a trowel and clean the pans that were underneath it. The trowel was still running when one of the pans ejected, striking and breaking an employee's left shin.

An employee was screwing a mechanical bar into rebar in concrete but was having trouble threading the bars. He used a drill to try to get the bar to go in, and caught the glove of another employee in the drill. This caused the injured employee's  left hand to spin around breaking his left pinky and index fingers and dislocating his ring and middle fingers.

An employee was on a ladder bolting a beam onto a wood column when the beam fell off the column. The employee tried to grab the falling beam and fell off the ladder to the ground, breaking his right arm.

An employee was cleaning the site and putting debris in a skid steer bucket. He was dislodging a piece of wood that was caught between the mechanical arm of a skid steer when he inadvertently pressed the skid steer's foot control. His right leg was then caught between the arm and the bucket, breaking his tibia.
While exiting a roof via an extension ladder, an employee fell off and suffered head trauma.
An employee was on a ladder pumping a residential column full of concrete. He was leaning on the column when it collapsed, causing him to fall to the ground. He injured his hip and was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a finger amputation while lifting a fire hydrant.
An employee was loading a truck with material when a metal banding brace that was holding the material broke and lacerated his finger.

An employee and his crew were connecting a float hose and a head section (floating pipeline for hydraulic dredge). He was tying a 2-inch polypropylene line from the dredge tender to the pontoon tank when his left ring and pinky fingers were caught and amputated between the line and the bit.
An employee was using a drill to install sheet metal beauty rings around ductwork when the employee's hand slipped and hit the metal duct, lacerating the right index finger.
On 1/25/2018, an employee was finishing drywall when he fell off a scaffold and broke his arm, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was marking a concrete structure that was frozen to the ground when an excavator operator went to push the structure with the excavator bucket. The operator did not see the employee and moved the structure, which then struck the employee. The employee suffered a dislocated hip and fractures.

An employee was preparing to install a conduit on an outside wall. He was climbing an 8-foot A-frame ladder that was leaning against the wall when he lost his footing and fell about 6 feet, striking a table positioned next to the ladder. He broke his arm, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

Two employees were aligning a head pulley with a tail pulley on a vertical leg/bucket conveyor. The injured employee was measuring the distance from the tail pulley to the plumbing string at the lower level when he was struck by a 2x2x6 angle iron weighing approximately 14.64 lbs. that came loose while the coworker, 130 feet above, was repositioning it. The angle iron fractured and severely lacerated his lower right leg, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was standing close to an excavator when the equipment hit a pipe, which then moved toward him. His boot was caught on something, so he was unable to move before the pipe struck his left leg, fracturing his tibia and fibula.
Two employees were involved in a physical altercation. One employee was shoved and fell to the ground breaking a leg.
An employee was working on a scaffold when he fell to the ground below, shattering his leg and breaking his wrist.

An employee was holding a valve open by hand when a pig within the pipe struck the valve, causing the lever to strike the employee, who then fell to the ground. The employee suffered broken ribs and a bruised lung, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was securing a bell hook by wrapping a strap around the A-frame of a side boom when the operator moved the winch, causing the strap to fasten around the A-frame and the winch mounting bracket. The employee's left hand was then caught between mounting bracket and A-frame. The employee suffered a broken left hand, a ring finger compound exposure, and broken middle finger.

An employee was performing roofing operations at a house when he walked over the opening of a skylight that had been covered with insulation and fell through it approximately 8 feet to the ground. He received cuts to his head, possible broken ribs, and a back injury, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was climbing down a ladder when the bottom of the ladder shifted. The ladder and the employee fell, landing on his back and breaking his vertebra.
An employee was climbing a 12-foot ladder when he fell approximately 5 to 7 feet to the concrete below, injuring his head and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was trying to move an X-ray machine 4 inches away from the wall by sliding a skate underneath it when a board broke and the skate twisted, crushing his right middle finger between the skate and the machine. His right middle finger was amputated at the fingernail.

An employee was cutting wood with a circular saw when the blade kicked back and he lost control of the saw. The blade then lacerated the fourth and fifth fingers on his right hand, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was pressure washing at a location when the pressure washer injected the employee's right little finger.

The employee was repairing the broken shaft on the drum of the conveyor that had been locked out.  His finger was pinched between the shaft and the drum. When he removed his finger, the fingertip was amputated.

An employee was helping a forklift operator erect a 30-foot-tall frame when the employee lost control of the frame and it struck the employee's knee, breaking it in two places. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was climbing a ladder to access a hydro-mobile scaffold when the ladder shifted and pinched the employee's finger between the ladder and a scaffold component, causing a fingertip amputation.
An employee was between two asphalt rollers when one of them moved and caught the employee between the two rollers. The employee suffered broken ribs and a fractured collarbone.
An employee was walking to her car and fell breaking the right hip.
An employee was moving a 50-pound barrel in the back of a box truck when he lost control of the barrel and his finger was caught between another barrel, resulting in a finger amputation.
An employee fell off an 8-foot ladder while performing residential construction, hitting the porch surface below and tearing ligaments in his back. He was hospitalized.
An employee was attempting to lift a bundle of angle iron to create space for a ladder when the employee's middle finger was crushed between the steel and the underlying wood.

On January 31, 2018, at 11:30 a.m., an employee was struck on the left wrist and the left side of his torso by the end of a truss that broke in half as it was suspended from a crane. He suffered a bone bruise to the left hand, torn left rotator cuff, three broken ribs, and a hematoma of the left lung, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was operating a pallet jack. When he stepped off, he moved the handle on the pallet jack, which proceeded to hit his left ankle, severely lacerating it.
An employee was setting up the warning fence around the top of an excavation when he stepped back and fell into the trench striking his head. The employee was hospitalized for a concussion.

While walking on a welded frame, metal scaffold, approximately five feet off the ground, the injured employee went to grab a 2x4 that was over the doorway and fell resulting in broken ribs and a lacerated spleen.
An employee was trying to tie the boat to the barge and fell off the boat into the cold water. The employee suffered dry drowning and was hospitalized.
An employee was walking downstairs, passed out and fell down the stairs resulting in a fractured skull.
An employee fell while descending a ladder and fractured their lower back.

An employee was performing demolition activities. The employee removed a ceiling tile and liquid from a water pipe spilled onto the employee. Shortly thereafter, the employee suffered lack of muscle control, nervous system depression, and memory loss. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was working from a man lift, installing siding to the exterior of the building. The employee unhooked his lanyard to enter a third floor window opening, when he slipped and fell to the ground below. The employee was hospitalized for a concussion and a broken foot.
An employee was walking and performing a visual inspection of the fire protection system, slipped on mud and fell fracturing the knee.

An employee was using an impact driver to screw on the cover of the electrical panel and contacted a live wire. The employee was hospitalized for burns to his hands, arms and stomach as a result of an arc flash.
An employee was working from a 10-12 foot extension ladder and fell to the ground resulting in injuries to the employee's left wrist and shoulder.

An employee was hydro-blasting a 2-inch line with a flex lance at approximately 18,000 psi. The tip inadvertently exited the pipe, striking him in the left arm. The contact resulted in a blunt force abrasion and a possible water injection. He was hospitalized.
An employee was assembling formwork when a section of formwork fell to the side and struck the employee resulting in a broken leg.
An employee was helping a crane lower a column when his left thumb was caught between the hook and rebar. His left thumb fractured and his thumb tip was amputated.

An employee was conducting maintenance on a hydro flaker machine that was turned off and locked out. The employee manually tuned a pulley and his finger was caught in the belt. His right middle fingertip was amputated.

While on an aerial lift, an employee was removing a tree top using a chain saw when the tree top fell backwards and struck the employee. The force of the contact drove the employee's face into the lip of the aerial lift's bucket. The employee suffered a broken nose and several facial fractures.
An employee was walking when he stepped on a loose piece of concrete and lost his footing. He fell to the ground and broke his left tibia and fibula, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was climbing a ladder to put up scaffolding. He was being handed a scaffold plank when he slipped from the ladder and fell 18 feet to the ground below, injuring his spine, head, and face.
An employee was on a ladder removing a light fixture with a screwdriver when he fell backwards off the ladder from approximately 4 feet, injuring his right arm and pelvis.
An employee was exiting a job trailer when he tripped and fell, breaking ribs and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was letting the air run through the bags on a vacuum truck when he adjusted the door to the truck and it slammed on his fingers. His middle fingertip was amputated.

Two employees were part of a crew performing a re-roofing job (TPO type roofing work) at night. The building was 22.7 feet high (at the highest elevation) and was a single-story warehouse-type building with two roof elevations. The employees were on the highest roof elevation when a rough terrain forklift with a material handling wooden box on the forks was used to remove debris from the roof. The box was raised to the roof and the two employees got in the box to get a ride back to the ground. While they were in the box, it became dislodged and fell to the ground. One employee sustained head and body trauma, while the second suffered a fractured wrist. Both were hospitalized.
An employee was repairing a generator and testing the system for a leak when the generator's rotating fan blade struck his right pinky finger, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut a 2x4 when he contacted the blade, resulting in an amputation to his left index finger.
An employee was sand blasting on the outside wall of a water tower when he lost his balance and fell at an angle. He hit the ground, breaking one rib and puncturing a lung.
An employee fell 6-8 feet off a ladder while traversing over a wall resulting in broken ribs and a bruised clavicle.

An employee was holding a pole and waiting for a forklift to push the pole into the ground. The pin was missing on the forklift forks, allowing them to fall and hit the employee's lip. The employee fell to the ground and suffered a back injury.
While positioning a new cable around a new transformer, an employee contacted an electrical line, burning both hands.
An employee was walking across the roof and fell approximately 20 feet through a skylight. The employee sustained broken heels, a broken ankle and broken bones in the back.
An employee was taking measurements along a sidewalk, slipped on ice and fell hitting the back of his head on the ground.
An employee slipped and fell causing a head injury.
An employee was carrying plywood on the roof when the employee's self-retractable lanyard locked up. The employee lost balance and fell dislocating an ankle.

An employee was on a scaffold approximately five feet tall working overhead to cut a hole for an access panel near a roll-up door. The door was energized and bumped the employee as it rolled up. The employee fell and sustained one cracked rib and two broken vertebrae (L1 and L2).
An employee was welding when hot slag dropped into his tool bag, igniting it and causing burns on his back and side.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut a door when the saw kicked back and caught the employee's left pinky finger, resulting in an amputation.
An employee was standing on a 5-gallon bucket when he stepped down onto an upright welding rod and impaled his right foot.
An employee was standing next to carry deck equipment when an outrigger set down on the employee's right foot, fracturing a metatarsal.
An employee was helping to move a scaffolding platform when his left middle finger was caught between two pieces of scaffolding, resulting in an amputation.

An employee was helping a table saw operator cut 6-inch blocks when the employee's right hand entered the cutting area and contacted the blade, amputating the thumb below the nail. The saw was guarded at the time.
An employee was cutting a concrete pile when a previously cut pile of concrete fell on the employee. The employee was hospitalized with broken ribs, a broken left arm, and possible lung damage.
An employee was working in a power room making temporary power connections on a 480V box when an arc flash occurred. The employee suffered second and third degree burns over 60% of his body.
An employee was standing on the second step of a portable step ladder while removing wall tiles and fell to the concrete slab, fracturing the right femur.

An employee was attempting to relocate a 10-inch flange by hand. During the relocation, the flange started to roll onto its side and the employee attempted to control the flange catching the employee's right middle finger between the rolling flange and another flange on the pallet resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was on a 7-foot step ladder installing ceiling light fixtures. The employee contacted energized wiring with wire strippers and fell from the ladder. The employee was hospitalized for head trauma and broken ribs.
An employee was working on the roof and fell through an opening in the roof resulting in a broken wrist and three broken ribs.
An employee was inspecting a roof for leaks. As he was accessing the ladder to get off the roof, he fell approximately 14 feet resulting in a fractured L2 vertebra.
An employee was cleaning resin from a surface of a 16" globe valve and valve body. The globe valve closed and severed three fingers on the employee's right hand.
An employee fell approximately three feet from a scaffold resulting in a broken arm and a possible shattered elbow.
An employee received an electric shock on his right hand while he was plugging an extension cord to a grinder machine and the extension cord contacted the wet floor. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was installing pipe hanger into the ceiling. The employee was working from a 12-foot step ladder using a full body harness with an MSA beam clamp and self-retracting lifeline attached to a 5-inch I-beam. The anchor point was located approximately 3 to 4 feet to the rear of the employee's position with the employee facing away from the anchor point. The beam clamp and self-retracting lifeline became detached from the 5-inch beam allowing the devices to swing downward towards the employee's position and striking the ladder's lower rung. The worker fell from the ladder landing feet first on the concrete floor below resulting in fractures to both lower extremities.

An employee removed a piece of plywood that was covering an HVAC chase hole approximately 2' x 2' in size. Upon removing the plywood from over the hole, the employee turned and stepped into the hole falling 11 feet to the wooden floor below. The employee suffered a broken right forearm, fractured ribs and several fractured vertebrae in his back.
An employee was installing bracing on the top of a concrete column form when it fell over. He then fell to the ground, breaking his right foot and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was grinding while standing on a bakers scaffold and fell off the scaffold fracturing an arm.

On February 13, 2018, an employee was assembling a sand hopper for a customer. The sand hopper was in the upside down position. The employee was attempting to push the framework into position for the lifting lugs and hopper legs and pinched his left pinkie finger between the lifting lug and the post resulting in amputation at the distal joint.
An employee was drilling with a hand held hammer drill. A second employee grabbed the bit to straighten it and their glove was caught on the drill bit dislocating three fingers.

A temporary employee was checking a groove that was being machined into pipe when the machine started up and amputated the left index finger from the tip to the second knuckle. Cut resistant gloves were worn at the time.

An employee was struck by a hydraulic jack that kicked out from a concrete form and struck him in his ribcage and right elbow. The employee was admitted to the hospital for an open wound fracture to his right elbow.
An employee was standing near the edge of a cantilevered sheet of plywood and when he leaned over, the plywood moved, causing him to fall 38 feet to the ground and fracture both legs.

On February 15, 2018, at approximately 3:00 PM, an employee was standing on a gooseneck trailer unloading material when he lost his balance, falling approximately four feet and landing on the ground on his side. The employee was hospitalized for five fractured ribs.
An employee was walking to the company vehicle to retrieve a tool and fell 18 feet through an uncovered 2' x 3' drain inlet resulting in a broken right femur.

An employee was ascending on a scissor lift to transfer insulation material. As the employee was climbing out of the scissor lift to the commercial roof, he fell 20 feet to the ground. The employee was hospitalized for broken ribs, a bruised liver and back pain.
An employee was helping to roll out geotextile material. As the employee was lifting the roll over a wall, it spun and struck the employee's leg fracturing it.

An employee was cleaning around a 54-inch tall partition wall. The wall fell over and the employee was struck in the back of the leg. The employee sustained a fracture in the lower right leg, which required hospitalization.
An employee was walking in the hallway when 10-15 sheets of drywall fell on him causing a left leg fracture.

An employee was receiving scaffold materials up to the 21st floor via an engineered opening in the scaffold flooring. The employee fell approximately 14 feet through a gap in the scaffold flooring. The employee struck his head in the fall and was hospitalized. The employee was not tied off at the time.
An employee was working from a ladder inside a hole (trench) rubbing the chamfer line on the concrete, removing nails and/or debris, and fell 6 feet, receiving a lower back fracture.

An equipment operator was loading a tripod onto a backhoe while standing on the ground. He inadvertently struck a lever with the tripod causing the boom to swing into him and pin him between the boom and stabilizer resulting in fractured ribs and a fractured pelvis.

At approximately 10:30 AM on 02/16/2018, an employee was working with a crew of pipe fitters and plumbers, moving a long steel pipe into position in a designated area. The crew was using a portable lift to move the pipe onto cricket. The pipe spun and struck the employee's left foot resulting in a partial amputation.

An employee was walking on a walkway between buildings and brushed up against the guardrail. The railing detached and the employee fell about 22 feet to the ground. The employee also struck an air conditioner on the way down. He was hospitalized with a serious cut to the head and a broken ankle and sternum.
An employee fell out of the dump vehicle he was driving and was struck by it resulting in a crushed lower right leg.

An employee was being elevated in a scissor lift to install duct work. The employee's left hand was caught between the scissor lift's hand rail and the conduit suspended in the air resulting in a fractured and lacerated hand.
While taking down a light fixture, an employee fell about 7 feet from an A-frame ladder and broke both heels.
An employee was putting two pipes together and one of his fingers was caught in a pinch point, resulting in medical amputation of the fingertip down to the bone.
An employee was standing on the third rung of a 10-foot step-ladder using a reciprocating saw, fell and fractured an ankle.
An employee was struck by a block that fell from a 600-ton crane when the crane collapsed. The employee sustained multiple fractures to the body.

An employee was on the third-story balcony of an apartment complex. He was pulling up a 25-foot section of gutter with a rope so that it could be installed. When the employee grabbed the section of gutter the end of it hit a power line. The electricity exited out of the employees left foot causing an exit-wound burn.

An employee was changing electrical poles. The employee grabbed the chain to try and move it up on the pole and pinched the left thumb between the pole and chain. The tip of the thumb was crushed and amputated.
An employee was rigging a section of pipe into an upper-level steel structure when the pipes shifted, striking and crushing the employee's leg.

An employee was walking on a flatbed tractor trailer while loading equipment. He was checking to make sure chains were not trapped between the load and dunnage when he tripped over the dunnage and fell 57.5 inches off the trailer to the concrete below, fracturing his pelvis.
An employee climbed up an extension ladder to ensure it was setup correctly. The employee fell 23 feet, sustaining back injuries and broken ribs.
An employee was struck on the head by falling sheet metal duct work during demolition operations, suffering a concussion.
An employee was assembling a scaffold when it tipped over, causing the employee to fall approximately 8 feet sustaining bruising and contusions to the head and ribs.
