An employee was unloading two bundles of trusses from a powered industrial truck when the second bundle fell off the forks and caught the employee's leg, fracturing it.
While surveying a construction site, an employee tripped over a wooden stake and fell to the ground, breaking the left hip. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a wire brush handheld grinder to smooth out concrete. The grinder hit the side of a stair and kicked back, hitting the employee's left leg and causing a 2" deep and 4" wide laceration on his thigh.

An employee was climbing down a scaffold ladder when the employee's right foot slipped from the  third rung from the bottom. The employee then fell to the ground, fracturing the left leg and requiring hospitalization.
While installing screws on a sheet metal roof, an employee slipped off the roof and fell to the frozen ground, fracturing both feet.
An employee was helping to change the bucket on a skid steer when it fell off the skid steer and onto the employee. The employee suffered a broken ankle.
An employee was attempting to clean a clog out of a spray fire proofing hose when fire proofing and accelerant released under pressure and entered his eye.

An employee was removing forms inside an excavation around the concrete foundation of a residential home. 
The excavated vertical wall caved in, trapping the employee. The employee sustained a concussion and was hospitalized. Rain was a contributing factor.
An employee was climbing a 24-foot extension ladder to access a roof when he mis-stepped and fell approximately 16 feet to the ground, breaking his lower right leg.
An employee was working on the roof. A piece of metal roofing twisted and caused the employee to fall 8 ft. to the ground. The employee sustained a fractured hip and three broken ribs.

An employee was unscrewing track studs from the ceiling while standing on a Bakers scaffold. The scaffold rolled and the employee fell to the concrete ground below resulting in a concussion and a dislocated shoulder.

An employee was helping to steady a bunker hoisted on a forklift jib attachment when the forklift drove forward over the employee's left foot. The employee's foot and toes broke, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was working on a scissor lift installing a column when a flange flipped and crushed their hand, resulting in amputation of the middle finger. Three other fingers were mangled.
An employee was guiding a piece of metal in place with welds when one of the welds broke and hit the employee on the hip. The employee suffered a hip fracture and was hospitalized.

While pushing a pipe away from the dredge using a wooden paddle, an employee slipped and grabbed a cable, catching his fingers between a cable and a pulley. This resulted in the loss of part of his left middle and ring fingers.

An employee was standing on a catwalk bridge, attempting to clean the inside of a kiln, when the employee fell approximately 30 feet off the catwalk and contacted debris and material inside the kiln. The employee suffered head trauma, a broken shoulder, broken ribs, and a broken pelvis, requiring hospitalization.
An employee slipped and fell to the same level while trying to use the first step on a scaffold access ladder. The employee hit and injured their ribs and was hospitalized.
An employee was removing electrical conduit wrapped around a scaffold bracket when his finger was pinched between the conduit and scaffolding, resulting in an amputation.
An employee was moving a crane into place to pick up a girder when the hook hit the girder, causing it to fall and hit the employee's right arm.
A piece of concrete fell from a device and pinned an employee against a steel beam. The employee suffered a broken leg and was hospitalized.
An employee walked into a wooden crate on a telehandler to dispose of trash/debris and fell 12 feet to a lower level. The employee suffered fractured ribs and a possible punctured lung.
An employee was bending a 1/2-inch thick piece of stainless steel on a mechanical press when the steel broke and flew through the air, striking and lacerating his right cheek.
A crew was performing hydrostatic testing to a recently installed steel gas service. The injured employee was turning off the valve when it blew out, striking the employee in the face.

An employee was standing in front of a 24" steel casing while an adjoining 24" steel casing was being moved. The employee was then crushed between the two casings, suffering a laceration to the lower part of the right leg.

An employee was dry blasting garnet media from a step ladder. As he went to step down a rung, he stepped on the hose, angled the blasting gun down toward his leg, and blasted his thigh. He suffered a right leg media intrusion and required hospitalization.
An employee's right ring finger was amputated while pipe fitting.
An employee lost balance and fell to the ground while climbing a ladder, suffering a broken hip.

An employee was reinstalling an atomizer header pipe when the tack welds failed, causing the pipe to fall approximately 4.5 feet and strike the employee in the lower right leg, fracturing it above the right knee and ankle.

The injured employee was assisting with material offload. His hand was above the two part block line on the crane. Two employees were disconnecting the rig. When the rigger gave the signal to raise the crane hook, the injured employee's hand became caught within the hook mechanism resulting in amputation of the right middle and ring fingers.

Employees had cut out the concrete slab foundation inside a building that was being remodeled and were placing a sewer line in a 2' deep trench. The injured employee was walking towards the exit when the roof of the structure collapsed, striking and injuring the employee. The employee was hospitalized for treatment of a fractured collar bone and a sprained knee.

An employee was standing on an A-frame ladder approximately 3 to 4 feet off the ground, attempting to install a porch ceiling soffit, when the ladder and employee tumbled to the ground. The employee's leg was pinned in a rung of the ladder, fracturing the tibia and fibula. The ladder was placed on loose fill rock at the time of the incident.

An employee leaned half of an extension ladder against the side of a power unit and started to climb up while two other employees held the sides of the ladder. When he extended his hand to receive a nozzle from one of the other employees, the ladder slipped out from underneath him. He fell approximately 4 to 5 feet and hit the ground, breaking his ankle.

An employee was moving a sheetrock dolly with dense glass down a small plywood ramp that bridged a concrete curb to the next level (approximately 8 inches high) when the dolly tipped over and fell on the employee, fracturing his right leg between the knee and calf area.

An employee was holding a handheld drill in one hand and using his other hand to place a bit in the drill when it unexpectedly energized. The glove he was wearing twisted around the drill and his left fourth fingertip was amputated. His fifth finger sustained a laceration that required stitches.

An employee was cutting into an excavated PVC waterline with a pipe saw when the PVC pipe shattered under pressure. The employee was hospitalized with fractures to the forearm and cheekbone and lacerations to the face and neck.
An employee was pulling cable down on a swing stage to roll it up when the cable touched a crosswalk pole and meter pole, causing an electric arc that shocked him. He was hospitalized.

An employee had just finished sheathing a roof and was exiting it. He slid off a wall walker scaffold to get into a window, but his tool belt was caught on something, causing him to be pulled out of the window and fall 12 to 15 feet to the ground below. He fractured his leg.

Two employees were installing a metal panel ceiling. As they flipped the panel over, it slipped from the injured employee's hand and lacerated his wrist, slashing the artery. He required sutures and hospitalization.
An employee was accessing a ladder. The ladder kicked out and the employee fell breaking an ankle.

Employee was back-filling a trench with a skid loader when the skid loader fell forward into the trench and flipped over onto an H-pile beam. The employee was trapped inside the flipped skid loader, breaking a leg and arm and dislocating a thumb.
An employee was loosening a plug on a union. The pipe wrench fell and the employee lost his balance causing him to step awkwardly and break a leg.

An employee and three other coworkers were setting a wall panel down on the floor. As the wall was lowered, the employee's finger was caught between the wall and his steel-toed boot. He sustained a traumatic amputation of the tuft of the left third digit.
An employee was applying grease to the sprocket of a traffic roller when his right ring fingertip was caught and amputated in the chain of the sprocket.
An employee was placing barricades into a row of other barricades when his left ring finger was pinched between two barricades, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was moving a single-person lift into an elevator when the lift tipped over and struck the employee's left foot, breaking four bones.
An employee was spotting a dozer truck when it ran over the employee's legs, breaking the thighs and legs.

An employee was installing natural gas lines above a drop ceiling when the platform he was standing on gave way. He fell through the ceiling to the concrete floor approximately 25 feet below, suffering internal organ damage.

An employee was attempting to remove a grinding blade on a 4" grinder. He lifted the grinder and put it under his right arm to help him grip the tool. While grabbing the blade with his left hand and applying pressure, he inadvertently flipped the safety switch with the underside of his arm. The trigger then activated, causing the blade to move and suck his glove between the guard of the grinder. The blade then cut into his left index fingertip.

An employee was in an aerial lift preparing to install mechanical rigging onto a new power line when the fourth and fifth fingers of the employee's right hand were pinched and crushed between the aerial lift basket rail and the cross arm of the power line structure.

An employee was on a step ladder using a hammer drill to drill concrete when the employee fell approximately 6 feet to the cement ground, suffering skull fractures, bleeding from the ear, and fractured ribs.
An employee was unhitching a trailer when his left pinky finger was caught between the chain and the hitch. As he pulled his hand out, his left pinky fingertip was severed.
An employee was walking on tube steel at ground level when he slipped and fell to the ground, breaking his left leg and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was placing an extension on a hand-operated drill when his hand was caught and pulled into the drill bit, amputating his left pinky finger.
An employee was attempting to stop a steel load from swinging when the employee's left middle finger was smashed and partially amputated between two steel loads.

An employee was hanging on a long line from a helicopter, clipping in travels on the arms of a transmission mono pole, when the helicopter maneuvered the employee into a three-phase distribution line. The employee suffered an electrical shock to the hip and buttocks, and later required amputation of the left arm from the elbow.

An employee was up on an I-beam, tied off to set a long span joist on the wide flange beam. As the joist was coming up into position, it got close to his foot. He moved his foot, lost his balance, and fell off the beam. The retractable caught him, bounced once, and swung toward the building. The bottom flange of the I-beam then severed the retractable and the employee fell approximately 10 feet onto the sand/concrete floor. He fractured his left wrist and was hospitalized.

An employee was replacing shingles and roofing paper on a residential home when he tripped on the roofing paper and fell about 15 to 20 feet through a skylight cutout hole to the concrete floor. He injured his head and fractured his nose, cheekbones, neck, and right arm.

An employee was attempting to run to the inside of a pickup truck that had accidentally been placed in reverse instead of park when the employee was pinned between two vehicles, suffering broken ribs and a fractured left shoulder.

An employee was climbing out of a box truck when his feet became tangled, causing him to fall approximately 4 feet to the ground. He struck his head on the concrete, fracturing his skull and left wrist and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was pulling a cart of glass windows to be loaded onto a truck when he backed up to a pillar and his left hand was caught and lacerated between the cart's handle and a fire extinguisher. He was hospitalized.
An employee was installing a ground rod, slipped and fell impaling himself on the ground rod. The rod entered his left thigh.
An employee fell 15 feet from a roof when his lanyard broke and fractured his knee.

An employee was surveying joints and concrete inside a construction zone about 5 feet away from the safety cones when a pickup truck with a trailer hit him. He suffered a broken left leg, concussion, and laceration to his lower back, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was installing a gas service/main and was in a trench standing on the gas main to push it down. His hand was on the lip of the excavation while an excavator operator was moving a road plate several inches. The operator put the road plate down, catching and breaking the employee's thumb between the excavation lip and the road plate.

An employee was trying to escape a construction fire while working on the third floor. He was climbing on the exterior of the building to get to the fire department's ladder when he lost his grip and fell to the ground, breaking his legs and ankle. He was hospitalized.
An employee was welding tube steel above his head when a spark entered his coat and caught it on fire. He received second and third degree burns to his left arm from his elbow to his fingers.

An employee was in the process of installing a metal curb on a roof for placement of HVAC. He was kneeling and reached his hand over a floor hole cover. The floor hole cover gave way and the employee fell 18 feet. The employee suffered skull fractures as well as a broken pelvis and femur.

A crew had completed drilling a 4.5' diameter shaft for a micro-pile installation and were placing thread bar reinforcement into the drilled shaft. Two employees used pipe wrenches to hold the bar and lower it into the shaft. The first employee was holding his wrench approximately 6' above the ground and the second employee was holding his at waist height when he lost his grip on the wrench. The full weight of the bar fell on the injured employee's wrench, which pulled his wrench and hand down to the ground. His right middle fingertip was pinched between the bottom of his pipe wrench and the ground, resulting in a partial amputation to the distal phalanx.

An employee was standing on an aluminum extension ladder while removing house siding at approximately 10 to 12 feet above ground when the employee fell to the ground. The employee suffered a fractured collarbone and rib, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was removing a 3-feet by 5-feet AC wood platform while on a 6-foot A-frame ladder when the weight of the platform shifted and knocked him off balance, causing his left leg to be caught between the ladder's rungs as he fell about 4 feet to the floor. He suffered a compound fracture to his left leg and was hospitalized.

An employee was climbing scaffolding when he attempted to hand a kick board up to the next level. He then lost his footing and fell approximately 10 feet to the ground, fracturing his wrist and vertebra.

An employee was attempting to clear a jam in a trash chute where it opened into a dumpster. The employee climbed into the dumpster and was removing material from around the bottom of the chute when he stepped backwards and fell over the edge of the dumpster, landing on the ground head first. He suffered head trauma, a fractured neck, and broken ribs.
An employee was getting tools out of a toolbox drawer when the drawer closed on the employee's right pinky finger. The fingertip had to be medically amputated.

An employee was installing an inflatable blow plug into a 30-inch ADS pipe when it ruptured as he was pumping air into it, knocking him unconscious inside the catch basin. He suffered a concussion and lacerations to his upper lip and left ear, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cutting a metal beam when the beam shaft fell on his left thumb, requiring a partial surgical amputation.
On or about March 9, 2018, an employee was cleaning out pipes in a trench when the trench caved in. The employee was hospitalized with a pelvic fracture and two broken ribs.
An employee was shoveling snow, went on a break and collapsed from a possible heart attack after returning from the break.

On 03/09/2018, an employee was installing AC vents on the second floor of a residential house under construction. He opened a door to an elevator shaft and subsequently fell to the first floor, injuring his head and requiring surgery.
An employee was working on a scaffold when the scaffold fell. The employee impacted the lower surface, suffering whiplash and a concussion that required hospitalization.
An employee was replacing a submersible well pump and pulling out a pipe when a wire that was connected to the pipe wrapped around and amputated his left pointer finger at the first knuckle.

On March 12, 2018, an employee was installing roof decking on an addition to a school. The employee was in the process of landing the leading edge of the steel decking when they stepped on an unsecured piece of decking material causing it to shift. The employee fell 14.8 feet to the ground below and fractured both hips.
An employee was operating a dozer when he was thrown out of the seat and into the roof of the dozer, fracturing his neck. A seat belt was not worn at the time.

While walking in an area where hot water was on the ground (approximately 1 inch deep), an employee tripped and landed in the water, sustaining second and third degree burns to the hands, knees, forearms, and hip.
An employee was examining a standpipe that had been disconnected when a standpipe valve struck and cut the employee above the eye.
An employee was using a bender machine to bend a short pipe when his right hand was caught in the equipment, amputating one of his fingertips.

An employee was working inside a trench approximately 3 feet deep. An excavator was working above him when the weight of the excavator caused one of the trench walls to fall, pushing the rebar cage into the employee and striking his abdomen. He was hospitalized with abdominal bleeding.
An employee fell from a roof to the ground, suffering broken ankles and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using an iron worker to cut a piece of metal and partially amputated the left thumb.

On March 13, 2018, at approximately 9:00 a.m., an employee was using a crane to unload a 6x6 concrete box when the crane became unbalanced and rolled over, pinning and crushing the employee's legs under the fuel tank. He was hospitalized.
An employee was using a hand grinder when part of the grinder wheel blade came loose and struck his right eye, puncturing it and requiring hospitalization. The grinder was guarded a the time.
An employee was climbing onto a flatbed truck to retrieve materials when he hit and lacerated his head on a steel member of the parking garage, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was attending a tag line while a forklift was lowering a steel joist to the ground when the joist fell from the forklift and struck the employee. The employee suffered broken ribs, a perforated lung, and a broken leg.

An employee was working on a ladder, installing insulated metal panels, when he lost his balance and grabbed a metal stud to keep himself from falling. The metal lacerated his left-hand fingers, requiring stitches and hospitalization.

An employee finished using a vehicle-mounted boom arm/crane to load clean-out tubs and was retracting the stabilizers when he was caught between a stabilizer and the truck. The employee's spine, mid-torso, and abdomen were crushed, causing internal injuries that required hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was measuring the depth of a hole when the employee fell into the hole and hit the ground, suffering a broken pelvis, arm, back, and ribs.
An employee was on a ladder putting up masking for painters when he lost his balance. The ladder kicked and he fell to the ground, injuring his right wrist.

An employee slipped while walking on a scaffold. The employee was ducking under a beam and fell approximately 10 feet between the walk plank and the stock plank. The employee hit the full planked area below and then fell from there, suffering a broken pelvis.

An employee was coming down a ladder after inspecting a roof and was four rungs from the bottom when he lost his footing and fell to the ground. He landed on his buttocks and hurt his lower back, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was taking electrical measurements from a battery interface board when it caused an arc flash. The employee suffered second degree burns to the left hand and first degree burns to the right hand.
An employee was dismounting from a modular scaffold that was approximately 28 inches high when he landed on the edge of his foot, which then rolled underneath him, breaking his right ankle.
An employee was on a ladder connecting a fire alarm conduit when the employee fell backwards off the third rung to the ground, suffering a concussion, swollen left eye, and broken ribs.
An employee was removing a rock from a mixer when the employee's finger was caught in a pinch point in the vein feeder housing, resulting in an amputation.
An employee walked in front of an operating concrete/asphalt saw cutter. The employee's foot contacted the 36" saw blade resulting in amputation of the employee's toe.
An employee was getting ready to put an insert inside a distribution panel when an arc flash occurred. He sustained first, second, and third degree burns to the face, legs, arm, and stomach.

An employee was standing in a work zone next to his sweeper truck that had just been filled with water from a water truck parked adjacent to it when a vehicle driving the wrong way entered the work zone and collided with the trucks. The employee was struck by the vehicle and/or debris from the struck vehicles and suffered a broken leg, bruises, and road rash.

While in a trench taking a material survey for the next day, an employee was struck by a 1,000-pound electrical panel and caught between the panel and trench wall. The employee sustained multiple rib fractures on both sides, as well as a lacerated liver and spleen.
Two employees were cutting concrete with a power saw when they were overcome by carbon monoxide poisoning.
An employee fell approximately 3 feet from a scaffold ladder to the ground while climbing, suffering a broken pelvis.

An employee was helping to load a dump truck with construction debris when, unbeknownst to him, another employee lowered the truck's lift gate. When he attempted to walk backward out of the truck, the lift gate was no longer there to support him and he fell 3.5 feet to the lift gate below, fracturing his L1, L2, and L3 vertebrae.

An employee was preparing a road for asphalt paving when a nearby forklift operator put a forklift in neutral and exited the cabin. 
The forklift started to move forward and struck the employee, pinning him between it and a pile of soil. He injured his lower back and was hospitalized.
An employee was on a roof walking toward a ladder to get down when he stepped on a tile that broke off. He then lost his balance and fell 8 to 10 feet off the roof to the ground, breaking his arm.
An employee was using an electric router to shape rough-sawn lumber. The router engaged the employee's right wrist and forearm, causing deep lacerations to the muscle, tendons, and bone.

While shoveling concrete debris into the bucket of a mini-excavator, an employee was pinned between the bucket and an existing pier face. The employee sustained a leg injury with lacerations and possibly broken bone(s).

An employee was modifying the scoreboard at a stadium. The employee was attempting to re-spool the cable on the drum of the hoist. He was guiding the cable with his left hand and operating the hoist by the pendant remote with his right hand. His glove was caught on the cable and the cable pulled his hand into the hoist resulting in the amputation of the right index finger and an avulsion injury to a second finger.

An employee was in a road work zone using a measurement wheel to determine how many feet of temporary pavement markings were painted when a pickup truck struck him resulting in a broken wrist and leg, requiring hospitalization.

The injured employee was extracting the drill string from the well bore (tripping out of the hole) and was struck by the drilling slips when the drilling string rotated resulting in a broken left leg.

An employee was helping to install low-profile concrete barrier walls when his left hand was caught between barriers, fracturing his pinky finger and lacerating his hand. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was operating a hammer drill when his work glove was caught in the drill bit, resulting in a left pinky finger amputation.
The injured employee was doing construction work from scaffolding. The scaffolding tipped over injuring the employee's arms, chest and legs.

An employee was ascending a fixed ladder and opened a roof hatch. The roof hatch then slammed on his hand and broke his finger, causing him to fall approximately 8 feet, where he broke three vertebrae in his back.

An employee was standing on top of a mobile crane's stabilizer, calibrating the boom while holding onto part of it with his hand. The boom came down and started to pinch his fingers. When he pulled his hand out, he lost his balance and fell about 9 feet to the ground, breaking both legs (a compound fracture to one leg). He was hospitalized.

An employee was helping a road bore move pipes from one place to another. The employee was strapping up the pipe casing as a backhoe was reversing nearby. The backhoe then struck the stem connected to the pipe's auger, which resulted in a teeter-totter effect, causing the pipe to strike the employee around his right thigh. He suffered a compound fracture to his right tibia and fibula, as well as a twisted ankle.

An employee was selecting a pipe fitting from a cart for installation. The employee took a fitting from the cart, moved to get back onto a ladder, and slipped. As the employee started to fall, he grabbed the handle on the cart and suffered a hernia, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was standing and welding in a scissor lift that was approximately 11'-8" above the finished concrete floor when his clothes ignited and he tried to remove them. He then tried to dismount the scissor lift through the chain gate on the rear of the lift. He attempted to step down the scissor supports of the lift but lost his grip and fell to the ground. He landed on his left wrist and left side. He suffered burns and a broken wrist, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was unscrewing bolts and the ceiling collapsed. The employee sustained a broken wrist, arm, and collarbone.
An employee was descending a tower crane when he fell approximately 20 feet from one landing to the lower landing located inside the tower crane. He sustained head injuries and was hospitalized.
An employee was riding as a passenger on a golf cart when it struck a forklift. The employee sustained a broken nose and mandible, as well as a laceration to the knee, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was installing insulation from a scissor lift that was 15 to 20 feet above ground level when he flipped over the railing and landed on the ground, injuring his back. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was using a handheld grinder to cut thread rods on pipe stands when the abrasive wheel on the grinder kicked back and cut his left wrist.
An employee's left hand was caught and crushed between a C-channel and a building wall while he was hooking a dock lock at the loading dock, resulting in a left ring finger amputation.

An employee was on a scaffold platform waiting for bricks to be delivered. When the bricks were placed on the scaffold, they broke the wooden platform, causing the employee to fall over 20 feet. The employee suffered shoulder and torso bruising.
An employee was moving a sheet backwards on a roof when he slipped and fell on top of a shooting boom lift basket, breaking a femur.
On March 21, 2018, an employee was clearing the side guard on a table saw when his fingers came into contact with the saw blade. Two of his left-hand fingers were amputated at the middle knuckle.
An employee was measuring and cutting insulation using a water jet cutter when his hands went under the water jet, lacerating his right pinky. The machine was guarded at the time.
An employee was fine grading dirt around a concrete channel box when he tried to jump over the box, suffering a concussion and facial contusion.

An employee was on a ladder testing an energized wire in the ceiling to make it safe when his pliers touched the electrical junction box, causing an arc flash. The flash startled the employee, causing him to fall off the second rung of the ladder to the floor, re-aggravating a pre-existing shoulder injury.
An employee was driving a boom lift when it bounced off a curb, causing him to strike his mouth on the bar above the controls. He suffered a head contusion as well as fractures to the jaw and ribs.

An employee was adjusting the tip on his pressure washer with his right hand when he accidentally hit the trigger with his opposite hand, shooting a stream of high-pressure water into his right hand. He suffered a laceration to his right hand and was hospitalized for an embolism.
An employee finished installing trusses and was climbing down a ladder when it slid out from under the employee. The employee fell 8 to 10 feet to the ground, breaking a leg and ankle.
An employee was disassembling scaffolding when he lost his balance and fell, impacting the ground and breaking his leg. He was hospitalized.

An employee was preparing to make vertical saw cuts in a hard wood floor for removal. The employee was using a 7.25" circular saw set at a depth of 0.75" when the tip of his glove was pulled into the rotating blade, cutting and partially amputating his left thumb at the tip.

An employee was operating a power buggy to help pour a concrete slab and footer. He had to get off the power buggy platform to fold a piece on the equipment. While he was walking beside the machine, the steering tires hit an obstruction, causing the machine to push him between a large glass window panel and the power buggy. He broke his right lower tibia and fibula.
An employee was struck by a forklift while fitting a pipe, crushing the employee's hand.

Two employees were sitting on a beam facing each other and protected from falling. They were working to drive barrel pins for a field splice. Employee 1 was using an 8 lb. sledgehammer to drive a pin, but missed the pin and hit a spud wrench that was sitting on the splice. The wrench was propelled upward and struck employee 2 in the face, causing nasal and facial fractures that required hospitalization.

An employee was working within the cubicle of a primary switch when an energized buss (approximately 13,200 volts) arced and caused a flash fire. The flash fire burned his left arm between his shoulder and elbow.
An employee was lowering a 24-inch long steel I-beam that was connected to a chain sling. After he disconnected one end of the rigging, the loose end struck and broke his leg.
On Saturday, March 24, 2018, at 10:00 AM, an employee was using a chop saw to cut PVC pipe when the saw amputated his finger.
An employee was dumping containers at the parking lot level when one of the container doors closed on his right hand. His right index fingertip had to be amputated.

An employee was operating a sweeper machine when a passing motorist struck it, causing the employee to be ejected and strike the ground. The employee suffered head trauma, broken ribs, and exterior abrasions on the arms, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was building a skylight curb on the roof of a building. He was cutting a piece of plywood with a saw when it kicked back, cutting the little, ring, and middle fingers of his right hand. His little fingertip was amputated.
An employee fell to the ground while climbing a ladder, suffering a broken ankle.
An employee was directing the lowering of a trench box while standing on a sewer inlet when the box swung and crushed his foot between it and the sewer inlet.

An employee climbed up a pilaster wall panel to hook up with the crane. The employee removed the she-bolt and the wall panel fell while the employee was hooked off to it. The employee suffered a broken right tibia and left shin laceration.

An employee was climbing a fiberglass extension ladder that was on a deck and leaning against the gutter of a house. The ladder slid out and the employee fell approximately 7 feet, landing on his chest. The employee sustained three broken ribs, a punctured lung and a strained elbow.
An employee was walking backwards alongside a forklift to help steady the load (scaffold component). He tripped and fell and was run over by the forklift injuring his right thigh and left leg.
An employee was pulling a hose off a dishwasher. When the hose broke free, the employee's forearm slammed against a piece of glass under the dishwasher, causing a laceration that required sutures.
An employee was dumping a portion of a load from a buggy when he lost control of the buggy and descended down a ramp. His right leg was pinned and broken between the equipment's gas tank and a wall.

An employee was transferring trash from a rolling hopper to a dump hopper when his right hand entered a pinch point between the dump hopper and the rolling hopper. His right thumb was crushed, resulting in a thumb tip amputation.
While disassembling a scaffold, an employee fell from the fourth level of the scaffold to the ground, fracturing the C-6 vertebra and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was rigging I-beams for a crane when an I-beam fell on his right leg, fracturing it below the knee. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was cleaning a cement/sand mixer when the machine amputated the employee's left index finger. The machine was on at the time.

An employee was working from an extension ladder about 6 to 8 feet above ground level.  He had a volt meter in his hands. The volt meter began to fumble and he attempted to catch it to prevent it from falling to the ground. In the process, he lost his balance and fell from the ladder to a 55-gallon metal drum that was located below.  The front of his right lower leg struck the metal drum, causing a laceration/avulsion to the skin.
An employee was on a ladder installing guttering on a residential house when he lost his balance and fell approximately 20 feet, injuring his vertebrae.

An employee was using an 8-foot fiberglass A-frame step ladder to access the ceiling. When he went to descend the ladder, it slipped. This startled the employee, who lost his balance and fell to the floor below. He fractured his left elbow and right wrist, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using a table saw when the blade partially amputated the employee's fingertip. The blade was unguarded at the time.
An employee was using a fixed ladder to take copper piping to the roof when he missed a rung and fell approximately 6 feet. He was hospitalized with fractures to his neck, back, and pelvis.
Employees were repairing a cooling unit on a new oil tank battery when a piping union failed and struck the injured employee, who suffered an amputation of the right leg below the knee.

An employee was spreading material for footing when a crane that was holding the material reversed and caught the employee's right thumb between it and a 4 x 4. The employee's right thumb tip was amputated.
An employee suffered third degree burns on the back and lesser burns in the armpit area while torch cutting on a bolt.
An employee was removing an outrigger pad from the far right front side of a rough terrain crane when the employee was pinned between the crane and a trailer, suffering a fractured pelvis.
An employee was riding up in a scissor lift when the employee's finger was caught between the lift and a piece of conduit, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was performing HVAC maintenance at the ceiling level. While he was moving his fall protection lanyard from one side of a beam to another, the working surface on which he was standing collapsed. He fell to the floor, breaking three ribs and his scapula.
An employee was using a table saw to cut lumber when the saw back fed and then became stuck. As he tried to unjam the saw, the blade contacted his left hand, amputating two fingers.

An employee was dismantling a scaffold system when a cable line supporting the counterweight for the scaffold broke. This caused the counterweight to suddenly drop and catch the employee's left thumb and index finger between the weight and a steel cross beam, resulting in the amputation of the thumb at the first knuckle and fracture of the index finger.
An employee fell while installing drywall, striking the back of the head and neck on a step.
While installing decorative stone on an exterior wall, an employee became dizzy and fell from a 6-foot ladder to the ground, suffering lacerations and possible fractures on the face and head.

An employee was climbing a ladder to access the ladder jack scaffolding when the employee either tripped or slipped when stepping on the plank and fell. The employee suffered chipped vertebrae in the back.

An employee was operating a roof cutter when the employee's left middle finger was pinched between the roof cutter's crank shaft and a metal plate, resulting in a partial traumatic transphalangeal amputation.

An employee was connecting structural steel at a height of 13 feet when a piece of steel that was coming toward him bumped the steel he was standing on. He lost his balance and fell to the ground, fracturing both wrists and his right elbow.
An employee was attempting to remove a pipe from a waterline when the pipe moved and caught his foot, fracturing it.

An employee was installing MC cable from an extension ladder. The ladder feet slipped out as the employee stepped up a rung on the ladder. The employee fell to the floor, suffering sprains and torn ligaments in the ankles.
An employee was cutting a wooden board when the saw kicked back and lacerated his left thigh, requiring hospitalization.
While climbing a ladder, an employee missed a step and fell backwards onto a concrete slab, suffering a concussion.

An employee was on a ladder (fourth rung) cutting ductwork loose when a piece of the ductwork became caught on an internal metal liner. The ductwork then swung to the side, knocking the employee to the ground. The employee broke both wrists.
An employee was installing wall ties when he stepped on a non-scaffold-grade board and fell approximately 20 feet through to the ground below. He suffered back pain and was hospitalized.
An employee was working on the brake pads underneath a broom (equipment vehicle) when something fell and struck the employee. The employee suffered a broken right arm and was hospitalized.

On April 4, 2018, an employee was moving material on a pallet jack when a crate of material began to fall over. As the employee attempted to stop the crate from falling, the employee's right pinky finger was pinned by the material, resulting in an amputation.
An employee was working on trusses when the ladder slipped out from under him. He fell approximately 14 feet onto concrete, fracturing a heel, a shin, and the L4 vertebra.
An employee was operating an industrial table saw to cut a metal part when the saw kicked back and struck the employee's left hand, amputating three fingers.

An employee was cutting carbon steel on an automated bench saw when he lost consciousness and fell, striking his head on the concrete floor. He suffered a laceration, concussion, and hematoma to the head.
An employee was removing an existing concrete culvert with an excavator when the concrete culvert broke, causing a jolt to the employee, who suffered five fractured ribs.

An employee was using a handheld shovel to level out a ditch for a retention pond pipe. At the same time, an off-road truck was being loaded beside the retention pond. A rock (2 to 3 inches in diameter) then fell off the dump truck and rolled downhill into the ditch, striking the employee. The employee suffered back and left side injuries.

An employee was cutting wire with a quickie saw to remove the core of a storm drain structure. When he got to the last wire, the concrete fell on the saw and knocked it out of his hand.  The saw landed on his left ankle, lacerating it.
On 4/05/2018, an employee was in a car accident due to ice/slick roads. He broke his arm and was hospitalized.
An employee slipped on ice and fractured his ankle.
An employee was watching a mini excavator operator drive the equipment when the excavator ran over and fractured the employee's right leg.
An employee was descending from a ladder with a drill while a second employee was on the ground. As the first employee came down, his drill caught and cut the second employee's neck.

An employee was adding mortar to a mixer when he noticed some build-up inside the mixer. He was attempting to clean the build-up when the mixer's rotating blade caught his gloved left hand, amputating his index finger and damaging his middle finger (possible amputation).
An employee was on a roof attempting to remove a piece of underlayment when the employee stepped back and fell from the roof to the ground, suffering fractured ribs.
An employee was nailing framing above his head at a residential property when the nail gun fired a nail into his head. He was hospitalized and had brain surgery.
An employee was using a chop saw when the guard broke. The saw then cut his fingers, resulting in one partial finger amputation and one finger laceration.

On April 6, 2018, an employee was coming down after installing cameras and walking along the joists at a front entrance when he missed a joist and fell approximately 10' to the concrete below. He suffered an internal brain bleed, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was unloading pipes off the back of a truck. As the employee removed a section of pipe, the 2 x 3 wood spacer that was in place between the pipes came loose and struck the employee in the head. The employee was hospitalized with a skull fracture.
An employee was attempting to use a conduit seal-off tool to push a dart when the dart struck his left leg above the knee, breaking his femur.
An employee was removing concrete forms from the top of a company truck when he lost his balance and fell to the ground, fracturing his ribs and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was operating a grapple truck and loading 30-foot sections of railroad track at the storage yard. The end of the rail struck his abdomen and pinned him against the truck seat while he was attempting to load the rail on the truck. He suffered a traumatic hernia of the abdominal wall.

On 4/7/2018, at 2:30 p.m., an employee was stripping concrete dismantling form-work. He removed a U-bolt and was climbing down a shoring frame when he slipped and fell about 10 feet to the ground, fracturing his left wrist and requiring hospitalization. He was wearing harness and lanyard and was anchored to the shoring frame at the time of the incident.

An employee was walking alongside a forklift that was carrying panels when he lost his balance and tripped. The forklift ran over his foot, causing fractures that led to a medical leg amputation 6 inches below the knee.
An employee was using rope to lower a pallet jack to a lower level when the employee's right pinky finger became tangled in the rope, resulting in an amputation.

On April 7, 2018, at about 10:15 a.m., an employee was on a ladder placing a drip pan under a mezzanine. He was descending the ladder when the drip pan moved out of place and hit the ladder, causing him to fall from the ladder onto his left arm. He suffered a compound fracture to the left arm and was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was working from a straight ladder putting the cover on a junction box while another employee braced the ladder. The foot of the ladder slid out and dropped the employee 3 to 4 feet to the ground. The employee suffered a concussion and was hospitalized.

An employee removed the master link out of the chain supporting a counterbalance that he thought had no weight. The counterbalance then fell and struck his upper arm, lacerating it and peeling off the skin.
An employee was sanding drywall in the corridor of a building when he fell approximately 6 feet from the platform of a wheeled baker scaffold to the concrete floor, fracturing his left hip.

An employee was going in and out of an attic via the access ladder when the third rung of the ladder broke, causing him to fall about 3 feet to the floor. He experienced back and shoulder pain, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was descending a ladder from the second floor of a remodeled construction site when he stumbled, lost his balance, and fell. He suffered a broken rib, shattered wrist, and a fractured hip and ankle, requiring hospitalization.
An employee had been using a pressure blasting gun. As the employee was moving an aerial, the pressure gun abruptly started and the water blast hit his leg, causing a laceration.
After cleaning wet grain from a bin, an employee fell 99 feet from the exit at the top of the bin, suffering a broken arm and pelvis.

An employee was performing site preparation on a roof when he fell approximately 17 feet through a skylight to the ground. He suffered broken ribs, a broken collarbone, and shoulder injuries and required facial surgery.
An employee fell from a concrete catcher basket to rip rap (rock) and suffered a broken nose and contusion to the chest.
An employee was helping to erect a steel building when he slipped and fell approximately 14 feet off a beam and contacted the ground, breaking his right ankle and heel.

An employee was offloading a section of structural steel from a trailer when he slipped on ice and the beam landed on his finger. This pinched his fingers between the concrete and the beam, resulting in a right ring finger amputation.

An employee was moving a 2-inch joint of pipe when the pipe struck the lid of a toolbox. The employee tried to catch the lid when it was closing, but it struck his left ring finger, resulting in an amputation before the first joint.
An employee was cutting a fallen tree with a chainsaw when the chainsaw slipped and cut his left leg below the knee. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee fell approximately 20 feet from a portable ladder while installing gutters, suffering a broken ankle and wrist. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was walking toward a customer's HVAC unit when he slipped and fell on the garage's wet concrete floor, breaking his hip and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was helping to break up concrete slabs when the employee's right pinky finger was caught and amputated between two pieces of concrete.
An employee fell from an 8 foot A-frame ladder while removing a duct system. The employee's head struck the ground floor.
An employee was helping to move some roofing equipment and was walking on the flat roof when he stepped into standing water, slipped, and fell to the same level, breaking his lower left leg.

An employee was feeding coil into a coil line machine. While readjusting the coil, the employee's gloved right hand was caught in the rollers. A strip of skin was removed from the employee's right index finger. The coil machine was unguarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was on a scaffold finishing a ceiling with plaster when a pin came out of the scaffold, causing it to move. The employee lost balance and fell 6 feet to ground level, breaking the right ankle.

An employee was operating an excavator to clear trees when a tree shifted in the bucket and broke through the front window of the machine. The tree came in contact with the travel controls, pushing them into the forward position. The machine moved forward farther into the tree, causing it to go through the cab and forcing the employee out the back window of the machine. The employee then attempted to re-enter the machine to shut it down. At this point, the moving machine caused the moving branch of the tree to strike the employee's left hand, smashing and lacerating the ring finger. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was picking up safety cones on the interstate and placing them into the back of a pickup truck when he lost his balance and fell beside the truck. The rear wheel of the truck then struck and broke his right ankle, requiring hospitalization.

An employee used a step ladder to get onto a flat trailer and then climbed onto a precast plank. At the same time, a crane was lowering clamps onto a nearby plank to lift it. As the crane lifted the plank off of the truck, the plank came toward the employee. He jumped from the precast plank and trailer to the ground and landed on large rocks. His left leg rolled, breaking his left ankle. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was standing on planking located on the top buck of a two-end frame, tubular-welded frame scaffold when one of the scaffold planks broke, causing the employee to fall 10 feet to the ground below. The employee suffered a fractured hip and two fractured ribs.

An employee was trying to throw out construction debris contained in a wheel barrow. The employee went through an unlatched gate on the third floor of a five floor building while attempting to enter a hoist. The hoist was located on the second floor. The employee fell three stories, suffering a dislocated shoulder, possible leg fractures, and a sprained wrist. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was rolling out roof insulation between the purlins when the employee fell to a concrete slab below, suffering head injuries (blunt force trauma) and broken bones.
An employee twisted his back while maneuvering a wheel barrow full of concrete through a building that is under construction.
An employee was directing concrete operations when he became dehydrated and was hospitalized.

An employee was putting straps on steel beams by hand. The smaller beams were being moved by two employees using a long reach arm excavator. A larger steel I-beam flipped and rolled off the block it was on and pinned the employee's ankle to the ground, fracturing it.
An employee was installing a metal roof on a non-residential building when he fell approximately 16 feet to the ground below, breaking both wrists. He was hospitalized.
An employee fell 12 feet to the ground while performing electrical work, suffering a punctured lung, broken rib, and back fractures.

While installing a sewer line using the horizontal directional drilling method, an employee was helping to add a drill stem to the tail string when his hand got too close to the nylon sling and the drill pipe and was crushed between the two. His right hand was amputated.
An employee was installing glass on ground level when wind blew a door from its hinges on the second floor. The door struck the employee, who suffered broken neck vertebrae.

An employee was descending on an angled concrete embankment when his right foot slipped downward and shifted his body weight to his left foot. This caused his left ankle to rotate laterally, fracturing it.
An employee was descending a ladder when the ladder shifted and the employee fell 10 feet resulting in a fractured left foot and elbow.

Two employees were replacing a water pump on a flatbed truck. The water pump had been raised underneath the truck with a jack. The injured employee had just finished removing the bolts that attached the old water pump to the rest of the vehicle, and was attempting to lower the pump to the ground with a floor jack. The second employee attempted to release pressure off of the hydraulic floor jack in order to lower the old part to the ground while the injured employee was attempting to hold the part steady on the jack while it was lowered. The jack lowered faster than expected and the injured employee lost his grip on the part, which rolled off of the jack and onto his abdomen. He suffered blunt force trauma to his abdomen and a torn intestine.
An employee was fixing the gate to a silo at a concrete batch plant when the gate fell and caught his right thumb, resulting in an amputation.
An employee moved a bundle of sheetrock in order to look behind it but it fell on his leg, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was finishing up on an interior wall from a baker scaffold when the scaffold fell over. The employee fell over 10 feet and suffered a head injury.

An employee bent down to retrieve his keys, which had fallen on the ground in the loading dock area. As he grabbed them, he lost his balance and used the dock's railing to support himself. The railing then collapsed and he fell about 5 feet to the concrete floor, suffering two broken ribs and a fractured pelvis. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cleaning and maintaining switch gears when an arc flash occurred resulting in burns to the employee's right arm.

An employee was painting from a mobile scaffold that was 6 feet by 3 feet and three frames high. The scaffold had railings on three sides and no railings at the wall side. The employee was cleaning his painting trail when other employees moved the scaffold about 2 to 3 feet from the wall. At that point, the employee lost his balance and fell about 16 feet to the concrete floor, fracturing both ankles. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was getting off the roof of a single story house using a ladder. While getting on the ladder from the roof, he stepped on the first course tile adjacent to the ladder and it broke, causing him to lose his balance and fall about 10 feet to the driveway. He fractured his left femur, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was removing plywood from a roof when he fell approximately 12 feet to the ground, breaking his arm and dislocating a vertebral disc. He was hospitalized.

An employee was moving a pallet of material with a non-mechanized pallet lift. The employee lost their balance and grabbed onto the lift, tipping it over and causing the lift to strike the employee's foot. The employee sustained a foot fracture requiring hospitalization.
An employee was climbing a ladder with a sharp bladed tool when it impaled his right knee as he raised his leg to climb.
An employee was removing trash on the first floor near a wall opening when the employee slipped and fell off the building to the ground, suffering multiple internal injuries.

An employee was reversing a truck into a parking space. He had opened the door to get a better view when he accelerated instead of pushing the brake. The truck went over the curb and he was thrown on the ground against the cement boards (parking stops), breaking a rib and two vertebrae. He was hospitalized.
While in the process of sandblasting, an employee lost control of the hose and sandblasted his leg. He was hospitalized with severe abrasions and raspberry burns to his leg.
An employee was walking across a warehouse roof when he fell through a deteriorated section and broke his leg, requiring hospitalization.
After a tree had been felled, a dead limb fell out of an adjacent tree and struck an employee in the back of the neck and back. He was hospitalized with a fractured neck and back.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut a piece of wood when the saw cut and amputated his left index fingertip.

An employee had just started going down a ladder (+/- 4 rungs) when one of her feet slipped off a rung, causing her to lose her balance. She attempted to catch herself, but was not able to stop her momentum backwards. She hit the concrete floor below, suffering traumatic damage to multiple body parts, including but not limited to her head, neck and shoulder.

An employee was operating a roller to roll the asphalt near a handicap post and sign. He pressed the vibration button while moving at around 1 to 2 miles an hour. The roller then drifted to the right, closer to the sign. As he neared the post, his hand was sliced by the sign.

At around 3:30 PM, an employee was using a tool to pry open a manhole to clear the main drain line when the tool slipped while his thumb was in the manhole. The manhole lid then came down on his left thumb and severed it above the knuckle.

An employee was walking backwards while operating a concrete burnisher when he tripped over a protruding pipe and fell. The burnisher handle then hit his abdomen, perforating his bowel and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was inspecting a leaking roof when he fell approximately 39 inches to a lower roof, fracturing his left wrist and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was setting up the excavation with lamp light and fell into the excavation after his glasses fogged up. The employee sustained a fractured rib.
An employee was cutting a piece of plywood with a portable saw when the tool lacerated his right thumb.

On April 19, 2018, at around 9:00 AM, an employee was standing on the tailgate at the back of his pickup truck trying to get something out when he slipped and fell backwards off the truck to the ground. The employee was admitted to the hospital due to a fractured vertebrae and compressed lower back disc.

An employee was cutting a piece of lumber with a cut-off saw when the piece collapsed and pinched the saw blade, causing the saw to 
kick back. The employee lost control of the saw, and it contacted/lacerated his left bicep.
An employee was climbing up an extension ladder and fell about half-way up (6 feet) onto loose conduit on the ground resulting in a broken leg near the ankle and hospitalization for surgery.

An employee was riding on the back of a truck as part of an escort crew for milling equipment on a road construction project. The truck stopped and the employee was ejected, hitting his head on the pavement.
An employee was climbing a stepladder, slipped on the fourth rung and fell approximately four feet to the asphalt ground resulting in a broken right wrist and a bruised right hip.

An employee was moving an electric buggy to gain access to an electric pallet jack. While operating the buggy in reverse, the employee was pinned between the buggy and a new loader tire resulting in a fractured left tibia and fibula.

An employee was directing a lull operator. The employee jumped onto the back of the unbalanced lull, slipped and fell striking their face on the lull. The employee sustained a laceration and fracture to the face and a fractured foot.
An employee was preparing a site when construction equipment backed over the employee's leg, fracturing the tibia.
An employee slipped and fell while getting out of his delivery truck. He landed on the concrete pavement, suffering four broken ribs and a hematoma. He was hospitalized.
An employee was drilling holes into asphalt to install a pin barrier when the drill bit dislodged, striking the top of his right foot and causing a laceration, contusion, and broken bone.
On April 20, 2018, an employee suffered an electrical shock.

Employees were setting trusses on a multi-family apartment building. A truss was leaning against another truss when it tipped over, swung down, and struck an employee in the shoulder. The employee suffered a shoulder fracture, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was holding a rope that was used to secure equipment when a second employee cut the rope from below. The rope then severed the first employee's right thumb.

Two employees were repairing a broken gas line on the roof of a commercial business. One of the employees was stepping off of the roof and onto a ladder when he fell to the ground, injuring his skull and puncturing a lung. He was hospitalized.
An employee was operating an aerial lift when the main control feed line ruptured, injecting fluid into his right palm.
An employee was removing grounds when he was electrically shocked by induced voltage coming off an existing 138 KV line.
An employee was preparing to groove a pipe when his left pointer finger was pulled into the groove machine, sustaining a fracture and cut.
An employee was working from stilts when his stilt broke and he fell to the floor, breaking his right fibula and tibia.

On April 21, 2018, at approximately 11:30 a.m., an employee was on top of a walk-in freezer performing contracting electrical work, installing J-hooks and cables on the inside of a rooftop, when he fell 23 feet to the concrete floor below, damaging his ankles and back.

An employee was operating a fuel truck on a construction access road when it struck a berm and flipped. The employee was hospitalized with fractures to the right shoulder, lumbar spine, left leg, right finger, and ribs.

Employees were hoisting a motor for an elevator with a gantry crane. The crane tipped over and the top support beam for the gantry crane struck an employee in the left leg. The employee suffered a broken and dislocated left foot.

An employee was using a lattice boom crawler crane to unload a 20-ton section of anchor chain from a vessel. As the employee was moving the anchor chain with the crane, the crane flipped over. The employee jumped out of the cab as the crane was flipped over was injured. The employee sustained broken teeth, a severe pelvic ring injury with sacral fracture, and vertebral disc herniation in the L3-L5 and L5-S1 areas.

An employee was helping another employee weld a truck when the truck rolled. The back tire then pinned the employee in the hip area, requiring hospitalization. The truck wheels were not chocked at the time of the incident.
An employee was crushed between a truck and a trailer resulting in a fractured and lacerated arm.
An employee was tearing off a roof when a tool in his hand came into contact with an overhead powerline. He suffered an electrical shock.

An employee was guiding a crane that was hoisting an air conditioning unit onto the roof. The crane released and the unit fell, snapping a riser clamp against the employee's right index finger, which was crushed and amputated.

An employee was operating a forklift with a hopper attachment to dump trash in a dumpster. While releasing the handle to allow dumping, the employee placed his left hand between the hopper and the forklift tine to reach up to release the lever. When it released, the weight shifted, pinching his left ring finger between the hopper and the forklift tine. This resulted in a crushing injury that required amputation to left ring fingertip.
On April 23, 3018, an employee stepped back and fell approximately one story though a hole in the floor to a concrete floor below. He broke his wrist, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was helping to place a pin into a shoe bolt on a frame that was being raised and lowered by a forklift when material slipped and smashed the employee's left middle finger. The finger had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was on a ladder taping off a window for paint when he fell to the ground, breaking his back.
An employee was under a boom lift and while the boom lift was being lowered the employee lifted his head striking the boom lift resulting in a concussion and laceration to the head.
While unloading scaffold materials from a flatbed truck, an employee slipped off the truck and dislocated his right ankle.
An employee was using a circular saw when it lacerated the employee's pinky finger, requiring surgery.
An employee was installing siding on a wall from a scaffold when he fell about 8 to 10 feet to the ground below, fracturing his ankle and suffering other injuries.
An employee was cutting rebar with a cut-off saw when the employee's clothing caught fire, causing burns to approximately 70% of the employee's body.

An employee was using a cat's paw tool to pull out a screw when the screw popped out and hit his eye, scratching his cornea and iris. He was hospitalized. Safety glasses were not worn at the time of the incident.
A employee was fastening a structural member at a roof eave strut when the employee fell from the eave and landed on a concrete slab, suffering a broken pelvis, broken nose, and contusions.

An employee was tensioning a come-a-long that was attached to a brace plate. The injured employee noticed the come-a-long needed adjustments and stopped work. As the injured employee straddled the come-along to make adjustments, the come-a-long broke free and hit/fractured his left leg.
An employee was walking in the parking lot from one office to another when she tripped and fell between the curb and sidewalk, breaking her left leg and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using a powered saw to cut a piece of wood that was supported by two saw horses when the saw cut his hand. He was hospitalized.
An employee lost control of a chainsaw and lacerated his right thigh. Personal protective equipment was not worn at the time.
An employee was tightening a screw cap on a pipe when the cap broke loose and struck the employee's face, breaking bones in the cheek and below the eye. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was installing metal trusses when he fell approximately 15 feet before he was caught by his harness' fall protection system. He landed on his feet and then fell to the ground, breaking an arm and elbow. He was hospitalized.

While covering vent systems with plastic, an employee stepped onto a hole cover for a vent shaft and the cover gave way. The employee then fell from the 16th floor to the 5th floor in the vent shaft, fracturing both ankles and three vertebrae and suffering several lacerations.
An employee was struck by a cap that was installed on a 12" water line. The cap blew apart, striking and amputating his right leg.
An employee was installing metal decking when a sheet moved off its support. He then fell to the next level and broke 5 to 6 ribs.

After cutting a hole in a concrete wall, an employee was attempting to pick up a pallet when the employee slipped and fell through the hole, falling approximately 10 feet to the concrete floor on the other side. The employee suffered cracked ribs and was hospitalized.
An employee was rolling metal material in the rolling machine and pinched their left index finger in the roller.
On April 26, 2018, an employee fell from a single-story garage onto the concrete below, suffering a fractured skull, punctured lung, and fractured ribs.

An employee was cutting rebar using a 4-inch grinder when it started to spark and created a fire. The sparks ignited his vest and sweater, and he received a burn to the right side of his abdomen and chest.

An employee was hooking up a trailer to a truck. His left index finger was on the trailer tongue when the tongue dropped over the truck ball, catching and partially amputating his finger between the trailer and the truck.

An employee was using a gas-powered pressure washer inside the basement of a residential construction site to wash out the concrete floor when he started to feel dizzy and was overcome by carbon monoxide poisoning. He was hospitalized.
An employee was driving an ATV and struck a tree resulting in a fractured left femur.

An employee simultaneously rolled two test coupons to prepare them for a pre-test for a new welder. A coupon consists of the end of a pipe and weighs about 50 pounds. The employee's left thumb was pinched between the two rolling coupons, tearing the tissue from the thumb tip, which required surgical removal of about 1 mm of bone.

Two employees were moving a dolly containing sheet rock when a wheel became caught on top of a drain. When they tried to free the dolly, some of the sheet rock fell. One of the employees tried to stop the sheet rock but was struck, breaking a leg, knee, and ankle.

An employee was walking next to a pipe that was being moved with a forklift when the synthetic strap slipped off the pipe and one side of the pipe fell onto the top of the employee's foot behind the protective steel toe. The employee sustained a dislocated big toe and open and closed fractures.
An employee slipped and fell while descending a fixed ladder. The employee's hard hat then lacerated the back of the employee's head.

An employee was running a jumper on a dead-end structure when an electrical event occurred. He received electrical burns to his forearm, the underside of his bicep area, and his left-side torso, requiring hospitalization.

An employee went to close a breaking machine. When he grabbed the handle he reached over the top of the machine to secure the handle with his left hand. He then pulled the handle and lost his balance. His right hand slipped into the pinch point, which closed on and amputated his right pinky fingertip.
An employee lost his balance while exiting from a ladder onto a one-story roof.  He fell, hit the roof, and then fell to the ground, landing on his feet. He fractured his right ankle and left heel.
An employee was installing insulation in a home. As he was closing an open hurricane-resistant window, it came down on his left pinky finger and severely lacerated it.

An employee was having his dump truck loaded by a front end loader. When loading was completed, the employee jumped off the truck to talk to the operator of the front end loader and stumbled onto the dirt between the cab and the loader tires. The employee sustained a knee fracture, a shoulder injury and a forehead abrasion.

An employee was painting a wall from a 32-foot extension ladder when the ladder slipped out, causing the employee to fall 14 feet to the ground. The employee suffered hip, pelvic, and humerus fractures.
An employee was cutting wooden forms from a scissor lift when an 8-foot piece of wood form struck his left thumb, amputating it at the first knuckle.
An employee was cutting a piece of iron pipe with a chop saw when the saw kicked back and lacerated his left cheek, requiring stitches.

Employees had placed netting on the ground to capture debris. The injured employee stepped backward over the mesh netting and his foot became caught. He then fell, fracturing his right arm at the elbow.
An employee was installing shingles from a ladder when the employee fell 20 feet to the ground, fracturing the left wrist and left arm.
An employee was installing step bolts on a pole while standing on a metal plate that was 28 inches from the ground when the employee slipped and fell, sustaining a laceration injury.
An employee was moving a scaffold when he slipped on some stones and fell off a retaining wall onto his side, breaking ribs.

An employee climbed on the back of a pickup truck bed after he finished picking up signs off the side of the road. The driver was driving the pickup truck along the interstate shoulder going eastbound toward the jobsite when the employee fell off the vehicle, striking his head on the ground and requiring hospitalization. He was wearing a hard hat when he fell.

An employee finished rigging and was walking in an area where a crew was loading an exchanger bundle on a trailer when the load shifted, pinning the employee between the active load and an adjacent stationary load. The employee suffered a fractured left femur and pelvis.
An employee was trying to loosen a pipe with a wrench and a vice stand when the wrench slipped and the employee fell, dislocating and fracturing the right ankle.

An employee was using a core drill to dill holes into a concrete wall when his sweatshirt was caught in the rotating shaft, which then drew his right arm into the shaft. He suffered a compound fracture of the radius and ulna of his right forearm.
An employee's foot was run over and bruised by a road grader.
An employee slipped after stepping off a rebar wall, suffering a fractured bone in the right shin.

On May 2, 2018, an employee was observing a crane lift when the load shifted and struck the employee, pinching him between a demolished walkway and existing handrail. He suffered six broken ribs, two broken transverse processes, a lacerated kidney and a lacerated liver, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was on top of a cooler removing conduit when he struck his head on the ceiling while wearing his hard hat. He was hospitalized with a pinched nerve in his C7 vertebra.
An employee was operating a hydraulic machine when it amputated three fingers.

An employee was part of a crew that was reconstructing an apron in front of a house in a safety work zone when a passenger vehicle entered the work zone and struck the employee. The employee suffered fractures to bones near the right ankle.

On May 3, 2018, an employee was opening the concrete composite cover of a hand hole with a screwdriver when the cover slipped off the screwdriver and fell on the employee's finger, pinching off the fingertip.
On May 2, 2018, an employee suffered heat stress after working outside to finish concrete. He was hospitalized.

A load of steel was being moved with a powered industrial truck. An employee was guiding the load while walking down a corridor when he lost his grip on the tagline and attempted to stabilize the load with his hand. The load then pinned his hand against the wall, fracturing it.

An employee set up an extension ladder in the back of a building near a rooftop unit that needed service. While he was on the ladder a strong gust of wind from an approaching storm caused him and the ladder to fall approximately 10 to 15 feet onto the concrete sidewalk below. He fractured his right ankle and fibula, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was manually turning over a dock plate that was sitting flat on the lifts of a forklift truck in preparation for installation. The dock plate consisted of two metal pieces connected by a hinge. Three of the employee's right-hand fingertips were caught and amputated in the hinge.
An employee was removing a pipe when he lost his balance and twisted his back, causing inflammation to an existing back injury. He was hospitalized.

An employee was unfolding the fixed ladder on a concrete mixer truck when he lost hold of it as it was being lowered down, causing it to fall quickly. His left index finger was then pinched in the hinge where the ladder unfolds.

An employee was trying to connect a drive to duct work when it became stuck. He pulled on the drive, which released and knocked his safety glasses out of the way, lacerating his eye. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

On May 4, 2018, an employee started to build a scaffold when the vertical scaffold leg fell and hit the cross braces. The employee's left ring finger was caught between the cross braces and the vertical scaffold leg. His left ring fingertip was amputated (no bone loss).

An employee was running new overhead powerlines from a lift when the lift's bucket contacted a pole insulator and moved unexpectedly, throwing him against the side of the bucket and the pole insulator. He strained a back ligament and was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a rider hand truck and struck a guardrail and the right side of the hand truck struck an order picker. The employee suffered an oblique fracture to the first phalanx of his foot, requiring hospitalization.

While walking through a building that was under construction an employee stepped onto a portion of the floor where the tiling was uneven. The employee lost balance and fell, fracturing the left ankle.

An employee was on a ladder installing fire alarm wiring in a new construction building when the employee lost balance. The employee reached out to brace themselves and grabbed a metal stud that was part of the framing, suffering a hand laceration.
An employee fell approximately 14 feet from a scaffold while installing siding and dislocated a shoulder, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was operating an excavator to drag a swamp mat. The excavator was going around a fallen tree when it pivoted and the weight of the swamp mat caused the excavator to pivot up and down. The employee suffered a pelvic fracture and broken bones.
An employee was spraying weed killer from a 4-wheeler when the 4-wheeler's throttle malfunctioned and got stuck. The employee tried to turn the 4-wheeler and fell off resulting in a broken arm.
An employee was cutting steel with a torch on an elevated expressway structure. As he was lighting the torch, he was burned on both ears, the front of his face, and neck.

An employee was operating an excavator when it tipped on the edge of the road adjacent to a trench. This caused the employee to fall against the inside of the cab resulting in hospitalization for broken ribs, a punctured lung, and a bruised spleen.
An employee was grinding a piece of metal and set the grinder down. Their hand made contact with the grinder before it stopped spinning. Two fingers on the left hand were cut.

Two employees were cutting a plaster bulkhead from a scaffold when the cut piece fell and tipped the scaffold over. One of the employees suffered a broken jaw, facial lacerations, and a possible broken leg.

Two employees were installing siding from an aluminum plank that was between two step ladders when the plank gave way, allowing them to fall to the ground. One employee sustained a sprained ankle, while the other sustained multiple fractures to his left leg. One employee was hospitalized.
An employee was running a cement mixer when the employee's left hand was caught between the paddles inside the mixer, resulting in the amputation of the employee's middle, ring, and pinky fingers.
An employee was using a miter saw to cut the end of a wood piece when the saw lacerated the employee's right hand between the thumb and index finger.
An employee fell 24 feet to the ground while erecting a concrete wall form. The employee suffered a right arm fracture and laceration, pelvic fracture, rib fracture, and vertebra fracture.
An employee was working from a ladder using a grinder when he slipped and cut his left forearm.  He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was erecting scaffold and fell 15 feet from the top of a mobile scaffold to the pavement below, suffering a chin laceration and broken ribs.
An employee was attempting to dislodge a stuck pin in a sheet shackle when the pin engaged after being struck and caught the employee's fingertip, resulting in a fingertip amputation (no bone loss).
An employee was relighting a residential pilot light when a fire/explosion occurred. The employee was hospitalized with second degree burns to the face and arms.
An employee was helping to unload a concrete pole from a pole trailer when it fell onto the employee's leg, breaking it.
