An employee was on a scaffold removing duct from overhead when the employee lost balance and fell 4 feet to the floor, suffering a broken hip.

On Wednesday, May 9, 2018, at approximately 11:15 a.m., an employee was removing transite panels on a construction site when he lost his balance and fell 4.5 feet to the ground. His left ankle struck a small pile of brick rubble. He was hospitalized with a possible broken ankle and abrasions to the left forearm. A lanyard was not connected at the time of the incident.

An employee was in a bucket connecting parts on a pole when a wire in the employee's left hand touched something and caused an arc flash (7,200 volts), burning the top and palm of the employee's hand.
An employee was working in a 4-foot-deep excavation applying epoxy to welds when the employee became ill with heat cramps. The employee was hospitalized for heat exposure.
An employee was setting trusses at a building when he slipped and fell 5 to 8 feet, dislocating his ankle. Fall protection was worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was on the fourth step of an 8-foot ladder removing a piece of HVAC duct work from the ceiling while a coworker supported the duct work from the floor. The coworker lost control of the duct work and it swung down and knocked over the ladder, causing the employee to fall to the ground. The employee suffered a fractured right scapula, fractured right clavicle, and seven fractured ribs.
An employee was cutting a tree off of a communication line when the tree snapped and the tension on the line flipped the tree/limb back onto the employee, striking his forearm and fracturing a bone.
An employee fell in the parking lot, sustaining two fractured elbows and a laceration to the forehead.
An employee was using an air nailer to perform framing work when the nailer shot a nail into his chest.

Three employees were manually offloading a steel H-brace from a utility trailer. As the crew was attempting to push the brace away from the trailer, the brace slid down and struck one employee across both knees. The employee suffered a fracture to the left knee and a 4-inch laceration above the left knee.

An employee was ripping and cutting sheeter sidings (a piece of wood) on a table saw when he attempted to flick a piece of wood out of the table saw area. His hand was then caught on the saw blade, amputating his index and ring fingers.

An employee wrapped a rope around a truck crane outrigger leg to use as an anchor to lower a large jack from a steel utility pole. The rope was wrapped once around the outrigger leg and when the jack started lowering from the utility pole, the rope let out quickly and knocked the employee off their feet falling onto the ground. The employee suffered a fractured right hip and left scapula.
An employee was operating an off-road vehicle when he lost control of the vehicle and it rolled. He suffered a broken left radial bone and a fractured left foot.

An employee was hydro blasting a vertical pipe with a lancer to unclog the pipe.  When the material that was clogging the pipe broke free, it knocked the lancer out of the pipe. The employee was then hit on the left arm by the lancer water pressure, suffering a laceration.
An employee suffered a heart attack while laying water line pipe at a construction project.
On 5/11/2018, an employee was signing a truck call ticket when a truck driver struck and ran over his feet. He suffered fractures to both feet as well as his tibia and fibula. He was hospitalized.

An employee was installing painter's tape around a window while standing about 12 feet up on a 24-foot extension ladder. After he finished the installation, he was descending when he slipped and fell about 8 feet onto the sandy ground below, resulting in a micro-fissure fracture on his L-2 vertebra. He was hospitalized.

An employee was ripping off shingles from a single-story residential re-roofing project when the employee stepped on a piece of loose felt and slipped from the roof, falling to the ground and injuring the right elbow.
An employee fell approximately 30 feet onto the driveway of a gated garage. He was then struck and run over by a car, sustaining femur and jaw injuries, loss of teeth, and a collapsed lung.

On May 14, 2018, an employee was working on a sheet metal roof and started to experience symptoms related to heat illness. The employee was admitted to the hospital for heat exhaustion and dehydration.

On 05/14/2018, at approximately 2:45 PM, an employee was working from a 12-foot fiberglass A-frame step ladder. The employee was using a drill to install conduit for a junction box when he fell 8-9 feet from the ladder onto the concrete floor below, fracturing his right/left wrists and lacerating his face above the left eye. He was hospitalized for surgery and stitches. Proper PPE was worn at the time.

An employee was walking with a mini-excavator that was carrying a sewer vault in a marked construction zone on a public roadway. A privately owned vehicle sped through the zone, causing the employee to step sideways into the path of the mini-excavator. The mini-excavator then struck and broke his leg.
Two employees were moving and tilting a large steel beam when it suddenly fell over and struck the injured employee's right and left shins. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

The employee was stripping some forms using a crowbar when the crowbar slipped, causing him to lose his balance. He then put all his weight down on his right foot and rolled his ankle. His ankle suffered a fracture and required surgery.
An employee was pouring concrete when the concrete pump truck struck and knocked him to the ground, bruising his ribs. He was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a jointer/lathe when a small strand from his protective gloves became caught in the machine. The small strand forced his right index finger into the blade of the rotary spindle and he sustained a partial amputation to his right index fingertip.
At around 10 a.m., on 5/14/2018, an employee was weed-eating in a shipyard when he experienced a headache, dizziness, and cramps. He was hospitalized due to dehydration and low sodium levels.
On May 14, 2018, an employee was helping a co-worker load a compressor onto a truck when he was caught between the compressor and the truck frame, fracturing his pelvis.
On 5/14/2018, an employee fell off a roof to the ground that was approximately 16 feet high, breaking both ankles and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was pressure testing a fuel tank and void tank on a boat. Liquid was coming out of the pot into the test hose when the T-bar hatch blew off, striking the employee in the left knee and face and knocking him onto his back. He suffered a fractured tibia and broken nose.

An employee was disconnecting gauges from a condenser when a valve failed to close, releasing refrigerant from the system. The employee attempted to shut the valve with a wrench and was exposed to refrigerant, receiving a chemical burn to the right hand.

An employee was working on a two-story condo unit's roof area when he slipped and fell from the roof, hitting an air conditioning unit before hitting the ground. He sustained fractures to his left-side ribs.

An employee was using a hand held drill to mix concrete when he noticed the mixing pedal was coming loose. He tried to tighten it and his left glove became caught in the mixer, which then amputated his left pinky. The mixer was running at the time.

An employee was preparing girder #2 to be raised from the ground and put in position with girder #1. He was standing on top of girder #2, which was approximately 9 feet high, when girder #1 rolled over and fell. He heard the noise and jumped from girder #2 to avoid being struck. He fell and hit his head, suffering a left eye bruise and multiple facial fractures.
While walking alongside an excavator, an employee tripped on a curb. The employee's left ankle was run over by the excavator track, breaking bones above the ankle and in the foot.
An employee was climbing onto the operator's seat of a digger derrick when he lost his balance and fell backwards 6 to 8 feet to the ground. He suffered a lower back compression fracture.
On May 15, 2018, an employee was spotting for an excavator that was pulling a tree when a tree branch whiplashed and struck his hip, fracturing his pelvis and requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell from an A-frame ladder to the ground while installing duct wrap insulation, fracturing the right leg.

An employee was re-spooling a chain on a machine used to spray insulation. As he finished, the machine energized and two of his left-hand fingers where caught in the chain, amputating one and fracturing the other.

An employee was servicing and cleaning an air handler when back pressure (air) from the unit caused it to spin backwards.  The employee attempted to grab the belt with his gloved hand and it was pulled into the pulley, amputating a fingertip.
An employee was using a pneumatic nail gun to install asphalt shingles on a residential roof when the nail gun brushed his head and was triggered, shooting a nail into his head. He was hospitalized.

An employee was exiting the roof and stepped onto a tied off ladder. The ladder shifted and the employee fell 20 feet, sustaining two fractured ribs, a fractured collarbone, and a head laceration that required stitches.
An employee was using an elevator to bring materials to co-workers. He had been at work for about 1 hour when he started feeling dizzy due to a possible heat-related illness.

On May 16, 2018, an employee was replacing windows on the fourth floor of an apartment building when the employee fell out of a window to the ground below. The employee broke both legs and wrists, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was putting nuts and washers on bolts while standing on an 8-foot A-frame ladder that was in the closed position when the ladder slipped. The employee fell and struck his head on the concrete below, suffering head trauma and a skull fracture.

An employee was holding a piece of siding in position with his left hand so he could nail it in place. His right hand slipped while positioning the nail gun and the nail shot into his left hand, puncturing it and possibly fracturing one bone. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was cleaning up debris at a demolition site when the employee's hand was pinched between a backhoe bucket and a concrete wall, amputating the right middle fingertip.
An employee was pulling wire and installing conduit and suffered a heart attack.
An employee was going up a roof hatch ladder when the employee slipped and fell approximately 12 feet to the concrete floor, fracturing the right femur, right pelvis, and multiple ribs.

On May 17, 2018, an employee and a coworker were preparing to move steel plates. The coworker had the steel plates lifted with a pry bar while the employee's hand was placing a clamp under them. The coworker removed the pry bar, which caused the steel plates to fall onto the employee's left middle finger and resulted in an amputation.
An employee was using a shovel and digging to locate a gas line when the employee began to feel symptoms of heat exhaustion, including muscle cramps, nausea, and dizziness.
An employee was helping to spray concrete when he fainted due to dehydration, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was retrieving electrical wires with a tugger machine when a pulley or wheel mounted on the wall came free and hit her legs, fracturing her left leg and bruising her right leg.
An employee was cutting a 2x4 with a circular saw when the blade contacted and deeply cut his left wrist, wounding the muscle and nerves. He was hospitalized.

On May 18, 2018, an employee was performing rooftop work with a coworker when the coworker left the roof to get a drill from a vehicle. The employee walked to the neighboring building's metal roof, stepped on a fiberglass skylight, and fell through to the concrete below. The employee was hospitalized with a shattered left elbow and fractured left arm.
An employee was rigging steel on a truck bed when he was caught between a steel column and the truck bed, suffering an 8-inch gash on his left inner thigh and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using a rivet buster to break up a concrete floor for demolition when the employee fell through the working level to the level below, suffering a concussion.

An employee was walking on the right side of equipment in a blind spot. The equipment operator maneuvered right to avoid another piece of equipment, and the front right tire caught the injured employee's legs and pinned him to the ground. He sustained a back injury and potential pelvic fracture.
An employee was cutting timber logging with a chainsaw in an upward direction with the top of the chainsaw bar when the chainsaw kicked down, cutting the top of his foot.

Three carpenters were removing glass from a crate. Two employees placed the glass on the cart while the injured employee was at the end of the crate. The glass began to tip and the injured employee attempted to stop the glass from falling. The glass pinned the injured employee's leg to the ground resulting in leg bruising.

An employee was working from the extended boom/basket of a bucket truck. The outriggers of the bucket truck were not set on solid ground, resulting in the outrigger sinking into the ground as the boom was further extended. The truck became unstable and collapsed with the employee inside the basket. He rode the bucket to the ground and fractured his back and ribs.

An employee was working from drywall stilts while installing a ceiling grid when he lost his balance and fell to the concrete floor. He sustained a concussion, skull fracture, fractured sphenoid bone, subdual hematoma, and intracerebral hemorrhage.

Employees were relocating a VFD to its installation location using a rough terrain forklift. The load was not secured at the time and as the forklift changed gears from 2nd to 1st, the load swayed and fell off the forklift, striking the injured employee in the leg. The employee's leg broke above the knee.

An employee was using a jackhammer to break rock in an excavation when a section of asphalt (approximately 2 feet by 2 feet by 8 inches) broke away and struck his left leg, fracturing his tibia. Person protection equipment was worn at the time.

An employee was moving a cart out of an elevator when a metal plank contacted the handrail on the opposite side, creating a pinch point between the plank and the handle on the cart. The employee's right middle finger was caught in the pinch point, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was in bucket replacing a utility pole when he contacted an energized powerline (7,200 volts) and received second and third degree burns to the upper left arm.
An employee was operating a circular saw at a residential construction site when the saw kicked back and lacerated the employee's right leg. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was placing skids for pipes that needed to be unloaded when a mechanical lifting device failed, allowing a steel pipe to hit the employee's right leg. The employee sustained a broken right femur.

An employee was sweeping debris from a roof when the employee stepped into an 18-inch by 18-inch hole that was covered with an unsecured piece of metal before falling 14 more feet to the concrete below. The employee suffered a broken right elbow and right wrist.
On 5/21/2018, an employee was inside an aerial lift and raising it when the employee's right hand became pinched, causing a laceration that resulted in a right pinky finger amputation.

An employee was hand loading demolition concrete into a backhoe bucket. When he adjusted the broken concrete in the bucket his right hand was caught between the concrete and the bucket, cutting and breaking his right index finger. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cleaning the top of a tank trailer when he fell to the ground, breaking his femur.
An employee was dewatering the work site. A guy line on a drill came loose and knocked a live electrical powerline into the employee, shocking his forearm. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting a window sill with a chop saw when the saw cut his left index finger, resulting in an amputation.

An employee was down in a culvert directing an excavator operator who was moving a 24-inch cast iron pipe. The rigging slipped from the excavator and the pipe struck the employee's left leg, possibly fracturing it. He was hospitalized.
An employee was climbing up a ladder to inspect a roof for a leak when he fell to the ground, injuring his arm and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was lifting an outrigger float (pad) off a crane when the outrigger swung around and the float slid off, pinching the employee's right middle finger between the deck of the crane and the float. His right middle finger distal tip was amputated.

An employee was using a jack hammer on the fourth floor of a four-story concrete garage when the jackhammer broke through the floor. The employee then fell approximately 10 feet to the floor below, suffering a back fracture.

An employee was hoisting an elevator platform when the rope broke, causing the elevator to fall into the pit. The employee's left index finger was then caught between the elevator platform and the rail (where the elevator moves up and down), resulting in an amputation to the second knuckle.

On May 22, 2018, at approximately 8:40 a.m., an employee was in the enclosed cab of an excavator preparing the ground for the installation of a silt fence. While the employee was digging around the base of a dead oak tree, a limb broke off of the top of the tree and fell onto the cab of the excavator. The limb shattered the glass sunroof, and the employee was struck by glass and broken limbs.  The employee was hospitalized for a skin graph to the right index finger, cut on the head and cheek, and bruise to the hand and shoulder.
An employee was running wiring when it became stuck. He then contacted a live 480-volt bus bar and an arc flash occurred, burning his left hand and wrist.
An employee was cutting down a tree when a branch hit the chain saw he was operating, causing the saw to lacerate his left leg above the knee.
While transferring from a ladder to the roof of a single-story house, an employee lost balance and fell 12 feet to the ground, breaking an ankle.
An employee who prepared roads for asphalt patching exhibited dehydration symptoms and began to have chest pains. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was tightening a coupling on a piping system that was under pressure. The coupling failed and the air pressure released and steam contacted the employee. The employee suffered stomach and facial burns and fractures.
An employee was climbing down a ladder scaffold when the employee fell about 3 feet to the concrete ground, fracturing an arm and the pelvis.
An employee was erecting a divider in a storage unit when the employee slipped and fell off of a 22" mobile scaffold. Part of the scaffold entered the employee's backside, causing a severe injury.
An employee was using a packet screw machine to build cabinets when the machine cut his right index fingertip.
An employee turned around after brazing a piece of copper wire; the back of his upper right arm contacted the hot pipe, and he was burned. He was hospitalized with a blood infection from the burn.
An employee fell while operating a demolition saw and cut his arm.
An employee was hooking blinds on an elevator lift for assembly. When the lift was lowered, the employee's left ring finger was next to a stop and was partially amputated.

The injured employee was operating part of the paving machine near a roller machine. The roller was being repositioned when it lunged forward instead of reversing. It pinned the injured employee's left leg between the roller and the paver, severely lacerating the leg from the thigh to the top of the ankle.
An employee was taking the pin out of an outrigger plate when his fingertips were caught under the plate and injured.
An employee was operating a drill press when the bit made contact with a cable, amputating a finger.
At 3:00 p.m., an employee was cutting a tree from the ground. A tree limb separated and rolled back on him, breaking bones in his hip, ribcage, and chest. He was hospitalized.
An employee was standing next to a pile of reinforcing steel. A bundle of the steel slipped off the pile, striking the employee's lower left leg and breaking a bone.
An employee was cutting trim with a table saw. While he was using a "push stick," his left index finger contacted the sawblade. The blade amputated his fingertip.
An employee was descending an extension ladder carrying a power tool. As he stepped down to the concrete floor, he slipped off the last rung, falling on his right elbow and fracturing it.

An employee was using an abrasive blaster when its hose caught on the platform he was working on. The blaster turned on the employee, and its steel shot caused an abrasion below his chin. The dead man's switch on the blaster had been disabled.

Throughout the day, the employee was driving a scooter and delivering 6-foot tables and chairs to booths. While standing next to another employee and discussing the daily tasks, the employee suffered a cardiac event and collapsed.
An employee was removing a gutter system from the back of his work truck when he slipped and struck his right knee on the truck bumper, suffering an abscess that became infected.
An employee was helping a carpenter put up some concrete forms. He was installing anchor bolts when he started having cramps in his feet, legs, and arms due to dehydration.

An employee was on a roof applying valley tin. The employee slipped on the valley tin and fell approximately 20 feet to the ground. The employee sustained lacerations to the face and arms. The employee's lanyard was unhooked at the time.
An employee was removing an old kitchen countertop when the countertop broke and fell on his right leg, lacerating the skin. He was hospitalized and required stitches.

A backhoe operator was exiting the cab of the backhoe when his wedding ring got caught in the door handle. When he stepped down, the momentum caused injury to the left ring finger that required partial amputation at the hospital.

An employee was working on an extension ladder that was being held by another employee cutting old wire off a pole. When the line was cut, the wire struck the employee on the ladder causing the employee to fall approximately 14 feet off the ladder. He fell onto a portable toilet and then onto asphalt. The employee sustained a six-inch laceration to the back of the head, broken ribs and fractured vertebrae in his back.

An employee was descending a ladder from a roof where he had been removing shingles. The ladder, which was set on a tarp on the ground, slid and the employee fell to the ground. The employee sustained a right ankle fracture and two fractured vertebrae.

An employee was trying to repair the winch line on a crane. The cable on the winch got twisted. The injured employee was on the base of the boom and was holding the cable from an access hole when the boom retracted all the way back smashing his right middle finger. The fingertip was amputated.

An employee was standing on an 8-foot A-frame ladder taping insulation to a duct. His shirt got caught on something and as he tried to wiggle free, he lost balance and fell off the ladder feet first. The impact with the ground fractured the employee's left foot.

An employee was going back through and tightening bolts on the girt that was recently placed. While sitting on and tightening a girt, a bolt snapped causing the girt to slide down. The employee's left leg was pinched between the girt and beam. The employee was hospitalized with a leg fracture.
An employee was decking on the 53rd floor while standing on a joist supported by props. He lost his footing and fell 7 feet, hitting a plumber stack and breaking his left tibia.

An employee was using a tread machine when it became stuck, causing the handle on the tread machine to spin and pinch the employee's left index finger between the machine and the bumper of the truck next to him, resulting in an amputation.
An employee was placing a post when his left ring finger was caught between the post and an excavator bucket, amputating his fingertip.
Employees were putting rebar together with chicken wire at a construction site when one employee became ill and dizzy, requiring hospitalization for heat exhaustion.
An employee was oiling a conveyor chain when his right index and middle fingers were caught between the chain and sprocket, resulting in amputations.
An employee was using a hammer when it struck his left index finger.
On May 31, 2018, at approximately 10:30 a.m., an employee was performing re-roofing operations when he fell from a two-story building, fracturing both of his ankles. He was hospitalized.
An employee was lifting a hydraulic driller (coring machine) from the ground when he injured his back, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was installing gutters on a patio roof. He was transitioning onto the patio roof from a ladder when the structure collapsed. The employee fell 9 to 10 feet to the ground, fracturing his right knee and separating his left shoulder.
An employee was walking down steps when her foot became stuck on a step and she fell, dislocating both ankles.
An employee fell from a track hoe, suffering a broken wrist and shoulder and neck injuries.

An employee was mixing mortar when a bag fell in the mortar mixer. The employee was attempting to retrieve it when the mixing paddle struck the employee's hand, breaking a finger and causing lacerations.

An employee was on the third rung of a 10-foot step ladder pulling wire when he fell off the ladder and broke his leg, requiring hospitalization. The ladder had a bad rear horizontal section at the time of the incident.
An employee was loosening bolts on a flange to drain water from a furnace header when he was contacted by condensate, burning his right and left forearms.
An employee was beginning to remove a cap off of equipment when it flew off and struck the employee in the head.

The headache rack on a forklift had come loose during transport. While unloading the forklift, the headache rack struck the employee on the side. The employee was hospitalized with rib fractures and a punctured lung.
An employee was walking on the jobsite, tripped over an elevated manhole and fell to the ground. The employee sustained a broken femur.

An employee was changing a screw driver drill bit while holding a hammer and small pry bar under one arm. The drill activated and caught the employee's glove and the pry bar resulting in amputation of the right index finger at the third knuckle.

An employee opened the transformer/fuse drawer and changed two medium voltage fuses while the drawer was de-energized. As the employee began to push the main power drawer (13,200 VAC./1,200 amps) back in an arc flash occurred. The arc blast energy and fire ball came out of the bottom door of the main power drawer and up. The employee was standing next to the main power drawer, on the bottom rung of a four-rung step ladder, when the fire ball engulfed his upper torso. The employee sustained second and third degree burns to his arms.

An employee was injured while working on a mobile scaffold inside of a water tank under construction. While in the mobile scaffold, the employee was struck by a 2X10 piece of lumber from above and hospitalized for a concussion.
An employee was working from a one-tier scaffold to install drywall sheets when he lost his balance and fell, breaking his left leg.

An employee was operating a lift vehicle when it became unbalanced and started to roll. The operator attempted to exit the vehicle, but was thrown out. The employee sustained head injuries and broken ribs.
An employee was preparing to install sprinkler pipes. While installing the pipe brackets, the beam clamp snapped onto his right index finger crushing it and resulting in amputation.
An employee was on a bakers scaffold taping drywall. The scaffold tipped over and the employee fell 8 feet. The employee sustained a back fracture.
An employee was walking behind a roofing tar kettle when the kettle door exploded, causing hot tar to contact and burn the employee's face, back, shoulder, and neck.
An employee was sitting down and passed out when he stood up possibly due to heat-related illness. The employee sustained rib fractures and a back injury.

An employee was driving the forklift and encountered a metal post shore in the way. He stopped the forklift, shut it down and attempted to move the post shore. While moving the post shore, his right middle finger was caught within the locking hole causing a fingertip amputation.

An employee was attempting to install a floor covering over an opening on the third floor of a new construction tri-plex when he fell 19-20 feet through the hole. The employee sustained a hip and brain injury.
An employee was unloading a 50 lbs. bucket of powdered grout from a pallet. His feet got tangled in cellophane and he fell to the ground fracturing a hip.
An employee was offloading tools from the pickup truck bed when the tailgate extender fell striking his left ring finger and amputating the fingertip.
An employee was using a magnetic hammer to nail eave flashing when a 2.5 inch nail went through his thumb and into the frame of the house.
An employee was walking down stairs, missed a step, and fractured her left ankle. The employee was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was working from an extension ladder installing lights on the outside of a building. The employee and the ladder fell approximately 10 feet landing on a concrete sidewalk. The employee suffered a dislocated right shoulder, left distal wrist fracture, left non-displaced radial head fracture (arm), multiple right pelvic fractures, a concussion and laceration.
An employee lost his footing while climbing down off a crane and fell approximately six to seven feet to the ground. The employee sustained a hip fracture.

An employee was prying precast with a pry-bar when the bar flipped up and struck the employee's face. The employee sustained a fractured jaw, broken teeth and a laceration to the chin requiring stitches.
An employee was setting a meter in the meter bank. The box slipped and the raw edge lacerated the inside of his right arm. The laceration required surgery.
An employee doing demo work on the third floor of building was struck by falling material from above when the fourth floor collapsed. The employee sustained lacerations to the head and broken teeth.

Employees were raising a structural steel beam (L 27' x  W 24" x 104") when it fell striking the injured employee. They were lifting the beam using a beam clamp and a crane to orient it to slide in place to be bolted up. The injured employee's lower left leg was amputated. The employee also sustained serious injuries to the right leg, a bruised hand and a possible fractured cheekbone.
The injured employee was standing next to an I-beam that had been removed from a rebar mat. The I-beam fell to the ground and struck the employee's right foot causing four metatarsal foot fractures.
Employees were working on an electrical power outage. An employee received an electrical shock from the left triceps to the right index finger and thumb and was hospitalized for electrical burns.
An employee was walking, tripped on a raised section of the floor, and fell resulting in a fractured femur.
Two employees were cutting a section of pipe. As the injured employee was cutting the pipe, a 8' x 14' aluminum trench box fell over onto the injured employee resulting in a cracked pelvis.
An employee was performing drywall work and fell approximately six feet from equipment, landing on the floor and sustained broken ribs.
An employee was cutting open a bundle of wooden studs with a knife and severed an artery in his left wrist resulting in hospitalization.

An employee was testing flashing welds for proper depth and fell approximately 25 to 30 feet through the mid-rail of a guardrail and landed on the ground. The employee was hospitalized for a lacerated liver.
An employee was cutting a precast storm sewer pipe. He slipped off the pipe and cut the left side of his rib cage with the saw.

At the job site the injured employee used a vacuum to extract water from one pit, backfilled three small pits, helped coworkers fill two other pits, and then performed sweeping on the road and sidewalk before leaving. Afterwards, the employee began experiencing symptoms of heat-related illness, including vomiting. The employee was hospitalized for heat-related illness.
An employee was installing insulation and became dizzy. The employee was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee was sweeping the road and was run over by a skid steer fracturing both legs.
An employee was speaking with the skid steer operator when he became trapped between the loading bucket and track of the skid steer causing a left leg fracture.
An employee suffered heat related illness including slurred speech and vomiting while driving back to the office after working all day. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was installing a water tie-in and walking on cooler panels in the ceiling. The employee stepped on the drop ceiling above the bakery and fell approximately 10 feet. The employee suffered a broken right clavicle, humerus, ribs and wrist.
Three employees were removing attachment pins from a skid steer to remove the bucket. The skid steer bucket fell onto on employee's right foot resulting in five broken toes.

On June 8, 2018, an employee was moving a beam while on a scaffold. The employee stepped off of the scaffold onto a shelf and it collapsed causing the employee to fall 11 feet to the floor below. The employee was hospitalized for a fractured right ankle.

The injured employee was installing the last two pieces of decking to the floor of a mezzanine being built within the warehouse. The employee pushed the decking back so that he would have room to cut it and fell through the exposed hole approximately 14 feet to the concrete floor below. He struck steel framing on the floor and broke his arm. He also suffered lacerations to his forehead.
An employee was walking and tripped over the ground elevation difference, fell and broke the upper right arm.
An employee was cutting water pipes when the saw kicked back and cut the employee's face and chin.

An employee was working on a balcony about 12 feet high, removing the railing in preparation to work on the balcony floor. After removing the railing, the employee fell to the concrete pavement below. The employee suffered a fractured skull and ribs, broken vertebrae and collarbone and a bruised lung. Fall protection was not worn at the time.
An employee was power washing a roof and fell approximately 30 feet through a sky light. The employee sustained a fractured leg, pelvis and sternum.
An employee was working on the roof exposed to heat from the sun. The employee was hospitalized that night for dehydration.

Two employees were dismantling forms from a cap on a bridge column. The concrete forms shifted and collapsed onto both employees. The first employee was hospitalized for a broken pelvis. The second employee was hospitalized for a broken jaw.
An employee's finger was caught in a door resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was using a concrete pump to repair sidewalks and curbing. The pump could not reach the location where pumping was done and additional hoses were connected. While holding the hose end, he lost control of it and was struck in the head by the hose end. The employee sustained head lacerations requiring stiches and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was prepping the ground for a concrete sidewalk and suffered leg cramps. The employee was later hospitalized and diagnosed with dehydration/acute kidney failure.
An employee fell off an eight-foot scaffold, hitting a crossbeam and then the concrete ground. The employee sustained a broken rib and three transverse process fractures.

Three employees were on a paint truck applying paint stripping on the highway when a semi-trailer struck the rear of the paint truck flipping it over. Two employees were hospitalized for a concussion, brain bleeding and broken ribs.

An employee was installing decking on a mezzanine level. The employee stepped backwards and fell 18 feet through an undecked portion of the mezzanine to the concrete floor below resulting in hospitalization for a concussion. Fall protection was not secured at the time of the incident.
An employee suffered a thoracic lumbar strain while lifting a heavy rock on site.
An employee was dismantling a building and fell approximately 14 feet from a truss resulting in back injuries. Fall protection was not attached at the time.

The injured employee was working in the GE plant purging the gas in the building. Work in a 4-foot pit had just been completed and the diamond floor plating over the top of the pit was replaced incorrectly. As the injured employee was walking to check the valve, he fell through the floor plating over the pit. The injured employee sustained a right leg laceration on the corner of the plate.

An employee was installing a receptacle on a live floor box. He was extending the floor box using PVC glue to secure it. The flammable glue ignited with the live wire in the floor box. The employee's left hand sustained second degree burns.

An employee was caught in a rain storm while attempting to button up a roof and fell 26 feet to the gravel surface below resulting in hospitalization for a broken left wrist, fractured ribs and a broken pelvis.
An employee was cutting a piece of 15" pipe. When he got to the end of the cut, the pipe pinched, causing the saw to kick back and cut his left shoulder.

An employee was installing a metal roof on a building, lost footing, and fell to the deck. The employee slid approximately 16 ft on 4/12 pitch roof. The employee then fell off the roof edge 13 feet to ground. The employee sustained a fractured L2 vertebra and a fractured wrist.
An employee was using a pry bar to lift a manhole cover. The manhole cover slipped and fell onto the employee's left middle finger, crushing the fingertip. The fingertip was amputated.

Employees were removing a piece of glass from a building when the glass panel caught on a screw in the wall and broke in pieces. A piece of the broken glass cut an employee's arm just below the elbow.

An employee was rewiring replacement batteries in an existing battery string and created a short circuit that resulted in an arc flash. The employee sustained second degree burns to his left hand and fingers.
An employee was cutting lumber to box a water pipe. The saw jumped the workpiece and struck him in the leg, causing a laceration.
The employee was engaged in paving operations. He walked into the ditch and was struck by the bulldozer causing a fractured shin.
An employee was attempting to secure a metal track to a metal base when the employee's hand slipped and the metal came down, crushing the employee's finger between both pieces.
Employees were setting up cross members on a pallet rack. The members snap into place. One of the cross members fell down striking one employee and breaking the right leg.
An employee was preparing wood to paint while standing on a residential roof. He fell to the ground about 8-12 feet below, breaking his right heel and suffering contusions to his right shinbones.

Two employees were tying rebar and getting ready to pour a concrete slab for a ramp to a parking lot of a multi-family dwelling under construction. A vehicle struck a temporary chain link fence that the employees were working in close proximity to causing it to fall over onto the employees and trap them. One employee was admitted to the hospital for a strained back and contusions.

An employee was standing at the rear of a digger derrick truck loading it. The employee's finger was caught between a railing and a concrete pier as it was being loaded into the truck. The left index fingertip was amputated.
An employee walking down an egress ramp fell and broke his leg.

An employee was working on a ladder attaching gutters to the roof. The ladder started sliding to the right and the employee jumped 18 feet to the ground. The employee sustained a fracture in his lower vertebrae and possible ligament damage to his knee.
An employee was walking behind a trackhoe when it backed up and ran over both of the employee's legs. The employee was hospitalized with leg lacerations.

An employee was repairing a butterfly valve when a coworker turned on the pressure. The disc inside the butterfly valve then rotated and cut the employee's left ring finger, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee's finger was pinched and avulsed while moving I-beams.
On 6/14/2018, an employee was placing trash/debris in a dumpster when the lid/door closed on and crushed his finger, resulting in a partial fingertip amputation.

An employee was operating a rough terrain forklift to repair a metal guardrail along the highway when the forklift drove off a 6-foot ledge and rolled over. The employee suffered dislocated vertebrae, a fractured left eye socket, lacerations, and contusions.
An employee was pulling electrical wire through an outlet box when his left thumb was cut on the edge of the box, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was descending a ladder when it became displaced. The employee then fell from the ladder  to the roof and fractured a leg, requiring hospitalization.

On June 14, 2018, an employee fell approximately 17 feet while performing roofing work. The employee sustained a broken ankle, fractured ribs and abdominal pain. The employee was wearing fall protection at the time.

An employee got into an altercation with an employee of another subcontractor on the job site. During the altercation, the employee was cut on the left forearm with a carpentry razor blade, requiring reconstruction surgery.

On June 14, 2018, at 11:40 a.m., an employee was installing rebar bands on a gabion wall when he suffered a seizure, requiring hospitalization. Dehydration contributed to the seizure. The employee was tied off at the time so there were no physical injuries.

An employee was sandblasting on a pipeline when the blasting hose became tangled. As he pulled on the hose to release it, he inadvertently hit the trigger of the blasting gun. Blasting media then hit his upper thigh, causing an abrasion/laceration.
An employee tripped over a rock while walking and fell, fracturing his right lower leg.

An employee with Peninsula Roofing Company, Inc., slipped and fell approximately 26' as he was transitioning from a ladder to a roof with his personal fall arrest system harness. He suffered fractured wrists, a broken heel and right foot, and a small fracture to the spine near the tailbone, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cutting a PVC pipe with a cut-off saw when the saw kicked back and severely lacerated his face. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was attempting to remove a compressed spring and tension rod assembly from a dock leveler when the spring and tension rod came loose and struck the employee's left femur, breaking it and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was operating a string line reel to roll up the string line used in concrete paving operations when the reel stopped working. As he then walked towards the string line reel, it activated, causing the string line to wrap around his legs. He suffered a compound fracture to the right leg.

An employee was steadying a road boring machine as it was loaded onto the back of a truck. The employee's right index finger was in a pinch point when the machine was lowered onto the finger, crushing it and requiring a medical amputation.

An employee was trying to avoid a car passing through the work zone when she stepped into the path of an asphalt front roller. The roller's steel drum then ran over her left foot. She suffered severe left ankle/foot fractures with open wounds, lacerated tendons, and a right tibial fracture. Her left foot and ankle eventually had to be surgically removed.
While cleaning up materials and equipment on a hot day, an employee suffered heat-related injuries, including an acute kidney injury, liver problems, and a muscle injury.
An employee was climbing a ladder to inspect roofing work when he lost his balance and fell approximately 17 feet, landing on two subcontractors below. He broke five ribs.
An employee was attempting to move sheets of drywall stacked against a wall when the stack fell over and landed on his left foot and leg, damaging tendons and requiring hospitalization for surgery.
An employee was attempting to assemble a section of a racking system when his right middle finger became caught between the racking system, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was taking apart some pipe on top of an oil and gas tank when he slipped and fell approximately 22 feet. The employee sustained cracked ribs, a collapsed lung and a cracked collarbone. Fall protection was not worn at the time.
An employee was using a mag drill to drill holes when the drill broke friction and spun, amputating his left index fingertip.

An employee was providing air to support a bridge dismantling project. He began to walk to a truck where the air compressor was housed when his knee gave out at the top of a hill, causing him to slip down the embankment approximately 12 to 15 feet. He sustained knee injures and was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was performing concrete work when he fell from a scaffold and lost multiple teeth.

An employee was working from an A-frame ladder while installing cardboard baffles in a garage's roof truss seals when he lost his balance. He grabbed the garage door track to try and regain balance, and the sharp track partially amputated his right ring finger.

A flagger was directing vehicular traffic when the traffic light turned green and a vehicle (minivan) proceeded through the intersection and struck the flagger. The flagger sustained a broken right leg and a broken left ankle.
On June 19, 2018, an employee was repairing the roof of a two-story residence when he fell from the roof, breaking his ankle(s). He was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell on a concrete entryway that was wet from rain, suffering a fractured right kneecap.
An employee was in a bucket cutting in jumpers to energize a new electrical line when his hands started cramping due to heat-related illness. He was hospitalized.
An employee dropped a concrete form on his hand, causing an injury that required surgery.
On June 19, 2018, an employee was cutting with a chop saw when the blade broke and impaled his leg. He was hospitalized.
An employee suffered heat-related illness while performing construction work outside, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was sitting on the side of a truck trailer with his arm resting on the ramp, which was in the up position. The truck driver got into the truck and began reversing the trailer. The employee's right arm was then caught between the trailer and a skid steer that was behind it. The employee was hospitalized with a dislocated right shoulder and swelling.
While operating a helical machine used to dig holes, an employee was struck by the machine's stabilizing bar. The employee's right thumb was amputated.

An employee was climbing up scaffolding to put plastic on the roof and keep water out of recently poured wet concrete when the employee slipped on the wet scaffolding and fell approximately 25 feet to the ground. The employee suffered a broken right leg.

An employee was helping a crew inspect a newly installed pipeline. High-pressure water and construction debris escaped from the pipeline during pigging operations, knocking over the employee and injuring their head, torso, and leg.

An employee was moving an accordion punch press into position to punch materials. Its wheels got stuck and it tipped onto him, fracturing a vertebra in the thoracic region of the back and causing abrasions to his shoulders and knees.
An employee was finishing the installation of LED lamps on a scissor lift when he suffered an electric shock resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was sliding the fork of an extendable boom forklift when the employee's left middle finger was amputated to the first knuckle between the sliding fork and the forklift carriage.
An employee was using a hot stick to test an electrical circuit in a junction box. He came into contact with an energized electrical circuit and was shocked.
An employee received an electrical shock while getting ready to tie in a light ballast, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was moving a small bundle of metal flashing when he lost control and the flashing cut his wrist, tearing a tendon.
An employee became nauseated while installing HVAC filters on a rooftop. He was hospitalized for dehydration.

Two employees were installing center bars, plates, and nuts on cased micropiles. As one employee was holding the center bar with a pipe wrench, the injured employee went to lift the plate. The wrench was released which caused the nut to catch and pull the plate down. The employee's right ring finger was caught between the plate and the casing; the first digit was amputated.

Emergency work crews were dispatched to an area that had lost power. An employee was climbing a pole to repair a powerline that he thought was de-energized when he came into contact with an energized line. He suffered first degree burns on his left hand and third degree burns on his left thigh, requiring hospitalization. Electrical insulating gloves were not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was walking through the door frame and caught his leg on a stringer on the bottom of the frame and fell to the floor of the adjacent room which was about  6 to 8 inches lower. The employee sustained a broken right hip.
An employee was cutting the flange on a fire stop collar with a portable bandsaw and amputated his left index finger to the knuckle.
An employee fell off a ladder to the ground and broke his pelvis.

An employee was using an oxy-acetylene torch to repair a leaking refrigeration line to a walk-in freezer. The heat ignited some oil trapped in the line. The employee suffered second-degree burns to the left arm and less serious burns to the right arm and neck, and was hospitalized.

An employee was working on the ground pouring five gallons of silicon coating into a tub reservoir to accommodate the pump sprayer when the employee became ill and started vomiting. The employee suffered a heat-related illness.

An employee was helping unload a delivery truck while an all-terrain forklift was being used to remove a stuck side gate from the truck. The forklift began to raise the gate, which was caught on a pallet. The gate came loose from the pallet and struck the employee under the chin resulting in a broken jaw.

An employee was cutting a threaded rod with a portable bandsaw. The saw jumped and struck his left hand, cutting and pulling his cut-resistant glove into the guard and amputating the tip of his left index finger.

An employee was using a forklift to install a lifting beam on the top of a tower section when his finger was pinched between the beam and the forklift, resulting in an amputation of his left ring fingertip.
An employee was helping a truck back up to a loading dock when his finger became caught between the truck and the dock plate and/or loading dock door, resulting in a partial fingertip amputation.

An employee was cutting a piece of copper from an exterior wall using a 10-foot A-frame ladder when he lost his footing and fell about 6 feet to the ground. He injured his spleen and was hospitalized.
An employee was using a 4" angle grinder to cut a steel plate. The grinder kicked back, striking the employee's right knee.
An employee was climbing off a work truck's ladder. He fell about 3 feet to the ground, breaking his right wrist.
An employee was painting about 8 feet off the ground on a metal walk board. He fell about 8 feet to the ground below, suffering head trauma and broken vertebrae.
An employee fell through or over a residential balcony's guardrail to the ground 21 feet below. The employee suffered a collapsed lung and fractured vertebrae.
An employee's left little finger was pinched in a door jamb causing a fingertip amputation.
An employee was preparing a metal drip edge on a roof. The employee fell from the roof, breaking both heels and one tibia.
While doing steel erection work, an employee fell 20 feet to the ground, breaking both heels. He was not tied off at the time.
An employee was lifting a piece of aluminum guttering to install on a gas station canopy when it contacted a high-voltage power line. He suffered electrical burns to both hands and a foot.
An employee was struck by an unchocked car in a fenced area, suffering a broken leg.
An employee was hanging conduit using an 8-foot ladder. He fell to the floor, suffering a concussion and broken ribs, pelvis, and thumb.
An employee fell from a 6-foot A-frame ladder, and their head struck the concrete floor. The employee suffered a fractured skull and bleeding in the brain.
An employee just accessed a roof and fell off to the ground below sustaining an ankle and sacrum fracture. Fall protection was not worn at the time.
An employee was cleaning up a work area when a piece of a metal panel fell from a set of sawhorses. It struck his foot, severing the Achilles tendon.
An employee was installing tile when an abrasive wheel grinder kicked back, striking him in the left shin. He was hospitalized.

On June 24, 2018, an employee was working in the warehouse to prepare the upcoming week's jobs. He used an extension ladder to try to retrieve a dolly from a box stored on a mezzanine. The ladder slipped out and the employee fell to the floor, breaking his hip and foot. His injuries required surgery and hospitalization.

Two employees fell while installing second-floor decking. One employee fell approximately 10 feet to the deck below and sustained facial lacerations and fractured the C7 vertebra requiring surgery and hospitalization. The second employee sustained a muscle strain and bruising on the chest, shoulder and back from the retractable lanyard. Both employees were wearing retractable lanyards at the time of the incident.
An employee was climbing down a fixed vertical ladder when he fell to the floor. He suffered a back injury with broken bones, and was hospitalized.
An employee was pushing a machine down a gravel ramp when the machine pinned the employee against a beam. The employee suffered a back injury.
An employee was moving a temporary switch gear with a pallet jack. The gear rolled off and fell onto the employee's right leg, breaking two bones.
An employee fell from a 47-inch-high baker scaffold to the floor, suffering broken ribs. The employee was hospitalized.
While working on a metal roof, an employee suffered shortness of breath, lightheadedness, and chest pressure. He was hospitalized for heat stress and dehydration.

An employee was adjusting pins to get a concrete pouring machine into position. A spring-loaded pin came out of the machine and struck his hand, causing an amputation to the tip of his right ring finger. The machine was not locked out or tagged out at the time of the incident.

An employee was digging a pole hole inside a construction work zone on a city street when a motorist who had fallen asleep at the wheel drove their car into the work zone and struck the employee. The employee suffered a right leg fracture.
An employee was loading a truck with plywood when his ring became caught on a rack and ripped his left ring finger. His finger was later surgically amputated.
An employee suffered heat exhaustion while working on a rooftop. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was in a loading dock, staging and sorting auto parts. He slipped or tripped on tailgate liners that had fallen to the concrete floor, striking his head against the floor.

Two employees were lowering a jumping jack into a 2-foot trench. One employee's left hand was caught between the handle and the roller; the employee suffered a broken little finger and a broken ring finger and fingertip amputation (without bone loss).
On June 26, 2018, an employee suffered a broken wrist after falling 5 feet from a scaffold to the floor while reaching to apply insulation in a ceiling joist.
An employee was opening a 4-inch condensate line to replace a gasket. Hot condensate steam was released from the flange, burning the employee's elbow and hand.
An employee was shoveling material to expose a temporary drainpipe. A piece of clay/rock rolled down an embankment and struck the employee's lower left leg, breaking it.
An employee was walking around the corner of a foundation under construction, tripped and fell into rebar, suffering a laceration to his inner right thigh.
An employee was placing cribbing to accommodate a load from a forklift. The load was lowered and came down onto the employee's hand, leading to a partial amputation of his right ring fingertip.

While disconnecting a strap at the back of a flatbed truck trailer, an employee fell from the side of the truck, landing on wood mats about 5 feet below. The employee suffered a broken nose, broken ribs, broken teeth, fractured sinus cavity, fractured wrist, and facial lacerations. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was working on a construction site finishing concrete and was hospitalized with heat illness.
An employee fell off a metal roof sustaining leg fractures and a dislocated shoulder.
An employee was walking on the crane deck when he slipped and fell into the engine compartment, breaking his left arm and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was replacing an underground transformer when an arc flash occurred, causing a second degree burn to his left forearm. He also fell forward, striking his head on a distribution service bar and suffering a laceration.
An employee working on a utility pole fell approximately 13 feet to the ground below, fracturing the left leg.
An employee was operating a grinder in an aerial lift when the grinder struck a structure, bounced back, and struck the employee's face, causing a deep laceration.

An employee side stepped and then tripped and fell. When he reached his arms out to brace for impact, his right arm entered a mop cart of hot asphalt and sustained burns from the top of the hand to just below the elbow.
An employee was pouring gas into a gasoline-powered pump when the gas ignited and burned the employee's chest and legs.

An employee was placing material on the roof as part of a retro-fit project. The employee laid the material down to measure so he could cut it to the proper size. The employee then fell about 10 feet from the roof causing a broken clavicle. Fall protection was not utilized at the time.

An employee was getting out of a dump truck and facing the truck with three points of contact. As he stepped onto the slip-resistant tread, his foot slipped off and he fell backwards, striking his head on the step of a backhoe that was parked next to him. He suffered a head laceration and lost consciousness.

On June 27, 2018, at approximately 11:00 p.m., an employee was injured while winching a derailed coal car. During this procedure a piece of metal came off the car and struck the employee in the stomach and upper right arm. The employee was hospitalized for a severe laceration to the upper right arm.

An employee was laying decking material for a reinforced concrete roof. The employee was not able to get decking material under a piece of bent rebar. The employee was attempting to bend the rebar up when it suddenly became free from the cinder block wall, causing the employee to lose balance at the leading edge and fall approximately 10 feet to the floor. The employee fractured the left wrist and femur.

An employee was disconnecting a breaker attachment from a backhoe. He used another pin to push the attachment pin out. When the attachment pin became free of the backhoe, the attachment dropped slightly, causing the pin in his hand to shift and pinch his left pinky finger between the attachment frame and the pin. His left pinky fingertip was partially amputated.

An employee fell off the second step of a step ladder while installing a vacuum hose on a plastic injection mold machine. The employee fractured the right leg below the knee, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee suffered an amputation to the right ring finger while working with a crane. The employee was injured by an engine turbo charger fan.
An employee was on a bakers scaffold when it tipped over and the worker fell six feet. The employee sustained a broken wrist and a dislocated hip.
An employee was cutting wood with a saw. The saw kicked back and caught his glove and amputated his left pinky finger.
An employee was hospitalized for a heat-related illness.

An employee was working with a demolition crew on a bridge deck set up below an overpass. While working from a horizontal shield, the employee fell approximately five feet through an opening in the shield and onto the bed of a company dump truck that was parked directly below, suffering a bruised hip.

An employee was installing a roof on a metal building and cut his hand on one of the screws protruding through a metal sheet.  It caused a laceration that tore a ligament between the thumb and index finger in his left hand.
An employee was hospitalized after suffering a heart attack while installing a concrete pad on June 30, 2018.

At about 11:20 a.m. on June 30, 2018, an employee was operating a paving machine when a 7,200-volt uninsulated power line arced to a tandem truck, which then arced to the paving machine. The employee was shocked while touching the operator toggle. He was hospitalized, having suffered electrical burns to his left hand and an exit burn on his right foot.
An employee was tightening lugs on a pipe coupling when the line became pressurized, causing the coupling to blow off the pipe and strike the employee's leg, fracturing it.

An employee was on a scaffold stripping paint from the exterior of a commercial building when he lost his balance and fell backwards to the ground, suffering several broken ribs on his right side, a bruised lung, and a concussion.
An employee working outside applying grout began showing signs of physical distress including sharp pain in the right back, shoulder and arm areas. The employee was hospitalized for a heart attack.
An employee was cleaning a sewer line with a hydro-jet. While he was pulling the hose, it came too far out of the manhole and the nozzle struck the employee's face, lacerating it.
An employee fell and fractured his ankle while descending an unstable ladder that moved during a roof inspection.

An employee was sitting on an 8-foot scaffold, preparing to descend to the ground below, when a plank shifted. He fell to the ground, suffering a fracture and dislocation of the left wrist, a broken nose, and contusions. He was hospitalized.

An employee was installing exterior drywall while working in a boom lift. The employee suffered six fractured ribs when caught between the boom lift basket and a structural I-beam. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was carrying buckets of hot tar to perform roofing activities when he tripped and lost his balance. The hot tar contacted his body, causing third degree burns to both of his hands.
An employee was removing supports under an auger when the auger fell and struck the employee's head. The employee suffered bleeding and swelling of the brain.
An employee was on a ladder when he was shocked by a live electrical component. He fell from the ladder, suffering an electrical burn and an open wound on the right thumb.
An employee fell on top of another employee as he was setting a form wall. The employee on the ground suffered a broken hip and shattered ankle.

An employee was clearing gypsum from a pump trailer machine's hopper while standing on the machine's auger. The machine started unexpectedly and twisted his right foot into the opening below the auger. His first toe was badly damaged, the second was partially cut off, and the third was lacerated. The machine was off but had been switched to an automatic setting at the time of the incident.

An employee was on the fifth step of an 8-foot ladder when he turned/twisted to his left to grab a pipe to make a connection. The ladder also turned/twisted, and the employee fell, striking and lacerating his head on the floor.
A construction worker assisting with street construction in a new residential community began experiencing symptoms of heat related illness and was hospitalized for heat stroke.
Two employees were shutting down equipment to move a condenser's breaker box from one building to another when an arc flash occurred, burning their left and right arms.
An employee was coming down a 6-foot step ladder when he slipped on a rung and fell backwards approximately 3 feet to the concrete floor. He landed on his lower back and fractured his tailbone.
A roofing employee was working at a jobsite and suffered from heat related illness. He was hospitalized.
An employee fell to the concrete ground while coming down an extension ladder, suffering hip, pelvic, rib, and wrist fractures.
An employee was welding a 25-foot steel A-frame. As the employee lifted the A-frame, a chain about 10 feet high came loose and the A-frame pinned them, causing a possible fracture to the left femur.

An employee was operating a skid loader to dump gravel into a pit. The skid loader was overloaded and tipped into the pit. The cab broke loose and pinned the employee's legs, causing multiple injuries.

An employee was working from a ladder to tie electrical into a junction box on a new construction commercial building. When the employee opened the junction box, a wire fell and contacted his hand, causing a shock. He then fell off the ladder and contacted the ground, fracturing his skull and ribs.
An employee was installing a wood floor. While ripping a piece of wood on a table saw the employee's fingers contacted the saw blade causing amputation injuries to two fingers.

An employee was changing a cylinder on the steering column of a motor grader while standing on the raised blade. He hit the lever rod that controls the blade with his hands or arm, causing the blade to rotate and pinch his left leg between the grader and the step. His left leg broke.

An employee was testing a 240V to 480V transformer when he received an electrical shock, causing him to fall to the ground. His back and head struck a concrete step, and he suffered cuts, bruises, electrical burns to his fingertips, and a possible concussion.
An employee was trying to move 8 sheets of sheetrock when a sheet fell on the employee. The employee suffered a broken leg/kneecap.

An employee was on a scissor lift, installing a disconnect to an energized engine bus stop. The disconnect made contact with two phases, causing a short and an arc flash. The employee suffered burns to the skin on the neck, stomach, and left arm and hand.
An employee was struck by lightning while walking to his vehicle, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell from an extension ladder while climbing it. The employee suffered a broken ankle.
An employee was accessing the second floor with a ladder when he lost his grip and fell off the ladder more than 10 ft., landing on his feet and suffering a compound fracture to his ankle.
An employee's foot slipped off of the second step of a loader as he began to climb into the cab. He fell to the ground and fractured his left hip, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was lifting a quartz slab using a clamp attached to an overhead crane when the slab came off the clamp and fractured the employee's right hand.
An employee fell through drywall in an attic, landing on a lower level 11 feet below. He suffered a fractured tailbone.
On July 6, 2018, an employee was installing pipe in an excavation four feet deep. The walls collapsed and the employee was struck by falling rock and dirt, suffering a compression of the L2 vertebra.

An employee was on a ladder unhooking the ground clamp of a welding machine with the right hand when the employee grabbed a piece of conduit with the left hand for support and received an electric shock. The employee suffered a burn to the right hand around the thumb and ring finger.

An employee was sandblasting walls. As the employee reached to sand blast a spot, the ladder became unbalanced. The employee fell and the blast stream contacted his left hand and wrist causing abrasions requiring a skin graft and nerve damage.

On July 7, 2018, employee was engaged in sand blasting operations when he began having issues with his pot. As he inspected the connections, the sand blasting nozzle activated and the blast media hit his face. He was hospitalized with foreign bodies embedded in the eyes and face.

An employee was working with a gunite mixer when the auger failed due to an abnormal valve. The auger pulled his gloved hand into the mixer, resulting in the amputation of his ring and middle fingers.

An employee was descending a set of stairs when his boot tread may have become stuck in the stair grating causing him to trip and fall to the ground. The employee sustained multiple fractures to his left leg.

An employee was waiting for an excavator to move its boom into place and stop operating. The excavator stopped, and the employee walked toward the machine. The bucket began to move again and struck the employee, causing a spleen injury.
An employee was walking on a metal roof when he fell through a section that had been cut out. He landed 12-15 feet below, breaking his foot.

An employee was signaling for a load to be brought up. The employee's finger was caught between the load line and the sheave of the block, and the employee suffered an amputation of the little finger on the left hand.
An employee was applying home coating around the exterior of a rooftop when the employee fell off the edge of the building, suffering a broken wrist and other trauma.

An employee was cutting a piece of metal in a 12" compound miter saw when the material became caught in the saw and pulled his arm into the extruded aluminum knife edge metal, causing a deep laceration to his left forearm.

An employee was driving a side-boom operator across a temporary bridge. The bridge collapsed and the machine rolled slightly and came to rest at about a 45 degree angle. As the employee disconnected his seat belt, he fell from the machine and landed in the creek bed on his back. The fall caused hairline fractures to his scapula and a rib.
An employee suffered heat stroke while working on a jobsite installing foundation drains.
An employee showed signs of heat stress while operating a paver during a heat wave. The employee was hospitalized.

On July 10, 2018, an employee was unloading a tandem dump truck at a dump site. The locking mechanism on the truck's gate was stuck. As the employee tried to unjam it, their hands were caught between the gate and the truck bed. The employee's left-hand fingers were crushed, with a possible amputation to the left middle finger; the right-hand fingers suffered contusions.
An employee was operating an ATV to move base plates on a roof when the throttle became stuck and he lost control, falling off the roof to the ground and breaking ribs.

An employee was removing a large hydraulic ram to gain access to a hydraulic leak when he unbolted the cradle and it fell out, pinning him against a steel bulkhead. He suffered an amputation to his right arm.
An employee of G&H Underground Construction, Inc., was cutting a concrete pipe with a gas-powered concrete saw when the saw kicked back, striking and lacerating the employee's throat.
An employee suffered heat-related illness while prepping a site for utility pole installations, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was removing bolts from a pipe flange when he lost his balance and fell, striking his right side against a valve handle and breaking a rib.
An employee was working near a manhole when a car drove through the work zone and caught the line/cords to the employees water pump equipment, causing the equipment to strike the employees right arm.

An employee was installing house wrap tape while working from a 300-pound-rated, 28- to 32-foot fiberglass extension ladder, which had filler lumber material elevating and supporting one side of the base ladder side rails to level the ladder base. During the house wrap taping operation, the ladder and employee fell an estimated 20 feet. The employee suffered wrist, elbow, arm, and rib fractures, as well as lacerations to the kidney and face.
An employee experienced severe heat cramps after conducting electrical rewiring activities, requiring hospitalization for heat stress.
The injured employee was working on a crew finishing a concrete curb. After finishing, the employee started cramping and was hospitalized for potential heat stroke.

An employee was working on the ground at an active job site when a reversing milling machine ran over the employee's left foot. The machine continued running up his leg to approximately his hip. His left foot and leg were crushed, with damage to the left hip and amputation of the left leg from the knee down. He also suffered a fractured right leg and hip.
An employee was doing electrical work when he fell 6 feet from a ladder, injuring his back and head.

An employee was climbing a fixed ladder up to a water tower when a stranded metal safety cable located beside the ladder came loose at the top anchor point and struck his leg, puncturing his right thigh.

An employee was placing a metal screen on a sheet metal folding machine when his foot inadvertently pushed down on the machine's cycle foot pedal, causing the upper ram to close down on his hands. He suffered a compression injury and fractures to the left hand and bruises to the right hand.
A rack of sheet metal tipped, and an employee's face and nose were lacerated by the falling sheet metal.
An employee was using a manual pallet jack to push a transformer when he made a sharp turn and the transformer fell on his leg, fracturing his tibia and fibula.
Two employees were involved in an altercation and one employee was cut on the face with a knife.
On July 11, 2018, an employee began having symptoms of heat-related illness while installing rebar at a construction site. He was hospitalized.
An employee was in a manlift conducting demolition work. A piece of steel beam broke loose and struck the employee causing a left arm and shoulder fracture.
An employee cut the wire of a lightning arrester. The hot wire then made contact with a metal bracket and a flash occurred, causing thermal burns to the employee's face and chest.

An employee was using an underwater blaster to clear barnacle off of wooden columns when a wave came in and splashed against him, knocking him off balance and into the path of the blaster's water jet, which cut his left index finger. His left index finger was amputated.

An employee was standing on the tines of a forklift while the operator was driving it through a parking lot. The forklift hit a bump, knocking the employee off the tines. The forklift operator then ran over his leg, breaking his femur and ankle bones. He was hospitalized.
Employees were rolling telephone poles off a trailer. As a pole came off the truck, it landed on an employee's leg, breaking his tibia.
An employee fell down an unmarked elevator shaft, breaking his foot.

An employee was installing drywall on a piece of wall that was laying flat on the ground. Nearby, a 9-foot wall with drywall was already framed and standing on its own with four support braces. Strong winds blew the standing wall down and it struck the employee's back.
An employee was on a roof taking measurements when he slipped and fell 10 feet off of the roof, breaking both heels and requiring hospitalization. The pitch of the roof was 6- to 7 in 12.
An employee was unchaining a grader from a lowboy trailer. He tripped and fell, and his head struck the trailer. He suffered a cut to the forehead and possibly other injuries.
An employee was working from a ladder that was 8 to 10 feet in height when he fell off the ladder, suffering brain bleeding, disorientation, and back fractures.
An employee was walking down the hallway while carrying tools when he tripped on the seam of a curled up Masonite board and fell, breaking his nose and left eye socket.
An employee was setting a spud on a hydraulic dredge when the spud fell on and crushed the employee's right index finger, resulting in a partial finger amputation.

An employee was waiting on a backhoe to bring a manhole down from a stock pile to be installed at a pump station. The employee was sliding the manhole ring when a bolt that holds the backhoe blade caught the ring and lid. This caused the employee to lose his grip, and the ring and lid dropped on his left hand, smashing his index and ring fingers and resulting in a middle fingertip amputation.
On July 13, 2018, an employee was cutting the top of a concrete wall with a gas-powered handsaw. The saw kicked back, striking and lacerating the employee's face. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was sweeping the floor inside a building. A conduit was being installed from the outside of the building; a 4x6x5 piece of stone was jarred loose from the top of a masonry column above where the employee was sweeping. The stone fell 23 feet onto the employee's hard hat, penetrating the hat and lacerating his head. He was hospitalized.

An employee was installing an air handler on a building's second floor using an all-terrain forklift. The equipment had been placed on a 12-by-12 skate and moved to a placement pad. It shifted and struck the employee, causing fractures to the wrist, elbow, and leg, and a laceration to the forehead.

An employee was cutting insulation on a roof edge when the employee fell approximately 25 feet off the roof, landing on pavement. The employee injured the left hand and foot and sustained two spinal fractures.
An employee was troubleshooting an interlock switch on an HVAC unit. The employee's left pinky finger was caught in the HVAC door panel as the employee closed it, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee suffered from heat stroke after working outside with asphalt.
An employee fell off a mobile scaffold when the wheel hit a hole, suffering fractured heels and a bicep cut.
An employee was working from a platform at a residence. The platform collapsed and he fell to ground level about 10 feet below. He suffered fractured vertebrae in his back, requiring surgery.

Two employees were working on a roof above 20 feet, both tied off. Work was also being done about 60 feet above them, and debris from that work was striking the employees. The employees detached their lanyards and got closer to the edge of the roof to get the attention of the employees who were blowing the debris down onto them. One of the employees fell from the roof to the concrete about 14 feet below, breaking ribs and his arm.
