An employee was parked on the side of the road changing a tire on a company vehicle when the jack slipped, causing the vehicle to come down. The employee was pinched by the vehicle and sustained multiple fractures to the pelvis and sacrum.
An employee was setting up for a job when a hydraulic hammer fell on and crushed his foot, breaking bones.

On July 16, 2018, an employee was disassembling concrete wall forms while standing on scaffolding when he attempted to transfer from one side of a wall to the other side and fell 14 feet to the concrete below. He suffered rib, pelvic, and heel fractures.
An employee was getting mortar for bricklayers when she fell partway through a gap on a scaffold. She suffered bruised/broken ribs.

An employee was standing on a stepladder trimming a tree branch when the branch fell and knocked the ladder over, causing him to fall to the ground. He suffered a head laceration, a fractured collarbone, and fractured ribs.
An employee was putting a strap around a bundle of rebar to be moved when his left middle fingertip was caught between two pieces of rebar, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee troubleshooting a 24V circuit on a heat pump when he received an electric shock, burning his pointer finger and experiencing tingling in his hands and arms.
An employee was replacing a gas line. When the employee began to cut the line, a fire caused second-degree burns to the employee's right arm, neck, and face.

On July 16, 2018, two employees were performing maintenance on a piece of heavy equipment that was having issues with its rubber tracks. Employee #1 was operating the machine while employee #2 was watching the tracks. As the track was moving, employee #2's arm entered the track. His left arm was crushed, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was in a trench, cleaning off a duct about 8 feet away. A steel plate slipped while being placed in the trench; it knocked another steel plate (which had already been placed into the trench) against the employee and pinned him against the duct. He suffered a broken pelvis and femur and was hospitalized.
An employee had climbed down a ladder and was on the ground beneath a concrete form when it fell onto him, breaking his left arm. He was hospitalized.
An employee was trimming vegetation from an aerial lift. The employee fell from the lift to the ground, suffering a broken left arm.
An employee was laying sewer line when their hand was caught between the top of the shoring box and the bottom of the excavator bucket. The employee sustained a fractured forearm.

An employee was helping to move rafters to build a cone on a tank. One of the rafters was hooked onto a tractor. When the employee went to pull the rafter, the joint of the rafter caught the rafter below it, which then slid and put the employee in a pinch point and the line of fire. As a result, the employee broke two bones above her left ankle (tibia and fibula) and three bones in her left foot.

An employee was using acetone to clean dripping foam insulation from a basement wall when the pilot light flame of a hot water tank ignited the acetone fumes, causing first, second, and third degree burns to the employee's legs.
An employee was adding water to the radiator of a piece of heavy equipment when a front end loader struck him. He suffered abdominal injuries and a broken pelvis and was hospitalized.
An employee was unrolling a roof ice guard when the employee fell off the roof to the ground, suffering a ruptured spleen, collapsed lung, and injured rib.
An employee was standing on a 10-foot A-frame ladder installing an eave drip. The ladder shifted and he fell about 5 feet to the ground, fracturing a vertebra in his lower back. He was hospitalized.

An employee was fabricating a frame support for a shackle line. The frame detached and fell, hitting the employee's right leg above the ankle. The employee suffered a laceration and fracture to the leg and was hospitalized.
An employee was standing on site when the wind picked up a 3/4-inch plywood board and threw it towards the employee. The board struck his head, causing cerebral contusions.
An employee was helping build a water pump when he fell, hitting and breaking his leg on a concrete wall.
An employee picked up concrete at a concrete plant and delivered it to a home. At an unknown point he suffered a concussion, apparently from slipping and bumping his head on a hard surface.
An employee was working from a stepladder when it broke. In falling, he grabbed the steel rail of a garage door and his right hand was lacerated.
An employee was helping one of his co-workers move an extension ladder to another location when he felt a pain in his chest due to a possible muscle strain. He was hospitalized.
An employee was working outside weed eating a pond area when he became dizzy and unresponsive due to heat stress and dehydration.
An employee was laying poly pipes when he reached under the poly pipe and was bitten by a rattlesnake, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was performing manual labor to build a solar farm outside when he began feeling unwell and experienced severe cramps in his stomach, legs, neck, jaw, and hands. He was hospitalized for dehydration and kidney malfunction due to heat stress.
The cable of a ladder hoist amputated two of an employee's fingers.
An employee was working from a scaffold and fell 12 feet to the ground. The employee sustained a broken shoulder, hand and pelvis.
An employee was engaged in various electrical installation activities throughout the day. That evening he began to feel ill and was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee was on a metal deck roof when he fell through a skylight to the concrete floor, about 15 feet below. He suffered a broken left femur and a laceration to the face.

An employee was preparing to unload liquid asphalt from the tanker truck into the storage tank at the asphalt plant. Hot oil splashed onto the employee after the cap was removed to hook up the hose. The employee sustained burns to the arms and shoulders (4.5% of his body). The safety valve was not closed at the time of the incident.

An employee was on the roof of a residential property cutting plywood with a circular saw. The employee lost his footing while operating a circular saw and the saw lacerated his left forearm. The laceration reached the artery and required surgery.
An employee was installing sod at a golf course when the sod installer ran over his left foot/ankle fracturing the ankle.
An employee was applying sealant to a duct from an 8-foot ladder. The employee fell to the floor, suffering a broken left leg that required surgery.
An employee was using an excavator to lift a pipe. The pipe slid off the sling and fell through the cab, striking and injuring the employee's right leg.
Two employees were working at a table saw. The injured employee walked past and a 4x4 piece of wood that was being cut kicked back from the table saw and struck the injured employee in the eye.

An employee of Balfour Beatty was partway up a 12-foot A-frame ladder, working with a crew to put up steel canopies on a rail corridor expansion. A tack weld broke on the steel post that was being used to push a canopy up into position. The post struck the employee's ladder, causing him to fall about 5 feet. He hit his head in falling, suffering a possible concussion; he also suffered a fractured wrist and a cut on the neck from the post.

An employee was walking on the roof of a school, 20 feet above ground level. The employee fell through the gypsum roof deck and was injured requiring hospitalization. The employee suffered a fractured pelvis, ribs, right hip, tailbone, vertebrae, wrist, and humerus as well as nerve damage and temporary blindness.

An employee was staging an air compressor that was set on a trailer in preparation to run a "pig" through a pipeline. The trailer wheels jumped the vehicle chocks and started to roll. The employee tried to grab the trailer to keep it from rolling. The employee fell to the ground and the jack stand for the trailer landed on the employee's legs. The employee suffered a fractured left leg and possible fracture to a right toe, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was washing a crane tire when it fell on his lower leg, fracturing his tibia and fibula.

An employee was adjusting the forks on a forklift when his right ring finger was caught between the forks and the mast of the forklift. His right ring finger was severely lacerated, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee fell 12 feet while decking a first floor resulting in broken ribs, a fractured wrist and a ruptured spleen.
An employee was exiting a service truck when he shut the door on his left middle finger, smashing his fingertip and resulting in a partial fingertip amputation.
An employee felt ill and was hospitalized with symptoms of dehydration.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut two-by-fours. The saw kicked back, causing the amputation of the employee's left thumb.

An employee was attempting to remove a piece of structural steel from around a furnace. He stepped down, then tripped and fell approximately 20 feet down a chute to the ground, dislocating his right shoulder. His harness was unhooked at the time of the incident.
An employee was cutting a piece of dealt paper with a box cutter when the blade cut through the paper and lacerated his knee.

An employee was standing on an extension ladder 16 feet above ground and pulling wire through a conduit when the wire broke, causing him to lose his balance and fall to the concrete floor. He broke his left and right heels, as well as his L3 vertebra.
An employee was stripping concrete forms in a lube oil sump. The temporary 2x4 handrails failed, and the employee fell 12 feet to a lower level, fracturing ribs and injuring parts of his spine.

An electrical crew was about to jump out a potted porcelain cutout that had cracked. An employee was under the cutout, preparing the jumper, when the bottom of the cutout broke free. It hit the employee in the jaw, causing jaw and ear injuries.
An employee was using a saw to cut 4" off of a 4" diameter pipe when their left index finger contacted the blade causing a partial amputation.

An employee was operating a lift to move a pallet of plywood when the forks extended to another stack. When the lift started to lift the intended pallet, the subsequent stack behind it started to lift and tilt and then fell. An employee walking nearby was caught under the pallet of plywood and suffered a fractured skull, two broken ribs and lacerations.
An employee was helping a crew lift a welded steel beam that came apart and fell. The beam hit a metal pipe that then hit the employee's lower leg, fracturing and lacerating it.
An employee was installing solar rails on a building roof. The employee was shocked by electricity flowing from the line to the ground, suffering injuries. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell into an excavation. The employee was in the excavation for about an hour and suffered dehydration, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was installing a TPO membrane on the edge of a flat roof and as he was about to throw out some garbage, he slipped and fell 10 feet from the roof into the dumpster. He fractured his wrist and lacerated his right eyebrow, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was rewiring a power line pole when the back of his right hand touched the 7,200-volt tap line. He suffered second-degree burns to his right hand and an exit wound on the left side of his torso.

An employee was on a 12-foot step ladder getting ready to strap up a flexible conduit on a light fixture. When he grabbed the flexible conduit, he was shocked by ~277 volts and fell off the ladder to the ground, fracturing his L3 vertebra.
An employee was cleaning a grout machine when his hand entered the machine. The paddles grabbed and dislocated his index finger. The machine was running at the time of the incident.
An employee was manually lifting a steel manhole cover when it fell on his left foot. He suffered a fracture of his left foot metatarsal bone, requiring hospitalization.
At approximately 3:15 p.m. on 25 July 2018, an employee was cutting pipe with a saw when the saw lacerated his knee, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was struck by an excavator bucket while backfilling a rock wall, suffering a back injury.
While helping with the load on a forklift, an employee tripped and fell. The forklift ran over the employee's left foot, breaking bones.
An employee was plastering on the floor when he fell about 20 feet to the ground below, sustaining shoulder fissures. A safety railing was installed at the time of the incident.
An employee was working on an electric panel when an arc flash occurred, burning the employee on his face, arms, and torso.
An employee was performing concrete work when he fell in a hole that had a piece of rebar in it and was impaled. He suffered internal injuries.
An employee was climbing down an extension ladder. The employee fell about 6 feet to the concrete floor, landing on their head and suffering an injury that required 16 stitches.
An employee was lowering a pump when his finger was caught between a block and cable. He suffered a right ring fingertip amputation.
An employee was climbing a ladder to install gutter guards on a house. The employee fell 10 feet from the ladder to the ground, breaking his left ankle and right heel.
An employee was cleaning the tracks of a bulldozer when he fell to the pavement and suffered an intestinal injury. He was hospitalized.
An employee was unloading asphalt milling onto a state highway from a dump truck. The dump truck rolled over onto the driver's side and the employee sustained fractured ribs and a punctured lung.
A floor scraper's blade cut the palm of an employee's right hand.
An employee was cutting plywood and the saw blade amputated the left pinky finger.

An employee was working atop a 7-foot-high refrigerator case, spackling a sheet rock column. He was about to climb down when he tripped on debris and fell to the concrete floor, suffering severe injuries including six broken vertebrae and two broken collarbones. He was hospitalized.
At 7:30 a.m., an employee began work with an asphalt crack sealing team. At 2:30 p.m., he had begun to suffer severe leg cramps due to heat and dehydration. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cleaning a mixer with a hammer. The hammer bounced back, hitting him in the face and fracturing bones beneath his eye. He was hospitalized.

An employee was changing out the anode on a treater shack when the anode, which was under pressure, struck the employee's waist. The employee's torso twisted and the employee sustained a broken leg. The wrong line on the treater shack was locked out at the time of the incident.
On July 27, 2018, a lineman fell while guiding a steel tower foundation leg in place. His thumb was caught in a pinch point in the tower frame, suffering a fracture.
An employee was helping two dock workers to upright a power jack that had overturned.  While uprighting the jack, his middle fingertip was amputated and required stitches.

An employee was leaving a mobile scaffold platform while holding a tower section that had just been unbolted. The employee and the tower section fell to the ground about 3 feet below, landing on an outrigger and suffering four broken ribs and blood in the lungs.
An employee was using a pneumatic nail gun to nail 2x8 boards together when his right leg bumped the nail gun. The gun then discharged a nail into his right leg, striking his bone.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut expansion board material when his right index finger contacted the saw blade, resulting in a fingertip amputation at the bottom of his fingernail.
An employee fell from a roof to the ground and sustained a head injury, broken ribs and a punctured lung.
While replacing a fluorescent two-by-four light fixture with an LED fixture, an employee was shocked and fell off a 6-foot ladder (likely from the third rung) to the ground.
An employee's left hand was crushed by the hydraulic clamp on a drilling machine.
An employee tripped and fell down and a road grader hit him, breaking his pelvis.

At about 8:30 a.m. on July 28, 2018, an employee was trapped by the boom of a skid steer while trying to help another employee change the skid steer's forks. The employee suffered eight broken ribs and was hospitalized.
An employee was struck by a roof truss, suffering head injuries. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was unplugging a welding machine when he was shocked. He was hospitalized.
An employee was removing leftover material from the bed of a flatbed truck. He tripped on dunnage and fell off the flatbed, landing on and injuring his right elbow. He was hospitalized.
An employee was climbing down an extension ladder when it unlocked and slid down. The employee fell, breaking his ankle and leg.

While installing a piece of ridge cap on a roof, an employee fell to the ground about 28 feet below. The employee suffered a dislocated right shoulder, a broken left wrist and left leg, and facial lacerations.
An employee fell 28 feet while laying metal decking, suffering broken bones in the face, knee, and foot.

An employee was shoveling hot asphalt mix inside the box of a truck. The back vertical gate opened partially and the employee fell through, coming into contact with the hot material. The employee suffered severe burns to the stomach, palms, and wrists (requiring skin grafts), as well as possible nerve damage to the right forearm.
An employee was standing on the bed of a flatbed trailer, banging on the drum of a concrete mixer while it was being washed. He fell to the ground 5 or 6 feet below, breaking his tibia and fibula.

An employee was in a scissor lift, helping rig iron beams to be removed as part of concrete form work. A beam struck the scissor lift, knocking it to the ground with the employee inside it. The employee suffered injuries including an injured spleen.
An employee was cutting a piece of 4-by-4 lumber with a handheld circular saw. The saw amputated the tip of his left index finger.
An employee fell to the floor while climbing down a ladder, suffering a broken femur.
An employee was installing a control box outside in the shade and started feeling lightheaded. The employee later passed out. He was hospitalized for dehydration.

An employee was climbing an extension ladder to install gutters 21 feet above the ground. The employee fell at the fourth rung from the top, landing on the ground. The employee suffered broken ribs, vertebrae, and sternum.
An employee was placing a sheet of decking on metal roof rafters. While trying to adjust the roof sheeting, he slipped and fell 30 feet, suffering a head laceration from a metal sheet.
A piece of cable came loose from a crane, amputating part of an employee's foot.

An employee was attempting to drive a forklift onto a flatbed trailer when the forklift tires fell off the side of the trailer. The employee then fell or was thrown from the forklift, suffering broken ribs, a broken collarbone, and lacerations to the face.
An employee was climbing down a 6-foot step ladder when he lost his footing at the third rung. His leg was hung up in the ladder and he fell to the ground, breaking his left leg and/or ankle.
Two employees were using a propane saw when they suffered carbon dioxide poisoning. They were hospitalized.
An employee was working near a junction box when his foot was caught in the corner of the 2x3 junction box. He fell down approximately 1.5 feet and broke his hip.

An employee stepped from a man basket onto a roof that was being demolished. The roof collapsed and the employee fell 10 feet to the ground, breaking an arm and several ribs. Fall protection was not being worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was cutting wooden crates using a powered saw when the saw slipped and contacted his right leg, causing a laceration.
An employee fell to the ground while decking a building, suffering a head laceration and damaged ribs.
An employee was pouring concrete cement on the ground when it got into his boot, causing second-degree burns to both his legs.
An employee was climbing down the ladder of a front-end loader when he slipped on the bottom rung and rolled his foot, falling from the ladder to the ground and fracturing his right ankle.

An employee was attempting to exit a tractor when it rolled over the employee's right leg, fracturing it in two places. The tractor's motor was running and the brake was not set at the time of the incident.
An employee was climbing poles and attaching cables. One of the throw lines got caught in a tree. The employee climbed the tree and fell breaking an ankle.
An employee was placing a broken concrete piece under a concrete slab as support when the slab broke and came down on/pinned the employee's right hand, cutting it and requiring stitches.

An employee was watching as equipment ripped curbing from the side of a roadway when a piece of the curbing became lodged between the middle blade and the wheel of the curb removal equipment. When the wheel was turned, the piece of asphalt was ejected and struck the employee's chest, breaking ribs.

An employee was adjusting the throttle controls on a high-pressure water pump when a hose on the equipment ruptured. Pressurized water came out and contacted his right wrist, causing a deep laceration.

A temporary employee was on a ladder attempting to work with an electrical wire after placing a light in a ceiling grid when he fell to the ground, suffering a sore back. He may have been exposed to electricity.
An employee slipped off a ladder and fell to the ground sustaining a severe head injury.

An employee unloaded a broom tractor from a trailer. He then got off the tractor to check the hub locks on the wheels. When he moved the hub locks, the boom tractor grabbed his leg and took off with him underneath. The tractor then made a 360 circle and ran him over a second time, breaking his pelvis in two places. He was hospitalized and required surgery. The boom tractor was in operation at the time of the incident.

An employee was guiding a dozer back to tie it to a stuck vehicle. When the dozer stopped, the employee stepped between the vehicles to tie them together. The dozer then moved and caught the employee between the vehicles. The employee suffered a broken pelvis.
An employee was on a tractor bucket, being lowered into a trench that was being excavated. He slipped and was struck by the thumb of the excavator, suffering puncture wounds to both feet.
An employee was setting trusses in a residential construction when he lost his balance and fell approximately 16 feet to the next lower level, suffering fractured ribs.
On 08/03/2018, an employee fell off a baker's scaffold while installing ceiling tiles, injuring his upper left leg and requiring hospitalization for surgery.

An employee was spotting for a skid steer when the skid loader struck the employee. The employee suffered a left femur fracture, a right ankle fracture, multiple pelvic fractures, a hematoma to the popliteal region, and an L7 transverse fracture.
An employee was installing metal roofing when the employee slipped and fell 16 to 20 feet from the roof to the surface below, fracturing the right leg.
An employee was loading a piece of plywood onto a table saw when the saw blade severely lacerated his right little and ring fingers.

An employee was going down the stairs outside a sales home when he lost his balance and fell down the steps, hitting his head. He suffered a concussion, two skull fractures, and a broken ribs, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was shocked when he came in contact with a live power line. The line was not insulated and his gloves had perforations at the time of the incident.
An employee tripped on a piece of wire while pulling a pallet jack, suffering a right lower leg fracture.
An employee was attempting to erect a boom when the boom failed, resulting in contusions to the employee's head and knees and multiple fractures to the vertebrae.
An employee was unloading a trench box panel from a forklift when it fell on the employee, who suffered lower vertebra fractures. The employee was hospitalized.
After conducting flagging operations, an employee experienced hand cramps and nausea at the end of the day. She was hospitalized with low potassium levels and dehydration.
An employee was climbing a wall-mounted ship's ladder while holding a PVC pipe under his arm when his hand slipped off a rung and he fell 10 feet to the floor, fracturing both legs.

An employee was laying standing seam metal roof decking when he stepped on insulation that was laid out underneath the metal decking and fell 30 feet through the insulation to the ground, landing on a crushed stone surface. He suffered a fractured left arm, fractured pelvis, and diaphragmatic hernia. A safety lanyard was not attached at the time of the incident.
While checking for failures in the pipe, a pipe that was being lifted by a track hoe rolled and hit the employee's leg, breaking it.

An employee was working on the metal decking of a new dorm when he went to get a tool and stepped on the deck. The deck collapsed and he fell 12 feet to the ground, fracturing his left hip and requiring hospitalization. A retractable lifeline was not hooked up at the time of the incident.
An employee stepped on mud while exiting a shipping container and fell backwards, suffering a concussion and possible injuries to the neck and back. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was working on an electrical switch gear when an arc flash occurred. He sustained first and second degree burns on his head and face and was hospitalized.
An employee was using a powder-actuated decking tool when the pin caught the edge of a beam flange, causing the washer on the deck pin to shear off and lacerate the employee's right eye.
An employee was hospitalized for dehydration after performing highway construction.
An employee did not feel well at the end of the day and experienced muscle cramps and vomiting. He was hospitalized for heat stress.

An employee was on the roof (new two story house) fixing an incorrectly installed metal flashing. As he was lifting the metal flashing to add a peel stick, a roof drip edge flashing came out of its box and landed on his left hand, resulting in the amputation of his left middle finger from the first joint.
An employee experienced heat stress symptoms while working outside at a construction site. He was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee was climbing up an extension ladder to inspect a roof when the bottom kicked out. The employee fell and hit the ground, suffering fractured feet and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was trying to hold or guide a wrench and bolt together while using an impact gun at the same time to loosen the bolt. The impact wrench slipped and caused a severe laceration to the employee's left index finger.
An employee fell from a roof ladder and suffered a fractured leg.
An employee was using a scissor lift to hang ceiling wires. As he was getting off the lift, he slipped, lost balance, and fell backward, breaking his femur and hip. He was hospitalized.

An employee was repairing the front tie rod of a milling machine that broke. He was trying to put the rod together to align it when the end yoke moved and hit his left hand, fracturing his index and middle fingers.
An employee was setting roof trusses when a truss broke below him, causing him to fall approximately 13 feet and break his ankle.
An employee was helping crew members set up a hydraulic pump when he started to experience leg cramps. He was hospitalized due to possible heat-related illness.

An employee acting as a spotter was walking alongside a forklift when the forklift operator turned to the right and the left rear tire pivoted outward, contacting the employee. The employee suffered a fractured foot and elbow.

An employee was leaning against a handrail located in front of a tool trailer when the handrail gave out and the employee fell backwards, striking his head and back against the ground. He suffered bleeding inside the brain, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was pulling grass from a grade stake when a coral snake bit his right forearm. He was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a pneumatic nail gun at the ridge of the roof when the gun shot a nail into his foot, entering the bone. He was hospitalized.
An employee was attempting to clean out a tack truck when the spray bar expelled tar/tack onto the employee. He suffered second degree burns to the right side of his face, ear, neck, chest, and arm.
An employee fell off a 10-foot step ladder when he missed a step, falling on the concrete floor and impacting his back and head.

An employee was trying to look at electrical devices that were on a wall behind vertically stacked drywall when the drywall fell towards him, striking and breaking his right ankle. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.

Employees were performing steel erection activities and placing clips, insulation and roof sheeting onto a pre-engineered metal building. The employees were walking and working from a partial bundle of roof sheeting (approximately 3 sheets). During the operation, an employee stepped on an inadequately supported area of the roof sheeting partial bundle; the sheets bent down and the employee fell 21 feet to the ground below. The employee was hospitalized with a broken arm and tailbone.

An employee was helping another employee install bridge beams on a construction site on a hot, humid day when he began to feel dizzy and lightheaded. He then began to experience muscle cramping and vomiting and required hospitalization due to dehydration.
An employee was hospitalized with heat exhaustion after working as a concrete finisher at a commercial construction site.
An employee fell 6 feet from an 8-foot step ladder to the ground while installing ductwork, breaking his left fibula.
An employee was walking on ceiling joists in an attic when his foot slipped off the joist and he fell through the ceiling, landing on the floor 10 feet below and fracturing his left wrist.
An employee was troubleshooting an energized sub-station breaker when an arc flash explosion occurred, causing second and third degree burns to the employee's arms, hands, and face.
While performing mechanical work on heavy equipment, an employee experienced dizziness, disorientation, and a raised body temperature due to heat stress.
An employee was collapsing forms when his finger slid down the side of the form and was amputated.
An employee fell from the roof of a one-story building while setting roof trusses, landed on the ground and punctured a lung.

An employee was being walked off the job site when he was involved in a physical altercation with two other workers and fell to the ground, fracturing his right tibia and fibula. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee's right leg was caught against a concrete slab by a wheeled power buggy that another employee was driving. The employee suffered a compound fracture that resulted in an amputation above his right knee.

An employee was attempting to secure a reinforcing steel cage into place when he was caught between the steel cage and a section of a temporary concrete barrier wall. He suffered a lacerated and fractured left index finger, broken right ankle, and hernia.

A crane operator was lifting a vertical pipe inside a steel tower structure so the pipe could be cut to size when the pipe started spinning. An employee went to check on the pipe when it came loose and fell approximately 6 feet, crushing the employee against the tower structure. The employee suffered injuries that resulted in a medical amputation of the left hand and left leg.

An employee was on the ground directing a telehandler that was placing trusses when the telehandler tipped, pinning her beneath the boom. She suffered a compound fracture in her leg, arterial bleeding, and a spinal injury.

An employee was on a ladder installing lighting inside an elevator shaft when the elevator became energized and the counterweights came down on him, pinning and crushing his shoulder and arm area. He suffered multiple fractures to the arm, shoulder blade, and clavicle.
An employee was connecting steel when he reached for a hoisted joist, lost his footing, and fell approximately 25 feet, fracturing his wrists and femur. He was hospitalized.
An employee was adjusting a pedestal fan when his right thumb went through the guard in the back of the fan and was struck by the fan blade, suffering multiple fractures.

An employee was working on an electrical component of the water pump when the lead contacts sparked. The sparks ignited an unknown gas that was coming from a capped well in the work area. The employee was engulfed in flames and sustained first and second degree burns to both hands and wrists and first degree burns to his face.
An employee's left index finger was caught in a hammer drill, resulting in an amputation at the first knuckle below the fingernail.
While removing a plywood floor cover on a flat roof, an employee fell through an opening in the roof. The employee fell onto a scissor lift guardrail, suffering a lacerated liver.

An employee was standing on a plank set between two step-ladders while using a cordless drill to firmly screw/drill into metal siding. He lost his balance and fell approximately 5 feet to the ground below, breaking his wrist and forearm.
A TMS employee was performing maintenance work on a steel plate rolling machine. A hold-down clamp crushed the employee's foot, leading to an amputation of the little toe.

An employee was working outside on a hot, humid day when he began to feel ill. He drank some water, went into a restroom, vomited several times, and lost consciousness, hitting his head on the floor. He suffered dehydration and a head laceration that required staples.

An employee fell from scaffolding to the ground and suffered a broken wrist, broken ribs, and a punctured lung. The employee was hospitalized. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was on a ladder attempting to install artwork on a wall when the employee fell approximately 20 feet to the ground, suffering a broken collarbone and a concussion that required hospitalization.

An employee placed a ladder on a mid-span and was ascending the ladder when it shifted. The shift caused one of the hooks to come off the mid-span. He dismounted from halfway up the ladder and landed on his feet, breaking both ankles.

The injured employee was applying flammable, solvent-based adhesive on the roof. As he walked by another employee using a torch to dry the roof, the employee's clothes ignited. The injured employee then entered the area where the adhesive was being applied and a fire started. The injured employee sustained burns to about 80 percent of his body and was hospitalized.

An employee was moving a fiberglass extension ladder along the side of a building when his foot became caught on a wooden stake protruding from the ground, causing him to fall. When he fell, his other foot became tangled between the first and second rungs of the ladder, and he suffered compound fractures of the right tibia and fibula.
An employee was cutting open a bag of materials with scissors when they cut his right forearm.
On August 15, 2018, around 3:00 PM, an employee was hit in the back of his head from a falling shackle. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was walking at a residential construction site when he tripped at the front door entry threshold and fell to the ground, breaking a femur.
An employee was cutting wood stakes with a powered saw when it cut four fingers on his left hand.

An employee was unloading the back of a triaxle truck when the tailgate would not lock due to excess material in the bed of the truck. He placed his left hand on the side of the tailgate and his right hand on the latch to open the tailgate. The tailgate opened briefly and then closed immediately, catching his ring and middle fingertips. As a result, his left middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee was cutting a 16" water main with a saw when the sawblade kicked back and cut his face on the right side.
An employee was loading a kettle up with asphalt to be pumped up to a roof when he became ill due to heat stress and dehydration, requiring hospitalization.

An employee went to step onto the top of an H-pile (metal beam) to get a laser level from the other side when his foot was caught on an extension cord, causing him to fall onto the pile. The H-pile deeply lacerated his lower left leg.
While climbing a ladder, an employee slipped and fell to the ground, landing on both feet. The employee suffered a fracture to the lower left leg and a compound fracture.
An employee was holding onto a rack at a top cross member when his finger was caught between the rack and a pipe, resulting in a finger amputation.
An employee slipped off the tire of a dump truck after finishing cleaning operations in the tub. The employee landed on the ground and sustained a fractured ankle and broken wrists.

On August 16, 2018, an employee was using a shovel to help a motor grader operator clean off the road in preparation for milling when he was struck by a dump truck, fracturing his right tibia and pelvis. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee had changed a bearing on a fan (air handling unit) and was manually checking (rotating by hand) the tension of a drive belt he had reinstalled when his left hand was pulled between the motor and the drive belt pulley, resulting in a left ring finger amputation.

An employee was wrecking a framework on a commercial construction building. As he was unclamping his harness, the anchor broke and he slipped and fell approximately 14 feet to the ground. He suffered a lacerated left eyelid, lacerated left knee, spinal fractures at the L1 and L2 vertebrae, and a hematoma of the bladder. He was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a heart attack after excavating concrete, requiring hospitalization.
After working all day, an employee became ill due to heat-related injuries and was hospitalized.

An employee was in a scissor lift setting a truss for a T-hangar when the truss hit the scissor lift after becoming bound up on a column. The employee was ejected from the scissor lift to the floor as the lift overturned. The scissor lift then landed on the employee's face. The employee suffered multiple facial bone fractures; lacerations on the forehead, back of the head, nose, and face; a small brain bleed; a small fracture on the spine (C6); and a broken upper jaw.

An employee was using a wheelbarrow to pour hot stone and rubber into a bridge plug joint when the wheelbarrow started to tip over. As he tried to stop it from falling, the hot rubber contacted his skin, causing a third degree burn to his right forearm between the wrist and elbow.

An employee was saw-cutting a floor indoors for about one hour using a walk-behind concrete saw with an oxidation catalyst when he became dizzy, exited the building, and collapsed. He was hospitalized due to carbon monoxide exposure.
An employee was using a battery-powered circular saw to cut material on a shipping crate when the saw kicked back and the blade made contact with his finger, resulting in a finger amputation.

An employee was installing street lamps from an aerial lift bucket when a car struck the aerial lift's control panel. His right hand was then crushed between the bucket and structural steel, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was handling a concrete road barrier when an automated lifting bracket moved and crushed the employee's fingers, resulting in amputation injuries.

An employee was using a sledgehammer to drive an 8" railroad spike to secure a street road plate. As the employee struck the railroad spike into the asphalt, it ricocheted out and cut the employee's right shin.

An employee was on an 8-foot scaffold conducting a repair activity on a vessel when a hot substance shot from an opening in the vessel, striking the employee's face and causing second degree burns. The employee also fell off the scaffold and suffered a swollen right wrist.

An employee was operating a bulldozer in a pond where hydrogen sulfide had been detected by monitoring devices. The employee was found unconscious and required hospitalization. Personal protective equipment was not worn at the time.

At approximately 3:45 p.m., on 8/20/18, an employee was changing roof anchors when he fell approximately 10 feet from the roof to the ground, spraining his ankle and fracturing his spine. He was hospitalized. The employee's fall protection was disengaged at the time of the incident.

An employee was adjusting the cover on an LED light when he contacted a live wire and was shocked, suffering electrical burns that required hospitalization. Gloves were not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was repairing a piece of heavy equipment when a metal plate fell, pinching his right ring fingertip between the plate and the ground and resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was climbing a ladder when his hand slipped off a rung and he fell to the concrete ground below, breaking a hand and foot.
An employee was hammering a steel wedge when a piece of metal flew off and lodged in his chest, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was attempting to flip over a concrete column form using a tower crane to access and tighten the pipe braces on the bottom side of the form. His hand was on a partially suspended form when his left thumb was pinched between the form and the pipe brace, resulting in a partial thumb amputation (just below the first knuckle).

Two employees were using survey equipment to set a center line measurement in a cross-over median section of the roadway when a vehicle drove across the roadway at a hard 45-degree angle and struck both employees. One employee suffered a knee injury and abrasions, while the other employee suffered a clavicle fracture and laceration.
An employee was stacking boxes of tile when one box fell on and broke his foot. He was hospitalized.
An employee was trying to start a truck engine by adding fuel to the carburetor. There was a fire, and the employee suffered burns to the torso and left arm.
An employee was rigging a crane with a panel. When the crane lifted the panel off the floor, another panel that was next to it fell on the employee, who suffered a broken leg and back fracture.
An employee fell 15 feet off a roof to the concrete below, dislocating the right shoulder, fracturing the right elbow, and fracturing the right heel.

While carrying HVAC equipment on a roof, an employee walked over a foam board covering and fell approximately 18 feet through the rough opening of the skylight to a lower level floor. The employee broke both ankles and suffered a fractured vertebra.
An employee's shin was hit by a hammer.
An employee was standing on the ground observing pole line construction when he began showing signs of heat exhaustion, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was walking and carrying a bucket of hot rubberized material when he tripped and fell over a propane tank line. The bucket hit the ground, causing hot tar to splash onto his arms and burn his skin.

An employee was using a core drill to drill into concrete when the drill bit became stuck, spun around, became airborne, and struck the employee in the head. The employee suffered a small fracture and was hospitalized.
An employee suffered from extreme cramping and vomiting while tying rebar outside, requiring hospitalization for dehydration and heat illness.

An employee was cleaning under a mutton saw that had been shut off when the blade came into contact with her right index finger, causing a severe laceration. She was hospitalized. The saw was guarded at the time.
An employee was removing an overhead door during demolition-type activities when part of the door came down and injured the employee's finger.
An employee had been applying coating to pipes for about 30 to 45 minutes when he became ill due to heat exhaustion, dehydration, and kidney failure, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell 19 feet off a two-story residential roof to the concrete below during roofing activities. The employee suffered a broken arm and was hospitalized.

An employee was saw-cutting a concrete slab with an electric flat saw powered by a generator. The electrical cord was being run through an open doorway. A doorstop was holding the door open. Someone removed the doorstop, and the cord was crushed and shorted out, energizing the saw. When the employee touched the saw, he sustained an electrical shock to the right arm and torso.
An employee was changing gloves while holding a drill when the drill trigger was pushed. The tool drilled into his left hand, causing a laceration and tendon damage to his pinky finger.

On 8/22/2018, an employee was putting plywood down between two joists while laying floor decking when he stepped on non-secured plywood and fell through the gap between joists. He fractured his ribs, elbow, and left arm, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was handling a 30-pound tube block to place on a trailer bed. In an attempt to keep the tube block from falling, his right thumb was caught between the tube block and the bed of the trailer, resulting in a right thumb tip amputation.
An employee fell 6 feet off a straight ladder to the cement floor, fracturing both wrists.

An employee was moving an articulating dump truck on a mat bridge when one of the tires caught the edge of the mat bridge and began to slide. The truck slid off the bridge and rolled onto its side. The employee suffered a punctured lung, fractured ribs, and a head laceration, requiring hospitalization.

While backing up an excavator, an employee reached out to pull in a mirror to avoid striking a telephone pole. The employee's hand was caught between the mirror and pole, resulting in fingertip amputations.

An employee was on his hands and knees, doing maintenance work on a roof. He stood up, became dizzy and then fell off the roof, landing 12-15 feet below. He suffered broken ribs, a broken pelvis, a head contusion, and a cut to his right little finger. At the time of the incident, the employee's harness that was not tied off.

An employee was helping remove a raised elevator basket when a chunk of debris fell from the basket to the ground, 70 feet below. The debris bounced off the ground and struck the employee's hand, causing an amputation to his ring and little fingers at the second knuckle.

An employee was installing new breaker hardware in existing panels. While the employee was wiring the hardware, crossed phases caused an arc flash. The employee suffered severe burns to his face, neck, and both arms and was hospitalized. The hardware was not shut down or locked out at the time of the incident.
A roofer fell off the edge of a roof, suffering broken legs.

An employee was lowering a concrete pipe (weighing approximately 2,000 lbs.) into a trench when the pipe struck the employee. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured pelvis and ruptured bladder.

An employee was climbing a ladder with a 46-pound aluminum box frame. The frame hit a wall and began to fall; as the employee tried to stop it, he suffered a shoulder dislocation that required surgery.
An employee fell 11 feet, 5 inches through a roof hole opening to the next lower level, suffering back, rib, and head injuries. The hole was unmarked and unguarded at the time of the incident.

After reporting to work at 7:00 a.m., an employee became lethargic and shaky at about 9:30. Suffering from possible heat exhaustion, he was hospitalized for testing related to a possible heart attack.

An employee was installing wire mesh on a second floor, about 20 feet high. He fell, breaking his right arm. A harness was not being worn at the time of the incident, and the employee was outside the area protected by a safety wire.

An employee was removing a wire from a 480 VAC meter when the employee made contact with a live wire. An arc flash occurred, causing second and third degree burns to the employee's face, neck, torso, and left arm. Proper personal protective equipment was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was in a scissor lift welding a clip angle and needed to reposition the scissor lift for the next weld. While repositioning the scissor lift, his left hand was caught between the top rail and an existing pipe support, resulting in a partial pinky fingertip amputation.
An employee suffered heat exhaustion while working inside a tunnel pipe.
An employee was using a grinder when it caught onto his shirt and contacted his chest, requiring stitches.
An employee was standing on the tongue of a tractor trailer attempting to loosen the safety strap on a load of pipes when he fell 2 feet off the trailer to the ground and broke his hip.

Employees were getting off the roof of a single-story home due to rain. While retrieving tools from the roof, an employee slipped on the wet panels and fell to the ground, about 10 to 12 feet below. He suffered a broken right ankle and was hospitalized for surgery.

A Rozell Industries employee was working near a contractor who was using a stone wheel grinder when the stone wheel blew apart. The shrapnel hit and broke the employee's leg, requiring hospitalization.
An employee became ill while doing landscape work. He was hospitalized for possible heat-related illness.

An employee was walking beside a stand-behind trencher as it dug a trench. The cutting chain pulled in one of his shoelaces and severely lacerated his lower left leg. The chain was guarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was observing the hoisting of a steel roof beam. As the crane was setting the beam down so its rigging could be tightened, the beam fell out of the rigging, hit the ground, rolled, and struck the employee. It broke his left ankle and lacerated his right foot.

An employee was operating a joiner saw. While the employee was pushing a board on the saw, the employee's left hand slipped into the guard and touched the blade, which amputated the middle fingertip. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was in a scissor lift welding lintels. The scissor lift platform was struck from below by a moving personnel hoist crushing the employee into the ceiling. The employee sustained a fractured arm and wrist, a collapsed lung, a blood clot in the lung, and kidney damage.
An employee was moving a piece of steel to its landing position when his left fourth digit fingertip was caught between the steel and its landing position, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee fell off his truck to the ground while getting bars and chains to tie down his load, fracturing a leg.

An employee was attempting to adjust a chain on a utility pole when the pole moved back into a hole, catching the employee's right thumb between the pole and chain. The employee suffered a thumb tip amputation when he pulled his hand out of the pinch point.
An employee was walking by a stack of drywall when the drywall fell on her right leg, breaking her tibia and fibula.

An employee climbed onto the fourth story roof of a multi-family structure to begin installing flashing around chimneys. As he stepped to connect his lanyard to a lifeline, he slipped on synthetic felt covering the roof and fell approximately 30 feet onto a porch overhang, before falling  about 10 more feet onto a concrete driveway. He was hospitalized with a fractured upper front right rib, a laceration to the back of the head, a concussion, and abrasions to the face.
An employee was walking next to a milling machine when it ran over his right foot. Amputating his foot and ankle.
An employee was installing a cast iron pipe when the pipe fell and amputated his right thumb.

An employee was breaking down a pump trailer while standing on a platform approximately 3 feet above the ground when the employee turned and fell off the platform to the ground, suffering shoulder and rib fractures.

An employee was cutting deck boards with a power saw. The saw cut the hand he was using to secure a board, severing the ring fingertip just above the end joint and lacerating the index and middle fingers.
An employee was working at a residential construction site when he fell from a window opening to the ground, breaking a femur.
An employee was installing a gas line to a residence and felt lightheaded possibly due to the heat.
An employee was driving stakes for formwork when he started experiencing cramps throughout his body. He was hospitalized for severe dehydration.

An employee was bringing trash down a stairwell when he stumbled and fell down five steps, landing on his head. He suffered bleeding in the brain, a fractured cheekbone, and swelling on the right side of his head and eye.

An employee was carrying debris down the stairs when he stumbled and fell down five stairs, striking a door/door jamb on the ground level. He suffered a head contusion, left eyebrow laceration, and right eye/facial swelling.

An employee was using a circular handheld saw to cut a wood midrail from a guardrail system. While cutting at a downward angle, the employee lost control of the saw, which then lacerated the employee's right thigh.
An employee became ill due to heat stress while performing masonry work on a manhole, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was emptying trash cans when he approached a trash can that was behind the support bracing for an overhead crane. He stepped over the support bracing and his left foot was caught on the bracing. He then lost his balance and fell, fracturing his right hip.
An employee slipped on a wet road as he approached a leaking hot tar kettle. Hot tar burned 40 percent of the surface of his hands.
An employee stepped off the counterweight of a crane and fell 6 to 8 feet to the ground below, suffering back and rib injuries.

An employee was training another employee on how to light the back part of a paver and set his butane torch down on the paver. When the paver was later started, its doors closed on the torch, causing it to bend, be punctured, and blow up, at which point the employee jumped from the paver. He suffered burns to both arms, his nose, and forehead, as well as a possible broken left heel.

An employee was installing a ground rod with a sledge hammer when the shaft of the handle pulled away from the ground rod, came down, and pinched his right thumb. His thumb was lacerated and required stitches. He was hospitalized after having an allergic reaction to antibiotics.
An employee was working on a lift when the employee's left thumb was pinched between pieces of metal, resulting in a thumb tip amputation.

An employee was working on a raised platform, tightening a pipe with a pipe wrench. As he was pushing the wrench forward, the wrench slipped, which carried him forward and caused him to fall approximately 3 feet. He fractured his right femur. The platform did not have guardrails at the time of the incident.
On August 29, 2018, an employee was operating a mechanical shear when the employee's right hand slipped under the guard and the blade amputated the index fingertip.

An employee was preparing to service a 69-kilovolt OCB switch. One leg of the switch did not disconnect when the air switch was opened. As the employee grounded the legs of the switch, an arc burned his hands and knocked him to the ground, breaking his ribs.
An employee slipped while walking down an embankment and fell to the ground, suffering a ruptured patellar tendon.
At about 2:30 p.m. on August 30, 2018, an employee was found in his car, having vomited due to heat stress. He was hospitalized.

An employee was attempting to clear a jam from a crimping machine. When the employee removed the jammed material, the machine began to operate and amputated the employee's left thumb tip. The machine was not locked/tagged out at the time of the incident.
An employee's right thumb contacted a concrete truck chute, resulting in a thumb tip amputation.

After checking the plumbing in a residential customer's attic, an employee pulled his truck into a local park to perform paperwork. A bystander found him slumped over the wheel. He was hospitalized for dehydration and pneumonia. Heat may have been a contributing factor.

On August 30, 2018, an employee was carrying a concrete finishing machine when he tripped over a lip. The machine fell on his right hand and one of the blades caught his right ring finger, amputating it above the first joint.
An employee was using a nail gun to install a roofing system when a nail ricocheted and struck the employee's eye. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
While standing on a mezzanine doing electrical work, an employee fell through a cover for the light panels to the floor below. The employee sustained a hip fracture.

An employee was stepping down an extension ladder after installing a ceiling anchor for a section of duct when the ladder and employee fell. He suffered a broken right wrist, broken ribs, and a punctured lung.

At 3:11 a.m. on August 31, 2018, while working in a manhole, an employee was overcome by an unknown air contaminant and lost consciousness. A second employee entered the manhole to rescue the first, but also lost consciousness. One of the employees was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a boom lift in reverse when he hit a parked mobile crane. His left arm was pinched between the basket guardrail and the crane, fracturing it above the elbow.

At 4:00 p.m. on August 31, 2018, an employee was installing water lines in a trench when it collapsed, partially burying the employee. The employee suffered a broken pelvis, broken ribs, head trauma, and broken facial bones. Cave-in protection was not installed in the trench.

An employee was removing metal bars from the base of a hammer cage being held up by a crane when the cable holding up the hammer snapped. The hammer dropped and pinned the employee's left hand, which had to be amputated at the wrist.
An employee was loading a forklift machine with steel walings (I-beam) when a waling fell off the forklift and caught his right hand, amputating his ring fingertip.
An employee was installing a garage door counterbalance. The spring action lifted the employee 6 to 8 feet into the air, causing fractures to the hip and shoulder. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was installing shingles on an approximately 8-foot-high roof when the employee fell from the roof onto a concrete wall, suffering a lacerated lip and fractured jaw.

An employee was under a parked vehicle performing repair work on brake lines when the vehicle rolled over his left arm and left side, momentarily pinning him between the vehicle tire and the ground. He suffered broken ribs as well as multiple cuts and contusions.
AN employee was carrying a roll of insulation tape when he slipped and fractured his left leg, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing trusses when the truss he was tied to faulted and he fell 12 feet to the ground, suffering lacerations to the head and shoulder.
An employee at a water line drilling site was struck by a hose when its fitting broke at the threads. The hose broke the employee's cheekbones.

Two employees were working from an aerial lift to install insulation within the interior walls and roof of an aviation hangar. The lift operator drove it into an existing two-foot deep excavation causing the lift to tip over. Both employees fell out of the lift basket onto the concrete hangar floor. One employee was hospitalized for multiple leg fractures. Both employees were wearing a personal fall arrest system at the time of the incident.

An employee was cutting a 5-inch by 6-foot floor board using a table saw. The board jammed, and the employee's left hand was pulled into the saw. His left thumb and palm were severely cut. He was hospitalized, requiring surgery.
An employee was walking down a stairway. He tripped on the last step and fell forward, striking his head on a wooden table. He was hospitalized for facial surgery.

An employee was pulling back the rods of a boring machine when the rods became bound. Once they became loose, the bore rods flipped over and a bore head struck the employee's right leg, breaking bones.

An employee lost consciousness while standing on the second step of a front end loader, 3 feet off the ground. The employee fell, suffering a kidney laceration, a facial fracture, and several fractured ribs. The employee was wearing a hard hat.
An employee was installing a water pipe when he became overheated and later experienced leg cramps, requiring hospitalization for dehydration.
An employee tripped while walking and broke her kneecap on the floor, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was moving a lift into another room and had closed the room door when a sheet metal damper installed in the wall above the door fell from the ceiling and hit the employee's back, fracturing the C5 vertebra and compressing other vertebrae.
An employee was setting up equipment at an electrical substation when the employee became ill and passed out due to heat exposure, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was climbing an extension ladder when the employee fell from the ladder to the ground, suffering a shattered heel and other injuries. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was on an 8-foot ladder, taking apart a light fixture in a ceiling grid. A live wire shocked him and he fell to the floor. He suffered burns and lacerations to his left hand.
A temporary employee was using a shovel to finish the edges of a clay tennis court. The employee became ill due to heat stress and was hospitalized.
An employee was installing bolts to hold the metal parts of a framework when a metal part slipped and trapped his right pinky fingertip, resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was on a 12-foot ladder changing a light fixture. He lost his balance and fell to the tile floor, suffering a head laceration and fractures to his right elbow, his left wrist, three ribs, an eye socket, and his skull. He was hospitalized.
As a banded load of concrete forms was lowered onto a flatbed trailer using a forklift, it crushed a trailer truck operator's finger. The tip was amputated.
An employee was driving a buggy down a hill when he hit a curve and fell off the buggy onto a concrete sidewalk, hitting his head and suffering a concussion.
The top of an employee's gang box fell on his finger, resulting in an amputation.
An employee was installing a transformer when an arc flash occurred, causing second degree electrical burns to the employee's right arm. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was installing a walkway when a motorized wheelbarrow struck his foot, resulting in a cracked ankle and puncture wound that required hospitalization.
An employee was cutting wood with a chop saw. The saw caught the employee's left index finger, amputating the tip.
An employee was using a high-pressure hose to find an underground utility line. The wand fell on his left foot, cutting it with water pressure.

An employee was running a concrete pump truck when the boom struck either the employee or handrail, causing the employee and handrail to fall 29 feet. The employee was hospitalized with a head laceration, five broken ribs, a broken ankle, and a fractured fibula.

While an employee was using a manual post driver, his left middle finger was trapped between the driver and a post. The fingertip was crushed; he was hospitalized, and the tip was medically amputated.
An employee was removing a hose from a mud pump with a crescent wrench when the wrench slipped off the nut and his hands were mashed between the wrench and pump.
An employee was welding laps on a commercial roof. The employee slipped and fell about 13 feet, suffering a broken humerus, broken rib, broken spinal wing, and pelvic fractures.
An employee was ripping lumber using a circular saw. The saw kicked back, striking the employee's left thumb and cutting off the tip just below the nail.

An employee was on top of a baker style scaffold that was approximately 5 to 6 feet high attempting to move it when the employee became unstable and fell to the concrete ground below, suffering neck fractures.
An employee fell from a third floor while conducting roofing work, fracturing a leg.

An employee was crossing the street while a crew was paving a section of road.  He was within the work zone when he was struck by another passing car that was in the wrong temporary lane of traffic. He flew over the car and landed on the ground behind it. He was hospitalized with a broken ankle, two fractured/chipped vertebrae, minor cuts to his head, loss of skin from the back of one hand, and a small brain bleed.
An employee was climbing a ladder when he fell, suffering a broken wrist and a cut on the forehead.
An employee was riding in the back of a company work truck when a pipe roller made contact with his hand, causing multiple fractures.
An employee picked up a portable bandsaw. It activated and its blade touched his right hand, amputating the little finger up to the first knuckle.
An employee was moving steel with an overhead crane when the crane hook slipped off the chain and the steel fell on the employee, cracking the employee's right femur.
An employee was using a screwdriver when it slipped from the employee's hand and struck the employee's left eye. Safety glasses were not worn at the time of the incident.

A flagger was trying to instruct a passenger vehicle to stop when the vehicle's side mirror struck her. She fell to the ground and the truck ran her over, breaking her leg and hip. She was hospitalized.
While standing on a bumper checking water levels on a truck, an employee slipped and fell to the ground. The employee was hospitalized with a broken right wrist.
An employee was taking speed shoring out of a truck when it opened, pinching off the employee's little finger.
While building a platform to cover an elevator shaft, an employee slipped and fell 8 feet to the ground. The employee suffered broken ribs.

An employee was performing abrasive blasting when a pipe made contact with his blasting hood and slid down his chest and waist area, knocking him to the ground. He suffered fractures on his spine and pelvic area.

Two employees were installing a jumper between two power lines from an aerial lift when an arc flash occurred. The first employee suffered a second degree burn on his left thigh, and the second employee received a first degree burn to his left arm. They were both hospitalized.
Two employees were cutting with a saw when carbon monoxide built up. They suffered carbon monoxide poisoning and were hospitalized.

An employee was helping another employee move a generator when he stepped onto a skylight that had been coated over. He fell about 13 feet to the concrete floor, suffering a fractured rib and internal bleeding.

An employee was directing an excavator in the installation of water piping. The employee's left middle finger was caught and fractured between the excavator's quick disconnect and a piece of lumber. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
On September 13, 2018, an employee was framing a home when a wall that was being moved by a telehandler lift fell over and struck the employee. The employee suffered a broken pelvis.

A lease employee was on an A-frame ladder, testing wires for live electrical service. When he made the tap, he was shocked. He fell about 4 feet onto concrete, breaking his left hip, left scapula, and right shoulder.

A temporary employee was working from a metal ladder, troubleshooting a lighting problem. The employee was shocked and thrown from the ladder, suffering injuries including (but not limited to) a broken hip and broken ribs. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was climbing up and over a concrete wall and broke his fibula when he jumped down from the wall to the ground.
An employee was compacting dirt using a plate compactor when a rubber-track mini-excavator ran over his left foot, breaking two bones.
An employee walked and slipped on the ground level of a terminal, fracturing his right arm.
An employee experienced heat-related illness and cramping while working outdoors, requiring hospitalization.

Two employees were using ATVs to help transport a 236-foot length of pipe. One ATV struck the other, causing it to roll over; its driver suffered broken legs, a broken pelvis, and a hand laceration. The driver was hospitalized. One of the driver's legs was amputated.

An employee was replacing a roof panel on a storage building when a panel gave out and the employee fell approximately 9 feet onto a concrete block, fracturing bones in the face. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was placing plywood down on flooring at ground level when he tripped over a gap between two pieces of plywood, causing him to fall and fracture his right arm.

At about 5:00 p.m. on September 15, 2018, an employee was driving a utility vehicle at a natural gas pipeline site when it flipped over. The employee suffered a potential stomach tear and was hospitalized.
While re-roofing a home, an employee fell off the one-story roof to the ground. The employee suffered a broken forearm.

An employee was picking up a spare tooth from under the wheel of a ditching machine when the machine operator lowered the crumming shoe, striking the employee. The employee suffered bruised lungs and a bruised abdomen, as well as two broken ribs.
At approximately 1:15 PM, was accommodating an empty bucket  to sit on it when a snake bit his left hand, requiring hospitalization.
An iron worker was injured when a clamp fell approximately thirty-five feet and struck the employee in the head.

A spreader chain was holding a tailgate open. The employee pulled the chain out while the employee's finger was between a box and the gate. The tailgate then smashed and severed the employee's right ring fingernail and index finger at the distal joint.
An employee was on the third rung of an A-frame ladder applying caulking to a wall when the employee slipped and fell off the ladder, fracturing both ankles.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut a wood wedge when the saw struck a knot in the wood and kicked back, partially amputating the employee's thumb tip.
An employee was changing the tools on an auger driller. The employee's right middle finger was caught between the kelly bar and the slide box. The finger was amputated.

An employee was using a power saw to rip 2x4 lumber. The lumber kicked back, striking the employee's hand. The employee's left middle fingertip was amputated; the little finger and ring finger were lacerated, with tendon involvement.
An employee performing carpentry work fell from an 8 foot stepladder to the ground below and sustained a broken right wrist, bruised chest, and bruised face, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was using a chop saw to cut a 10-inch steel pipe that was suspended in the air using a telehandler. A piece of cut pipe fell to the ground and toppled over, striking the employee. The employee was hospitalized with a broken left leg and right ankle.

An employee was climbing a ladder up a scaffold that he was erecting. He was carrying a section of the scaffold in his hand when the section became caught on the scaffold, causing him to lose his balance and fall approximately 8 feet. He suffered a cerebral injury, bruising, internal bleeding, loss of feeling in his legs, and paralysis.
Employees were pulling a fiber optic cable with a rope attached to an ATV when the rope snapped and struck an employee on the left arm.

An employee was on a ladder next to a wooden wall when the wall bracing broke off, allowing the wall to fall and knock into the ladder. The wall fell on the employee's ankle, fracturing it and requiring surgery.

An employee was working in a boom lift to take measurements for a replacement panel when the weld between the boom lift mast and jib broke, causing the employee to fall 12 to 15 feet within the basket to the ground. The employee fractured six ribs.

An employee was ripping a 2/4 plank on a table saw. As he reached to grab the 2/4 plank, the saw blade lacerated his right index finger and thumb, requiring hospitalization. The saw blades were unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee fell from a scaffold to the ground while removing foundation pins, suffering a broken pelvis.
An employee as working on a cover on a barge when the cover slipped and the employee fell about 20 feet to the bottom of the barge. The employee broke his left femur and was hospitalized.

Two employees were working in a designated paving area. The first employee was operating an asphalt paver while a second employee was walking to the left of the paver, examining the paving, when a publicly owned vehicle veered into the designated paving area and struck the two employees. The first employee suffered fractures to the left leg, while the second employee suffered multiple fractures to the body.
An employee fell approximately 9 feet from a basement wall to the concrete floor while installing anchor bolts due to possible heat exhaustion, suffering a broken neck and spinal injuries.
An employee was setting up a core drill when the bit fell and amputated his fingertip.
An employee was turning quickly to catch a vender's attention when she fractured her ankle.

An employee was leaning over to pick up an air hose when his left pinky finger was run over by a motorized cart that ran on precast form molds, resulting in a partial finger amputation. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was framing a new building. The employee fell from the building's roof to the ground, suffering broken ribs, a concussion, and possibly other injuries. The employee was hospitalized.
While performing metal decking, an employee slipped and fell 14 feet to the ground, suffering a broken back.

An employee was operating a compactor truck in a parking lot. The compactor tipped over; the employee was thrown out, then its rollover protection system struck his right leg, causing an amputation injury. A seat belt was not being worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was shocked while removing the steel cover from an underground electric pull box. The employee lost consciousness.

An employee was changing a filter on an air conditioning unit when his ladder slipped. The employee grabbed the side of the unit and their hand struck a piece of angle iron projecting from the unit as it slid down amputating his pinky finger.
An employee was fixing a tap on a sewer line. The trench collapsed, inuring the employee's shoulder, ribs, and back. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was rigging and helping an excavator operator connect a reinforced concrete pipe when the pipe twisted and struck the employee's right femur, causing a deep contusion.
An employee was operating a roller/compactor when he went down an uneven slope and jumped out of the vehicle. He stepped into a rut in the side of the slope and fractured his lower right leg/ankle.
An employee was sanding a portion of a work basket placed on a saw horse stand when the equipment fell onto the employee's left leg, breaking it and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was operating rig equipment to drill and install soldier piles. The rig was traveling to the next pile location when it encountered a soft spot on the bench. The employee immediately stopped on command from the spotter. The left side track of the rig then started to sink, causing the rig to tip over on its side. The employee's left leg struck the tramming levers and computer inside the cab when the rig tipped over, suffering two fractures below the knee.
An employee was climbing down a fixed ladder when he lost his grip and fell to the lower level of the building, 10 feet below. He suffered a fractured femur and a fractured back.
An auger came loose and struck an employee, breaking the employee's left arm in 16 places.
While setting up temporary traffic control, an employee was struck by a distracted driver in a work zone, suffering facial, skull, rib, and clavicle fractures.

An employee was descending from an electric pole when he stepped into 6-foot tall weeds and fell backward, impaling his left buttock on a metal fence T-post that was covered by the weeds. He was hospitalized.
An employee was turning on a 480-volt breaker to reenergize machines when an arc flash burned the employee's left arm and left hand. The employee was hospitalized.
A pipe fell onto an employee breaking his femur.
An employee fell off a roof and fractured his skull, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was working from a portable ladder when he fell straight down from the top of the ladder, hitting his head and breaking his ribs and clavicle. He was hospitalized.
An employee was attempting to descend a ladder when the employee fell from level 6 to the concrete floor on level 5, sustaining a compound fracture to the right leg below the knee.
An employee was leaning on a pile of sheet metal and amputated a finger between sheets of metal.
An employee was adding an extension to a rock drill when the rock drill rotated and fractured the employee's arm.

An employee was cutting a chamfer on the edge of the concrete curb with a cut-off saw. The curb broke and pinched the blade which caused the cut-off saw to kick back and cut the employee's shoulder/armpit area.
An employee was showing the owner the possible issue with the electrical panel when the panel arced. The employee suffered burns to the left side of the face and neck.
An employee was standing in a row of curbing and was caught by granite curbing. The employee was hospitalized for a lower leg fracture.
On September 24, 2018, an employee fell approximately 9 feet off a roof when he was taking a measurement of the gutter system. The employee was hospitalized for a fractured T6 vertebra.
An employee was connecting a trailer to a pickup truck and pinched their left index finger between the trailer and the ball on the trailer hitch resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An electrical lineman working in an elevated bucket sustained an electrical burn under his ribs and atrial fibrillation when the rope he was using to dismantle an overhead electrical distribution system contacted an energized line.

An employee was on a 6- to 8-foot A-frame ladder, sawing an overhead pipe. The side of the pipe gave way and hit the ladder, knocking the employee to the ground below. The employee suffered a broken tibia and was hospitalized.
An employee was troubleshooting a 277-volt light pole and suffered electrical burns to his hand.
An employee was climbing a 10-foot A-frame ladder and fell striking his head on the floor. The employee lost consciousness and was hospitalized.
While descending a ladder, an employee was struck on the neck by a battery pack and suffered a concussion. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was installing a gas pipe at a residential construction site. He was descending an A-frame ladder when he missed a step and fell. He was hospitalized for a broken foot and ankle.
An employee was re-roofing a residential roof in the rain. He slipped and fell from the roof, landing on the concrete ground 19 feet below. The employee suffered a broken leg.
