An employee was installing a new drum of sealant into the road sealant machine and caught their left thumb between the compression piston and plunger assembly resulting in amputation of the distal end.
An employee was guiding the removal of an 8-foot piece of reinforced concrete pipe. The pipe cantilevered downward and struck the employee's left little finger, causing an amputation.
An employee was adjusting a steel beam on two work horses. It fell off the horses, breaking the tip of his thumb and a bone in his foot.
An employee was struck by a pickup truck as it backed up, suffering head and neck injuries.
An employee was carrying a metal piece when the employee tripped and fell. The metal piece then cut off the employee's left thumb tip.
An employee suffered an electrical injury.
An employee was cutting a 6-foot pipe with a chop saw when the blade kicked back, hitting the employee in the face.
An employee fell from a roof to the ground, about two stories below. The employee suffered a fractured pelvis and sacrum, as well as a compressed spine.
An employee was hydroblasting a vertical line when the hose came out and the pressurized water blast lacerated the employee's right wrist and forearm.

A 3-foot-diameter concrete pipe was being lifted by an excavator while a well point was removed. The load swung over and pinned an employee against a 42-inch iron pipe, causing hairline fractures to his left hip. He was hospitalized.
An employee was drilling a hole in a piece of wood when the drill bit grabbed his glove and caught his right index finger, resulting in a fingertip amputation.

On September 26, 2018, an employee was pressure washing a truck conveyor when he tripped over the pressure washer hose and fell approximately 14 feet to the ground below. He was hospitalized with a dislocated left shoulder and fractures to the right arm, L1 vertebra, and pelvis.

An employee was standing on a platform spraying a surfactant onto the bed of an asphalt truck. The truck pulled next to the platform, then veered right; the platform fell over and the employee broke his left leg.
An employee was struck by an I-beam that was being hosted by a crane. The employee's lower left leg was broken, and the employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell 14 feet from an I-beam to the concrete floor below, suffering head trauma and broken ribs.
An employee was walking behind an excavator operating in reverse. The employee's leg/foot was run over and crushed by the excavator's steel track. The lower leg was amputated at the hospital.
An employee was installing electrical boxes when a plumbing pipe broke loose and fell on his right knee, severing cartilage and requiring hospitalization.
On September 27, 2018, an employee was replacing a bolt on the clamps of a drill rig when a clamp closed. The employee's hand was crushed, causing broken bones and an amputation of the ring finger.

Employees were pumping concrete into a 6-foot wall. The pump was plugged, then surged, causing concrete to spray out of it in force and the hose to whip. One of the employees was struck by the hose and knocked off the wall to the ground. The employee suffered broken ribs.
While painting, an employee went to drink water out of a plastic bottle, but the bottle contained a chemical called xylene. The employee ingested the chemical and was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a golf cart when it flipped it over. He broke his left arm and scraped his knee.

An employee climbed into a man lift on the ground. He was about to ascend when a piece of hardened asphalt dislodged from the top of a silo, fell toward the ground, and struck his right hand. He suffered fractures and lacerations to the hand and was hospitalized.

An employee was working on a bridge deck when he walked across an unsecured deck mat and it slid, causing him and the mat to fall approximately 30 feet to the road surface below. He suffered arm, leg, pelvic, and skull fractures; liver bleeding; and a concussion.
While kneeling in front of a meter cabinet, an employee came in contact with a 13-kilovolt wire within the cabinet. An arc flash severely burned the right side of the employee's body.

An employee was steadying a glass panel in a crate with five other panels when the six panels (weighing approximately 900 pounds each) fell on the employee. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured right fibula, torn ligaments in the right ankle, and cuts to the right hand and forearm.

Three employees were attempting to relocate a shoring tower when the tower fell over and struck them. One of the employees received neck injuries and required stitches to the index and ring fingers. A second employee fractured the lower left leg and was hospitalized. The third employee received a contusion to the right hand.
An employee was standing on the second-to-bottom rung of a step ladder, adjusting ladders on top of a van, when he fell backwards and his head struck the ground. He suffered a head laceration.

An employee was repairing a dump truck on the side of the road when his finger was caught in the pulley and belt of a compressor. He suffered a partial amputation of the left ring finger at the tip, after the nail.
A scaffold carpenter was climbing a ladder to build a deck of scaffolding. He fell about 16 feet to the ground, breaking his right arm. He was hospitalized, requiring surgery.

An employee was climbing a ladder with a bundle of shingles when another bundle of shingles was dropped from the roof onto him. He was knocked to the ground, landing on his head and suffering a head injury. He was hospitalized.
An employee was on a ladder, holding a bucket of hot asphalt. He lost his balance and fell to the ground; the asphalt splashed onto him, burning his face, arms and legs. He was hospitalized.
An employee fell while walking down stairs, suffering an ankle fracture/dislocation.

An employee was loading a vibratory roller onto a trailer. The employee missed a step exiting the machine and fell onto the trailer, striking his back and head. He then fell from the trailer onto the ground. He suffered a head abrasion and fracture to the mid- to lower back.
An employee was rotating an asphalt plant baghouse rotor when his right index fingertip was pinched between the rotor and the rotor brake. The fingertip was amputated.

At 11:00 a.m. on October 2, 2018, an employee was installing 15-inch PVC pipe in a storm sewer when his left hand was caught between the pipes. Three of his fingers were smashed; the index finger suffered a partial amputation.
An employee was disconnecting an asphalt hose from a truck. Hot asphalt splashed onto the employee's arms, torso, and neck, causing third-degree burns. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell through a hatch hole in a metal roof deck, landing on the ground below and suffering injuries to the back and right leg.
An employee was trying to remove a piece of lumber from a web saw. The saw blade kicked the lumber back, pulling the employee's middle finger toward the fixed guard and amputating the fingertip.
An employee was cutting flooring with a table saw when the blade amputated two of the employee's fingers.
While fighting a rooftop fire, two employees slipped on melted tar. The tar got on their hands and arms, causing second-degree burns.

An employee was unloading a concrete floor polisher from a vehicle using a lift gate. While trying to stop the polisher from slipping, the employee grabbed a bar that was a part of the machine's suspension system and it moved, pinching the employee's fingers and causing the amputation of the left index and middle fingertips above the first knuckle.

An employee was walking on plywood to check an HVAC unit when he stepped off the board and fell through the ceiling. He suffered a fractured orbital socket and two fractured ribs on the lower left side.

Between 9:00 and 10:00 a.m. on October 3, 2018, an employee was guiding the butt of a wooden electrical pole, which was being lifted by the winch of a digger derrick. The employee's neck came into contact with the pole as it was being grabbed by the pole claws; the top of the pole moved into (or close to) overhead high-voltage electrical lines. The employee suffered a 69,000-volt electrical shock down the body and out his foot.

An employee was sweeping the floor on the second level of a building. The employee fell through an opening in the floor, suffering forehead injuries that required stitches, bruised ribs, and a hip contusion.
An employee was removing sheet metal and studs from a ceiling soffit when a steel stud caused a deep cut to his arm. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee connected a nail gun to an air compressor line. The nail gun shot a nail into the employee's left thigh, deep enough to reach the bone.

An employee was using a derrick digger truck to lift wooden power poles. A pole lodged partially in the pile while being lifted. It shifted direction erratically after being dislodged and bounced toward the employee, striking his right leg and breaking the tibia and fibula.
An employee fell 15 feet through a roof opening while doing roofing work. The employee struck a CNC lathe machine during the fall to the floor and suffered a dislocated shoulder.

An employee was helping lift a 10-foot ductile iron pipe section into a trench box. The pipe came loose from the clamp, bounced sideways, and struck the employee, causing tooth loss and soft tissue injury to an arm.
An employee was deburring a piece of flat metal stock, 3" x 3", about 1/8" thick. The stock lodged in the disc sander, catching and causing the amputation of the tip of the employee's right thumb.

An employee was leaving a second-floor window of a home that was under construction. While hooking his lanyard to a safety rope, he slipped on a wet piece of paper and fell, landing on the ground about 15 feet below and breaking his pelvis on the left side. He was hospitalized.

An employee was on a barge, cleaning and cutting out rebar from a concrete trophy. Suffering from dehydration, he became overheated and dizzy and fell. He landed on a steel beam, which struck the left side of his ribcage and caused a pneumothorax.

An employee was on a 12-foot A-frame ladder, working on a plumbing fixture in a home under construction. He fell off the ladder, striking his head on the concrete floor. He suffered a head laceration and broken ribs, and was hospitalized.
An employee was using a shear to cut a piece of sheet metal. The employee's finger was pinched under the shear's hold-down; the tip was amputated.

An employee was instructing an excavator operator to lift a piece of reinforced concrete pipe (weighing about 10,300 pounds, 6 feet long, and 60 inches in diameter) when it rolled off the excavator bucket and onto the employee, causing a fracture and a torn ligament in his pelvis.
An employee was working on a bridge site when he tripped on angle iron and fell onto rebar. He suffered an injury to the parotid gland on the right side of his face.
An employee was handing a piece of ductwork to a coworker when it slipped from his hand and landed on the ground on top of his left wrist. He suffered a deep laceration to the wrist.

An employee was checking the alignment and tightness of ventilation system drive belts. A belt snagged the employee's glove, pulling the employee's hand into the machinery. The employee suffered multiple fractures, including an open fracture/fingertip amputation.

An employee was using a tugger to pull a cable on a rope. The tugger began to shake out of control; while the employee was trying to stop it from shaking, his hand was pulled into the tugger. The tugger began to roll on the ground, bringing the employee with it until his right index finger was partially amputated.
On October 8, 2018, an employee stepped down the step ladder, lost his balance, and fell off the balcony 11-feet to the ground, breaking his leg. He was hospitalized.
Employees were raising a 10-foot wood wall during framing operations. The wall slipped and fell on one of them, injuring his left elbow and shoulder. He was hospitalized.
An employee was trying to open a large mechanical door when his right hand was caught in the door. Part of his right little finger was amputated.
While installing conduit overhead, an employee fell through an opening in a steel platform to the concrete floor below. The employee suffered a head laceration, broken finger, and ruptured spleen.

A dual-drummed roller was lining up on a pad that was being paved, preparing to roll asphalt. The roller slid and its operator went over an embankment, suffering lacerations and multiple skull fractures.
An employee was walking down an embankment at a construction site. He slipped and fell to the ground below, breaking his tibia and fibula.

An employee was using air skates to move an industrial drill, weighing about 20,000 pounds. The drill tipped over and crushed the employee's thumb against a wedge mounting block. The thumb was surgically amputated up to the first knuckle.

An employee was bolting a steel beam (weighing approximately 720 pounds) to a structure when the steel plates shifted and pinned the employee's left hand. The employee sustained a broken left wrist, middle finger, and ring finger, as well as a severed thumb.
An employee was moving steel beams when his finger was pinched and lacerated between two of them. He was wearing cut-resistant gloves.

An employee was connecting a pipe to a new manhole inside an excavation when the soil caved in and pinned the employee against the manhole. The employee suffered fractured ribs and shoulder and wrist injuries.
An employee was carrying three pieces of 3/4" PVC up a ladder. He fell from the ladder to the concrete slab roof, injuring two vertebrae in his lower back.

A supervisor was on a utility cart, watching another employee cut brush using a tractor with a brush head. An object was ejected from the tractor, striking the supervisor in the head just below his hard hat and causing a fracture.
An employee was struck by an excavator while sweeping debris from the street into a trench, fracturing a leg and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was moving muck that had been dredged from a waterway with a bulldozer. He drove over a ledge and the bulldozer went down quickly and came to a sudden stop. He was thrown forward and struck the front console and windshield, suffering neck and arm pain. A seatbelt was not worn at the time.

A roofing crew was starting a roof installation, carrying up large rolls of insulation to be laid out. A gust of wind blew a roll over while an employee was holding its end, and the employee was pushed over the edge of the roofline. The employee fell to the ground, suffering a forehead laceration and a broken elbow. Fall protection was being worn, but was not adjusted for the distance to the ground.
An employee got into a fight with another person and suffered a broken tibia and fibula. He was hospitalized.

An employee was installing exterior plywood while standing on a second floor deck when he fell one story (about 12 feet) to the ground and broke his left arm, requiring hospitalization. A harness with a lanyard was worn at the time of the incident.
An employee fell from a ladder to the concrete floor, suffering a head injury, fractured ribs, and a fractured collarbone. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was on an extension ladder, about to power-wash a section of roof, when he slipped and fell 10 feet to the ground. His left leg was broken below the knee and his right toe was also fractured.
An employee lost his footing while moving concrete panels. A panel shifted, knocking him backwards to the ground. He suffered two broken ribs and an injured shoulder.

An employee was climbing up a ladder secured to a one-story home. Once the ladder was untied, it slipped and the employee fell. The employee suffered a broken left arm and swelling on the left side of the face.
An employee was spreading MEK solvent on the floor with a broom when a pilot light ignited, causing a fire. The employee suffered first-through third-degree burns on the chest, hands, and arms.
An employee was cutting material with a saw when it cut his finger, resulting in an amputation.
An employee was washing out a pole when an electrical contractor dropped a primary/high voltage line onto the employee's left shoulder area, resulting in an electrocution.
An employee was struck by a falling piece of plywood while cleaning a work surface, resulting in a partial amputation of the left middle finger.
An employee was walking on the bridge deck when he fell approximately 16 feet and landed on concrete panels. He suffered left-side rib fractures and fractures to the lower lumbar vertebrae.
An employee was positioning a piece of angle iron on a concrete pad when the angle iron fell off the concrete pad and struck his right leg, breaking it.
An employee was descending a scaffold ladder when the employee missed a rung and fell approximately 10 feet to the ground, breaking a leg.

An employee was installing gutters on the ridge of a residential building. The employee fell off the roof, suffering a broken pelvis. No fall protection system was in place at the time of the incident.

An employee was hanging plywood to the exterior of an apartment building. The employee was straddling a guardrail and was leaning past it when it swung outwards and the employee fell approximately 11 feet out of a wall opening onto a concrete patio. The employee was wearing a harness and a lifeline, but it failed to arrest his fall. Both of the employee's knees were fractured and his chin and right hand were lacerated.

An employee was painting on top of a scissor lift platform that was extended 19 feet when the lift went over a ramp incline and became unstable, tipping over. The employee impacted the ground, suffering broken ribs and fractured vertebrae.
An employee suffered from smoke inhalation while troubleshooting an electrical fire.
While installing a new roof on a facility under construction, an employee fell to the lower level and suffered a broken right arm.

An employee was working in an excavation to install a new water line. The employee was cutting an existing steel pipe with a cut-off saw when the pipe broke and caused the saw to kick back. The saw blade contacted and lacerated the employee's neck, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was on the fourth step of a 10-foot ladder installing wood blocking over an exterior doorway when he lost his footing and fell to the ground, hitting it face first. He suffered a broken nose and back injury.
An employee was cutting plywood with a handheld circular saw when it kicked back and lacerated his upper left thigh.
An employee was loading a crane onto a transport vehicle (low boy). The employee jumped down from the exit area of the crane and rolled his right ankle fracturing it.
After completing roofing work, an employee experienced headaches, cramps, and vomiting, requiring hospitalization for kidney failure.
An employee was loading H braces onto a truck when one of the H braces fell from the upright position and struck his right leg, causing a fibula fracture. He was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a hernia while removing a 19-pound strut from a rack, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee and a foreman were removing a steel walkway door when the door closed on the employee's finger, smashing it and causing a soft tissue amputation under the fingernail (fingernail still attached).

An employee was working on the roof bringing down materials to the ground floor. Afterwards, he went to the tent area to take a break and was abnormally fatigued, requiring hospitalization for dehydration and a muscle injury.
An employee was walking on a level hallway surface inside an office building when she collided with another employee and fell to the floor on her hip area. She fractured her hip and was hospitalized.

An employee was descending a wooden electrical pole line with his climbing belt, pull strap, climbing boots, and spikes. He unbelted in order to climb below the telephone lines. While he was putting his climbing belt back on with the pull strap, his spikes lost contact with the wooden pole, causing him to fall 20 feet to the ground and fracture both hips. He was hospitalized.

An employee was exiting the bucket of an aerial lift truck when his foot missed the step, causing him to lose his grip and fall about 8 feet to the ground. He struck his head on the rear outrigger of the truck, suffering a broken C1 vertebra, torn vertebra ligaments, a skull fracture, and two broken ribs. He was hospitalized.

An employee was pouring cement into a foundation form when he was struck by the cement pump truck dispensing arm, causing him to fall approximately 7 feet to the lower working surface. He suffered facial, neck, and head injuries.
An employee received an electric shock and arc flash burns to the hands and neck while pulling cable.
An employee was cutting a steel bar when a hopper gate fell on the employee's head, causing fractures.
An employee was conducting an inspection in a single family home's attic when he fell approximately 12 feet to the ground below, fracturing one of his middle vertebrae.
An employee had just pried up a sewer cover using a pick when it fell onto his right hand, resulting in amputation of his index fingertip.

On October 17, 2018, at approximately 1:40 PM, an employee was straddling a truss approximately 16 feet above the ground and cutting the top off the post with a chainsaw. As he made the cut, the chainsaw cut into his right leg above the knee, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was working on duct work when a piece of duct dislodged and struck the employee's arm.

An employee was putting a piece of decking on the 8-foot roof of a new construction residential home when he fell off the roof and hit the dirt below. He suffered a broken wrist and fracture below his eye, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was doing formwork when he moved and struck a horizontal rebar near his right eye. He suffered a laceration to his right eye that caused significant swelling, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was struck by a wire reel that was being dragged by a pick-up truck, suffering two fractured legs.

An employee was trying to retrieve concrete blankets that blew out of a truck on the highway when the employee was struck by another vehicle, suffering a fractured right ulna and humerus. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was stepping down from a rolling scaffold when the employee lost balance and fell to the ground, fracturing the left hip.

An employee was on the shoulder of a highway unloading boxes from the bed of a material truck when a parked stripe truck rolled approximately 75 feet across the highway, side-swiped the material truck, and hit the employee. The employee's lower left leg was fractured in multiple locations with multiple lacerations.
An employee was removing a bolt cluster ring from a concrete foundation when he slipped on gravel and the ring struck his lower leg, fracturing his tibia and fibula. He was hospitalized.

At approximately 2:00 p.m., on October 18, 2018, an employee moved a recreational vehicle, exited it, and then walked in front of the vehicle. The vehicle was not in park at the time and it rolled over the employee, causing trauma to her lower torso and legs. She was hospitalized.
An employee was helping to secure materials on a truck when a tie-down strap flew back and hit the employee's head above the right eye. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was attempting to relight a pilot light on a customer's hot water heater when the unit flashed, causing a propane blowback into the employee's face that knocked off his safety glasses and caused a possible injury to his eyes.

An employee was putting down a roof deck when he lost his footing, tripped, and fell on the deck (same level), suffering spiral fractures to both bones in the lower right leg. Fall protection was worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was climbing a ladder to install roofing flashing when the ladder slipped out from beneath him. He was hospitalized with a broken rib.
An employee was retrieving a log from a bundle of wood logs that was stacked high. The employee was struck by a log and sustained right leg fractures.
An employee was riding as a passenger in a utility vehicle (UTV) when the driver made a sharp turn and the UTV rolled on its side. The employee suffered a fractured right leg.

An employee was struck by a nail that ricocheted from another employee's nail gun. The nail struck his eyebrow and went behind his glasses and under his hard hat. The nail did not hit his eye. He was hospitalized.

An employee was assisting in the setup of a crane with a fixed jib. As he was handling a tag line, the load moved quickly. When he grabbed the rope, it wrapped around his right middle finger and broke it, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was crossing the road to retrieve flagger signs when the employee tripped and fell to the road surface, fracturing the left forearm and wrist.

An employee was cutting an 8-foot-long vertical section of an 18-inch-diameter pipe with an oxygen and propane torch when the pipe twisted and fell on his foot after the final cut. His right foot was de-gloved, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was setting up a double tee in a storage section when his finger was caught and crushed between the double tee, resulting in a partial finger amputation.
An employee was working in a ditch and was struck by a stolen vehicle. The employee sustained nose and lower back injuries.

An employee was unloading a trailer containing 600-pound rolls of roofing materials when a roll of material rolled off the trailer and struck his right leg, breaking his tibia and fibula. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was getting down from a roof using a scissor lift when he fell 30 feet to the base of the lift scissor mechanism, suffering internal bleeding, kidney damage and multiple fractures to both legs that required hospitalization.

An employee was rolling caution tape while walking backwards near a concrete manhole opening when he tripped and fell backwards into the open manhole, hitting his head on the concrete manhole rim. He suffered a skull fracture and bleeding in the brain.
An employee was setting up a precast concrete bed when his finger was crushed between the sled and end of the precast bed, resulting in a partial finger amputation.
An employee lost footing while loading materials onto a truck and fell face first onto concrete, suffering a broken jaw.

On October 21, 2018, an employee was walking on a concrete roof when the employee tripped over a broom that was laying on the roof and fell to the same level surface. The employee suffered a broken right femur and required surgery.
An employee fell 14 feet from a fixed ladder while climbing up to access the roof, hitting the ground below. He suffered two fractured ankles, a fractured pelvis, and other bruises and contusions.
An employee was helping another employee with a test rig tower when the splitter came out of gear and the metal tub came loose, falling and striking the employee on the head and arm.

An employee was standing next to a steel road plate that was suspended and being moved by a backhoe. While in transit, the suspended road plate started swinging and struck the employee's right foot, which was then caught between the road plate and a concrete curb, resulting in the amputation of his toes.

An employee was standing on the side of the excavation and leaned in to check the source of a noise coming from inside the trench. The concrete gave in where the employee was standing and the employee fell. The employee sustained broken ribs on the left side.
An employee climbed a short wooden ladder to a landing platform. While turning around to face the extension ladder, he fell to the ground, injuring both ankles.
An employee was lifting a spoil box out of a cart when the employee's fingertip was pinched between the box and cart, resulting in a left pinky fingertip amputation.

An employee was part of a crew engaged in dismantling a mast climber type scaffold. The crew was attempting to fully retract the power unit grab hooks to clear the scaffold mast so it could be removed. One employee was positioned at the controls for the power unit while the injured employee knelt down next to the mast to control/verify the position of the hooks. The grab hook inadvertently contacted one of the rungs of the mast, causing it to tip over and strike the injured employee. The employee suffered broken ribs as well as a broken pelvis and sacrum, requiring hospitalization.
Employees were laying sewer pipe when an employee was struck by a pipe, fracturing his hip.

Two employees were working together to lift a manhole cover. One employee placed a claw hammer in the manhole cover to lift it approximately 12 inches when the hammer slipped. The other employee tried to grab the cover but it fell and amputated his left middle fingertip.
An employee fell while exiting the back of a truck, suffering four broken ribs.
An employee was setting wall forms when his right thumb was smashed between two forms, resulting in an amputation.

An employee was installing flashing on a 19th level balcony when he lost his balance and fell backwards off the fourth rung of a ladder, hitting the balcony landing and fracturing his lower vertebra. He was hospitalized.
An employee was stabbed in the stomach by a homeless man on the jobsite.

An employee was attempting to open up a broken garage door when his right pinky was caught between two panels of the garage door. His pinky was sliced open and broke, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was using a vibratory truss screed for concrete paving. The employee was guiding a winch cable back onto the cable spool; the nip point between cable and spool caught the employee's hand, severing the fingertip.
On October 24, 2018, an employee's thumb was amputated by an object that was being lifted or handled.

A valve was installed on a sewer line. When the line was repressurized, a hose with a brass fitting came off the line and struck an employee in the face. The employee suffered a fractured jaw, a broken nose, shattered cheekbone, loss of teeth, and cuts and abrasions to the right eye.
While laying out a tarp at the end of the day, an employee fell about 10 feet off the edge of a roof. The employee was hospitalized for broken ribs, fractured back and a ruptured spleen.

An employee was connecting wires on the line side of an electrical cabinet when an arc flash occurred, causing second degree burns to the employee's right hand, soft tissue of the neck area, and lower part of the face and right ear. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was clearing a rock from a truck tailgate when the tailgate closed on his right ring finger, resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was climbing an extension ladder to access an HVAC system on a roof when he fell about 12 feet to the ground. He suffered a back and pelvis injury and was hospitalized; the pelvis injury required surgery. Gloves were being worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was removing a small section of exterior wall assembly above a precast concrete panel that was being removed.  While he was removing debris around the top of the precast concrete panel, the precast concrete panel shifted, causing his left middle finger to be caught between the top of the precast concrete panel and the bottom of a horizontal structural steel member above. His left middle finger had to be medically amputated.
An employee was helping to work on an 8" water line when it erupted, striking the employee in the left leg and causing a deep laceration that required 100 stitches.

An employee was working inside an interstate lane closure installing raised pavement markers when an automobile swerved into the work zone and struck his right elbow. His right elbow was fractured, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was resetting a traffic barrel on its side when an automobile veered off the road and struck the employee. The employee sustained injury to the legs, ribs and wrist.

An employee was connecting steel tube sections for the installation of helical piles. He was checking the alignment of two tube sections when one of the sections was turned in an effort to align it, and his left index finger was caught in in a bolt hole amputating the fingertip.
An employee was shot in the face, neck, and stomach while getting materials from a work vehicle, suffering trauma and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was shutting down a water pump. When the hose was disconnected, hot water was released and burned the employee's leg.
While working from a podium ladder, an employee lost balance and fell to the ground, suffering a broken left wrist and ribs.

An employee had just finished rigging a bundle of channel iron together to be lifted to the roof of a building. When the load began to lift, the employee was stepping back from the load to grab the tagline when he reached out and lightly placed his left hand against the load to steady it. At that time, the bundle of channel iron rolled inward, catching his left glove and pulling his hand in between two pieces of iron. He was able to pull his hand back immediately, but his left middle fingertip was crushed, resulting in an amputation (without bone loss) of the distal tip of his left middle finger.
An employee was preparing to jet drain lines when a hose developed a pinhole and water shot out at 3,800 psi. The employee's hand was lacerated between thumb and finger.
On October 26, 2018, an employee was torch cutting a steel racking system when the system struck and fractured the employee's leg, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was struck by a reversing forklift, suffering a broken leg and ankle.
An employee was working on a milling machine when its drum caught his left foot, amputating the third and fourth toes.
An employee was grinding an I-beam when the grinder disk ruptured and blew into the employee's right leg, fracturing the tibia and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was walking/working on a roof and stepped through insulation, falling 8 to 12 feet onto a catwalk. The employee suffered multiple bruises to the neck, shoulder, and shin (tibia).
An employee was installing the pins in the exterior carriage basket of a machine when the drive struck the employee's right leg crushing it.
An employee was in a trench clearing away dirt when the trench collapsed on the employee. The employee sustained two broken ribs and a collapsed lung, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was straddling an I-beam and scooting across it when he lost his balance and the yo-yo to his harness grabbed him, pulling him backwards. He fell 15 feet from the above floor to the finished concrete below, fracturing his face and lacerating his ear.

An employee was struck in the forehead by a metal hook and rope combination that was thrown to him by another employee. The employee sustained a forehead laceration and possible intracranial bleeding.
An employee was on a ladder trimming drywall with a reciprocating saw when the employee fell off the second rung of the ladder to the ground, fracturing the left leg below the knee.
An employee was walking down an embankment when his leg gave out. He suffered a torn quadriceps.
An employee was grinding a steel beam for grounding bracket installation when a gantry crane ran over his foot and crushed it.

On October 30, 2018, an employee was working with a crane, trying to remove lifting forks from a pallet. The employee's left hand was crushed and fractured between the lifting forks and the post supporting the stowed boom. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was boring a 28-inch hole using a concrete boring machine. The machine's anchor bolts broke and the machine spun around and struck the employee causing a left arm fracture.

An employee was laying metal floor decking on the second floor of a building. While dragging a sheet of deck, the employee fell, landing on a 4-foot pier cap about 18 feet below. The employee suffered two broken ribs, a broken left arm (between the shoulder and the elbow), and a fractured pelvis. Fall protection was not being worn at the time of the incident.

The injured employee was on an 8-foot step ladder holding piping while helping another employee install HVAC piping. The employee fell from the ladder and suffered a broken collarbone and a head laceration.

An employee was walking on an I-beam in the lay down area. The employee stepped down from the I-beam and another I-bean (approximately 3,200 lbs.) rolled over onto his ankles fracturing both ankles and the lower right leg.

An employee was assisting a motorist on the side of the highway and was struck by another vehicle while standing at the back of the assist vehicle. The employee was crushed between the two vehicles and suffered a bilateral leg amputation.

An employee was installing tubing, joining connections onto structural beams. He was tied off to the beam he was trying to connect when one end of it came down, pulling him to the ground from about 15 feet up. He suffered a broken left femur and several cracked ribs and was hospitalized.

An employee was kneeling in the street beside a curb, holding an expansion joint in place while concrete was being poured. As the concrete truck pulled forward, its passenger-side front tire ran over the employee's feet. The employee suffered a fracture in the right little toe, damage to blood vessels in the left foot, and lacerations requiring five stitches to the toes on the left foot.
While installing decking, an employee fell from the decking and suffered a dislocated shoulder. The employee was tied off at the time.
An employee slipped off a ladder onto a second employee that was holding the ladder before hitting the ground. Both employees were hospitalized with fractures.
At about 11:00 a.m. on October 31, 2018, an employee was carrying a bundle of rebar that was tied with wires. A wire popped and hit him in his safety glasses, lacerating his right eyelid.
An employee fell approximately 15 to 16 feet off a scaffold to the wood sub-floor while preparing a ceiling for painting, suffering two broken wrists and a broken nose.
An employee was working on a piece of directional drilling equipment. Its fan blade lacerated the employee's right thumb, index, and middle fingers. The employee was hospitalized.

Two employees were loading a dolly with metal frames. One was using a "J" bar to hold the frames in place while the other positioned the dolly. The frames hit the employee handling the "J" bar on the leg, fracturing the tibia and fibula.

An employee was demolishing an abandoned pipeline in a trench, about 5 feet deep, using a demolition saw. He lost balance and the saw cut into his left forearm above the wrist, possibly cutting or nicking tendons. He was hospitalized.
An employee stepped on a recently poured concrete form and suffered a fractured right foot.

An employee was setting up a pressure washer to clean a roof. The employee was uncoiling the pressure washer hose when the employee fell through a skylight fixture and hit the ground, suffering a fractured left knee and left wrist.
An employee was unloading doors from a box truck. A pallet of doors fell from the truck's tailgate, breaking the employee's pelvis.
An employee was on a ladder installing fire dampers at a retail store when the employee fell from the ladder to the floor, sustaining a fracture to the right wrist and right pelvis.
An employee was hit by a collapsing concrete boom truck, suffering trauma, a severed spine, and paralysis. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell through a hole from the third floor to the second floor, landing on a concrete floor. The employee suffered broken ribs and a hip/pelvis fracture and was hospitalized.
An employee was erecting steel in an elevator shaft. A winch was engaged while his hand was on a cable, and his fingers were pulled into the snatch block. His first two fingers were amputated.
An employee fell from a trailer while using a pry bar at a construction site. The employee suffered a broken right wrist and elbow, bruised ribs and chest and road rash on the left side of the face.

An employee was flagging traffic in a highway work zone. A car struck the employee, who traveled an estimated 90 feet before landing. The employee suffered broken legs and back and head injuries, with multiple lacerations.

An employee was adjusting his lanyard to get more slack so he could move to a different part of the roof he was working on. He slipped and fell 8 feet from the leading edge of the roof to the ground, breaking his arm. He was hospitalized.

An employee was rigging a 6-foot bundle of steel to be hoisted off a roof, approximately 105 feet high, with a crane. When the crane lifted the bundle off the roof, the employee's hand was caught in the wire rope sling. He suffered an amputation to the left index finger.
An employee slipped on uneven terrain and fell to the ground. The employee suffered bulging discs.
An employee was working with a plant component that was being released from tension. The component struck the employee, causing a fractured cheekbone, right wrist, and four ribs.
While helping a coworker perform hydroblasting, an employee was struck in both shins by the high-pressure water stream.

At 2:39 p.m. on November 5, 2018, an employee was putting a metal storm drain grate (which had been removed for cleaning) back in place. It pinched a finger on his right hand, causing an amputation that left bone visible. He was hospitalized and underwent surgery.

While removing a tree branch from the edge of a one-story-high roof, an employee fell through a skylight to the concrete floor. The employee suffered fractured ribs, a lacerated liver, and a broken wrist.
An employee was operating a road roller when it rolled down an embankment and tipped over, throwing him to the ground. His left hand was broken and he was hospitalized, requiring surgery.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut a board. The saw cut two of the employee's fingers off.

On November 5, 2018, an employee was placing scrap metal onto a trailer when the load began to shift and the employee dismounted from the trailer. A few pieces of steel slid from the trailer and onto the employee's right leg, fracturing the tibia and fibula. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.

A truck pulled under a conveyor system (being used to remove dirt that had been excavated from an interior courtyard). The truck's canopy roller struck the conveyor, moving it forward and causing it to strike a nearby employee and break three of his ribs. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was installing a metal roof and fell 8 feet from a ladder onto a concrete sidewalk. The employee sustained a concussion and a bruised elbow and knee.

While helping offload concrete traffic barriers at a construction site, two employees were struck by a flatbed truck as it backed up. One of them suffered a broken right foot and ankle and was hospitalized, undergoing surgery.
While hanging doors, an employee fell from a fourth-story balcony, landing on the ground 40 feet below. The employee suffered a fractured right wrist and a contusion to the lower back.
While installing lights, an employee fell from a ladder to the floor and suffered a fracture to the left femur.

An employee was using a chainsaw to cut a tree limb when it became wedged in the limb. A coworker used his chainsaw to cut part of the limb to relieve pressure on the chainsaw. As the employee was retrieving his chainsaw, he moved in the direction of his coworker and his left pinky came in contact with his coworker's chainsaw blade. His left pinky finger had to be medically amputated.

An employee was removing rigging hooks and chains from a concrete storm drain that was being hoisted into a trench when his hand was caught between the hook and the concrete structure. His hand was fractured and lacerated.

A backhoe was removing tub and frame forms from a new drill pier foundation. An employee got his right index finger caught between the hoisting chain and the bucket of the backhoe resulting in an amputation.
An employee sustained a fractured leg after being caught between a concrete wall and a front-end loader, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee tossed a dirt clod at the injured employee, who lost his balance, fell to the ground, and fractured his right arm while trying to break his fall.
An employee came into contact with a 5 kV power line and sustained an electric shock, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was adjusting a part of the pneumatic tool on a piece of equipment when his left index finger was caught by the tool and amputated.
On November 7, 2018, an employee stepped on a wire that cut his toe.
An employee was carrying a floor truss across other set trusses when the truss he stepped on broke and he fell 9 feet to the floor, fracturing his ribs and shoulder.

An employee was helping a delivery driver offload equipment from an 18-wheeler trailer. He fell from the trailer to the ground about 3 feet below, suffering a head laceration (which required sutures) and a broken left third rib. He was hospitalized.
An employee was climbing a ladder with a pneumatic nail gun. The nail gun actuated and sent a nail through his knee.

An employee was taking down a shore post for deck forming. After removing the pin from the shore post, he put his left hand on the top portion of the post and his right middle finger in one of the adjustment holes for the pin. When he proceeded to remove the shore post, it slid down and his middle finger was caught between the adjustable top slide and the adjustment hole itself, lacerating the very tip of his middle finger and resulting in an amputation.

An employee was stepping out onto a 12-foot-wide, 6-foot-deep wood platform raised to a third-story window opening with a telescoping boom forklift. The platform flipped off the side of the forks and the employee fell about 24 feet to the ground below. The employee suffered a fractured neck vertebra and was hospitalized.

An employee was laying a cement block on the second floor balcony of a new residential building. At the same time, a crane was hoisting a pallet on the eighth floor when a cement block unit fell from the pallet and struck the employee on the balcony. This knocked the employee from the balcony to the ground floor below. The employee suffered a fractured clavicle.

The injured employee was using a chalk line to mark the location of conduit under the roof membrane. The employee slipped on standing water/ice that was near the flag line and fell towards the warning line system. As the employee tried to catch himself, he fell approximately 17 feet off the roof to the ground below. The employee suffered a left hip fracture and lower lumbar fractures (L3 and L4 vertebrae).
Upon turning to exit a van, an employee missed the bumper he intended on using as a step and fell approximately 42" to the ground below fracturing two bones in his lower leg.

An employee was reroofing a two-story condo complex. While reaching to access a ladder, the employee slipped on debris and fell 18 feet, landing on the ground and coming into contact with a bush. The employee suffered cuts on the eyebrow and lips, a minor fracture of the eyebrow, and a suspected concussion. Fall protection was not being worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was walking along the ridge of a roof when he slipped and fell approximately 10 feet and landed on a concrete patio.  He sustained broken bones in both legs and ankles, requiring hospitalization.
An employee had positioned a jack under a steel casing and was hand-pumping it when it slipped. It struck him in the forehead, cutting him and fracturing his skull.
An employee was cutting a 2-by-4 with a radial arm saw. The saw amputated his left index finger.

An employee was walking by a lower pulley that had a wire rope running through two large pulleys when he slipped and grabbed the wire rope to keep himself from falling. His fingers were then pulled into the rotating pulley, resulting in the partial amputation of three fingers.

An employee was descending a ladder. The employee's foot caught on a ladder-up device and the employee fell 18 feet to the ground below. The employee suffered a broken pelvis and fingers and was hospitalized.
An employee was beveling a pipe flange with a compact router. The router's bit jammed and struck the employee on the right hand, lacerating it.

A crew was felling a tree on a transmission power line. When the last cut was made, the tree came off the stump, crashing to the ground. Due to the terrain, it bounced and came straight back, striking an employee in the left leg. He suffered a compound fracture between the knee and the ankle.

An employee was working with a group of three other employees to strip a column form. The employee was holding the column form upright so that when it loosened it would not fall, while another employee was striking the outside of the form with a metal burke bar to loosen the concrete. The injured employee's left hand slid down the side of the form and the burke bar struck it, causing a laceration and fracture to the left ring finger.
An employee was climbing a ladder to paint. The hinge was not locked in place, causing the ladder to collapse. He fell to the ground, injuring his back/spine.
An employee was climbing down a ladder when he fell to the floor, suffering a compound fracture to his right leg.
An employee was rigging a load when his hand was caught between the load and a pendant line. His arm and finger(s) were broken.
An employee was grooving the end of a steel pipe using a roll grooving machine. The machine caught his right middle fingertip, cutting it off.
An employee fell approximately 8 feet while descending a ladder and struck his head.

An employee was dismantling scaffold that was three frames high and had planking that was three planks wide. As he was dismantling the ladder portion, the ladder tipped forward and he lost his balance and fell 18 feet to the ground, suffering a left heel fracture, a right ankle fracture and compression of numbers 1, 2 and 3 vertebrae.
An employee was standing on the third ring of a 6-foot ladder when he lost his balance and fell to the floor. His lower left leg was fractured and he was hospitalized, needing surgery.
An employee was using a grinder to buff concrete when the wheel broke apart, striking the employee in the chest and causing a chest contusion.

An employee was directing a large articulating forklift that was moving some insulation off a flatbed truck. Two bales of insulation were stacked vertically on the forklift when the top bale slipped off, falling onto an employee and breaking the employee's hip.

An employee was replacing the bolts that held the tongue to the main frame. The trailer was on the jack stands. Using the torch, he cut out the bolts on the left side then cut out the bolts on the right side. Some slag was still holding the tongue frame to the main frame. The employee used a bar to pry them apart when the front of the trailer fell off the jack stands and onto his foot breaking all five toes.

An employee was removing bases from a truck's trailer when it lifted off the ground. The employee fell off the trailer and hit the sidewalk, suffering a shattered shoulder, a broken left arm, three broken ribs, a punctured lung, a broken left hip, and a broken bone in his back.

An employee was working on the roof of a car wash that was being built. The employee fell through a roof panel to the floor about 25 feet below, suffering 22 broken bones and a head laceration. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was installing rubber roof material at the edge of a roof. He fell to the ground 39 feet below, suffering a broken pelvis.
An employee was using a drum transfer cart to move a drum. When the employee disengaged the lock on the drum cart, it broke and injured the employee's hand.

An employee was climbing a wooden ladder built at the jobsite to go between the third and fourth floors. The employee slipped and slid down the ladder, falling onto the third floor and injuring the left heel/ankle.

An employee was operating a walk-behind asphalt roller. The employee's left little finger was caught and pinched between the handle of the roller and a building. The upper part of the finger was amputated.
An employee was installing panels for a garage when the wind blew a panel onto the employee's foot. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured foot.

Four employees were attempting to push electrical fitting material over a lift gate when the material fell onto the injured employee, who was standing below them at the time. The employee sustained five broken ribs and shoulder pain.
An employee was working on a roof when he fell approximately 20 feet to the ground below, suffering head lacerations and fractured ribs.
An employee was descending on a scissor lift. An electrical conduit on the wall cut through his glove, smashing his left little finger.

An employee was installing sheeting on a roof. He slipped near the edge and fell 11 feet to the ground below, suffering broken wrists, broken arms, a head laceration, bruises on a leg, and a back contusion. He was hospitalized.

An employee was performing housekeeping activities on a walking/working surface before installing an electrical panel board. While removing plywood on the walking/working surface, the employee stepped forward and fell through a floor hole opening, resulting in a right middle fingertip amputation.
An employee was tightening a drill bit with a wrench when the wrench broke free, causing the employee to fall to the ground. He landed on his back and suffered broken vertebrae.

An employee was installing girt on the metal roof (30 degrees) of a newly built greenhouse from a scissor lift. He got off the scissor lift to nail down the top of the girt, then fell 26 feet through the roof to the ground, breaking his left leg and injuring his neck. He was hospitalized. Fall protection was not being worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was climbing a ladder when the ladder slipped out from under him. He fell approximately 12 feet to the floor, injuring his right shoulder, right wrist, and right ankle and suffering a right knee laceration.
An employee was climbing a ladder to access a residential attic through a hatch. He slipped and fell, and his body struck against the ladder or another solid object as he fell. He broke four ribs.
An employee was replacing a breaker in a high voltage integrated circuit (HVIC) unit when an arc flash occurred, causing second and third degree burns to both hands.

An employee was helping move a fusion welding unit with a forklift and a sling. The unit was frozen to the ground; when it was suddenly freed it swung, hit a pole, and knocked the employee to the ground, lacerating his face and breaking both his ankles. He was hospitalized.
A concrete truck backed over an employee's right ankle.
An employee was hospitalized with broken ribs after being struck by forks that dropped from a powered industrial vehicle.
An employee was moving from one platform to another. The platform gave way and the employee fell 10 feet to the ground, suffering a broken left foot.
An employee was installing a drain pipe on a canopy when he started vomiting at the job site and eventually lost consciousness due to heat. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was guiding a trench box into place in a trench when he lost his balance and fell approximately 9 feet into the box, striking his head. He suffered a cut on his head and a concussion.
An employee was fixing an electrical sign while on an extension ladder outside a local bank when he fell from the ladder to the ground, breaking a femur and shattering an ankle.
While stretching roof insulation, an employee fell through a roof and landed on the ground. The employee suffered head and back injuries.

Two workers were separating a bundle of 2-3 angle iron bar joists. The injured employee was using a pry bar on the ground and was the "hook-on" man. He was separating the angle iron (30-feet length x 2ft. high) when a loose iron bar joist fell onto the employee's left leg crushing it.
An employee was working from a platform about 4-5 feet off the ground, installing deck joists. The employee fell from the platform onto the concrete below, suffering a head injury.

An employee was unloading poles with another employee when one employee dropped his end of the pole and the other end bounced and hit the injured employee in the jaw. The employee was hospitalized with a broken jawbone.
An employee was cutting a concrete pipe with a saw when the saw kicked back and struck the employee's chest, lacerating it.
An employee was reentering a building through a roof hatch when he slipped on the fixed ladder, falling to the level below. The employee was hospitalized for a shattered elbow that required surgery.
An employee was trying to access a rooftop from an adjacent wall. He fell 6 feet to the ground below, suffering fractures to a thoracic bone.

An employee was installing sensor equipment and fell from a fixed ladder to the floor. The employee sustained a fractured left femur, pelvis and arm. He also needed stitches for a laceration on the eyebrow.

An employee was working on a gang wall when their hand was caught between a metal waler and plate washer while installing wall spacers. The left middle finger sustained a laceration requiring surgery.
While trying to install a conduit, an employee moved a pallet and tripped over a hole in the floor. A piece of metal stud lacerated his arm.
An employee had a finger under a T-post and was straightening it out when a piece of equipment contacted the T-post. The employee suffered a partial metacarpophalangeal amputation of the finger.
An employee was on a ladder painting the outside of an apartment. The ladder legs slipped and the employee fell to the ground, breaking his leg and nose.
An employee was on a dock standing next to a ladder where a portable bandsaw was located. The saw tipped and cut the employee's left thumb, causing an amputation.
An employee was in an aerial basket, monitoring an operation. The employee's fingers were caught between a demolished pipe and another pipe, causing amputations to the left middle and ring fingers.

A post pounding machine was being used to pound a post on site. The operator lifted the hammer top high and the hammer came out of the mast. The mast assembly missed an in-plate that would have prevented the hammer from separating from the mast when lifted above a certain height. The hammer struck the employee while he was setting up another post for placement. The hammer fell onto his hard hat and grazed his lip/chin area. The impact caused significant lacerations to the head and face.

On November 21, 2018, two employees entered a trench to manually locate a fiber optic cable that had been cut. The trench was 9'8" deep and 5'6" wide and had no protective systems in place.  At approximately 8:30 p.m. the east wall of the trench caved in, trapping both employees. Both employees were hospitalized for nerve damage to their lower extremities.
An employee was cutting the bands on a stack of 38-foot railroad ties. When the last band was cut, the ties fell onto the employee's leg and ankle, resulting in a fractured left leg.

An employee was helping to remove a manhole cover when the tool used to remove the manhole cover slipped out of the groove, causing the heavy cover to crash down on the employee's finger. The employee suffered a left middle finger laceration that resulted in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was doing maintenance work in a substation. As the employee inspected a piece of electrical equipment, an electrical flash occurred in the equipment. The employee's finger was burned.
An employee was chalking lines on a second-level floor when the employee fell 10 to 12 feet to concrete below, suffering a broken right foot, broken toes, a broken vertebra, and a head injury.
An employee was installing house wrap on a deck when he bent over the temporary railing to pick up debris and the railing gave way. He fell 6 to 10 feet to the ground, fracturing a tibia and fibula.
An employee was caught between an air compressor and a stationary bucket truck. The employee suffered a hip fracture.

An employee was pulling electrical cables in an electrical vault. The employee was splicing an energized electrical cable when it came close to completing the ground and flashed, causing a second degree burn to the right side of the employee's face.

An employee was cutting 2x2 stakes out of 2x4 material with a circular saw. He was making vertical cuts when the cut went through the material and down his right leg, causing an 8- to 10-inch laceration to his lower leg (below the knee and above the ankle) that cut an artery.
An employee was operating a sheet metal bending machine when both hands were caught in the machine. The fingers on both of the employee's hands were crushed up to the knuckles.
An employee was cleaning a mortar machine. A paddle in the machine amputated half of the employee's left ring finger.
An employee was bolting lumber onto a steel beam that was sitting on the ground. The beam tipped over onto his leg, causing compound fractures of the leg bones.
An employee was rolling metal when his glove was caught between the metal and the roller. The roller pulled in his fingers, smashing them and causing fractures.
An employee was in a trench, helping fit up a section of 24-inch pipe. The pipe section pinned him to the trench wall and broke his pelvis. He was hospitalized.
An employee was installing flashing around the garage door and fell approximately 9 feet off the scissors lift to the concrete floor. The employee suffered two broken heels.

An employee was standing on the offloading side of a bending machine. The counterweight of a side boom that was backing up came into contact with the machine's radiator. This caused the bolts to break loose from the mount, pushing it forward into the employee's waist. He fell forward into the fan area with his left elbow leading; the elbow suffered a gash/laceration.
An employee was preparing structural beams for hoisting and was struck by a beam that tipped over during hoisting. The employee sustained a fractured leg.

An employee was installing lightning arrestors at a new electrical substation. The employee had climbed a ladder to see how the lightning arrestors were installed on the energized side when an arc flash occurred. As a result, the employee received burns on his arms and back.
An employee fell from a ladder while painting with a sprayer. The employee suffered a fractured skull, broken ribs, and a broken pelvis.
An employee was changing accessories on a trackhoe when his index finger was crushed between the trackhoe and the jackhammer, resulting in a broken bone that required hospitalization.
An employee was climbing down a ladder with a nail gun. The gun fired a nail into the employee's chest, where it caused tissue damage but missed all vital organs. The nail was surgically removed.

On November 28, 2018, at approximately 1:45 PM, an employee was wrapping a tree with lights from a ladder at a residential location when a wind gust caused the employee to fall to the ground. He was hospitalized with an L1 back fracture.
Air pressure was being applied to an underground natural gas line. The air escaped from the line, and air and dirt entered an employee's skin under his pants leg. He suffered a serious leg injury.
An employee was placing wire on an aerial strand. He fell to the street from about 20 feet up, suffering head and body lacerations.
An employee was dismantling a scaffold at ground level. A scaffold leg component fell over and struck the employee on the thigh, causing a femur fracture.
An employee had his foot/leg run over by a roadway tiller during roadway demolition work in preparation for pavement. His foot and lower leg were crushed and surgically amputated.

An employee was hand-tightening a ground cable in an electrical switchgear enclosure. A fault between two phases above the isolated work area caused an arc flash, and the employee suffered burns to the right side of the face and the backs of both hands.
An employee was coming down from a scaffold when he fell to the ground and broke his left ankle.
An employee was spotting a roller truck driver from the top of a dumpster. The lower half of his body was pressed between a beam and a truck, and he suffered ruptured organs.

An employee was using a directional drill to install 12-inch water pipe. The employee's right leg got stuck between the gearbox and the rod box, suffering breaks in many places. The employee was hospitalized.
On November 28, 2018, an employee was standing in a 4 1/2-foot trench when it collapsed. The falling clay/dirt broke the employee's left leg.
An employee was erecting steel racking when a piece of the steel fell and hit the employee. The employee suffered a broken skull, shoulder, arm, and wrist.
An employee was cutting an HDTP pipe with a chainsaw. The saw kicked back and struck his left leg above the knee, causing a laceration. He was hospitalized.
An employee reached into a conveyor to remove a stuck piece of tire. The guarded tail roller of the conveyor caught his glove and pulled in his left arm, resulting in a broken bone and muscle damage.
An employee was clearing the asphalt sprayer bars on the back of a distributor truck when asphalt sprayed and burned his hands and forearm.

On 11/29/2018 at approximately 7:45 a.m., an employee was positioning a choker strap between a pipe and a reducing "T" as it was being lifted when the pipe fell/slid off a skid and pinched/crushed the employee's right thumb between the choker strap and the pipe.
An employee slipped on ice/snow and broke his ankle.
An employee fell off a roof to the ground 8 feet below, breaking both feet.
An employee stepped on a piece of plywood over a screened porch and fell 17 feet backwards to the ground. The employee sustained head and back injuries.

An employee was attempting to anchor down on the top ridge of a new two-story house (7:12 pitch) when his feet became tangled on the tie-off rope, causing him to lose his balance and eventually fall about 20 feet to the ground. He was hospitalized with three broken ribs, a collapsed lung, and a fractured pelvis.

An employee was laying bricks from the working platform of a scaffold. Boards gave way and the employee fell 25-30 feet to a dirt floor. The employee suffered a broken heel and a hairline fracture of the hand.

An employee was using an overhead crane to lower a wind wall. As he lowered the piece into place, it crushed the fingers on his left hand. The nail bed had to be surgically removed and two fingers were fractured.
An employee tripped and fell, breaking his right wrist on the ground.

A service technician was working from a bucket truck about 14 feet high, repairing a sign. He received an electrical shock after touching the metal channel letter raceway, suffering severe burns to both of his hands. He was hospitalized.
An employee was unhooking a shackle when the machine moved the washout box, pinching the employee's left middle finger between the box and the shackle and causing a fingertip amputation.
An employee slipped and fell on ice in the parking lot, suffering a leg fracture that required hospitalization.
An employee was cleaning the interior of a gasoline storage tank using a power washer to facilitate disposal. A fire in the tank caused third-degree burns to the employee's face and hands.
An employee dismounted a skid-steer loader and fell into a trench injuring his right shoulder. The employee was hospitalized.
An electrician was troubleshooting 480 volt 3-phase wiring when their left hand fingers contacted exposed wiring causing burns to the ring and pinky fingers.
During roofing installation, an employee fell 18 feet from the roof to the ground and sustained broken wrists and facial fractures. Fall protection was not being worn at the time.
An employee was installing duct work from a 10-foot ladder when the employee fell off the ladder and was struck by the duct, fracturing the right elbow and left leg.

An employee was undoing a snag of wire splice hung up on a pole. The wire snagged the employee's left glove, pulling the employee's hand into the wire rollers; the employee's left thumb suffered several fractures.

An employee was operating a truck behind a vehicle laying down road striping. A tractor-trailer veered into the work zone, striking the employee's truck. The employee suffered back, neck, hip, and head injuries and was hospitalized.
An employee was conducting an estimation for house insulation when a contractor on site threw debris out of a window. The debris hit the employee's head, causing a head laceration.

An employee was positioned on an extension ladder to pour concrete. The concrete bucket slid from the forks of the forklift and struck the ladder causing the employee to fall 8 to 10 feet to the ground. The employee sustained fractures to the right wrist and left ribs.

Two employees were performing aerial work using a bucket truck. One employee was in the bucket when the truck backed into a 3-phase electrical line (7500V). The power grounded him and held him on the wire. He was hospitalized for second to third degree burns to 30-40% of his body.
An employee was plowing a conduit, watching warning tape go into the shoot. The tape holder brushed against a telephone pole while his hand was on it, and his fingertip was pinched and amputated.

An employee sprained their left foot after falling from an upper roof surface to a lower roof surface. The employee was connected to a lifeline, but there was enough slack to allow the employee to contact the lower level before the lifeline stopped the fall.

On December 4, 2018, an employee had repaired a hot water system line and it began to leak after it was turned back on. It was then shut off, and an adjacent line and pump were turned on. The employee went to find the serial number off the pump that had leaked; when he was in the area, the adjacent pump sprung a leak and sprayed 180-degree water onto him. His back, shoulder, and eye were scalded.
An employee tripped and fell to the floor inside an elevator, injuring both shoulders.

An employee was working from a 16-foot ladder wiring a light fixture; while doing so the fixture fell. The employee tried to catch it and fell off the ladder. The employee landed on the tile floor and sustained a broken arm.
An employee was moving materials and caught a finger between steel and concrete resulting in a left thumb amputation.
An employee was climbing up a ladder when it shifted and both the employee and the ladder fell to the ground. The employee sustained a fractured lower right leg.

An employee was tending a sandblasting pot when he attempted to get the hose unstuck and it struck his hand. He then fell backwards and began convulsing. He was hospitalized with a burn to the back of the right hand and internal issues.

An employee was inside a work zone, spotting a dump truck that was backing up to a milling machine. Another truck, coming from the other direction, ran over the employee's left foot with the passenger-side front tire as it passed. He suffered several fractures to the foot, and was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was on a ladder helping to guide a 400-pound angle iron into place so he could weld it to the brackets on the precast wall. The angle iron hit a bolt and disconnected from the magnet that was attached to the rigging of the crane. The employee fell from the ladder to the ground and sustained a laceration to his head and bruising throughout his body. The employee was wearing fall protection.
An employee was using a hammer drill when his glove became entangled in the drill, causing an amputation of his left middle fingertip.
Two employees were at a roadside, digging pole holes using hydro pressure. The boom on a truck got close to electrical lines, which arced; the employees were shocked. Both were hospitalized.

An employee was removing a concrete barrier wall. He had his hand on the bolt that joins two pieces of wall together, trying to remove it, when the backhoe shifted slightly and pinched his right middle finger. He pulled the finger out of the pinch point and ripped the skin off the end. The finger was amputated at the first knuckle.

Employees were purging an epoxy supply hose with MEK (paint thinner) inside an unventilated 4-wheel tow trailer. A torpedo heater in was in use at the time and ignited the MEK. Two employees received burns to the hands and face. A third employee inside the tow trailer was uninjured.

An employee was exiting from a scaffolding unit and transferring to a fixed ladder when his foot slipped on the top rung of the ladder. The employee attempted to grab the ladder while falling and dislocated both elbows. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was standing approximately 10-15 feet from a worker that was hammering on a sheer pin. The pin snapped off and flew into the employee's eye, having passed between his cheek and safety glasses.

While attaching a trailer attachment to a low-boy trailer, an employee's  left index finger was  smashed between the attachment and the low-boy trailer's connectors resulting in amputation of the first knuckle.
An employee was hospitalized after both legs were lacerated with a drill bit.

An employee was moving a panel on a sliding panel dry-erase board to access the panel beneath it when the board fell on the employee. The employee was hospitalized with stress fractures to the right hip and two fractures in the lower left leg.
An employee had been climbing or positioning himself on rebar and fell approximately 10 feet to the lower level decking. The employee sustained a broken femur.

An employee was working from an aluminum telescoping scaffold approximately 12 feet high. The employee lost his balance and fell to the ground. The employee sustained a fractured right wrist requiring surgery. Fall protection was not worn at the time.
An employee was walking near staging on top of a roof and fell 14 ft. through a hole between the staging and the ladder. The employee sustained 3 broken ribs and a back injury.

An employee was framing in a wood beam. The hoisting strap from a crane got stuck on his 8-foot ladder and pulled the ladder out from under the employee. The employee fell to the floor and was hospitalized with a fractured wrist.
An employee was pulling service power wire through an occupied conduit on a utility pole and contacted a live 120-volt service resulting in burns to both hands.

An employee was working to connect a sewer line (sewer tap) to a residential building. The wall of an 8-ft. ditch collapsed and the employee was pushed back against the other wall causing a fractured rib and fractured vertebrae between the shoulder and neck.

An employee was helping to move a pipe using a tagline. The pipe was being lifted by a forklift. The pipe began to swing and the employee placed a hand on the pipe to stop it from swinging. The employee's pinky finger became caught between the pipe and one of the forks. The pinky finger was surgically amputated.

On 12/10/2018, an employee was replacing metal roof panels on a steel framed building. There was an open section in the middle of the roof where the old panels had been removed. The employee went to step on a metal purlin to walk across the opening and lost their footing. The employee fell about 12 feet through the opening and landed on top of a tractor cab that was parked inside of the building and then fell off the tractor about 12 feet onto the concrete floor. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured pelvis.

Two employees were working at a height of 35 feet to perform steel erection. The employees were using a horizontal lifeline for fall protection. They were using the stanchion from the lifeline for leverage when pushing beams with a pry bar. One of the fall protection stanchions that was attached to a beam popped off, and the horizontal lifeline pulled the employees to the ground. One employee struck the concrete half-wall of the parking garage next door and then fell down to the ground. The employee sustained a broken right leg, lacerated liver, heart bruise, and broken ribs.

An employee was standing on stilts installing acoustic ceiling grids. He saw a ladder leaned on a corner and a 3-foot diameter plastic ring on the ground. When he took a step, one of the stilts got caught against the ring throwing the employee off balance. As he attempted to regain balance with his other foot, the employee stepped on a piece of conduit lying on the ground causing him to slip and fall. The employee sustained a right femur fracture.
An employee's finger was lacerated by a circular saw while cutting plywood.

An employee was working from a ladder on the second floor of a residential house. There was a hole in the floor approximately 3 inches in diameter in the area where the ladder was set up. The ladder shifted to the side and the employee fell 4 feet to the wooden floor. The employee sustained a head injury and was hospitalized.

An employee was cutting a rack of horizontal piping with a with a reciprocating saw while standing on the floor. He freed both ends of the pipe and the pipe fell onto his right leg breaking the lower leg.

An employee was walking inside a new residential construction home when the floor joist broke under him and he fell 10 feet to the concrete below. The employee sustained a broken collar bone and bleeding from the head.

An employee fell 14 feet off the side of a ladder to the ground while taping a window on a new residential construction. The employee was hospitalized with strains to both shoulders, a neck strain, and a cut on the head.

An employee was guiding an excavator to load a dump truck. The employee's hand was caught between the excavator bucket and the top rail of the dump truck, resulting in an injury that required hospitalization.

A deck engineer was using an endless loop rope to moor a tender vessel to a dredge. The rope was secured to the port side cleat at the stern of the vessel. The dredge was in its cut, moving away from the vessel. As the engineer brought the rope over the cleat, a finger on his left hand was caught between the cleat and the inside of the rope. The fingernail and flesh from the first digit were amputated.
A bucket loader was on an incline in front of a conex box. The loader rolled down the slope and struck an employee on the right foot causing a laceration.

At about 8:10 a.m. on December 11, 2018, an employee was adjusting material while on the bed of a flatbed truck. The employee slipped on frost and fell off the truck bed, landing on their feet on the ground (about 4 feet below) and breaking their right heel. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was helping to tie steel rebar for a generator's concrete pad. The employee was holding rebar as another employee tied steel using tie wire. When the extra tie wire was cut it popped up and grazed the employee's left eye causing an eye laceration.
