An employee working from a bucket truck to install a neutral wire on an existing power line sustained arc flash burns to the right hand, arm and right side of the face. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was removing a chain block from a steel structure while standing on a scissor lift. The scissor lift was blown over while fully extended and the employee suffered broken ribs and a punctured lung.
A pile of sheetrock fell onto an employee while trying to relocate the extension cord underneath. The employee sustained a fractured leg.

While working on an electrical subpanel, an employee fell from a mezzanine to a lower level. The employee suffered fractures to the right hand, right foot, and left leg, and was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee's hand was resting on the delivery truck's lift gate when it was activated. The employee suffered a finger amputation.

An employee was painting a wall while standing on a scaffold approximately two feet high. The employee fell off the scaffold and struck his head on the concrete floor. The employee was hospitalized for a skull fracture and brain bleed.

An employee finished working in an attic. While leaving the attic, the employee lost their balance. While falling, the employee caught their right hand on a duct strap resulting in a laceration of the right pinky finger and an injured tendon requiring hospitalization.

A ladder to the roof was set up on the loading dock. An employee was on the loading dock and getting ready to climb the ladder when the employee fell 3.5 feet off the loading dock. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured skull and broken collar bone.
An employee was walking toward the shuttle bus stop and was struck by a turning vehicle. The employee sustained a left knee injury and a fractured big toe.

An employee was on an 8-foot A-frame stepladder, installing electrical conduit on a ceiling. The employee fainted and fell backwards from the ladder's fourth rung, landing on the concrete floor and suffering a head injury. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was struck by a forklift while he was sweeping the floor and sustained a fractured pelvis.

An employee was onsite getting estimates for additional work to be done. Later that day, a co-worker found the injured employee on the side of a road with lacerations to the head resulting in 10 staples.
An employee was holding the toe board of an elevator while installing it. The toe board slipped and contacted their pinky finger resulting in a laceration and fracture to the pinky finger.
An employee was manually unloading a truck when a U-shaped steel column fell on the employee causing a deep laceration to the left thigh.
A stack of drywall fell on top of an employee's left leg that ruptured an artery in the knee.
An employee fell through a window opening to the ground three stories below. The employee sustained a shattered left wrist and multiple broken ribs.

An employee was retrieving material off the fourth floor. The employee stepped on the platform of a forklift outside the window and the platform collapsed. The employee fell to the ground and sustained injuries to the jaw, ribs, collar bone, hip, leg and ankle. All injuries occurred to the right side of the body.
An employee fell from unsecured decking on top of structural steel resulting in seven broken ribs and a contusion.
An employee was using a saw to bevel a 2x4 and amputated a thumb tip.

On December 17, 2018,  the injured employee was standing near where two other employees were disassembling the winch line from the easement machine. The winch line was being drawn in and the injured employee noticed that the eyelet at the end of the winch line was about to become stuck in the boom tip. As the injured employee grabbed the eyelet with his left hand and twisted it  to free it, the eyelet was abruptly pulled through the boom tip and his left index finger was amputated below the distal joint.

On December 17, 2018, at approximately 4:00 p.m., the injured employee was directing a shuttle buggy operator who was moving a shuttle buggy which had contacted a light pole. The light pole fell and struck the employee in the head. The employee was hospitalized with cerebral swelling.
An employee was standing on a ladder pulling Romex cable. The cable got stuck and the employee lost his balance, falling from the ladder and landing on the right side of his lower back.
An employee was setting a beam inside a column when the beam came loose and amputated the employee's right index fingertip.

An employee was operating a 12-inch dual compound miter saw to make a 45 degree angle cut into a 1-inch thick lead ingot. The employee wore leather-welding gloves and had his left hand on the ingot to hold it in position. As the saw blade contacted the ingot, the ingot shifted, which caused the employee's left hand to contact the saw blade. The employee sustained a laceration to his left hand.

An employee was finishing the edge of a concrete pour for a highway section. He tripped and fell while moving out of the way, and his leg was run over by the wheel of the tube float. The employee sustained a displaced fracture of the right tibia.
On December 18, 2018, an employee was cleaning a residential sewer with a steel cable. The cable wound around the employees' right hand, resulting in a partial amputation of the middle fingertip.

An employee was inside a rebar cage, helping a coworker hook up chains to rig for lifting. The cage shifted and the rebar collapsed to one side; the employee suffered crushing injuries to the chest and an ankle contusion. He was hospitalized.

On December 18, 2018, at a tower erection site, an employee working as an oiler was crushed when the jib of the crane fell on them. The employee suffered fractured ribs, pelvis and femur in addition to a collapsed lung and kidney damage.

While securing the access ladder to the roof, an employee slipped on roofing paper and fell 8 feet. The employee was hospitalized with fractured vertebrae. At the time of the incident, the employee was wearing a harness but was not connected to an anchoring point.
While an employee was installing a door opener, the limit switch chain engaged and amputated his fingertip.

The injured employee was assisting a tie back drill. As the operator moved the drill toward the wall, the injured employee's left leg was caught between the rotating part of the drill and the wall. The injured employee's lower left leg sustained soft tissue swelling requiring hospitalization.
An employee dropped a humidifier panel on his left middle fingertip resulting in amputation.
An employee fell while ascending a ladder, catching and breaking his leg between the fifth and sixth rungs.

An employee was climbing a 24-foot extension ladder to get to the roof of a new one-story house when he lost his balance and fell to the ground. He sustained a fractured left wrist and dislocated left shoulder. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was walking up or down the stairs, slipped or tripped and fell striking his head on the door. The employee suffered a laceration to the head.
An employee was moving a stack of drywall that was leaning against a wall. The stack tipped over and fell back onto him, breaking his left tibia.
Two workers received flash burns to their faces and hands while bleeding a residential gas line. The fire was ignited by the customer's cigarette.

An employee was rinsing the inside of a tank with water from a 1-inch hose. The water pressure surged and the hose whipped around. Its metal nozzle struck the employee's head and face, causing a fracture to the right mandible, a head laceration on the right side of the head behind the ear, and trauma to the right side of the head.
An employee was on a 9-foot ladder installing cables. He fell to the floor, breaking two ribs on his left side and suffering a concussion.
An employee was repositioning a bucket truck and struck an electrical line. The employee sustained burns to the forehead, left palm and buttocks.
An employee was climbing into a bucket truck, slipped, and fell. The employee hit their head and suffered a laceration.
An employee was handling a bandsaw in preparation to use the tool and severely lacerated a finger while removing the tool from a gang box.
An employee was on a ladder inspecting a roof. The ladder slipped out on a wet deck and the employee fell. The employee fractured 10 ribs, an arm, their head and punctured the right lung.

An employee was welding a 25-foot, 1,700-pound steel I-beam when a forklift knocked it off its supports. It fell onto the employee, breaking his right collarbone and six ribs on his right side and causing a hematoma on his left leg.
An employee was moving a wooden shelf when a skid steer loader ran over his right foot, breaking it. He was hospitalized.
An employee was working on an eight-foot step ladder on the third or fourth rung hammering a nail. The employee slipped and fell hitting his head on the ground. The employee sustained a concussion.
While picking up trash, an employee was struck in the head by cinder block debris that fell from a scaffold. The employee suffered a head injury and was hospitalized.

A welder was installing weights on 24-inch plastic pipes, using a wedge to install the two half weights. The wedge moved and the tip of the welder's right thumb got caught between the pipe and the wedge. The thumb tip was amputated.
An employee had just removed a cash box from a safe. The safe door closed on the employee's left hand, cutting off the tip of his thumb.

Employees had just finished rerouting conduit and wiring beneath a rooftop air conditioning unit. The unit had been moved off its stand to access the wiring. While it was being lowered back onto the stand, an employee's right middle finger was caught between the unit and the stand. The fingertip was amputated at the top joint.
An employee was using a ladder to take a building measurement of a mansard. The ladder slid and the employee suffered two broken heels. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee went to drive his golf cart after a safety meeting, but it would not start. While working on the golf cart, the engine started and the employee's finger was caught in the running belt between the belt and pulley. The employee's right index finger was damaged in the nail area.
An employee was installing the harness bracket from an 8-foot ladder. The employee slipped and fell to the ground from the roof line. The employee sustained injury to the lower back.
An employee and his supervisor were repairing an electrical panel when an arc flash burned the employee's left hand.

An employee was installing TPO roofing on the parking garage side of a 3-story building. When he lifted a sheet of insulation, the wind pushed the insulation and caused the employee to lose balance and fall 10 to 12 feet onto the third floor level of the parking garage. The employee sustained injuries to the ribs and arm. The employee was wearing a lifeline at the time.

An employee was working from a scaffold to remove an HVAC unit from a ceiling. Part of the unit fell out and struck the scaffolding, causing the employee to fall to the ground. The employee suffered a cut to the back of the head and a back injury requiring hospitalization.
While checking rebar, an employee fell from an 18-foot height to the ground. The employee fell on their face and suffered a broken pelvis and a nicked artery.
On December 28, 2018, an employee fell from a ladder while installing playground equipment. He landed on the concrete and the ladder below, breaking ribs and bones in a foot. He was hospitalized.

An employee was standing on a rack installing a fire alarm system when the rack collapsed causing the employee to fall approximately 20 feet to the ground. The employee sustained a fractured pelvis, a broken right wrist, and a laceration to his hand.
An employee was vacuuming dust for epoxy floor installation when she fell approximately 9 feet into a lube bay pit. She suffered a broken rib, collarbone and three vertebrae.

A crew was removing and replacing shafts/rolls on a conveyor using an overhead crane. A roll did not fit correctly and needed to be repositioned. A wire rope choker was positioned in a basket configuration around the shaft/roll with the ends of the choker connected to the crane hook. The injured employee was holding the top legs of the choker as the operator lifted up on the hook to put tension on the choker. While the employee was holding the choker legs, the crane hook started to twist. His left hand and glove became tangled between the steel choker legs. His left index finger was stuck between the choker legs, resulting in a distal phalanx amputation.
An employee was injured when he fell 25 feet from a roof. The employee sustained a broken arm, pelvis and ribs.
Two employees were installing conduit when they experienced headaches and felt unwell. Both employees were hospitalized with carbon monoxide exposure/poisoning.
An employee was working in a ditch installing drainage pipes when a backhoe slid into the ditch, breaking both of the employee's knees.

An employee was guiding a crane to pick up a spool of wire. While pulling the crane hook over to the spool of wire he reduced the distance to the 19.9 phase 2 ground overhead power line. The power line then arced across to the crane's wire rope shocking the employee. He was also burned on the left wrist and hand and both feet and was hospitalized.

A carpenter was walking on trusses eight feet above the ground at a residential home construction site. He lost his footing and fell toward the ground. He was wearing a safety harness and lanyard that activated and stopped his fall. His safety helmet fell off and he crashed into the plywood siding of the house. The collision with the plywood caused a laceration to the head requiring hospitalization.
An employee was removing an injection bottle from a riser pole using an extended fiberglass pole when he felt a strain in his chest.
An employee lost his balance and fell off of a step ladder onto a concrete floor. The employee was hospitalized with a compound fracture to the wrist.
On January 2, 2019, an employee was removing an iron pipe cap from a pressurized water line when the line burst and the cap struck him, fracturing his leg.
An employee suffered the partial amputation of his middle finger during the installation of a 6-inch diameter water line inside a trench.
An employee was operating a table saw when the employee's hand slipped. The blade then amputated the employee's index finger.

An employee was working on top of a mezzanine. He was getting ready to come down from the mezzanine floor when he fell approximately 12 feet from a fixed ladder to the lower level, suffering forehead and kneecap injuries that required stitches, a concussion, a swollen right eye, partial hearing loss in the right ear, and four broken ribs.
On January 3, 2019, an employee was setting up steel beams when a beam fell and struck the employee's left ankle, causing a fracture and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was standing on the first or second step of a 6-foot step ladder.  He was applying drywall mud to the ceiling tape when he lost his balance and fell to the ground.  He suffered a broken hip.

An employee was operating an articulating hauler and preparing to dump concrete onto a designated site when the earth gave way beneath the truck, causing it to fall and topple on its side. As a result, the employee suffered a broken femur.

On January 3, 2019, at 10:45 a.m., two employees located at ground level pulled a duct transition piece out of a pit conveyor through the pit conveyor ladder access area. As the first employee was exiting the pit, he put his left hand over a 2-inch metal drip edge that goes around the pit access area. At the same time, the second employee was setting the transition down next to the metal drip edge, striking the first employee's finger. The first employee's left middle finger was pinched between the duct transition and the metal drip edge, suffering a partial traumatic metacarpophalangeal amputation.
An employee was walking next to a pile of I-beams when a 12-inch I-beam slid off the pile and fell on the employee's right lower leg, fracturing the tibia and fibula.

While pumping concrete, an employee was struck by the boom of a pump truck when the right front outrigger sank into the ground. The employee was hospitalized with a broken left arm, dislocated right hip, and wound on the right leg.

Two employees were helping welders by holding a 16" flange when a flash fire occurred. The first employee suffered a puncture wound from a vent pipe and burns to the face. The second employee suffered burns to the back of his neck, his back, and his right arm.

An employee was performing emergency repairs on a roof when he noticed that the wind had blown a piece of insulation across the roof to the edge. As he went to retrieve the insulation, it caught the wind and he was pulled off of the roof, falling approximately 30 feet to the ground. He was hospitalized with fractures to his wrists, two broken fingers, and cracked disks in his spinal column.
An employee was cutting a loose bar or rebar using a handheld saw. The sparks generated by the cutting process ignited the employee's right pant leg. The employee suffered burns to the right leg.

An employee was working on an elevated surface when he walked across a board to grab a piece of equipment. Upon returning to his work area, the board he was walking on gave way and he fell 10 feet to the concrete below, breaking his elbow. A harness was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was cleaning at a construction site when a board with a nail in it caught her pant leg, causing her to fall from the second to first floor. She was hospitalized with a broken right heel.

A foreman and his crew were about to take a section of a crane hook and move it into position. The foreman stopped work, noticing something wrong, and the pipe shifted and struck his hands while they were on the handrail. He suffered amputation injuries to his left ring and little fingers.

An employee fell from a snow-/ice-covered two-story residential roof while removing snow. The employee landed on their back and cracked two vertebrae. The employee was hospitalized, requiring surgery.

An employee was wearing cloth gloves while holding a 50-pound concrete brace that was attached to a wall panel being lifted by a 200,000-pound capacity crane. The concrete brace moved toward his left pinky finger, and it was caught between the concrete brace and the brace foot, resulting in a finger amputation above the first knuckle.

An employee was relieving the pressure on a tank lid. He pulled the first and then second latch to let the pressure release, then hit the third latch with his foot.  The third latch opened and the lid struck him, knocking him up and over the railing onto the ground below. He was hospitalized for a fractured wrist and spleen and back injuries.

An employee put his weight on a trailer hitch while getting up from connecting a chain. The hitch was not connected to the ball and sank down, catching his finger and later resulting in fingertip amputations.
An employee fell 16 feet to the lower floor while pulling electrical wire and sustained back, neck and hip injuries.

Two employees were trying to roll an I-beam that was on top of another beam when the beam slipped off the bottom beam and fell onto the injured employee's right hand, crushing the ring fingertip and resulting in an amputation.
An employee was riding in an aerial lift when it contacted a high-voltage power line. The employee was hospitalized with burns to the torso and upper body.
An employee fell from an 18-foot ladder while doing roofing work. The employee suffered a leg fracture and was hospitalized.
While running wires at the bottom of an excavation, an employee slipped on clay and fell resulting in a broken right tibia.
An employee was placing an anchor and was aligning the Kelly bar when his left index finger was pinched between the anchor and Kelly bar, resulting in a partial amputation to his fingertip.

An employee was washing down brick from a scaffold when the employee fell approximately 25 feet from the scaffold to the ground/wall. The employee was hospitalized with a broken leg, broken hip, and broken nose.
An employee was conducting welding operations when a steel pipe rolled onto his leg. His lower left leg was broken.

A line crew was digging post holes with a vehicle-mounted auger. The crew had finished digging a hole and was attempting to stow the auger back onto the vehicle. They had just stowed the Kelley bar when a restraining strap broke. The Kelley bar then sprung loose and hit an employee in the chest. The employee was hospitalized with a spleen injury and seven broken ribs.
An employee was installing new lines and working around 2700-volt power lines. An arc flash occurred and the employee sustained burns to the jaw, chest, and arms.
An employee fainted while writing a report on a bench, suffering a laceration to the forehead.

An employee was transitioning from a ladder to the upper level platform of a 3-buck tubular welded frame scaffold when the employee fell off the ladder to the ground, requiring hospitalization for a fractured heel and possible cracked vertebrae.
An employee's fingers contacted the spinning blade of a table saw and were amputated.

On January 9, 2019, an employee was crossing the road when a vehicle ran a stop sign and struck an SUV driving down the road the employee was crossing. The SUV spun and struck the employee in the crosswalk. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured pelvis.
An employee was washing out a concrete pump when their hand became stuck in the cylinder. The middle, ring, and pinky fingers were amputated above the second joint.
An employee was on a 6-foot ladder installing sheet rock. The employee fell 3 feet to a lower level and broke an ankle.

An employee was on an extension ladder installing a window reveal trim inside the second level of a house being constructed when the ladder slipped on the floor, causing the employee to fall approximately 12 feet. The employee suffered a broken wrist, concussion, and sprained ankle.
An employee fell from a fixed ladder accessing the roof and sustained broken ribs, lacerations, and contusions.
An employee fell from about 24 feet to the ground below and sustained slipped spinal disk injuries.

An employee was cleaning up the shop area with a co-worker. There was a plunger on an I-beam. The employee picked up the plunger, then dropped it. The employee tried to catch it, and his right hand was caught between the plunger and a metal pipe stand. The employee sustained a laceration, torn tendon, and fracture to the middle finger.
An employee was exiting a scissor lift when he slipped on the step and fell, suffering a broken wrist and hip.
An employee fell through a cover over a staircase opening to the basement level and was hospitalized with a neck injury.

An employee was helping a backhoe operator place a concrete inlet box. The employee was holding the wire rope cable with his left hand when the backhoe lifted the box. The cable cut the employee's hand, resulting in a finger amputation.
An employee was inspecting roofing work when the employee slipped and fell 10 to 13 feet from the roof to the ground, fracturing the right heel.

An employee was getting material from inside a bucket truck bin (compartment) to provide to a lineman working aloft. When the employee released the locking mechanism for the bin door, the door swung open and lacerated the employee's face.
An employee was positioning metal grates on the back of a trailer when his left middle finger was caught on the metal grate, resulting in a finger amputation.
An employee was using an airline to blow condenser tubes out. An obstruction was dislodged from a tube and struck the employee in the hand and chin.

An employee ascended a flight of seven metal stairs to check supplies. He was going back downstairs with  and was making a turn on the landing when his boot became caught in the galvanized serrated metal grating, causing him to slip and fall to the metal steps, injuring his neck and back. He was hospitalized.
An employee was walking at the worksite when the employee tripped on a 4X4 piece of wood and fell to the ground, fracturing the left elbow.

An employee lost balance and fell from the third rung from the top of an 8-foot portal ladder while positioning air ducts in a drop ceiling. The employee contacted the concrete floor and suffered a head injury.
An employee was using a powered handheld saw to cut 2 x 4's, when his right leg was lacerated above the knee. The employee required hospitalization and surgery.
An employee slipped on ice and fell resulting in a hip fracture.

An employee was attempting to remove a scroll compressor and was pulling on the suction line while his helper was heating the solder joint enough to allow him to pull the joint apart. His helper was in the process of removing the flame when hot refrigerant oil sprayed onto the employee's face, forearm, and neck, causing burns.
An employee fell off a scaffold to the floor, injuring his back, neck, and elbow.
An employee slipped on ice and hit his leg on the underside of a trailer, fracturing both bones in his leg and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was checking concrete grades when a skid steer backed onto the employee's leg, causing multiple fractures.

An employee was in a hole helping to install two sections of a gas pipe at a bend when the pipe slipped through the clamps used to hold it and crushed the employee's right leg. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.

Part of the safety cable that ran vertically along the post that was covered by previously poured concrete had been chipped away. As the employee squatted and held onto the safety cable to look at the outer side of the post, the safety cable gave way, causing the employee to lose his balance and fall forward 14 feet over the edge of the second level of the parking garage. The employee was hospitalized with 2 broken heels.
An employee was working from a foot hop. The plank fell off its support when the support moved under it, causing the employee to fall. The employee suffered internal bleeding and contusions.
Two employees were using Dexpan when the chemical sprayed into their eyes, causing eye injuries to both. One employee was hospitalized.
While installing utility meters, an employee contacted overhead power lines and sustained burns to their hand and face.
An employee slipped and fell from the roof of a two-story house to the ground while on his way to secure his harness to the rope, suffering a right ankle fracture.
An employee was sawing a board when the saw kicked the board back. The saw blade contacted the employee's left hand, lacerating it and amputating the ring finger.

An employee set a ladder on a second landing's snow and ice rubberized surface. The employee was climbing the ladder when he fell with the ladder from 15 feet onto a concrete slab. He sustained a broken right wrist and four broken ribs.

An employee was installing a cap on a gas fireplace vent on the exterior of a house. He fell 6-7 feet off a step ladder onto the ground. The employee sustained a broken rib, punctured lung, and a fractured wrist.
An employee was hammering a wooden stake into the ground with a sledge hammer when the hammer hit his right hand, injuring his index finger.

On January 16, 2019, at approximately 4:00 PM, an employee was installing insulation to a steel exhaust vent in the storage garage as a temporary solution to reduce escaping heat. The employee was working from an aerial lift and was found unconscious and face down on the gravel surface below the lift. The lift was positioned in an elevated position with the basket door open. It is presumed that the employee fell from the lift. The employee was hospitalized for head trauma. Fall protection was not worn at the time.
An employee was using a reciprocating saw when his right pinky finger contacted the blade, resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee removed a piece of decking for a welding inspector to see under it when he inadvertently fell through the opening about 16 to 18 feet to the ground below. He was hospitalized with a collapsed lung and fractured ribs.
An employee was operating a crane and experienced respiratory distress caused by exposure to toluene vapors. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was drilling holes in steel beams when his right hand and glove became entangled in the magnetic drill. The employee was hospitalized due to lacerations, possible ligament damage, and a nail avulsion on his right hand.

An employee was cutting metal from an elevated position of approximately 10 feet. He was tied off to the structure he was cutting. When he cut the structure, it came loose, and both he and the structure fell to the ground. He suffered a broken left leg above the knee, a bump on the back of the left ear, and scratches above the right eye.

An employee had been disassembling a scaffold, working on the fourth tier. Components being stacked on exterior outriggers caused a shift in weight, which led to the collapse of the scaffold's top section. The employee fell 25 feet and sustained a fractured and lacerated right arm.
An employee was climbing a ladder when the ladder slid and the employee fell to the ground sustaining back and leg contusions.
An employee was putting bricks on an elevator when he fell from a scaffold, landing about 20-30 feet below. Blocks fell on top of him. He was hospitalized with a broken arm and broken back.
An employee was struck by an outrigger while delivering spa equipment to a residence. The employee suffered a compound fracture to a finger on the right hand.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut boards. The saw cut into the employee's right thigh.

An employee was moving a basket into position to connect a steel beam when the employee was pinned between the basket and a jack beam, requiring hospitalization for fractured ribs and an absence of oxygen in the tissues.

An employee was showing another employee how to perform a process on a drill press and moving shavings away from the drilled area when the employee's glove was caught in the press. The employee's left ring fingertip was amputated.

At about 8:15 a.m., on January 18, 2019, two employees were trying to clear jammed lumber in a saw. While one of the employees was holding up a lumber indexing guide, the saw switched to reverse feed. A 2-inch by 4-inch piece of lumber caught the bottom of the guide, moving it forward, and pinched the employee's index and little fingers. The tip of the little finger was amputated.
An employee turned while carrying a ladder, then felt a severe back pain. The employee was hospitalized, suffering from swelling on a nerve.
An employee was replacing the floor trim, using a pneumatic nail gun. A nail hit something and bounced back into his left eye. The employee sustained an eye injury requiring surgery.

An employee was standing on the back side of an 8-foot fiberglass portable ladder at the lower brace and handing a piece of ductwork up to a second employee who was standing on the 3rd or 4th rung on the front side of the ladder.  The ladder collapsed and both employees fell to the ground.  The ladder and ductwork landed on the first employee, who was hospitalized with a fractured lower left leg.
An employee was pulling a new fiber optic line and fell approximately 30 feet from the bucket to the ground. The employee sustained fractured ribs, hip, pelvis, and an arm.
An employee was measuring the radius of the community exit/entrance when he was struck from behind by a car, dislocating the left ankle and shoulder and fracturing the left fibula.
An employee was walking across the driveway when he slipped on ice and fell to the ground, breaking his right lower leg and ankle.
An employee was setting up a portable desk in a jobsite trailer. His left index finger became caught in the hinge area of the desk and was amputated at the first knuckle.
An employee fell from a roof to the ground about 20 feet below. The employee suffered a concussion and fractures to the vertebrae and hip.

An employee was working in a manlift basket when the basket launched him into the air. The employee fell back into the basket and stuck his head causing a skull fracture. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was walking down a hall to a work area when his left pinky fingertip was caught in a door hinge, resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was walking from a general contractor's trailer to a work area, near a temporary roadway that was being used to bring heavy equipment to the construction site. The employee was struck by a trailer, suffering two broken legs.
An employee was trying to move a roll cart to access a cable. The cart fell on top of the employee, breaking the employee's femur and right knee.
An employee was welding from a scissor lift. As the lift moved, he was caught between its rails and a beam. His chest was crushed.

Two employees were demolishing brick and stone from a facade. The first of them was using a hammer drill to demolish the brick and stone; the second was holding the stone to prevent debris from falling to the ground. The drill bit slipped and the second employee's right ring fingertip was amputated.

Employees were using a cable grip device to remove the end cap of a water main. An employee's left hand became entangled in the device's metal cable; the tip of his ring finger was amputated and his middle finger was broken.

An employee was operating a walk-behind skid steer. He was traveling under an elevated 18" pipe when the front of the machine dropped into a hole, raising the back of the machine and pinching his left hand between the machine and the pipe. He suffered an amputation of his left middle fingertip (approximately 1/2 inch).
An employee slipped on ice while exiting a job trailer, suffering a broken hip and shoulder.

An employee was on the roof of a new one-story house installing fascia and a drip cap when he lost his footing and fell 10 feet to the ground below. He was hospitalized with a broken back and head trauma.
An employee was sweeping up construction debris on the floor when he fell down a stairwell, breaking his pelvis.
An employee was struck by a car while crossing the street after verifying the depth of a fire hydrant's water valve. Both of the employee's legs were broken.

An employee was operating a mini-excavator in a saw-cut hole. While the employee was trying to climb out of the hole, the excavator became unstable and tipped over. The employee's left foot was wedged and crushed between the excavator and concrete.

An employee was winching a dumpster box onto a hauler truck. The dumpster got stuck. While the employee was getting it loose and reeling it in, his thumb was caught between the wire rope and the reel. His left thumb was amputated above the knuckle.
A carpenter was cutting a 2 x 6 using a circular saw when it amputated his right little and ring fingers.
While brushing snow off a work truck, an employee slipped on ice and fell to the ground, suffering a broken left foot.
An employee was struck in the leg while cutting a piece of metal. The employee was hospitalized.

A crew of carpenters were in an electric work cart near a handrail. As the driver of the cart was backing the cart up, the heel of his left foot came into contact with the rail, causing his foot to twist. The foot was broken and he was hospitalized, undergoing surgery.
While breaking apart drilling augers an employee was struck in the head by a pipe wrench and sustained a head injury.

An employee working inside the street barriers on the shoulder of an on-ramp was struck by a  vehicle that swerved into the jobsite. The employee was hospitalized due to a fractured pelvis and internal injuries.
While walking and working on the road widener machine, an employee fell and broke his left ankle.

A swivel snagged on a Kelly bar. An employee was trying to un-swivel the wire rope while the swivel was turning. The wire rope was winded up and when the tension was released it caught the employee's left hand resulting in the partial amputation of a finger.

An employee was driving a forklift when it ran over a 6 x 6 piece of wood. The employee was thrown up in the air and hit his head on the top of the forklift cage causing a deep head laceration and ruptured artery.

An employee lifted a 55-gallon plastic tank filled with trash to empty it into the dumpster. He placed the 55-gallon tank upside down so it could be completely emptied. The employee then climbed into the dumpster and knelt on the container wall. When he tried to shake the tank to empty it, he lost balance and fell 4 feet to the pavement resulting in a compression fracture to the back.

An employee was working on a flat roof with a 2-foot parapet. He was laying a roll of tar paper when he stumbled and fell over the parapet onto an adjacent scaffold and then fell down to the ground. The 30-foot fall caused a head fracture and a broken arm.

An employee was walking away from the worksite where he had just attached a steel cable to the pulling machine. The employee was struck by a steel cable that broke off from a fiber rope. The employee sustained a right side clavicle fracture, left side rib fracture, and a collapsed lung.

An employee was climbing up a ladder to replace a metal roof. As he was getting ready to connect to a life line, he slipped and fell approximately 20 feet onto metal roof panels. The employee sustained a broken arm, pelvic fracture and facial bruises.
An employee was cutting the banding from around a group of pipes when the pipes rolled over his foot and twisted his knee. The employee suffered a left kneecap fracture.
An employee was standing on the bank of an excavation. The side of the excavation gave way and the employee fell in. Concrete pieces fell on top of him and he sustained a broken leg.
An employee was moving a roof top air conditioning curb and fell approximately 15 feet though a skylight to the floor. The employee's pelvis was fractured in four places and surgery was required.
An employee was engaged in drywall installation in an attic. The employee fell through the ceiling and landed on the concrete floor below, injuring his hands and nose.
An employee was lowering an 82-pound steel stud into a PVC pipe when his right little finger was caught and fractured between the steel stud and the PVC pipe.
On 1/28/2019, an employee was hospitalized after slipping off of the step of his dump truck and suffering a concussion.

An employee was working from a scaffold chiseling mortar. As the employee set his tools down onto the walk boards between two outriggers, the walk boards gave way and the employee fell feet first to the ground below. The employee suffered a broken ankle and was hospitalized.

An employee was standing near a sandblasting pot when the 2-inch air hose came uncoupled from the pot. Its four-lug couple struck him in the face, causing a fracture to his lower jaw, soft tissue damage to his face, and deep lacerations to his lower face. He was hospitalized.
An employee was stepping off an 8-inch step, slipped on some concrete slurry and fell breaking the left tibia and fibula.

An employee was filling a tank with water and was struck by a pressurized water blast that knocked him to the ground. The employee hit his head on the pavement and sustained a concussion. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was operating the metal machine to make metal roofing panels when a piece of metal got stuck in the machine. As he attempted to remove the metal piece, the employee's left index finger was amputated.
An employee stepped onto a dump truck to check the load. As he was climbing down his ring finger was caught on the steps and lacerated.
An employee was fueling a tack distributor with gas when it suddenly caught fire on the burners. The employee received burns on his right hand.
An employee was using a chop saw and was lacerated between his left thumb and forefinger.

An employee was installing a steel band to a pole when the band became loose and one side hit an energized conductor. An arc flash occurred, causing first degree burns to the employee's cheeks and neck and second degree burns to both ears.
An employee was working in a trench (3' 10" deep by 6' wide) when the walls of the trench collapsed onto the employee's right leg, breaking it.

An employee was operating a hand held electric core drill to create a 2.5 inch hole through concrete to install refrigerant piping when the drill became bound in the concrete. It started to rotate, then threw him off the drill. The employee sustained a dislocated hip and was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was securing a load on a trailer, slipped off the trailer and fell to the ground breaking the right radius and ulna.

An employee was directing a forklift operator from the top of a truck flatbed when the forklift pushed the trash box or skid pad, which caused the employee to fall from the flatbed to the ground. He suffered a fractured right arm.
An employee was loading an ATV using a winch when the employee's right thumb was caught in the winch, resulting in a partial thumb amputation.
An employee was carrying installation material up a ladder onto a slate tile roof when the employee slipped on the roof and fell 10 to 12 feet to the ground, breaking an ankle.

An employee was attempting to correct a rubber seal that had flipped upside down when a concrete panel shifted and crushed the employee's leg between it and another concrete panel. The employee suffered a left femur fracture and left knee laceration.

Three employees were working on the roof of a newly constructed residential home when the brace holding up the roof over the back patio gave way and the patio roof collapsed. The employees fell 21 feet and impacted the frozen ground. All three employees sustained multiple cuts, bruises and fractures to their lower extremities, specifically their feet and legs. Two of the three employees were hospitalized.

A dump truck tailgate was elevated, wedged, and would not work correctly. An employee tried to free the tailgate by removing a clump of clay when the tailgate came down and pinched his left middle and ring fingers, amputating them below the nail.

An employee was attaching rigging gear to steel joists during crane operations. When the load was lifted his foot was entangled in the tagline and the employee was lifted to a height of approximately eight feet. The employee freed himself and dropped to the ground fracturing his pelvis.
An employee tripped on a power cord while hanging drywall and fell down the stairs. The employee was hospitalized with back, neck, and rib injuries, as well as fractures to both wrists.

An employee was troubleshooting a paving machine. He was cleaning the grease on the sprocket using a rag wrapped around his finger. The sprocket was running at the time and caught his hand and amputated the left middle finger.
An employee was working on a catwalk when he slipped on ice and fell onto his side. He was hospitalized with a broken left hip.

An employee was performing maintenance on a roof top unit and was either ascending or descending the roof hatch ladder when he lost his footing and fell to the concrete floor. The employee sustained broken eye sockets, a concussion, a fractured knee and internal bleeding.
While unloading a fork attachment for a front-end loader, an employee's finger became caught between a fork and the fork plate resulting in a partial amputation to the right middle finger.

As an employee was climbing down from a ladder, the ladder began to slide and move. The employee fell approximately 10 feet to the ground below and sustained two fractured ribs, a broken radial bone on the left arm, and a broken left wrist.
The injured employee was outside the building talking to another employee. As the injured employee went to lean back on the railing, he fell onto his left side and suffered a broken hip.

An employee was standing on a pipe trailer to disconnect cabling from a pipe that had just been loaded. While reaching to disconnect the cabling, the employee lost footing and fell 7 to 8 feet from the trailer to the ground. The employee landed on the right hip, causing fractured vertebrae in the lower back. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was struck by a motorist while installing a temporary traffic control pre-warning sign. The employee sustained a fractured pelvis and a ruptured bladder.
An employee was walking behind a telehandler all-terrain forklift when the forklift ran over the employee and crushed both legs.
Sometime between 8:00 and 9:00 AM, on 02/02/2019, an employee was walking behind a telehandler when it struck him and his legs were crushed.
An employee was pulling pipe from a hole using a drill machine. A weld broke and the pipe struck the employee's face breaking the right cheek bone.
An employee was inside a crane positioned on top of a sink hole when the crane tipped over. The employee jumped out of the cab and suffered a hairline fracture to his right leg.
An employee was accessing a roof hatch from a fixed ladder and fell approximately 15 feet to the ground. One ankle was broken and the other ankle was injured.
An employee was taping/finishing drywall when he miss-stepped and fell, breaking his wrist.

On February 4, 2019, an employee was removing a sheet of aluminum from a pile of aluminum (~ 4 feet x 10 feet) when the aluminum sheets fell on the employee. The employee was pushed into a rack and pinned. Both legs were broken just under the knee caps.
An employee was helping to unload metal sheet panels from a truck. A panel sat on a piece of wood and the wood broke crushing the employee's right pinky, ring and middle fingers.

An employee was using a chain hoist to position a pipe to be welded when the chain caught a valve on the existing pipe and opened the valve, releasing hot water on the employee. He suffered burns to the right arm (from his forearm to his bicep) and right torso (from the ribs to the stomach).

Employees were installing trusses and were tied off to a truss when a crane with another truss struck the truss where the employees were tied off. The employees and the truss fell and suffered injuries requiring hospitalization. One employee suffered a fractured skull. The second employee fractured ribs.
An employee was throwing debris into a dumpster. As the employee was throwing a pole into the dumpster, it bounced back and struck his left arm fracturing it.
An employee was descending a jobsite-made ladder when he slipped and fell, breaking his right ankle.

Employees were terminating cables at a job site. The electrical room was locked out and all grounds were applied. 
The employees had finished the task and were grabbing their tools.  As they were walking out, an arc flash occurred and caused burns to the injured employee's right hand and face.
While accessing an electrical junction box, an employee suffered burns and lacerations to the left- and right-hand fingertips.
An employee was loosening nuts and bolts on the engine of a drill rig when his finger was caught between a drive belt and pulley, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was core drilling concrete when the drill bit became stuck, causing the drill to spin out from underneath the employee's feet. The employee then suffered a fractured femur.

An employee was helping to move a power pole. The aerial crane carrying the pole made contact with 7,200-volt power lines, and the employee suffered first and second degree electrical burns to the right foot.

On February 7, 2019, a dump truck an employee was driving broke down and was placed on a flatbed. The dump truck driver climbed onto the flatbed and inside the truck cab to retrieve his lunch box and upon climbing down he fell to the ground below and struck his head. The employee was hospitalized for a head laceration requiring stitches.

An employee was standing on the top of concrete forms, which were part of the setup for the basement walls of a new house under construction. The employee was directing the flow of concrete into the forms. The hose from the concrete pumper truck moved unexpectedly as a result of a clog in the hose and knocked the employee to the ground in the interior of the basement. The employee suffered minor vertebrae fractures.

An employee was standing on the second floor balcony of a multistory home at a construction site. The employee was leaning over the rail, lost his balance, and fell to the concrete floor below. The employee sustained a fractured ankle and a bruised right shoulder.

A crew was using a crane to lift a section of sheet piling with a chain and clamp lifting device. While the injured employee was guiding the load with a guide line, the clamp malfunctioned and released the load. The sheet pile fell to the ground and over striking the injured employee causing him to fall to the ground resulting in a dislocated hip, a laceration to the eye, and a fractured jaw bone.

An employee was walking on top of rebar reinforcement that was part of a new bridge construction site to measure a bid well motor.  As he moved from one location to another, he tripped, fell and fractured the left wrist. 

The employee was transported to the hospitalized for  surgery.
An employee was changing out the insulator on a buswork at a substation. An energized lightning arrester shocked the employee, causing burns to the left hand. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was on a roof, putting material near a chimney for work later that day. He slipped and fell off the roof, injuring his left lower leg above the ankle. He was hospitalized.

An employee was removing ice from the ropes used to pull power lines through a traveler. The grip broke and the rope pulling the cable through the roller pulled the employee's right hand into the traveler, breaking some bones and tearing the carpal tunnel ligament.
A gust of wind blew a fence onto an employee, injuring his back.
An employee was climbing an 8-foot A-frame ladder to work on bolted ceiling blocks. He slipped and fell from the ladder to the floor, breaking his wrist and suffering a brain hematoma.
A service technician was working on a rooftop heating/AC unit. The technician slipped on ice and snow and fell from the roof to the ground, suffering a crushed vertebra in the lower back.

An employee was standing on top of a 10-foot ladder platform, prying loose a form panel, when the panel fell and struck the foot of the ladder. The employee fell from the ladder and suffered a dislocated right wrist and fractured finger.
An employee was repairing a forklift when a fork fell and injured the employee's right leg.
An employee was operating a cutting machine and suffered the partial amputation of a middle finger.

The injured employee was assisting coworkers to set a fiberglass wall inside a trench. The injured employee had his hand on the wall when the wall shifted and pinched his finger between it and another section of already placed wall. His right middle finger was amputated behind the nail at the first knuckle.

An employee was changing a razor blade on his non-retractable utility knife. He put the knife down on the ground and removed his glove. As he began removing a plastic strip on the bottom of the sheetrock his hand brushed against the knife and lacerated his index finger.

A crew was dismantling a hoist on the exterior of a building when one of the turnbuckle ties snapped at the eye where it was bolted into the mast. The mast which weighs approximately 100 lbs. and measures approximately 10.5 feet swung down approximately 4-5 feet and struck an employee on the back of his head.  The employee was hospitalized with skull fractures and hemorrhaging.
An employee was working on a section of roof when the chain saw kicked back and cut the employee's right leg. The employee was hospitalized.
At approximately 4:30 p.m. there was an explosion and fire while starting up a unit at a refinery. One employee was burned on the face.
An employee slipped and fell on ice breaking a leg in two places.
An employee was breaking loose a sheet metal duct connection that was sealed with pure duct seal using a flat head screw driver. The screwdriver slipped and struck his left eye. He was hospitalized.

An employee was using a cutoff saw to cut a hole in the top of a digester tank. Sparks ignited the methane gas in the digester tank. He was thrown over a railing and fell. The methane gas explosion burned his back and midsection.
An employee was using a snow blower and attempted to clear the snow from around the rotating brush when it energized and severed the employee's right index fingertip.
Four employees were renovating a pre-existing commercial facility. One employee fell four feet from a scaffold and sustained head and hand injuries.

An employee was using a rodder snake to unclog a 4-inch sewer line. The rod hit a blockage while being pulled back and bound around the employee's left hand severing part of the ring finger at approximately the first knuckle.

An employee was using a crowbar to lift the back left side of a section of electrical switchgear cabinet to install a shim. The crowbar rolled, and the weight of the gear came down onto the tip of the flat piece of metal he was pushing the shim with. His left index finger was pinched between the shim metal and the concrete pad amputating the fingertip.
An employee was walking outside, slipped on ice and fell fracturing the right hip.

An employee was pulling two sheets of plastic together with his hands. He was holding a nail in his right hand which he was going to use to stitch the sheets together. His right hand slipped off the plastic and traveled toward his face and the nail struck his right eye. The employee sustained an eye injury requiring hospitalization. The employee was wearing safety glasses at the time.
While installing new steel decking on an interior mezzanine, an employee fell 29 feet, suffering a forehead laceration. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was conducting concrete crushing operations. The equipment was turned off and the employee moved to an area to remove debris. The concrete crusher was turned back on while the injured employee was in the area causing the amputation of his right arm.

An employee was working from a walk plank over stairs, installing sheets of insulation. He fell off the plank to the floor 16 feet below. He was hospitalized for fractured ribs and a kidney laceration.
An employee was performing maintenance on the electrical service and was shocked.
An employee slipped and fell while exiting a truck fracturing the tail bone.
An employee was climbing a ladder to retrieve some tools on location at a job. The employee slipped, lost his balance, and fell to the ground breaking both of his legs.
An employee lost his balance while stepping onto a baker scaffold in the parking garage and fell to the ground resulting in a fractured wrist.

An employee was operating a differential crane weighing 300 pounds. He placed a clamp to secure the crane onto the cable. The clamp came undone and the crane fell onto the employee's left leg breaking it. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was climbing a straight ladder that was secured to a boiler.  On the third or fourth step of the ladder, the employee's foot slipped causing him to fall backwards and hit a fire extinguisher that was on the wall before falling to the concrete ground. The employee was hospitalized due to an injury to his twelfth vertebrae.

A carpenter was using a 7.25 inch circular saw to cut a 2 x 4  wooden board that will be used to construct a barn. The circular saw kicked back causing the amputation of the right tip of his thumb including bone loss.

The injured employee was part of a wrecking crew removing plywood formwork from a structural concrete deck. He was using a pry bar to loosen the formwork. As he was pushing the pry bar upward, the formwork separated from the concrete and the pry bar slipped upward, smashing his left index finger between the bar and a metal support pole and causing amputation of the proximal joint.
An employee was attaching the tie off to the roof, slipped on ice and fell off the roof to the ground. The employee sustained facial fractures and a fractured left foot.
An employee was transporting a 1700 lbs. electrical panel. The panel fell to the floor and struck the employee causing a fractured back, contusions and facial lacerations.
A worker was positioning the forks on a back hoe when one came loose from the bracket, fell and hit his left leg resulting in left leg fracture.
An employee slipped on a patch of ice and fell resulting in a broken ankle that required surgery.
An employee was disassembling a scaffold and reaching for a scaffold pole when he fell forward into another horizontal scaffold pole causing a fractured right forearm.

On February 14, 2019, the injured employee was preparing to move an underground boring machine. As the employee was standing next to the machine, another employee was backing up a "Vac Truck"  and struck the injured employee. The employee was hospitalized for severe back and neck injuries.

On February 14, 2019, at approximately 3:00 p.m., an employee was stepping off a ladder onto a low slope roof approximately 10 feet in height. He stepped onto a section of rotten plywood covered with asphalt shingles which gave way and he fell to the ground below. The employee injured his upper back and was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a groove machine. As he checked the grooves in a pipe, his right hand was caught between two metal plates. The index and middle fingers were amputated.
An employee was on a six-foot ladder replacing an aluminum balcony hand rail system and fell onto the concrete bed landing on his hip and breaking his pelvis and possibly his back.
An employee was working from a Baker scaffold when he fell 6 feet to the floor, breaking his hip.

An employee fell from the roof of a commercial building, landing on the ground about 20 feet below. The employee suffered cracked vertebrae (one in the neck and one in the back) and broke both wrists.
An employee fell off a manhole structure to the ground 8-10 feet below, suffering a broken right knee and a hairline fracture to the left ankle.
An employee was cleaning pipes. The employee's left index finger was caught between a pipe and a machine, suffering a laceration and a cut tendon.
An employee was installing a concrete storm drain pipe from inside a concrete storm drain box/catch basin. The pipe rolled over and struck the employee in the face/jaw. The employee was hospitalized.
A trackhoe moved a concrete storm box, causing it to break an employee's lower right leg. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was nailing a double-headed nail into a form. One of the heads flew off the nail and struck him in the eye, causing a cut that required surgery.
An employee was checking piece mark numbers on pipe braces. A timber dunnage broke and a pipe rolled off, striking the employee's right foot and breaking his big toe.

An employee was setting a double-tee into storage with the help of a gantry crane. As he was guiding the piece into position, it swung and pinched fingers on his left hand. His index fingertip was amputated (including bone) and his little finger was injured.
An employee caught fire while warming up next to a heater. The employee suffered second-degree burns to the left leg.

An employee stepped off a ladder onto a 5-foot-wide porch roof. The roof collapsed, and the employee fell with it to the ground about 18 feet below. The employee suffered wrist and leg fractures and facial lacerations.

An employee was working from a 6-foot stepladder, pulling a piece of wood from a concrete wall. The employee fell backward from the ladder to the ground, landing on their tool belt and suffering a back sprain.

An employee was installing a sewer pipe in a trench. He was changing the bucket to a smaller bucket using the quick connect attachment on an excavator when the bucket fell on the employee, breaking his leg. He was hospitalized.
An employee's hand was caught and injured between a pipe and a wooden skid, with an excavator applying pressure.

An employee was pulling the locking pin from an attachment on an excavator. Pressure buildup caused the pin to pull back. The employee's right hand was caught between the locking pin and the attachment and the tips of the middle and ring fingers were amputated.

An employee was de-stressing cabling on a flat pour due to a failed concrete test. The de-tensioning tool slipped and struck the employee, breaking the employee's left radius and causing a hand laceration.
An employee was cutting a ductile pipe with a gas-powered chop saw. The saw kicked back and its blade lacerated the employee's chest. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was removing a nail gun from his tool belt when it fired a nail into his right hip.
A load (concrete pile) struck an employee as it was being moved by a crawler crane, breaking the employee's pelvis.
An employee fell while climbing over a scaffold's cross-braces. The employee landed on the ground, suffering a broken femur and a burst fracture of a lower back vertebra.
An employee was climbing down a ladder on a stationary horizontal tank that was 10 feet above the ground. He fell off the ladder to the ground 6 to 8 feet below, injuring his back.

An employee entered a trench (about 7 feet deep and 7 to 8 feet wide) to install a fitting on a sewer main at the bottom. The trench's one vertical wall collapsed onto the employee, who suffered four broken ribs, a collapsed lung, and a broken shoulder blade.
On February 18, 2019, an employee slipped on pavement while walking in a parking lot. The employee fell to the asphalt, breaking a hip, and was hospitalized.
An employee was moving material using a forklift. A spreader bar (being used to carry the material) fell on his right foot, causing a dislocation. The employee was hospitalized, requiring surgery.
An employee's left ring finger was amputated after a pressurized airline ruptured in his hand.

An employee was trying to transfer lumber from a bundle on a forklift into the bed of a truck. The lumber was frozen together, and another employee began to tap it with a hammer. The wood began to slide, and the first employee's hand was caught between the falling wood and a stack of wood. The employee's right ring fingertip was amputated.

An employee was installing decking. While reaching for a piece of the decking, the employee slipped and fell off the building to the ground, suffering two broken ribs and a skull fracture. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was using a power trowel to smooth a concrete surface. The employee was overcome by carbon monoxide fumes.
An employee suffered a laceration to the right leg on top of an elevator that was being serviced. The laceration required surgery.

An employee started to cut a thermowell (a 2-inch piece of pipe with a sensor inside) using a portable bandsaw. A flash caused minor burns to the employee's chin, neck, and wrists; the employee was hospitalized.

An employee was on an A-frame ladder, using a beam clamp to guide a truss onto a beam on a new home. The beam clamp broke and the employee fell about 6-7 feet to the ground, suffering back contusions.

An employee was transporting a machine part using a forklift. As the forklift made a sharp turn, the employee's hand was caught between the forklift and a nearby assembly line machine and his little finger was crushed. The finger was amputated.

An employee was holding a piece of rebar while another employee was cutting it with a cut-off saw when the saw kicked to the side and into the employee's arm, causing a laceration to the right forearm. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was on an 8-foot stepladder when one of the spreader bars broke causing the ladder to twist and turn throwing the employee off the ladder. The employee suffered a broken right arm.
An employee was repairing a furnace at a job site. While the furnace was being lifted, it struck him in the leg, breaking his femur.

Two employees were acting as spotters while a forklift moved pipe joints. One of them, on the left side of the forklift, was laying down a tagline when a pipe began to roll. It struck and broke his leg.
An employee was on a scissor lift 8 or 9 feet from the ground, installing some blast chill fans for a new ammonia refrigeration system. The employee fell to the ground, hitting his head.

An employee was working from a 10-foot ladder, cutting into a copper line. A blast of pressurized air was released from the line and the employee fell, landing on the concrete floor 8 feet below. He suffered injuries to the head, back, and spine.
A roofer fell from the roof and was hospitalized for a head injury. It was raining at the time of the incident.

An employee was walking alongside a forklift loaded with frames. The frames began to fall, and the employee tripped and fell while moving to avoid them. The forklift then ran over the employee's foot. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was moving a welder's cable out of the way when the cable shocked his right hand and arm.
An employee was refueling a tracked excavator. The employee slipped and fell off the excavator to the ground injuring their back, shoulder, and head.
An employee was walking out of the building at the end of a shift, tripped on the door sill and fell to the ground breaking the left arm.
A roofer fell off a roof to the ground 20 feet below, suffering broken wrists and a puncture injury to the head. He was hospitalized. Fall protection was not being worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was installing a metal roof when he slipped and fell on the roof. When the employee fell, he hit the edge of a metal roof panel with his right wrist and suffered a laceration that cut tendon and ligaments, requiring surgery.

An employee was operating a bucket truck picking up road signs along the side of the road at the end of the day. The employee was on the back of the truck strapping down the signs. When he stood up, he struck his head on the bottom of the bucket, lost his balance, and fell approximately four feet off the side of the truck to the ground breaking the lower left leg.
A falling cement block struck an employee on a job site, causing a fractured skull and a laceration.

An employee was leaving a front end loader when the wind caught the loader's door, causing the employee to fall to the cement curb about 5 feet below. He suffered broken ribs and a head laceration and was hospitalized.
An employee was transferring from an aerial lift to a scaffold platform and fell approximately 50 feet to the ground. The employee suffered two broken legs and the loss of teeth.
An employee was opening a horizontal manway on top of a drum using a jack. When the manway opened, the employee's right index finger contacted a valve on the manway causing a fingertip amputation.
An employee was working on a paving job and was pinned between a paving machine and a dump truck resulting in fractures to the left femur and both ankles.

Three employees were walking down the stairs. The stairs collapsed and two of the employees were injured. They suffered multiple fractures, contusions, and lacerations to the legs, arms, ankles, back and chest.
An employee was sweeping around metal roofing beams when a metal beam collapsed onto the employee's foot fracturing it.
An employee was painting from a bakers scaffold. The scaffold shifted and the employee fell approximately 6 feet to the floor below fracturing their lower back.

A framing contractor was standing on top of a concrete podium deck on the second floor, working on framing in that area. As he was trying to move a wall, he slipped and fell approximately 10 feet to the first floor, injuring his wrist and lacerating his nose and upper lip.
An employee was moving a plastic bead box weighing about 5 pounds. He tripped over a pipe stub and fell, landing on his tape measure. He suffered a broken left leg that required surgery.
An employee was taping drywall on stilts. The employee tripped on an electrical cord and fell to the ground, suffering a broken kneecap.

An electrician was taking out an uninterruptible power supply (UPS) system. One of the systems was set on the ground by an aerial lift. While the second system was being set on the ground, the employee was walking between the two systems. One of the units fell on him trapping him between the two systems. The employee suffered an ear injury, a broken jaw and a broken leg and was hospitalized.

An employee was descending a 24-foot extension ladder when the ladder began to fall. The employee rode the ladder down and landed on his feet on the concrete ground resulting in a fracture to his right foot and a vertebra.

An employee was found unresponsive near a heat recovery steam generator, on his knees with blood around his nose and a bump on the head. He was hospitalized, having suffered a traumatic brain injury, a subdermal hemorrhage, multiple facial fractures, and lumbar and thoracic fractures.

An electrician was moving a food warmer table with the help of his co-worker. The table slipped out of his grip and the metal lip at the edge of the table lacerated his left index finger. The employee was wearing heavy, vinyl gloves at the time.
An employee was adjusting/fixing the cover on the bucket of the truck while it was not in use and fell from the bucket truck. The employee sustained a head injury.

An employee was on an extension ladder, using a metal crowbar to remove shingles from near a second-story window on an outside detached garage. The ladder slipped from under him and he fell, landing on the black asphalt driveway in front of the garage. He suffered an injury to his back and was hospitalized.
While sorting mail, an employee tripped over a file box that was sitting in front of the mailboxes. The employee fell, suffering a broken right hip.

An employee was receiving 2-by-4s from a lower level onto a mezzanine. The employee tripped on a lifting strap and fell about 18 feet from the mezzanine to the ground, suffering a broken pelvis and back injuries.
An employee was carrying a sheet of plywood while walking on 2x6 rafters. He lost balance and fell approximately 10 feet to the concrete ground fracturing a hip.
An employee fell from an extension ladder while painting. He suffered wrist and face injuries and was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting a steel tube using a band saw and lacerated the top of their left hand requiring stitches. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was struck on the back of the leg by a forklift outside of the garden center on the east side of the building. The employee suffered an ankle injury as he fell to the ground.

An employee was using a 24-foot extension ladder to install gutters. The ladder kicked out and slid down the residential home's siding to the ground. The employee fell 15 feet and broke both wrists and sustained a head laceration requiring stitches.

A bolt broke on a tow hitch. The injured employee placed his finger in the hole to clear the broken bolt when another employee lifted the hitch to move it up and amputated the injured employee's right index fingertip.
A chlorine spill occurred at the worksite and the chlorine fumes caused respiratory distress for two employees.
An employee was cleaning a concrete pump hopper and suffered multiple finger amputations when their hand was caught in the pump intake.
An employee was repairing a gas leak at a restaurant. Flames from a grill ignited the gas and the employee suffered second degree burns on the hands, face and ankles.
A drywall cart with metal panels fell onto an employee's leg fracturing the tibia and fibula.

An employee was stringing new rope from a drum onto a pulling machine. The rope started to veer off to one side; the employee was pushing the pulling block back into place with his right hand when his neoprene glove was pulled into the block. The skin on his right thumb tip was torn.
On February 28, 2019, an employee slipped on the icy ground while exiting a truck. The employee fell, suffering a broken leg.
An employee was unloading a truck. While he was lowering a loading dock, it smashed his right index finger, causing a partial amputation.
An employee fell backward while removing a manhole cover, landing on the pavement and suffering a broken pelvis.
An employee fell from a metal deck to a concrete slab 10 feet below, suffering a head injury.
While trying to remove a bolt from a concrete form, an employee suffered a pinched left ring finger. The fingertip was amputated, including bone.

An employee was operating a backhoe in reverse on a gravel haul road. The backhoe went off the edge of the road two to three feet onto soft dirt. The backhoe rolled over and the employee fell off. The backhoe then struck the employee and pinned his lower legs and feet. The employee sustained a fracture right ankle and a broken left foot.

Employees were retracting the pullout extension on the end of the jib attachment on a 35-ton crane. An employee was pushing on the jib extension and his left index finger was crushed by the sheave on the end of the jib causing a fingertip amputation with bone loss.
A driver was stepping down from the back of a flatbed trailer, missed the step (DOT bumper) and fell to the ground fracturing his right upper leg.
An employee was unloading a truck when materials dropped from it onto his left foot, breaking two toes.
An employee was repairing a leaking drain pipe under a sink at a restaurant. Water splashed on the employee's leg, causing a bacterial infection.

An employee was climbing a 12'8" permanent fixed ladder when he fell to the ground, landing on his left side. He suffered a fractured radius, fractured tail bone, fractured lower vertebrae, and internal bleeding.

An employee was walking on stilts installing metal frames in the ceiling. He stepped on a piece of insulation which caused him to lose balance and fall. A bracket on the wall cut tendons in his hand that required surgery.
An employee fell while walking into a storage container and suffered head and back injuries.
An employee was installing a light fixture when it fell and struck him. He suffered injuries to the nose and right eye, as well as broken facial bones.

An employee was taking photographs of fire caulking from a 28-foot extension ladder. He fell about 8 feet to the ground, suffering injuries to both arms including fractures to the right wrist, left elbow, and thumb and a chin injury that required stitches.

A crane technician was in a manlift. A stacker crane struck the manlift, causing it to fall over and the technician to suffer a broken ankle. The technician was appropriately tied off at the time of the incident.

At 1:30 p.m. on March 4, 2019, an employee was installing a pipe. The employee leaned on a door to adjust the pipe and fell 30 feet to the bottom of the pump pit. The employee was hospitalized for a fractured skull.

While putting a truck bed in the horizontal position, an employee noticed it was not latching properly. While he was investigating, the tailgate released, crushing his left middle and ring fingers against the bed and amputating them.
A crew was racking up outriggers on a 50-ton crane. An employee slipped and fell, and his left index finger was caught in the moving parts of an outrigger. The finger was partially amputated.
An employee was at a single family home to repair the central heating system and fell through the ceiling to the ground below. The employee sustained injuries to the elbow and eye socket.
An employee was using a chop saw to cut pipe. The saw kicked back and the employee sustained a cut to his lip and broken teeth.
Two employees were moving sheet metal by hand. One employee lost their grip on the metal and sustained a laceration on his left arm/wrist that required hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was on a bakers scaffold finishing drywall. The platform shifted and he fell approximately 7 feet to the ground below and broke his left ankle.

An employee was setting stones and installing a retaining wall. An excavator bucket came down, squeezing his hand/arm against the stone. The arm was broken, and the employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was installing an extension chute on a cement truck. The chute caught the employee's right middle finger, amputating the tip.
An employee was testing a 6-inch water line when a rubber ball struck him and cut his hand. He was hospitalized, requiring surgery.

Two employees were rigging and lifting a load when they were struck by a 12-foot long, 1600-kg structural support that broke free from its chain sling during the lift. One employee suffered broken ribs, a broken left foot, a concussion and required stitches on the left ear.

An employee was on a ladder, looking into an attic to take pictures for a house inspection. The ladder slipped and the employee fell. The employee's left middle finger was amputated to the first joint.
An employee was on an 8-foot ladder doing drywall work. He fell, suffering a broken left arm and a cut on the forehead above the left eye.
A nail gun shot a nail into an employee's right knee.
Wear plates for a mixer were being manufactured. The bit that was used to punch holes shattered and a fragment of it lodged in an employee's neck.
An employee suffered a broken right leg when his weight shifted.

An employee was on a ladder trying to remove a concrete form from a grain silo that was being built. The form shifted, causing the employee to fall to the ground about 8 feet below. His ankle was broken and he was hospitalized, requiring surgery.

An employee was next to a mini-excavator when its control handles caught his coat. The excavator activated, causing the employee to fall, and its track then ran over and broke his right foot. He was hospitalized, requiring surgery.
An employee was moving windows when a window slipped and pinned his left hand to the floor, causing the amputation of his left ring finger at the base.

On March 6, 2019, an employee was working in a trench when a 20-inch-thick gas pipe slid off a skid and fell into the trench. It struck the employee, injuring the employee's ankle. The employee was hospitalized.
As it backed up, a mini excavator ran over an employee's left leg and broke it.

On March 6, 2019, an employee was working from the third or fourth step of a ladder, installing steel on a horse barn. The employee slipped and fell to the ground, suffering a broken wrist and arm, and was hospitalized.
An employee was loading steel beams onto a flatbed truck using a crane. The controls pinched and amputated his right ring finger.
An employee was marking out roof beam locations and fell off the roof. The employee sustained rib fractures.

An employee was sandblasting sheets on the ground. The sandblaster was low on media, and the employee released the trigger to refill it. The hose applied pressure to the employee's wrist, which twisted toward the employee's upper leg and hip. The sandblaster then shot media into the employee's midsection, causing a laceration between the hip and leg.
