An employee was using a demolition saw to cut pipe. The saw bucked back, lacerating his neck.
A closing toolbox lid caught an employee's left index finger, causing the amputation of the tip.
Three employees were unloading bundled windows from a box truck. The windows tilted over and fell, striking one of the employees on the right leg below the knee and breaking it.
An employee was walking on a wood 2-by-4 when the wood broke and he fell to the ground about 10 feet below, suffering a right ankle fracture.
An employee was on stilts when he tripped and fell to the ground, breaking his hip.
An employee fell off the edge of a platform to the ground about 32 feet below. He suffered a broken arm, leg and pelvis. A harness was not being worn at the time of the incident.
While exiting an excavator, an employee slipped on ice and fell to the ground, suffering a broken tibia that required surgery.

Two employees were in the bucket of a bucket truck energizing a 13,800-to-2,400-volt stepdown transformer by closing three 100k fused cutouts at the riser pole. A voltage meter used to take readings on the ground was overloaded and failed, causing an arc flash. One of the employees in the bucket suffered first- and second-degree burns to both wrists, the face, the neck, and the ears and was hospitalized.
An employee was hooking up a chain under a metal floor base. The floor slipped and smashed three fingers on the employee's right hand, breaking them.
An employee fell about 13 feet from a mezzanine to the concrete ground floor, suffering a broken ankle.
An employee fell from the fourth rung of a ladder to the ground below, breaking his left forearm.

An employee was using a 6-foot breaker bar to demolish an old concrete sidewalk when the concrete slipped off the excavator forks, causing the breaker bar to pop up. Concrete hit the employee in the chin and Adam's apple area, lacerating his neck and knocking him unconscious.

At about 11:20 a.m. on March 9, 2019, an employee and his employer were working on the roof of a new construction structure. They were installing paper in the roof when both slipped and fell to the concrete floor. The employee suffered massive bleeding from the head and severe bruises on his left shoulder.

BMWC employees were unloading 18-inch pipe from a trailer and placing it on the ground. The pipe began to roll, trapped an employee's foot, and rolled up onto his leg, breaking his tibia. He was hospitalized.
An employee tripped over carpet, suffering a broken right hip.
An employee was climbing a 35-foot ladder. He slipped and fell from about 12 feet up, landing on the ground and suffering a broken hip and a facial laceration.
While walking out of a job trailer, an employee slipped on ice and fell on his back, suffering broken lower-back vertebrae.
An employee was walking toward a 3-foot-high pile of new power poles. The pile shifted and a pole rolled up onto the employee's left foot, breaking bones. He was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell on an icy walkway while entering a job site. He fell to the ground, suffering a leg fracture that required surgery.

On the morning of 3/11/2019, a temporary employee working for Deventry, was working on an exterior facade that was located on the rear of the school on top of a lower roof using a 16' extension ladder. The employee fell approximately 10 feet from the ladder and struck his head on the lower roof.
An employee fell from an 8-foot step ladder, suffering a broken right lower leg.
An aerial forklift struck an employee as it backed up, breaking his right leg. He was hospitalized, requiring surgery.
A crane operator was doing rigging work on the deck of a crane. He fell off the deck to the ground 5 to 6 feet below and broke his right femur. He was hospitalized, requiring surgery.

An employee was installing new wire during construction of a residential townhome and contacted a live pedestal buss bar resulting in electrocution. The employee was wearing flame resistant clothing and electrical protector gloves at the time.
An employee was pushing a 3-foot ductile steel pipe into an excavator bucket and felt a pop in his lower back. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was suspending a pour pot above an open kettle of hot tar when the wire broke and the pour pot fell into the kettle, splashing hot tar on the employee. The employee was hospitalized with burns to the face and neck.
An employee was cutting baseboard with a chop saw and amputated a finger.

An employee was working with a team to lift and move a metal skylight curb. The curb slipped and while the employee tried to stabilize it, the metal corner of the curb lacerated his forearm/wrist area.
An employee was cleaning a lot with an excavator. As he was pulling down branches, a tree limb came through the windshield and smashed his right leg, perforating the skin.
An employee was walking along the slope of a trench and jumped towards a ladder causing fractures on right leg.
While moving a traffic barrel/drum, an employee fell into an open manhole. His left tibia was broken in the 2-foot fall.

An employee was using a fusion machine and attempting to clamp a pipe when the machine's vise arm closed and the employee's finger was caught in a shear point of the clamp arm. The employee received a partial finger amputation.
An employee was climbing down a ladder when he slipped and fell to the ground, breaking his elbow and pelvis.

An employee was serving as a lookout for a forklift operator who was picking up steel beams to move them on the job site. The forklift arm caught something on the ground and caused the load to bounce. When the load bounced, the beams toppled over. The employee was then pinned between a steel beam and a vehicle, suffering a cut to the upper left leg and bruising on the upper right leg.
On March 14, 2019, an employee fell on a seating area while assisting in a concrete pour. The employee suffered a head injury and was hospitalized.

While installing underground plumbing, an employee was holding a PVC pipe straight as a skid steer backfilled the pipe. The skid steer bucket struck his fingers, resulting in a left index finger amputation.
An employee was using a cut-off saw to cut an 8-inch pipe for a water main when the saw kicked back and struck the employee's face. The employee was hospitalized with multiple lacerations.

On March 14, 2019, at approximately 11:40 AM, an employee was cutting a piece of quarter stock for a trim on a residential housing unit.  As the employee cut the piece, which was approximately 3 inches in length, the employee's left hand became unstable from the wood, and the left index finger contacted the blade. The employee suffered a left index finger amputation.
An employee slipped on icy slush and fell to the ground while stepping off a curb, fracturing his ankle.
An employee was unloading glass shower door panels (3 feet x 7 feet), when the pile (approximately 20) fell on him, breaking both of his ankles.
An employee was setting a truss on a tie-beam when he fell 20 feet to the ground. He suffered broken ankles, legs, arms, a broken neck and back and a fractured skull.
An employee was picking up roofing debris from the ground when a roll of roofing insulation fell and struck his leg, breaking it. He was hospitalized.
An employee was installing bolts on an electrical pole. The employee fell about 40 feet, suffering a shattered right ankle and a broken left heel. Fall protection was worn at the time.

An employee was mounting a track assembly machine when the machine tipped over, pinning the employee underneath. The employee was hospitalized with a laceration to the left middle finger and a hairline fracture to the left fibula.
An employee was cutting a piece of wood with a table saw. The saw blade cut the employee's hand. He was hospitalized, requiring surgery.
An employee was cutting material on a radial arm saw. The saw blade cut his left thumb, amputating the tip.

An actuator got stuck on a rusted stud and did not release. An employee tried to unjam the actuator and it moved, pinching his finger against the base of the pipe. His right index fingertip was amputated.
An employee tripped on rocks and dirt at a construction site and fell, suffering possible broken ribs. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell about 6 feet while dismantling scaffolding and suffered a broken right tibia.
An employee was taking a measurement when he contacted a power line, suffering injuries to a nerve in the right forearm.
An employee was holding a Goldberg fitting up to ductwork. The fitting fell and struck the employee's left forearm, lacerating an artery. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell through a weak area on a roof, landing on top of a rack about 6 feet below and then falling another 12 feet to the ground level. The employee suffered a broken lower-back vertebra.
On March 18, 2019, an employee was discarding a toilet in a dumpster. The toilet shattered and deeply lacerated the employee's right forearm.
An employee was installing insulation in the 2x6 exterior wall on the third floor when he slipped and fell to the ground about 22 feet below. The employee suffered back and neck fractures.
A pipefitter was climbing down a detachable ladder attached to the side of a flatbed truck. He fell off the ladder and struck the ground, suffering a concussion, a broken collarbone, and broken ribs.
An employee was cutting a 6-inch fire hydrant pipe with a handheld circular saw. The saw blade came up and struck the employee in the chin and chest, causing lacerations.
An employee was cutting cinderblock with a masonry saw and amputated his thumb.
An employee was carrying a duct strap hanger and drill up a ladder. The employee fell 6 feet to the concrete floor, suffering head, left shoulder, and collarbone injuries.
An employee was in a trench installing a storm drain. A dirt clod fell from the unprotected side of the trench and struck the employee, causing him to fall to the ground and break his left leg.

An employee was turning over an open caulk bucket with the metal lid partially attached. During this process, the open lid scratched the employee's right forearm, causing a 6-inch laceration to the underside that required hospitalization.

An employee was working from a 16-foot extension ladder installing insulation. The employee was standing on the seventh step when he fell to the ground level. He received a broken left arm, bit his lip, and suffered bilateral cracked ribs.

An employee was ripping plywood into 2 1/2" strips with a table saw. He was toward the end of his rip cut when the blade hit a knot. His push stick and his right hand were pulled into the blade. He suffered cuts to the thumb and index, middle, and ring fingers; the index finger was cut through and had to be amputated at the second joint from the tip.
An employee was removing and installing skylights when the employee fell approximately 42 feet through a skylight to ground level, injuring the lower body and head. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was installing a 3" schedule 80 line when the load shifted, pinning his lower left leg between the pipe and the ground. He suffered a fractured left tibia.
An employee was operating an ATV down a closed street on the jobsite and crashed. The employee suffered a dislocated shoulder and broken bones in the elbow and thumb requiring surgery.

An employee was setting angle iron in a machine when his right hand was caught between the machine and the machine's rail as the machine changed direction resulting in amputation of the thumb just below the knuckle.
An employee was shoveling left-over wet concrete from under a machine that made concrete blocks. He felt a sharp pain in his lower abdomen and was hospitalized, requiring hernia surgery.
An employee was on a ladder removing insulation. The employee slipped and fell about 5 feet, suffering a jammed finger on the right hand and a head injury.
An employee was pulling a wire through a conduit when their left ring finger was caught in a tugger and partially amputated.
An employee was preparing a steel frame to be painted. The frame fell, causing a laceration across the employee's forehead that required stitches. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was standing in a 6.5- to 7-foot deep excavation preparing to install a plastic drainage pipe when part of one excavation wall caved in, burying the lower half of the employee's body in dirt.  A large chunk of dirt also rolled against his upper body. He was hospitalized with fractures to the pelvis and several vertebrae.
An employee was attempting to straighten a digging bar that was wedged in a backhoe. When the bar moved, the employee lost balance and fell breaking the left ankle.

Three employees had moved a metal electrical cabinet (about 8 by 11 feet) for a new power wall at a new construction site. The cabinet was placed against a wall. While holes were being drilled in it, it tipped over and struck one of the employees. The employee was pinned beneath the cabinet and suffered injuries including a broken tailbone. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was conducting steel erection activities. He fell approximately 12 feet to the ground below while descending a ladder from the steel structure and fractured his elbow, wrist, pelvis and leg. Fall protection was not connected at the time.
An employee was hooking up a chain from the bucket of a backhoe to a trench box. The trench box was moved, and the employee's right ring finger was amputated.
An employee stepped on a conduit, rolling and fracturing his right ankle. He was hospitalized.

An employee was working on a sub-roof assembly approximately 13 feet high. The employee was pushing down on a pry bar and lost balance, falling 13 feet to the ground. The employee fractured both legs and the left wrist.
An employee swung their leg over to climb down a baker scaffold. Their pant leg caught on the frame causing the employee to fall approximately 4.5 feet and suffer a fractured tailbone.
An employee was struck by a forklift while taking inventory. The employee suffered an open fracture of the left ankle.
An employee was carrying a pipe stand when he lost his footing and fell to the ground. The stand smashed his hand. His right ring finger was injured and had to be amputated.

An employee was part of a four-person crew that was removing a form after a concrete pour was set. A crane tried to pull the form off a concrete column, and the wire rope guideline hung up on something. The employee tried to release the guideline; the employee's right hand was caught between the form rebar and the guideline. The employee suffered a pinch-type amputation of the right index, middle, ring, and little fingers.

An employee was aligning bolts on an excavator counterweight weighing 4400 pounds during assembly. The counterweight slid sideways and pinned the employee's left arm between it and the surface level causing a fracture below the elbow.
An employee fell on a staircase at a home being built, suffering head trauma with concussion, a shoulder injury, and rib damage.
An employee was cutting lumber with a table saw. The saw nicked the employee's left little finger, amputating the tip.

Two employees were repairing a filter fence around a storm drain. A semi-trailer lost its two back wheels, which struck the employees. One of the employees was hospitalized, having suffered a broken wrist, ribs, fingers, and shoulder along with head trauma.
An employee was installing balcony railings and fell from the second floor to the ground resulting in a fractures to his spine.

An employee was welding an 24-inch diameter flange to a pipe that was attached to a weld positioner. The flange and the pipe combined weighed approximately 1,500 to 1,600 pounds. The employee went into the pipe to check the completed partial weld on the opposite end of where the positioner was located. The employee's feet were hanging outside the open end of the pipe. The weld broke causing the pipe and the employee to fall to the floor. The employee's feet were caught between the beveled ended of the pipe and the floor. All of the employee's toes on his right foot were amputated and the big toe on his left foot was fractured.
A temporary employee was cutting wood with a miter saw when his hand contacted the blade, causing a left thumb amputation. The saw was guarded at the time.
An employee fell to ground level while installing a wall form, suffering a femur fracture.

The injured employee was standing next to a metal beam to connect it to a wooden beam. An excavator bucket hit the 2,000-pound metal beam, which in turn knocked the injured employee to the ground. The beam then landed on the employee's right hip/thigh, injuring it. The employee was hospitalized and underwent surgery.

An employee was using measuring tape to shoot grade when he slipped in mud and fell, striking his face above the right eye. He suffered a cracked sinus cavity and required stitches above his right eye.
On March 26, 2019, an employee slipped down an embankment, hitting a post and suffering fractures to the face.

An employee was on a step ladder installing a low voltage telecommunications cable when he fell from the step ladder to the concrete below, suffering a bruised lung, broken ribs, and a dislocated and fractured shoulder and elbow. He was hospitalized.
An employee was walking near an operating backhoe. The bucket struck the employee and fractured three ribs.

An employee was cutting wire away from a bar joist that was being held/moved by an excavator. The excavator was moved, and the joist struck the employee in the back. The employee suffered back pain and broken ribs.

An employee was standing on a concrete form, pumping concrete. The pump drew in air and it caused an air hammer in the line, knocking the employee from the form. He suffered broken ribs, a broken arm, and other injuries.

An employee was working around the metal grate for a concrete inlet. The employee's fingers were pinched between the grate and the concrete; the employee suffered severe lacerations and the possible amputation of a fingertip.
An employee was assisting a crane and flipped a duct panel when the employee fell and was struck by the duct panel, injuring the pelvic bone.
An employee was loading thermal paint into tanks for heating when he contacted the metal edge of the cover opening, severing his right pinky and ring fingers just below the nail.

An employee was on a baker scaffold when one of the wheels rolled off a curb. The scaffold tipped over and the employee fell about 8 feet to the ground, breaking his left humerus, clavicle, wrist, ribs, and pelvis.

An employee was using a vacuum to suction sand out from the bottom of an air filter bed used to filter fiberglass during paper production. The employee stepped down from a plywood plank being used as a temporary work platform; the employee's foot got caught between two dividers in the filter bed, causing the employee to fall. The employee suffered a torn anterior inferior tibiofibular ligament and was hospitalized, requiring surgery.

An employee was prepping a foundation for a concrete pour and walked behind an active excavator. As the excavator was turning, the employee was caught between the counterweight and a wall causing a broken pelvis.
An employee was using a drill with a hole saw attachment to cut holes for bar ties on a wall form. The drill's chuck snagged his work glove and his left little finger was amputated.

An employee was walking on the rafters in an attic while blowing fiberglass. He stepped on a 2-by-4 board, which slipped out of place, causing him to lose his balance and fall through the ceiling. He suffered a broken right elbow and three compressed vertebrae in his back.
Two employees were painting street lines in a middle lane work zone when they were struck by a vehicle, suffering head injuries.

An employee was in an elevated scissor lift, running wires to light ballasts. The lift fell over and the employee fell with it to the cement floor. The employee suffered two broken ankles, a broken pelvis, and a broken vertebra.
An employee was on a finished section of the roof of a single-story house during a reroofing job. He slipped and fell off the roof, breaking his left arm. He was hospitalized.

An employee was rolling a 15-inch by 12-foot pipe off a trailer. When the pipe started to roll, a band clamp on it bent. The pipe caught the employee's glove and pulled the employee off the trailer. The employee's wrist and hand were crushed under the pipe; the employee's thumb was amputated and other fingers were crushed, with skin torn off exposing bone.

The injured employee was supervising another employee who was operating a track skid steer loader during a backfilling excavation. The operator lost control of the skid steer and rotated toward the injured employee's path, striking him on the chest with the bucket. He suffered five to seven broken ribs and a possible collapsed lung.

An employee was working from a scissor lift, dismantling pallet stacks. The racks collapsed and knocked the scissor lift to the ground. The employee suffered a head laceration, a fractured elbow, a left hand contusion, a laceration to the right hand, broken ribs, a partially collapsed left lung, and a ruptured spleen.
An employee fell while coming down a ladder, dislocating his arm. He was hospitalized.
An employee was attaching a base frame and mast section together on a hoist when his right middle fingertip was caught between the base frame and mast section, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was replacing coolant on a chiller. The pump leaked propylene glycol on the floor and the employee slipped and fell, tearing a hamstring. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was working on a roof. The fall protection system the employee was using fell at a gap in the roof, pulling the employee with it; the employee fell 30 feet, suffering maxillofacial and wrist injuries, and was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell off a ladder to the ground, breaking an ankle and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was strapping down plastic water barriers on a lowboy trailer. A gust of wind knocked a barrier into the employee, knocking him off the trailer. He fell about 2 feet to the ground and suffered a broken hip. He was hospitalized.
An employee was repairing a meter. The meter's glass cover shattered and the employee's left wrist was lacerated.
An employee was loading a vehicle when an automatic loading dock pinned the employee's toes, causing partial amputations to three toes.

An employee was attempting to pull an exchanger using an air winch and a pulley. A chain securing the winch broke, causing the winch to lurch forward. The winch struck the employee in the leg, causing a broken left femur.
An employee injured his hand while using a press brake.

An employee was working at the eave of a roof when rotten wood in the fascia, decking, and trusses gave out, causing the employee to fall to the ground. The employee suffered a laceration to the right cheek and a broken bone in the right shoulder.
An employee experienced back pain while carrying a 20 lb. box by rope to the next level.
An employee was installing/splicing bulkhead sheet piling when the employee's hand was caught between sheeting. The employee was hospitalized with a hand fracture.
An employee was using a ladder to access a roof. He fell about 10 feet to the grass/concrete ground, suffering wrist, forearm, and pelvis injuries.

Two employees were using a telehandler forklift with an adjustable spreader bar to transport rebar at a construction site. When the load was lifted off the ground the spreader bar beam slipped off the forks and struck the employee on the right leg fracturing it.
An employee was laying rebar next to a roadway when an oversized load of wooden trusses on a truck struck the employee in the back, fracturing three ribs and both shoulder blades.
An employee was walking across a highway when a motor vehicle struck him, breaking his right hip.

An employee was adjusting/moving an aluminum float during a concrete pour when the 30-foot long float swung outside of construction working limits and contacted a 13,200 volt primary power line. The employee received electrical burns to both palms.
An employee was unbolting an I-beam when it fell on his right foot, resulting in the amputation of four toes.

At 3:00 p.m. on April 2, 2019, an employee was setting a frac pump in place. While a Pitman arm was being pulled into place, it struck him in the left leg, causing a dislocated ankle and fractures to the tibia and fibula. He was hospitalized.
An employee was using an infrared gun to check the temperature of hot mix that was being loaded into an elevator to feed a silo. The flames rose, burning his face and neck.
An employee fell off a roof to the ground and suffered a back injury.

On 4/02/2019, an employee was approximately 6 feet off the ground on an 8-foot ladder, hand-adjusting a wire on ducting/sheet metal that was being hung. He became unbalanced and fell to the concrete floor, fracturing his left upper arm and requiring surgery.

An employee was helping a sheet metal foreman measure a small sheet metal roof over the dock. The employee walked onto the sheet metal roof and fell through a flush skylight on the canopy.  He fell 16 feet, landed on some 55-gallon drums, bounced, and ended up on the dock concrete flooring. He was hospitalized with broken ribs, broken vertebrae, a punctured lung, an injury to the other lung, and a damaged spleen.

On April 2, 2019, an employee was holding onto a hoist chain with one hand and placed the other hand above the hoist block. As the employee pushed the load away from the handrail, the employee's glove pulled the employee's right hand into the hoist block, pinching the fifth digit between the chain guide and hoist chain. As a result, the employee suffered a right pinky finger distal phalanx fracture and soft tissue avulsion, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was hooking up a sling for an excavator to move a piece of concrete pipe when the excavator operator pulled up on the sling, crushing the employee's left hand between the pipe and teacup.

An employee was changing a 5-ton compressor on an HVAC unit using an acetylene torch. While applying heat to the discharge line, residual oil/freon that had been expelled during brazing ignited, causing first and second degree burns to the upper chest and face.

An employee was insulating an AC duct pipe in a ceiling area about 10 feet above ground level, using an 8-foot A-frame ladder. He fell to the ground, injuring his head and breaking his left femur. He was hospitalized.
An employee was working on a 24-inch PVC pipe when it struck the employee, causing broken ribs and possibly collapsed lungs.

An employee was dismantling masonry scaffolding with a partner from a six-foot ladder.  When he pulled one end of the 2x8 boards free the other end also broke free and caught his gloved left pinky finger in a pinch point between the board and a steel pipe. The fingertip was amputated.

A cable installer at a residential single family home hooked his ladder over a metal strand line, climbed up the ladder and hooked up his fall protection to the strand line and began diagnostics on the communications line. A splice on the strand line failed resulting in the ladder and the employee falling 18 feet to the concrete driveway below. The employee sustained fractures to the elbow and pelvis.

An employee was climbing a 16-20 foot extension ladder to secure it. While stepping onto the roof to tie off the ladder, the ladder slipped and the employee fell. The employee landed on paver stones on a walkway and was hospitalized with a broken arm and leg.
An employee was lying on his back underneath a kitchen sink installing a laminate countertop and felt pain in the lower chest while pulling on the countertop.
An employee fell from a roof to the ground 12 feet below, suffering bruises to the heels, the left arm, and the wrist.
An employee's foot was run over and crushed by a telehandler.

An employee was refueling an excavator from a fuel cell located in the back of a pickup truck. When the employee was rolling up the fuel hose and cable, the excavator rotated counter-clockwise and crushed the employee's lower back/torso between the excavator and the pickup truck.

An employee was cutting plywood with a circular saw when it became stuck and kicked back, making contact with his left hand. The top portion of his left hand below the fingers and above the wrist was lacerated, as well as his left pinky finger below the knuckle.

An employee was using an angle grinder when he tripped on a sea wall grounding wire, causing the angle grinder to contact and lacerate his right knee as he fell to the ground. The angle grinder blade was unguarded at the time.
An employee was assaulted by an employee of another contractor, suffering a crushed esophagus, a shattered nose, and bruises to the face.
An employee was moving a stack of drywall that was leaning against a wall when the drywall fell onto his right leg breaking his tibia and fibula.
An employee was repairing plumbing under the crawl space of a residential dwelling when a spider bit the employee's abdomen, causing an infection that required hospitalization.
An employee fell from a dumpster rail to the ground, suffering a head laceration and fractures to the shoulders, breast plate, and spine. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was on the fourth floor of a building under construction. The employee was discussing getting welding leads down from up above to ground level. When the employee looked down to see where the welding cables would go, the wooden safety railing failed and the employee fell approximately 25 feet. The employee fractured their right arm, sternum, and two vertebrae in their back.
An employee was performing roofing work when he fell from elevation and fractured his arm, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was working in a 15-foot-deep foundation when a boulder from the perimeter rolled down and fell on the employee's lower right leg, causing muscle injury.
An employee was lifting a 100-pound CMU block while on a scaffold. The board he was walking on flipped over and he fell about 5 feet to the ground, suffering a broken left leg and ankle.
An employee was working from a baker scaffold, removing ceiling tiles. He fell 4 feet to the ground, breaking his shoulder.
An employee was getting some roofing material from the top of a pallet. As he stepped down, he twisted and broke his ankle, requiring hospitalization.
An employee sustained soft tissue damage to the upper left leg when he was caught underneath a trailer tire.
A skid steer machine's bucket was knocked loose from the machine and fell on an employee's foot, breaking it. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee had reached down to pick up debris from a milling operation. A dump truck rolled over his right hand as it backed up, causing compound fractures of two fingers.
An employee was working in a hoist way. The employee's hand was severely injured.

A partially assembled stair landing/post assembly was being hoisted when it shifted and the top of the landing rolled over. It hit an employee in the small of the back, on the left side, and knocked him down. He suffered a hematoma and was hospitalized.
A plumber was repairing a customer's cast iron stack pipe. As he lifted it to install the band connector, it slid down and amputated the tip of his right index finger.
An employee was stepping down a stepladder when she fell from the third step to the floor. Her right leg was broken below the knee, and she was hospitalized.
A wooden pole loosened as it was being pulled down and smashed an employee's left hand. One of the employee's fingertips was amputated, and another had the skin and flesh stripped to the bone.
On April 9, 2019, an employee was cutting a piece of 6" pipe with a demo saw.  The saw kicked back and cut the employee's face.
An employee was in a work zone flagging traffic. An automobile entered the work zone and struck the employee. The employee was hospitalized with a head injury and a broken leg.
An employee was framing a residential home when he fell approximately 4 feet off a step ladder to the ground, breaking his left leg and requiring surgery.
An employee was rolling up warning line on a roof when he fell through a skylight to the floor. His lower back was injured and he was hospitalized.
An employee was painting from a baker scaffold. He fell from the scaffold to the floor 1.5 feet below, suffering a tibia/fibula fracture and a fractured ankle.
An employee was installing Tyvek on a 7:12 pitch roof and fell about 12 feet to the ground, suffering fractures to both wrists and a broken vertebra. Fall protection was not being worn at the time.
An employee was diagnosing a water leak on an ice machine when the tip of his left index finger was cut off in a small hole on the machine.

An employee was holding the tag line for a debris bucket that was being lowered to the ground. The bucket caught the edge of a floor and tipped, spilling part of its contents onto the employee. He suffered fractured neck vertebrae and was hospitalized.
An employee was cleaning parts of a metal fabrication machine. His left little finger was caught between moving rollers and amputated.
An employee was climbing down an extension ladder set up on a telephone pole. He fell about 20 feet to the ground, suffering broken ribs and a broken shoulder.
An employee was preparing to install an electrical conduit on a switch gearbox when he fell about 7 1/2 feet to the floor. He suffered nine broken ribs on the left side of his body.
An employee was fixing low-voltage wires in a store's garden center when he fell 25 feet to the ground, suffering a broken back and brain hemorrhaging.
Employees were drilling a water line/pipe when a sling, used to stabilize the pipe, caught an employee's arm and shoulders. His hands and arms were broken.
An employee was at the top of a ladder changing light bulbs and fell onto a music stand, which impaled the employee and punctured a lung.
An employee was about 6 feet up an 8-foot ladder, fishing wire down a wall. He fell from the ladder to the carpeted floor, breaking his right leg.

An employee was performing putty work and final painting work when he reached for a water bottle. After drinking from the water bottle he began to vomit. The employee had ingested paint thinner and was hospitalized.
A tree rolled onto an employee's legs. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was standing on a disassembled section of scaffolding frame, which was lying flat on the ground connected to a second frame. The second frame was hit with a hammer to dislodge it from the first, and the employee lost his balance and fell backwards. His right jaw and head area struck an I-beam and his jaw was fractured.
An employee was cleaning out concrete at the bottom of a concrete pump hopper. The pump turned over and caught his fingers, causing partial amputations to two of them. He was hospitalized.
An employee was refueling a gas pump when it caught fire. The employee's legs and arms were burned.
An employee was walking on a second-floor joist when he fell, breaking his right hip.
An employee was cleaning a linear saw using compressed air. The saw activated and the employee suffered lacerations to the right hand.
An employee was loading brush into the bucket of a backhoe. His left ring finger was caught between the bucket and a limb of the brush, resulting in a partial amputation.

A roofer was carrying a box of nails when he fell off of the roof of a one-story house and landed on the ground. He sustained a broken left arm and left pelvis and was hospitalized. A safety lanyard was not connected at the time of the incident.

Several employees were riding in a flatbed truck. The truck had to swerve to avoid a barrel in the road and an employee fell out onto the street. The employee suffered a laceration to the right ear, a broken bone in the right ear area, and lost consciousness. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was replacing insulated roof panels when his right foot slipped causing him to fall forward into an open space  He fell approximately 10 feet from the roof to the floor of the building striking a wall section and the edge of the stone fire place. The employee sustained contusions and strains to the back and neck and left side of his body. The employee was wearing a harness, but it was not tied off to an anchor point.
After test leads were attached to an energized cable, a flash burned an employee's face and hands. The employee was hospitalized.
Employee was on a 6-foot stepladder hanging cables. The employee fell off the ladder, striking his head on the floor 4-5 feet below. The employee suffered a skull fracture and soft tissue trauma.

An employee was using a circular handsaw to cut a wooden board at ground level. The blade ricocheted and cut the toes on the employee's right foot, causing an amputation. The safety guard was not in place at the time.
An employee was cutting metal with scissors. The metal cut his right hand and he was hospitalized.
An employee was taping a wall for painting when plastic became tangled in his stilts. He fell, suffering two broken elbows.
An employee was climbing a fiberglass extension ladder when it gave way. He fell to the ground, breaking his right kneecap.

On April 17, 2019, an employee was helping to fix an issue with the pipe system. The employee removed a hose from the boiler truck used in the pipe lining process and hot water sprayed out, burning the employee's legs. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was cleaning a paint gun with xylene. He had removed the gun's spray tip when pressurized xylene sprayed out, lacerating and injecting his hand. He was hospitalized with hand swelling and a potential infection.

An employee was attempting to land a pallet jack on an outrigger landing platform (Level 12). The employee was signaling the crane and controlling the load at the same time. His hand was in the open slot at the end of the forks where the wheel retracts into the fork. The wheels were not powered down, but extended because of gravity. As the load was brought down, the wheels retracted into the opening, pinching the employee's fingers. The index and middle fingers were severed at the first knuckle.

An employee had been trimming logs with a chain saw when he started to move to a new location. His left foot became caught under a log as he stepped over it, causing him to fall forward and fracture his left leg.
An employee was welding when the welding hose blew out, causing third degree burns to his lower abdomen.

An employee was removing wooden forms from 30-foot-tall poured concrete cylinders at a building site. The employee's right hand was caught between the wooden panels of two forms, and the employee's ring fingertip was amputated.

An employee was handing masonry blocks to another employee on a scaffold when the employee walked backwards off the scaffold and fell approximately 5 feet onto a concrete floor. The employee suffered a broken right arm, requiring surgery, and a fractured right hip.

An employee was climbing down from a scaffold. The locking key to the midrail came undone, and the employee lost his grip on the rail (which was wet) and fell. He landed on the ground about 12 feet below, suffering cracked ribs and bruised lungs.

An employee was helping his work crew perform maintenance on furnace slide valves. While the valve components and hardware were being disassembled, the employee's right middle finger was caught between the flange's slide plate and blind. The tip was amputated.

An HVAC service technician was responding to a service call at a customer's residential location. The employee was investigating a portion of the HVAC system in the backyard and fell from the elevated deck to the unpaved ground below. The employee suffered contusions and lacerations to the spleen and lower arms that required hospitalization.
An employee was connecting pipe when his left middle finger was pinched between a fixed ladder and a swivel pipe component, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee's head contacted a nail gun, which fired a nail into his head, puncturing his skull.

Employees were installing floor decking on the second floor deck when one of the employees fell approximately 14 feet through the roof, landing on the concrete ground. The employee suffered head trauma.

An employee was on a scaffold performing overhead demolition of ductwork when a piece of duct swung loose and knocked the employee off the scaffold. The employee fell approximately 5 feet onto the concrete floor, suffering broken ribs.
An employee was operating a bar bending machine to bend rebar when their fingertip was amputated. The machine was unguarded at the time.

On April 17, 2019, at about 7:50 a.m., an employee was working on a roof measuring a section to be cut out and replaced when the employee fell through the roof inside the building. The employee was hospitalized with head and spinal injuries.
A valve assembly separated and a piece hit an employee's leg, breaking it.

An employee was using a handheld propane torch to heat the end of another tool. The employee turned the propane torch off and set it on a truck. The truck caught on fire. The employee and another employee tried to suffocate the fire, then used fire extinguishers to put the fire out. Both employees sustained burns to the right arm and face. One employee also sustained a burn to the back. They were both hospitalized.

An employee was helping to move a piece of casing off a guide wire from a rig. The casing was on a pipe rack. As the pipe was pushed to move it out of the guide wire, the pipe rolled and caught his right hand, pinching his middle finger and resulting in partial amputation of the fingertip.
An employee was re-roofing a commercial building when the employee fell to the ground, suffering a head injury. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was changing out a compressor at a store. While sweating the lines, the pressure built up in the line and the oil shot out along with flames, causing second degree burns on both arms from his fingertips to the elbows and a slight burn on his lower abdomen.
An employee was on a roof, painting the exterior of a garage. He fell to the ground and suffered a broken hip.
An employee was working on a seamer when it rolled over his right thumb, causing a partial amputation. The seamer was unguarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was helping to remove a large, damaged 30-foot-high by 4-foot-wide insulated metal building panel from a structure using a mobile telehandler equipped with a vacuum attachment. The telehandler unit retracted the loosened panel from the structure and set it on the ground with its small dimension (4 feet) on the ground. At this point, the panel was standing 30 feet straight into the air when it detached quickly from the vacuum and fell on the injured employee, breaking his right femur.

An employee was on the ground spreading dirt/gravel with a metal concrete rake when they slipped on loose dirt and fell onto the rake. The employee suffered a rib fracture and a contusion on the spleen.

An employee was operating a skid steer loader, which struck the leftover stub of a basketball pole. The employee was jolted forward and struck his head on a rollover protection bar. He suffered a broken neck and a cut forehead and was hospitalized.

An employee was walking by a pipe that was placed on a stand to be unclogged of liquid asphalt. The heated asphalt bubbled out of the pipe and onto the employee as he walked by, burning his arms and legs.
An employee was removing a bolt from a beam when the beam shifted, crushing his hand. He sustained a broken ring finger below the first joint and a broken index metacarpal.
The injured employee was helping to load a toolbox onto a trailer. As employees were lifting the toolbox, the rigging slipped, amputating the tip of the injured employee's right pinky finger.
A maintenance employee was using an air-powered grease gun to grease some floating mooring bits when it injected grease underneath his thumb.
A truss fell on an employee, breaking his leg. He was hospitalized.
An employee fell from an 8-foot ladder and hit his head on the ground.

An employee was using loading equipment to install a metal guardrail on a bridge. He was jockeying the rail into place when his right index finger was caught between the guardrail and the equipment, resulting in a finger amputation.

A 3-foot, 1,500- to 2,000-pound bucket  became detached and fell onto a spool, then rotated and flipped over on top of an employee, breaking the employee's skull and a vertebra in the employee's back.
An employee was cutting plywood concrete forms. As he was picking up a piece of wood, the sawblade amputated his left little finger.

An employee was about to climb down from a scaffold when he fell onto a concrete slab 6 feet below. He landed on his shoulder and head, his hard hat cracking on the ground; he suffered bleeding to the left ear and a concussion, as well as bruising to the left shoulder. He was hospitalized.

An employee had his left hand on the concrete floor while installing a vapor barrier on exterior walls. A conduit pipe hanging above fell out of its fitting approximately 12" and hit his left index finger, cutting off approximately 1/2" - 3/4" of the tip.

An employee was working inside a single-phase pad-mounted transformer, pulling wires to energize street lights. A cordless drill that was being used to tighten a lug created a phase-to-phase contact inside the transformer, resulting in an arc flash. The employee suffered second-degree burns to the face and torso.

An employee was attaching a detonation cord to a power source when a static charge set off a length of the detonation cord with three charges attached. Two employees were struck by multiple explosive fragments in the arms and legs, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was on break in his personal truck when he shot himself in the right leg with his personal gun.

An employee was installing roofing material about 7 or 8 feet from the edge of the flat roof of a one-story residential house. He stepped on an insulation board and lost his balance, falling 8 feet to the concrete patio below and fracturing his left elbow. He was hospitalized.
An employee was working at a hotel under construction, standing on a ladder while pulling wiring. The employee fell and suffered a broken right knee. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell approximately 9 feet from a porch roof to the ground below while installing a metal roof. The employee was hospitalized with tailbone and vertebrae fractures.

An employee was assembling a parapet with a nail gun when she attempted to move by sliding. Her finger was on the trigger when it hit her leg, causing the nail gun to fire a nail into her upper thigh.
An employee was putting an off-road vehicle back in a barn. The vehicle hit a cattle gap, went airborne, and flipped over. The employee suffered head trauma and a broken left arm.

An employee was reaching out the front of a boom lift cab to remove something on the hood of the machine when his leg hit the controls, thus lowering the boom on his fingers at a pinch point. His right ring and pinky fingers were smashed, resulting in medical amputations of the fingertips.
An employee was using a saw to cut stakes for concrete forms when the saw slipped and struck the employee's leg, causing a laceration.
An employee was attempting to shut down the power service to a pole when he made contact with a live wire and received electrical burns to the left hand.
An employee working in a road construction zone was struck by a motor vehicle that entered the work zone, suffering a broken leg.
An employee was doing a patch repair on a pipe and experienced an inhalation reaction to the epoxy material in the patch while heating it.
An employee lacerated three fingers while operating a circular saw and was hospitalized.

An employee was working inside a 14-foot excavation laying pipeline when a clog of dirt (football size) hit his shoulder. He turned around and ran, then hit his head on an excavator bucket. He was hospitalized with a severe head injury and concussion.
An employee was climbing down a 10-foot stepladder when it shifted. He fell about 5 feet to the ground below, breaking his left wrist.
While standing near a mini-excavator, an employee was struck by the track of the machine, suffering leg and foot fractures that required hospitalization.
An employee was operating a side boom on a hill, when it fell, rolled twice, and ejected the employee onto the ground. The employee sustained a broken skull and cervical injuries.
An employee was handling a live ground wire and suffered burns to his finger and the palm of his hand.
An employee was replacing switch gear in the basement of a building. The main breaker failed to trip resulting in an arc flash. The employee suffered burns to the torso and upper extremities.
An employee was unloading a mini-excavator from a trailer and broke a bone in their arm.
While unloading a tractor-trailer, an employee fell off the flatbed trailer platform to the ground. The employee suffered a broken skull and possible brain bleeding.
An employee fell off a 16-foot ladder to the concrete below, suffering a broken right ankle.

The injured employee was installing metal cap facia using a 20-foot extension ladder at a residence. The ladder was set up on top of gravel and shifted laterally. The employee fell approximately 13 feet to the ground breaking the left humerus.

A journeyman iron worker was working on top of a piece of iron to cut it loose from the rigging. The piece rolled causing the journeyman to fall off the piece and strike his ribs on the connecting point.  The employee suffered two fractured ribs.

An employee was on a roof behind a parapet wall, guiding a rough-terrain forklift as it raised a trash bin to the roof. The bin crushed the employee's right middle finger against the wall. She was hospitalized and the fingertip was medically amputated.
An employee was dropping equipment off an 8-foot roof when he lost his balance and jumped to the concrete ground approximately 11 feet below. The employee suffered fractured heels and ankle.

On 4/29/2019, an employee was conducting landscaping operations at a street corner. He pushed a tree branch out of his way, and it snapped back and struck his face. A splinter pierced the left upper cheek just below the eye. Safety glasses were worn at the time.
An employee bent over to hook up the truck to a fire hydrant to load water. While bending over, he herniated a disc in his back.
An employee was on the ground handling a cable attached to a crane. The crane touched a power line and the employee was shocked.

An employee was spraying walls and ceilings with paint. While trying to fix the tip of the paint sprayer, the air valve trigger was pressed and the employee suffered a small cut on the left side of the thumb. Paint got inside the wound and the employee was hospitalized for an infection requiring surgery.

An employee was attempting to operate a newly installed dock leveler. It was not operating properly. He thought it was a pin on the leveler that was causing the hold up. The maintenance pin for the leveler is located underneath it and can only be accessed from the underside of the leveler.  He went underneath the leveler to release the pin. When the pin was released, the leveler fell on top of him breaking his leg and ribs and fracturing his back.

The injured employee was on a ladder and was holding two wires out of the way for the lead technician. When the wires were energized, the injured employee was shocked. The employee sustained an electric shock to the right hand and a dislocated shoulder when he slid off the ladder.

An employee was removing roofing material from a retail store front canopy. The employee was walking on plywood that had been placed over the support braces. The employee stepped into an area that did not have plywood and fell to the ground. His fall was partially arrested by his safety harness. The employee suffered fractures to the face, nose and right arm.

An employee was using a table saw to cut wooden shingles. The shingles kicked back and the employee's hand contacted the blade resulting in a laceration to the left index finger. The fingertip was medically amputated.
An employee was disconnecting the rigging on a 6x6 precast panel and his right middle finger was caught between the cable and the anchor resulting in a partial amputation.
An employee was descending an 8-foot stepladder after doing a paint touch-up above a garage door when he missed the last step and fell to the floor, fracturing his hip.
An employee was working from a step-ladder approximately 14 feet above grade to paint a ceiling. The employee missed a rung and fell to the ground resulting in fractures to the face and wrist.

An employee was attaching sandbag straps to a lifting chain hook in preparation for lifting a bag when the employee's right thumb was pinched between the strap and chain hook. The tip of the thumb was amputated.
An employee was ascending a ladder and fell on his right side striking a metal grate. The employee suffered a torn tendon on his right arm.
An employee was sweeping and picking up construction trash when the employee started having cramps and nausea due to possible dehydration and heat exhaustion.

An employee was in the trench putting a gasket on the previous pipe joint when an excavator  started lifting the cut joint. The pipe swung like a pendulum as it was lifted and smashed the employee's left-hand fingers between the swinging pipe and the existing pipe. Two fingers were surgically amputated to the first knuckle.

An employee was attempting to lift a manual pallet jack up 18" with another employee. When setting the pallet jack down on the concrete walkway, the employee's left ring finger was crushed by the bottom of the pallet jack causing a fingertip amputation.

An employee was mopping hot tar on a roof when his foot stuck to the roof. As he tried to move he fell and his arms landed in the mop bucket which contained hot tar. The employee sustained burns to the left arm and right hand requiring hospitalization.

On May 3, 2019, an employee was placing pipe in a trench and was working in the vicinity of an excavator. A hydraulic line on the excavator ruptured causing the bucket to swing down and strike the employee. The employee sustained a fractured right arm and kidney damage.
Employee was on a section of 7-foot scaffold doing propeller repair. The scaffold shifted causing the employee to fall to the ground and fracture the left arm.
An employee fell from a 6-foot scaffold and hit his forehead on a concrete block. He sustained a head injury.

An employee was unloading carpet from a truck's trailer using a forklift. When the truck rolled forward away from the dock, the forklift fell off the dock and the employee was thrown from the forklift to the ground, injuring her left-upper back and two right-hand fingers.
On May 1, 2019, an employee's thumb was amputated by machinery.

An employee was reroofing a flat roof of a single story dwelling. The employee went to get a chalk line from the ground. He then climbed back up the ladder and knelt down on the edge of the roof to snap the chalk line. The roof gave way and he fell 8 feet 4 inches onto a pile of landscaping posts and sustained fractured ribs. The employee was wearing fall protection, but it was not connected at the time of the fall.

An employee was installing metal edging on roof fascia while working from an extension ladder when he lost balance and fell approximately 18 feet onto a pile of rocks. The employee was hospitalized with a broken pelvis and hip, and also sustained injuries to his knee, elbow, and heel.

Two employees were preparing to pour concrete in the tie beams. Both employees were holding the concrete pump hose when the hose kinked and swung knocking both employees off the tie beam onto the plywood floor. One employee was hospitalized for a concussion. The second employee was hospitalized for a fractured tailbone.
An employee was walking toward an excavator to get the operator's attention when he fell in dirt. The excavator then rolled over his left leg and broke his tibia.

An employee fell from the edge of the third floor of the building to the ground while unloading HVAC fan coils from a forklift basket resulting in a dislocated shoulder, two broken ribs and a bruised lung. Fall protection was not worn at the time.

On May 3, 2019, at 5:15 p.m., an employee had finished working for the day and began walking up a slippery grassy incline to his truck. He slipped and fell fracturing the right ankle. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was hitting a concrete hose with a hammer to unjam a plug in the line. The plug released and the pressure in the hose caused the hose to whip around and strike the employee in the leg breaking his tibia and fibula.
An employee slipped while working on an extension ladder and fell six feet to the ground. The employee suffered a left knee injury and was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting an 18" pipe with a demo saw when the pipe kicked back. The employee was hospitalized with a cut on the chest that required stitches.

A maintenance employee was working alone on May 4, 2019. The employee may have been performing a sanding operation in an office and fallen from a 6-foot step ladder. He was found with head trauma and was hospitalized.
An employee was siphoning curing compound and inadvertently swallowed some, causing him to vomit. The employee was hospitalized with mouth and stomach pain.
An employee was helping to lift a plate using a chain when the chain snapped and caused an amputation to the employee's finger.
An employee was cutting conduit with a battery-operated band saw. The band saw jammed and kicked back amputating the employee's left index finger to the nail bed.

A driver was tightening a strap on his trailer to secure a load. The ratchet came loose and flew off the trailer hitting the driver in the mouth. The driver sustained an injured lip, broken mouth, and broken teeth.
An employee fell from a ladder which resulted in a fractured left wrist, right elbow, and possibly fractured ribs.

An employee was walking during a demolition job when he tripped and fell onto the steel decking of the working surface he was on. He sustained several fractured ribs on the right side of the body, an injury to his right lung, and a laceration to the liver.
An employee was inspecting carriers traveling down the conveyor system and was walking over a mezzanine when his right foot slipped and was caught and amputated in the conveyor rollers.
An employee walking across an existing metal roof stepped through a skylight and fell 20 feet to the floor below. The employee sustained two broken arms.
An employee was dismantling an engineered scaffold and fell approximately 57 feet. The employee was hospitalized for compound fractures to his legs and ankles and two fractured ribs.
An employee was walking down the stairs at a new construction site when he tripped and fell. The employee suffered broken ribs and a broken left arm.
Two employees were replacing a 4 x 8 floor tile. The floor tile was on pedestals when the injured employee's finger was caught below the tile, resulting in an amputation.

On 5/7/2019, an employee was working on the ground level collecting falling brush from a tree and disposing of it in a wood chipper. A second employee was performing tree pruning and utility line clearance operations in a utility truck bucket approximately 45 feet high. The second employee began to cut a tree lead, approximately 15 feet in length, with a chainsaw. The tree lead then fell and struck the first employee's face, causing nose and facial lacerations, fractures, and contusions.

A temporary employee had been cutting a section of a catwalk with a torch. After completing the cutting, the catwalk made a twisting motion and caused a light pole on the far end of the catwalk to fall and strike the employee. The employee sustained a puncture wound to his left upper cheek and a laceration on his back and was hospitalized due to symptoms of a concussion.
An employee was cutting wood blocks with a circular saw and lacerated their left ring finger. The finger was medically amputated at the first joint.
An employee was working inside a bucket truck replacing old power lines with new power lines. An arc occurred between the two lines and one employee was burned on his stomach and left arm.
An employee was carrying insulation to a second floor when he injured his lower back.

An employee was on a roof inspecting network hardware and cabling. As the employee transitioned from the roof edge onto a ladder, he slipped and fell 25-30 feet to the ground below and suffered a broken left leg and ankle.

An employee was painting from a scissor lift and fell 30 feet between the platform and the middle guardrail to the ground below. The employee sustained a fractured hip. The employee's harness was not tied off to the equipment at the time of the incident.
An employee fell from a 6-foot ladder and suffered a wrist fracture requiring hospitalization.

An employee was on a ladder that was leaning against a pole to disconnect cable TV from a client's house. The pole the ladder was leaning on broke at the base and the employee and the ladder fell to the ground. The employee sustained four broken ribs and a bruised lung.
An employee was working near a backhoe and was struck by the rig of the backhoe. The employee suffered a leg and hip injury and was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting a 2x4 wood stud with a hand-held saw. The blade contacted his left hand and amputated two fingers and lacerated a third finger.
An employee tripped and fell to the ground suffering injury to the right shoulder and elbow.
An employee had been walking on the flat roof of a school when he fell approximately 20 feet through a hole to the ground below. He was hospitalized with a fractured pelvis and fractured ribs.

An employee was installing a downspout from a ladder. The ladder was leaning on the side wall of a two-story house. The employee dropped the downspout and tried to catch it with his foot. The employee lost balance and tried to get his foot on the ladder, but missed the rung. The employee fell 12 - 15 feet from the ladder to the mulch bed resulting in fractures to his left arm, the first two left ribs and left scapula. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was disassembling a scaffold and fell approximately 7 feet from the scaffold to the ground resulting in hospitalization for fractured ribs and an injury to the left side of his head.
An employee was climbing a fixed ladder when he slipped and fell about 8 feet to the ground. The employee suffered a fractured left arm.
An employee working on a metal roof fell 20 feet through an opening to the interior concrete surface below. He was hospitalized with a fractured wrist and two compressed fractures in his back.
An employee was installing an exterior aluminum trim when the employee fell from a ladder jack scaffold to the ground, suffering a broken left wrist and fractured pelvis.

The injured employee was watching another employee utilize a drill reamer. The injured employee slipped or fell into the hole being reamed and contacted the drill reamer. The employee suffered a foot amputation.
An employee was working overhead and brazing 4" copper when a galvanized hanger was heated and he inhaled zinc. He later experienced respiratory distress and was hospitalized.

An employee was cleaning out water and debris around column footers in preparation for filling with concrete. The employee experienced skin irritation to the hands including discoloration suggesting possible infection.

An employee was assisting in the removal of a trench box from an excavation. The employee noted that a rigging hook was stuck on a corner of the trench box and went to unlatch it. At the same time, the excavator operator lifted the rigging and the employee's middle finger was caught between the rigging and the trench box resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was climbing out of the lower section of a crane cab when he grabbed a strap from the door for assistance and the strap broke, causing him to fall to the ground. He fractured his femur.
An employee was climbing down a concrete column form and fell. The employee suffered a dislocated shoulder and a laceration.

An employee was on a scaffold shaking mortar when the employee stepped backward and fell approximately 20 feet between two boards to the ground below. The employee suffered a collapsed lung, fractured vertebrae, and a skull contusion.

Two employees were preparing to stop working for the day and had started to lower the scissor lift to the ground. Both employees were tied off with their fall arrest systems. A gust of wind caused the trusses on the building to fall. It resulted in a domino effect and the last truss struck the scissor lift that was approximately 16 feet high, causing it to tip over while the employees were in it. One employee sprained his ankle and was treated and released that day. The other employee suffered injury to both elbows that required surgery and a laceration on the forehead that required stitches.  He was hospitalized.

An employee was connecting a vibratory hammer using a 2-inch, 10-foot choker. The employee contacted the point of operation at the sheave and cable and their right ring finger was amputated below the nail.
An employee was hit in the head while racking and was hospitalized with a head injury.

An employee was operating a scissor lift, traveling down a ramp in a parking garage. The lift started slipping due to the flooring conditions and a 9-degree grade. The scissor lift slid until it hit a curb at the bottom of the parking garage. When the lift hit the curb it stopped and the employee was ejected onto the concrete floor. The employee sustained 4-5 broken ribs, a fractured tail bone, a contusion to the right side of his head, and a lacerated liver.

An employee was making a key way in a concrete platform when he stepped on a 3 X 4 bracing that gave way. He then fell about 24 feet to the next 3 X 4 bracing and broke eight ribs, requiring hospitalization.

On May 13, 2019, the injured employee was performing demo work with a pry bar in one hand while his other hand was leaning against a door jam. Another employee closed the door causing and pinched the injured employee's finger between the door and the door frame resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was standing on top of a string line when he lost his footing, twisted, and dislocated his hip.

An employee was picking up rigging shackles at the foundation base of a purposed cell tower. A climber on the tower had a tool pouch with a wrench that came loose off of his belt. The tool bag and metal wrench fell and struck the employee in the face, lacerating his upper lip and breaking his jaw and teeth.

An employee was using a scraper to clean debris from an asphalt paver when his safety vest became caught on the paver and he was pulled in toward the auger. He was hospitalized with second and third degree burns from the mid-torso to the armpit. The paver was running at the time of the incident.
An employee was operating a scrapper on the side of the road and began to feel unwell. He was hospitalized for heat stress.
An employee was starting to do work on a mobile scaffold when the scaffold fell over. The employee fell on a bench, suffering broken ribs and a collapsed lung.

An employee was hauling cardboard to a dumpster on an industrial forklift. He reached to open the gate while on the lift. The gate stopped when he was trying to drive through it and his hand was smashed and a finger was broken between the forklift and the gate.
An employee was struck by a rail buggy while working on a gas pipe line, suffering a crushed ankle.

An employee was sliding a heavy piece of stone when it slipped down and pinched his left index finger between the stone and a meter cover on the ground. His left index finger was smashed, resulting in an amputation.
An employee was using a hand saw to cut a piece of 1 x 6 fence picket when the saw cut his left middle finger, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was pumping down an existing refrigeration line set in a mechanical room when there was a release of liquid refrigerant. While working to stop the release, the employee received burns to the right hand, requiring hospitalization.

The injured employee was standing on a flat bed truck reading labels on parts to another employee who was on the ground. The injured employee put their foot on an interior support column weighing 826 pounds that was stacked four high and the stack shifted. The employee jumped to the ground and the column fell on top of him. The employee was hospitalized for broken ribs, a punctured lung, a punctured liver and internal bleeding.

An employee was using a chain come-a-long to move a boiler down the steps into a building. The neutral lever hit a solid surface and disengaged the come-a-long. As the chain began moving freely the employee's finger became caught in the sprocket of the come-a-long resulting in the amputation of the left ring finger.
An employee was installing lights in a deli area from an 8-foot ladder when the ladder slipped and he fell to ground, fracturing both ankles.

An employee was stripping a wire at a job site when he lacerated his wrist or arm and went to get a bandage out of his truck. He then passed out and hit his head on the truck or ground, sustaining head injuries.
An employee was trying to nail a rafter while standing on a joist. He was stepping onto the wall and slipped, falling 10 to 12 feet to the ground. He suffered a fractured arm and back soreness.

An employee was transitioning from a forklift platform to a roof when the employee fell approximately 18 feet from the roof to the ground, suffering a dislocated right wrist and a compression fracture in the back.

An employee was using a chop saw to cut pieces of wood. He made a cut with the chop saw and moved back to his workstation with the piece of wood. He went to make an additional cut. The chop saw blade was still spinning from the previous cut when his left hand contacted the moving blade, causing a laceration between the index finger and the thumb.
An employee was climbing a 20-foot ladder while transporting roofing materials when the ladder slipped and the employee fell, landing on an air conditioner unit and suffering broken ribs.
An employee was opening the door to an asphalt truck when it exploded, causing burns to both arms and his chest, neck, and face.
An employee was on the third floor decking and reached down to pick up his gloves and fell to the second floor decking injuring his chest and back.
Two employees were carrying rebar. One employee lost balance and fell onto a stack of rebar fracturing their left leg.
An employee fell off a ladder to the ground and broke a leg.

An employee was using abrasive blasting equipment as part of the fabrication process for a steel tubular rack. The employee's left hand suffered an abrasion that required hospitalization after it was struck by the blasting media.
An employee was rigging and walking around a construction site when he became ill and required hospitalization for heat exhaustion.

An employee was driving a utility terrain vehicle (UTV) and struck some 4-inch PVC pipes laying on the ground. The employee lost control of UTV and as he was about to be ejected he grabbed the rear view mirror causing it to break and lacerate his left index and middle fingers.
An employee was rotating a crane when the crane tipped over. The employee jumped off the crane and fractured a leg upon impact with the ground.
While working on a platform lift installing electric service an employee was electrically shocked. The employee then fell 18 feet from the lift to the ground and suffered a broken ankle.

An employee was helping a mechanic install a boom on a pipelayer. They were trying to pin the block when the block caught the employee's left pinky finger between the boom and the block, resulting in a finger amputation behind the nail.

An employee was addressing an alignment issue with the metal trim at the end of the conveyor. After making the adjustment, the employee's right hand was caught in the moving conveyor belt. The employee's pinky finger was fractured and dislocated. The employee also sustained a laceration from the mid-pinky to the middle of his right palm.
An employee was performing roofing construction and fell through a skylight fracturing a hip and leg.

An electrician was in an elevated bucket truck utilizing a tie wire to tie a conductor. A live power line above the employee's head contacted his body and generated an arc flash. The employee suffered burns on his face, mid torso and his abdomen.
An employee was using a toe kick saw to cut flooring when it struck a nail and kicked back. The employee's fingers were caught in the blade resulting in amputation of his right index finger.

An employee was working from a fiberglass ladder to install an electrical conductor on a 120v circuit when he received an electrical shock, became startled, dismounted the ladder, and fell on the concrete floor. He fractured his hip and pelvis. The power to the conductor was not shut off at the time of the incident.

Two employees were operating remote-controlled guillotine concrete breakers. The breakers have steel plates that come down and break the roadway concrete for removal. The injured employee's breaker was not operating and he got between the two units. When the second unit moved, the injured employee was pinned between the two breaker units resulting in a fractured left fibula.

An employee was working from a ladder cutting an old pipe. When the pipe was completely cut through, it fell and struck the ladder, knocking the employee to the floor. He broke his femur and was hospitalized.
An employee was erecting a scaffold and fell approximately eight feet to the ground when a plank broke. The employee suffered a chipped bone in his shoulder.
An employee had climbed a ladder and unsecured the top of the ladder from the building so that it could be lowered when he fell from the ladder to the ground below fracturing a hip, ankle and heel.

An employee was installing roof decking and fell approximately 20 feet through the roof, landing on the practice gym floor. The employee sustained fractures to both legs that required hospitalization.
An employee was setting up form work for concrete and was struck in the left eye by a tie bar.

Tri-axle dump trucks were importing stone to the worksite. After one of the trucks emptied its load the injured employee noticed stone on the tail of the body where the tailgate would close. The employee notified the driver who, again, raised and lowered the bed of the tri-axle to dislodge the debris. When the bed lowered the employee's left hand was caught in a pinch point between the truck body and the tailgate resulting in amputation of the middle and ring fingertips.
An employee was on a ladder reaching for a metal basket on a shelf when the employee fell to the concrete floor, suffering a head injury and broken ribs. The employee was hospitalized.

A diver was underwater cutting steel floor beams from an anchor span truss when the anchor span moved and pinched his hand between the previously cut lateral beam and the truss. The employee was trapped for a few minutes until the steel structures moved and released him, allowing him to surface. He suffered a right ring finger and pinky fingertip amputation, as well as a right middle finger laceration.
An employee was driving a utility terrain vehicle (UTV) to close the worksite gates. The UTV overturned and the employee was ejected from the vehicle. The employee suffered a broken nose.
An employee was fixing a garage door from an extension ladder when the employee fell approximately 14 feet to the ground, suffering wrist, ankle, and rib fractures.
On 5/20/2019, at 8:00 AM, an employee suffered a spiral fracture to his tibia and fibula while turning around.

On 5/20/2019, at approximately 10:00 a.m., an employee was helping another employee unload a large cylindrical item off of a trailer bed using nylon straps/slings. The object began to fall on one end, which pulled on the sling the first employee had wrapped around his arm. The force of the falling object caused the first employee to be pulled off of the ground, and he started to be pulled up and over the flatbed. His foot became caught on a gate, and his right femur became a fulcrum and was fractured.

Two employees were pulling a messenger cable from one utility pole to another when the messenger cable contacted an adjacent power line. Both employees suffered electrical burns to the hands and arm and were hospitalized.
A roofing employee fell 10 feet from a roof and was hospitalized for a back injury.
An employee slipped and fell off a utility truck while loading a drain pipe. The employee's head struck the concrete floor.

An employee was working in the field where a tornado had destroyed 4 to 5 substructures. The employee was marking lines with tape when a wire was freed and sprung up, striking and injuring the employee's back.
An employee was cutting pipe on a portable band saw and lacerated his left index finger. The finger was surgically amputated at the first knuckle.
An employee was removing the headpin from a high load scaffold (shoring system) when it fell on his left ring finger resulting in an open fracture and partial amputation.
An employee was shutting a garage door while carrying supplies when the employee's little finger was caught between door panels, resulting in a smashed finger and a possible amputation.
An employee walking on the job site slipped on a piece of cardboard and impacted the ground, fracturing his hip.

An employee was handling 6-inch PVC piping from a dewatering system that was full of water and heavy while trying to connect it to a pump. The pipe fell onto another pipe and the employee's right ring finger was pinched between the two pipes causing a partial amputation.
An employee was dismantling a shore tower at a construction site. The shore tower tipped over and struck the employee causing a compound fracture to the lower left leg.
An employee was struck by a reversing forklift and was hospitalized for a leg fracture.

An employee was climbing up a 24-foot extension ladder to paint the top portion of a building when the ladder slid backwards, causing him to fall on the concrete floor. He suffered fractured ribs and a fractured skull, as well as a broken back.
An employee was working on a ladder when a forklift struck the ladder causing the employee to fall and fracture the left wrist.
An employee was walking in the storage yard, tripped and fell to the ground. The employee was hospitalized with head and neck injuries.
An employee was hoisting loads. The load swung and the employee's hand was pinched between two loads. A finger was crushed and required surgery.
