An employee was operating a roller to compact dirt along the edge of an embankment in a construction zone. As the machine was backing up, the left rear tire ran off the edge of the embankment and the machine rolled down the embankment four to five feet and came to rest on its side. The employee was hospitalized for a rib fracture and a fractured pelvis.

A crew was applying hot asphalt to a built-up roof. They were tearing off the old roof and applying layers of asphalt and roofing materials to build the roof up at several layers. Asphalt is heated on the ground and built up through a pipe, put into a pie boy and a low-profile mop cart (400 to 500 degrees F), and applied to the roof with a mop that spreads hot asphalt at the right thickness. Because the asphalt cools quickly, the crew had to lay it out in a grid on rolls of felt. The injured employee was dry-setting some felt while others were mopping. He was walking backwards and bent over, rolling out the felt. As he walked back to the cart, someone called out to him. He then fell over the tires and back onto the hot cart, rolled to the side to try and avoid the hot asphalt, but tipped over the cart. His inside forearm and outside forearm came into contact with hot asphalt, suffering third degree burns.

An employee was caught between a counter weight and the crane outrigger when the outrigger slipped during crane assembly. The employee sustained approximately 4-5 fractured ribs and a fractured T12 vertebra.

An employee fell 10 feet from a bridge that was being demolished to the ground and suffered a left wrist fracture and a contusion on the left side of their body. Fall protection was not used at the time.

An employee and a second employee were cutting a log with a chain saw next to a storm water ditch. The employee walked to the downhill side of the log to position a 6-foot crowbar to assist with the log cutting. When he repositioned the crowbar, the log began to roll towards him and he fell into the ditch (approximately a 2-foot dry ditch). While he was in the ditch, another log rolled down. The second log crushed him and pinned him to the ground. He suffered a fractured pelvis and punctured bowel.
An employee was helping a crew perform a dry run for placing concrete slab when his hand was caught in a wrench drive shaft that engaged, causing a right hand laceration and finger dislocation.

An employee was bent over using a multi-purpose saw to cut a knee-high plank lagging board that was jammed. During the cut, the saw blade pinched, causing the blade to kick back and lacerate the employee's right shoulder.
An employee was climbing a ladder to adjust the tarp on his dump truck when he fell from the top of the dump truck to the ground, injuring his head and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was hospitalized after being struck by an airborne piece of wood. He sustained head and shoulder contusions.
An employee was performing her duties as a flagger when she was over by a forklift, fracturing her right leg and dislocating her pelvic bone.
An employee was cutting a concrete pipe with a saw when the saw kicked back and lacerated the employee's bicep.
An employee was disassembling a powered actuated tool that was jammed. As he attempted to put the barrel back on the device, it was actuated and the ram rod impaled his right hand.
An employee was installing duct work for an HVAC system when a 10-foot ladder slipped out from under the employee. The employee fell, breaking four ribs and lacerating a heel.

An employee was ripping plywood with a circular saw and prepping it to attach sheet rock when the saw hit a knot hole and bucked, landing on the employee's left hand and amputating the middle and ring fingers.

An employee was landing steel decking. A bar joist where the steel was being landed gave way causing the employee to ride the decking 25 feet to the ground. The employee suffered a cracked sternum and a broken rib.
An employee was using a circular saw to trim a wood frame. The blade slipped and severely lacerated the employee's index finger.
An employee was walking to pick up tools on the 14th floor when he slipped on the wet floor and fell into a metal stud causing a laceration to the left hand/wrist.
An employee was grinding stainless steel shim packs. The grinder kicked back and struck the employee's left hand causing a laceration to the index finger.

An employee was helping a drill rig operator and was cleaning out a pinhole when the pin was removed, causing the drill rig bar to raise and pin the employee's finger between the pinhole and the rig bar. The employee's left index finger was completely amputated at the distal phalanx joint.

Two employees were coming down a ladder when one slipped and started to fall. He grabbed the other employee in an attempt to stop himself and pulled him down with him to the concrete floor. The first employee suffered bruising to the ribs, shoulder, and neck. The second employee suffered a fractured wrist and pelvis.
An employee was helping to move floor tiles when the tiles struck and fractured the employee's foot.
An employee was using a miter saw when the blade cut the employee's left index finger, resulting in a medical finger amputation.

Two employees were working from an aerial lift about 10 feet off the ground. One employee was taking off a bracket to remove an overhead wood platform. The platform fell and pinned the other employee's pinky finger against the lift's rail resulting in the amputation of the employee's pinky finger.
An employee was working on a ladder when the ladder's foot shifted on loose soil, causing the employee to fall 8 feet off the ladder. He fractured and dislocated his left ankle, requiring surgery.
An employee was descending a loader and fell fracturing his hip.
An employee lost his balance and fell 8 feet from a residential flat roof to the grass/ground below, suffering a compound fracture of the tibia and a fractured tailbone.
An employee was connecting a water pump on a truck when the truck driver pulled forward, running over and fracturing the employee's right foot.
An employee was nailing siding on a building with a nail gun in a lift. The gun shot him in the lower chest and upper stomach.

An employee was working on a scaffold 3 feet off the ground when the employee lost footing and slipped, causing the employee's arm to come down onto the frame of the scaffold. The underside of the employee's arm caught the scaffold pin, causing a 3- to 4-inch laceration that required sutures and hospitalization.
A temporary employee was running a spot welding machine when it was activated via the foot pedal. The machine then cut his right index finger at the first knuckle.
Two employees were in a scissor lift removing a brick wall using a cutoff saw. The saw bucked and lacerated the left forearm of the second employee.

An employee was working at a new home construction site on a ladder, lost his balance and fell to the concrete floor below. The employee fractured the right wrist and had pain in the lower back and hip.
An employee was cutting a steel beam on the 11th floor. As the employee was relocating the steel beam, it slipped and amputated a portion of his right index finger.
A roofer felt dizzy and nauseous. He was hospitalized for heat related injuries.
An employee was cutting a piece of aluminum with a chop saw, which caused an amputation to his left index finger.
An employee was moving a gas meter post to a truck, tripped and fell. The post landed onto his left hand and fractured three fingers.
A Ramco employee was directing a dump truck into position at a worksite when a pickup truck backed over the employee breaking both legs.

On June 4, 2019, a crew was installing fiber across a railroad crossing. A train came through and snagged the fiber. The fiber caught an employee in the neck area and the employee was thrown to the ground. The employee sustained cuts to the head and neck and was hospitalized.
Wire wrapped around a bulldozer operator's ankle, breaking it.
On 6/04/2019, an employee was cleaning debris off the roof of a residential property and fell off the roof. He was hospitalized for injuries to his head and left arm.
An employee's feet were crushed by a mud bin.
A lineman was working in an aerial lift when a leaking, broken hydraulic line injected fluid into his hand. He was hospitalized.

An employee was on a scaffold performing stucco work at a one-story residence and fell approximately 8 feet striking his forehead on the face of the building. The employee was hospitalized for abrasions to his forehead.

An employee was on a 24-foot extension ladder when the ladder's metal feet slid on the smooth concrete floor and the employee fell about 8 feet to the floor. In striking the floor and the ladder, he suffered a broken wrist.
An employee was moving a pneumatic chain saw. When the employee picked the saw up, it struck another employee, causing lacerations below the shin.

An employee was confirming measurements on the fascia/soffits. While dismounting the ladder, he lost balance, caught his foot on the front rail of the ladder, and fell onto metal cutting shears that impaled his right side. He suffered injury to his kidney, liver and colon.
An employee was cutting a steel irrigation pipe with a powered concrete saw. The saw kicked back and lacerated the employee's face and neck.

An employee was stepping from an interstitial concrete landing 10 feet above the floor onto a 16-foot fiberglass A-frame ladder. He had one foot on the interstitial landing and one foot on the ladder when the ladder tipped sideways and he fell 10 feet to floor below. He fractured his left heel bone and left L4 vertebra.
An employee was resetting a breaker on an electric motor when an electrical arc occurred resulting in burns to the employee's right ear, right hand, thumb, and index finger.

An employee was picking up an electrical box to install it. The box slipped and when the employee went to grab it his right hand went inside of the box and contacted a thin sheet metal edge that severed tendons and veins on the middle and index fingers.
An employee was driving a water truck to spray a newly chipped road, lost control, jumped from the truck and was partially run over. The employee sustained a broken leg and pelvis.
An employee jumped off a truck while it was moving. The employee's head struck the road, causing a head injury.
While conducting equipment and vehicle maintenance, an employee was struck on the head by the hatch door of the vehicle, suffering a head injury that required stitches.

An employee was positioning a metal pipe to make a connection. He was holding on to one end of the pipe when a coworker went to move the pipe into place on the other end. The employee's left hand was caught between the pipe and a rock resulting in amputation of the index fingertip.
An employee was conducting maintenance on the conveyors. His left index finger was caught in the chain and sprocket of the gear controls causing a partial amputation.
Two employees were on a platform under a bridge, removing decking. The platform failed and both employees fell to the riprap area; one employee broke his pelvis.

On June 5, 2019, an electrician was performing electrical work at an assisted living facility that was under construction. He was working with a junction box at an open ceiling grid from an 8-foot A-frame ladder when he was shocked and fell to the ground. He suffered several broken ribs, a head contusion and fractures to the L3 an L4 vertebrae. He was hospitalized.

An employee was unloading a bundle of bridge foundation beams. While disconnecting the rigging chains, the beams shifted and the employee's leg and foot were pinned between two beams causing foot and ankle fractures.

An employee was working in an attic when he fell through the ceiling to the first floor 25 feet below. He suffered multiple injuries to the left side of his face, left pelvis, left lung, brain, right and left wrists, arm, and right knee.
An employee was cutting a piece of wood with a portable powered saw. The saw amputated two digits on the employee's right hand.
An employee fell from a roof to the floor about 8 feet below, breaking his heel.
An employee was cutting plywood when the blade amputated the tip of the employee's left index finger.
As it was being removed from the ground, a 20-foot section of sheet piling struck an employee in the face, causing fractures to the upper jaw and the orbit of the left eye.
An employee was working at the site moving building materials. He was not feeling well and suffered from heat stroke/exhaustion.
An employee was setting up a ladder when his hand slipped off the ladder and struck a threaded rod, breaking his hand.
An employee was pouring some compound on the ground and began to feel unwell and had cramps. The employee was hospitalized for dehydration.

On June 7, 2019, an employee was installing wood trim on the ceiling of a new house from a baker's scaffold. The scaffold came apart and the employee fell 7 feet to the ground. He sustained a broken left wrist and right elbow and was hospitalized.

An employee was juking a pile of concrete when a triangle beam hit the top of the concrete pile, causing a section of the top edge to chip off, fall, and strike the employee. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured left humerus and skin avulsion.
An employee tripped and fell on a floor, suffering an open arm fracture with blood loss.
An employee was painting the dormer of a house when the employee fell approximately 9 feet from the roof onto the ground and broke the right wrist.

An employee was standing in an excavation when a capped, abandoned-in-place, 12" cast iron water line became pressurized and pushed out of the ground, striking and pinning the employee's leg against the cut end of another pipe. The employee's leg was severely crushed.
An employee was climbing a ladder to repair an HVAC system when he fell from the ladder, suffering a broken pelvis, broken right foot, and head injuries.
An employee was hospitalized after falling off of a ladder onto the ground. The employee fractured their pelvis and right wrist and tore a ligament in their knee.

An employee was offloading a road milling machine from a lowboy trailer when it fell off the trailer and tipped over. The employee was thrown from the machine and struck his head on a parked asphalt roller. He received a head laceration, injured elbow, and three broken ribs.
Two employees were rolling a piece of tube steel over when one of the employee's fingers was caught between the steel and the floor, resulting in a right middle fingertip amputation.
An employee was climbing an extension ladder when it slipped out of place and fell, taking the employee with it. He broke his left leg.
An employee's left hand was caught between an elevator rail and the floor while he was moving the rail using a channel dolly. The middle and ring fingertips were amputated.

On June 11, 2019, an employee was attempting to reach the edge of a metal roof when he slipped and fell approximately 15 feet to the ground. He sustained a fracture to his right wrist, multiple facial fractures (including his mandible), and a concussion. He was hospitalized. The employee's lanyard was unhooked at the time of the incident.
An employee was pinned between an outrigger and a truck, suffering a fracture of a lower-back vertebra and abdominal trauma.
An employee was cutting a wooden 2x4 using a hand-held circular saw and amputated his left thumb.
A load of material suspended from a forklift became unstable and fell, breaking an employee's leg.
An employee sustained a hot tar burn on his hand from a hot tar kettle splash.
An employee was inside a trench putting lube on a laid pipe when an iron pipe came loose from a backhoe and struck him, injuring his left side and left lung.
An employee received an electric shock to the head and face while testing a battery bank, suffering head and facial electrical burns.
An employee was turning to climb down a fixed ladder when he lost his balance and fell approximately 15 feet to the floor, breaking three vertebrae and his left elbow. He was hospitalized.
An employee was using a 9" grinder on a skid when the grinder slipped off the skid and slashed the inside of the employee's left upper leg. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
An ironworker was using a magnetic drill to drill a steel beam. The drill bit caught his left glove and amputated his left thumb.
An employee was repairing an overhead door and installing cable when the cable slipped and struck both of the employee's hands, amputating three fingers.

An employee was installing form panels for pouring concrete when the row of panels tipped over and landed on top of him. He suffered several fractured ribs, right knee pain, and a laceration on the lower left jaw.

An employee was working on a powerline pole. The employee was installing an equal potential zone while using a cluster bar that attached to the pole. A chain hangs from the cluster bar, which started swinging back and forth after it was attached to the pole. The employee attempted to grab the swinging chain and came into contact with the energized powerline. An entry wound was present on his hand and an exit wound was present on his chest. He was hospitalized with burns.

An employee was standing on a level surface and was using his hands to guide an iron column, which was being moved by a small tower crane. As he was guiding the suspended column, his finger was caught between a flange of the column and a tie-back cable (for a swing-stage) that was behind him. This resulted in a crushed right index finger and a laceration to the right middle finger. Following the injury, his right index fingertip was amputated at the hospital (from the top knuckle up), and his middle finger required stitches.

An employee was operating a saw cutter while cutting a concrete slab (balcony) on the second floor level of a residential home when he slipped and fell approximately 8 feet down to the concrete ground level. He was hospitalized with a head fracture, a spinal fracture, and rib fractures.

On June 14, 2019, an employee was getting onto a scaffold to descend to the ground and retrieve more materials. When he stepped onto the unsecured planks, the planks fell off and he fell about 12 feet to the ground, landing on his feet. He sustained a fracture to his lower back and ruptured a lower back disc, requiring hospitalization.
An employee pulling nails on a roof fell 10 to 12 feet to the ground, breaking a leg.
An employee slipped and fell to the ground while walking between roof trusses, breaking the left and right wrists.

An employee was loading a bottle of water into a cooler in the back of a work truck when another employee entered the driver seat of the vehicle to move it. When the second employee moved the truck forward, the injured employee fell out of the truck and hit his head on the ground, suffering head trauma.
A part of a boring machine struck a hand tool, sending it flying through the air. It struck an employee in the back and injured the employee's spleen.

At 11:00 a.m. on June 14, 2019, an employee of Manhattan Construction Company (MCC) and an employee of Centennial Moisture Control were in a yard when a piece of corrugated metal decking fell onto them from about 140 feet above, knocking them to the ground. The MCC employee suffered significant facial trauma and was hospitalized.

An employee was working on a road crew that was replacing asphalt in a closed left lane when a vehicle involved in a high-speed police pursuit entered the left lane road closure area. The speeding vehicle swerved around a state police vehicle stationed at the construction site and struck another vehicle. One of the vehicles struck the employee, who suffered a punctured lung; a ruptured spleen; and lacerations to the right knee, ankle, and wrist.

On June 17, 2019, an employee was receiving a scaffolding piece on the ground as other employees dismantled a scaffold. The well wheel used to manually lower the equipment broke apart, causing the load to fall and strike the employee, who suffered a laceration to the upper left shoulder.

On June 17, 2019, an employee was painting on an elevated platform when the power went out. The employee fell 10 feet 6 inches to the floor and was injured. The employee was hospitalized for facial fractures.

An employee was sitting on top of the middle section of a truss while waiting for another truss to be delivered by crane. The truss broke and employee fell approximately 15 feet to the ground and suffered a compound fracture to the left elbow, a fractured hip, and a fractured pelvis.
An employee was dropping a 10-inch cast iron pipe into a hole when his hand was caught between the cement wall and the pipe. He was hospitalized with a swollen hand.

An employee conducting electrical work was descending a 10-foot step ladder when he lost his balance and fell to the ground, striking his right arm on a metal stud. He was hospitalized with back pain and an arm laceration that required surgery.
An employee was at a job site helping to unload a truck when the employee became overheated and dehydrated. The employee was hospitalized due to heat exhaustion.

An employee had been installing solar panels on a roof during the day. As he was installing the last two, his hands cramped up and he was removed from the roof. He then began to have whole-body cramps and he was hospitalized, suffering from heat stress.
An employee was checking a belt in an air handler. The employee's hand was pulled into a nip point and the belt and pulley amputated three fingertips.

An employee was doing demolition work in a storm drain culvert. As he was adjusting a steel I-beam, the tip of his right index finger was caught between the two pieces of the adjustable beam. The fingertip was amputated.
An employee was disassembling a scaffold and fell to a lower level. He suffered fractures to the left scapula, right forefoot, and right ankle.

An employee was operating a trenching machine when it struck an old, unmarked natural gas pipeline. The machine caught fire before the operator could turn it off; he suffered burns to his right hand as he left the cab, as well as a broken right knee and left wrist as he jumped to the ground. He was hospitalized.
An employee was performing construction work when he became lightheaded and vomited due to heat stress.
An employee was replacing catalyst parts in the heat and became ill due to heat exhaustion, requiring hospitalization.

On June 19, 2019, an employee was operating a machine that carries shingles onto a roof when the belt came off. As he attempted to set the belt onto the machine's pulley, his right index finger was caught between the pulley and the belt, resulting in an amputation of his right index finger without bone loss. The machine was energized at the time of the incident.

An employee was reconfiguring a 1" airline. The employee's hand was on a 90-degree fitting while a co-worker turned the pipe using an 18-inch pipe wrench. The employee's hand then became caught between the 90-degree fitting and a steel skid, resulting in a fractured left ring finger and nail avulsion that required surgery.

Two employees were in a scissor lift lowering support pipes down. As they began lowering one of the pipes, the bottom of the pipe slid into the scissor lift, causing the lift to tip over. Both employees jumped out of the lift (approximately 3 feet) before the lift collapsed to the ground. The first employee suffered a broken hip, a broken tailbone, bruises, and cuts. The second employee suffered a broken pelvic bone, a fractured left elbow, bruises, and scrapes.
An employee was hammering a concrete nail into the brace of a concrete pad when the concrete nail broke and went into the employee's right eyeball.

An employee was placing a metal plate into a furnace to be heat-treated when he tripped and fell forward, resulting in his hands making contact with the hot metal plate. He suffered burns to the palms of both hands and was hospitalized.

An employee was installing an air conditioner at a customer's home. He was using a set of needle-nose pliers. The pliers slipped off from the object they were grasping and the employee's fist hit his left eye. He sustained a laceration to the globe of the left eye.
An employee was dumping trash when he lost his balance, fell off the loading dock (approximately 4 feet), struck the concrete floor, and broke his left tibia. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee fell 8 feet from a scaffold while setting a roof on a modular home, suffering a broken hip.
An employee was using a nail gun when a nail ricocheted off another nail and impaled the employee through the tongue and into the roof of the mouth. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was sweeping a curb when his left foot was run over by a reversing mini excavator. His left foot broke.
A temporary employee was using an upcut saw when the blade amputated four of his fingers.
An employee was installing bracing on the edge form as the crew prepared a bridge for a deck pour. The employee began to feel hot and thirsty and then fainted. He was hospitalized for heat stress.

An employee on a commercial roofing job was gluing an adhered membrane when he stepped backwards and fell approximately 20 feet through an unguarded skylight opening in the roof. He fractured his pelvis.
An employee became light-headed due to heat and missed his step on a rebar mat. His left leg went through the rebar mat and his left knee sustained a cut.

An employee was working near the edge of a concrete slab preparing a skip pan to be removed from the building. The employee fell 10 feet when a skip pan that was on a cart rolled off the side of the first level of the building. The employee suffered a broken nose, three dislocated fingers on the right hand, and a right front hematoma.
An employee was digging a trench for a new water service line when they became short of breath and had chest pain. The employee was hospitalized with a collapsed lung.
A low impact collision occurred when a skid steer backed into a buggy. During impact, the injured employee suffered a fractured fibula, requiring hospitalization.
A temporary worker was walking in a warehouse and was struck by a forklift. The forklift ran over his left foot resulting in amputation of two toes.
An employee was closing his tool box when it shut on his finger, resulting in an amputation of the skin on his fingertip.

An employee was working on a four-step step ladder repairing a pane of glass over a door frame. While descending the ladder, he missed a step and fell backwards into a corner wall. The employee was hospitalized for back pain and tingling in his legs.

An employee was helping a driver unchain a load on a haul trailer. The load weighed approximately 20,000 to 30,000 pounds. The trailer was lowered onto the employee's feet fracturing the employee's toes.

An employee was trying to dismount the operator seat of a boom truck when he lost his balance and fell approximately 6 feet to the ground, landing on his back. He was hospitalized with six fractured ribs, lumbar vertebrae chipping, and a slight puncture of his left lung.

An employee and his coworker were lowering a 10-foot long, 3-inch conduit steel pipe to be installed at the ceiling part of the tunnel when the employee's right pinky finger was caught between the end of the pipe and a fixed ladder located at the west wall of the tunnel. He suffered the amputation of his right pinky fingertip without bone loss. Leather gloves were worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was on an 8-foot step ladder using a saw to cut sheathing for fireplace pipes and a firestop when he stepped onto a piece of wood that was not load bearing and fell to the ground level. He injured his head, left hand, and ribs.
An employee was working on a modified scaffold preparing to install an I-beam and fell approximately 9 feet to the concrete ground. The employee suffered a head and back injury.
An employee was working on a water well when he was caught in a winch line and fell, fracturing his ribs.

An employee was working at a customer's home, replacing an aerial drop. His ladder was on the strand approximately 15 feet above the ground. As he began to descend the ladder, the strand shifted, causing the ladder to shift, and he fell about 10 feet to the ground. He suffered a bruised rib and liver.
An employee was inspecting a roof for storm damage when the employee fell to the ground, suffering elbow, rib, and pelvic fractures as well as a punctured lung. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was applying hot asphalt to material layers. As the employee moved toward a parapet wall to cut a roll of felt, the employee slipped and fell forward. The employee's hand then entered the mop cart that contained the hot asphalt, causing third degree burns to the right hand and wrist.
An employee was climbing into a quad axle dump truck cab when he slipped to the ground and suffered broken ribs.

An employee was working on an extension ladder 10 to 12 feet from the ground. Upon descending, his foot was caught in a ladder rung and he fell to the ground, injuring his hip and right foot. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting a 24-inch concrete pipe with a cut-off saw when the saw kicked back and struck his head, causing a concussion and jaw fracture.
An employee was climbing the upper portion of an extension ladder when the ladder slipped. The employee then fell 8 feet to the ground, suffering fluid in the lungs.

On June 24, 2019, an employee was guiding a steel pipe into a pipe clamp to marry it to another piece of pipe when the pipe moved unexpectedly, pinching his right pinky finger and causing an amputation.

An employee was attempting to remove a metal wedge from a tall tunnel boring machine when pressure from the equipment caused the wedge to strike the employee's face, injuring the right cheek and nose.
An employee was using a jackhammer when it jumped back on his big toe, lacerating and breaking it.
An employee was working under the front of a truck when another employee got in the truck and backed up over the employee. The employee suffered a fractured right hip and pelvic area.
An employee was emptying a waste container that was elevated on a forklift into a dumpster. He fell six feet to the ground below and broke an ankle.

An employee was tightening a guy wire in proximity of an energized line and received an electric discharge causing burns on the left leg and right arm and hand. The employee was hospitalized for surgery on the arm and leg.
An employee was working on the flat roof of an elementary school and fell approximately 8 feet to the ground below, suffering fractured ribs that required hospitalization.
An employee was sealing a gas furnace exhaust pipe on a two-story roof. The employee fell off the roof and broke a rib and bruised a leg. The employee was not wearing fall protection at the time.
An employee was walking to the truck and was struck on the right side of the face with the bucket of a front end loader. The employee suffered a facial laceration that required surgery.
An employee was cutting trim work with a power miter saw. The saw cut his hand.
An employee was moving a mobile scaffold vertical lift that was approximately 800 pounds. It fell back on the employee causing a fractured left ankle that required surgery.

An employee was getting ready to leave for a jobsite in the morning and needed to put something away in his car when a stranger approached him and hit him in the head. He suffered a cracked skull and bleeding/swelling on the brain.
An employee was unloading a flat bed truck. He slipped off the truck and fell to the ground breaking the left ankle.
On June 26, 2019, an employee reached into an electrical cabinet and received a shock injury to the arm, requiring hospitalization. The cabinet was energized at the time of the incident.

An employee was assembling shoring to prep for a concrete pour when the employee fell from an approximately 40-inch high platform to the concrete below, breaking the left ankle. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was unloading a sign trailer and disconnecting a sign from its travel supports. The employee's right arm was caught on the horizontal stiffener (Z-bar). The employee fell off the trailer and suffered a laceration to the right arm from under the arm pit to below the elbow. The brachial artery was severed.

An employee was preparing to pull in new electrical power lines with a rope when the rope became entangled in the base of a street sign, causing the sign to become loose and strike the employee in the back. The employee was hospitalized with a bruised left lung, cracked ribs, and bruised vertebrae.

An employee was applying sealant to the roof of a covered bridge when the employee slipped and fell off the roof to the ground below. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured back and broken right arm.
A crew was removing an old, silt fence.  As the injured employee was reaching for part of the fence to pull it out, a rattlesnake bit the employee's left hand.
An employee was on a scaffold and fell approximately 6 feet to ground resulting in a leg injury.
An employee was cutting lumber with a cut-off saw when it kicked back and lacerated the employee from the cheek to the chest.
An employee fell from the catwalk of an excavator, suffering broken ribs and a bruised left lung.
An employee was getting equipment from a truck when the truck door closed on him, rupturing a disc in his back. He was hospitalized.
An 120-pound roll of environmental fabric struck an employee as it rolled off a delivery truck. The employee suffered a dislocated hip.

While spinning a belt onto a pulley, an employee's right ring and middle fingers were caught and contacted the pulley.  The top of the ring finger was cut off at approximately the top knuckle joint.  The middle finger suffered lacerations and is possibly broken.
An employee was operating a utility terrain vehicle (UTV). The UTV rolled onto its left side and the employee sustained lacerations and skin damage to the left leg and knee requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing sheet metal when a panel of the metal slipped out of his hands and cut his left arm, lacerating an artery. He was hospitalized, requiring surgery.

Employees were "daylighting" (exposing) a 2-inch pipeline in the ground to remove the pipeline. Thirty feet of pipe was already exposed. An excavator was digging down 6 inches to expose the pipeline. When the bucket of dirt was rotated away from the pipeline, the tooth of the bucket struck the pipe causing the far end of the pipe to shift and strike an employee at the far end of the pipeline (30 feet) in the neck and jaw. The employee was hospitalized for a fractured jaw.

An employee was part of a crew replacing a joint on a bridge. As he was pushing and pulling to get the joint in position, his finger got caught between the concrete and steel joint, resulting in a fingertip amputation.

A lift was being used to place a stack of ten scaffold planks on an erected scaffold. Several planks fell off the lift and hit an employee, pinning the employee's leg between the planks and construction equipment. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured leg.
An employee working inside a trench box located in a 9' deep excavation slipped and fell, hitting his head on the trench box spreader bar and suffering a head injury.
An employee fainted due to the heat while working on a roof. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was holding 1-inch by 2-foot stainless steel duct strapping. The strapping spun when a self-tapping screw was set into it; the employee suffered a laceration at the base of the left thumb. He was hospitalized, undergoing surgery.

An employee fell from an 8-foot step ladder while washing down a metal ceiling. The employee was found on the floor unconscious and bleeding from the head, having suffered contusions and brain swelling.

An employee was climbing back into a dump truck when he lost his balance and fell backwards, striking his head, back, and ribs on the ground. His head required stitches, and his back and ribs were possibly broken.
On 7/1/2019, an employee amputated a finger on machinery.
An employee was on a scaffold doing masonry work when he fell 5 feet to the ground below, suffering broken ribs and requiring hospitalization.

An employee leaned out a doorway and fell 15 feet to the ground after the temporary safety railing failed. The employee was hospitalized for fractures to the hip, pelvis, ribs, and sternum as well as head lacerations.
An employee was 6 feet up an 8-foot ladder. While descending, the employee slipped and fell to the dirt ground, suffering a right shoulder injury.

An employee was on the roof on his knees drilling holes on the edge of a building with a hammer drill. He used force to push the hammer drill into the concrete edge of the building and strained his left knee.
An employee was sitting power tongs down on a base. The employee's right hand was resting on the rig where the tongs come down and the tongs smashed and deeply cut the employee's right thumb.
An employee was moving masonry blocks when he dropped a block on his hand, pinching his fingertip. As a result, his fingertip was amputated.
An employee was using fish tape to retrieve a broken rope that had been used to pull wires from a 480-volt panel when an arc flash occurred. The employee suffered third degree burns to the arms.

A crew was finishing setup of crane outriggers and then prepared to switch from a 3-sheave block to a headache ball/pill. An employee was helping to un-reeve the crane block. The operator swung the crane over to the side and placed the block on level ground. He got down from operator's cab and checked to ensure it would not topple over under its own weight. He then helped the employee remove pins from the block to remove the rope. The crane operator then went up onto the crane and heard the employee yelling. The block from the crane had shifted and pulled the wire rope down, causing the rope to tighten up. The employee's finger was caught between the crane boom tip sheave and wire rope. The crane operator ran to pick up the block and relieve tension on the wire rope. The employee suffered an amputation of the right ring fingertip.

An employee was working on a residential roof when she went to get additional screws. As she was walking, she stepped on an ISO board that was hanging off of the roof and fell down to the surface below, fracturing her ankle and the base of her spine. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was joining rail links when a bolt (1" diameter X 6" long) failed to line up. The employee struck the bolt with a hammer and it jumped out, striking the employee's leg. The employee sustained a left lower leg fracture and was hospitalized.
A pile rack was being lifted during bridge construction. A piece of the load slipped off the rack and struck an employee, causing fractures to the scapula and pelvis.
Two employees were working out of a bucket truck moving a service line higher up an existing utility pole. Both employees were shocked and hospitalized.
On July 3, 2019, an employee suffered from dehydration while working on roofing activities.
An employee fell from a ladder to the ground, suffering a broken collarbone.
An employee was stripping concrete forms while tied into a form. The employee's lanyard became unattached and the employee fell 14-16 feet, suffering fractures to the back and wrist.

An employee was preparing to lift and move a 25-foot, 1,897-pound structural beam from a conveyor system with a crane. He was using a lifting chain to make the lift when the thumb on his left hand was caught between the chain and the structural beam, resulting in a thumb fracture.

An employee was guiding a concrete barrier onto a flatbed trailer. The barrier crumbled in the employee's hand, causing him to lose his balance and fall off the trailer. He struck his head on the crane tire rim and suffered a laceration to the rear crown of his head.
An employee was drilling a hole in a concrete wall with a hammer drill. His right middle fingertip was amputated.

An employee was cleaning a condenser coil on a rooftop unit. The access plate slipped while the employee was reinstalling it, and the employee's hand went into the unit's fan blade. The employee suffered severe lacerations to the right thumb, index, and middle finger and was hospitalized, requiring surgery.
An employee fell from a ladder to the ground, suffering a head injury.

An employee was guiding a guardrail post out of the ground. It released from the hole with force and jumped up. The employee's right hand was pinched between the post and the boom of the puller machine, causing an amputation of soft tissue on the ring finger.
An employee had left a roof during a lightning storm and was entering his work van. Lightning struck the ground and the employee was shocked as he entered the van.

On July 8, 2019, an employee was using a forklift (to unload a heater from a truck) when it caught fire. The employee suffered second and third degree burns to 40 percent of his body and hospitalized.
A steel construction employee was hospitalized with heat stress symptoms.
An employee fell about 30 feet through a metal roof. The employee suffered facial fractures and was hospitalized.
An employee was on the fifth rung of a ladder, securing it to the wall. The ladder's feet slid out and the employee fell to the concrete floor, breaking his wrist.
An employee fell about 6.5 feet from the utility body of a truck and suffered a wrist injury. The employee was hospitalized, requiring surgery.
An employee was painting equipment from a platform approximately 30 inches high when he lost his balance and fell to the ground, fracturing his right hip and requiring surgery.

At about 11:45 a.m. on July 8, 2019, an employee was working with a crane operator to flip a sheet of steel piling with two shakeout hooks hung from the crane. While the sheet of piling was being lifted, a hook became dislodged and struck the employee in the right leg, breaking the tibia. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee fell from a ladder to the crushed concrete ground while hanging security cameras on the outside of a building. The employee suffered a broken and dislocated left elbow, a broken right wrist, and a laceration to the floorhead.
An employee suffered heat-related illness (vomiting, dehydration, kidney function issue) while hanging steel. The employee was hospitalized.
After installing grounding wire in rebar mats, an employee became dehydrated and was hospitalized.
An employee fell five feet ten inches from a rebar wall mold to the ground below and suffered a concussion and a fractured hand.
An employee was climbing down an extension ladder when he fell, suffering a broken heel and hip. He was hospitalized.
An employee was retrieving 9-inch rebar from a saw when the saw actuated and amputated the tip of his thumb.

An employee was hanging drywall from a scissor lift. The employee fell off the scissor lift after having an apparent seizure. The employee landed on the floor and sustained brain swelling, a broken back, and a broken neck.
An employee suffered dehydration and possible kidney failure and was hospitalized.
An employee was walking beside a skid steer, adjusting the width on the skid swing arm. The skid steer ran over the employee's left leg, breaking the tibia and fibula. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was mixing concrete using a drill with a paddle attachment. The employee's right middle finger got caught in the drill and the fingertip was amputated.
An employee was spreading a gasket for sound wall installation. The vacuum lifter released and dropped the barrier, which crushed his right hand.
An employee was unloading pipes from trucks. The employee began to suffer cramps from the heat and was hospitalized.
An employee was assisting the operator of a window sill mold press. The machine cycled in reverse while the employee's hand was inside resulting in amputations to the right ring and pinky fingertips.
An employee was conducting a grading operation and cutting down a 25-foot tree for new homes to be built. The tree struck the employee and fractured the right hip.

After an employee had completed a delivery, the boom lift was moving back into position and struck the employee in the chest. The employee was hospitalized with multiple fractures to the right side ribs.
An employee was plunge-cutting a 2x4 for an outlet using a circular saw. The saw grabbed the wood and then lacerated the employee's wrist.

An employee was reversing an unloaded powered buggy down a concrete ramp. The ramp was damp from the rain. The buggy slid as it was descending the ramp and struck a tandem dump truck that was parked near the base of the ramp. The employee's ankle/leg was caught between the wheeled buggy and the dump truck and the employee sustained a fracture to the left ankle/fibula.
An employee was rigging four sets of pipe from around 12:30 PM to 2:30 PM. The employee then began to feel ill. The employee sustained heat stress and kidney failure.
An employee was installing culvert ends. While removing a temporary light, the light fell and struck his head. He was hospitalized with scalp and facial lacerations.
An employee working on a roof was sweating profusely and had pain in their side. The employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.
While operating a one-yard cement mixer, a temporary employee (working for Express Employment) was caught and entangled by the mixer. The employee suffered a crushed left forearm and lacerations.
When a boom fell, a 5-inch concrete delivery pipe attached to the boom struck an employee in the leg resulting in a compound fracture of the right femur.

Employees were driving piles. An employee was using his left hand to guide the leads (upright portion that drives the hammer). The lines were suspended by a crane and the third line was not in use. As the crane lowered the leads, the weight of the leads draped onto the third line. This caused the third line to tighten against the employees hand causing an amputation to the left thumb just below the nailbed near the first joint.
An employee was assisting three other employees in sliding a new A/C unit under a house. The A/C unit exposed a live electrical line that was buried and the employee was shocked.

On July 11, 2019, an asphalt maintenance technician was removing a handicap sign in preparation for resurfacing the parking lot when a bee or wasp nest was disturbed and he got stung. He collapsed to the ground and had difficulty breathing. He was hospitalized for an allergic reaction to the sting.

Employees were working to re-line sewer lines with a fiberglass liner. The employees had cut out a piece of fiberglass liner and were pulling it up using a forklift and rope when the piece caught on the manhole rim. The rope was severed and the piece fell and struck an employee, who was in the manhole, on the left foot amputating the middle toe.
An employee was separating a bundle of joists when one of the joists fell on him and hit him in the shoulder. He was hospitalized.
An employee was conducting lay-out work from a one-tier bakers scaffold and fell 4 feet to the cement floor resulting in head trauma.
An employee was picking up a piece of plywood to move it to another area. The plywood had been covering an 8-ft hole. The employee fell into the hole and sustained a broken ankle.

An employee was collecting welding leads to leave work for the day. A 1-foot round pipe was on the ground and slid in mud caused by heavy rain. The pipe struck the employee in the leg, breaking his ankle.

On July 11, 2019, an employee was laying an 8-foot, 36-inch diameter concrete pipe as an excavator was pulling the grade. As the excavator was setting the bucket (54-inch wide) down on the ground it pushed the employee towards the 36-inch pipe. The employee's lower back got caught between the bucket and the pipe. He sustained bruising and a contusion to his lower back and was hospitalized.

Two employees were cutting a concrete wall with a chop saw. The blade got stuck within the cut and the saw kicked back, cutting both employees on the leg. One employee received stitches and was not hospitalized. The other employee had to have surgery on the right leg.
An employee became dizzy while building forms along an interstate. The employee was hospitalized for dehydration.

An employee was utilizing a magnetic drill to drill holes in 1.5" tube. The employee was removing metal shavings and his glove was caught by the bit pulling his left hand into the drill. The drill amputated his index fingertip and thumb, and lacerated his middle finger.

An employee working as a framer was putting hardware on the bottom of an exterior wall on the right side of the house. He was standing on the completed deck floor of the second story when he fell to the dirt ground. The employee sustained a spinal cord injury resulting in paralysis from the chest down.
An employee suffered heat exhaustion while connecting conductors to underground transformers.
An employee was installing roofing material. While walking on trusses he fell approximately 9 ft. to the ground and sustained a broken right ankle. Fall protection was not worn at the time.
The injured employee was holding a piece of 2x4 wood while a co-worker was cutting it with a circular saw. The circular saw kicked back and amputated the injured employee's left thumb.
An employee was operating a motorized concrete buggy that was filled with concrete when his lower right leg was pinned and broken between the buggy and a fence.
An employee was de-rigging and unplugging motors. While sliding a motor to a cart, the employee fell and the motor landed on their hand. The employee sustained a stretched ligament in the right hand.
An employee was struck by a food truck at the jobsite resulting in contusions and a possible concussion.

An employee was unloading an asphalt roller off of a trailer. The roller slipped off the ramp and the employee was pinned between the ramp and the roller. The employee sustained fractures to the left hip, knee, and ankle. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.

On 7/13/2019, at 8:00 AM an employee working as an operator and carpenter was stripping the wall forms of a structure. While repositioning himself he lost his footing, fell to the ground and landed on his foot. He sustained a broken lower left leg requiring hospitalization and surgery. The employee was wearing fall protection, but it was not connected at the time of the fall.

An employee was moving material using a telehandler. He was on the road, which is elevated, and the right wheels dropped off the embankment. The telehandler rolled over and the employee was hospitalized with broken ribs.

An employee was helping to move precast concrete panels in the yard using a gantry crane. The employee was caught between two panels as one was being placed and the employee tried to reset the foot panel on which the panel rests. The employee sustained broken ribs and a punctured lung.
An employee was walking in the yard when he was struck by a truck backing up. He sustained fractured ribs, a punctured lung, and his left ear was removed.

An employee was installing conduit in the ceiling area of a new school building utilizing a 12-foot A-frame ladder. The employee's legs got caught in the ladder rungs, causing the ladder and the employee to fall. The employee struck the floor and was hospitalized with cracked ribs and lacerations to the head.

An employee was installing steel decking to the roof a warehouse while standing on a roof truss. The employee lost his footing and fell. He was wearing personal fall protection which included a full body harness, a D-ring extension, a retractable lanyard, and a beam anchor clamp. After falling approximately 21 feet, the retractable device caught and stopped his fall but then the D-ring extensions threading failed and it broke. The employee then free-fell approximately 27 feet to the concrete floor. The employee was hospitalized with injuries including: the right knee shattered into twenty pieces, the right leg fractured in three places, fractures to the front of the skull/forehead, a broken nose, five teeth knocked out, and numerous facial lacerations.
While working in a stairwell installing shoring, an employee was struck by an aluminum beam and sustained injury to the right shoulder.

An employee was in a scissor lift raising to an elevated working height to install fire suppression equipment. The employee was caught between a structural beam and the scissor lift and sustained a severe head injury.

An employee was in a trench cleaning soil off of the water line in preparation for a connection. The trench collapsed along with the soil pile that was approximately one foot from the edge of the trench. The employee was completely covered with soil and was hospitalized for a broken jaw and lacerations to the ear and right arm.
An employee fell while climbing out of a truck. A barrel fell on him, breaking his tibia and fibula.

An employee was working on the sixth rung of an 8-foot ladder. He was unplugging temporary lights when he received an electrical shock from the temporary lighting cords and fell from the ladder. He landed on and fractured his left ankle.
An employee had been shoveling sand when he felt light-headed and dizzy and fell to his knees. The employee suffered from dehydration and heat illness.
An employee was repairing a winch cable when it came loose, struck him on the chin, and fractured his jaw.
An employee was sitting inside a trailer with a/c and had a seizure, possibly brought about due to heat stress.

An employee finished cutting a 2x4 with a circular saw and set the saw on the saw horse. The saw then fell and as he tried to catch it, his right middle finger became caught in the spinning blade amputating a portion of the finger.

An employee was performing re-roofing work when he lost his footing, slipped, and fell 7 feet to the ground, breaking his left leg. He was hospitalized. Personal fall protection was worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was pulling the pull cord on a generator. The cord jumped and wrapped around his right hand, then retracted and pulled the hand in, causing an abrasion across the hand and an abrasion on the index finger.

An employee was cutting an 8-inch PVC pipe with a saw. When the saw cut through the pipe, both ends of the pipe came together and pinched the saw's blade. The saw kicked back and lacerated the employee's chest. The employee had surgery to clean the wound.

While an employee was using a wet-saw to cut a concrete wall for a door header, he fell from staging and landed on the ground. The employee sustained a laceration to the right side of the head and a fractured skull.

An employee was waiting out a storm in his work truck but had to use a nearby portable toilet. While he was in the portable toilet, a lightning strike occurred approximately 50 feet away. He collapsed after coming out of the toilet. He suffered a concussion and brain swelling, requiring hospitalization.

On July 17, 2019, a temporary employee was hand picking discarded construction materials while using cloth gloves when a piece of ceramic tile flipped and lacerated his left forearm near the wrist. He was hospitalized.
An employee was building manhole tops at a construction worksite. After work, the employee was hospitalized for heat stress and dehydration.
An employee was building a concrete structure while on top of a 20-foot wall. The employee fell from the wall and was hospitalized with fractures to the femur, jaw, and hip.
After working from 6 AM to 7 PM as a flagger for an asphalt crew, coordinating traffic around an area that was being repaved, the employee became ill and required hospitalization for dehydration.
An employee performing acoustical ceiling work fell from a scaffold to the floor and was hospitalized with a possible wrist fracture.

While an employee was observing and lubricating a chain-driven conveyor belt, a spray bottle he was holding slipped out of his hand. As he attempted to catch the spray bottle, two of his fingers contacted the moving conveyor belt resulting in the partial amputation of his index and middle fingers.

On July 17, 2019, an employee was operating an asphalt paver for a road construction company. At approximately 10:00 a.m. the employee was stepping down from a platform on the paver when he rolled and fractured his ankle.
An employee was using a portable band saw to cut threaded rod when the blade cut his left thumb. The employee got an infection that required surgery and antibiotics.

An employee was building a scaffold frame for use as a temporary structure. While attaching a truss frame, he lost balance and fell approximately 8 feet to the ground. The employee was hospitalized with a concussion.
An employee was using an abrasive wheel to cut water pipe when the wheel kicked back, knocked the employee's face shield off and caused facial lacerations.
While opening the door of his car, an employee turned around, slipped, and fell. The employee was hospitalized with a broken leg.

An employee had been draining a small vat used for cleaning machine parts; he had carried a 5-gallon bucket of cleaning fluid upstairs four times to pour it into a waste oil collection tank. He suffered dehydration and heat-exhaustion-related hand cramping, then chest and abdomen cramping.

An employee had been setting up a steel plate to cover an excavation. The employee signaled the excavator operator to move the plate using an attached chain. The employee's left hand became caught in the chain resulting in amputation of multiple fingers.
An employee on a scaffold was pulling up a load of stone when he fell approximately 50 feet to the lower working surface and sustained a crushed pelvis and internal injuries.

On July 18, 2019, two employees were washing down ash in the economizer hopper. The water that was being applied struck a pocket of hot ash, causing it to flash. Ash and steam contacted one employees thighs and forearms, and entered his work boots, resulting in burns and hospitalization. The second employee sustained a minor burn to his arm requiring first aid.
While walking down from the twenty-seventh floor to the twenty-sixth floor, an employee slipped and fell down the stairs fracturing the left leg.
An employee was running electrical conduit when he suffered cramps and felt ill. He was hospitalized for heat-related muscle injury.
An employee fell while working from a ladder, suffering a jaw injury that required surgery.
An employee stepped off the frame of the crusher and fell to the ground. He was hospitalized with injuries to his ribs and right hip.
An employee was using a handheld power saw when the spinning blade struck and amputated his index finger.

An employee was working on a beam about 12 feet from ground level, prepping for welding operations. He became lightheaded and dizzy due to the heat and fell from the beam. His personal fall arrest system stopped him from falling to the ground, but his head struck the beam. He lost consciousness and was hospitalized.

An employee was running a trencher in a yard. The trencher hit a 10-foot rod that had been covered with dirt, and the rod flipped into the employee's back thigh and caused a puncture wound above the knee. The employee was hospitalized.

At 5:45 p.m. on July 19, 2019, an employee was using a jib on a bucket truck. He had his left hand on the winch line to help with the slack; when he turned, his left little finger was drawn into the pinch point created by the winch line and spool. He suffered a partial transphalangeal amputation of the left little finger, as well as a fracture to the little finger and ring finger.

An employee slipped off a wet metal roof and fell 12 feet to the ground. The employee sustained a concussion and his face was fractured on the right side. The employee was not tied off at the time of the fall.
An employee was moving steel from a trailer using a boom truck. The load shifted and caught the tip of his right middle finger. The fingertip was amputated.

At 9:15 a.m., on July 19, 2019, an employee was installing gutter screens while standing on the roof of a house. The employee slipped and fell from the roof, landing on a concrete sidewalk about 10 feet below and suffering a broken pelvis and vertebrae.

An employee was on the roof setting up a ladder to reach higher elevations during siding installation operations. He fell off the roof and landed on a table 10 feet below. The employee sustained fractures to his shoulders and face.
An employee was using a sandblasting gun on a pipeline. The gun hit his right arm and the sandblast media caused an open wound on the forearm.
While installing a guide rail, a post pounder machine backed up and ran over an employee's left foot. The employee suffered a broken foot and ankle.
An employee fell from a ladder while cutting a tree branch. The employee struck the ground and suffered a broken left femur and dislocated left shoulder.
On July 20, 2019, an employee was not feeling well while performing her normal job duties as a laborer. She went home and was later hospitalized with dehydration.

On July 20, 2019, an employee was on a lift making a pipe connection inside of a garage door when  the garage door opened and pushed the lift over. The employee fell and sustained face and head injuries.

On July 22, 2019, a controls technician was working on a rewiring job. He was pulling the top off a box containing equipment parts. As the top came off, he jerked backwards and went over the railing of the walkway he was standing on. He fell 14 feet, hit a wire reel, and struck his head on the floor. He was hospitalized and had surgery for severe head injuries.

An employee was rigging angle steel sections to be hoisted by a crane. A section was lifted by hand and pushed in order to free it from the rest of the bundle. While holding the section, gravel shifted under his feet and caused the employee to lose control. The steel pulled back to its original position and caught the employee's hand against the resting section of steel. He sustained a crushing injury which required amputation of the right middle and ring fingertips.

An employee was pinned between the spreader bar of a trench box and an excavator bucket during a sewer main installation. The employee sustained lower lumbar and thoracic compression fractures, a bruised liver, and dislocated ribs.
An employee was installing a mirror in a home under construction. The mirror broke and fell on their forearm causing a laceration that required hospitalization.

The injured employee was kneeling beside a core drill in order to put water on it while another employee was drilling a 2" diameter hole into the bonded overlay. The core drill seized up in the concrete, causing the entire drill to spin, striking the kneeling employee on his left side and throwing him into the foundation wall. The employee sustained contusions to his knee and elbow.

An employee was helping to move a granite slab onto the photograph station using an overhead crane with a clamp attachment. The clamp holding the slab lost its grip and the slab fell, causing crushing injuries to the employee's right foot and the amputation of all the toes.
An employee was making electrical connections for lighting in the first floor locker room. While connecting two wires the employee sustained a transthoracic electric shock and burns on both hands.

An employee was using plywood to cover access openings in the bridge decking when he slipped and fell through. He fell about 5.5 feet to the temporary platform below, sustaining bruising and fractures to the ribs and wrist.
While operator training was being conducted for an excavator operator, an employee was run over by the excavator and sustained a right leg injury.
During the dismantling process, an employee was removing shoring poles from underneath forms. He was struck by a horizontal beam and sustained crushing injuries to the left leg.

An employee was sealing cracks in the highway with a wand that dispenses rubber sealant from a slowly moving truck when the truck's light tower struck overhead power lines. Electricity traveled through the vehicle and down the wand where it shocked the employee.
An employee was climbing a ladder with a pack of shingles when he fell off the ladder and landed on a pallet, injuring his back.

An employee was on a platform cutting boards when he fell approximately 12 feet from the platform to the ground, suffering spinal fractures, a broken left collarbone and shoulder, a rib fracture, a torn lung, and a concussion.

An employee was using a 7,000-psi pressure washer to clean out caulk from concrete. The hose to the pressure washer got entangled and as the employee freed the hose, the pressure washer traversed across his foot while spraying, causing a severe laceration requiring hospitalization.
An employee was standing next to a tractor when it rolled backwards and the right front tire rolled onto the employee's right foot. The employee sustained torn tendons and a fractured right foot.

An employee was assisting another associate in utilizing the large roll bender to bend 3-foot steel pipe. The employee's left index finger was caught in the machine and sustained an avulsion resulting in amputation to the first knuckle.

An employee was sitting in the cab of an excavator as employees were taking a trench box apart. A pin was pulled and the trench box's connecting bar went into the cab of the excavator, striking the employee's left leg and fracturing it below the knee. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee was heating tar with a propane torch. Tar and fire blew out of the tank when the valve came off. The employee suffered burns to the arms, legs and body.
An employee was using a sledgehammer to strike a stake into the ground when the sledgehammer struck and broke his right index finger.
An employee was aligning an elevator inside a tower when the employee fell from a height and suffered a head injury, broken pelvis, and broken back.
An employee was moving a cart of glass mat sheathing when the cart tipped onto his lower left leg and fractured the tibia and fibula.

On July 25, an employee was installing a metal spiral duct at a newly built grocery store. He was walking backwards while moving the spiral duct to a different location when he lost his footing and fell on a piece of metal conduit. He suffered a pelvic injury and was hospitalized.
An employee was performing HVAC start-up work when he was found unconscious and was hospitalized for a head injury.
An employee was operating a weed eater cleaning around guard rails when he disturbed a yellow jacket nest and was stung numerous times, suffering an allergic reaction to the stings.

An employee was operating a plate compactor when a dump truck backed into him. The tire ran over his leg and pelvis. He was hospitalized with a broken pelvis and tailbone and required a skin graft on his leg.

An employee was trying to remove round bar risers from pipelines to replace them with marine board risers. He rigged two pipelines to be elevated so that the round bar could be cut off and replaced with marine board. His hand was on an outside pipe and when the two rigged pipelines were elevated, they swung and collided with his right hand. His right middle finger was crushed and had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was laying deck. He was attempting to untangle his retractable when he fell 27 feet onto the concrete floor below. He suffered a back fracture and puncture wound near the liver, requiring hospitalization and surgery. His retractable was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was repairing an automatic pool cover machine when his left middle finger was caught in the moving parts, resulting in a left middle fingertip amputation.

An employee was operating a telehandler to set trusses on a new construction site. The employee was making a y-turn maneuver to position the telehandler perpendicular to the sidewall and raise the small post frame truss up and over the 12-foot sidewall. The telehandler was on a steep grade. As the employee was making the maneuver, the telehandler began tipping to the side. The employee attempted to jump from the operator's seat and was struck by the roll cage. The employee was hospitalized with lacerations to the forehead and fingers.

An employee was installing insulation into the cavity of a wall. A wooden guardrail system was installed around the opened area. The employee was leaning over the guardrails when one topsail separated, allowing the employee to fall from the fourth to the second level floor. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured pelvis and right arm.

An employee was attempting to free a section of tarp cover that was caught on a trailer when the trailers air-operated gate was engaged. His hand was caught and crushed by the closing gate, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was driving a golf cart in the facility when their left leg came in contact with a steel safety barrier and was fractured.

An employee on a roof was headed towards a lift, and slipped on a fiberglass panel and fell 12 feet to a dock below. The employee was hospitalized with a broken nose, bruised and lacerated right eye socket, broken right elbow, broken ribs on the right side, and injuries to the pelvis. Fall protection was not connected at the time of the fall.
An employee was working with a crew on the road to help install cable when the employee crossed the road and was struck by a pedestrian vehicle. The employee broke both legs.

An employee had a team working on a new conduit feeder to a substation switchgear. The 480-volt side of the switchgear where the work was taking place was locked out, tagged out, and verified with a meter to not have power.  At the entrance point of the conduit into the substation, another employee was using a knock-out set to punch a hole into the gear. He was having trouble getting the knock-out started, so the injured employee attempted to help him. The injured employee was standing on a two-step riser working with his hands over his head. He was trying to adjust and move some existing wires out of the location of the new knock-out location to thread on the cutting die. As he was moving and pulling, he pushed against the side wall of the switchgear. The side wall flexed into the adjacent compartment, touching a buss that caused an arc flash. The injured employee suffered burns to the hands, left arm, and midsection of his body.
An employee had just climbed down a ladder after completing a welding job. The employee was then struck by a concrete block and sustained cuts, scrapes, and a fracture to an arm.

An employee was adding paneling on the roof of a 25-foot tall home when he fell off the roof onto concrete. He was hospitalized for a head injury, broken arms, and a fractured skull. Multiple surgeries have also been performed. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was on a roof guiding insulated roof panels into place to secure them into steel beams with self-tapping bolts. He was working with two other employees who were in a scissor lift. The roof panel slipped from the beam at the peak before being secured and fell to the scissor lift below.  This caused the other end of the lift to teeter upward, making contact with a 7,620-volt powerline. All three employees were shocked and received electrical burns. The employee on the roof fell approximately 25 feet to the concrete ground below. He was hospitalized with multiple breaks of the right leg and arm, numerous broken facial bones, severely damaged lungs, a tear in the aorta, and possible spinal damage.
An employee was trying to determine what was wrong with operation of a miter saw when the saw amputated the end of the employee's left index finger.

An employee was rigging a muck box on a crane. As the crane operator hoisted slack out of the rigging, one of the lifting eyes did not align. The employee attempted to hit the lifting eye with his hand to straighten it out when his left ring, middle, and index fingertips were crushed by the muck box lifting eye, resulting in an amputation.

An employee was lifting a cart onto the access floor with another employee. The second employee dropped his side and the injured employee could not hold the weight by himself. His left ring finer was smashed between the cart and the access floor, resulting in a partial amputation.

Employees were core drilling into the foundation of a new 
building. When they finished drilling, they tried to pull the 
drill bit out of the machine using two wrenches positioned on 
either side of the drill bit. An employee was attempting to loosen the bit when the 
wrench came loose and struck the employee's right eye, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was bending over to pick up a crane outrigger pad when the outrigger retracted, catching the employee's left hand. The employee suffered a dislocation and laceration of the left wrist.
Employees were troubleshooting a T-nut machine. The machine started while an employee's right index finger was placed where the machine punches, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was cutting out a caulk joint with utility knife when the knife was caught in the joint, causing the blade to slip and cut into the employee's left wrist.
An employee fell approximately 50 feet from the roof of a water tower to the ground, suffering a broken arm that required hospitalization.
Two carpenters were hoisting an aluminum bridge between water tanks at a water treatment plant. The elevated load struck one of the employees in the torso, resulting in possible broken ribs.

An employee was tearing off the existing roof on a residential structure when he fell approximately 8 feet to the ground below, fracturing his pelvis and collarbone. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee slipped on a wet floor while walking through a break room, falling to the floor and breaking her kneecap.

An employee was performing a structural upgrade on a tower. The employee's fall protection detached when a part of the tower was removed. The employee fell about 180 feet, striking an ice cover and an ice bridge, and suffered injuries to both legs, the right arm, and the chest.
An employee experienced dizziness and weakness from possible heat stroke after being exposed to high temperatures generated by a melter.

While an employee was removing a soffit support jack, the cushion block on the bottom of the soffit fell and smashed the ends of his right middle and ring fingers. He sustained an amputation of the right ring fingertip and was hospitalized.

An employee was preparing to close the site for the day and was securing the fence to the dumpster. The employee was struck by a roller machine and was pinned between the fence and dumpster. The employee sustained injuries to the foot and shoulder and also sustained a broken pelvis.
An employee's finger was caught and amputated between a loader bucket and attachments.
An employee was working from a scaffold platform. The employee began vomiting due to heat exhaustion and was hospitalized.
An employee was changing a light bulb from a ladder. The ladder slipped and the employee fell 18 feet to the floor, suffering six broken ribs, a broken pelvis, and a broken hip.

An employee was using a remote-controlled, vehicle-mounted jackhammer to demolish an oven. While the employee was removing debris built up near the hammer, the hammer head crushed his left hand against the floor, injuring his index finger and thumb.

An employee was helping a carpenter place handrail/guardrail material around pier holes, as well as moving lumber from material storage to the work area. He began to sweat excessively, then felt cramps down both legs, his arms, and his abdomen as well as nausea. He was hospitalized, suffering from heat-related dehydration.

An employee was in the center of the street applying marks to the pavement for placement of reflective buttons to mark the lanes. An SUV turned onto the street at a high rate of speed. It dragged the employee before running them over with the front and rear tires. The employee sustained injuries including: an open fracture to the left pelvis; fractured right pelvis; bilateral hip fractures; fractured bones near the eye and cheek bone areas; fractured nose; bruised right lung; bruised liver; and abraded skin and tissue of the face.
An employee spraying product onto the ceiling of a building fell to the concrete floor from a 39-inch scaffold. The employee was hospitalized with a ruptured spleen and a left shoulder injury.
An employee was doing demolition work on a concrete masonry unit wall with a sledgehammer. Part of the wall gave way and fell onto the employee, breaking his right leg.
An employee was helping to lift a C-channel cross member into place when the C-bolt channel clip amputated the employee's fingertip.
